title: Bekenntnis-Platte von Lana del Rey: Jetzt alles echt
content:
Das Blau des Himmels kÃ¶nnte kaum blauer sein, das Licht nicht gleiÃŸender. Ein perfektes, sonnendurchflutetes Idyll wie aus einem Cinemascopefilm. Wenn da nur nicht diese unheilvollen Zeichen wÃ¤ren. Das Stocken der Bilder, die in Flammen aufzugehen scheinen, die Kondensstreifen der Flugzeuge, die sich hoch Ã¼ber den Palmen kreuzen.
Im Video zum Titelsong ihres Albums â€Chemtrails Over The Country Clubâ€œ gleitet Lana del Rey im kirschroten Mercedes-Cabrio durch SÃ¼dkalifornien, weit zurÃ¼ckgelehnt, um sich im Fahrtwind abzukÃ¼hlen. SÃ¤uselnd singt sie zu hallenden Pianoakkorden, dass sie nicht unglÃ¼cklich sei, sondern bloÃŸ ein bisschen wild. Und sich auf der Flucht befinde, mit einem sÃ¼ÃŸen Geliebten.
Bis sich die Welt verdunkelt, ein Wirbelsturm aufzieht und das Auto mit sich fortreiÃŸt. Am Ende verwandelt sich die SÃ¤ngerin in einen zÃ¤hnefletschenden Werwolf.
Lana del Rey, mit 24 Millionen verkauften TontrÃ¤gern und unfassbaren vier Milliarden Streams einer der grÃ¶ÃŸten Popstars der Gegenwart, ist auch auf ihrem siebten Studioalbum schwer zu fassen. Den Titel kÃ¶nnte man als ironischen Schlusskommentar zum moralischen Ausverkauf Amerikas in der Trump-Ã„ra verstehen. Chemtrails, das sind die von Flugzeugen erzeugten Kondensstreifen am Himmel, mit denen die Regierung laut VerschwÃ¶rungstheoretikern die BevÃ¶lkerung zu vergiften trachtet.
Und in den Luxusdomizilen der Countryclubs bleiben die MillionÃ¤re und MilliardÃ¤re vor allem in den SÃ¼dstaaten gerne unter sich. Aber kÃ¶nnte der Song nicht auch bloÃŸ eine Postkarte aus der eigenen Vergangenheit sein, Kindheitserinnerung an trÃ¤ge Tage, die sie mit ihrer Schwester am Swimmingpool verbrachte, trÃ¤umend in die wechselnden Wolkenmuster starrend?
Seit ihr 2011 mit ihrer lasziven Hymne â€Video Gamesâ€œ der Durchbruch gelang, ist Lana del Rey vorgeworfen worden, mehr Kunstprodukt als KÃ¼nstlerin zu sein. Sie wurde als â€KÃ¶nigin des TrÃ¼bsalsâ€œ und lebende MÃ¤nnerfantasie verspottet. Und seit sie sich von einem Interviewer provozieren lieÃŸ und sagte, sie fÃ¤nde Feminismus â€langweiligâ€œ und wÃ¼rde lieber Ã¼ber â€intergalaktische MÃ¶glichkeitenâ€œ sprechen, gilt sie als Anti-Feministin. Gerade erst hat sie erneut der Behauptung widersprochen, dass ihre Lippen das Ergebnis einer SchÃ¶nheitsoperation seien. Im letzten Jahr lÃ¶ste sie einen Shitstorm aus, nachdem sie auf Instagram gefragt hatte, warum Beyonce, Cardi B und Kehlani fÃ¼r die Darstellung von SexualitÃ¤t in ihrer Musik gefeiert wÃ¼rden, man ihr aber vorwerfe, in Songs wie â€Ultraviolenceâ€œ weibliche UnterwÃ¼rfigkeit zu glorifizieren? Im Feminismus mÃ¼sse es auch â€ Platz fÃ¼r Frauen geben, die wie ich aussehen und sich wie ich verhaltenâ€œ. Rasch versuchte sie die EntrÃ¼stungswogen zu glÃ¤tten und beteuerte, ein Fan der schwarzen Kolleginnen zu sein.
Befreiung von den Vorbildern
Dass sie vergangene GrÃ¶ÃŸe schÃ¤tzt, demonstriert die SÃ¤ngerin, die vor 35 Jahren als Elizabeth Woolridge Grant in New York geboren wurde, bereits mit ihrem KÃ¼nstlernamen. Er kombiniert die Hollywooddiva Lana Turner mit einem Automodell, das lange nicht mehr produziert wird, dem Ford Del Rey. Ihr Vintage-Pop schwelgt im Erbe von Fifties- und Sixties-Stars wie Doris Day, Bobbie Gentry oder Nancy Sinatra. Die nostalgische Farbstichigkeit ihrer Musik ist geblieben, doch von den Vorbildern hat sie sich lÃ¤ngst befreit.
[Wenn Sie aktuelle Nachrichten aus Berlin, Deutschland und der Welt live auf Ihr Handy haben wollen, empfehlen wir Ihnen unsere App, die Sie hier fÃ¼r Apple- und Android-GerÃ¤te herunterladen kÃ¶nnen]
Angefangen mit dem noch etwas richtungslos wirkenden Album â€Born To Dieâ€œ, das â€Video Gamesâ€œ enthielt, wurde Lana del Reys Songwriting von Platte zu Platte besser. Das letzte, 2019 erschienene Album â€Norman Fucking Rockwell!â€œ, das fein ziselierte Orchesterarrangements mit retrofuturistisch fiependen Synthesizersounds verknÃ¼pfte, war ihr Meisterwerk. Einmal gehÃ¶rt, bekommt man die fast zehnminÃ¼tige Popsymphonie â€Venice Beachâ€œ nicht mehr aus dem Ohr.
Die Kunst der Inszenierung
AuthentizitÃ¤t von einer PopsÃ¤ngerin zu verlangen, ist ein Widerspruch in sich selbst, schlieÃŸlich liegt im Pop die Kunst gerade in der Inszenierung. Im Fall von Lana del Rey, die aus Zitaten und Huldigungen ein ganz eigenes musikalisches Universum gezimmert hat und bis heute damit beschÃ¤ftigt ist, Zuschreibungen zurÃ¼ckzuweisen, wirkt die Forderung umso absurder. Trotzdem Ã¶ffnet sie auf â€Chemtrails Over The Country Clubâ€œ (auf Polydor/Universal), das an diesem Freitag herauskommt, ihren Panzer und gibt mehr von sich preis denn je.
â€Ich musste mich stÃ¤rker nach innen wendenâ€œ, so hat Lana del Rey gegenÃ¼ber dem britischen Musikmagazin â€Mojoâ€œ ihren Ansatz beschrieben. Fast ist die Platte ein Folkalbum geworden, und von Folksongs wird erwartet, dass sie von echten GefÃ¼hlen, echtem Leben erzÃ¤hlen. Bereits das mit kargen Klavierakkorden einsetzende AuftaktstÃ¼ck â€White Dressâ€œ wirkt bekenntnishaft. Mit wisperndem Falsett beschwÃ¶rt die SÃ¤ngerin ihre KarriereanfÃ¤nge, als sie eine weiÃŸe Kellnerinnenuniform trug, um mit Nachtschichten die Teilnahme an einer Musikkonferenz in Orlando zu finanzieren. Sie musste sich mÃ¼hsam hocharbeiten, lautet die Botschaft. Mag sein, dass sie damit auch dem Eindruck widersprechen mÃ¶chte, mit einem goldenen LÃ¶ffel geboren zu sein, weil ihre Eltern in der Finanz- und Werbebranche arbeiteten.
â€Dance Til We Dieâ€œ heiÃŸt der SchlÃ¼sselsong des Albums. â€Iâ€™m covering Joni and I'm dancing with Joan / Stevie is calling on the telephoneâ€œ, spricht sie da mehr, als dass sie singt. Eine Ahnengalerie, unterlegt mit PianotÃ¶nen, einer flirrenden E-Gitarre und einem gedÃ¤mpft einsetzenden Softrocksaxofon. Stimmt ja auch alles: Mit Fleetwood-Mac-SÃ¤ngerin Stevie Nicks hat del Rey bereits auf ihrem hippieesken Album â€Lust For Lifeâ€œ gesungen, nun covert sie Joni Mitchells Ballade â€For Freeâ€œ. Und mit Joan Baez stand sie bei deren Abschiedstournee in Berkeley auf der BÃ¼hne. Seitdem ist die 80-jÃ¤hrige Folkveteranin voll des Lobes fÃ¼r die jÃ¼ngere Kollegin: â€Sie ist eine auÃŸergewÃ¶hnliche Frau, die ihre Karriere in die eigenen HÃ¤nde genommen hat. Und darauf kommt es an.â€œ
Lana del Rey lebt schon lÃ¤nger in Los Angeles, nun verortet sie sich auch musikalisch im Erbe der â€Ladies of the Canyonâ€œ. Gemeint ist der Laurel Canyon, die bergige Wohngegend, in dem Songwriterinnen gegenkulturelles Engagement mit introspektiven Texten verbanden. Unter den elf StÃ¼cken auf â€Chemtrails Over The Country Clubâ€œ, die Lana del Rey wieder mit ihrem Produzenten Jack Antonoff geschrieben hat, findet sich kein neues â€Venice Beachâ€œ, aber doch einige herausragende Lieder.
Weggehen, um anzukommen
Das schÃ¶nste heiÃŸt â€Let Me Love You Like a Womanâ€œ, vielleicht eine Anspielung auf Carole Kings Klassiker â€(You Make Me Feel Like) A Natural Womanâ€œ. Mit schlÃ¤frig einsetzender, sich weit hochschraubender, gedoppelt in einem Chor endender Stimme zeigt sich die SÃ¤ngerin verletzlich wie begehrend: â€I donâ€™t care where I go as long as youâ€™re with me.â€œ Egal wohin, ich folge dir. Im Hintergrund wimmert eine Slide-Guitar.
Vom Aufbrechen und vom Weggehen, um anzukommen, einem alten Folk- und Country-Topos, ist Ã¼berhaupt viel die Rede. In der Akustikgitarrenballade â€Wanderlustâ€œ reimt del Rey â€Not all those who wander are lost / Itâ€™s just wanderlust.â€œ
Das StÃ¼ck ist minimalistisch instrumentiert, zwischendurch schnarrt die Produzentenstimme aus der Kontrollkabine. â€Wanderlustâ€œ, ein Lehnwort aus dem Deutschen, steht fÃ¼r Fernweh. Lana del Rey will in Bewegung bleiben. Man lÃ¤sst sich gern von ihr mitnehmen.

title: PerchÃ© non possiamo fare a meno di Lana Del Rey
content:
Câ€™Ã¨ bisogno di Lana Del Rey, in tempi come questi. Câ€™Ã¨ bisogno di una voce che scorra lieve sotto i cieli grigi della primavera di qui, evocando la primavera sulla costa tra Los Angeles e San Francisco, le rocce scure e la foschia che si alza dallâ€™oceano, tra villaggi di pescatori e dimore di vecchie glorie della cultura alternativa. Tutto un poâ€™ fanÃ©, come la musica della cantante americana, che col tempo si Ã¨ spogliata di vezzi, orpelli, supporti ritmici e arrangiamenti complicati. Il suo settimo album, Chemtrails Over the Country Club esce oggi e segue Norman Fucking Rockwell!, votato della critica di mezzo mondo come uno dei migliori dischi del 2019. Dalla pandemia Ã¨ stato appena sfiorato, nella fase finale della registrazione, quando il produttore Jack Antonoff (giÃ  con St. Vincent e Taylor Swift), Ã¨ stato costretto a lavorare da remoto. Ci sono quindi le consuete atmosfere da noir anni Cinquanta, malinconie da Yacht Club superesclusivo (o Country Club in questo caso), cuori spezzati e relazioni finite malissimo. Ma anche momenti personali, come nell'iniziale White Dress, che racconta di quando Lana lavorava come cameriera e aveva ancora il suo vero nome: Elizabeth Woolridge Grant.
Nelle interviste, come lâ€™ultima a Mojo, non manca mai il riferimento a un passato oscuro per le strade di New York, dove arrivÃ² diciottenne da una cittadina di provincia. Diverse false partenze, poi il boom di Born To Die, pubblicato nel 2012 e finito subito al primo posto nelle top ten di 11 Paesi. Da allora miliardi di streaming, 4 album in cima alle classifiche nel Regno Unito, oltre 16 milioni di copie vendute, centinaia di concerti.
Per Joan Baez, che ha cantato con lei dal vivo qualche anno fa, Ã¨ â€œuna donna straordinariaâ€; nel disco, Dance til we Die nasce da quella serata con la regina del folk americano. Grandi complimenti arrivano anche intanto anche da Bruce Springsteen: â€œLana Del Rey crea un mondo tutto suo e ti invita a farne parteâ€.
In quel piccolo capolavoro che Ã¨ Dark But Just a Game lei sussurra â€œContinuiamo a cambiare continuamente / I migliori hanno perso la testa / Quindi non cambierÃ² / ResterÃ² la stessaâ€. Ãˆ, come sempre, una figura protagonista, totalmente in controllo, non ha bisogno di esaltare niente della sua femminilitÃ , a 36 anni non deve esibirsi per esistere, non deve perÃ² neppure nascondersi. Chemtrails Over the Country Club si chiude citando Joni Mitchell, di cui Ã¨ ripresa For Free, con le voci di Weyes Blood e Zella Day. Parla di viaggi, di movimento, di libertÃ : di cui câ€™Ã¨ tanto bisogno, come câ€™Ã¨ bisogno di Lana Del Rey.

title: Lana Del Rey, une voix puissante qui se (re)dÃ©couvre
content:
La chanteuse amÃ©ricaine Lana Del Rey sort vendredi son huitiÃ¨me album, "Chemtrails Over The Country Club", comme toujours avec elle une cÃ©lÃ©bration d'un passÃ© rÃ©volu, californien et cette fois trÃ¨s fÃ©minin. Avec une voix qui, sur disque comme dans l'industrie musicale, porte de plus en plus.
On ne peut pas dire qu'elle ait franchement levÃ© le pied. AoÃ»t 2019 : Lana Del Rey dÃ©voile Norman Fucking Rockwell, un album suivi d'un triomphe critique. Un an plus tard, surprise, c'est dans un recueil de ses poÃ¨mes qu'elle fait entendre sa voix, Violent Bent Backwards Over The Grass. Et voilÃ  qu'aujourd'hui, elle surprend encore.
Car si Ã  35 ans, Lana Del Rey semble avoir dÃ©passÃ© le stade des moqueries de dÃ©but de carriÃ¨re - trop maniÃ©rÃ©e, peu naturelle, jugÃ©e sous toutes les coutures avec les remarques les plus sexistes -, ce huitiÃ¨me album est une nouvelle redÃ©couverte. Hommage poignant Ã  Laurel Canyon, bastion de la crÃ©ation folk dans la Californie des annÃ©es 1970, on y entend une simplicitÃ© peu Ã©prouvÃ©e jusqu'ici par la chanteuse.
Et l'hommage ne trompe pas, puisque Lana Del Rey reprend For Free, morceau de son idole et inspiratrice Joni Mitchell pour clÃ´turer l'album en compagnie de la chanteuse Weyes Blood... Lizzy Grant, de son vrai nom, est aujourd'hui une voix puissante d'une industrie musicale amÃ©ricaine au sein de laquelle les femmes sont Ã  la pointe. Lana Del Rey Ã©voque en creux, et dans plusieurs morceaux, une lutte de dix ans pour se faire une place.
En prÃ´nant la sororitÃ©, Lana Del Rey s'est Ã©chappÃ©e du regard des hommes, qui avait tendance Ã  l'enfermer dans un rÃ´le bien trop Ã©troit. C'est aujourd'hui, une artiste et une interprÃ¨te plus libre que jamais.
"Chemtrails Over The Country Club", le nouvel album de Lana Del Rey | La chronique de Yann Bertrand Ã©couter
Lana Del Rey, Chemtrails Over The Country Club (Polydor/Universal). Album disponible.

title: Lana Del Rey: Chemtrails Over the Country Club review
content:
There is boldly talking your new album up, and then there is the approach taken by Lana Del Rey prior to the release of Chemtrails Over the Country Club. â€œI am literally changing the world by putting my life and thoughts and love out there on the table 24 seven,â€ she wrote during a social media exchange about her eighth solo albumâ€™s cover art. â€œRespect it.â€
Clearly, here were rich pickings for connoisseurs of the point where a pop star says something so self-regarding it makes your head hurt, but Del Ray may be forgiven for getting carried away. An artist given an unfairly rough ride on arrival, she finds herself, a decade on, not merely vastly commercially successful, but hugely influential, the inspiration behind a wave of melancholy bedroom pop that loops disconsolately in the background of TikTok videos. Moreover, her last album, 2019â€™s Norman Fucking Rockwell!, topped critical end of year lists (including in the Guardian) and was hailed as the work of â€œsimply one of the best songwriters in the countryâ€ by Bruce Springsteen. She was recently featured on the front of a heritage rock magazine that doesnâ€™t ordinarily put photographs of thirtysomething singer-songwriters on its cover unless they were taken in 1972. â€œJoan Baez advocates her acceptance in the pantheon,â€ it wrote, reassuring its more conservative readers.
Facebook Twitter Pinterest Lana Del Rey: Chemtrails Over the Country Club album cover
This has all been achieved by refining what she does rather than radically remodelling it. There are points where Chemtrails Over the Country Club edges slightly into new territory: when she abandons her dead-eyed vocal style for a breathy falsetto that sounds edgy and panicked; when the geographical location of her lyrics moves from LA to the midwest; when the sound of Dark But Just a Game is subjected to a series of jump-cuts, her vocal suddenly losing its coating of distortion, the backing shifting from echoey to claustrophobically intimate. But these are minor alterations, not tearing up the plans.
The songs stick to her patented tempo â€“ everything moves with all the pacy zip of the World Indoor Bowls Championship â€“ and exists in the space Del Rey demarcated some time ago, where trip-hop meets early 70s singer-songwriter stylings, the lush spookiness of Julee Cruiseâ€™s Floating Into the Night and the reverb-y sound of Mazzy Star. Its lyrical cast is heavily populated by brooding, neâ€™er-do-well men â€“ â€œIâ€™m on the run with you my sweet loveâ€ etc â€“ for whom the protagonist will do anything: â€œWe should go back to Arkansas, trade this body for that can of gin.â€ There are ruminations on the dark side of fame and success â€“ â€œtheir stories all end tragically â€¦ the best ones lose their minds,â€ suggests Dark But Just a Game â€“ with a dash of bitter personal experience thrown in. Opener White Dress finds her recalling her pre-fame job as a waitress, with the kind of period detail that doubtless pushes nostalgia buttons for the millennial wing of her fanbase (â€œlistening to the White Stripes when they were white hotâ€) and wondering aloud if â€œmaybe I was better offâ€.
She also does the things she keeps angrily telling people she never does: singing in character, projecting a persona, writing with her tongue lodged firmly in her cheek â€“ on Breaking Up Slowly, her latest neâ€™er-do-well partner is depicted as the alcoholic country singer George Jones, reacting to having his car keys deliberately hidden from him by heading off to the liquor store on his sit-on lawnmower â€“ and warranting the word â€œmetaâ€. â€œIâ€™m covering Joni,â€ she sings on Dance Til We Die, shortly before doing precisely that, closing the album with a version of For Free, another gloomy rumination on the hollowness of fame, from Joni Mitchellâ€™s 1970 album Ladies of the Canyon.
There are certainly points where you think youâ€™ve heard a lot of this stuff before; perhaps the claims for her genius have a lot to do with context. In a pop world predicated on trend-chasing, her doubling-down approach is how Del Rey has developed such a recognisable musical identity that her name has started to take on an adjectival quality: if you describe a song as Lana Del Rey-esque, people know exactly what you mean.
Still, Chemtrails Over the Country Club does what it does exceptionally well. The songwriting misfires that plagued her early albums have been eradicated through that refinement; everything here is incredibly melodically strong, strong enough, in fact, that it feels beguiling rather than formulaic, which is an impressive feat to pull off. It literally isnâ€™t going to change the world, no matter what its creator thinks. But almost uniquely among her peers, sheâ€™s created a world of her own, which is deserving of respect. How long she can keep inhabiting it before that world feels confined is another question.
What Alexis listened to this week
Mykki Blanco: Free Ride
Apparently influenced by Luther Vandross, the rapperâ€™s return is a joyous, tumbling Hudson Mohawke-co-produced pleasure.

title: Lana Del Rey Releases Album Chemtrails Over the Country Club
content:
Photo: YouTube/LanaDelRey
Open the window overlooking the golf course and take a big, deep breath, because Lana Del Rey has just dropped Chemtrails Over the Country Club. The singerâ€™s seventh studio album, which arrived Thursday night, was largely produced by Jack Antonoff. Chemtrails features eleven tracks, including a cover of Joni Mitchellâ€™s â€œFor Free,â€ featuring Zella Day and Weyes Blood, from Mitchellâ€™s 1970 album Ladies of the Canyon. Del Rey references the album-closing track in another of the albumâ€™s previous songs. â€œIâ€™m covering Joni and Iâ€™m dancing with Joan/Stevie is callinâ€™ on the telephone,â€ she sings on â€œDance Till We Die.â€
The singer teased her impending release earlier in the day on social media, snapping a photo of the album on vinyl at Walmart. â€œWhat a pretty day in LA to release an album,â€ Del Rey tweeted. Chemtrails Over the Country Club is the singerâ€™s first EP since 2019â€™s Norman Fucking Rockwell!, thought she released spoken word album Violet Bent Backwards Over the Grass just last year.

title: Alben der Woche: Neues von Lana del Rey, Paul Stanley, Phoebe Lou
content:
Vegyn - "Like a Good Old Friend" (Plz Make It Ruins/Rough Trade)
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen
Es ist ja alles nicht so leicht gerade. Lockdown-Winter, steigende Infektionszahlen, dazu Sturm und Regen. HÃ¶chste Zeit also fÃ¼r Seelenmusik. Irgendwas jedenfalls, das einen mindestens so effektiv ausbalanciert und mit Energie versorgt wie 382 Yogastunden. HÃ¶chste Zeit fÃ¼r Vegyn. Oder Krautjazz. Beides klingt sehr gesund, vegan und fermentiert halt. Keine akustischen Sedativa, sondern sanfte Muntermacher. Hinter Vegyn verbirgt sich der Londoner Produzent Joe Thornalley, der bereits fÃ¼r Frank Ocean gearbeitet und mit dem eigensinnigen Noiserapper JPEGMAFIA kollaboriert hat. 2019 erschien sein DebÃ¼talbum voller kleiner Perlen, die mal aus der Hip-Hop-Bay, dann wieder aus den smoothen GewÃ¤ssern der elektronischen Tanzmusik gefischt waren. Sehr uneitle, aber nicht ambitionslose, coole, aber in warmen Synth-TÃ¶nen gehaltene Tracks. Genug Beat-Gefrickel, um die Nervenzellen im Hirn aktiv zu halten, aber mindestens genauso viel Harmonik und flimmerhÃ¤rchenstreichelnde Klangtextur. Seine neue EP heiÃŸt "Like a Good Old Friend" (Plz Make It Ruins/Rough Trade), und damit ist eigentlich schon alles gesagt. Auf diesen Freund kann man sich auch im erzwungenen Alleinsein verlassen. Die Soundgeneratoren pumpen weich, die Melodien bewegen sich wie sanfte Wellen. Sogar die effektverfremdeten Sprachsamples knarzen irgendwie menschenfreundlich. Dabei einzuschlafen, muss aber auch niemand befÃ¼rchten, dafÃ¼r passiert zu viel. WÃ¤re Vegyn ein Gesundheitsprodukt, wÃ¼rden wir werben: Die perfekte Balance zwischen Anspannung und Entspannung. "Sometimes I feel like I'm ruining songs" heiÃŸt der letzte Track. Er kann beruhigt sein. Ist alles sehr hÃ¼bsch geworden.
Mathias Modica - "Kraut Jazz Futurism"-Compilation (Kryptox / !K7 Records)
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen
Mathias Modica, der MÃ¼nchner Gourmet fÃ¼r unbekannte, aber dafÃ¼r umso interessantere Musik aus Deutschland schenkt uns derweil den zweiten Teil seiner "Kraut Jazz Futurism"-Compilation (Kryptox / !K7 Records). Der erste enthielt unter anderem geheime Hits wie "Orange Man" von Karl Hector & The Malcouns. Auch die neue Zusammenstellung bereitet wieder groÃŸes VergnÃ¼gen. Hier regieren Rhythmus und Spielfreude. Ein paar psychedelische Keyboards dÃ¼rfen orgeln, aber vor allem ist diese Musik, die bei aller HeterogenitÃ¤t der Bands tatsÃ¤chlich treffend Krautjazz genannt werden kann, ein Fest des offenen Grooves. Offen, insofern diese Songs nichts werden wollen, sondern im stÃ¤ndigen Werden ganz bei sich sind. Der Groove, muss man wissen, ist so etwas wie der Chefgott der Musik. Nur viel cooler als jeder Chefgott. Weshalb er viel Ã¶fter in einer wilden Orgie gefeiert werden sollte. Zum Beispiel mit einem percussiongetriebenen, ritualschreiangereicherten "Tanz um den Melkeimer".
Alice Phoebe Lous - "Glow" (Alice Phoebe Lou)
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen
Die wilden Orgien liegen auf Alice Phoebe Lous neuem Album "Glow" (Alice Phoebe Lou) wohl eher in der Vergangenheit. Jedenfalls haucht sie, die Stimme vernebelt von geisterhaftem Studiotremolo, gleich im ersten Song "Only when you're far away, far away, far away", wÃ¤hrend links und rechts Analogsynthesizerarpeggien am Layed-back-Schunkelbeat herunterrinnen wie Rapunzels Haar. Die Musik ist eigenproduziert. Sehr Hi-Fi, alle Instrumente nah am Ohr und dicht beieinander: Kammerfolk, der einen sofort in seinen Bann zieht. Wobei immer wieder auch die Indie-E-Gitarre zuschlÃ¤gt. Ein Schrammeltrauma muss aber niemand fÃ¼rchten, dafÃ¼r sorgen schon Dreiertakt-Balladen wie "Mother's Eyes". Ãœberhaupt hat Alice Phoebe Lou ein feines Sensorium fÃ¼r Chefgott Groove, dafÃ¼r, dass auch Singer-Songwriter-Musik einen Tanz in sich tragen muss, und sei er auch aus dem letzten "Corner of My Mind" heraus geboren. Was Schmacht-Country nur mit E-Gitarre und ein bisschen Slide-Schmelz wie "How to Get out of Love" nicht ausschlieÃŸt. Seit Jahren gehÃ¶rt die SÃ¼dafrikanerin zur Berliner Musikszene. "Glow" ist kein Album, das auf den Mainstream schielt. Dank des starken Songwritings und der feinen Arrangements ist es trotzdem Ã¼beraus zugÃ¤nglich. Und es bietet eine Menge selbstbewusste Sehnsucht: "I ache for you but it doesn't paint me blue." So Ã¼bersteht man auch die dritte Welle.
Paul Stanley's Soul Station - "Now And Then" (Universal Music)
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen
Da hat wieder einer sein Jodeldiplom geschafft: Paul Stanley, MitgrÃ¼nder der New Yorker Schmink-Schock-Beatles Kiss, hat ein zehnkÃ¶pfiges Miniorchester um sich geschart - und spielt authentisch verbrÃ¤mten 60er- und 70er-Soul. Neben Versionen der Klassiker von Smokey Robinson, den Stylistics oder Temptations hat Stanley auch fÃ¼nf eigene Genre-Songs geschrieben. Der Spott sitzt hier locker, dafÃ¼r muss man zugeben: Seine Stimme klingt im Kontext super, die neue Samthose passt. Daran, dass "Now And Then" unnÃ¶tig wie ein zweiter Eierschneider in einer bestens ausgestatteten WohnkÃ¼che ist, Ã¤ndert das nichts.
Lana Del Rey - "Chemtrails Over The Country Club" (Universal Music)
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen
Detailliert rezensieren kÃ¶nnen und dÃ¼rfen wir dieses Werk vor der VerÃ¶ffentlichung leider nicht. Aber wenn man nach dem geht, was vorab Ã¼ber das achte Album der amerikanischen Fantasy-Songwriter-Diva zu hÃ¶ren war, ist dies ein mehr als wÃ¼rdiger Nachfolger zur Sensationsplatte "Norman Fucking Rockwell!". Etwas gedeckter im Ton, insgesamt so sommermelancholisch, wie es die bereits verÃ¶ffentlichten Songs vermuten lassen. An einem riesigen, bestimmt auf einer Soundstage der Paramount-Studios gelegten Hollywood-Lagerfeuer singt sie zum Schluss sogar ein Joni-Mitchell-StÃ¼ck. Klasse, in jeder Wortbedeutung.
Bell Orchestre - "House Music" (Erased Tapes / Indigo)
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen
FÃ¼r alle, die sich einfach mal davontragen lassen wollen aus dem ganzen Schlamassel, sei zum Schluss noch "House Music" (Erased Tapes / Indigo) empfohlen, der erste Longplayer seit zehn Jahren von Bell Orchestre. Die Instrumental-Band aus Montreal kann man aufgrund der personellen Ãœberschneidungen fast als Nebenprojekt von Arcade Fire bezeichnen. Offen wie Krautjazz ist diese "House Music", grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils in Improvisationssessions entstanden. Aber statt Jazz gibt es einen Ausflug in weite, bewegte Klanglandschaften. Der Schichten von E-Bass Ã¼ber Streicher bis zum BlechblÃ¤serensemble sind darin viele, aber Wall of Sound wÃ¤re trotzdem ein viel zu martialischer Begriff fÃ¼r den Charakter dieser Indie-Sinfonien. Die Orchestre-Mitglieder bauen stattdessen flexible Klangraumteiler, die immer wieder neue Konstellationen bilden. Die Stimmung verÃ¤ndert sich gleitend wie das Wetter. Eine Musik, die sich wie die groÃŸe Bewegungsfreiheit anfÃ¼hlt.

title: Justin Bieber & More: Vote for Your Favorite New Music!
content:
Artists from Justin Bieber to Lana Del Rey continue a much deeper exploration of their artistry and the world around them with their new music. But which release are you wanting to explore more this week?
Bieber delivered Justice, his sixth studio album, which explores the outer edges of joy and his personal perseverance through punchy, radio-friendly anthems. LDR crisscrosses the country throughout her seventh studio album Chemtrails Over the Country Club, juxtaposing natural beauty and material wealth in her dreamy ballads.
With "Tu Veneno" ("Your Poison"), J Balvin provides not a head-banging reggaeton club banger, but a head-nodding contemplative track about a toxic relationship. And Paloma Mami explores her identity and dexterity through bilingual lyricism and switching her flow up between singing and rapping on her debut album SueÃ±os de DalÃ­.

title: First Stream: Justin Bieber, Lana Del Rey & More
content:
Justin Bieber gains more artistic clarity on Justice, as he tries to express a complex emotional state -- focused on the happiness of marriage, but interested in the outer edges of that joy -- over the course of an album instead of jamming it into three minutes. There have been countless iterations of Justin Bieber The Pop Superstar, but this one is spending the time to help fans understand who he is and where he's going, and the result is his strongest front-to-back listen to date. (Click here to read the full review of Justin Bieberâ€™s Justice.)
Lana Del Rey, Chemtrails Over The Country Club
Two years after 2019â€™s Norman F--king Rockwell! became Lana Del Reyâ€™s critical breakthrough, earning her best career reviews and multiple Big Four Grammy nominations, follow-up Chemtrails Over The Country Club finds the singer-songwriter continuing to challenge herself as a conduit of American narratives. The album criss-crosses the country, with images of natural beauty, material wealth and religious uncertainty flickering to the forefront; Del Reyâ€™s voice has been hypnotizing audiences for nearly a decade, but her latest songs are worth returning to for the trinkets and turns of phrase buried in her words. Paloma Mami, SueÃ±os de DalÃ­
Paloma RocÃ­o Castillo Astorga, the 21-year-old better known as Paloma Mami, has a crystal-clear vision of her artistry: she can sing and rap, flow in and out of Spanish and English, bounce around genres but commits wholeheartedly to the sound in which sheâ€™s operating. SueÃ±os de DalÃ­ is such an exciting debut thanks to that mix of identity and dexterity, with songs like â€œI Love Her,â€ â€œTraumadaâ€ and â€œFor Yaâ€ showing off the width of Paloma Mamiâ€™s palette without ever spreading her skills too thin.
Lil Tjay feat. Polo G & Fivio Foreign, â€œHeadshotâ€
Although Polo G and Lil Tjay combined for one of the catchiest hip-hop hits of 2019 in â€œPop Out,â€ their latest collaboration, also featuring Fivio Foreign, forgoes a hook entirely, instead functioning as a showcase for the trioâ€™s respective flows much like Polo Gâ€™s â€œGo Stupidâ€ did last year. â€œHeadshotâ€ opens with Polo Gâ€™s charismatic storytelling and closes with Tjayâ€™s airborne delivery, with Fivio Foreign providing heaps of braggadocio in between. J Balvin, â€œTu Venenoâ€
After releasing the crackling â€œMaâ€™ Gâ€ as the first taste to his next album, J Balvin has showcased his range by following the single up with a meditative reggaeton single. â€œTu Venenoâ€ (â€œYour Poisonâ€) provides the listener with a rhythm that makes for easy head-nodding, but Balvin, crooning about a toxic relationship, is more concerned with delivering an emotional impact here. Addison Rae, â€œObsessedâ€
As TikTok staple Addison Rae begins her transition from social media star to full-fledged recording artist, sheâ€™s recruited some heavy hitters for her first step, as debut single â€œObsessedâ€ was produced by Benny Blanco, Blake Slatkin and Ryan McMahon. The spacious pop track allows Rae, who co-wrote â€œObsessed,â€ the opportunity to ease into the new role -- while also providing a few killer lines, like â€œWhen you say that youâ€™re obsessed with me? Me too,â€ pristine for 10-second excerpts.

title: Lana Del Rey's 'White Dress' Video: Watch
content:
The twilight illuminates Lana Del Rey's "White Dress" as her double blissfully rollerblades down a desert road in a new music video, out Friday (March 19). A talented woman, meant to represent the 19-year-old Del Rey, is shown skating throughout the video.
LDR's real-life stunts were less graceful, and the klutzy Lutz landed her in an arm sling (that can be seen in the visual), which she explained last winter. "I wiped out on my beautiful skates before the video even began after a long day of figure eights and jumps in the twilight of the dezert," she wrote on Instagram back in December. "Anyways my fracture isnâ€™t that bad kind of goes with my new bucket hat. Thanks to my beautiful family for my gifts."
Regardless, the serene Constellation Jones-directed clip bids adieu to a blissful summer of waitressing, singing in the street and wishing to do it all over again because it "made me feel like a god."

Aqui tem aquela voz super aguda e bonita de novo. Ã‰ tÃ£o minimalista que atÃ© deixa de remeter aos anos 70 e lembra o folk alternativo da dÃ©cada passada. Mas sem perder a cara de Lana.

â€œYosemiteâ€
Tudo aqui Ã© hippie demais: o tÃ­tulo com nome do parque da CalifÃ³rnia, os versos contemplativos e otimistas, o dedilhado e atÃ© uma percussÃ£o.
O arranjo lembra uma roda de violÃµes em volta de uma fogueira com amigos cantando - e atÃ© faz pensar se isso nÃ£o seria uma ideia tÃ£o ruim assim.
â€œBreaking up slowlyâ€
SÃ³ nessa mÃºsica a voz de Lana del Rey parece caricatural demais. Ela imita uma cantora country antiga - intenÃ§Ã£o que fica Ã³bvia no verso "nÃ£o quero teminar como Tammy Wynette" , citando a artista falecida.
Mas vale a intenÃ§Ã£o de cruzar estilos na mÃºsica feita em parceria com a cantora e compositora country Nikki Lane.
"Dance Till We Die"
Outra bela melodia e mais uma letra cheia de nostalgia que ainda prepara o cenÃ¡rio para o fechamento do disco.
"Eu tenho feito covers de Joni e danÃ§ado com Joan", ela abre a mÃºsica, citando com intimidade as veteranas de sobrenome Michell e Baez. Depois, ainda incorpora um arranjo e vocal roqueiro anos 60 e cita Bob Dylan
"For Free"
Lana termina o disco fazendo o que descreveu na faixa anterior: uma cover de Joni (Mitchell). Ã‰ "For free", uma canÃ§Ã£o amarga de 1970 sobre o mundo falso da fama e do showbusiness.
Para trazer a ideia para o presente e para o cenÃ¡rio inicial do disco de encontro de amigas, ela chama duas cantoras menos conhecidas do indie folk atual: Weyes Blood e Zella Day.

title: On Chemtrails Over the Country Club, Lana Del Rey moves the focus away from men
content:
Two things happen when I give each new Lana Del Rey album a spin. I get a complete thrill â€“ at what sheâ€™s turned out to be, how clearly her strange aesthetic plays out, how witty her words are these days, how strong and consistent her imaginative world. And then I have a big slump. It might be that her records are front-loaded with all the good tracks: there seems to be a dazzling setting out of the stall, each time, then 30 minutes sitting behind it twiddling her hair. But does it really matter if she basically does one thing when that thing itself is getting better and better? â€œVideo Gamesâ€, her first hit, floated out on its own in 2011 as a viral phenomenon, detached from any idea of who she was. It wasnâ€™t just a song â€“ it was a mood and a world. In Chemtrails Over The Country Club, Del Reyâ€™s unusual, 3D music continues.
In recent years itâ€™s become apparent that she is funny. At least in her songs. In â€œWhite Dressâ€, where minimalist music and cloud-scrapingly high vocals give all the impression of deep introspection, she reminisces about being a waitress, â€œ...wearing a white dress / Look how I do this, look how I got this / [...] Down at the Men In Music Business Conference / I only mention it because it was such a sceneâ€. She has always managed to make things modern and mundane sound classic, which is probably she was drawn to the hyperreal world of 1950s advertising. But increasingly her strength is in the jarring banality of her images, in such a sincere-sounding setting. That is where the surprises lie.
Those who like Joni Mitchell will pick up a handful of piano notes at the start of â€œWhite Dressâ€ that recall her 1970 song â€œWillyâ€. Del Rey boldly closes the album with a cover of Mitchellâ€™s â€œFor Freeâ€, sung with Zella Day and Weyes Blood (who is such an uncanny match for Mitchell that I assumed it was a sample). In â€œFor Freeâ€, Mitchell pines for a former, simpler life as a musician, as Del Rey pines for her waitress days. Even chemtrails â€“ well, jet trails â€“ are Joni Mitchell images: on â€œAmeliaâ€, she sings of their pattern in the sky: â€œIt was the hexagram of the heavens / It was the strings of my guitar.â€
Some of what Del Rey is doing lyrically is the same as she did on 2019â€™s Norman Fucking Rockwell!. The effortless eroticism of the line â€œIâ€™m taking off my bathing suitâ€ (from that albumâ€™s "The Next Best American Record") is reflected in Chemtrails Over The Country Clubâ€™s title track: â€œWearing our jewels in the swimming pool / Just me and my sister playing it cool.â€ But perhaps there is a freer spirit emerging than the cartoon waspy girl lounging sulkily in the Hamptons. There was a song on the last album called â€œHope is a Dangerous Thing for a Woman Like Me to Have â€“ But I Have Itâ€, where Del Rey pictured herself â€œtearing around in my fucking nightgown / 24/7 Sylvia Plathâ€. In â€œChemtrails Over The Country Clubâ€, she says: â€œIâ€™m not unhinged or unhappy, Iâ€™m just wild.â€
Whatever the new spirit is, it is enhancing the persona and moving the focus away from the men she loved to worship: I always had an image of her throwing herself down and wiping their feet with her hair. And thatâ€™s the biggest difference on the new record: Del Reyâ€™s awful, miserable boy-men are absent. There is plenty of relationship stuff, but it washes over you, taking second place to her eccentricities. Talk of love seems more self-contained, as in â€œBreaking Up Slowlyâ€ (â€œI donâ€™t want to end up like Tammy Wynetteâ€), which is so tightly written and self-consciously country that I thought Miley Cyrus was duetting on it (itâ€™s actually Nikki Lane).
Speaking of strange voices, Del Reyâ€™s wispy angel singing may dominate (in â€œNot All Who Wander Are Lostâ€, she harmonises with herself over ethereal sprays of acoustic guitar) but on â€œDance Till We Dieâ€ she breaks, for a few seconds, into a great bit of blues singing, with a squelching Janis Joplin backdrop. The song is about the Louisiana two-step and Iâ€™m pretty sure Del Rey must have watched Jane Fonda in They Shoot Horses Donâ€™t They before she wrote it. Who knows, maybe there is more musical variation from her on the horizon. And if there isnâ€™t, there is plenty of room in the world for Lana Del Rey to keep doing what she does.

title: Il ritorno di Lana Del Rey: sognante e malinconica con "Chemtrails Over The Country Club"
content:
Dopo il grande successo del precedente disco "Norman Fucking Rockwell" , uscito nel 2019 e candidato ai Grammy, arriva finalmente il nuovo album di Lana Del Rey. Il settimo lavoro della cantante americana si intitola "Chemtrails Over The Country Club" e include 11 nuove tracce sognanti, tra malinconia e chiaroscuri. Perla dell'album Ã¨ la cover del classico di Joni Mitchell, "For Free", cantato in collaborazione con Zella Day e Weyes Blood, una canzone che per Lana "significa tutto", come rivelato nell'intervista esclusiva a Mojo.
Leggi Anche Lana De Rey anticipa il nuovo album con un video seducente e animalista
Alla rivista americana la Del Rey ha raccontato che dai brani del nuovo album traspare un suo lato "piÃ¹ vulnerabile, e piÃ¹ innocentemente emotivo". Intanto pochi giorni prima dallâ€™uscita, aveva condiviso un messaggio con video molto enigmatico: "Questo Ã¨ il mio ultimo post mentre il mio album si avvicina rapidamente. Grazie mille a tutti i miei amici per il vostro supporto fino ad ora e... per tutto. FinchÃ© non ci rivedremo, sarÃ² lÃ  fuori da qualche parte correndo con i lupi".
A fine fine maggio 2020 Lana Del Rey aveva condiviso un messaggio sui social, anticipando la data dâ€™uscita del disco per settembre. Ma a causa dellâ€™emergenza sanitaria, Ã¨ stata costretta a posticipare il tutto per alcuni ritardi nella produzione del disco. Il primo singolo estratto dal disco Ã¨ stato â€œLet Me Love You like a Womanâ€, che Ã¨ arrivato sulle piattaforme digitali a ottobre 2020.
Instagram
A gennaio Ã¨ uscito il singolo "Chemtrails Over The Country Club" e poche settimane fa un teaser aveva lanciato il video di "White Dress", ispirato ai film di David Lynch, uscito contestualmente all'album. A fine luglio invece Lana ha pubblicato la sua prima raccolta di poesie dal titolo â€œViolet Bent Backwards over the Grassâ€, uscito in versione audiolibro; la seconda parte, â€œBehind the Iron Gates â€“ Insights from the Institutionâ€, dovrebbe uscire nelle prossime settimane.
Ma non Ã¨ finita qui. A quanto pare il 2021 sarÃ  davvero il suo anno. Appena uscito "Chemtrails Over the Country Club", la Del Rey ha giÃ  annunciato che il suo prossimo album intitolato "Rock Candy Sweet" uscirÃ  l'1 giugno 2021.

title: "Chemtrails Over the Country Club"
content:
Tre beste lÃ¥ter: Â«Not All Who Wander Are LostÂ», Â«Love You Like A WomanÂ», Â«Wild At HeartÂ»
Den nevnte dekadensen og glamouren har definert Lana del Rey som artist de siste ti Ã¥rene, etter Â«begravelsenÂ» av hennes fÃ¸rste artistnavn Lizzy Grant i 2010. Hun har formidlet en fascinasjon for estetikken rundt Hollywoods gullalder og datidens historiske og mytiske personer.
Dette ambisiÃ¸se imagekremmeriet har bidratt til at hun nÃ¥ nÃ¦rmest ses pÃ¥ som en utenomjordisk velsignelse blant fansen, og en glitrende haug med falskt gull av kritikerne.
Med Â«Chemtrails Over the Country ClubÂ», som egentlig skulle slippes i september i fjor, men ble bremset av pandemien, begir Lana Del Rey seg ut pÃ¥ den vanskelige Ã¸velsen det er Ã¥ kombinere aggressiv og pÃ¥klistret dekadens med jordnÃ¦r og folkelig americana. Hun vil tilbake til rÃ¸ttene â€“ men ikke sine egne rÃ¸tter.
Â«Chemtrails Over the Country ClubÂ»
Lana Del Rey har en brokete, men privilegert bakgrunn fra nordÃ¸st-USA: Et omrÃ¥de som ikke akkurat forbindes med americana og som ligger langt fra hjertet av Amerika. Det er en interessant sjangerblanding, bÃ¥de kulturelt og musikalsk.
Etter en altfor forsiktig start utvikler denne plata seg til Ã¥ bli en interessant og noksÃ¥ nyskapende sjangerblanding.
Imponerende sjangermiks
Lana Del Reys episke ballader setter gustne prÃ¦rier i nytt, glamorÃ¸st lys, men ikke fÃ¸r et par rimelig tradisjonelle barokkpop-numre er unnagjort.
Ã…pningslÃ¥ta Â«White DressÂ» er irriterende skarpt vokalmikset, og selv om Lana forsÃ¸ker seg pÃ¥ sin beste Kate Bush-imitasjon faller denne enkelt under paraplyen intet nytt under solen. Hovedsingelen og tittellÃ¥ta er heller ikke noe voldsomt bidrag til americana-fÃ¸lelsen jeg tolker som mÃ¥let med plata.
FÃ¸rste tredel av plata glir mer eller mindre over i hverandre, som et velkjent soundtrack til det moderne, amerikanske aristokratiet.
Â«Love You Like A WomanÂ»
Det er ikke fÃ¸r lÃ¥t nummer fire, Â«Let Me Love You Like a WomanÂ», at man kan ane omrisset av tradisjonsrik americana. Her er spor av bÃ¥de Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young og Joan Baez, og det skulle ikke forundre meg om Lana Del Rey i all sin iver etter Ã¥ romantisere svunne tider, har lagt sin elsk pÃ¥ musikken og motkulturens storhetstid i Laurel Canyon pÃ¥ slutten av 60-tallet.
PÃ¥ Â«Wild at HeartÂ» tar hun for fÃ¸rste gang pÃ¥ plata et ordentlig grep om americanaens malerkost. Lerretet er Del Reys farvel med det glatte og kommersielle Los Angeles, og musikalsk er dette en imponerende sjangermiks. Det urbane og storslÃ¥tte er i behold, mens det jordnÃ¦re og bondske Ã¸nskes velkommen med klassisk country-koring og et skikkelig sleggeslag av et refreng.
Â«Wild At HeartÂ»
AmbisiÃ¸st og stemningsfullt
Etter en fullstendig malplassert 90-tallspastisj i Â«Dark But Just a GameÂ» er vi enda dypere inn i det amerikanske heartland pÃ¥ Â«Not All Who Wander Are LostÂ». Dette er nok selve bindingsverket mellom glamour og gulrotÃ¥ker. Denne lÃ¥ta byr pÃ¥ et mer akustisk uttrykk, og gir Lana Del Rey en helt ny musikalsk verden Ã¥ utforske. Den stÃ¥r seg som kroneksempelet pÃ¥ hvordan sjangerblandingen pÃ¥ denne plata kan gjÃ¸res pÃ¥ en interessant og ikke minst musikalsk formÃ¥lstjenlig mÃ¥te.
Â«Chemtrails Over The Country ClubÂ» er noe sÃ¥ sjeldent som en slags Â«Citizen KaneÂ» i Arkansas. Produsent og medlÃ¥tskriver Jack Antonoff har vÃ¦rt like involvert her som han var i Taylor Swifts glitrende Â«folkloreÂ» og mindre glitrende Â«evermoreÂ», og selv om stilskiftet ikke er like radikalt, har han og Lana Del Rey laget et ambisiÃ¸st og meget stemningsfullt album som forteller en historie om Lana Del Reys forsiktige start pÃ¥ et farvel med glitter og glamour i Los Angeles.
Platas vaklevorne og forutsigbare start blir heldigvis raskt glemt med den glidende overgangen ut pÃ¥ den musikalske prÃ¦rien.
Avslutningsnummeret, Â«For FreeÂ», er en Joni Mitchell-cover sammen med Zella Day og Weyes Blood. Den visker ut enhver tvil om at Lana Ã¸nsker seg tilbake til Laurel Canyon-dagene, og heldigvis kan hun gÃ¥ fra forsÃ¸ket om Ã¥ komme seg dit med hodet hÃ¸yt hevet.
Â«Chemtrails Over the Country ClubÂ»

approfondimento Lana Del Rey, pubblicata un'anteprima del videoclip di White Dress In allegato a questo messaggio un video che riprende il teaser del singolo â€œWhite Dressâ€, uscito poche settimane fa. Dopo un fortunatissimo tour in giro per il mondo, Lana Del Rey Ã¨ stato il turno dellâ€™album â€œHoneymoonâ€, mentre nel 2017 ha pubblicato â€œLust for Lifeâ€ e intrapreso il lungo tour mondiale â€œLA to the Moon Tourâ€. title: As 6 artistas femininas mais indicadas de todos os tempos ao Grammy
content:
Lizzo (Foto: instagram / reproduÃ§Ã£o)
Esse Ã© realmente o ano da Lizzo. Em 2019, a artista de R&B que tocava flauta conseguiu o sucesso no mainstream (e 27 milhÃµes de ouvintes no Spotify) com o single de sucesso, Truth Hurts, quase dois anos apÃ³s seu lanÃ§amento inicial. E agora, uma turnÃª mundial Truth Hurts esgotada, uma apresentaÃ§Ã£o no MTV Video Music Awards que viralizou e uma mÃºsica no topo da parada da Billboard dos EUA culminaram em sua indicaÃ§Ã£o para oito prÃªmios Grammy. â€œSomos todos vencedoresâ€, disse ela em um tuÃ­te emocionado em 20 de novembro, aludindo a seus fÃ£s, bem como Ã s outras mulheres indicadas em um ato de solidariedade. â€œEste ano tem sido incrÃ­vel para a mÃºsica e estou muito grata por fazer parte disso.â€
Felizmente, quando se trata do Grammy Awards de 2020, Lizzo nÃ£o estÃ¡ sendo reconhecida sozinha. Este ano, as artistas femininas estÃ£o liderando as indicaÃ§Ãµes - cinco dos oito indicados ao Ãlbum do Ano sÃ£o mulheres, incluindo Lana Del Rey, Ariana Grande e Billie Eilish. A bem-vinda mudanÃ§a veio depois que apenas uma mulher recebeu um prÃªmio solo em 2018, gerando a hashtag #GrammysSoMale (O Grammy Ã© tÃ£o masculino) - Neil Portnow, entÃ£o presidente da Recording Academy, respondeu dizendo Ã  Variety que as mulheres precisavam "dar um passo a mais" se quisessem ganhar. As artistas femininas retaliaram, dizendo que o processo de votaÃ§Ã£o do Grammy se recusa a reconhecer as mulheres. (Portnow mais tarde se desculpou, alegando que seus comentÃ¡rios foram tirados de contexto.)
Agora dirigida por Deborah Dugan - a primeira mulher presidente e executiva-chefe da Recording Academy, que assumiu o cargo de Portnow em agosto de 2019 - o Grammy Awards passa a sensaÃ§Ã£o de ser uma nova era. â€œÃ‰ nossa tarefa garantir que os membros sejam diversos, representativos da comunidade musical criativa, de todos os sexos, gÃªneros musicais e vozes", disse Dugan Ã  Billboard em setembro de 2019, tambÃ©m prometendo aumentar a diversidade dos eleitores do Grammy. â€œE aquele grupo pode se tornar ativista pelos seus direitos. Se dermos a eles as ferramentas para isso, o mundo mudarÃ¡ para melhor. â€
Quando vocÃª olha para a quantidade des indicaÃ§Ãµes ao Grammy desde sua inauguraÃ§Ã£o em 1959, a antiga falta de diversidade aludida por Dugan Ã© clara (especialmente considerando que as 84 categorias de prÃªmios sÃ£o definidas por gÃªnero musical, e nÃ£o sexo). De acordo com um relatÃ³rio de fevereiro de 2019 feito por Statista, os homens mais indicados, de todos os tempos, ao Grammy sÃ£o Quincy Jones com 80, Paul McCartney com 78 e Jay Z com 77. Enquanto isso, BeyoncÃ© Ã© a Ãºnica mulher que chega perto - e a Ãºnica mulher entre os 10 mais indicados - com 70 indicaÃ§Ãµes.
Em homenagem ao ultimo PrÃªmio Grammy, dominado por mulheres, a Vogue confere as seis mais indicadas da histÃ³ria.
1. BeyoncÃ©
(*incluindo o trabalho com o Destinyâ€™s Child e o The Carters)
IndicaÃ§Ãµes: 70
VitÃ³rias: 23
CanÃ§Ãµes herÃ³icas: Bills Bills Bills; Love on Top; Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)
NÃ£o Ã© necessÃ¡rio dizer o quÃ£o poderosa BeyoncÃ© Ã© na indÃºstria musical, vendendo mais de 118 milhÃµes de discos atÃ© hoje. Depois de lanÃ§ar dois hits nÃºmero um em 1999 com o Destinyâ€™s Child (Bills, Bills, Bills e Say My Name), Bey fez carreira solo em 2003 com o lanÃ§amento de seu Ã¡lbum de estreia, Dangerously in Love. Sua performance ao lado de Prince em 2004 se consagra como um destaque do Grammy, e este ano ela concorre a quatro prÃªmios, incluindo Melhor Filme Musical pelo filme O Rei LeÃ£o de 2019.
2. Dolly Parton
IndicaÃ§Ãµes: 49
VitÃ³rias: 8
CanÃ§Ãµes herÃ³icas: Here You Come Again; Jolene
A rainha do country alcanÃ§ou as paradas em 1977 com seu Ã¡lbum de estÃºdio, Here You Come Again, e ganhou seu primeiro Grammy em 1979 pela faixa de mesmo tÃ­tulo. Duas de suas canÃ§Ãµes, Jolene e I Will Always Love You, foram incluÃ­das no Grammy Hall of Fame, enquanto ela recebeu o prÃªmio pelo conjunto de sua obra em 2011. Em 2019, ela estrelou sua prÃ³pria homenagem no Grammy com a afilhada Miley Cyrus, Katy Perry e Kacey Musgraves.
Dolly Parton (Foto: ReproduÃ§Ã£o / Instagram)
3. Emmylou Harris
IndicaÃ§Ãµes: 47
VitÃ³rias: 13
CanÃ§Ãµes herÃ³icas: If I Could Only Win Your Love; Elite Hotel
A carreira da cantora e compositora country jÃ¡ dura 50 anos, mantendo-se em um gÃªnero musical geralmente dominado por homens. Ela colaborou com nomes como Bob Dylan e Gram Parsons, e ganhou seu primeiro Grammy em 1976 como Melhor Performance Vocal Country em Elite Hotel - um nÃºmero massivo de 46 indicaÃ§Ãµes ocorreu atÃ© o momento. Desde 1999 ela ajudou a organizar o Ã¡lbum Concerts for a Landmine Free World; e em 2018, ela foi presenteada com o prÃªmio pelo conjunto de sua obra.
4. Barbra Streisand
IndicaÃ§Ãµes: 46
VitÃ³rias: 8
CanÃ§Ãµes herÃ³icas: Evergreen (do filme Nasce uma Estrela); Donâ€™t Rain on my Parade
Ao longo de sua carreira de seis dÃ©cadas, a atriz-cantora-compositora-cineasta fez de tudo. Uma lendÃ¡ria vencedora EGOT (alguÃ©m que tem um Emmy, Grammy, Oscar e Tony), ela foi homenageada no Grammy Awards em 1963 por seu Ã¡lbum de estreia, The Barbra Streisand Album. Ela foi inserida no Grammy Hall of Fame quatro vezes, mas seu alcance vai muito alÃ©m da mÃºsica: Streisand tem sido uma defensora dos direitos dos homossexuais por toda a sua vida, participou da Marcha das Mulheres de 2017 e doou para vÃ¡rios fundos relacionados Ã  crise climÃ¡tica.
5. Aretha Franklin
IndicaÃ§Ãµes: 44
VitÃ³rias: 18
CanÃ§Ãµes herÃ³icas: Respect; Chain of Fools; A Natural Woman (You Make Me Feel Like)
A indiscutÃ­vel rainha do soul, que infelizmente morreu em agosto de 2018, foi prolÃ­fica pelos anos 1960 - mas foi o seu cover de Respect de Otis Redding de 1967 que a colocou no mainstream e garantiu seu primeiro Grammy. Ela tem cinco mÃºsicas no Grammy Hall of Fame: Respect; Chain of Fools; Amazing Grace; A Natural Woman (You Make Me Feel Like); e I Never Loved A Man The Way I Love You. Franklin tambÃ©m foi uma incrÃ­vel filantropa e ativista; muitas de suas canÃ§Ãµes provocaram mudanÃ§as sociais, incluindo Respect, que se tornou o hino da campanha pelos direitos civis e do movimento feminista.
6. Alison Krauss
(*incluindo o trabalho com a banda Alison Krauss & Union Station)
IndicaÃ§Ãµes: 42
VitÃ³rias: 27
CanÃ§Ãµes herÃ³icas: Baby, Now That Iâ€™ve Found You; Looking In The Eyes Of Love
A cantora country de bluegrass (e violinista), que tambÃ©m Ã© membro da banda Union Station, estÃ¡ na indÃºstria hÃ¡ 35 anos - e nesse tempo, ela ganhou 27 de suas indicaÃ§Ãµes, o que a torna a artista feminina mulher mais premiada na histÃ³ria do Grammy. Em 2000, ela alcanÃ§ou o sucesso no mainstream com seu trabalho na trilha sonora de E aÃ­, Meu IrmÃ£o, CadÃª VocÃª?, antes de trabalhar com Robert Plant do Led Zeppelin no Ã¡lbum de 2007, Raising Sand. Ela foi creditada por ajudar a renovar o interesse no bluegrass nos EUA; e na Ã©poca de sua primeira vitÃ³ria no Grammy em 1991, ela era a segunda vencedora mais jovem.

title: Is Lana Del Rey Working on a Country Album?
content:
Singer-songwriter Lana Del Rey â€” who had her breakthrough as a pop hitmaker with her hit debut single "Video Games" in 2011 â€” may be planning to expand her horizons into country music.
In fact, in a print interview with MOJO Magazine, the singer points out that there's always been an element of country and Americana influence at the core of her music.
"I went back and listened to 'Ride' and 'Video Games' and thought, 'You know, they're kind of country,'" Del Rey says (quote via Contact Music).
"I mean, they're definitely not pop. Maybe the way 'Video Games' got remastered, they're pop â€” but there's something Americana about it for sure," she adds.
Next up, the singer says she's planning to further embrace her rootsy leanings by putting out "a cover album of country songs." And that's not all â€” Del Rey says she's also got another batch of "other folk songs" ready to go.
"So let's see how these things come out â€” I'm not going to have pedal steel guitar on every single thing, but it is easy for me to write," she continues, adding that despite the fact that her work has always contained country inflections, she's still anticipating some "skepticism" to emerge in response to the stylistic shift she's planning to make.
However, she wouldn't be the first pop star to cross over into the country realm. Bon Jovi, Lionel Richie and Cyndi Lauper are just a few of the stars who have "gone country" at one time or another.
Meanwhile, Del Rey is still continuing to release the haunting, melody-driven pop music fans know and love. Her newest single, "Chemtrails Over the Country Club," is the title track from an album due out on March 19.

title: Nel 2011 Lana Del Rey ha quasi lasciato la musica
content:
LOS ANGELES - La carriera musicale di Lana Del Rey ha rischiato di concludersi appena dopo essere iniziata, nell'estate 2011.
La cantautrice ha confidato alla rivista Mojo di aver desiderato di abbandonare la musica dopo aver appreso della morte del suo idolo, Amy Winehouse. Del Rey ricorda benissimo quel tragico giorno di luglio di 10 anni fa: oltre al decesso della popstar britannica, quello fu il giorno della sua prima recensione sui media. Â«Ho avuto 10 secondi di massima euforiaÂ» ha spiegato la 35enne, ma poi Ã¨ arrivata Â«la notizia sui tutte le televisioni che Amy era morta sui gradini di casa e io dicevo "No"Â».
Â«Tutti stavano guardando, ipnotizzati, ma personalmente mi sentivo come se non volessi nemmeno piÃ¹ cantareÂ». Per fortuna dei suoi fan, Lana ha poi preso un'altra decisione e oggi Ã¨ - a pieno diritto - una delle artiste piÃ¹ conosciute e apprezzate. Ora ha due progetti in ballo: ha infatti reso noto di aver registrato Â«un album di cover di canzoni countryÂ» e un altro disco piÃ¹ folk, che saranno pubblicati prossimamente.
Nel corso dell'intervista Del Rey ha ripensato con nostalgia al debutto della sua carriera. A parte lo shock per la notizia della morte di Winehouse, rimpiange la mancanza di pressione mediatica di quei giorni.

title: Lana Del Rey, in arrivo un album di cover di canzoni country
content:
In attesa di conoscere lâ€™album â€œChemitrails Over The Country Clubâ€, Lana Del Rey ( FOTO ) ha rivelato di avere giÃ  registrato un altro progetto. La cantautrice ha rivelato di avere giÃ  pronti brani country e di essere pronta a pubblicarli in un imminente album composto da cover di grandi classici del genere. Inoltre ha svelato di avere anche un'altra raccolta di "altre canzoni popolariâ€ in procinto di registrare. La notizia Ã¨ emersa da unâ€™intervista che la stessa Lana Del Rey ha rilasciato ad un magazine musicale. La cantante ha ammesso di aspettarsi puro scetticismo per il cambio del suo stile musicale considerando che spesso nella sua musica il country Ã¨ un tema ricorrente.
Il progetto country e il nuovo album in arrivo il 19 marzo
"Sono tornata indietro e ho ascoltato 'Ride' e 'Video Games' e ho pensato, sai che câ€™Ã¨ un poâ€™ di country ... Voglio dire, non sono decisamente pop. Forse il modo in cui 'Video Games' Ã¨ stato rimasterizzato, Ã¨ pop ma c'Ã¨ sicuramente qualcosa che rimanda al genere country. Vediamo come verranno fuori, non avrÃ² una chitarra a pedali in ogni singola cosa, ma Ã¨ facile per me scrivere in questo modoâ€. Il nuovo album di Lana Del Rey Ã¨ â€œChemitrails Over the Country Clubâ€ e uscirÃ  il 19 marzo. Il progetto Ã¨ stato anticipato dai singoli "Let me love you like a woman", "Chemitrails over the country club" e "White dressâ€, questâ€™ultimo annunciato a febbraio. In merito al nuovo singolo, Lana Del Rey ha pubblicato sui social due foto. Nel primo scatto Ã¨ immortalata una donna che sta pattinando e indossa un vestito bianco. Ad accompagnare lâ€™immagine ci sono le parole "Mi ha fatto sentire ... mi ha fatto sentire come un Dio" scritte in rosa. La seconda immagine mostra la stessa donna con ali d'angelo bianche e il titolo "White Dressâ€. Questa la tracklist di â€œChemitrails Over The Country Clubâ€:
White Dress Chemtrails Over The Country Club Tulsa Jesus Freak Let Me Love You Like A Woman Wild At Heart Dark But Just A Game Not All Who Wander Are Lost Yosemite Breaking Up Slowly Dance Till We Die For Free
La traccia â€œFor Freeâ€ chiude lâ€™album ed Ã¨ una cover di un brano di Joni Mitchell.
â€œNon volevo piÃ¹ cantareâ€
Nella stessa intervista Lana Del Rey ha raccontato che la sua prima recensione Ã¨ arrivata nel 2011 nello stesso giorno della scomparsa di Amy Winehouse (FOTO). "Ho avuto 10 secondi di euforia pura, poi la notizia ovunque, su tutti i televisori, era che Amy era morta e io non ci potevo credere. Tutti stavano guardando, ipnotizzati, ma personalmente mi sentivo come se non volessi piÃ¹ cantareâ€. Successivamente ha rivelato di aver amato il periodo iniziale quando la sua carriera non riusciva a decollare ed era predisposta a cantare di tutto, anche jingle pubblicitari.

title: Lana Del Rey Shares 'Blue Banisters' Teaser
content:
Lana Del Rey shared appeared to tease a new song dubbed "Blue Banisters" in an Instagram post on Sunday (April 11).
The singer posted a vintage-looking photo of herself looking up at the sky with the title underneath it. Following the tease, fans are speculating that a new single is on the horizon.
Del Rey recently released her Chemtrails Over The Country Club album, which hit No. 2 on the Billboard 200 chart. Shortly after the LP's release, Del Rey already announced that another new album, Rock Candy Sweet, will arrive on June 1.

title: Lana Del Rey Gets Backlash Over Queen Elizabeth, Prince Philip Photos
content:
Lana Del Rey Ties This Rock Band for Most No. 1s on Alternative Albums Chart
In one image, Queen Elizabeth is seen smiling up at Prince Philip, while another shows a black-and-white snapshot of the longtime partners holding two of their young children.
Many of Del Rey's nearly 19 million Instagram followers took issue with her post, noting that Philip and Elizabeth were distant relatives. "Mmm i love how they were cousins<3," one person commented. Another wrote, "Bestie they're related."
Others begged the singer to remove the post. "Please delete this I can't keep defending you," a fan responded, while another suggested, "Step away from the phone BFF."
Prince Philip died on Friday at Windsor Castle in England. He was 99.
In late March, Del Rey released her newest album, Chemtrails Over the Country Club, which debuted at No. 1 on Billboard's Top Album Sales chart. The set follows 2017â€™s Lust for Life and 2014â€™s Ultraviolence. The singer has already teased her next project, Rock Candy Sweet, which is scheduled to arrive on June 1.
See Del Rey's post about Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip here.

title: Lana Del Rey and the struggle to be mysterious in pop
content:
In a less high-profile way, the elusive and inscrutable singer-songwriter Frank Ocean has also felt compelled to defend himself on social media. Ocean earned rave reviews for making two albums rightly regarded as modern masterpieces, 2012's Channel Orange and 2016's Blonde, but received a rare slither of negative press when he launched a 2019 club night themed around HIV prevention drug PrEP. He described the idea as paying "homage to what could have been of the 1980s NYC club scene if the drug PrEP... had been invented in that era". But when some commentators suggested this felt like a crass PR stunt, Ocean took to Tumblr to shut down any criticism. "I'm an artist," he wrote, "it's core to my job to imagine realities that don't necessarily exist and it's a joy to."
A 21st-Century dilemma
It could be argued that these artists inadvertently fanned the flames of controversy when they engaged with it on social media: by attempting to defend themselves, they simply kept themselves in the news cycle. However, given that public figures are being held more accountable for past words and actions than ever before, it's probably not realistic to stay quiet and hope for a Twitter fire to burn out. These days, you probably have to acknowledge it, which instantly makes you seem less otherworldly.
Even Kate Bush, an artist who's guarded her privacy so religiously that we might call her the patron saint of pop star enigmas, has had to singe her fingers. In November 2016, she gave an interview to Canadian magazine Macleans in which she was asked about Hillary Clinton's recent defeat in the US presidential election and "the fear of women's power". She replied with a warm endorsement of the UK's then-Prime Minister Theresa May. "I actually really like her and think she's wonderful," Bush said. "I think it's the best thing that's happened to us in a long time. She's a very intelligent woman but I don't see much to fear." Bush's comments were widely dissected online, especially by left-wing music fans who felt disappointed that the seemingly bohemian singer had praised a right-wing Conservative leader.
Bush added nothing further at the time, but because her comments about May kept being quoted in subsequent articles about her work, she felt compelled to post a rare personal message on her website more than two years later. "My response to the interviewer was not meant to be political but rather was in the defence of women in power," she wrote in January 2019, conceding that what she had said "could make it seem like I am a Tory supporter, which I want to make clear I am not". Bush had learned the hard way that the internet never forgets.

content:
La chanteuse amÃ©ricaine Lana Del Rey publie un septiÃ¨me album intitulÃ© "Chemtrails Over the Country Club". Elle s'y Ã©panouit dans un registre pop et romantique intimiste Ã  mille lieues de son emphase habituelle.

Un septiÃ¨me album essentiellement portÃ© par un piano, une guitare et sa voix de braise, ardente et claire, qui fait merveille.
Dans cette absence d'effets, la chanteuse californienne gagne en mystÃ¨re et fragilitÃ©, hante littÃ©ralement ce rÃ©pertoire qui charrie de vastes et inquiÃ©tantes Ã©tendues, un romantisme peinÃ©, une Ã©trangetÃ© peu rassurante. RÃ©vÃ©lÃ©e voilÃ  dix ans par le tube obsÃ©dant "Video Games", la diva dont le chant Ã©vanescent et la pop Ã©thÃ©rÃ©e ont longtemps manquÃ© de caractÃ¨re semble depuis quelque temps enfin sortir du cocon oÃ¹ elle ronronnait et forÃ§ait son sentimentalisme sur des chansons trop maniÃ©rÃ©es

Comme si la superficialitÃ© initiale de l'auteure, qui aimait jouer sur son image de pin-up, se mÃ©tamorphosait peu Ã  peu dans la rÃ©pÃ©tition des efforts enregistrÃ©s Ã  pas feutrÃ©s. Epanouie dans un dÃ©corum sobre inÃ©dit, Lana Del Rey n'en perd pas pour autant les atmosphÃ¨res sÃ©pia et la nostalgie hollywoodienne qu'ont toujours charriÃ©es ses compositions. Pourvu qu'elle parvienne dÃ©sormais Ã  prolonger longtemps ce moment de grÃ¢ce.

Un rÃ©cit glaÃ§ant qui vaut surtout par les deux acteurs qui le portent : Tahar Rahim, d'une froideur mÃ©connaissable dans le rÃ´le du Â« serpent Â», et Jenna Coleman (la reine Victoria dans la sÃ©rie du mÃªme nom), victime de son impressionnante emprise. title: Lana Del Rey Ties for Most Alternative Albums No. 1s
content:
"Chemtrails Over the Country Club" is her fifth leader, matching Foo Fighters' record.
Lana Del Rey ties Foo Fighters for the most No. 1s in the history of Billboard's Alternative Albums chart, earning her fifth ruler with Chemtrails Over the Country Club on the tally dated April 3.
Chemtrails bows at No. 1 with 75,000 equivalent album units earned in the March 19-25 tracking week, according to MRC Data. Of that sum, 58,000 units comprise album sales.
Del Rey first crowned Alternative Albums (which began in 2007) for two weeks in 2012 with her first LP, Born to Die, followed by one-week reigns for Honeymoon (2015), Lust for Life (2017) and Norman Fucking Rockwell (2019), ahead of Chemtrails. Foo Fighters have led the list with Echoes, Silence, Patience & Grace (2007), Wasting Light (2011), Sonic Highways (2014), Concrete and Gold (2017) and, this February, Medicine at Midnight.

title: Bonnaroo music festival to feature Foo Fighters, Lizzo, Tyler the Creator
content:
March 31 (UPI) -- The 2021 Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival will feature headlining performances by the Foo Fighters, Lizzo and Tyler, the Creator.
Organizers announced a lineup for the annual music festival Wednesday.
Advertisement
This year's concerts will take place Sept. 2-5 in Manchester, Tenn. 2021 marks the 20th anniversary of the music festival.
Bonnaroo will kick off Sept. 2 with performances from the Grand Ole Opry. The Foo Fighters will headline the Sept. 3 shows, which also feature Megan Thee Stallion, Run the Jewels, Janelle MonÃ¡e, the Deftones and other artists.
Lizzo will take the stage Sept. 4, along with Tame Impala, Phoebe Bridgers, G-Eazy and others. Tyler, the Creator will headline the Sept. 5 shows, which also feature Lana Del Rey, Lil Baby, Deadmau5 and other artists.
Tickets go on sale Wednesday at 1 p.m. EDT.
Bonnaroo postponed its 2020 music festival due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Organizers said this year's event will follow COVID-19 safety protocols.
"Throughout its 20-year history, Bonnaroo has evolved and innovated to make each and every event more enjoyable, with the safety of its fans, artists, and staff a top priority. Bonnaroo organizers as always will be in regular communication with local health and public safety officials and will continue to abide by relevant recommendations."
Other 2021 music festivals have been canceled or will continue to hold virtual events. Glastonbury Festival said Tuesday that Coldplay and Haim will headline a live stream concert in May.

title: Bonnaroo Festival 2021: Lizzo, Megan Thee Stallion, Foo Fighters, More
content:
Lizzo, Megan Thee Stallion, Foo Fighters, Lana Del Rey, Tyler, the Creator, Janelle Monae, Tame Impala and many more are scheduled to perform at the 2021 Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival. The eventâ€™s 20th anniversary edition is scheduled to take place September 2â€“5, 2021 on the Bonnaroo Farm, located 60 miles southeast of Nashville in Manchester, TN. Bonnaroo will present dozens of acts across more than 10 stages over the four-day festival.
The complete Bonnaroo 2021 lineup is below.
Like most music festivals, Bonnaroo was forced to postpone its 2020 editions and move the planned date for this yearâ€™s event from its usual early June dates to Labor Day weekend. While a level of uncertainty remains for all mass-gathering events, as vaccinations gain momentum, many festivals in Europe and the U.S. are moving ahead with plans for late-summer and fall events.
This is noted in the announcement: â€œThroughout its 20-year history, Bonnaroo has evolved and innovated to make each and every event more enjoyable, with the safety of its fans, artists, and staff a top priority. Bonnaroo organizers as always will be in regular communication with local health and public safety officials and will continue to abide by relevant recommendations. As it approaches, Bonnaroovians will receive regular updates with the important information needed to plan their trip to The Farm, including any changes to policies and procedures theyâ€™ll need to know before entering the festival and campgrounds. Updates will be shared at http://www.bonnaroo.com, through Bonnarooâ€™s social media channels, and via the Bonnaroo email list (sign up HERE).â€
Tickets for Bonnaroo will go on sale today, March 31 at 1 PM ET/12 PM CT, via http://www.bonnaroo.com/tickets. Options include General Admission (4-Day), GA+ (4-Day), VIP (4-Day), Platinum (4-Day), General Admission Camping & Parking, VIP Camping, Platinum Camping, and more. Once again, Bonnaroo is presenting an array of options, with tickets starting at $35 down and accommodations available for as low as $99 per night. Car Camping Passes are priced at $60 (plus fees) per car, not per person, allowing fans to both save money and reduce their carbon footprint by carpooling.
To celebrate the return of Bonnaroo and to commemorate the festivalâ€™s 20th Anniversary, Bonnaroo has created a one-of-a-kind NFT collection including a 1 of 1 special edition of the 2021 Lineup Poster. This is the first time a music festival has produced an NFT collection and Bonnaroo is so excited to partner with digital artist Archan Nair and premier NFT marketplace, Makers Place.
â€œItâ€™s exciting to see Tennessee stages come back to life in time to celebrate the 20th anniversary of this internationally acclaimed festival,â€ said Gov. Bill Lee. â€œFans are ready to gather together and celebrate their shared love of music once again. We welcome them back for a full Bonnaroo and what is sure to be a truly unforgettable event!â€
The festival has also announced a series of new or updated amenities, including â€œJamtrak,â€ a free on-site transport system enabling festival attendees to easily travel day or night to Centeroo and throughout the campground with multiple routes and stops along the way; shuttle buses departing twice a day from Chattanooga as well as Nashville and return from The Farm twice each night; and a variety of camping and VIP and platinum packages.

content:

Deux ans aprÃ¨s le succÃ¨s de Â« Norman Fucking Rockwell Â», Lana Del Rey signe son septiÃ¨me album, Â« Chemtrails Over the Country Club Â», Ã  ranger lui aussi au rayon des joyaux musicaux qui sâ€™amoncellent dÃ©sormais dans la collection de lâ€™auteure-compositrice-interprÃ¨te. RÃ©vÃ©lÃ©e en 2012 par le tube Â« Born to Die Â», la New-Yorkaise de 35 ans Ã©volue depuis dans un univers pop enrichi de multiples influences. SophistiquÃ©e mais accessible, capable dâ€™explorer la superficialitÃ© de lâ€™existence avec une vraie profondeur dâ€™Ã¢me, celle que lâ€™on dÃ©crit volontiers comme une diva confirme ainsi que son art sâ€™apparente davantage Ã  de la porcelaine quâ€™Ã  une coquille vide. Ce quâ€™il ne lâ€™empÃªche pas de sÃ©duire un (trÃ¨s) large public.

Une magie cÃ©leste qui se prolonge
Ces onze nouveaux morceaux, encore produits par Jack Antonoff, autre talent confirmÃ© de la cÃ´te Est, distillent une ambiance rÃ©solument amÃ©ricaine et folk, oÃ¹ quelques figures fÃ©minines (Joni Mitchell, Nancy Sinatra, Kate Bush) montrent le chemin. De Â« White Dress Â» Ã  Â« For Free Â» en passant par le somptueux Â« Yosemite Â», une magie cÃ©leste opÃ¨re sans discontinuer, avec la lÃ©gÃ¨retÃ© de ces Â« traÃ®nÃ©es chimiques Â» qui caractÃ©risent lâ€™album. title: Lana Del Rey, la revanche de la diva pop
content:
TaxÃ©e de produit factice Ã  ses dÃ©buts, Lana Del Rey sâ€™impose comme une auteure pop incontournable, hyper-productive, avec deux bijoux en trois ans, Norman fucking Rockwell ! et le rÃ©cent Chemtrails over the country club.
Entre les deux, lâ€™AmÃ©ricaine sâ€™est mÃªme offert le luxe dâ€™un recueil de poÃ¨mes â€” plus difficile dâ€™accÃ¨s â€” mis en musique, Violet bent backwards over the grass.
Chemtrailsâ€¦, sorti en mars (chez Polydor/Universal), prolonge la magie de Normanâ€¦ (2019). Deux albums co-produits avec Jack Antonoff, architecte sonore qui magnifie la mÃ©lancolie de la compositrice-interprÃ¨te.
Dans son dernier opus, Lana Del Rey cueille dâ€™entrÃ©e lâ€™auditeur avec White dress, chantÃ© dâ€™une voix de cristal joliment Ã©brÃ©chÃ©e, et le morceau-titre Chemtrailsâ€¦ qui sâ€™achÃ¨ve sur un souffle de batterie hypnotique.
Lâ€™artiste, qui reprend aussi Joni Mitchell (For free) en conclusion, sâ€™est faite aussi rare en interview quâ€™elle est prolifique (elle promet encore un autre album pour 2021).
Un retrait mÃ©diatique qui sâ€™explique par lâ€™accueil critique cruel Ã  lâ€™Ã©poque de son tubesque Born to die (2012), entre railleries sur son recours Ã  la chirurgie esthÃ©tique ou Ã©tiquette de starlette fabriquÃ©e par les studios.
Â«Je nâ€™ai vraiment pas aimÃ© Ã§aÂ»
Â«La faÃ§on dont les choses ont commencÃ© pour moi, dans la faÃ§on dont jâ€™ai Ã©tÃ© dÃ©peinte, câ€™est que je feignais sensibilitÃ© et Ã©motions. Je nâ€™ai vraiment pas aimÃ© Ã§aÂ», confie la chanteuse dans Mojo, revue musicale britannique, la seule Ã  qui elle a accordÃ© une interview pour la sortie de Chemtrailsâ€¦ .
Â«Le cas de Lana Del Rey est trÃ¨s parlant de la faÃ§on dont on traite les femmes dans la musique dÃ¨s quâ€™elles ont la prÃ©tention dâ€™avoir un minimum de culture. Comme elle est hyper-apprÃªtÃ©e, quâ€™elle joue sur une image de pin-up, on sâ€™attendait Ã  ce quâ€™elle feuillette seulement Variety, or elle lit beaucoupÂ», analyse pour lâ€™AFP Sophie Rosemont, journaliste et auteure de Girls rock (Ã©ditions Nil).
Elizabeth Woolridge Grant, son vrai nom, nâ€™est pas la premiÃ¨re Ã  subir les foudres machistes dâ€™une partie de la critique rock. Â«Rolling Stone avait cartographiÃ© tous les mecs (des musiciens connus, ndlr) avec qui Ã©tait sortie Joni Mitchell au dÃ©but se carriÃ¨reâ€¦Â», rappelle Sophie Rosemont. Joni Mitchell, la surdouÃ©e de Laurel Canyon (quartier de L.A et fief dâ€™une talentueuse communautÃ© artistique), avait mÃªme Ã©tÃ© surnommÃ©e Â«Queen of El LayÂ», jeu de mots sexiste jouant sur les sonoritÃ©s anglophones de Â«Reine de L.AÂ» et Â«Reine des coucheriesÂ»â€¦
Hommage Ã  Nancy Sinatra
Lana Del Rey a aussi Ã©tÃ© passÃ©e au lance-flammes par Kim Gordon, ex-bassiste iconique de Sonic Youth. Â«Des nanas comme Lana Del Rey ignorent ce quâ€™est le fÃ©minisme et pensent que Ã§a veut dire (â€¦) coucher avec des hommes rÃ©pugnants et plus Ã¢gÃ©sÂ» Ã©crit-elle ainsi dans son autobiographie Girl in a band (Ã©d. Le mot et le reste). MÃªme si dans ce cas, Sophie Rosemont nuance: Â«Kim Gordon, et câ€™est pour Ã§a quâ€™on lâ€™aime, est hyper-mÃ©chante avec tout le monde, une des rares qui dise que personne ne peut se blairer dans le show-biz (rires)Â».
Mais depuis Normanâ€¦, la critique est unanime et Ã©logieuse pour Lana Del Rey (35 ans). Â«Elle explore davantage le territoire nord-amÃ©ricain, tout ce qui dÃ©conne, du patriarcat, Ã  la non-mixitÃ©, elle sâ€™interrogeÂ», dÃ©crypte Sophie Rosemont.
Et LDR sait toujours aussi bien sâ€™entourer. A ses dÃ©buts, elle avait fait appel Ã  Woodkid pour ses clips, qui profitent dÃ©sormais de la patte du duo BRTHR (The Weeknd, Travis Scott, Selena Gomez, etc).
Pour la reprise de Joni Mitchell, elle est aussi Ã©paulÃ©e par les voix de ses amies chanteuses Zella Day et Weyes Blood. Et Joni Mitchell nâ€™est pas la seule de ses aÃ®nÃ©es Ã  qui elle rend hommage, puisque Lana Del Rey se prÃ©sente souvent comme une Â«Nancy Sinatra gangsterÂ». Â«Elle mâ€™a fait un si beau cadeau en disant cela, elle a remis mon travail en avantÂ», commente dâ€™ailleurs lâ€™interprÃ¨te du mythique These boots are made for walkinâ€™ dans Rolling Stone.

title: Lana Del Rey, la revanche de la diva pop
content:
La chanteuse amÃ©ricaine Lana Del Rey en concert Ã  Benicassim, en juillet 2020 en Espagne
PublicitÃ© Lire la suite
Paris (AFP)
TaxÃ©e de produit factice Ã  ses dÃ©buts, Lana Del Rey s'impose comme une auteure pop incontournable, hyper-productive, avec deux bijoux en trois ans, "Norman fucking Rockwell !" et le rÃ©cent "Chemtrails over the country club".
Entre les deux, l'AmÃ©ricaine s'est mÃªme offert le luxe d'un recueil de poÃ¨mes -- plus difficile d'accÃ¨s -- mis en musique, "Violet bent backwards over the grass".
"Chemtrails...", sorti en mars (chez Polydor/Universal), prolonge la magie de "Norman..." (2019). Deux albums co-produits avec Jack Antonoff, architecte sonore qui magnifie la mÃ©lancolie de la compositrice-interprÃ¨te.
Dans son dernier opus, Lana Del Rey cueille d'entrÃ©e l'auditeur avec "White dress", chantÃ© d'une voix de cristal joliment Ã©brÃ©chÃ©e, et le morceau-titre "Chemtrails..." qui s'achÃ¨ve sur un souffle de batterie hypnotique.
L'artiste, qui reprend aussi Joni Mitchell ("For free") en conclusion, s'est faite aussi rare en interview qu'elle est prolifique (elle promet encore un autre album pour 2021).
Un retrait mÃ©diatique qui s'explique par l'accueil critique cruel Ã  l'Ã©poque de son tubesque "Born to die" (2012), entre railleries sur son recours Ã  la chirurgie esthÃ©tique ou Ã©tiquette de starlette fabriquÃ©e par les studios.
- "Je n'ai vraiment pas aimÃ© Ã§a" -
"La faÃ§on dont les choses ont commencÃ© pour moi, dans la faÃ§on dont j'ai Ã©tÃ© dÃ©peinte, c'est que je feignais sensibilitÃ© et Ã©motions. Je n'ai vraiment pas aimÃ© Ã§a", confie la chanteuse dans "Mojo", revue musicale britannique, la seule Ã  qui elle a accordÃ© une interview pour la sortie de "Chemtrails...".
"Le cas de Lana Del Rey est trÃ¨s parlant de la faÃ§on dont on traite les femmes dans la musique dÃ¨s qu'elles ont la +prÃ©tention+ d'avoir un minimum de culture. Comme elle est hyper-apprÃªtÃ©e, qu'elle joue sur une image de pin-up, on s'attendait Ã  ce qu'elle feuillette seulement +Variety+, or elle lit beaucoup", analyse pour l'AFP Sophie Rosemont, journaliste et auteure de "Girls rock" (Ã©ditions Nil).
Elizabeth Woolridge Grant, son vrai nom, n'est pas la premiÃ¨re Ã  subir les foudres machistes d'une partie de la critique rock. "Rolling Stone avait cartographiÃ© tous les mecs (des musiciens connus, ndlr) avec qui Ã©tait sortie Joni Mitchell au dÃ©but se carriÃ¨re...", rappelle Sophie Rosemont. Joni Mitchell, la surdouÃ©e de Laurel Canyon (quartier de L.A et fief d'une talentueuse communautÃ© artistique), avait mÃªme Ã©tÃ© surnommÃ©e "Queen of El Lay", jeu de mots sexiste jouant sur les sonoritÃ©s anglophones de "Reine de L.A" et "Reine des coucheries"...
- Hommage Ã  Nancy Sinatra -
Lana Del Rey a aussi Ã©tÃ© passÃ©e au lance-flammes par Kim Gordon, ex-bassiste iconique de Sonic Youth. "Des nanas comme Lana Del Rey ignorent ce qu'est le fÃ©minisme et pensent que Ã§a veut dire (...) coucher avec des hommes rÃ©pugnants et plus Ã¢gÃ©s" Ã©crit-elle ainsi dans son autobiographie "Girl in a band" (Ã©d. Le mot et le reste). MÃªme si dans ce cas, Sophie Rosemont nuance: "Kim Gordon, et c'est pour Ã§a qu'on l'aime, est hyper-mÃ©chante avec tout le monde, une des rares qui dise que personne ne peut se blairer dans le show-biz (rires)".
Mais depuis "Norman...", la critique est unanime et Ã©logieuse pour Lana Del Rey (35 ans). "Elle explore davantage le territoire nord-amÃ©ricain, tout ce qui dÃ©conne, du patriarcat, Ã  la non-mixitÃ©, elle s'interroge", dÃ©crypte Sophie Rosemont.
Et LDR sait toujours aussi bien s'entourer. A ses dÃ©buts, elle avait fait appel Ã  Woodkid pour ses clips, qui profitent dÃ©sormais de la patte du duo BRTHR (The Weeknd, Travis Scott, Selena Gomez, etc).
Pour la reprise de Joni Mitchell, elle est aussi Ã©paulÃ©e par les voix de ses amies chanteuses Zella Day et Weyes Blood. Et Joni Mitchell n'est pas la seule de ses aÃ®nÃ©es Ã  qui elle rend hommage, puisque Lana Del Rey se prÃ©sente souvent comme une "Nancy Sinatra gangster". "Elle m'a fait un si beau cadeau en disant cela, elle a remis mon travail en avant", commente d'ailleurs l'interprÃ¨te du mythique "These boots are made for walkin'" dans Rolling Stone.
Â© 2021 AFP
