title: Lana del Rey kondigt nieuw album aan
content:
Lana del Rey komt binnenkort weer met een nieuw album. Op 4 juli komt haar zevende plaat, Blue Bannisters, uit. Dat heeft de zangeres bekendgemaakt op Twitter.
Daarbij plaatste ze ook een foto van de cover van het album, een eenvoudige selfie. De zangeres deelde al eerder een foto op haar Instagram met de tekst "ROCK CANDY SWEET, 1 juni". Dat zou duiden op de eerste single van het nieuwe album.
Del Rey zet vaart achter het uitbrengen van albums. Op 19 maart kwam haar meest recente plaat Chemtrails Over The Country Club uit. Dat album zou eigenlijk vorig jaar al uitgebracht worden, maar liep door aanpassingen en de coronacrisis meerdere keren vertraging op.

title: Lana Del Rey Sets New Album 'Blue Banisters'
content:
Del Rey has been prolific of late. She recently released Chemtrails Over The Country Club album, which hit No. 2 on the Billboard 200 chart. Shortly after, the U.S. artist announced that another new album, Rock Candy Sweet, will arrive on June 1.
And in late 2020, she debuted her poetry collection Violet Bent Backwards over the Grass.
It remains unclear if Blue Banisters is a different working title for Rock Candy Sweet, or whether that album will drop as planned. What is clear, however, is that Del Rey is enjoying the most creative phase of her career so far.

title: Lana Del Rey Fans Want to Ban Her From PicsArt After Album Art Reveal
content:
Lana Del Rey announced on Tuesday that her new album, "Blue Banisters," will be released on July 4.
While many fans were excited, others were horrified by the sepia-toned cover art.
More than 2,000 people have already signed a petition on Change.org to "ban Lana from PicsArt."
Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.
Lana Del Rey's latest album announcement has inspired both excitement and horror among fans, many of whom are displeased with the aesthetic direction.
The "Wild at Heart" singer revealed on Tuesday that her new album, "Blue Banisters," will be released on July 4.
She also unveiled the cover: a selfie that Del Rey previously posted in August 2020 with a sepia-toned filter and inelegant white frame. The title appears at the bottom in a curly blue font.
Fans immediately dubbed the artwork a "PicsArt cover," referring to a photo-editing app that's known for its amateur-friendly features, simple effects, and cutesy stickers.
In fact, Del Rey has been accused of being a PicsArt enthusiast before. The artwork for her single "Let Me Love You Like a Woman" weathered similar criticism.
Del Rey also used the same selfie in March to announce something called "Rock Candy Sweet" dropping on June 1, which was previously thought to be her next album. (It may be a single from "Blue Banisters," or perhaps she just changed her mind about the title and release date.)
Within minutes of Del Rey's album announcement, the word "picsart" began trending on Twitter.
â€”anna â™¡'s jessie mei li (@ENVYBARNES) April 28, 2021
Less than one hour later, a petition began circulating on Change.org to "ban Lana from PicsArt."
"Lana had terrorized [us] just way too long with these edits, we need to stop her. Sign this for a future of quality album covers from Lana again," the description reads.
At the time of writing, more than 2,000 fans had already signed.
"I'm signing because I'm a proud Lana stan, she is my religion, the almighty queen of cocaine and Coney island. But the cover for Blue Banisters is the ugliest thing I've seen her make," one person commented. "The Lana subreddit has better fan-made covers."
"Lana baby if ur reading this we love you but these god awful album covers need to cease," another wrote.
The concept of a copy-and-paste, amateurish "PicsArt cover" has gained traction in recent years, with recent examples including Selena Gomez's "Rare" and Ariana Grande's "Positions."
In a 2019 article for Pitchfork, Emma Madden pointed to Tumblr as a possible inspiration for this aesthetic, noting that Taylor Swift's "Lover" cover "resembles the kind of fan art you'd find on the platform."
Indeed, "picsart" trending on Twitter may be partially thanks to Billie Eilish, who also announced her new album on Tuesday, titled "Happier Than Ever."
The cover shows Eilish with her new blonde hair, posing against a neutral background. The title appears in a curvy white font that resembles a retro movie poster.
"Picsart has the alt girls on a chokehold," one person wrote, comparing Eilish's "Happier Than Ever" cover to Del Rey's "Let Me Love You Like a Woman."
â€”this are dark days (@chemtrailrising) April 27, 2021
Del Rey's "Blue Banisters" will arrive just four months after her seventh album, "Chemtrails Over the Country Club" â€” whose cover was criticized for entirely different reasons.
The black-and-white artwork shows Del Rey grinning and surrounded by friends, all huddled around a table.
Shortly after she shared the image, the Grammy nominee commented on her own Instagram post, preemptively defending the apparent number of white people in the group.
"No this was not intended-these are my best friends, since you are asking today," she wrote â€” although it was written as a standalone comment, not a reply to anyone in particular.
"As it happens when it comes to my amazing friends and this cover, yes, there are people of color on this record's picture and that's all I'll say about that," she wrote, adding: "My best friends are rappers, my boyfriends have been rappers."
Many percieved this comment as an example of Del Rey's "textbook white fragility problematic white woman" vibe, an accusation that she had already been facing for months.

title: Lana Del Rey New Album 'Blue Banisters' Out July 4
content:
Lana Del Rey has revealed that a new album, titled â€œBlue Banisters,â€ is coming July 4.
In posts to her Instagram and Twitter accounts on Tuesday night, Del Rey wrote, â€œBlue Banisters. Album out July 4,â€ alongside what looks to be the album artwork.
â€œBlue Banistersâ€ seems to be the follow-up to Marchâ€™s â€œChemtrails Over the Country Club.â€ Del Rey had previously announced a release titled â€œRock Candy Sweetâ€ slated for June 1 with similar artwork, which many had assumed was an album. With the announcement of â€œBlue Banisters,â€ fans are wondering if the album was renamed or if â€œRock Candy Sweetâ€ is a single. Representatives for Del Rey did not immediately respond to Varietyâ€˜s request for clarification on the matter.
Though â€œChemtrails Over the Country Clubâ€ received generally favorable reviews, its chart placement has been less so. The album is currently at No. 165 on Rolling Stoneâ€™s album chart in its fifth week of release, and has amassed a total of 153,400 album units so far, according to Alpha Data.
In Varietyâ€˜s review of â€œChemtrails Over the Country Club,â€ deputy music editor Jem Aswad wrote: â€œKeeping things fresh for oneself, let alone for fans, is a constant challenge for any artist, and itâ€™s one that Del Rey rises to with impressive consistency. But self-parody is always just a heartbeat away, and her tendency to work primarily with a familiar pod of collaborators can make things repetitive. â€œChemtrailsâ€ is a progression in some ways but a holding pattern in others â€” weâ€™re most interested to see where she goes next.â€

title: Lana Del Rey displeases fans with artwork on cover of her next album
content:
American actress and singer Lana Del Rey announced to drop her eighth studio album Blue Banisters. However, her fans did not like the artwork of her album cover and want the Summertime Sadness hitmaker to reconsider it.
The 35-year-old singer Wednesday announced to drop her new album on July 4 - Independence Day in the US, after her last record Chemtrails over the Country Club was released in March this year. The music artist shared the news with her followers on social media platforms including Instagram and Twitter.
Lana Del Rey also shared a divisive cover artwork that did not go down well with her admirers, who have a lot of suggestions for the singer.
Check out the album cover here:
Some fans suggested Lana Del Rey reconsider the album artwork. The artist has written the album name in blue words at the bottom of her image.
â€œLana please tell me this is not the official cover art,â€ said one fan, while another has to comment, "i think we can all agree that we need to ban picsart from the app store.â€
A fan joked to ban the artist from using the editing app Picsart.
There were some others who seemed confused with an earlier announcement by Lana Del Rey who had said she would release a record titled Rock Candy Sweet on June 1.
Her fans want an explanation from her.

title: Musique : 10 albums Ã  Ã©couter en boucle
content:
PubliÃ© le 20 avr. 2021 Ã  17:50
Â« The Moon and Stars. Prescriptions For Dreamers Â», de Valerie June
Soul, folk, blues, gospelâ€¦ on ne sait pas trop comment dÃ©finir le style de Valerie June, tant sa musique est organique. L'artiste de Memphis entonne de sa voix irrÃ©sistible des chansons sorciÃ¨res. ConfiÃ©e Ã  Jack Splash (qui a notamment oeuvrÃ© pour Kendrick Lamar et Alicia Keys), la production est particuliÃ¨rement riche et soignÃ©e. Un album vaudou qui, comme son titre le suggÃ¨re, tutoie la lune et les Ã©toiles.
Fantasy records/Concord
Â« Justice Â», de Justin Bieber
Pas toujours inspirÃ© sur son prÃ©cÃ©dent album, Justin Bieber revient Ã  son meilleur avec son sixiÃ¨me disque : Â« Justice Â». MariÃ©e et assagie, la star canadienne propose un concentrÃ© de pop romantique (Â« 2 Much Â», Â« Ghost Â» ou encore Â« Anyone Â») avec une pointe de R'n'B, Ã  l'image du trÃ¨s bon single Â« Peaches Â». La voix du chanteur accompagne merveilleusement ces morceaux lumineux, qui rÃ©chauffent le coeur en ces temps compliquÃ©s.
Def Jam/Universal
Â« A tous les bÃ¢tards Â», d'Eddy de Pretto
MarquÃ© par le Covid, puis requinquÃ©, Eddy de Pretto a composÃ© cet album de mÃ©lancolie et de rÃ©volte, ode Ã  la diffÃ©rence, aux Â« Freaks Â» et Ã  Â« La Fronde Â». Moins percutant en apparence que son premier album, Â« A tous les bÃ¢tards Â» envoÃ»te aprÃ¨s plusieurs Ã©coutes. D'autant que l'artiste inclassable chante plus qu'il ne rappe dÃ©sormais. Des titres comme Â« Bateaux-Mouches Â», Â« Parfaitement Â» ou Â« DÃ©solÃ© Caroline Â» frappent fort et juste.
Universal
Â« Shapes of the Fall Â», de Piers Faccini
De pÃ¨re italien et de mÃ¨re anglaise, vivant en France, dans les CÃ©vennes, Piers Faccini est un musicien citoyen du monde. Son nouvel album, ode Ã  la planÃ¨te, Â« Shapes of the Fall Â», est une splendeur brassant folk, blues, musique gnawa et harmonies classiques. Avec en point d'orgue un morceau en apesanteur, Â« All Aboard Â», oÃ¹ la voix angÃ©lique du songwriter se mÃªle Ã  celles de Ben Harper et d'Abdelkebir Merchane.
No Format/Beating Drum
Â« Chemtrails over the Country Club Â», de Lana Del Rey
Sa voix est toujours de cristal, la production de Â« Chemtrails over the Country Club Â» est parfaite, entre dÃ©licatesse folk et lyrisme pop. On ne peut que cÃ©der au charme envoÃ»tant du nouvel opus de Lana Del Rey. MÃªme si leurs mÃ©lodies tournent toujours en rond, ses chansons ont gagnÃ© en intÃ©rioritÃ© et en profondeur. Mention spÃ©ciale au bouleversant Â« White Dress Â», qui ouvre l'album.
Polydor/Universal
Â« We Are Â», de Jon Batiste
Jon Batiste a Ã©tÃ© nommÃ© aux oscars pour la B.O. renversante de Â« Soul Â», le dessin animÃ© de Pixar. Il sort au mÃªme moment un album de soul music superbe, son quatriÃ¨me, baptisÃ© Â« We Are Â». Pianiste virtuose qui a grandi Ã  La Nouvelle-OrlÃ©ans, cet Afro-AmÃ©ricain trentenaire surdouÃ© et engagÃ© (dans le mouvement Black Lives Matter) mÃªle rhythm & blues, jazz, gospel, fanfares et hip-hop en un irrÃ©sistible combo. De Â« We Are Â» Ã  Â« I Need You Â» et Â« Freedom Â», du grand art.
Verve.
Â« Est-ce que tu sais ? Â», GaÃ«tan Roussel
Artiste indispensable de la scÃ¨ne musicale franÃ§aise (on lui doit notamment la rÃ©alisation du dernier album d'Alain Bashung Â« Bleu PÃ©trole Â») le leader de Louise Attaque, GaÃ«tan Roussel, sort un quatriÃ¨me solo trÃ¨s attendu. Un disque qui veut Â« exprimer la joie malgrÃ© des textes souvent tristes Â», selon son auteur. Entre Ã©vidence folk et pop orchestrale, tubes enthousiastes (Â« Tu ne savais pas Â» , Â« Je me jette Ã  ton cou Â» ou Â« On ne meurt pas en une seule fois Â») et beaux duos (avec Camelia Jordana et Alain Souchon), le pari est amplement rÃ©ussi.
Two Play
Â« RevelaciÃ³n Â», de Selena Gomez
AprÃ¨s son trÃ¨s bon album Â« Rare Â» dÃ©voilÃ© l'an dernier, Selena Gomez explore avec douceur ses racines latines. Proposant pour la toute premiÃ¨re fois un album en espagnol, la chanteuse amÃ©ricaine signe un disque lumineux, plein de fraÃ®cheur et de poÃ©sie, jouant Ã  la fois de la pop, du R & B et de touches de reggaeton. Avec pour inspiration principale l'amour - Ã  la fois de l'autre et de soi - RevelaciÃ³n met tout particuliÃ¨rement en valeur la voix presque chuchotÃ©e de l'artiste, au fil des morceaux Â« De Una Vez Â», Â« Vicio Â» ou encore Â« Buscando Amor Â». Un savant mÃ©lange de romantisme et de lÃ©gÃ¨retÃ©.
SMG Music/Interscope Records
Â« Concertos pour violon de Beethoven et de Mozart Â», Liya Petrova
La jeune violoniste bulgare Liya Petrova a choisi le rare Â« Concerto nÂ° 7 Â» de Mozart dont l'authenticitÃ© fait dÃ©bat mais dont l'interprÃ©tation fera l'unanimitÃ© par sa distinction naturelle, son lyrisme de velours et sa sonoritÃ© d'or. Dans le concerto de Beethoven, elle joue, avec une grÃ¢ce insigne, les Ã©quilibristes entre passion conquÃ©rante et tendresse bienveillante. Jean-Jacques Kantorow, Ã©galement violoniste, se montre aussi attentionnÃ© que stylÃ©. Un disque admirable.
Mirar
Â« Tasjan ! Tasjan ! Tasjan ! Â», d'Aaron Lee Tasjan
IgnorÃ© dans nos contrÃ©es, Aaron Lee Tasjan mÃ©rite d'Ãªtre dÃ©couvert, mÃªme tardivement (Ã¢gÃ© de 34 ans, il exerce son art depuis la fin des annÃ©es 2000). Avec son nouvel album, il nous offre une absolue merveille pop rock, Ã©voquant en moins de 38 minutes les plus grands Â« songwriters Â» : Paul McCartney, Elliott Smith, Les Kinks, Tom Pettyâ€¦ De Â« Sunday Women Â» Ã  Â« Another Lonely Day Â», on est bluffÃ© par un tel feu d'artifice mÃ©lodique. Trois fois oui Ã  Â« Tasjan ! Tasjan ! Tasjan ! Â»
New West Records

title: Lorde's 'Solar Power' Release Prompts Wave of Jack Antonoff Memes
content:
Lorde fans are rejoicing after the singer's audacious return to the spotlight this week.
After releasing eye-catching art for her new album earlier in the week, Friday morning saw the Kiwi hitmaker release the single and music video "Solar Power."
The track is being hailed by critics as a summery lo-fi pop return to form for the 24-year-old who has been taking a break since 2017. Musicians Clairo and Phoebe Bridgers sing back-up vocals in a surprising, but fitting collaboration.
"Solar Power" was co-written and co-produced by Jack Antonoff of Bleachers fame, who is also a creative force behind a number of other high profile pop stars including Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey and Sara Bareilles.
Pop fans took to Twitter on Friday morning to praise Antonoff for his tireless efforts to create great music throughout his production career.
"taylor, lana, lorde and bleachers. when does jack antonoff sleep ??!?" one Twitter user asked.
taylor, lana, lorde and bleachers. when does jack antonoff sleep ??!? â€” vala | LORDE â˜€ï¸ (@prfctromantics) June 10, 2021
While another added: "I BELIEVE IN JACK ANTONOFF SUPREMACY."
I BELIEVE IN JACK ANTONOFF SUPREMACY pic.twitter.com/8Q2mYUw9aa â€” Blinders (@NicolasSchrute) June 10, 2021
"Reminder that Jack Antonoff production is untouchable," said another.
Reminder that Jack Antonoff production is untouchable pic.twitter.com/4vyi7jaO8l â€” nolklore ğŸŒŒ (@watchmeswift) June 10, 2021
Another joked: "never before seen footage of taylor swift, lana del rey, and lorde, passing around jack antonoff."
never before seen footage of taylor swift, lana del rey, and lorde, passing around jack antonoff pic.twitter.com/OodbPwVD5Q â€” evelyn (@tsgoldrush) June 10, 2021
when lorde finally can collaborate with jack antonoff after 3 taylor's + 1 remake albums pic.twitter.com/46CvrbmHYI â€” sebb (@illicitbaguette) June 11, 2021
rare photo of lorde, phoebe bridgers, clairo, and jack antonoff after they finished recording solar power pic.twitter.com/EASnvW3Hng â€” sarahğŸŒŸ (@sarahk_tweets) June 10, 2021
Some of Antonoff's notable works in recent years include his collaboration with Swift on 2020's "Folklore" album and with Del Rey on her 2019 record "Norman F****** Rockwell!"
Lordeâ€”whose real name is Ella Marija Lani Yelich-O'Connorâ€”famously shuns social media and uses email to communicate with her fans.
In an email about "Solar Power," the singer painted a picture of the song's meaning for fans.
"There's someone I want you to meet," she wrote. "Her feet are bare at all times. She's sexy, playful, feral and free. She's a modern girl in a headstock bikini, in touch with her past and her future, vibrating at the highest level when summer comes around. Her skin is glowing, her lovers are many.
"The album is a celebration of the natural world, an attempt at immortalizing the deep, transcendent feelings I have when I'm outdoors."
In an email sent to fans in May about the album, Lorde wrote: "A thing started to take shape. And then, of course, the world shut down. We're still working awayâ€”Jack and I FaceTimed for over an hour this morning going over everything. But it'll take a while longer."
A release date for the forthcoming album is yet to be announced, but Lorde is confirmed as a performer at the festival Primavera Sound in Barcelona in 2022.
"Lorde, who will emerge from her retirement with her third album after her unforgettable visit in 2018," the website states.

title: New Music Friday: Everything out today you have to listen to
content:
New Music Friday can be so overwhelming. Where to start? Where to stop? Not everyoneâ€™s got a spare hour to sift through their Spotify release radar to find their new favourite songs. With that in mind, weâ€™ve been charitable enough to do it for you. Hereâ€™s a quick roundup of the 10 best new songs out this New Music Friday and the albums released that are definitely worth a spin:
Lana Del Rey â€“ Blue Banisters
When Lana Del Rey announced that her new album Blue Banisters would be coming out on July 4th, with the above image as the album cover, it wouldnâ€™t be daft to have assumed she was joking. She only released her sixth album in March, and the self-made artwork for Blue Banisters isâ€¦ a choice, letâ€™s just say that! But, she shuts you up as soon as she starts singing, and this is one of the most well written and sang tunes in her discography. Her vocals sound so powerful.
Listen if you love: Listening to the most gorgeous music to ever grace a human beingâ€™s ears
MARINA â€“ Ancient Dreams in a Modern Land
MARINA is back this New Music Friday with the title track from her upcoming fifth album Ancient Dreams in a Modern Land, and itâ€™s (thankfully) great! She kicked off the era with the sublime Manâ€™s World last year, and followed it up with the bloody dismal Purge The Poison; a racket with some of the worst songwriting in the game. But sheâ€™s back on track with this one, and the pop punk elements with her signature head voice work wonderfully.
Listen if you love: a 90s, grunge, pop punk riot grrrl vibe
David Guetta, Galantis & Little Mix â€“ Heartbreak Anthem
This is officially Little Mixâ€™s first new music as a trio, and itâ€™s a really fun chart ready feature with David Guetta and Galantis thatâ€™s a bit of a paint by numbers bop but itâ€™s a bop all the same. The girls sound amazing, but literally when do they not.
Listen if you love: Music that plays over Love Island montages
Georgia â€“ Get Me Higher
Georgia was the last gig I went to before we were locked down in March 2020, and thereâ€™s now this kind of extra euphoric layer to her music that signifies clubs being open and partying with your mates. Her new single Get Me Higher is her most danceable yet, and is just an absolute BLAST.
Listen if you love: The 1975â€™s poppier stuff
Lil Nas X â€“ SUN GOES DOWN
Probably Nasâ€™s most personal music moment yet. Much more raw instrumentation in the production, softer vocals and lyrical content that delves into his life before fame and coming to terms with his sexuality and not fitting in. And being a Nicki Minaj fan. Itâ€™s a nice different side to Lil Was X after the phenomenon of MONTERO (Call Me By Your Name), and is another exciting taste of his upcoming debut album.
Listen if you love: Khalid, but with actual personality
Duke Dumont & Channel Tres â€“ Alter Ego
GET. ME. TO. A. CLUB. NOW. This is an absolute banger. Funky baseline meets house drums and a clapping instrumentation that needs vogueing choreography put to it immediately.
Listen if you love: Not being able to stop yourself dancing round your bedroom
Sharon Van Etten & Angel Olsen â€“ Like I Used To
You know when you press play on something and you just know youâ€™re going to listen to it all year? Thatâ€™s how it feels with Like I Used To. Itâ€™s got a timeless charm thatâ€™s just stunningly beautiful. Feels like a huge American classic. Unreal.
Listen if you love: Kacey Musgraves, Shania Twain, Orville Peck
Bleachers â€“ Stop Making This Hurt
It was getting to the point in Jack Antonoffâ€™s career where heâ€™s almost more well known for his work with Lana Del Rey, Taylor Swift, Lorde and St Vincent than he is with Bleachers. Well, heâ€™s putting a stop to that with the EXCELLENT Stop Making This Hurt â€“ a little blast of serotonin and carefree euphoria with lush vocals and an irresistible sax. Incredible.
Listen if you love: Feeling the emotion of happiness
Years & Years and Kylie Minogue â€“ Starstruck
How do you make the already incredible 2021 single Starstruck even better? You get Kylie bloody Minogue on it, obviously! Olly and Kylie sound absolutely electric together on this, and you can just tell heâ€™s having the time of his life singing alongside such a legend in the field. Huge banger.
Listen if you love: Songs that would sound at home on Dua Lipaâ€™s Future Nostalgia
BTS â€“ Butter
Remember how Dynamite by BTS lived rent free in your head for the entirety of 2020? Well, in walks Butter. Itâ€™s your 2021 equivalent. So catchy it should be against the law.
Listen if you love: Manufactured pop music of the highest order
Albums
Olivia Rodrigo â€“ SOUR
my debut album SOUR is out now!!!!ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ https://t.co/yF3Kncm5Sx â€” Olivia Rodrigo (@Olivia_Rodrigo) May 21, 2021
The biggest new pop star on the planet has shown up to New Music Friday with her debut album and it is outrageously brilliant. Pop rock and balladry in equal measure, her songwriting is just really setting her apart from any other new artist right now. Everything feels so self assured and confident â€“ one of the albums of the year for sure.
Standout tracks: brutal, traitor, driverâ€™s license, deja vu, good 4 u
Zara Larsson â€“ Poster Girl (Summer Edition)
Zaraâ€™s reissued her earlier 2021 album Poster Girl with a few new tracks, and if you never heard it the first time round, this is now the definitive version you need to listen to. The princess of scandipop brings it constantly on this record â€“ itâ€™s absolutely stellar and if you didnâ€™t watch her live YouTube concert, go and watch it IMMEDIATELY.

title: Surprise! Lana Del Rey just dropped three new songs
content:
Listen to LDR's three surprise new tracks: 'Blue Banisters', 'Text Book', and 'Wildflower Wildfire'.
Following hot on the heels of recent album Chemtrails Over The Country Club, Lana Del Rey has given us a preview of her next one, Blue Banisters (ie. the one with the 'graphic design is my passion' aesthetic).
Quietly uploaded to streaming services overnight were 'Blue Banisters', 'Text Book', and 'Wildflower Wildfire'. Listen to all three below.
Skip YouTube Video FireFox NVDA users - To access the following content, press 'M' to enter the iFrame.
Skip YouTube Video FireFox NVDA users - To access the following content, press 'M' to enter the iFrame.
Skip YouTube Video FireFox NVDA users - To access the following content, press 'M' to enter the iFrame.
Lana co-wrote 'Wildflower Wildfire' with famed Kanye/Travis Scott producer Mike Dean, who also produced the track. In a recent interview with The Needle Drop's Anthony Fantano, Dean he was "planning on working with her a lot" in future.
Skip Twitter Tweet FireFox NVDA users - To access the following content, press 'M' to enter the iFrame.
According to a press release quoted by Pitchfork, these are "buzz tracks in anticipation of [Lana's] upcoming 8th studio album," which she announced in a post last month that got folks chatting. It's titled Blue Banisters and is set to arrive 4 July.
Additionally, Lana has previously announced that the Chemtrails follow-up would be titled Rock Candy Sweet, along with the same selfie for Blue Banisters, so it's a bit unclear if this is two projects we're getting, or just the one.
One things for certain, there's a lot of Lana for your sad girl summer playlists.

title: Lana Del Rey's Surprise New Single "Wildflower Wildfire" Will Give You Goosebumps
content:
Legendary hip-hop producer Mike Dean has done it again, lending his talent to Lana Del Rey for her latest surprise single "Wildflower Wildfire."
This year hasn't been without controversy for Lana Del Rey, who seems to always get caught up in the crosshairs of cancel culture. She most recently released her studio album Chemtrails over the Country Club, which was criticized heavily for its cover art. This week, producer Mike Dean began teasing a new collaboration with Lana and that song has officially been released as part of a surprise three-peat from Lana, who released "Wildflower Wildfire" out of nowhere.
The beautiful song is emotional, with Lana unpacking her relationship with her step-mother. The track will be featured on Lana's next album Blue Bannisters.
Check out the new single below and let us know what you think.
Quotable Lyrics:
My father never stepped in
When his wife would rage at me
So I ended up awkward but sweet
Later than hospitals and still on my feet

content:

Lana Del Rey said soft-girl summer has rights! Lana Del Reyâ€™s famously â€œsoft personalityâ€ was completely quiet today as she uploaded three lush new singles to all streaming platforms. â€œText Book,â€ â€œWildflower Wildfire,â€ and â€œBlue Banistersâ€ are each accompanied by the same grainy selfie of Del Rey, legal name Elizabeth Grant, with different filters. title: Lana Del Rey Drops 3 'Blue Banisters' Songs: Listen
content:
The 35-year-old singer-songwriter has already caused controversy with a lyric from the chorus of "Text Book," where she sings, "And there we were, screamin' 'Black Lives Matter' in a crowd." See some of the reactions below:
Shortly after the murder of George Floyd in May 2020 that sparked Black Lives Matter protests, Del Rey posted videos of looters breaking into businesses and running out with arms full as alarms blared. Black artists like Kehlani and Tinashe called her out for it because of the way it portrayed the protests and endangered the lives of other Black people.
Days earlier, Del Rey name-dropped Kehlani and other artists who are women of color while announcing her upcoming album last spring. In a lengthy note posted to Instagram, the singer wrote, "Now that Doja Cat, Ariana, Camila, Cardi B, Kehlani and Nicki Minaj and Beyonce have had number ones with songs about being sexy, wearing no clothes, f---ing, cheating, etc -- can I please go back to singing about being embodied, feeling beautiful by being in love even if the relationship is not perfect, or dancing for money â€“ or whatever I want - without being crucified or saying that Iâ€™m glamorizing abuse?"
After being labeled "racist" for calling out female artists of color in her post, Del Rey responded in the comments, writing, "This is sad to make it about a WOC issue when Iâ€™m talking about my favorite singers. I couldâ€™ve literally said anyone but I picked my favorite f---ing people." She continued to defend herself in a six-minute video. "I'm not the enemy, and I'm definitely not racist, so don't get it twisted," she said after earlier calling herself a girls' girl. "Nobody gets to tell your story except for you, and that's what I'm gonna do in the next couple books. So God bless and, yeah, f--k off if you don't like the post."

title: Lana Del Rey, Janelle Monae Pull Out of Bonnaroo Festival
content:
Lana Del Rey, Janelle MonÃ¡e and King Gizzard and the Lizard Wizard have pulled out of the Bonnaroo festival, organizers announced over social media on Thursday (July 8), with left-field rock trio Khruangbin and dance music titans Rufus Du Sol added.
No reason was given for the cancelations, but it seems likely that Del Reyâ€™s album delay and Janelle Monaeâ€™s widely reported appearance in â€œKnives Out 2â€ could have played a role. The updated lineup appears below.
BONNAROOVIANS! ğŸŒˆâœ¨ Unfortunately Lana Del Rey, Janelle MonÃ¡e and King Gizzard & The Lizard Wizard will no longer be able to join us on The Farm this fall. And now for the good news: Khruangbin and RÃœFÃœS DU SOL have been added and are ready to bring the good vibes to Centeroo.ğŸ™Œ pic.twitter.com/WHlUCgLngc â€” Bonnaroo (@Bonnaroo) July 8, 2021
Lizzo, Megan Thee Stallion, Foo Fighters, Tyler, the Creator, Tame Impala and many more are still onthe bill for the eventâ€™s 20th anniversary edition, scheduled to take place September 2â€“5, 2021 on the Bonnaroo Farm, located 60 miles southeast of Nashville in Manchester, TN. Bonnaroo will present dozens of acts across more than 10 stages over the four-day festival.
Like most music festivals, Bonnaroo was forced to postpone its 2020 editions and move the planned date for this yearâ€™s event from its usual early June dates to Labor Day weekend. While a level of uncertainty remains for all mass-gathering events, as vaccinations gain momentum, many festivals in Europe and the U.S. are moving ahead with plans for late-summer and fall events.
This is noted in the announcement: â€œThroughout its 20-year history, Bonnaroo has evolved and innovated to make each and every event more enjoyable, with the safety of its fans, artists, and staff a top priority. Bonnaroo organizers as always will be in regular communication with local health and public safety officials and will continue to abide by relevant recommendations. As it approaches, Bonnaroovians will receive regular updates with the important information needed to plan their trip to The Farm, including any changes to policies and procedures theyâ€™ll need to know before entering the festival and campgrounds.â€
â€œItâ€™s exciting to see Tennessee stages come back to life in time to celebrate the 20th anniversary of this internationally acclaimed festival,â€ said Gov. Bill Lee when the festivalâ€™s lineup was announced. â€œFans are ready to gather together and celebrate their shared love of music once again. We welcome them back for a full Bonnaroo and what is sure to be a truly unforgettable event!â€

title: Famosas que nÃ£o hesitam em mostrar corpos naturais
content:

Pensando nisso, OFuxico separou uma lista com outras famosas que, mesmo sendo consideradas dentro dos padrÃµes estÃ©ticos impostos, nÃ£o hesitam em mostrar corpos mais naturais, sem retoques e com curvas normais. Veja:
Camila Cabello
Camila Cabello jÃ¡ foi alvo de â€œbody shamingâ€ (quando o corpo de uma famosa vira motivo de piadas e xingamentos nas redes sociais, seja por seu peso ou alguma caracterÃ­stica em especÃ­fico) diversas vezes na web, principalmente apÃ³s assumir seu relacionamento com Shawn Mendes. Clicada vÃ¡rias vezes na praia, a famosa sempre aparenta estar feliz e tranquila com seu corpo, alheia a crÃ­ticas e xingamentos nas redes.
Lana Del Rey
Lana Del Rey, famosa cantora indie-pop dos Estados Unidos, mudou bastante de forma corporal em um curto perÃ­odo de tempo, o que, para muitos crÃ­ticos de plantÃ£o na internet, jÃ¡ foi o suficiente para uma enxurrada de comentÃ¡rios depreciativos sobre o corpo da artista. Mesmo assim, Lana continuou a compartilhar fotos em que aparecia feliz e contemplada com sua aparÃªncia, mesmo com os constantes apontamentos sobre sua mudanÃ§a fÃ­sica.
Demi Lovato
Demi Lovato sofreu desde a adolescÃªncia devido aos padrÃµes estÃ©ticos impostos pela mÃ­dia e a crescente reprovaÃ§Ã£o da imprensa acerca de sua prÃ³pria imagem: ainda jovem, a famosa enfrentou distÃºrbios alimentares devido sua exposiÃ§Ã£o desde crianÃ§a na televisÃ£o. Atualmente, Demi compartilha fotos em que aparece segura e confiante com sua aparÃªncia, sem qualquer pressÃ£o para emagrecer ou se submeter a procedimentos estÃ©ticos. Mesmo assim, a famosa sempre comenta como foi um processo difÃ­cil e que possui recaÃ­das de autoestima atÃ© hoje.
Carolinie Figueiredo
Carolinie Figueiredo, conhecida atriz da Rede Globo principalmente por sua atuaÃ§Ã£o em â€œMalhaÃ§Ã£oâ€ como a personagem Domingas, sempre compartilha cliques em que mostra seu corpo sem censura, ao lado de textos que reforÃ§am a autoestima de mulheres que nÃ£o se sentem â€œmagrasâ€ o suficiente, alÃ©m de mostrar com naturalidade todas as individualidades de sua forma fÃ­sica.
Preta Gil
Preta Gil jÃ¡ chama a atenÃ§Ã£o por seu talento, carisma e confianÃ§a. AlÃ©m disso, a filha de Gilberto Gil sempre ressalta como Ã© importante que as mulheres aprendam a amar seus corpos como sÃ£o, ao invÃ©s de odiÃ¡-los em busca de padrÃµes inalcanÃ§Ã¡veis. Com vÃ¡rias fotos de si mesma, Preta aborda a temÃ¡tica com confianÃ§a e assertividade.
AlÃ©m disso, vÃ¡rias influencers compartilham conteÃºdo especÃ­fico sobre o assunto e produzem posts relacionados a vertente conhecida como â€œBody Positiveâ€: @alexandrismos, @movimentocorpolivre, @todebells, @dorafigueiredo, @biagremion e entre outras.
Vale a pena conferir! Afinal, nos espelhamos muito, mesmo que indiretamente, no que consumimos nas redes. Sendo assim, porque nÃ£o seguir pessoas que mostram padrÃµes saudÃ¡veis e naturais, nÃ£o Ã© mesmo?

title: Lana Del Rey's 10 Best Music Videos
content:
The images Del Rey has created are inextricably bound to her music; in many ways, she is first and foremost a visual artist. "She's the most involved artist I've ever worked with," Kinga Burza, director of Del Rey's "Music to Watch Boys To" video, told Billboard in 2015. We took a look back at her videography and picked out 10 of her absolute best videos. 10. "Music to Watch Boys To"
The video for the second single from Del Rey's 2015 album Honeymoon is as lush and leisurely as the song itself. The clip cuts fluidly between crisp black-and-white shots of Del Rey surrounded by spinning gramophones -- only barely glancing at the shirtless boys playing basketball nearby -- and blue-tinted visions of the artist and her friends floating angelically through water. It's narratively more straightforward than many of the singer's visuals, but it's this unexpected simplicity that makes "Music to Watch Boys To" so hypnotic. 9. "Freak"
Directed by Del Rey, the nearly 11-minute video for "Freak," a promotional single from Honeymoon, moves at a deliberately narcotic pace. Singer-songwriter Father John Misty stars as a Jim Morrison-style figure who presides over a hippie cabal while Del Rey portrays his alternately despondent and love-struck bride. When she delicately drops a tab of acid on Misty's tongue, he's instantly surrounded by a harem of adoring, flaxen-haired women (there's more than a whiff of the Manson Family throughout). Set to Claude Debussy's "Clair de Lune," the second half of the video is an extended underwater scene, nearly identical to the one in "Music to Watch Boys To," evoking a watercolor painting come to life. 8. "Love"
The dreamy, sun-kissed video for "Love," the lead single from 2017's Lust for Life, follows a group of suburban teens, including one dressed like Rose McGowan's character from the '90s cult film The Doom Generation, as they gather at a planetarium, where they're transported into space and marvel at a solar eclipse while they bathe in celestial waters. Director Rich Lee's video â€“ not to mention Lana's lilting performance â€“ perfectly captures the wonder of teenage love. 7. "Lust for Life"
Hollywood is a recurring theme in Del Rey's music and visuals, and the video for "Lust for Life," a duet with fellow pop visionary The Weeknd, takes place almost entirely atop Tinseltown's most iconic symbol. Del Rey plays the lovesick lead singer of a girl group who climbs the Hollywood sign to rendezvous with her lover, who may or may not actually be there. She peers longingly over the side of the giant letters â€“ which director Clark Jackson created in his garage with papier-mÃ¢chÃ© and chicken wire â€“ and takes the plunge, landing alongside The Weeknd in a field of poppies (a symbol of remembrance). Whether her death is literal or symbolic, the point remains: Like the promises of the Dream Factory, life and love are just illusions. 6. "Chemtrails Over the Country Club"
The Wizard of Oz meets An American Werewolf in London in this peculiar, thoroughly captivating video for the title track from Del Rey's Chemtrails Over the Country Club, which debuted at No. 2 on the Billboard 200. A fever dream in which the titular vapor trails conjure tornadoes, shifting aspect ratios, and, apparently, a hunger for fresh lemons from the local farm stand, the video expands on the fiery, hallucinatory spell hinted at in her visual for 2014's "West Coast." By the end, Del Rey doffs her sparkly mesh face mask and prowls around the forest (hunting for birds, diamonds, and, presumably, men to devour) before crawling back to her bed. Carnivorous conspiracy theories never looked so glamorously decadent. 5. "Ride"
"Ride," from 2012's Paradise EP, marked a shift in musical style and visual aesthetic for Del Rey. Unlike the trip-hop-infused pop and noir-inspired visuals of Born to Die, "Ride" telegraphed the more rootsy direction the artist would take on her follow-up, Ultraviolence. Directed by Anthony Mandler, who also helmed Del Rey's Tropico short film, "Ride" is a vision of Americana steeped in totems of masculinity. Del Rey plays a dark-haired, "not very popular" singer who takes up with a nomadic motorcycle gang and becomes their lover. The video is a wistful depiction of what America "used to be," the kind of idealistic imagery that has raised eyebrows among the artist's critics over the years. But "Ride" is at turns sad, unsettling and beautiful. 4. "Video Games"
It's no coincidence that this was the song and video that introduced "Lana Del Rey" to the world. Within the hazy, vintage images of Los Angeles that Del Rey personally assembled, "Video Games" is a cautionary tale about Hollywood's exploitation of young women, a theme that runs through the artist's body of work. If the song itself is about the lengths a girl will go to for love, the video makes you wonder what she'd do for fame. 3. "Doin' Time"
The video for Del Rey's pitch-perfect cover of Sublime's "Doin' Time," which hit No. 1 on Billboard's Rock & Alternative Airplay chart in 2019, is a playful tribute to both her adopted home of southern California and the 1958 B-movie Attack of the 50 Foot Woman. Directed by Rich Lee, this movie-within-a-mini-movie thrillingly morphs into a feminist statement when a giant version of Del Rey steps out of a drive-in movie screen in order to exact revenge on the two-timing boyfriend of a young woman (also played by Del Rey). It's indicative of the singer's commitment to bridging the divide between nostalgia for the past and an acknowledgement of its, well, shortcomings. 2. "High by the Beach"
The video for "High by the Beach," directed by Jake Nava, plays like a deceptively tranquil opening scene to an action thriller. Del Rey listlessly wanders barefoot through an empty Malibu rental, dressed in a nightgown and robe, evading the prying eyes of a black helicopter circling above. When the chopper is out of sight, she slips down to the rocky beach below and retrieves a hidden guitar case, pulls a grenade launcher from it and blows the helicopter out of the sky. The burnt pages of a supermarket tabloid float through the air, revealing the voyeuristic intruder to be a reporter looking for a scoop -- and Del Rey as a contender for the next Bond girl. 1. "National Anthem"

title: Lana Del Rey pubblica la cover del nuovo album Blue Banisters
content:
Prima dell'album â€œBlue Banistersâ€, Lana Del Rey ha lanciato tre tracce : la canzone omonima â€œBlue Banistersâ€, â€œText Bookâ€ e â€œWildflower Wildfireâ€, uscite lo scorso maggio. Inizialmente sembrava che l'ottavo lavoro discografico dell'artista dovesse uscire il 4 luglio, ma la data Ã¨ stata poi posticipata. L'interprete di "Summertime sadness" sui social ha fatto sapere ai fan: " L'album uscirÃ  piÃ¹ tardi rispetto a quanto previsto. Il singolo arriverÃ  prestoâ€. La cantante ha poi dato ai suoi fan un'anticipazione del nuovo singolo, di cui ha condiviso una parte del videoclip.
approfondimento
Lana Del Rey, il post prima dell'uscita del nuovo album
Nel mese di marzo, un giorno dopo la data di uscita di â€œChemtrails Over the Country Clubâ€, Lana aveva anticipato il rilascio, a giugno, di un album intitolato â€œRock Candy Sweetâ€. Non Ã¨ chiaro, perÃ², se questo lavoro abbia semplicemente cambiato titolo in â€œBlue Banistersâ€. Lâ€™artwork che la cantante ha condiviso come cover dell'album, sembra essere la stessa immagine prevista anche per â€œRock Candy Sweetâ€. Se l'ottavo disco verrÃ  pubblicato a breve, si tratterÃ  del terzo album di Lana Del Rey pubblicato in un anno dopo lâ€™uscita di marzo di â€œChemtrails Over the Country Clubâ€ e del suo LP â€œViolet Bent Backwards Over the Grassâ€, rilasciato nel luglio 2020.
Lana Del Rey, â€œChemtrails Over The Country Clubâ€
â€œChemtrails over the Country Clubâ€ Ã¨ il settimo album in studio di Lana Del Rey, pubblicato il 19 marzo 2021. Nell'album c'Ã¨ anche una canzone country intitolata â€œBreaking Up Slowlyâ€, cantata insieme alla promessa indie Nikki Lane. â€œCredo che il nostro primo concerto insieme sia stato a Wichita, un posto cosÃ¬ â€“ ha rivelato tempo fa Lane a Rolling Stone - Sono partita per il Midwest, non la vedevo da tanto tempo, ma Ã¨ stato semplice. Ci siamo seduti nella camera dellâ€™hotel e abbiamo parlato di cosa ci era successo negli ultimi mesi. Io avevo con me la chitarra, dovevo preparare Look Away, la mia canzone che avremmo suonato quella sera. A un certo punto ho detto ad alta voce qualcosa tipo: 'beh, qualcuno dice che mi sto spezzando lentamente'. Adesso so che con Lana funziona cosÃ¬, una frase Ã¨ sufficiente per far nascere una melodia forte. Anche io scrivo in questo modo: qualcuno dice qualcosa, nasce unâ€™idea che poi si sviluppa. Insomma, lei si Ã¨ messa a cantare 'breaking up slowlyâ€¦' e io ho capito che funzionava. Lâ€™abbiamo scritta cosÃ¬, prima del concerto. Neanche mi sono resa conto che fosse giÃ  finita. Ci siamo ritrovate piÃ¹ avanti, quello stesso anno, e lei mi ha chiesto di mandargliela. Ho registrato una demo, pensavo che avesse bisogno di qualcosa di completo, e alla fine hanno usato quelle voci per costruire la traccia. Poi abbiamo potuto cantarla insieme. Quando mi ha detto che sarebbe finita sul disco ero entusiasta. Non sapevo cosa ne avrebbe fattoâ€.

Com 11 faixas, Chemtrails Ã© o primeiro trabalho de Lana Del Rey desde Norman Fucking Rockwell, de 2019. O Ã¡lbum teve colaboraÃ§Ã£o de Jack Antonoff, que recentemente se apresentou no Grammy ao lado de Taylor Swift.

title: Nieuwe album Lana del Rey komt later uit dan gepland
content:
Het nieuwe album van Lana del Rey laat langer op zich wachten. Aanvankelijk zou de plaat Blue Banisters op 4 juli verschijnen. Op sociale media deelde Lana wel alvast de cover. "Album komt later uit", schreef ze erbij.
Ook voegde ze een videoclipje toe met een stukje van een nieuwe, nog titelloze, single. Blue Banisters wordt Lana's zevende plaat.
Eerder dit jaar, in maart, lanceerde Lana al Chemtrails Over The Country Club. Dat album zou eigenlijk vorig jaar al uitgebracht worden, maar liep door aanpassingen en de coronacrisis meerdere keren vertraging op.

title: Lana Del Rey Drops Single Preview, Album Will Be Out â€˜Laterâ€™
content:
The face of a woman who is not dropping an album tomorrow. Photo: Instagram
Continuing her perplexing album rollout, Lana Del Rey has posted a snippet of an untitled new single from her upcoming album, Blue Banisters, as well as the cover art for the record. The full Instagram caption of the single preview reads, â€œAlbum out later laterâ€¦ Single out soonish. Have a good fourth.â€ The singer had previously announced that the album would drop on July 4, but weâ€™re guessing that doesnâ€™t qualify as â€œlater later.â€ The cover art for Blue Banisters is not in fact the grainy selfie weâ€™ve seen numerous times in Lanaâ€™s multiple album announcements, but instead a photograph of the singer alongside two German Shepherds. The preview for the single, meanwhile, shows Del Rey clad in blue jeans, singing about â€œthe Hilton hotelâ€ and comparing her loverâ€™s hands variously to a â€œToyotaâ€ and â€œa Land Rover.â€ In other words, peak Lana.

title: Between 'Zola' and 'Heaux Tales' women are owning their sexuality right now
content:
A version of this story appeared in CNN's Pop Life Chronicles newsletter. To get it in your inbox, sign up for free here . Tell us what you'd like to see more of in the newsletter at entertainment.newsletter@cnn.com .
(CNN) If you can't be sexy in the summertime, when the H-O-T as hell can you be?
Seriously. High temps, more skin and plenty of cocktails with umbrellas.
Count me in. And after surviving a pandemic, you had better praise ANY body you're living in and designate it summer-ready.
That's why I am all types of thrilled by the hot-girl summer energy right now as women are owning their agency.
The stars seem aligned to groove to that, with Jazmine Sullivan just picking up the BET Award for album of the year for her "Heaux Tales" (does the title alone not say it all?) and the epic "Thotyssey" film "Zola" hitting theaters.
Which leads me into this week's what to watch:
Three things to watch
'Zola'
Taylour Paige stars as the title character in "Zola."
What happens when you get two strippers, a needy boyfriend and a dangerous pimp together for a road trip?
All types of shenanigans -- and we are SO here for it.
Based on a viral 2015 Twitter thread , the film, directed by Janicza Bravo and starring Taylour Paige, Riley Keough and Nicholas Braun, is like a buddy road trip on ecstasy -- plenty of comedy and a guide to the hoe game as a bonus.
If Paige seems perfect as Zola, thank Bravo, who told me she found her and surreptitiously took photos of the young actress at a coffee shop after earlier spotting Paige in an ad for her VH1/BET drama, "Hit the Floor."
Paige was not happy about the snaps.
"She fully squinted at me like I was a garbage person and the thing is that's okay, because I was really taking a photo of you and not asking you to do that," Bravo told Paige during our interview , to which Paige responded, "I was going through it, probably."
"Zola" is in theaters now.
'Summer of Soul'
"Summer of Soul" starts streaming on Hulu Friday.
Questlove can literally do it all.
The drummer for The Roots, superstar DJ and adjunct instructor at New York University has directed his first film, a documentary titled "Summer of Soul."
The film is billed as "part music film, part historical record created around an epic event that celebrated Black history, culture and fashion."
"Over the course of six weeks in the summer of 1969, just 100 miles south of Woodstock, the Harlem Cultural Festival was filmed in Mount Morris Park (now Marcus Garvey Park)," according to a news release for the film. "The footage was never seen and largely forgotten -- until now."
Being educated while you jam? Sign me up!
The doc starts streaming on Hulu Friday.
'September Mornings'
Liniker as Cassandra (left) and Gustavo Coelho as Gersinho (right) are shown in a scene from "September Mornings."
Soul singer and songwriter Liniker , a trailblazer for the trans community in her native Brazil, shines in "September Mornings."
I'm a sucker for musical artists who can also act. Liniker's performance as Cassandra, a woman whose life takes a turn when a son she never knew she had turns up at her door, is stellar. She also sings in the series, so bonus!
"September Mornings," also known as "ManhÃ£s de Setembro," is currently streaming on Amazon Prime.
Two things to listen to
Lana Del Rey performs at the BenicÃ ssim International Music Festival in BenicÃ ssim, Spain, July 20, 2019.
Lana Del Rey's eighth studio album, "Blue Banisters," is a follow-up to " eighth studio album,is a follow-up to " Chemtrails Over the Country Club ," which released in March.
It seems that the pandemic has artists out here creating enough tunes that they can release more than one album a year.
Color me not mad about it.
Back in April, Del Rey tweeted , "I'm writing my own story. And no one can tell it but me."
Let the storytelling begin on Sunday.
The "Rebel Girls Go for the Gold" podcast streams on Audible.
The Summer Olympics start July 23. In honor of the games, Audible is offering up an exclusive six-episode podcast series.
"Rebel Girls Go for the Gold" is performed by is performed by Olympic bronze medalist Ibtihaj Muhammad and "takes listeners on a journey throughout Olympics history -- from the first woman marathon runner in the late 1800s to a young BMX racer from Colombia planning to compete in the upcoming Tokyo games."
With all the conversation about (the lack of) gender parity in sports , I dig shining a spotlight on these amazing athletes.
The podcast is currently streaming.
One thing to talk about
Michael Gandolfini (right) stars as the young Tony Soprano in "The Many Saints of Newark."
More prequels, please.
I know Hollywood loves a good sequel -- and multiple ones at that -- but I crave origin stories.
So, thank you, David Chase for the forthcoming film "The Many Saints of Newark," where we learn the story of a young Tony Soprano from "The Sopranos."
I was obsessed with the HBO show and am so looking forward to this film. (Obligatory corporate synergy disclosure: HBO and CNN are both part of WarnerMedia.)
Perfect casting. Plus, behind every great character is a history that helped him or her get there. Bada bing, bada boom.
Something to sip on
A portrait of Britney Spears looms over supporters and the media outside a court hearing concerning the pop singer's conservatorship at the Stanley Mosk Courthouse in LA, June 23.
Support for Britney Spears is growing louder.
As wonderful as that is, I hope support continues when headlines are gone.

title: Lana Del Rey's 'Blue Banisters': Album Release Date Update, New Single Preview
content:
Lana Del Rey's new album Blue Banisters, which she originally said would be available on July 4, now has a release date that is "TBD."
"Album out later later," she wrote in a Saturday night (July 3) update to fans on social media, where she shared the Blue Banisters album art and a music video teaser for a new, as-yet-untitled single in the meantime. Del Rey says the song, in which she can be heard singing "My body is a map of L.A.," will be "out soonish."
"Have a good fourth," she added. After she posted the update, "Lana" was trending on Twitter.

title: Billie Elish, Lana Del Rey and other hot new album releases
content:
Itâ€™s a big month for new album releases, highlighted by offerings from two of pop musicâ€™s biggest stars â€” Lana Del Rey and Billie Eilish. Hereâ€™s a look at some of the top releases for July.
â€œBlue Banisters,â€ Lana Del Rey
Del Rey has been on quite a roll over the past 10 years, beginning with the deliriously good major label debut â€œBorn to Dieâ€ in 2012 and continuing through such stellar efforts as 2014â€™s â€œUltraviolenceâ€ and 2017â€™s â€œLust for Life.â€ All told, sheâ€™s fashioned one of the best pop music catalogs of the last 10 years. And we canâ€™t to hear this new addition â€” Del Reyâ€™s eighth studio album overall â€” which quickly follows the March release of â€œChemtrails over the Country Club.â€ â€œBlue Banistersâ€ is due out July 4.
â€œHappier Than Ever,â€ Billie Eilish
Millions of fans around the globe have been breathlessly awaiting Eilishâ€™s sophomore effort, which follows 2019â€™s multiplatinum-selling, multi-Grammy-winning debut â€œWhen We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?â€ From what weâ€™ve heard from the new albumâ€™s four singles released already â€” â€œTherefore I Am,â€ â€œMy Future,â€ â€œYour Powerâ€ and â€œLost Causeâ€ â€” those fans will likely be happier than ever with â€œHappier Than Ever.â€ Due out July 30.
â€œInto the Mystery,â€ Needtobreathe
The South Carolina alt-rock troupe returns with its eighth studio album, which follows 2020â€™s â€œOut of Body.â€ One of the standout cuts in the set is â€œI Wanna Remember,â€ which finds lead vocalist Bear Rinehart crooning alongside country music superstar Carrie Underwood. The album is due out July 30.
â€œNative Sons,â€ Los Lobos
Los Lobos pays tribute to some fellow musical greats from Los Angeles â€” including Buffalo Springfield, War, the Blasters and Jackson Browne â€” on this collection of (mostly) cover songs. (The title cut is the only original composition on the album.) Of particular note is the groupâ€™s wonderful version of the Beach Boyâ€™s â€œSail On, Sailor,â€ which will hopefully be a staple of Los Lobos live sets for years to come. Due out July 30.
â€œHeart in Motion (30th Anniversary Edition),â€ Amy Grant
The acclaimed vocalist is celebrating the 30th anniversary of her biggest-selling album â€” 1991â€™s quintuple-platinum-selling â€œHeart in Motionâ€ â€” by offering up an expanded two-disc set for fans. The collection includes a remastered version of the original Grammy-nominated album as well as bonus disc filled with new mixes and never-before-heard tunes. Due out July 9.

title: Lana Del Rey celebrates 36th birthday with a style
content:
American singer Lana Del Rey celebrated her 36th birthday with the most beautiful cake.
The singer, who is known for her music of tragic romance and stylized cinematic quality, celebrates her birthday on June 21.
Taking to Instagram on Monday, Lana Del Rey posted her lovely-looking birthday cake as it was in the shape of a Barbie - which looked like her. It seemed she had the cake made on order.
The cake's icing was made to look like a frilly pink ballgown. The cake was marvellously designed to appear like a miniature model of the singer.
Marking her big day on social media, Lana Del Rey thanked her loved ones â€œfor being the center and happiness of my life,â€ in the Instagram caption. â€œEvery day I get on this beautiful earth is a good day. Thank you God for giving me another one,â€ the birthday girl penned.
Apart from her selfie, the singer posted a shot of pink geraniums. The singer included a heartwarming message as a tribute to her longtime photographer Caroline Grant, who is expecting a child. She also made a relevance of her flowers snap by telling a very short story about her birth.
Lana Del Rey also said, "On the day I was born they didnâ€™t know what they were having so when they called my grandmother to let her know what is was, they said â€˜plant pink geraniums.â€™ That was code for- it was a girl! Maybe we can plant a flower for this little one too. Whatever color u like."

title: Lana Del Rey, don't act prematurely
content:
CELEBRITIES BORN ON THIS DAY: Lana Del Rey, 36; Jussie Smollett, 38; Prince William, 39; Chris Pratt, 42.
Happy Birthday: Educate, liberate and turn something that interests you into a hobby or moneymaking endeavor. Embrace change and be receptive to suggestions. title: Lorde Says It's Sexist to Give Jack Antonoff Credit for Her Music
content:
Lorde opened up about her relationship with Jack Antonoff in an interview with the New York Times.
Antonoff coproduced Lorde's new album "Solar Power," but she said he "deferred" to her vision.
"I haven't made a Jack Antonoff record," she said, adding, "To give him that amount of credit is frankly insulting."
Business Insider: A daily selection of curated stories Loading Something is loading. Email address By clicking â€˜Sign upâ€™, you agree to receive marketing emails from Insider as well as other partner offers and accept our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
Lorde recently opened up about her "really unique" relationship with Jack Antonoff, as well as reductive assumptions about their creative partnership.
The two musicians have been working together for seven years. Antonoff coproduced Lorde's sophomore album, 2017's "Melodrama," as well as her forthcoming follow-up, "Solar Power."
He has also worked closely with artists like Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey, Clairo, and St. Vincent, which has earned him a reputation as a pop star's go-to collaborator.
As Pitchfork's Quinn Moreland wrote, "Antonoff's perceived grip over the introspective pop girlies has given birth to many memes at this point," and some fans believe "his omnipresence has flattened the sound of that niche between mainstream pop and indie music."
However, Lorde strongly objects to the notion that she's one of several female musicians in "Jack's stable."
"I haven't made a Jack Antonoff record," she told New York Times reporter Joe Coscarelli. "I've made a Lorde record and he's helped me make it and very much deferred to me on production and arrangement. Jack would agree with this. To give him that amount of credit is frankly insulting."
Lorde performs "Stoned at the Nail Salon" on "Late Night with Seth Meyers" with Jack Antonoff on guitar, right. Lloyd Bishop/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images
According to Coscarelli, she used the terms "retro" and "sexist" to describe the narrative, "which has also included speculation about the pair's romantic and sexual life."
Back in 2018, Antonoff dismissed dating rumors as "heteronormative gossip," while Lorde simply told fans, "He's awesome, but we're not dating."
"No one who's in a job that isn't my job has a relationship like the one I have with Jack," Lorde told Coscarelli. "He's like a partner to me. We're in a relationship. It's not a romantic relationship, but we've been in it for seven years, and it's a really unique thing, so I don't begrudge people maybe not being able to understand it."
She also said there are "certain hallmarks" of Antonoff's production that she likes, and some that she does not.
"I beat them out of the work that we do together," she explained. "I say this with so much love and affection, but I feel like we're doing up a house together and he's like, 'Look at this serviette that I fashioned into the shape of two swans! Look at this set of woven baskets!' And I'm like, 'Great â€” one per room.'"
Lorde's third studio album "Solar Power" will be released on August 20. Read Insider's full breakdown of what to expect here.

title: John Lennon's Son Said Making a Song With Lana Del Rey Changed His Life
content:
John Lennonâ€™s son, Sean Lennon, is a musician in his own right. He once collaborated with Lana Del Rey to make â€œTomorrow Never Came,â€ one of his most famous songs. Subsequently, Sean revealed what he thought of Del Rey â€” and the process of creating â€œTomorrow Never Came.â€
Lana Del Rey | Chelsea Lauren/WireImage
What John Lennonâ€™s son thought when Lana Del Rey sent him a song
Del Rey constantly pays homage to the pop and rock music of the 1960s. Her songs contain references to Tommy James and the Shondells, Jim Morrison, The Crystals, and so much more. Once, she released a song called â€œTomorrow Never Cameâ€ which mentions John and Yoko Ono in the bridge. Fittingly, the song features guest vocals from Sean.
During an interview with Paper, Sean discussed the origin of â€œTomorrow Never Came.â€ Sean said Del Rey called him to see if he would collaborate with her on the song. This surprised Sean because they had never met.
Sean Lennon | Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic for Michael Dorf Presents
RELATED: Adele Says This Lana Del Rey Song Makes Her Feel Like She Is Flying
Upon hearing â€œTomorrow Never Came,â€ Sean was impressed. â€œIt was very minimal, but the song was already very good,â€ he said. â€œI remember thinking, â€˜Her voice sounds so beautiful and rich and textured that I need to get a better vocal mic.â€™ I was too scared to sing on the same song as her with one of my sâ€”â€“ microphones.â€
How John Lennonâ€™s son reacted when he heard his vocals on â€˜Tomorrow Never Cameâ€™
Sean enlisted some help from someone else. â€œSo I called an engineer friend of mine, I said â€˜Listen, you gotta help me, I gotta do this song tomorrow or the next day â€” I need a good vocal mic.'â€ Sean recalled. â€œAnd he hooked me up with his friend.â€ The friend let Sean use a microphone that was previously used by Johnny Cash.
RELATED: Bruce Springsteen Reacts to Lana Del Rey Mentioning Him in a Song
Sean was enthused with his vocals on â€œTomorrow Never Came.â€ â€œIâ€™m really excited because my whole life I never really bothered to get a good mic because I never really considered myself a singer,â€ he said. â€œSo I sang through this mic and it really felt like it changed my life. I had never heard my voice sound that good.â€ Sean felt â€œTomorrow Never Cameâ€ was a magical gift from the universe.
Did â€˜Tomorrow Never Cameâ€™ become a hit song?
Del Rey and Sean did not release â€œTomorrow Never Cameâ€ as a single and it didnâ€™t chart on the Billboard Hot 100. Its parent album, Lust for Life, was a hit. It reached No. 1 on the Billboard 200, staying on the chart for 22 weeks.
RELATED: Lana Del Rey Once Said a Rapper Changed Her Life, He Said Heâ€™d Hit Her
The Official Charts Company reports â€œTomorrow Never Cameâ€ didnâ€™t chart in the United Kingdom either. Despite this, Lust for Life reached No. 1 in the U.K. and it stayed on the chart for 12 weeks. While â€œTomorrow Never Cameâ€ wasnâ€™t a hit, the song changed Seanâ€™s life.

title: The MixtapE! Presents Bleachers, Dan + Shay and More New Music Musts
content:
Watch : Lana Del Rey & Sean Larkin Split After 6 Months of Dating
New music Fridays are a thrilling, yet daunting prospect for any music lover.
It's essentially a weekly holiday where fan-favorite artists and fresh faces alike drop their latest offerings for all the world to hear, flooding streaming services and digital retailers with an onslaught of aural goodies. But who has the time to sit there and listen to everything before updating their playlists? There's just too much good stuff! (And, if we're being honest, usually a few stinkers, too.)
As it turns out, we do. Welcome to The MixtapE!
Get ready for some good old fashioned fun across more genres than you can count.
This week, Dan + Shay and Michael Ray deliver country bangers with attitude. Darren Criss, Bruno Mars, Anderson .Paak and ayokay span multiple genres (pop, R&B and EDM) with hits that we can dance to all night long.
Billie Eilish has made her electropop fans Happier Than Ever with her sophomore album, which balances out our playlist with its somber tone about not having it all, despite having it all. In the title song, she goes hard in chastising an ex, saying, "I'd never treat me this sh--ty" and "all that you did was make me f--kin' sad."

title: Lâ€™Ã©nergie mÃ©lancolique de Jack Antonoff
content:
Jack Antonoff, leader du groupe indie rock Bleachers, en 2021. CARLOTTA KOHL.
A ceux qui en douteraient, Jack Antonoff Ã©crit aussi pour les hommes. Enfin, au moins pour ce chanteur brun aux Ã©paisses lunettes, dÃ©miurge du groupe Bleachers. Le mÃªme garÃ§on au charme un peu lunaire, quâ€™Antonoff retrouve chaque matin devant sa glace, aprÃ¨s une courte nuit, entre deux sessions de songwriting. Ces derniÃ¨res annÃ©es, cet auteur-compositeur-interprÃ¨te, multi-instrumentiste et producteur amÃ©ricain de 37 ans a cosignÃ© et rÃ©alisÃ© tellement de chansons marquantes pour plusieurs des figures fÃ©minines majeures de la pop contemporaine â€“ Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey, St. Vincent, Lordeâ€¦ âˆ’, quâ€™on se demande comment il rÃ©ussit Ã  en garder pour lui.
Collectionneur de Grammy Awards quand il travaille avec ses copines (deux statuettes Â« album de lâ€™annÃ©e Â» avec lâ€™icÃ´ne pop Taylor Swift, une Â« chanson rock de lâ€™annÃ©e Â» pour le titre Masseducation Ã©crit avec Annie Clark, alias St. Vincent, une nomination pour Norman Fucking Rockwell !, le sixiÃ¨me opus de Lana Del Reyâ€¦), Jack Antonoff pourrait postuler Ã  dâ€™autres rÃ©compenses, avec Take the Sadness out of Saturday Night, lâ€™affriolant troisiÃ¨me album de Bleachers, paru ce 30 juillet.

Article rÃ©servÃ© Ã  nos abonnÃ©s Lire aussi Le romantisme Ã©purÃ© de la chanteuse Lana Del Rey

title: Neues Album von Bleachers: Der Traum vom GroÃŸstadtglÃ¼ck
content:
Jack Antonoff braucht die NestwÃ¤rme. Aus seinem Elternhaus in New Jersey ist er erst mit 27 ausgezogen â€“ auch aus finanziellen GrÃ¼nden. Auf die vergangene Tour seines Bandprojekts Bleachers, dessen fabelhaftes neues Album â€Take The Sadness Out Of Saturday Nightâ€œ (RCA) jetzt erscheint, hat Antonoff sein Kinderzimmer dann einfach mitgenommen. Er lieÃŸ es Poster fÃ¼r Poster, Sticker fÃ¼r Sticker abnehmen und in einem mobilen HÃ¤uschen, das aussah wie ein Ã¼berdimensioniertes Monopoly-Hotel auf RÃ¤dern, wieder einrichten.
So hatte er den Raum immer dabei, in dem seine Musik entstand, die Fans konnten hineingehen, seine Songs hÃ¶ren und alles anfassen. Das war 2017 und Antonoff, gerade 33, hatte die grÃ¶ÃŸten Geldsorgen hinter sich. DafÃ¼r hatte der Hit â€We Are Youngâ€œ seiner alten Band Fun gesorgt, ein gefragter Produzent war er Ã¼berdies.
Ehrliche Songwriterinnen haben es ihm angetan
TatsÃ¤chlich ist in den vergangenen Jahren derart viel prÃ¤gende Popmusik auf sein Konto gegangen, dass es nicht vermessen ist zu sagen: Von Jack Antonoff selbst mag man noch nie gehÃ¶rt haben, aber einen von ihm produzierten Song, den hat man bestimmt schon gehÃ¶rt. Zu seinen SchÃ¼tzlinge gehÃ¶ren unter anderem Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey, Lorde und St. Vincent. Mit ihnen schreibt und produziert er immer wieder.
Die Sache mit der NestwÃ¤rme gilt auch fÃ¼r seine ProduzententÃ¤tigkeit. Er arbeite nur mit Menschen zusammen, mit denen er befreundet sei, sagte er dem â€Rolling Stoneâ€œ. Man kann das ruhig noch weiter eingrenzen: Er arbeitet vor allem mit befreundeten Frauen zusammen.
Brutal ehrliche Songwriterinnen hÃ¤tten es ihm schon immer angetan, erklÃ¤rt er. Und sie arbeiten gern mit ihm, weil er nichts zu tun hat mit dem alten Produzententypus des nebulÃ¶sen Strippenziehers, der die Frau â€“ mit mal mehr, mal weniger zweifelhaften Methoden â€“ in die Erfolgsspur lenkt. Musik entsteht bei ihm aus dem Zusammenspiel heraus und durch den Austausch Ã¼ber gemeinsame Vorbilder.
Dabei wird Antonoff zum Euphoriker. Ein Hipster im Hoodie, der in Interviews von seinen Lieblingsbands schwÃ¤rmt und dabei kaum stillsitzen kann, sich stÃ¤ndig an die Designer-Brille fasst und in Haaren herumwuschelt. Die von ihm produzierten Songs sind wie ein Schacht ins Herz der Pop-Geschichte, aus dem die Musik frÃ¼herer Jahrzehnte emporhallt, immer wieder von den WÃ¤nden zurÃ¼ckgeworfen wird, sich Ã¼berlagert, bis ganz oben ein zeitgemÃ¤ÃŸer Sound herausdringt.
Auf der dritten Platte seines Solo-Projekts Bleachers, â€Take The Sadness Out Of Saturday Nightâ€œ, erlaubt er den StÃ¼cken, ihren nostalgischen Kern stÃ¤rker zu zeigen. Das Album illustriert eine Entwicklung, die sich seit einigen Jahren in seinem Werk abzeichnet: Die bis in den Achtziger-Himmel aufgetÃ¼rmten Synthies und Sample-Gewitter, frÃ¼her ein Markenzeichen seines Breitwand-Pops, weichen zunehmend einem organischeren Sound.
[Behalten Sie den Ãœberblick: Jeden Morgen ab 6 Uhr berichten Chefredakteur Lorenz Maroldt und sein Team im Tagesspiegel-Newsletter Checkpoint Ã¼ber die aktuellen Entwicklungen in Berlin. Jetzt kostenlos anmelden: checkpoint.tagesspiegel.de.]
Antonoff hat das Album nicht allein eingespielt wie die frÃ¼heren Bleachers-Platten â€“ diesmal war die Band mit im Studio. Das tut den Songs gut, sie wirken selbstverstÃ¤ndlicher. Gleichzeitig klingt Antonoffs Gesang souverÃ¤ner, die Texte sind schlÃ¼ssiger, die Emotionen weniger kalkuliert. Zeigten seine bisherigen Solo-Arbeiten wie sehr er auf eine geniale Partnerin angewiesen ist, erreicht er nun erstmals mit einer Bleachers-Platte die QualitÃ¤t seines Produzenten-Outputs.
Auch auf diesmal war Antonoff auf seinen Freundeskreis angewiesen: auf Leute, denen er die halbfertigen StÃ¼cke vorspielte, auf deren Meinung er hÃ¶rte. Das geht schon beim Opener los, â€91â€œ, einer vertonten Kindheitserinnerung. Kein Beat, nur Streicher und Stimme: der Irak- Krieg im Fernsehen, seine Mutter, die mit Geistern durch das Zimmer tanzt, alles scheint in AuflÃ¶sung begriffen. â€Sheâ€™s here but sheâ€™s not, just like her Iâ€™m not home.â€œ
Bestseller-Autorin Zadie Smith half ihm, den erzÃ¤hlerischen Rahmen fÃ¼r die Lyrics zu finden, St. Vincent hat Streicher-Arrangements beigesteuert, Warren Ellis von den Bad Seeds Violine gespielt â€“ wenn Jack Antonoff â€soloâ€œ arbeitet, sind eine Menge BerÃ¼hmtheiten involviert.
Einer jedoch ist prÃ¤senter als alle anderen: Bruce Springsteen. Nicht nur, dass er als Vorbild durch das gesamte Album spukt, er singt auf dem zweiten StÃ¼ck selbst mit. â€Chinatownâ€œ ist eine Wuchtbrumme von einem Song mit jeder Menge New-Jersey-Pathos: die groÃŸe Stadt New York so nah und doch auÃŸer Reichweite, Teenage-Verzweiflung, die rasende Lust auf Leben, die inmitten der Kleinstadt- Idylle wÃ¤chst und pumpt und darauf wartet, entfesselt zu werden. â€Iâ€™ll take you out of the city, honeyâ€œ, singt Antonoff erst allein, dann mit Springsteen, â€Right into the shadow, â€™cause I wanna find tomorrow.â€œ Dazu spielen die Synthies eine hymnenhafte Hookline und das Glockenspiel klingelt wie zu besten â€Born To Runâ€œ-Zeiten.
Lana Del Rey singt mit ihm
Den massigen Klang des Springsteen- Klassikers peilt Antonoff immer wieder an, auch auf â€Donâ€™t Go Darkâ€œ. Der Song wurde nach seiner Trennung von â€Girlsâ€œ- Erfinderin Lena Dunham zur InitialzÃ¼ndung fÃ¼r das Album. Lana Del Rey unterstÃ¼tzte ihm beim Texten und Ã¼bernahm auch die Backing-Vocals: â€Run, run, run, run with the wildâ€œ.
Das Schlagzeug wummert, Glocken lÃ¤uten, der Schellenring scheppert, das Saxofon legt sich flÃ¤chig in den Sound â€“ alles fÃ¼gt zu einer bedÃ¤chtigen Rockâ€™nâ€™Roll-Walze. Antonoff vervielfacht seine nicht sonderlich prÃ¤gnante Stimme, packt Hall darunter, mischt sie in die Klangmasse, wenn er singt: â€Do what you want, just donâ€™t go dark on me.â€œ
Mehr zum Thema Papa sitzt, Mama summt Ein groÃŸartiges Album von St. Vincent
Trotz der traurigen UntertÃ¶ne drÃ¤ngt die Musik von Bleachers hinaus ins Leben, insistiert, dass das GlÃ¼ck da drauÃŸen wartet, in der groÃŸen Stadt, auf dem Highway. Diesmal wird er sein Kinderzimmer nicht mitnehmen auf Tour. DafÃ¼r hat er all seine Freund:innen dabei, die ihm geholfen haben, den Weg zu diesen Songs zu finden. Nicht erst bei der Arbeit am Album. Sie waren schon immer da.

title: Bleachers and Lana Del Rey Share New Song â€œSecret Lifeâ€: Listen
content:
Bleachersâ€”the recording project of singer, songwriter, and producer Jack Antonoffâ€”has shared another new song from his forthcoming album Take the Sadness Out of Saturday Night (which is out this Friday, July 30, via RCA).
