title: Amy Winehouse: Diese Stars beeinflusste die SÃ¤ngerin
content:
Am 23. Juli jÃ¤hrt sich der Todestag von Amy Winehouse. Auch Promis waren ihre Fans, unter anderem Lana Del Rey und Adele.
Auch wenn Amy Winehouse am 23. Juli 2011 im Alter von 27 Jahren von immer von uns gegangen ist - ihre Musik und die Erinnerung bleiben bis heute. Bekannt war sie vor allem fÃ¼r ihre unverwechselbare Stimme und den Retro-Sound ihrer Lieder, der oftmals an den Soul der 1960er Jahre erinnerte. Stars priesen die KÃ¼nstlerin vor allem fÃ¼r ihr unglaubliches Talent, unter anderem Tony Bennett (94) und Paul McCartney (79).
Amy Winehouses letzte Aufnahme war ein Duett mit dem weltbekannten JazzsÃ¤nger. "Body and Soul" wurde auf Tony Bennetts Album "Duets II" (2011) verÃ¶ffentlicht. Im GesprÃ¤ch mit "Entertainment Weekly" fand der US-Amerikaner 2011 lobende Worte Ã¼ber die verstorbene SÃ¤ngerin. "Die ganz GroÃŸen mit viel Talent wissen, wie man aus Jazzgesang eine unvergessliche Darbietung macht. Amy hatte diese Gabe. Die Tatsache, dass sie im Alter von 27 Jahren gestorben ist, ist einfach schrecklich fÃ¼r mich."
"HÃ¤tte sie weitergelebt, wÃ¼rde sie in einer Reihe mit Billie Holiday und Dinah Washington stehen. Es ist einfach eine TragÃ¶die", erklÃ¤rte er weiter. Im gleichen Interview erzÃ¤hlte Bennett auch, dass Amy Winehouses grÃ¶ÃŸtes Idol tatsÃ¤chlich Dinah Washington (1924-1963) gewesen sei. Demnach bezeichnete Winehouse sie als "meine GÃ¶ttin".
"Hey, Amy, hÃ¶r zu, du bist wirklich gut"
Ex-Beatle Paul McCartney wollte der SoulsÃ¤ngerin bei einer Begegnung sagen, dass sie "richtig gut" sei, verpasste den Moment jedoch. Ihr in einer Situation nicht geholfen zu haben, in der sie offenbar nicht in der besten Verfassung war, bereue er bis heute. "Ich wusste, dass sie ein Problem hatte, am Ende sagte ich aber nur 'Hallo' und sie grÃ¼ÃŸte zurÃ¼ck. Hinterher dachte ich, ich hÃ¤tte ihr hinterherlaufen sollen - 'Hey, Amy, hÃ¶r zu, du bist wirklich gut (...)'", erzÃ¤hlte er 2018 im GesprÃ¤ch mit dem MÃ¤nnermagazin "GQ".
Als Amy Winehouse Mitte der 2000er Jahre auf ihrer Erfolgswelle schwamm, steckten Soulstars wie Duffy (37) und Adele (33) noch in den Kinderschuhen. Beide wurden als Nachfolgerinnen von Winehouse gehandelt. Ob sie jedoch ebenso berÃ¼hmt werden wÃ¼rden, wie die StarsÃ¤ngerin, war damals noch nicht klar. Heute wissen wir: Besonders Adele hat sich einen Namen gemacht, sie erlebte 2011 mit "Rolling in the Deep" ihren weltweiten Durchbruch und gilt als eine der erfolgreichsten SÃ¤ngerinnen des 21. Jahrhunderts.
Adele: "Ich habe Amy Winehouse verehrt"
In zahlreichen Interviews outete sich Adele als Fan von Amy Winehouse. Sie verdanke ihr "90 Prozent meiner Karriere", sagte die 33-JÃ¤hrige 2016 etwa dem "Rolling Stone" Ã¼ber ihr Idol. Wenn sie "Frank" (2003), das DebÃ¼talbum von Winehouse, nicht gehÃ¶rt hÃ¤tte, dann hÃ¤tte sie Hits wie "Daydreamer", "Hometown" oder "Someone Like You" nicht geschrieben, erklÃ¤rte sie 2015 dem "i-D" Magazin: "Ich habe Amy Winehouse verehrt."
Nach dem Tod der SÃ¤ngerin habe Adele einen "massiven Trauerprozess als ihr Fan durchgemacht", erzÃ¤hlte sie weiter. "Ich liebe Amy. Das habe ich immer und werde ich immer. Wissen Sie, was mich supertraurig macht? Dass ich nie wieder ihre Stimme hÃ¶ren werde (...)."
Auch Lana Del Rey war am Boden zerstÃ¶rt, als sie von Amy Winehouses Tod 2011 erfuhr. Im gleichen Jahr erlangte sie ihren groÃŸen Durchbruch mit dem Hit "Video Games". "Ich hatte zehn Sekunden fÃ¼r mein HochgefÃ¼hl und dann waren plÃ¶tzlich die Nachrichten Ã¼berall. Auf allen Fernsehern wurde verkÃ¼ndet, dass Amy (...) gestorben sei und ich sagte: 'Nein!'. Alle schauten gebannt zu, aber ich hatte das GefÃ¼hl, dass ich nie wieder singen wollte", erzÃ¤hlte Del Rey 2021 dem "Mojo"-Magazin.
Dieses GefÃ¼hl nahm offenbar nicht Ã¼berhand: Lana Del Rey gab das Singen nicht auf - und der Erfolg gibt ihr recht: Seit 2011 hat sie sechs Studioalben verÃ¶ffentlicht, die es sowohl in ihrer Heimat USA als auch in der Schweiz und GroÃŸbritannien jeweils in die Top drei der Charts schafften.

title: Lana Del Rey: Warum hat sie all ihre Accounts auf Social Media gelÃ¶scht?
content:
Die SÃ¤ngerin hat ihre Accounts auf Instagram, Facebook und Twitter gelÃ¶scht. Eine gezielt eingesetzte PR-MaÃŸnahme, um ihr neues Album zu promoten? Oder reagiert Lana Del Rey damit auf die stetige Kritik, die ihr in den sozialen Medien begegnet?
Anzeige
Es klingt nach einem radikalen Neuanfang. Lana Del Rey lÃ¶schte vergangenes Wochenende alle ihre Social Media-Accounts, um sich â€auf andere Projekte zu konzentrieren und mehr PrivatsphÃ¤re zu habenâ€œ, so die SÃ¤ngerin in dem Video, das sie vorab auf ihrem mittlerweile gelÃ¶schten Instagram-Account verÃ¶ffentlichte.
In diesem Schwarz-WeiÃŸ-Video bedankte sich die SÃ¤ngerin bei ihren Fans fÃ¼r deren UnterstÃ¼tzung. Der Clip, der fast drei Minuten lang war, wurde mehr als eine Million Mal angesehen. Rey hatte allein auf Instagram mehr als 20 Millionen Abonnenten. Einige Tage nach der VerÃ¶ffentlichung des Videos lÃ¶schte sie diesen Account sowie alle weiteren auf Facebook und Twitter.
Ihre Antwort auf die andauernde Kritik
Man kÃ¶nnte Del Reys Entscheidung, sich von allen KanÃ¤len zurÃ¼ckzuziehen, als gezielt eingesetzte PR-MaÃŸnahme fÃ¼r ihr kommendes Album â€Blue Banistersâ€œ einordnen. Auch Modemarken, wie erst kÃ¼rzlich Balenciaga, rÃ¤umen ihre Accounts leer, wenn sie eine neue, vermeintlich alles verÃ¤ndernde Kooperation ankÃ¼ndigen mÃ¶chten (in dem Fall, war es die Verschmelzung mit Gucci fÃ¼r die â€Ariaâ€œ-Kollektion). Und auch SÃ¤ngerin Dua Lipa lÃ¶schte 2019 alle Fotos, bevor sie ihr neues Album verÃ¶ffentlichte, sich die Haare blond fÃ¤rbte und predigte, von nun an â€ihr wirkliches Ichâ€œ zu zeigen.
Anzeige
Doch Del Rey ging einen Schritt weiter, sie lÃ¶schte ihre Accounts vollstÃ¤ndig. Wer die Karriere der SÃ¤ngerin verfolgt hat, weiÃŸ, dass Lana Del Rey ihre wahre PersÃ¶nlichkeit in der Ã–ffentlichkeit zu zeigen weniger wichtig war, als ihre Musik zu inszenieren und zu bewerben. Durch das LÃ¶schen der Accounts untermauert sie die Botschaft ihres Statement-Videos, dass sie fortan nur noch ihre Lieder fÃ¼r sich sprechen lassen mÃ¶chte. Ohnehin war Social Media fÃ¼r Del Reys Image eher hinderlich, sich als nostalgisch anmutende Kunstfigur inszenieren zu wollen, die mit einer verletzlichen WestkÃ¼stenromantik ihren Weltschmerz verarbeitete. Oder, wie der â€Guardianâ€œ sie einst rezensierte, als Persiflage des American Dream. In den vergangenen Monaten wurde dieses Bild durch die stÃ¤ndige Kritik und der Umgang mit teils haltlosen Trollen im Internet immer wieder gestÃ¶rt.
Denn ein stÃ¤ndig wieder auflodernder Shitstorm begleitete Lana Del Rey in den vergangenen eineinhalb Jahren. Seit sie sich im Mai vergangenen Jahres auf Instagram erstmals gegen die stÃ¤ndigen VorwÃ¼rfe Ã¤uÃŸerte, dass sie toxische Beziehungen mystifizieren und in ihren emotionalen Songs beschÃ¶nigen wÃ¼rde: â€Ich habe es satt, dass Autoren und SÃ¤nger behaupten, ich verherrliche Missbrauch, wÃ¤hrend ich in Wirklichkeit nur eine glamourÃ¶se Person bin, die Ã¼ber die RealitÃ¤t dessen singt, was wir alle sehen: weitverbreitete Beziehungen, in denen emotionaler Missbrauch vorkommtâ€œ.
Lesen Sie auch Poesie Die unterwÃ¼rfige SexualitÃ¤t der Lana del Rey
Ein Shitstorm folgt dem nÃ¤chsten
Diese Aussage reichte der Social Media-Community fÃ¼r ihre Debatten bereits als Treibstoff, aber unglÃ¼cklicherweise heizte Del Rey die Diskussion weiter an. Sie drÃ¼ckte ihr MissverstÃ¤ndnis aus, warum sie so heftig kritisiert werden wÃ¼rde, wenn zeitgleich ihre Kolleginnen Cardi B, BeyoncÃ© und Nicki Minaj Erfolge mit Musik feierten, indem sie darÃ¼ber sangen, â€sexy zu sein, zu strippen, zu ficken, zu betrÃ¼genâ€œ. Offenbar ein groÃŸer Fehler. Da es sich um latein- und afroamerikanische KÃ¼nstler handelte, wurde Del Rey beschuldigt, rassistisch und blind fÃ¼r ihre Privilegien als weiÃŸe SÃ¤ngerin zu sein. Die spÃ¤teren Entschuldigungen und Komplimente, dass sie eigentlich ein Fan der jeweiligen SÃ¤ngerinnen sei, verhallten im Strudel des Social Media-Hasses.
Keine VersÃ¶hnung auf Social Media fÃ¼r Lana Del Rey
Anzeige
Im MÃ¤rz, zur VerÃ¶ffentlichung ihres neuen Albums â€Chemtrails Over The Country Clubâ€œ gab sich Del Rey erneut reumÃ¼tig auf Instagram, und erklÃ¤rte, wie die Kritik des Vorjahres sie dazu gebracht hatte, ihre Vergangenheit aufzuarbeiten. Ein erneuter Versuch, mit den Problemen der â€Cancel Cultureâ€œ Frieden zu schlieÃŸen. Sie verglich den Hass, der ihr auf Social Media entgegenkam, wieder mit den asymmetrischen, wenn nicht gar missbrÃ¤uchlichen Beziehungen, die sie zuvor erlebt hatte â€bevor die Musik sie retteteâ€œ, so die SÃ¤ngerin. Erneut gab es wenig VerstÃ¤ndnis, der wÃ¼tende Mob an Kritikern nahm die Kommentarspalten ihrer Accounts auf Facebook und Instagram erneut ein.
Lesen Sie auch Cancel Culture Wenn Eminem gecancelt wird
Eigentlich steht die heutige Generation von Millennials und Gen-Z dafÃ¼r, offen und â€wokeâ€œ gegenÃ¼ber allen Meinungen zu sein. Der Diskurs mit einem ihrer grÃ¶ÃŸten Idole ist nun aber verstummt. Auch, wenn das LÃ¶schen ihrer Accounts und das damit einhergehende Digital Detox zu Del Reys nostalgischem Auftreten mit kÃ¶rnig gefilmten, leicht verwackelten Videos und ihren Siebziger Jahre-Looks passt, macht sie klar, dass dieser RÃ¼ckzug mehr als ein neues Puzzleteil fÃ¼r ihr Image ist. Am Ende des Videos von â€Arcadiaâ€œ sendet sie eine klare Botschaft mit einer fÃ¼r die SÃ¤ngerin ungewohnt unromantischen Pose: Sie verabschiedet sich mit zwei ausgestreckten Mittelfingern.
In unserem Podcast THE REAL WORD gehtâ€™s um die wichtigen groÃŸen und kleinen Fragen des Lebens: Was haben Busen-Selfies mit Feminismus zu tun? Wie bleibt die Langzeitbeziehung glÃ¼cklich? Und was kann man von der TV-â€Bacheloretteâ€œ lernen? Abonnieren Sie den Podcast auf Spotify, Deezer, iTunes oder Google Podcasts oder abonnieren Sie uns direkt per RSS-Feed.

title: SÃ¤ngerin Lana Del Rey deaktiviert Social-Media-Profile
content:
Ã–ffentlichkeit
+ Â© Evan Agostini/Invision/AP/dpa Lana Del Rey kommt zu der Verleihung der 60. Grammy Awards im Madison Square Garden. Â© Evan Agostini/Invision/AP/dpa
Die US-SÃ¤ngerin Lana Del Rey meldet sich bei Instagram und Co ab. Dort hatte sie zuletzt immer wieder fÃ¼r Aufregung gesorgt.
Berlin - US-SÃ¤ngerin Lana Del Rey (â€Video Gamesâ€œ) hat am Wochenende ihre Social-Media-KanÃ¤le deaktiviert.
â€Und das mache ich einfach, weil ich so viele andere Interessen und andere Jobs habe, die PrivatsphÃ¤re und Transparenz erfordernâ€œ, sagte die 36-JÃ¤hrige laut dem Promiportal â€Peopleâ€œ in einem letzten Video am Samstag. Am Sonntag schaltete sie demnach ihre Profile bei Instagram und Twitter ab. Auch ihre Facebook-Seite ist nicht mehr erreichbar. In dem Clip bedankte sich die Musikerin laut â€Peopleâ€œ auch bei ihren Fans.
Lana Del Rey, die mit bÃ¼rgerlichem Namen Elizabeth Woolridge Grant heiÃŸt, hatte in den sozialen Netzwerken immer wieder fÃ¼r Aufregung gesorgt. In einem Instagram-Post beschwerte sie sich darÃ¼ber, sie dÃ¼rfe nicht Ã¼ber ihre unterwÃ¼rfige Rolle in Beziehungen singen â€“ wÃ¤hrend Musikerinnen wie BeyoncÃ©, Cardi B, Nicki Minaj und andere fÃ¼r Lieder Ã¼ber das â€Sexy-Seinâ€œ gefeiert wÃ¼rden.
Weil es sich bei den meisten der genannten Musikerinnen um nicht-weiÃŸe Frauen handelte, wurde Del Rey daraufhin vorgeworfen, blind fÃ¼r ihre Privilegien zu sein â€“ und Biografien zu vergleichen, die nichts miteinander zu tun hÃ¤tten. Auch fÃ¼r eine glitzernde grobmaschige Netzmaske, die sie in der Corona-Pandemie wÃ¤hrend einer Autogrammstunde trug, hagelte es Kritik. dpa

title: De Bob Dylan a Lana del Rey: la faceta poco conocida de Sergio Mayer como promotor de conciertos en MÃ©xico
content:
Sergio Mayer se ha desempeÃ±ado como un gran promotor de conciertos en MÃ©xico, y ha traÃ­do a increÃ­bles artistas de numerosos gÃ©neros (Foto: FOTO: GRACIELA LÃ“PEZ /CUARTOSCURO.COM - Twitter / @NoMeDicenPepe)
â€œBellÃ­simo paÃ­s, bello cielo y unas bellas personas. Amor para siempreâ€, se puede leer en la bitÃ¡cora del Auditorio Nacional de la Ciudad de MÃ©xico, firmado por el cantautor Bob Dylan y fechado en 2008.
Tras la gira Nassau que aterrizÃ³ en territorio nacional, una de las piezas clave fue Sergio Mayer, actor y empresario poco conocido por su faceta de promotor de conciertos en MÃ©xico.
De acuerdo con el propio empresario, en entrevista con Alejandro Castro de El Sol de MÃ©xico, el tambiÃ©n cantante y hasta diputado durante la mÃ¡s reciente legislatura ha sido uno de los mÃ¡s fÃ©rreos adversarios de las grandes empresas del entretenimiento en el paÃ­s.
Su lucha lo llevÃ³ a consolidar una serie de conciertos por encima de los gigantescos consorcios, a quienes les adelantÃ³ la partida en giras de renombre como la de Bob Dylan en el Auditorio Nacional o el de David Guetta en el Estadio Azteca.
Sergio Mayer se ha destacado como promotor de conciertos en MÃ©xico (Foto: Cuartoscuro)
En este contexto, asegurÃ³ al medio de comunicaciÃ³n que uno de los principales baches en el camino fue la falta de dinero, y no porque no tuviera para invertir, mÃ¡s bien porque a sus adversarios no les da miedo subir las cantidades hasta que los empresarios locales tiran la toalla por fondos insuficientes.
AdemÃ¡s, asegurÃ³, una vez con los artistas en la bolsa, conseguir patrocinadores, bancos, empresas o gente que quiera invertir en el evento suele ser complicado al estar todos juntos en una red gigantesca y monopolizadora de los eventos en el paÃ­s.
â€œAunque no perdÃ­ dinero y tampoco ganÃ©, pues tuve la satisfacciÃ³n de haberlo traÃ­doâ€, dijo al diario en relaciÃ³n con el concierto de Bob Dylan en la Ciudad de MÃ©xico.
Pero entonces, Â¿de dÃ³nde salÃ­a el dinero para que Sergio Mayer pudiera pelear por dichos conciertos? El reto necesitaba un sacrificio de igual tamaÃ±o, asÃ­ que el ex funcionario pÃºblico hipotecaba su casa, con la bendiciÃ³n de su esposa.
Cartel del concierto que tuvo Bob Dylan en el Auditorio Nacional con Sergio Mayer como promotor principal
De acuerdo con Mayer, hipotecÃ³ su casa y luego pagÃ³, por lo menos en dos conciertos: el de David Guetta y el de Bob Dylan. Con ese dinero pudo pagar los anticipos necesarios para asegurar la llegada de lo artistas.
Pero quizÃ¡s del concierto que se tiene mÃ¡s memoria en MÃ©xico, organizado por Sergio Mayer, fue por el aÃ±o 2013, cuando se involucrÃ³ en la gira de Lana del Rey.
La historia cuenta que a travÃ©s de sus redes sociales, Sergio Mayer preguntÃ³ a quiÃ©n querÃ­a ver en concierto, y al ser Lana del Rey la mÃ¡s solicitada, se puso manos a la obra.
En Noviembre de 2013 se concretÃ³ la primera visita de la cantante a MÃ©xico, con una gira que aterrizÃ³ en el Pepsi Center del WTC, en la colonia NÃ¡poles, mismo que se llenÃ³ inmediatamente.
Sergio Mayer con Lana del Rey (Foto: Twitter / @NoMeDicenPepe)
Meses despuÃ©s, Sergio Mayer anunciÃ³ que Lana del Rey volverÃ­a, pero en octubre de 2014 y con dos conciertos llenos en el Auditorio Nacional, uno de los mÃ¡s prestigiosos recintos en la historia de la CDMX.
De esos conciertos sobreviven un par de fotografÃ­as publicadas por el propio empresario, de quien no es muy comÃºn encontrar fotografÃ­as junto a los artistas con quienes se ha involucrado.
Algunos otros artistas que figuraron en su larga lista como promotor del entretenimiento en MÃ©xico fueron Redfoo, de la famosa banda LMFAO, la cantante colombiana Shakira e incluso el intÃ©rprete Enrique Iglesias.

title: Lana Del Rey: Sie hat alle Social-Media-Accounts gelÃ¶scht
content:
Ãœberraschung fÃ¼r alle Fans von Lana Del Rey: Die SÃ¤ngerin hat alle ihre Social-Media-Accounts gelÃ¶scht. Ein Abschied ist das jedoch nicht.
Fans von Lana Del Rey (36) suchen derzeit vergeblich nach den Social-Media-Accounts der SÃ¤ngerin: Sie hat alle Profile gelÃ¶scht, einschlieÃŸlich Twitter und Instagram. Am Samstag (11. September) kÃ¼ndigte sie diesen Schritt bereits in einem Instagram-Video an, wie unter anderem das "People"-Magazin berichtet. Sie deaktiviere alle Social-Media-Konten, um sich auf andere Belange zu konzentrieren, erklÃ¤rte sie in dem Clip.
Del Rey habe "so viele andere Interessen und andere Jobs, die PrivatsphÃ¤re und Transparenz erfordern". Sorge mÃ¼ssen ihre Fans aber nicht haben, die SÃ¤ngerin wird auch weiterhin Musik verÃ¶ffentlichen. Die "Video Games"-Interpretin arbeite immer noch an ihrem achten Studioalbum "Blue Banisters". "Ich bin immer noch prÃ¤sent und ich liebe, was ich tue", betonte sie. Der Longplayer soll am 22. Oktober erscheinen.
"Ich melde mich ab"
Sie bedankte sich zudem fÃ¼r die UnterstÃ¼tzung ihrer Fans, die sie "weiterhin durch die Musik begleiten" wÃ¼rden. "Im Moment denke ich, dass ich meinen Kreis ein wenig enger halten und einige andere FÃ¤higkeiten und Interessen weiter entwickeln werde", erklÃ¤rte die 36-JÃ¤hrige. Sie sei "immer hier, um viele Platten zu machen, und in der Zwischenzeit lebe ich das Leben". "Also, vielen Dank und ich melde mich ab", beendete sie ihren Monolog.

title: Promis: Lana Del Rey hat keine Lust mehr auf Social Media
content:
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen (Foto: Felix HÃ¶rhager/dpa)
Linda Zervakis, 46, Nachrichtenmoderatorin, ist froh, nach fast 20 Jahren nicht mehr im Fernseh-Schichtdienst arbeiten zu mÃ¼ssen. "Manchmal wache ich immer noch nachts auf und denke: Oh Gott, mÃ¼sste ich jetzt beim ,Morgenmagazin' sein?", sagte die ehemalige "Tagesschau"-Sprecherin dem Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland. "Das bekommt man so schnell nicht raus." Ihr Kreislauf habe zuletzt jedoch die wechselnden Arbeitszeiten nicht mehr gut vertragen. "Immer, wenn im Fernsehen irgendetwas lief Ã¼ber Schlaflabore und welchen Einfluss Schichtdienste auf den KÃ¶rper haben, habe ich weggeschaltet - ich wollte lieber gar nicht hÃ¶ren, was ich meinem KÃ¶rper antue." Zervakis ist von der ARD zu ProSieben gewechselt. Dort moderiert sie kÃ¼nftig mit ihrem Kollegen Matthias OpdenhÃ¶vel ein wÃ¶chentliches Journal.
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen (Foto: Monika Skolimowska/dpa)
Marcus SchlÃ¤fke, 31, HobbygÃ¤rtner aus Templin, hat mit einer 56,75 Kilo schweren Zucchini den deutschen Zucchini-Rekord gebrochen. Nach einem Wettbewerb in Brandenburg erklÃ¤rte SchlÃ¤fke der Deutschen Presse-Agentur, er habe das ausgezeichnete GemÃ¼se im Garten seiner Eltern gezÃ¼chtet und "nichts Besonderes gemacht". Sein Zucchini sei "rein biologisch". Bisheriger Rekordhalter war Helmut Mahr aus Hessen mit einer 53,5-Kilo-Zucchini. Zucchini schmecken vor allem dann gut, wenn sie klein gewachsen sind. Auch besonders groÃŸe Tomaten, MÃ¶hren, Kohlrabi, Rote Beete und Zwiebeln wurden bei dem Wettbewerb ausgezeichnet. Auf dem Foto ist das SiegergemÃ¼se zu sehen, nicht aber der ZÃ¼chter, sondern ein Jury-Mitglied.
Detailansicht Ã¶ffnen (Foto: imago stock&people)

title: Lana Del Rey quitte les rÃ©seaux sociaux pour se concentrer sur "de nouveaux projets"
content:
Lana Del Rey a fait ses adieux aux rÃ©seaux sociaux ce week-end. L'interprÃ¨te de "Young and beautiful" a effectivement annoncÃ© qu'elle comptait se retirer de ces derniers jusqu'Ã  nouvel ordre afin de consacrer son temps Ã  des projets qui la passionnent.
Dans un post qui a dÃ©sormais disparu mais qu'a relayÃ© le site NME, la chanteuse a dÃ©clarÃ© : "Bonjour Ã  tous, je voulais juste vous faire savoir que demain nous allons dÃ©sactiver nos comptes de mÃ©dias sociaux, mes comptes de mÃ©dias sociaux. Câ€™est simplement parce que jâ€™ai tellement dâ€™intÃ©rÃªts, et dâ€™autres emplois que je fais qui exigent la confidentialitÃ© et la transparence."
MalgrÃ© cela, Lana a promis qu'elle ne tournait pas son dos Ã  la musique.
"Je suis toujours trÃ¨s prÃ©sente et jâ€™aime ce que je fais" a-t-elle affirmÃ©. "Je suis absolument lÃ  pour la musique. Je veux vous remercier sincÃ¨rement dâ€™avoir continuÃ© Ã  me voir Ã  travers la musique. Câ€™est toujours important dâ€™Ãªtre vu et câ€™est aussi trÃ¨s important dâ€™Ãªtre vu par les gens proches de vous en qui vous avez confiance. Pour lâ€™instant, je pense que je vais juste garder mon cercle un peu plus proche et continuer Ã  dÃ©velopper dâ€™autres compÃ©tences et intÃ©rÃªts."
RÃ©cemment, Lana a rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© qu'elle avait stipulÃ© dans son testament qu'elle ne souhaitait pas qu'un album posthume sorte aprÃ¨s sa mort, comme Ã§'a Ã©tÃ© le cas pour de nombreux artistes ces derniÃ¨res annÃ©es. La star a partagÃ© une photo postÃ©e par le chanteur Anderson Paak sur son compte Instagram, dans laquelle on peut voir un tatouage qui stipule : "Quand je ne serai plus de ce monde, ne sortez pas d'albums posthumes ou de chansons auxquelles mon nom est attachÃ©. Ce ne sont que des dÃ©mos et le public n'est pas censÃ© les entendre."
En lÃ©gende de ce post, Lana a Ã©crit : "C'est dans mon testament mais c'est aussi sur son tatouage."

title: Lana Del Rey deactivates her social media handles
content:
American singer-songwriter Lana Del Rey is embarking on an indefinite social media cleanse by deactivating her accounts. The six-time Grammy Award nominee announced in an Instagram video on Saturday that she's deactivating her social media accounts as she focuses on "some different endeavours" while bidding farewell to her 20.7 million followers and thanking them for their support.
"On the record," she wrote in the caption before following through with deleting her accounts on Sunday. "Hi guys, I just wanted to let you know that tomorrow, we are going to be deactivating our social media accounts, my social media accounts," Del Rey started in the black-and-white clip.
"And that is simply because I have so many other interests and other jobs I'm doing that require privacy and transparency," she added. She further said that she's still working on her upcoming eighth studio album titled 'Blue Banisters', as well as some more spoken word albums and short poetry books.
Del Rey noted, "I'm still present and I love what I do. And I'm absolutely here for the music, and I'm also just going on some different endeavours." She added, "And I want to say thank you so much for all the support, and I do hope you like the record. It's a compilation of older songs and a few newer songs, some written by family and friends and mostly old collaborators, and there will probably always be more to come."
Del Rey continued to thank her loyal fans while discussing her need for privacy. "And I want to say a heartfelt thank you for continuing to see me through the music. It's always important to be witnessed, and it's also really important just to be witnessed by the people close to you, that you know and who you trust," she said. "For right now, I think I'm going to just keep my circle a little bit closer and continue to develop some other skills and interests. Again, I'm always here making lots of records, and in the meantime, living life. So, I've really enjoyed sharing all these small tidbits with you, and I'm really blessed. So, thank you and... signing off," she concluded, throwing up a peace sign.
The 36-year-old artist officially parted ways with her Instagram and Twitter accounts at approximately 3:30 p.m. EST on Sunday. The social media hiatus comes after she found herself shrouded in controversy several times in the past year and a half. The 'Born to Die' singer faced backlash in May 2020 for comparing her struggle to artists of colour like Beyonce, Nicki Minaj, and Cardi B, before she clarified, "I'm talking about my favorite singers."
Del Rey was called out again in June by Kehlani and Tinashe for posting photos of people looting during the Black Lives Matter protests, potentially revealing their identities. She faced further scrutiny in January for pointing out the diversity in the women featured on her 'Chemtrails' album cover. Additionally, she came under fire that month for saying that Donald Trump's presidency "needed to happen," before claiming that her words were taken "out of context," adding: "Trump is so significantly impaired that he may not know what he was doing due to his significant lack of empathy and the wider-ranging problem is the issue of sociopathy and narcissism in America."
Del Rey wrote earlier this month on Instagram that the backlash she has faced has forced her to "dig deep" on 'Blue Banisters'. "As much as the ongoing criticism has been trying, it at least has pushed me to explore my own family tree, to dig deep, and to continue to exhibit the fact that God only cares about how I move through the world," she wrote. (ANI)
(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

title: Lana Del Rey stopt met sociale media
content:
Lana Del Rey neemt afscheid van haar kanalen op sociale media. De Amerikaanse zangeres laat zondag in een video op Instagram aan haar 20,7 miljoen volgers weten dat al haar accounts na het weekend zullen verdwijnen.
Del Rey wil haar netwerk weer wat verkleinen en zich focussen op andere zaken die "privacy en transparantie" vereisen, legt ze uit. De zangeres verzekert haar fans wel dat ze blijft werken aan haar muziek.
Ook bedankt Del Rey haar fans voor hun steun op zowel sociale media als voor haar muziek. "Het is altijd belangrijk om gezien te worden en het is ook belangrijk om gezien te worden door mensen die je kent en die je vertrouwt."

title: Lana Del Rey to Deactivate Social Media Accounts
content:
In the nearly thee-minute black-and-white clip, the singer thanked her fans for their support and assured them she will continue to release new music, spoken word albums and poetry books. Last week, she dropped her new single "Arcadia," which will be featured on her eighth album, Blue Banisters, scheduled for release on Oct. 22.
"I'm still very present and love what I do. I'm absolutely out here for the music and that I'm also just going on some different endeavors," she continued. "For right now, I think I'm going to just keep my circle a little bit closer and continue to develop some other skills and interests."
Del Rey closed the video by saying she's "always here making lots of records and in the meantime living life" and adding she's "always enjoyed sharing all these very small tidbits with you" before thanking fans and flashing a peace sign to the camera.
Del Rey has been prolific of late. Earlier this year, she recently released Chemtrails Over the Country Club album, which hit No. 2 on the Billboard 200 chart. And in late 2020, she debuted her poetry collection Violet Bent Backwards Over the Grass. Chemtrails follows 2019's Norman F---ing Rockwell, which peaked at No. 3 on the Billboard 200. That album earned the singer-songwriter her best career reviews and multiple Big Four Grammy nominations.
See Del Rey's announcement that she's leaving social media below on Instagram.

title: Why Lana Del Rey Says She's Deleting Her Social-Media Accounts
content:
Lana Del Rey said in a video on Saturday that she'll be deleting her social media accounts.
The musician said she wants to seek more privacy and focus on other interests.
Del Rey also assured fans that she'll continue to work on music, poetry, and more.
Business Insider: A daily selection of curated stories Loading Something is loading. Email address By clicking â€˜Sign upâ€™, you agree to receive marketing emails from Insider as well as other partner offers and accept our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
Lana Del Rey has announced that she'll be quitting social media this weekend to focus on other ventures and have more privacy.
In a black-and-white video posted to Instagram on Saturday night, the "Chemtrails Over the Country Club" musician thanked fans for their support, and explained her decision to delete her online presence.
"I just wanted to let you know that tomorrow we are going to be deactivating my social media accounts, and that is simply because I have so many other interests and other jobs I'm doing that require privacy and transparency," Del Rey said.
The clip, which runs almost three minutes long, has more than one million views at the time of writing. She has more than 20 million followers on Instagram.
A post shared by Lana Del Rey (@lanadelrey)
While it's unclear what jobs Del Rey is working on, she assured viewers that she'll continue to make music in the future, saying "there will probably always be more to come." She also confirmed that she's working on the release of poetry books and a spoken-word album.
"I'm still very present and love what I do. I'm absolutely here for the music," she said before mentioning her upcoming "Blue Banisters" album. "I'm also just going on some different endeavors and I want to say thank you so much for all the support and I do hope that you like the record."
Towards the end of her video, Del Rey again mentioned wanting more privacy.
"I wanna say a heartfelt thank you for continuing to kind of see me through the music," Del Rey added. "It's always important to be witnessed, and it's also really important just to be witnessed by the people close to you that you know and who you trust, and for right now, I think I'm going to just keep my circle a little bit closer and continue to develop some other skills and interests."
"I've really enjoyed sharing all these very small tidbits with you, and I'm really blessed, so thank you," she said. "Signing off."
Representatives for Lana Del Rey did not immediately respond to Insider's request for comment.

Em vÃ­deo publicado no Instagram, a cantora disse que precisa de mais "privacidade e transparÃªncia" para focar em novos projetos.
Isso Ã© simplesmente porque tenho tantos outros interesses e outros trabalhos que estou realizando que exigem privacidade e transparÃªncia. Eu sÃ³ quero dizer que obviamente continuo fazendo meus discos. Ainda estou muito presente. disse
Agradecendo o apoio que recebe dos fÃ£s, ela ainda contou que seu prÃ³ximo Ã¡lbum sera um compilado de mÃºsicas antigas e novas canÃ§Ãµes.
Por enquanto, acho que vou apenas manter meu cÃ­rculo um pouco mais prÃ³ximo e continuar a desenvolver algumas outras habilidades e interesses. finalizou
De apropriaÃ§Ã£o cultural a romantizaÃ§Ã£o de abuso, Lana Del Rey jÃ¡ se envolveu em algumas polÃªmicas nas redes sociais. A mais recente delas foi durante a pandemia do novo coronavÃ­rus, quando a cantora foi a um evento com fÃ£s usando uma mÃ¡scara de tela.

title: Lana Del Rey announces social media hiatus in favor of â€˜other jobsâ€™
content:
Lana Del Rey announces social media hiatus in favor of â€˜other jobsâ€™
Singer-songwriter Lana Del Rey recently shocked fans with her social media announcement.
The singer announced her plans in an Instagram video where she went â€œon the recordâ€ and addressed her plans.
She was also be heard saying, â€œHi guys, I just wanted to let you know that tomorrow we are going to be deactivating our social media accounts, my social media accounts. That is simply because I have so many interests, and other jobs Iâ€™m doing that require privacy and transparency.â€
She also went on to add, â€œI wanna say a heartfelt, just, thank you for continuing to see me through the music. Itâ€™s always important to be witnessed and itâ€™s also really important just to be witnessed by the people close to you that you know and who you trust."
Before concluding her announcement she added, "For right now, I think Iâ€™m going to just keep my circle a little bit closer and continue to develop some other skills and interests.â€

title: Lana Del Rey, Arcadia: il testo del nuovo singolo dall'album Blue Banisters in uscita
content:
Lana Del Rey ha utilizzato una maniera non del tutto insolita per comunicare lâ€™uscita del prossimo album â€œBlue Banistersâ€, ora fissata per il 22 ottobre. Ad anticipare i lavori del disco, un nuovo singolo dal titolo â€œ Arcadia â€. Lâ€™inedito Ã¨ stato scritto dalla cantante classe 1985, in compagnia del produttore Drew Erickson e ne Ã¨ giÃ  stato pubblicato un video sulla piattaforma di contenuti YouTube in cui, nelle vesti di direttrice e attrice, Lana Del Rey si mostra in tutta la sua semplicitÃ  e bellezza. Il suo Ã¨ uno dei come back piÃ¹ attesi della stagione, con la distribuzione del settimo album che avverÃ  tra poco piÃ¹ di un mese.
approfondimento
Lana Del Rey annuncia il nuovo album "Blue Banisters"
â€œArcadiaâ€ Ã¨ il quarto singolo estratto dal futuro disco â€œBlue Banistersâ€, insieme al brano omonimo e alle canzoni â€œText Bookâ€ e â€œWildflower Wildfireâ€. Uscito lo scorso mercoledÃ¬ 8 settembre, Lana Del Rey ha esortato i fan di tutto il mondo: â€œAscoltatelo come avete ascoltate Video Gamesâ€. Ecco il testo e il videoclip ufficiale della canzone, mentre sul sito dellâ€™artista Ã¨ giÃ  possibile il pre-order di â€œBlue Banistersâ€, che sarÃ  distribuito nei formati CD, cassetta, vinile e digitale.
Il testo di â€œArcadiaâ€

I ett TwitterinlÃ¤gg skickar den amerikanska sÃ¥ngaren och lÃ¥tskrivaren Lana en hÃ¤lsning till sin nya singel â€Lycka till lilla 'Arcadia', mÃ¥ du flyga in i hjÃ¤rtan hos de som behÃ¶ver hÃ¶ra dig.â€

LÃ¥tskrivaren och producenten Drew Erickson har tidigare arbetat med artister som The Killers, Florence + The Machine, Keith Urban och Father John Misty.

title: Lana Del Rey dÃ©voilÃ© Arcadia, nouvel extrait de son prochain album Blue Banisters
content:
Il y a peu nous vous avons proposÃ© de faire le point sur les chiffres de Donda l'album de Kanye West vs Certified Lover Boy celui de Drake, et nous allons rester dans le thÃ¨me musique internationale puisque l'on va vous parler de Lana Del Rey. Il y a quelques mois la chanteuse amÃ©ricaine nous a sorti l'album Chemtrails Over The Country Club et elle ne s'est pas reposÃ©e sur ses lauriers depuis ! En effet, elle s'apprÃªte Ã  nous sortir un tout nouveau projet : Blue Banisters, le 22 octobre prochain. Et pour nous faire patienter d'ici lÃ , elle a sorti le clip du premier extrait du projet "Arcadia".
AprÃ¨s plusieurs teasing, le morceau est enfin disponible ! Et on ne sait pas vous, mais Lana et sa voix envoutante nous ont une nouvelle fois convaincu chez melty. Contrairement Ã  ses prÃ©cÃ©dents titres, on retrouve dans "Arcadia" le cÃ´tÃ© ballade sur une instru au piano que la chanteuse apprÃ©cie tant. Visiblement, elle retourne Ã  ses premiers amours et ce n'est pas pour nous dÃ©plaire ! Quant au clip, il est tout aussi intense que le titre. Dans le reste de l'actualitÃ© musicale, on vous propose de checker dÃ©sormais le classement billboard de la semaine avec les BTS, Olivia Rodrigo, Kanye West et plein d'autres artistes encore !

title: Lana Del Rey Details New Album Blue Banisters, Shares Video New Song â€œArcadiaâ€
content:
Lana Del Rey has detailed her next studio album Blue Banisters, which finally arrives October 22. She has also shared the LPâ€™s latest single. This oneâ€™s titled â€œArcadia,â€ and Del Rey wrote and produced it with Drew Erickson. Watch Del Reyâ€™s self-directed â€œArcadiaâ€ video below.
â€œArcadiaâ€ follows three other singles the singer-songwriter released together in May: â€œBlue Banisters,â€ â€œWildflower Wildfire,â€ and â€œText Book.â€ All three songs, as well as â€œArcadia,â€ are featured on Blue Banisters. Find the albumâ€™s tracklist and artwork below.
Lana Del Rey announced Blue Banisters in late April and originally suggested it would come out July 4. She had also teased something called Rock Candy Sweet, but no other details followed.
Between 2019â€™s Norman Fucking Rockwell! and the more recent Chemtrails Over the Country Club, Lana Del Rey published Violet Bent Backwards Over the Grass, her first collection of poetry, along with an audiobook counterpart she produced with Antonoff.

title: Lana Del Rey Reveals New Release Date for 'Blue Banisters' Album
content:
Lana Del Rey has announced a new release date for â€œBlue Bannisters,â€ her second album of 2021, which was originally scheduled for July 4 but abruptly bumped days before its release. She announced the new date along with a new song, â€œArcadia,â€ which is a characteristically cinematic, orchestrated ballad loaded with California references (and opens with a definitively Lana Del Rey lyric: â€œMy body is a map of L.A.â€ Watch the video below.
The album is now scheduled for release on Oct. 22, with vinyl to follow on October 29, and along with â€œArcadiaâ€ will include the previously released songs â€œWildflower Wildfire,â€ â€œText Bookâ€ and the title track.
Just hours before the original July 4 release date, Del Rey posted on social media, â€œAlbum out later laterâ€¦ Single out soonish. Have a good fourth x,â€ alongside a preview of a music video for an unspecified new song.
Nothing if not prolific, Del Rey not only released â€œChemtrails Over the Country Clubâ€ in March and an audio book of her poetry, â€œViolet Bent Backwards Over the Grass,â€ in July of 2020. â€œBanistersâ€ is technically her eighth studio album in nine years, but sheâ€™s released several EPs and multiple stand-alone tracks over those years, as well as her 2008 debut EP, â€œKill Kill,â€ under her born name, Lizzy Grant.

title: Lana Del Rey Reveals 'Blue Banisters' Release Date, Single
content:
Lana Del Rey is gearing up to release her eighth studio album, Blue Banisters, soon. On Wednesday (Sept. 8), the singer dropped a new single from the upcoming album titled "Arcadia," along with a stunning visual to accompany the track.
The video sees Del Rey spending the majority of the visual in blue jeans and a butter yellow crop top and cardigan set as she stands next to windows -- which are overflowing with sunlight -- as she sings the melancholy, piano-driven track. The second half of the video shows the singer-songwriter lying down on a starry galaxy backdrop as scenes of Los Angeles flash against her chest. The video then abruptly cuts to clips of Del Rey dancing in what appears to be a motel room and driving in a car while a trap beat blares against a Latin trumpet instrumental.
"Good luck little 'Arcadia,' may you fly into the hearts of those who need to hear you," she tweeted. In a separate Instagram post, Del Rey thanked her album's collaborators, and used Twitter to express her gratitude for still being able to sing in light of COVID-19.

title: Lana Del Rey Teases 'Arcadia' Song
content:
Lana Del Rey is prepping her fans for her upcoming Blue Banisters album by announcing she'll release a new song "Arcadia" next week.
On Friday (Sept. 3), the singer-songwriter shared a vintage-looking portrait of herself that promised a new song with some nostalgia-inducing advice. "ARCADIA out Wednesday," she captioned the photo on Instagram before advising, "Listen to it like you listened to Video Games."
"Video Games" was the lead single on her 2012 major label debut album Born To Die and has long been considered her breakthrough hit, peaking at No. 91 on the Billboard Hot 100 for her career-first entry on the all-genre tally.

title: Lana Del Rey soaks up the sun in new 'Arcadia' music video
content:
Lana Del Rey attends the Grammy Awards in 2018. File Photo by Dennis Van Tine/UPI | License Photo
Lana Del Rey performs at an Apple Special Event in 2018. File Photo by John Angelillo/UPI | License Photo
Lana Del Rey attends the LACMA Art+Film gala in 2018. File Photo by Jim Ruymen/UPI | License Photo
Lana Del Rey, Guillermo del Toro and J.J. Abrams, from left to right, attend del Toro's Hollywood Walk of Fame ceremony in 2019. File Photo by Jim Ruymen/UPI | License Photo
Lana Del Rey released an alternate music video for "Arcadia," the latest single from her album "Blue Banisters." File Photo by Jim Ruymen/UPI | License Photo
Oct. 8 (UPI) -- Lana Del Rey is back with a new music video.
The 36-year-old singer released an alternate video for her song "Arcadia" on Thursday.
Advertisement
The new video shows Del Rey swinging outside and soaking up the sun.
"In Arcadia, Arcadia / All roads that lead to you as integral to me as arteries / That pump the blood that flows straight to the heart of me," she sings.
Del Rey released an original music video for "Arcadia" in September that shows her spending time at home.
"Arcadia" is the latest single from Del Rey's forthcoming album, Blue Banisters. The album also features the singles "Text Book," "Blue Banisters" and "Wildflower Wildfire."
Blue Banisters was originally scheduled for release in July. The album will now be released Oct. 22.
Blue Banisters will be Del Rey's second album of 2021, following Chemtrails Over the Country Club, released in March.

Une premiÃ¨re version du clip d' "Arcadia" a dÃ©jÃ  Ã©tÃ© partagÃ©e le mois dernier, et la chanteuse a maintenant proposÃ© une seconde vidÃ©o dans laquelle on peut la voir interprÃ©ter son tube sur une balanÃ§oire.
Par ailleurs, Lana a rÃ©cemment admis qu'elle avait dÃ©jÃ  Ã©crit son testament pour s'assurer qu'aucun album posthume ne soit autorisÃ© aprÃ¨s son dÃ©cÃ¨s.
Il y a quelques mois, l'interprÃ¨te de "Video Games" a effectivement partagÃ© une photo postÃ©e par le chanteur Anderson Paak sur son compte Instagram, dans laquelle on peut voir un tatouage qui stipule : "Quand je ne serai plus de ce monde, ne sortez pas d'albums posthumes ou de chansons auxquelles mon nom est attachÃ©. Ce ne sont que des dÃ©mos et le public n'est pas censÃ© les entendre."
En lÃ©gende de ce post, Lana a Ã©crit Ã  la plus grande surprise de ses nombreux abonnÃ©s : "C'est dans mon testament mais c'est aussi sur son tatouage."

title: Lana Del Rey se firma como poeta millennial do apocalipse em disco
content:
1
ReproduÃ§Ã£o Ela se diz uma "garotinha perdida", e busca algum tipo de fuga de um perÃ­odo turbulento
Em "Arcadia", Lana Del Rey apresenta seu corpo como o mapa de Los Angeles, enquanto fala de suas curvas como se fossem a serra de San Gabriel, e de suas artÃ©rias como as estradas que levam atÃ© a cidade que dÃ¡ nome Ã  mÃºsica. Ela se diz uma "garotinha perdida", e busca algum tipo de fuga de um perÃ­odo turbulento.
NÃ£o Ã© possÃ­vel saber se essa turbulÃªncia Ã© o ano e meio de pandemia, a era Trump ou apenas um relacionamento mal-sucedido. Fato Ã© que, em seu novo disco, "Blue Banisters", Lana Del Rey parece sentir que o mundo ao seu redor vai acabar a qualquer momento, indo mais a fundo no retrato melancÃ³lico e sarcÃ¡stico da decadÃªncia americana que marcou os seus Ãºltimos discos.
"Se este Ã© o fim, quero um namorado", ela canta em "Black Bathing Suit", canÃ§Ã£o que dÃ¡ o tom do Ã¡lbum, conforme ela descreve um momento de isolamento social, usando o Zoom, bebendo granadina e em que "a Ãºnica coisa que continua cabendo em mim Ã© meu roupÃ£o preto". Del Rey encara a incompatibilidade de um relacionamento enquanto fala freudianamente sobre problemas paternos.
"Blue Banisters", o segundo disco lanÃ§ado pela cantora neste ano, funciona quase como um complemento do antecessor, "Chemtrails Over the Country Club". Desta vez, ela trata um pouco mais de questÃµes pessoais, em faixas que parecem ter sido todas feitas durante o perÃ­odo de isolamento da pandemia.
Se em "Norman Fucking Rockwell", de 2019, a desilusÃ£o era com a era Trump nos Estados Unidos, agora a pandemia Ã© mais um ingrediente no apocalipse iminente que ronda a estÃ©tica de Del Rey. Mas a capacidade da compositora de capturar a melancolia millennial americana parece intacta.
Desde 2012, quando se mudou de Nova York para a CalifÃ³rnia --estado que transformou em uma espÃ©cie de musa em sua obra-- e despontou na mÃºsica, Del Rey nunca foi tÃ£o levada a sÃ©rio. No comeÃ§o, era tratada como uma espÃ©cie de piada, enquanto estourava com o pop retrÃ´ e modorrento de mÃºsicas como "Video Games" e declaraÃ§Ãµes polÃªmicas na imprensa.
Em 2017, para "Lust for Life", ela tentou se enquadrar numa sonoridade eletrÃ´nica mais moderna, com acenos para o trap e colaboraÃ§Ãµes com rappers como A$AP Rocky e Playboi Carti. Mas foi no trabalho seguinte, "Norman Fucking Rockwell", que ela enfim ganhou o aval da crÃ­tica, foi indicada ao prÃªmio de Ã¡lbum do ano no Grammy e passou a ser respeitada enquanto compositora.
Ã‰ como se do glamour melancÃ³lico e hedonista, da vida selvagem e dos excessos dos primeiros discos, tivesse sobrado apenas a melancolia, a poesia e o sarcasmo. De certa forma, a desilusÃ£o tambÃ©m acompanha boa parte de seu pÃºblico, que tambÃ©m cresceu e, quase dez anos depois, vÃª apenas a sombra de uma vida libertina e cheia de esperanÃ§as.
Com o Ã¡lbum de 2019, Del Rey foi alÃ§ada ao posto de compositora que melhor captou a angÃºstia dos Ãºltimos anos nos Estados Unidos. De fato, cheio de ironias, bom humor e referÃªncias Ã  cultura pop do paÃ­s, o Ã¡lbum traz personagens perdidos e encapsula o sentimento de estar vivo em meio aos destroÃ§os de um glamour de outrora.
Os versos de "The Greatest" sÃ£o os que mais bem representam o momento. "E eu estou perdida/ NÃ£o vÃ¡ embora, eu sÃ³ preciso que alguÃ©m me dÃª uma real/ Estou encarando a maior/ A maior perda de todas/ A cultura Ã© incrÃ­vel e, se for sÃ³ isso mesmo, eu tive meu momento/ Mas acho que estou exausta depois de tudo/ Se for sÃ³ isso, vou despedindo [...] Los Angeles estÃ¡ em chamas, estÃ¡ ficando quente/ Kanye West estÃ¡ loiro e esquecido/ 'Life On Mars' nÃ£o Ã© apenas uma mÃºsica/ Ah, a live estÃ¡ quase comeÃ§ando."
Nos dois trabalhos seguintes, Lana expande esse sentimento de desilusÃ£o sarcÃ¡stica. "White Dress", principal faixa de "Chemtrails Over the Country Club", ela soa nostÃ¡lgica enquanto canta sobre uma jovem garÃ§onete que trabalha no turno da noite. Em meio a sussurros e uma melodia crescente, lembra de bons momentos do passado --ela tem 36 anos--, como "ouvir White Stripes/ Quando eles estavam bombando/ Ouvir rock o dia inteiro."
Agora, com "Blue Banisters", Del Rey grita que nÃ£o quer viver em "Dealer", condena um homem que tenta mudÃ¡-la em "Violets For Roses" e convida o ouvinte para sua intimidade em "Wildflower Wildfire". "Meu pai nunca fazia nada quando a mulher dele brigava comigo/ EntÃ£o acabei estranha mas doce", ela canta na faixa.
Um tema recorrente da mÃºsica --e de todo o disco-- Ã© quando Del Rey tenta controlar seu lado selvagem sem apagÃ¡-lo por completo. E em meio Ã  tristeza latente, hÃ¡ a consciÃªncia de sua capacidade como artista. "E se alguÃ©m pedisse a Picasso para nÃ£o ser triste? Eu nunca saberia quem ele era ou o homem que se tornou", ela canta em "Beautiful", quando diz que consegue transformar dor em beleza.
Musicalmente, "Norman Fucking Rockwell" consegue ser mais completo, apesar de ancorado em melodias de violÃ£o e piano. Os dois Ã¡lbuns mais recentes --que certamente seriam mais interessantes caso suas faixas fossem cortadas e unidas em um Ãºnico disco-- mantÃªm o formato piano e voz, cada vez mais no estilo cantautora, mas fazendo com os discos soem maÃ§antes para o ouvinte mais desavisado.
A esta altura da carreira, o apelo de Del Rey estÃ¡ em sua voz peculiar e, principalmente, em suas letras --muito mais do que na estÃ©tica no entorno dela. Ao conseguir cantar o sentimento de um tempo, a artista se firma como uma das compositoras mais relevantes dessa decadÃªncia americana, uma espÃ©cie de poeta millennial debochada do fim do mundo.

title: New music: 5 cool albums to check out in October
content:
Here are five new albums for music fans to check out in October:
â€œBlue Banisters,â€ Lana Del Rey
The amazing singer-songwriter â€” known for such popular singles as â€œYoung and Beautiful,â€ â€œVideo Gamesâ€ and, best of all, â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ â€” is set to release her second album of 2021 on Oct. 22. â€œBlue Banistersâ€ is Del Reyâ€™s eighth album overall and follows â€œChemtrails over the Country Club,â€ which came out in March and reached as high as No. 2 on the Billboard 200.
â€œPunk,â€ Young Thug
The Atlanta rapper returns with his eagerly awaited sophomore effort, which follows the 2019 chart-topper â€œSo Much Fun.â€ The first single from the album is â€œTick Tock,â€ which was produced by Dr. Luke and Rocco Did It Again! â€œPunkâ€ is due out on Oct. 15.
â€œNew Creation,â€ Mac Powell
The Alabama native is best known for his time fronting the Grammy-winning Christian rock act Third Day, which delivered such popular offerings as â€œCall My Nameâ€ and â€œCry Out to Jesusâ€ before disbanding in 2018. Now a successful solo artist, Powell is ready for fans to check out his latest album, â€œNew Creation,â€ on Oct. 15.
â€œKing Size Manger,â€ Josh Turner
The country music star, who possesses one of the best â€” and certainly most recognizable â€” voices in the genre today, treats fans to his first-ever Christmas album. â€œKing Size Managerâ€ features such longtime seasonal favorites as â€œThe First Nowellâ€ (with the songâ€™s traditional spelling) and â€œSilent Night, Holy Nightâ€ as well as original tunes like the title cut and â€œWhat Heâ€™s Given Me.â€ Album is due out on Oct. 8.
â€œI Donâ€™t Live Here Anymore,â€ the War on Drugs
The Philadelphia indie-rock act follows such winners as 2014â€™s â€œLost in the Dreamâ€ and 2017â€™s â€œA Deeper Understandingâ€ with its fifth full-length album on Oct. 29. The first single from â€œI Donâ€™t Live Here Anymoreâ€ is â€œLiving Proof.â€

title: Lana Del Rey beschuldigt Lorde van plagiaat
content:
Lana Del Rey beweert dat Lorde melodieÃ«n van haar heeft gebruikt in nieuwe muziek. Dat meldt althans The Sun op basis van ingewijden. Volgens de Amerikaanse zangeres lijkt de muziek van Lordes nieuwe liedje Stoned at the Nail Salon verdacht veel op dat van twee van haar hits: Wild At Heart en hope is a dangerous thing for a woman like me to have.
Een bron zegt tegen de Britse krant dat Del Rey het probleem aan Lorde heeft voorgelegd. Zij kwam vervolgens met het voorstel om een percentage van de rechten van het nummer af te staan, maar daar gaat de Born To Die-zangeres niet mee akkoord. Het is haar naar verluid niet te doen om het geld, ze wil dat Lorde haar fouten publiekelijk erkent. Als ze dat weigert, dan is Lana volgens de ingewijden niet te beroerd om juridische stappen te zetten.
Lorde en Lana Del Rey lagen al eerder met elkaar in de clinch. In een interview met The Fader zei Lorde eens dat ze vindt dat Lana's muziek niet goed is voor jonge meiden. In de songteksten zou ze zich te afhankelijk opstellen tegenover mannen. "Dat wanhopige, 'laat me niet achter'- gedoe. Dat is niet goed voor jonge meisjes, zelfs niet voor jonge mensen, om te horen", zei de Nieuw-Zeelandse zangeres toen.

title: Lana Del Rey in 'bitter row' with Lorde over her refusal to admit she 'copied' songs
content:
The video will auto-play soon 8 Cancel
Get daily headlines and breaking news alerts for FREE by signing up to our newsletter Invalid Email Something went wrong, please try again later. Sign up! Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice
Lana Del Rey has become embroiled in a bitter row with New Zealand songstress Lorde.
The Summertime sadness hit-maker, 36, has called out Lorde, 24, for â€˜copyingâ€™ two of her most famous songs.
The American musician has reportedly claimed that the Royals chart-topper used her melodies in her new music.
And in a bizarre turn of events, Lorde has reportedly agreed with the claims.
Despite this, she is refusing to go public with the statement - prompting an even bigger fall-out between the two pop singers.
(Image: Getty Images) (Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)
The disagreement between Lana and Lorde has been â€˜bubbling for a whileâ€™, according to an insider.
â€œA lot of Lanaâ€™s fans had flagged one of Lordeâ€™s new songs â€œStoned At the Nail Salonâ€ online saying the melody mimicked two of her tracks â€“ Wild At Heart and Hope Is A Dangerous Thing For A Woman Like Me To Have,â€ a source told The Sun.
Following the scandal, Lanaâ€™s team took action and got an â€˜expertâ€™ involved.
After the similarities were laid bare in front of Lordeâ€™s team, they reportedly offered Lana a percentage of the publishing rights to keep things sweet between the two musicians.
(Image: Getty Images North America) (Image: Getty Images for NARAS)
â€œLanaâ€™s team agreed and after an expert got involved and some discussions were thrashed out between everyone involved, Lordeâ€™s people came back and offered Lana a percentage of the publishing rights to the song,â€ the source added.
Despite the money offer, Lana is reportedly not interested.
The Born To Die singer simply wants Lorde to acknowledge her mistakes publically.
However, if that doesnâ€™t happen, the source has claimed that the only other route to go down is for Lana to take legal action and sue her fellow music-maker.
(Image: WireImage)
â€œIt means the only last course of action would be to sue â€“ but everyone is very keen to avoid that if at all possible and hopes there can be an amicable resolution instead,â€ the music insider revealed.
â€œThe forensic experts agree with the fans, so it seems to be quite a clear cut case.â€
Although they are two of the biggest and most successful female artists in the music industry, itâ€™s not the first time Lana and Lorde havenâ€™t seen eye-to-eye.
In a previous interview with The Fader , Lorde discussed female artists she felt werenâ€™t using their platforms to uplift women and she called out Lana Del Rey specifically.
(Image: Getty Images)
Sharing her thoughts on her fellow singer, Lorde said: â€œI listened to that Lana Del Rey record and the whole time I was just thinking itâ€™s so unhealthy for young girls to be listening to, you know: â€˜Iâ€™m nothing without youâ€™.
â€œThis sort of shirt-tugging, desperate, donâ€™t leave me stuff. Thatâ€™s not a good thing for young girls, even young people, to hear.â€
The Mirror has contacted Lana Del Reyâ€™s and Lordeâ€™s representatives for comment.

Viele Fans von Lana hatten einen von Lordes neuen Songs, 'Stoned At the Nail Salon', online gemeldet und meinten, die Melodie sei zwei ihrer Tracks nachgeahmt â€“ 'Wild At Heart' und 'Hope Is A Dangerous Thing For A Woman Like Me To Have'. title: Lana del Rey embroiled in row with 'rip-off' rival Lorde over claim she copied two songs
content:
THEY say all is fair in love and war â€“ but the same can definitely not be said for the music business.
Insiders at the Ivor Novello song-writing awards told me a behind the scenes dispute is brewing between two of musicâ€™s finest female stars â€“ Lana Del Rey and Lorde.
8 Lana has accused Lorde of copying the melody of two of her songs Credit: Getty
8 Sources say Lorde has quietly agreed to the similarity behind the scenes Credit: Rex
It comes after the former accused the latter of copying the melody of two of her songs.
Such disagreements are increasingly common, but in a bizarre twist sources tell me Lorde has quietly agreed to the similarity behind the scenes â€“ but is refusing to do so publicly prompting a further fall-out.
An insider from the songwriting business explained: â€œThe disagreement between Lana and Lorde has been quietly bubbling for a while.
â€œBut nobody involved wants it to escalate further if possible.
â€œA lot of Lanaâ€™s fans had flagged one of Lordeâ€™s new songs â€œStoned At the Nail Salonâ€ online saying the melody mimicked two of her tracks â€“ Wild At Heart and Hope Is A Dangerous Thing For A Woman Like Me To Have.
â€œLanaâ€™s team agreed and after an expert got involved and some discussions were thrashed out between everyone involved, Lordeâ€™s people came back and offered Lana a percentage of the publishing rights to the song.â€
But Iâ€™m told that despite the offer, Lana isnâ€™t interested in the money â€“ simply a public acknowledgement from Lorde that the track was inspired by her.
â€œIt means the only last course of action would be to sue â€“ but everyone is very keen to avoid that if at all possible and hopes there can be an amicable resolution instead.
â€œThe forensic experts agree with the fans, so it seems to be quite a clear cut case.â€
If thereâ€™s one thing Iâ€™ve learnt in showbiz, court battles never play out nicely for anyone.
NILES: GRANDE TO TAKE JOB
ARIANA Grande has enlisted Chic's Nile Rodgers to help on her album.
The Good Times musician told me hit-maker Ryan Tedder called him to produce a track co-written by John Legend.
8 Ariana Grande has enlisted Nile Rodgers to help on her album Credit: Getty
8 Nile said: 'I canâ€™t reveal what the music is like though, thatâ€™s for her to reveal' Credit: Reuters
Nile said: â€œOver the last two weeks Iâ€™ve done pre-production for The Zuton's new album.
â€œI just finished John Legend and Ariana Grande too. Working with Ariana was great.
"Look, Ryan Tedder is such an awesome writer that when he called me and gave me the instructions I was like, â€˜Iâ€™ve got thisâ€™.
â€œI donâ€™t say that in an egotistical way. I believe its my job to take artists from this place to that place.
â€œI canâ€™t reveal what the music is like though, thatâ€™s for her to reveal.â€
CHARLIE'S A HIT WITH ELTON
AFTER teaming up on new song After All, Sir Elton John has revealed Charlie Puth now feels like one of the family.
Speaking about their collaboration from his upcoming album The Lockdown Sessions, Elton said: â€œCharlie is an amazing musician, we just hit it off.
â€œHeâ€™s become a friend and a friend of the family. Our children love him and he loves them.â€
The pair penned their track together and Elton said he loved every second of working with the US singer.
He added: â€œCharlie and I were in the studio, just the two of us.
â€œHeâ€™s got a little home set- up with his keyboards, synths, and Pro Tools.
â€œI played electric piano and actually wrote the song all the way through and then Charlie wrote the lyrics pretty quickly.
â€œHeâ€™s incredibly quick, Charlie. We just had an amazing chemistry in the studio.â€
ABBA TO ADD MORE DATES
FANS who missed out on tickets to ABBAâ€™s sell-out hologram shows next year are in luck.
Bjorn Ulvaeus has revealed the group are planning on adding more dates to the Abba Voyage gigs, which are being held at the Olympic Park in East London.
In an exclusive chat backstage at the Ivors with Apple Music 2021, he said: â€œWe might add more dates because the Abba-tars donâ€™t get tired.
â€œThey can do ten shows a day and they have no private jets and no riders. They also have no worries about their voices and stuff.â€
8 The Sun confirmed Abbaâ€™s comeback last month, which will see digital versions of the band performing
The Sun confirmed Abbaâ€™s comeback last month, which will see digital versions of Bjorn and his bandmates Agnetha Faltskog, Benny Andersson and Frida Lyngstad, perform their classic hits and new songs.
At the Ivors, Bjorn also poured cold water on the possibility of a third Mamma Mia! film.
When asked about the prospect of another instalment in the film franchise, he said: â€œI donâ€™t think there is any chance of a Mamma Mia! three.
â€œYou canâ€™t squeeze another story out of that.â€
The foursome will reunite on the opening night of the concerts next May.
They spent weeks performing in front of the cameras together to create their digital concert. But earlier this month Agnetha said she believed it would be their final project.
She said: â€œThere was a vibe, one felt, that maybe itâ€™s the last thing we do. Same thing with the album.â€
MAYA'S A DREAM GIRL LIAM PAYNEâ€™s on-again fiancÃ©e Maya Henry looked as though she was ready to call it a night after hitting London Fashion Week in this pyjama-style outfit. The US model was at Harris Reed's debut show at the Serpentine Gallery in the capital wearing the a pink silky top and trousers. Maya was flying solo without Liam, whoâ€™d been spotted out with her at a Vogue dinner earlier in the week.
BECKS'S OFF-PITCH KICKS
DAVID Beckham's style hits and misses are the stuff of legend.
But the former England captain has now admitted his four children told him he was too old to wear trainers.
8 Becks admitted his four children told him he was too old to wear trainers Credit: The Mega Agency
Becks told Vogue: â€œI put on a pair of trainers the other day and they were like, â€˜Really Dad? Do you not think you are a bit old for those?â€™
â€œI was like, â€˜No!â€™ Then I showed them 20 different pictures of me wearing other stuff and they were like, â€˜OK, maybe you canâ€™.â€
Just make sure you keep that sarong in the back of the wardrobe though Dave.
WAYNE'S BACK IN FULL FORCE
WHEN Wayne Rooney put the England shirt back on for Soccer Aid, other players may have thought heâ€™d take it easy.
But it turns out the Derby County boss didnâ€™t hold back during the match at Man Cityâ€™s Etihad Stadium.
8 The Derby County boss didnâ€™t hold back during the Soccer Aid match Credit: PA
Speaking on the RUSSELL HOWARD hour on Sky Max, TOM GRENNAN said: â€œI dropped the shoulder on Rooney a few times.
â€œThe weirdest thing after the game was him coming up to me saying, â€˜I tried kicking you a few times but I just couldnâ€™t get near youâ€™.â€
MABEL'S INTO HEAVY PETAL
MABEL often comes up smelling of roses in her choices of outfits.
But Iâ€™m not too sure about this loud floral dress she wore to Richard Quinn's show at London Fashion Week.
The Donâ€™t Call Me Up singer smiled as she arrived at the bash in the frock, complete with enormous bow and matching shoes.
On the night, she rubbed shoulders with stars including supermodel Erin O'Connor and Olympic sprinter Dina Asher-Smith.
8 The Donâ€™t Call Me Up singer smiled as she arrived at London Fashion Week in the frock, complete with enormous bow and matching shoes Credit: Getty Images - Getty
Mabel returned to the stage last month and played a storming set at Reading Festival.
It was one of the first times she did a live performance of her latest single Let Them Know, due to the Covid pandemic â€“ and I can confirm she smashed it.
The song is the first of Mabelâ€™s yet-to-be-announced second album, the follow-up to 2019â€™s High Expectations, which was the highest-charting female debut album of that year.

title: Lana Del Rey Feels She's Friends With Him and Other Dead Celebrities
content:
During an interview, Lana Del Rey said many of her closest friends are people she never met, including Elvis Presley. The King of Rock â€˜nâ€™ Roll has inspired her art on multiple occasions. In addition, she revealed sheâ€™d like to do a little more with Elvis than just take inspiration from him.
Lana Del Rey | Chelsea Lauren/WireImage
How Elvis Presley inspired Lana Del Rey
Before she adopted her current stage name, Del Rey performed under her real name Lizzy Grant. During that point in her career, she gave an interview with HuffPost where she discussed Elvis. She recalled seeing an image of him once. Immediately, she knew Elvisâ€™ songs would become her personal soundtrack. In addition, she cited Elvis as a constant influence on her work.
This was not the final time Del Rey referenced the King of Rock â€˜nâ€™ Roll. Del Rey starred in a short film called Tropico. Elvis appears as a character in the film alongside other icons like Adam, Eve, the Virgin Mary, Jesus Christ, John Wayne, and Marilyn Monroe. A snippet of the Elvis classic â€œAlways on My Mindâ€ appears near the end of the film.
RELATED: The Saga of the Lana Del Rey/Lorde Beef
Why Lana Del Rey feels so connected to dead celebrities
During an interview with Clash Music, Del Rey explained why those figures were in the film. â€œI wrote a little monologue for everyone who came to the premiere of Tropico,â€ she recalled. â€œWhen I was studying philosophy my teacher told me that itâ€™s okay to feel like the people youâ€™re closest to arenâ€™t alive anymore. Sometimes that is the best company to keep. Itâ€™s about the people that pondered the same questions as you did, and had the same sort of life mentality as you. I was upset and inspired by that premise.
â€œI knew then, really, that my closest friends would be people I have never really met before,â€ she said. â€œI was different and I didnâ€™t know many people who felt about mortality how I did. As a result, I do feel a personal connection with the icons: John Wayne, Elvis. I loved how nice Marilyn was, I related to her. Finding girls who were as loving and warm as her is hard.â€
What she would like to do with Elvis Presley if she could meet him
During an interview with Rnbjunk Musica, Del Rey said she would like to collaborate with Elvis. In the moment, she could not think of any other artist with whom sheâ€™d like to collaborate. She also said sheâ€™d like to make out with him.
RELATED: Elvis Presleyâ€™s Former Bodyguard Once Claimed the King of Rock and Roll Had a Strict Rule About Priscilla Presley â€“ And Those Who Broke It Got the â€˜Third Degreeâ€™
The interviewer joked that Elvis was her â€œmillion dollar man.â€ This is a reference to her song of the same name. Del Rey feels a connection to the â€œCanâ€™t Help Falling in Loveâ€ singer from beyond the grave and that connection is a little risque.

title: X Factor, Erio passa il turno con The greatest di Lana Del Rey. VIDEO
content:
Non ha bisogno di presentazioni, l'artista livornese Erio torna sul palco di XF2021 ( RIVEDI LA PUNTATA ) e con il carisma che lo contraddistingue strega i giudici e il pubblico, con eleganza e senza alcun tipo di sforzo regala il meglio di sÃ©. Dopo una settimana tosta per via dellâ€™eliminazione dei suoi amici Westfalia ( X Factor, gara a colpi di cover e Westfalia primi eliminati: il podcast ) di cui sente tremendamente la mancanza, cosÃ¬ come ci ha raccontato nel corso dei daily di XF, stasera ci ha regalato l'ennesima performance da dieci e lode. E lo ha fatto cantando una canzone che non conosceva, "The greatest" di Lana Del Rey: " E' la prima volta che canto qualcosa che non conosco, Ã¨ una canzone malinconica nel giusto modo, mi piace e sono contento". Del resto al suo giudice Agnelli piacciono le sfide e con Erio non ci sono confini, tutto Ã¨ possibile.
i commenti dei giudici
approfondimento
gIANMARIA spacca con il brano â€œIo sto beneâ€ dei CCCP. VIDEO
Erio chiude la seconda manche che ha portato alla seconda eliminazione della serata (Vale LP e i Karakaz sono fuori dalla competizione e tra le lacrime escono di scena), e lo fa con un'esibizione delicata e profonda davanti alla quale non si puÃ² non restare colpiti. Il suo, per dirlo con le parole di Agnelli, si chiama talento con la "t" maiuscola. Non c'Ã¨ molto altro da dire.
"Sei pericoloso, io non difendo il mio orticello, sono qui a dare umilmente un giudizio, nel tuo caso, e non voglio essere ripetitiva, continuo a vedere un grande interprete, un grande artista. Sono sincera, onesta e obiettiva", le parole di Emma.
â€œEâ€™ stato bello, hai preservato la tua magia, ma il ritornello era troppo elaborato e ho perso il gesto emotivo. Non perdere mai la tua estrema magiaâ€, dice Mika.
Complimenti spassionati anche da parte di Manuelito: â€œTi trovo poetico. Le parole non bastano, parla la musicaâ€.
â€œTu non canti Lana Del Rey, canti te stesso sulle note di Lana Del Rey. Questo Ã¨ ciÃ² che fanno i grandi interpreti", conclude Manuel Agnelli.
Arrivederci al prossimo Live di XF2021!

content: Depois de um Ã¡lbum sublime (Norman Fucking Rockwell!, 2019) e outro muito competente (Chemtrails over the Country Club, 2021), Lana Del Rey poderia facilmente reeditar a parceria com Jack Antonoff, produtor estrela que, nos Ãºltimos anos, ganhou preponderÃ¢ncia na pop. title: Lo nuevo de Tirzah, el Ãºltimo prodigio de la electrÃ³nica, el regreso de Lana del Rey y otros discos
content:
Colores en el viento
Por ÃÃ±igo LÃ³pez Palacios
La primera sensaciÃ³n es de desconcierto, hasta de preocupaciÃ³n. Â¿Por quÃ© es todo tan oscuro en Colourgrade? Â¿DÃ³nde estÃ¡n canciones como â€˜Holding Onâ€™, que destacaban en el primer Ã¡lbum de esta joven prodigio? La alegrÃ­a de su primera entrega parece haber desaparecido por completo en este segundo disco. Resulta curioso porque, por lo poco que sabemos, el estado de Ã¡nimo de Tirzah Mastin no deberÃ­a ser tan sombrÃ­o. Desde que la londinense publicÃ³ su largo de debut, Devotion, en 2018, las cosas parecen haberle ido bastante bien. El Ã©xito del disco fue enorme. Pero sobre todo fue inesperado. Sus temas tienen una instrumentaciÃ³n tan bÃ¡sica que parece esquelÃ©tica, sus ritmos se pueden hacer rascando con un bolÃ­grafo sobre una mesa y su fraseo, sentido pero arrastrado, huye del perfeccionismo vocal de las divas. Pero al mismo tiempo su timbre es tan cÃ¡lido, tan sentido, que alguien escribiÃ³ de su primer disco que tenÃ­a tanta vida como una cama deshecha.
Ese Ã©xito le llevÃ³ a girar por todo el mundo, asÃ­ que dejÃ³ su trabajo de diseÃ±adora en una agencia para dedicarse Ãºnicamente a la mÃºsica. Desde entonces, ha tenido dos niÃ±os y se ha mudado con su pareja a Sidcup, uno de esos barrios de Londres tan alejados del centro que uno tiene la impresiÃ³n de estar en una pequeÃ±a ciudad de provincias. QuerÃ­an dejar atrÃ¡s los pisos interiores de un solo dormitorio y ahora viven en una casa con jardÃ­n, cerca de una de sus hermanas. Entonces, Â¿por quÃ© suena su disco como cuando Tricky ha pillado una marihuana demasiado fuerte y le ha dado un mal viaje? QuizÃ¡ sea porque Devotion fue, en realidad, un trabajo de ediciÃ³n. Tirzah seleccionÃ³ para aquel disco canciones entre las muchas que habÃ­a compuesto durante 10 aÃ±os. ContÃ³ para ello con su amiga de infancia Mica Levi, otra artista poco convencional que saltÃ³ a la fama de forma inesperada cuando su banda sonora para Jackie, de Pablo Larrain, fue nominada al Oscar en 2017.
Este Colourgrade, sin embargo, es un disco surgido de cero en el que Tirzah y Levi han trabajado mano a mano, ademÃ¡s de contar con el vocalista Coby Sey. Los tres estuvieron de gira mientras la pandemia lo permitiÃ³ y aseguran que eso les ha convertido en un equipo estrechamente unido. Y el mundo no ha sido un lugar amable en los Ãºltimos dos aÃ±os.
La verdad es que segÃºn transcurren las escuchas desaparece esa sensaciÃ³n de tristeza y es sustituida por algo mÃ¡s complejo. Colourgrade suena a ratos fantasmagÃ³rico e intenso. Otras veces es simplemente un disco nocturno e Ã­ntimo. Ese mismo tema que antes resultaba indescifrable se convierte, de repente, en una nana, o mÃ¡s bien en la voz de una mujer que acaba de ver cÃ³mo su hijo se duerme. Se oye a Tirzah carraspear y aclararse la voz, y a Levi moviendo cosas, y es como estar en el mismo estudio viÃ©ndolas trabajar. Colourgrade, y quizÃ¡ de ahÃ­ su nombre, parece cambiar de color con cada nuevo acercamiento. Ese mismo disco Ã¡spero y monÃ³tono de la primera vez se va llenando de matices y se descubre extraordinario, valiente, personal y mÃ¡gico. QuizÃ¡ no sea el mÃ¡s adecuado para ponÃ©rselo a nadie en casa. Pero desde luego que lo es para recomendÃ¡rselo. Que cada cual lo escuche a su ritmo, poco a poco, y que decida. AquÃ­ pensamos que merece la pena.
Tirzah. â€˜Colourgradeâ€™. Domino / Music as Usual
Sincretismo atlÃ¡ntico
Por Javier Losilla
Con IIII+IIII, su debut publicado en 2017, ÃŒFÃ‰ creÃ³ un nuevo patrÃ³n de groove afrocaribeÃ±o que desafiÃ³ a las raÃ­ces tanto como a las puntas. En Ã©l, los elementos acÃºsticos y electrÃ³nicos establecÃ­an un vigoroso y sutil intercambio de cÃ³digos. ÃŒFÃ‰, aclarÃ©moslo, es el alias musical de Otura Mun, puertorriqueÃ±o afincado en Nueva Orleans desde 2020, sumo sacerdote (bÃ bÃ¡lawo) del culto de IfÃ¡, complejo sistema religioso de origen yoruba. Ahora, con 0000+0000, su nueva entrega discogrÃ¡fica, completa el ciclo abierto con IIII+IIII (ambos signos pertenecen al llamado sistema de adivinaciÃ³n de la regla de IfÃ¡). Si aquella primera apuesta simbolizaba el dÃ­a, el renacer y la claridad, esta segunda representa la noche, el mundo mÃ¡gico y tambiÃ©n la muerte. Escrito, interpretado y producido en Nueva Orleans por Otura Mun, especialista en los ritmos puertorriqueÃ±os, 0000+0000 no solo complementa conceptualmente a su predecesor; tambiÃ©n, asumiendo los hallazgos rÃ­tmicos de aquel, ensancha los caminos musicales que dibujan el mapa sonoro de la diÃ¡spora africana. Voces, tambores tradicionales, sintetizadores, piano, percusiones electrÃ³nicas, guitarra y el muy sonoro bajo de trap del Roland 808 generan un universo de difÃ­cil taxonomÃ­a, pero de resultados brillantes, en el que intervienen, reformulados, varios patrones musicales caribeÃ±os. El disco se abre con un preludio en yoruba en el que la voz cabalga sobre una nota que se repite y se cierra con un electrogÃ³spel del sexto continente, â€˜Closing Prayerâ€™, con el acompaÃ±amiento de The London Lucumi Choir. En medio, uno se topa con una revisiÃ³n de â€˜One Heart Full of Loveâ€™, del trÃ­o sesentero The Invincibles, o con trallazos como â€˜Fake Bloodâ€™, en la que el mantra â€œÂ¿QuÃ© es lo que pasa aquÃ­?â€ se va interpolando en un texto en inglÃ©s que cuestiona verdades dudosas y explicaciones oscuras. Con aportaciones de intÃ©rpretes esplendidos, de las voces de Lex, el sapeur Robby The Lord y la polacoestadounidense Lavoski a las percusiones de Bill Summers, exintegrante de los Headhunters de Herbie Hancock, 0000+0000 es la palpitante resaca musical del AtlÃ¡ntico negro del siglo XXI.
ÃŒFÃ‰. â€˜0000+0000â€². IfÃ  / Mas Um / Everlasting
Belleza sin coartada
Por Xavi Sancho
El capitalismo nos ha acostumbrado al crecimiento continuo, convenciÃ©ndonos de que no solo es posible sino incluso necesario. Lo mismo sucede con el pop: se supone que los artistas deben estar progresando, creciendo, reinventÃ¡ndose hasta reventar. Del mismo modo que el crecimiento econÃ³mico es una necesidad perentoria en Mauritania o BangladÃ©s pero no tanto en CanadÃ¡ o China, hay artistas pop con necesidad de desarrollo constante y otros que viven sin esa angustia por reformularse, por hacer un disco maduro, luego otro rejuvenecedor y despuÃ©s una colaboraciÃ³n con RosalÃ­a. Blue Banisters es un magnÃ­fico disco de Lana Del Rey. Sin coartada, sin relato y sin apuestas. Un artista es grande cuando su nuevo disco se parece a los anteriores.
Lana Del Rey. â€˜Blue Banistersâ€™. Polydor / Universal
El regreso del rey del â€˜drillâ€™
Por Beatriz G. Aranda
Tras ser nÃºmero 1 en el Reino Unido con su debut, Edna (2020), regresa el rey del drill con un disco sobre la amistad, que este londinense de 26 aÃ±os describe como un vÃ­nculo arduo en un Ã¡lbum de sonido mÃ¡s atemporal y, hecho poco habitual, sin estrellas invitadas. En â€˜Cryâ€™ y â€˜PTSDâ€™ demuestra que tambiÃ©n sabe cantar; y en â€˜2 Chainsâ€™ y â€˜Long Night in Knightsbridgeâ€™, el ritmo trap y los bajos grumosos ponen banda sonora a la precariedad emocional que implica vivir rodeado de pagans, o enemigos en la jerga del drill, subgÃ©nero estigmatizado por la diversiÃ³n violenta que practican sus seguidores (Headie One ha estado en la cÃ¡rcel cuatro veces), pero donde se concentra la escena mÃ¡s expresiva del hip hop reciente.
Headie One. â€˜Too Loyal For My Own Goodâ€™. Sony Music
Cante con un lenguaje propio
Por Carlos GarcÃ­a SimÃ³n
Es habitual que, cuando se electrifica el flamenco, el cante se quede de invitado de piedra y se limite a reproducirse casi como un sample. No es el caso del disco de Cristian de Moret: allÃ­ el cante estÃ¡ vivo. El cantaor, pianista y guitarrista elÃ©ctrico lo retuerce con conocimiento, pero a placer, para sembrarlo dentro de los nuevos mimbres armÃ³nicos a los que se lo lleva. La otra gran cosa a celebrar de este Supernova es que, en Ã©l, tambiÃ©n se retuerce el rock, que es el otro gÃ©nero protagonista del disco. Rock de guitarras y bajos pesados, severo en sus mejores partes, con herramientas de jazz fusiÃ³n y rock progresivo, y un lenguaje musical elaborado y propio. Con Cristian de Moret gana el flamenco y gana el rock.
Cristian de Moret. â€˜Supernovaâ€™. Spyro Records
Creatividad en democracia
Por YahvÃ© M. de la Cavada
Hay dos rasgos claros en Andrew Cyrille: no tiene prisa y es un jugador de equipo. ClÃ¡sico vivo y uno de los grandes bateristas del jazz, posee una personalidad enormemente creativa que no se acerca a la extravagancia ni al artificio. Su estilo, siempre original, parte de la tradiciÃ³n y llega hasta lo que cada tema necesita para hacer de la baterÃ­a mucho mÃ¡s que un instrumento eminentemente rÃ­tmico. Cinco aÃ±os despuÃ©s del debut de su cuarteto, Cyrille vuelve con un Ã¡lbum brillante, repleto de texturas, y muy marcado por la sustituciÃ³n del recientemente fallecido Richard Teitelbaum por el joven pianista David Virelles, tan protagonista como sus compaÃ±eros Bill Frisell y Ben Street en una mÃºsica en la que la democracia creativa es total.
Andrew Cyrille Quartet. â€˜The Newsâ€™. ECM / Distrijazz

content:
