Citaten i texten Ã¤r hÃ¤mtade ur Lana Del Reys lÃ¥ttexter, i tur och ordning: â€Radioâ€, â€Million dollar manâ€, â€Video gamesâ€ och â€This is what makes us girlsâ€.

title: Courtney Love Once Revealed Her Favorite Lana Del Rey Song
content:
Lana Del Rey has given the world many great songs. She once discussed her music with Courtney Love. Love said her favorite song by Del Rey was one of her earlier tracks. She didnâ€™t think Del Rey would approve of her choice.
Lana Del Rey | Chelsea Lauren/WireImage
1 of Lana Del Reyâ€™s famous songs originally sounded different
Del Rey and Love have a history together. According to a 2017 Dazed article, they toured together once. Del Rey said this was a fantastic experience for her. She compared it to owning one of Elizabeth Taylorâ€˜s diamonds. While discussing each otherâ€™s work, Love named her favorite song by Del Rey.
â€œI think my very, very favorite song of yours â€” youâ€™re not gonna like this because itâ€™s early â€” is â€˜Blue Jeans,'â€ Love said. â€œI mean, â€˜Youâ€™re so fresh to death and sick as ca-cancerâ€™? Who does that?â€
Del Rey said the original version of â€œBlue Jeansâ€ was considerably different. â€œI have to say, that track has this guy Emile Haynie all over it,â€ she recalled. â€œI remember â€˜Blue Jeansâ€™ was more of a Chris Isaak ballad and then I went in with him and it came out sounding the way it does now. I was like, â€˜Thatâ€™s the power of additional production.'â€
RELATED: Why Lana Del Rey Refuses to Sing a Line From Her Controversial Song â€˜Ultraviolenceâ€™
Courtney Love asked Lana Del Rey if a lyric from â€˜Blue Jeansâ€™ reflected her life
Del Rey gave fans more details on the creation of â€œBlue Jeans.â€ â€œThe song was on the radio in the U.K., on Radio 1, and I remember thinking, â€˜F***, that started off as a classical composition riff that I got from my composer friend, Dan Heath,'â€ she remembered. â€œIt was, like, six chords that I started singing on.â€
Love asked Del Rey if one line of the song reflected her life. â€œYou have that lyric (on the song), â€˜You were sorta punk rock, I grew up on hip-hop,'â€ she said. â€œDid you really grow up on hip-hop?â€ Del Rey responded by saying she wasnâ€™t exposed to good music until she was in high school. She didnâ€™t directly answer Loveâ€™s question.
Courtney Love | Nicholas Hunt/Getty Images
RELATED: Stevie Nicks Said Singing on This Lana Del Rey Song â€˜Changed Me Foreverâ€™
The way audiences in the United States and the United Kingdom reacted to â€˜Blue Jeansâ€™
â€œBlue Jeansâ€ wasnâ€™t much of a hit in the United States. The song did not chart on the Billboard Hot 100. On the other hand, its parent album, Born to Die, became a chart juggernaut. It reached No. 2 on the Billboard 200 and remained on the chart for a whopping 419 weeks.
â€œBlue Jeansâ€ was considerably more popular in the United Kingdom. The Official Charts Company reports the song peaked at No. 32 and remained on the chart for seven weeks. Meanwhile, Born to Die reached No. 1 in the U.K. for two of its 150 weeks on the chart. â€œBlue Jeansâ€ was a hit â€” and it clearly impressed Love.
RELATED: John Lennonâ€™s Son Said Making a Song With Lana Del Rey Changed His Life

title: All 33 from Video Games to Watercolor Eyes
content:
Lana Del Rey has changed two very important things forever â€“ the music industry and my life. The first time I heard Video Games Iâ€™d never heard anything like it. Her music has evolved over the years but one thing has remained consistent: Her storytelling is like no one else in the industry. After Norman Fucking Rockwell came out in 2019, Pitchfork named her one of the true great American songwriters and theyâ€™re absolutely correct. Sheâ€™s one of the best we have. Hereâ€™s all 33 Lana Del Rey singles, definitively ranked from worst to best.
33. Groupie Love
It knocks me sick that a song this terrible got a single release. Terribly written, tedious production and a phoned in verse from A$AP Rocky. A real low.
32. Once Upon A Dream
Listening to this snoozefest cover feels more like being asleep than actually sleeping does.
31. Summer Bummer
The single choices from Lust For Life are all over the place. I just want to talk, Lana. Cherry was right there!
30. You Must Love Me
Lana absolutely devours this Madonna Evita cover to her credit, but itâ€™s linked with Andrew Lloyd Webber â€“ and this we must not reward under any circumstances. Vocals are incredible, though.
29. Music To Watch Boys To
Play
I always think that with a name as good as Music To Watch Boys To, this should have more of a lasting impact. Itâ€™s a pleasant way to spend a few minutes, but you never come away feeling wowed or moved.
28. Dark Paradise
15 year old me would assassinate 25 year old me for putting Dark Paradise this low. Itâ€™s just the absolute pinnacle of the Born To Die era. Melodramatic, soaring, campy and not quite as well written as it should be. But it was an era. This song sounds like spending an afternoon YouTube converting songs onto your iTunes because you were too skint to be able to buy them. It sounds like reblogging pastel grunge on Tumblr. A great song, but thereâ€™s 27 greater Lana Del Rey singles ranked here.
27. Watercolor Eyes
The latest addition to the Lana Del Rey singles canon comes in the form of this Euphoria soundtrack cut â€“ clearly a leftover from the Blue Banisters sessions. That album was initially titled Rock Candy Sweet, which Lana says on this track. Itâ€™s got all the hallmarks of post-NFR Lana but doesnâ€™t quite stack up to how great her other recent singles are.
26. High By The Beach
Play
One of the most straight up POP tracks of Lanaâ€™s catalogue. Radio ready, and deserved to be a big hit. Perfect summer vibes. Itâ€™s a shame that the rest of Honeymoon doesnâ€™t have the breezy likability that High By The Beach radiates in spade loads.
25. Donâ€™t Call Me Angel
LOOK GUYS. I will die on the hill that this song slaps. I know itâ€™s objectively crap, but I canâ€™t get enough of it. Whoever dreamed up Ariana, Miley and Lana doing a song together deserves some form of knighthood. Completely bizarre and random, but I love it in all its messy glory. Lanaâ€™s curveball bridge is iconic and thereâ€™s nothing anyone can say that will make me think otherwise!
24. Lust For Life
Lana and Abel have such chemistry on this track that it makes me wish for a whole album. They exchange verses like theyâ€™ve been doing it for years. A title track thatâ€™s not really like any other songs in her discography. Dreamy. â€œMy boyfriendâ€™s back and heâ€™s cooler than ever.â€
23. Love
Play
When the posters teasing Love started going up in LA and fans were putting pictures on Twitter, thatâ€™s when I truly knew what being alive felt like. The vibes shifted with this one. Out of the dark and into the light. For a singer unfairly branded as depressing all the time, Love was something to smile about â€“ pure happiness and warmth.
22. Shades of Cool
The James Bond theme that never was. The fact weâ€™ve had the likes of Sam Smith do a Bond song and not Lana when she sits on songs like Shades of Cool is a disgrace! One of the most sprawling and hypnotic Lana Del Rey singles ranked here, Shades of Cool takes its sweet time and lets you revel in its woozy Dan Auerbach production. Ultraviolence at its best.
21. Summertime Sadness
Play
â€œKiss me hard before you goâ€ is a great line to open a song with. Summertime Sadness is a Lana staple. Everyone knows it, and with good reason. As long as that reason isnâ€™t the cursed Cedric Gervais remix, but that goes without saying.
20. Doinâ€™ Time
You know an artist has done a good job covering a song when they make it feel completely their own. Lanaâ€™s take on the Sublime classic is woozy, sun drenched, a lazy Saturday afternoon with a beer. Sublime band members themselves absolutely adore it, and thatâ€™s all the proof you need.
19. Brooklyn Baby
Ultraviolence gets dark and really goes there, but with Brooklyn Baby Lana takes us to a satire laced dream pop world of hipsters and millenials. The guitar on Brooklyn Baby is just something else â€“ completely infectious.
18. Ultraviolence
One of Lanaâ€™s most controversial songs due to its lyrical content â€“ detailing a violent relationship where the victim is still infatuated with her abuser. The criticism isnâ€™t warranted â€“ itâ€™s a song with a narrative, not an endorsement. The chorus is one of the most heavenly sheâ€™s ever sang.
17. National Anthem
Play
National Anthem stands out on Born To Die, and was clearly begging for single treatment. Outrageously catchy, full of July 4th fireworks and chanting choirs, nonsensical lyrics and a music video that is still one of the best sheâ€™s ever released.
16. Blue Jeans
The first four songs I heard from Lana were all during a 2012 YouTube binge â€“ Video Games, Born to Die, Diet Mountain Dew and Blue Jeans. I honestly donâ€™t think Iâ€™d ever heard a first verse so arresting â€“ her storytelling here, whilst a bit immature in retrospect, was just unlike anything else in contemporary music at the time. â€œYou fit me better than my favourite sweaterâ€ is still such a wow.
15. Let Me Love You Like A Woman
To me, this song feels like my mum putting her arms round me and giving me a hug. Hope that makes as much sense to you as it does to me. They should prescribe this song as a healer on the NHS. It fixes everything.
14. Born to Die
The title track of Lanaâ€™s first record is in complete contrast to Let Me Love You Like A Woman â€“ huge grandiose strings, melodrama, the unmistakable drums that defined the era. Itâ€™s a song that occasionally feels too big for a casual listen, but when youâ€™re in the mood for it itâ€™s the most blockbuster sheâ€™s ever sounded.
13. Arcadia
Play
I really canâ€™t stress enough how outstanding the songwriting is here. The first verse â€“ where Lana declares her body is a map of Los Angeles, her chest the Sierra Madre and her hips every high and byway. Itâ€™s honestly just breathtaking, and itâ€™s hard to imagine anyone else in the industry writing like this. â€œLay your hands on me like youâ€™re a Land Roverâ€ has no right being as sexy a lyric as it is.
12. Tulsa Jesus Freak
Her hyperpop Charli XCX era has arrived! The autotune! RAMP IT UP, BABY! So much to love here, a standout of Chemtrails. I really LOVE that she pronounces Arkansas wrong about 50 times on Tulsa Jesus Freak, because sheâ€™s Lana fucking Del Rey and she makes her own rules! I actually think they should change the pronunciation officially in her honour.
11. Young and Beautiful
Play
Lana Del Rey singles ranked wouldnâ€™t be complete without this little masterpiece â€“ her contribution to The Great Gatsby soundtrack (a weirdly excellent album, whilst weâ€™re here). Young and Beautiful is an absolute spectacle â€“ old Hollywood glamour and faded glory, permeating sense of doom and an orchestration to die for. The vocals on the middle eight? Unmatched.
10. Hope Is a Dangerous Thing for a Woman Like Me to Have but I Have It
The showstopping end to Norman Fucking Rockwell is the perfect way to kick off the top 10 ranked Lana Del Rey singles, because every song from here on out is a 10/10 and this song is an absolute feat. The songwriting, the simple piano, the vocal performance. Outrageous. The title alone, so long and wordy, just perfect. Favourite lyric goes to â€œHello, itâ€™s the most famous woman you know on the iPadâ€ because itâ€™s perfectly stupid.
9. Blue Banisters
Play
There is something so special and unique about Blue Banisters, and that goes for both this as the lead single and the album itself. Her songwriting has never been so fascinating â€“ the use of colour and the banisters metaphor for a broken relationship and how familial warmth is the healer feels so rich on every listen. The final act, where Lana just notes things going on around her like a diary entry, feels so full of life. Itâ€™s so visceral and familiar, but sounds nothing like sheâ€™s done before. The vocal choices she makes are inspired.
8. Ride
Play
Following up the phenomenon of Born To Die was never going to be an easy feat â€“ did Lana have longevity or was she going to be a one album wonder? Ride assured the world that she was truly the real deal, if anyone still had their doubts. Its sprawling monologue, the soulful vocal performance, the high notes of the middle eightâ€¦ A signature song if ever there was one. Just so good.
7. Chemtrails Over The Country Club
Play
A swooning and swirling masterpiece of a song that sees Lana using the light and dark shades of her vocals so wonderfully â€“ as soon as it came out, all wolfed up music video in tow, it just felt like an instant Lana classic. I love how the whole song feels like the spiralling tornado in its video â€“ it descends into a looped mania of the mundane; â€œWashing my hair, doing the laundryâ€ is sang like itâ€™s life or death and with Lanaâ€™s star quality she makes me feel like it is. Future classic.
6. West Coast
Play
The vibes were well and truly shifted when Lana Del Rey left the Born To Die era behind in favour of this woozy, psychedelic track that introduced the Ultraviolence era perfectly. I love how different the verses are to the chorus, the complete tempo change just feels so satisfying as the guitar does that little riff before it. Best bit of the song is in the final chorus is that stray burst of synth â€“ perfectly shrill as Lana dances into the flames.
5. The Greatest
Play
â€œI miss Long Beach and I miss you, babe.â€ It feels like a Bowie epic â€“ one of her most existential and timely tracks and a highlight of both Norman Fucking Rockwell and her entire career. She ended careers when she said â€œKanye West is blonde and goneâ€, no, itâ€™s true!
4. Mariners Apartment Complex
Play
The official theme tune of main characters everywhere! The ultimate reading a book in a coffee shop on your own whilst sipping a mysterious and chic coffee. TikTok almost has made this song feel comedic because of how much itâ€™s used for main character vibes but itâ€™s only so good at being used for that because the song is so brilliant. Folky, psychedlic, dream like and perfectly written.
3. Video Games
Play
The song that started it all. And over a decade later, it has never lost its ability to take my breath away. Itâ€™s the perfect introduction to everything Lana Del Rey is known for â€“ the Americana, the faded Hollywood glamour, the doomed romance. The chorus is the kind of thing artists would kill for â€“ long, overdrawn, masterful. Almost every line of Video Games feels like an iconic and timeless quote. A song that defined an era and a decade. Itâ€™s one for the Great American Songbook.
2. Venice Bitch
Only two songs outdo Video Games when it comes to Lana Del Rey singles ranked, and both of them are weird, brave and bold. Venice Bitch runs close to 10 minutes in length â€“ and not one second of it is wasted. Not one second of it do you wish there was a four minute radio edit. Itâ€™s an all encompassing world build, a moody epic of guitar and dreams of jeans and leather. Itâ€™s hard to think of another artist who could ever come up with a song like this â€“ classic rock sensibilities but with her own sharp and playful songwriting.
1. White Dress
Play
White Dress. White fucking DRESS. When I pressed play on Chemtrails Over The Country Club for the first time I could not believe my ears. Thereâ€™s something so ethereal about it â€“ from the second the piano hits, to the yearning vocals on the verses to the whispery desperation in the chorus. The raspy speed of â€œDownatthemeninmusicBUSINESSCONFERENCEâ€ is just instantly iconic. White Dress is Lanaâ€™s greatest achievement to date. All these years and albums in the industry and she is still trying new stuff and pushing her art into new heights.
What makes White Dress so special and actually quite emotional is the way that the lyrics look back at a time before her fame â€“ before she became an industry legend who literally inspired a generation of Eilishes and Lordes. It feels like the song her entire career has been building up towards. Itâ€™s for the ages.
Recommended stories by this writer:
â€¢ Erm so Lana Del Reyâ€™s Born To Die album shoot was done in Watford?
â€¢ Oh baby, baby: Here are all nine iconic Britney Spears albums ranked from worst to best
â€¢ The definitive ranking of Britney Spears music videos, based on how iconic they are

title: Lana Del Rey Gives Grammys Shout Out to Jack Antonoff and Taylor Swift
content:
Lana Del Rey was very much part of the winnerâ€™s circle at the 2022 Grammy Awards when Jack Antonoff won Sunday night (April 3) for producer of the year.
As proceedings rumbled on in Las Vegas, Antonoffâ€™s name was called out in the category for producer of the year, non-classical â€” his third consecutive nom for the award and first win.
Antonoffâ€™s trophy was reward for his impressive list of credits over the year, which include Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€œGold Rushâ€ and multiple Del Rey projects, including Chemtrails Over the Country Club.
Explore Explore Lana Del Rey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
The â€œVideo Gamesâ€ singer was quick to pay tribute to the in-demand producer and Bleachers and Fun. bandmate, by sharing a cuddly throwback pic of herself hanging with Antonoff and Swift.
â€œCongrats from us!,â€ she wrote to the 1.1 million followers of her original â€œHoneymoonâ€ Instagram account, which LDR has returned to after deactivating her other account.\
At the 64th Grammy Awards, Antonoff was up against Hit-Boy, Ricky Reed, Mike Elizondo and RogÃ©t Chahayed.
His previous Grammy wins include album of the year for his contribution to Taylor Swiftâ€™s Folklore and 1989, best rock song for St. Vincentâ€™s â€œMasseduction,â€ and several keepsakes with Fun.
During the course of his Grammy-winning production run, Antonoff broke down some of the habits of highly effective producers, himself included.
â€œIf you meet someone whom you believe you could do something valuable with â€” which is why I end up doing more than one record with some people, because itâ€™s very rare to find those connections,â€ he told Billboard. â€œHow dare you not explore that?â€

title: Jack Antonoff Wins Producer of the Year, Non-Classical at 2022 Grammys
content:
Jack Antonoff has been named Producer of the Year, Non-Classical at the 2022 Grammy Awards. Itâ€™s his third consecutive nomination for the award and first win. He was nominated alongside Hit-Boy, Ricky Reed, Mike Elizondo, and RogÃ©t Chahayed.
Antonoffâ€™s nomination this year credits his work on Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€œGold Rush,â€ Lana Del Reyâ€™s Chemtrails Over the Country Club, St. Vincentâ€™s Daddyâ€™s Home, Lordeâ€™s Solar Power, Clairoâ€™s Sling, and his Bleachers album Take the Sadness Out of Saturday Night.
In his acceptance speech, Jack Antonoff said:
This meansâ€¦ uh... fuck. Love to my family, my partner, my band, theyâ€™re all here. Besides me, thereâ€™s one other person whoâ€™s always in the studio: Thatâ€™s Laura Sisk. Sheâ€™s here; we make these records together. Get your own Jerry Maguire: I got one; I claim this victory in the name of Tyler Childs. Years ago, we met at a venue; he was playing me beats; I was playing him my demos that nobody gave a shit about, means a real lot to be here. This is for all the people who sit at home, make shit that they think is really cool, and just keep making it and just keep making it. Iâ€™m really at a loss man, sorry. Itâ€™s the coolest. It means the world to me. Thanks, guys.
His previous Grammy wins include Album of the Year twice for his work on Taylor Swiftâ€™s Folklore and 1989, Best Rock Song for St. Vincentâ€™s â€œMasseduction,â€ and, with his band Fun., Best New Artist and Song of the Year for â€œWe Are Young.â€ Heâ€™s nominated for Album of the Year with Swift again this year for his work on Evermore.
Read Pitchforkâ€™s essay about Antonoffâ€™s prolific 2021, and follow all of Pitchforkâ€™s coverage of the 2022 Grammys.

title: Pusha T Explains The Infamous Lana Del Rey Photo With White Powder
content:
When it comes to coke bars, no one delivers them quite like Pusha T. The Clipse MC has been frequently categorized as a "coke rapper," which he's embraced over the years. Ahead of the release of "Diet Coke," the rapper teased the release of new music by posting a photo of Lana Del Rey covered in a small hill of white powder, which fans presumed to be cocaine.
Kevin Winter/Getty Images
One might think of it as an insensitive publicity stunt to ramp up the hype surrounding his next album but Push explained that there's a deeper sentiment behind the picture. According to the G.O.O.D Music president, there are plenty of parallels between the worlds that he and Lana Del Rey navigate musically.
"Musically, I think Lana Del Rey speaks to the same subject matter, but just on different ends of it,â€ he told Rolling Stone. â€œYou can hear remnants of drug indulgence and addiction. So itâ€™s like, â€˜Man, why not?â€™ I thought it made sense.â€
Neither have worked together but it seems to be a possibility down the line. Push revealed that someone from Interscope reached out to him in hopes that he'd jump on a remix to one of her songs.
"One of the heads of Interscope called right after the picture came out and asked me to get on a remix,â€ he continued with a laugh. â€œI forgot which song, but Iâ€™m still waiting for them to send it over.â€
Earlier this week, Pusha Treleased the "Spicy Fish Diss" for Arby's new fish sandwich in their latest promo campaign.
[Via]

title: London-based musician MR WA7T on working Beyonce and releasing debut album
content:
A Northern Irish artist and producer who has worked with Beyonce, Missy Elliott and Lana Del Rey has told how his debut album helped him process familial trauma and hurt around his sexuality and coming out as gay.
London-based MR WA7T â€” real name Ian Watt â€” has spent years in the music industry remixing and producing for some of the worldâ€™s biggest stars.
But when a family crisis at home reignited past hurt around his familyâ€™s struggles to accept he was gay, he decided to launch his career as an independent recording artist, releasing his debut solo album No Thread Leads Back to the Heart this week.
The nine-track album follows the release of two singles Home and Sleeping like a Star.
The inspiration for the album came after Watt returned to Northern Ireland to support his sister when she was ill.
While back home, difficult issues Watt thought he had dealt with when heâ€™d moved away to live in London and Glasgow, resurfaced.
In his hotel room, he wrote a collection of songs in a "haze of booze and pills".
After returning to London, Watt realised that he had an album of songs at hand which dealt with trauma caused by his motherâ€™s struggle to accept him as a gay man.
â€œAll these things I thought Iâ€™d dealt with started coming to the surface,â€ Watt said.
â€œBut it turned out I hadnâ€™t come to terms with anything.
â€œAs much as the record is about my sister, itâ€™s about my mother and having a bad childhood.
â€œAll these things seem to run in parallel.â€
The track Home sees the singer and producer battle with his mumâ€™s angry reaction to him coming out.
â€œMe and my mum were really close and there was a lot of love there, but I just remember her asking me to tell her it wasnâ€™t real,â€ he said.
â€œShe was really angry and almost went to throw up.
"She just couldnâ€™t deal with it at all,â€ Watt concluded.
Another track, Only He Knows, is dedicated to his partner of 20 years, while These Are My People is a celebration of community and chosen family.
â€œI turned 50 and when I think of my generation of gay men, thereâ€™s a lot of my friends who arenâ€™t around anymore,â€ Watt said.
â€œWhen I go home, I still get looks from people I went to school with and still get called a poof.
"If you didnâ€™t get that acceptance and love as a kid, you create it later on in life.
â€œThese Are My People is for those people.
"Itâ€™s about our little community.â€

title: Lana Del Rey 'Coke Necklace' TikTok Virality Explained by Experts
content:
A discontinued necklace once sold as Lana Del Rey merchandise has grown popular on TikTok.
People have compared it to one famously worn by Sarah Michelle Gellar in "Cruel Intentions."
Fans and experts say a number of factors have contributed to the necklace's virality.
Over 3 million people read Morning Brew ; you should too! Loading Something is loading. Email address By clicking â€˜Sign upâ€™, you agree to receive marketing emails from Insider as well as other partner offers and accept our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
At least five years ago, singer Lana Del Rey released a necklace as a part of her merchandise collection. Despite the fact that it's been discontinued for years, it's recently grown popular online â€” especially on TikTok.
The necklace is a rosary chain with a golden heart attached to it which unscrews into a little spoon. To some, it's reminiscent of the cross-shaped necklace worn by Sarah Michelle Gellar's character Kathryn in the 1999 movie "Cruel Intentions," in which it's used to store cocaine. Del Rey has never alluded to this reference, and her representatives did not respond to Insider's request for comment.
The exact origins of the necklace are hard to pin down. In 2017, when Lana was promoting her album "Lust for Life," the item ended up on Del Rey's official online merch store, as reported by Refinery29. But according to a conversation on a Lana Del Rey fan forum, some people remember the necklace being available to purchase at merchandise stands as far back as 2015, during Del Rey's "Endless Summer" tour.
It is no longer listed on her official sites, but some of the supposedly original necklaces are available to purchase for up to Â£1,000 (around $1,200) on platforms such as Depop or eBay, with unofficial replicas costing up to Â£150 ($187).
Over the past year, TikTok videos featuring the necklace have view counts ranging from a few thousand up to several million, with many colloquially referring to it as the "coke necklace." Users include various different hashtags in their videos; #lanadelreynecklace alone has over 20 million views.
Experts and fans told Insider the necklace's popularity on TikTok is complex, linked to the inferences fans make about its intended use, and current aesthetic trends dominating the app.
The necklace feeds into various trends currently popular on TikTok, users said
Anna Zhang told Insider she bought the necklace for $133 in November 2021, from a website called outoftheboxxx.com which no longer appears to be active. She often posts about the necklace and noticed Del Rey songs frequently go viral on TikTok, which she thinks has added to the necklace's popularity.
"Queen of Disaster," an unreleased Del Rey song recorded in 2011 and leaked in 2013, for example, blew up on TikTok in 2020, with the associated hashtag receiving over 30 million views. The song is also often used in videos about the necklace.
Kate Turner, who said she bought her necklace on Depop for Â£250 ($313) in 2021, agrees a passionate fandom for Del Rey on TikTok could be playing a role in the item's popularity. She has a simple reason for posting about hers, telling Insider it's because "a lot" of her followers are huge Del Rey fans.
But Zhang believes there's more to it than that, saying the necklace matches an aesthetic that's currently "huge on TikTok," which she described as "hyper-feminine," "coquette," and "full of heart and floral patterns."
Journalist and former LA Times columnist Art Tavana, who is currently writing a book about Del Rey, thinks there is a connection between the necklace's virality and another TikTok obsession â€” the HBO teen drama "Euphoria."
The show, which is a source of inspiration for many TikTokers, follows the lives of modern-day high-school students, who often use alcohol and drugs, which are also themes in a lot of Del Rey's music. Recently, the singer contributed an original song to the series.
"'Euphoria' captures the same elements that made Del Rey so alluring to her fans," Tavana told Insider. "The 'coke necklace' symbolizes that. TikTok just makes that message glitter."
Dr Kate Ngai is a lecturer at Glasgow Caledonian University, Scotland, specializing in fan culture. She told Insider that the necklace is seen as "edgy and provocative."
"The reason behind the necklace going viral is the same reason it appealed to Del Rey's fans first â€” the nostalgic vibe, vintage aesthetic, a little bit of darkness to it," she said.
The popularity of a "vintage aesthetic" on TikTok may be contributing to the necklace's virality. NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images
Experts believe the necklace's popularity on TikTok is boosted by the subtlety of its significance
Dr Bethan Jones, whose academic research focuses on pop-culture fandom, told Insider that the unusual nature of a necklace as merch may be partly what's driving its popularity.
"Fans will be familiar with items of clothing, rare edition CDs or vinyl, and the badges or stickers that are common pieces of merchandise, especially at concerts. Jewelry, on the other hand, is something that stands out," she said.
Ngai agreed that part of the appeal of the necklace is that it allows people to "be a part of the fandom without being obvious about it."
She told Insider she also thinks part of the necklace's breakthrough popularity is down to it looking similar to the necklace in "Cruel Intentions," and causing some controversy on social media as a result, with some Twitter users calling the item "irresponsible."
"Stories talking about that in the media meant that the necklace circulated beyond the fandom so more people were aware of the necklace," Ngai said. "While they might not be Lana Del Rey fans, they might be attracted to the necklace for aesthetic reasons."
For more stories like this, check out coverage from Insider's Digital Culture team here.

title: Lana Del Rey annonce du nouveau son "en colÃ¨re"
content:
Lana Del Rey a annoncÃ© un nouvel album qui ne mÃ¢chera vraisemblablement pas ses mots. L'interprÃ¨te de "Born to die" a effectivement Ã©voquÃ© ses prochaines chansons auprÃ¨s du magazine W, admettant que ce nouveau son sera sans filtres et honnÃªte.
"J'ai essayÃ© ce nouveau style de chanson mÃ©ditative sans aucun filtre" a-t-elle confiÃ©. "Ã‡a n'est pas parfait, Ã©videmment. Il y a des pauses et je marmonne."
La star a Ã©galement avouÃ© qu'elle envoie rÃ©guliÃ¨rement ces titres sans filtres Ã  son producteur et parolier Drew Erickson, avec qui elle a dÃ©jÃ  collaborÃ© sur son album "Blue Banisters" paru l'annÃ©e derniÃ¨re.
"Il ajoute un orchestre sous les mots, trouve la musique pour chaque syllabe et ajoute de la texture Ã  ma voix" a poursuivi Lana.
Quant aux thÃ¨me de son prochain album, Lana a affirmÃ© qu'ils seraient bien moins doux que ceux de son prÃ©cÃ©dent disque.
"C'est bien plus du genre : je suis en colÃ¨re" a-t-elle expliquÃ©. "Les chansons sont trÃ¨s conversationnelles. C'est un album trÃ¨s complexe. Il n'y a pas de couleur. C'est comme si je transcris mon esprit."
Durant cette mÃªme interview, Lana a Ã©voquÃ© les poÃ¨tes qui l'inspirent.
"Je me vois beaucoup dans le travail de Walt Whitman et Sylvia Plath" a-t-elle confiÃ©. "Elle Ã©crivant avec honnÃªtetÃ© quant Ã  l'expÃ©rience d'une femme."

title: Lana Del Rey Says This â€˜Honeymoonâ€™ Track Makes Her Cry
content:
Lana Del Rey is known for her emotional, vulnerable lyrics, and in a new conversation with Gucci creative director Alessandro Michele for W Magazine, she shared which of her stirring songs makes her cry.
The singer revealed that her Honeymoon track â€œSwan Songâ€ gets her misty-eyed. â€œPut your white tennis shoes on and follow me / Why work so hard when you could just be free? / You got your moment now, you got your legacy / Letâ€™s leave the world for the ones who change everything,â€ she sings in the opening verse of the 2015 song.
Explore Explore Lana Del Rey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
â€œItâ€™s the antithesis of hopefulness,â€ Del Rey told Michele. â€œItâ€™s about trying to find beauty in giving up. If I had my way, I would continue to persist in all areas of my life, but it can be quite challenging because I can be too trusting too soon. The burn that can come from that really can incinerate your whole thinking life and your daily processes. At the end of every album, I say goodbye and thank youâ€”very Old Hollywood styleâ€”and yet I cannot help but just continue to write.â€
Speaking of Old Hollywood, she said her grandparents are the reason for her love of the classic era. â€œWhen I was younger, my grandparents would let me watch their old movies, and I related to the subtle nuances of the female characters,â€ Del Rey explained. â€œNot much needed to be said; a lot was inferred between the lines. When things got bigger for me and my career, I always assumed that just by me speaking and being myself, people would know who I was inherently. I learned that was not true. You had to really spell things out, and that was very hard for me.â€
Del Rey also shared that sheâ€™s working on some new music for an untitled album still in the works, set to follow up her 2021 album Chemtrails Over the Country Club. She told Michele that the upcoming LP will be different than her previously released music. â€œIâ€™m angry,â€ she said. â€œThe songs are very conversational. For the first song, I pressed record and sang, â€˜When I look back, tracing fingertips over plastic bags, I think I wish I could extrapolate some small intention or maybe get your attention for a minute or two.â€™ Itâ€™s a very wordy album. So thereâ€™s no room for color. Itâ€™s almost like Iâ€™m typing in my mind.â€
Read the full interview here.

title: Lana Del Rey and Jack Donoghue Fuel Romance Rumors With Jail Visit
content:
Watch : Lana Del Rey & Sean Larkin Split After 6 Months of Dating
Lana Del Rey and Jack Donoghue just added fuel to the fire when it comes to their romance rumors.
The "Born to Die" singer and Salem band member posed together outside the Cook County Jail in Chicago in a July 12 Instagram post shared to Jack's page. He captioned the photo series, "family visit."
While it's unclear why the pair stopped by the facility, these two appear to be spending more time together.
Back in February, Lana and Jack sparked romance speculation when he shared a since-deleted video of himself and Lana at a monster truck race, per People. And fan theories grew even stronger when photos of Lana at Jack's birthday circulated on the internet in May.
Prior to being linked to Jack, Lana was reportedly engaged to Clayton Johnson. Back in December 2020, a source told US Weekly that Clayton had popped the question. However, it's still unclear exactly when the proposal happened.
Despite being spotted with a diamond ring on that finger, Lana remained tight-lipped during the course of this romance.

title: Lana Del Rey, make bold moves
content:
CELEBRITIES BORN ON THIS DAY: Lana Del Rey, 37; Prince William, 40; Chris Pratt, 43; Juliette Lewis, 49.
Happy Birthday: Make a lasting impression, knock the ball out of the park, be proud of what you accomplish and take on a leadership position. Acting courageously and making bold moves will help you get your life in gear and headed in the desired direction. Pay attention to risk factors, and counter whatever comes your way with precision and confidence. Your numbers are 7, 12, 19, 28, 31, 37, 40.
ARIES (March 21-April 19): Keep your life simple, conversations honest and promises doable. A unique alternative will prove helpful when faced with a challenge that requires discretion, responsibility and honesty. Make financial gains, new beginnings and personal growth your priorities. 3 stars
TAURUS (April 20-May 20): Channel your energy, and finish what you start. A change will impact the way you take care of matters. Think about the possibilities, but donâ€™t make unrealistic promises. Gauge the time it will take and the cost involved before you commit. 3 stars
GEMINI (May 21-June 20): Smile and make your entrance. Preparation will pay off and encourage you to take a bold approach to get your way. Stick to the truth, and recognize when someone isnâ€™t being honest with you. Call the shots and control the situation. 4 stars
CANCER (June 21-July 22): Slow down, take a deep breath and plan your actions with precision and detail. Bring attention to whatâ€™s important to you, and establish how to get things done with the least amount of difficulty. Choose your battles wisely. Self-improvement is favored. 2 stars
LEO (July 23-Aug. 22): Set out on a discovery mission, and donâ€™t stop until you get answers. What you uncover will help you assess your direction and distance yourself from anyone trying to manipulate you. Use your intelligence and insight to your advantage. 5 stars
VIRGO (Aug. 23-Sept. 22): Monitor what goes in and out of your financial accounts. Donâ€™t take on too much or limit what you can do because youâ€™ve promised to help others. Being honest with everyone will help you maintain your plans without interference. 3 stars
LIBRA (Sept. 23-Oct. 22): Think matters through. Refuse to let your emotions interfere and cause havoc to your plans and relationship with a friend, relative or peer. Take a cautious approach when dealing with investments. 3 stars
SCORPIO (Oct. 23-Nov. 21): Look at how others do things before you decide to participate. Donâ€™t labor over something you cannot change. If something doesnâ€™t feel right or fit into your plans, take a pass and keep moving in a direction that suits you. 3 stars
SAGITTARIUS (Nov. 22-Dec. 21): Donâ€™t lose sight of your objective or let someone meddle with your plans. Concentrate on whatâ€™s important to you and the changes you want to make at home to ease stress and make your surroundings more comfortable. 5 stars
CAPRICORN (Dec. 22-Jan. 19): Think before making a move or saying something youâ€™ll regret. Pay attention and make decisions that will ease stress and simplify your life instead of causing unnecessary financial worry. Donâ€™t let a problem with a friend, relative or peer hold you back. 2 stars
AQUARIUS (Jan. 20-Feb. 18): Set your sights and mind on a challenge, and donâ€™t stop until you are happy. Use experience, knowledge and basic instincts to overcome setbacks others cause. Protect your health and reputation. Put your valuables in a safe place. 4 stars
PISCES (Feb. 19-March 20): A home improvement plan will keep you out of trouble. Donâ€™t argue with someone who doesnâ€™t see things your way. Go about your business and do things that please you. A change will help you put things in perspective. 3 stars
Birthday Baby: You are optimistic, pioneering and sensitive. You are unique and helpful.
1 star: Avoid conflicts; work behind the scenes. 2 stars: You can accomplish, but donâ€™t rely on others. 3 stars: Focus and youâ€™ll reach your goals. 4 stars: Aim high; start new projects. 5 stars: Nothing can stop you; go for gold.

title: Father John Misty Releases Lana Del Reyâ€™s â€œBuddyâ€™s Rendezvousâ€ Cover: Listen
content: â€œBuddyâ€™s Rendezvousâ€ is a world unto itself. It is a place out of time. My dream for the video is that it would surrender itself to the power of the song. An unnamed man (played by Craig Stark), fresh out of jail and down on his luck makes his way across the fractured landscape of Los Angeles to meet his daughter (played by Arrow DeWilde). All the while he is beset by memories of a more innocent time. Despite her hesitance, his daughter and her boyfriend (played by Gilbert Trejo) agree to meet her father and find moments of sadness and sparks of tenderness in the connection made. Although the video and the song can be considered love letters to Los Angeles, the themes are universal. Disappointments, regrets, forgiveness, tenderness, perseverance, and love. The incredible performances by Arrow, Craig, Gilbert, and David Haley all coalesce to bring this vision to life. Cinematography by James Wall on 16mm evokes the down and out feeling of L.A., merging past and present. This video could not have been accomplished without the talent of producer Bria Little and creative director and editor Jonathan King.

title: Trending Up: Shania Twain, Beabadoobee & Lana Del Rey
content:
Welcome to Billboard Proâ€™s Trending Up column, where we take a closer look at the songs, artists, curiosities and trends that have caught the music industryâ€™s attention. Some have come out of nowhere, others have taken months to catch on, and all of them could become ubiquitous in the blink of a TikTok clip.
This week: Shania Twainâ€™s recently released Netflix documentary nets a consumption boost for her catalog, alt-pop darling Beabadoobee picks up buzz with a new track and Lana Del Rey lends the all-too-appropriate perennial soundtrack for the dog days of summer.
OK, So Youâ€™ve Got a New Documentary: Shania Twain Catalog Gets â€˜Not Just a Girlâ€™ Bump
Shania Twainâ€™s impressive back catalog of country-pop gems has been a reliable performer on streaming services, but her entire discography got an extra bump last week following the July 26 release of her new Netflix documentary Not Just a Girl. The doc, which also came with an accompanying 17-track Not Just a Girl (The Highlights) compilation â€“ featuring one new song in the setâ€™s title track â€“ resulted in a 47.4% gain in official U.S. on-demand streams (to 12.6 million) and 147.6% gain in U.S. digital sales (to 12,000) for her catalog in the tracking week ending Aug. 4, according to Luminate.
Some of the biggest gains for individual songs in her catalog include Come on Over classics â€œThat Donâ€™t Impress Me Muchâ€ (up 83.4% in official U.S. on-demand streams to just over one million), â€œYouâ€™re Still the Oneâ€ (up 31% to 1.3 million) and â€œMan! I Feel Like a Womanâ€ (up 21% to 1.9 million). The collective bump for these singles is enough to send her Greatest Hits set back onto the Billboard 200 albums chart, where it re-enters at No. 95 this week (chart dated Aug. 13) â€“ the compilationâ€™s highest ranking on the chart since May 21, 2011 â€“ a testament to the Canadian crossover superstar still having the touch decades after her commercial peak. â€“ ANDREW UNTERBERGER
Beabadoobee and TikTok: A Perfect Pair
â€œYou ought to know that/ I think weâ€™re one and the same,â€ Beabadoobee sings to open her lilting, bossa nova-flavored track â€œThe Perfect Pair.â€ Itâ€™s a fitting line for a 22-year-old whoâ€™s fashioned an impressive career as an alt-pop singer-songwriter, but who some top 40 listeners may know only via a hip-hop sample: the hook to Beabadoobeeâ€™s 2017 debut single â€œCoffeeâ€ was repurposed for Powfuâ€™s 2019 track â€œDeath Bed (Coffee For Your Head),â€ which became an early TikTok success story and climbed to No. 23 on the Billboard Hot 100.
Beabadoobeeâ€™s jangly, indie-rock-leaning 2020 debut album Fake It Flowers earned critical acclaim, but didnâ€™t produce a hit to build upon the unexpected momentum of â€œDeath Bed.â€ Two years later, however, â€œThe Perfect Pairâ€ â€“ from her more experimental sophomore LP Beatopia â€“ may prove to be that follow-up: the track has started taking off on TikTok, with a series of clips utilizing that opening line in a variety of ways, from before-and-after makeup tutorials to virtual duets.
â€œThe Perfect Pairâ€ earned nearly 910,000 U.S. on-demand streams between the week of July 29 and Aug. 4 â€“ a 71 percent jump from the previous week, according to Luminate â€“ and, if it keeps rising at this velocity, could give Beabadoobee her first Hot 100 hit as an unaccompanied solo artist. â€“ JASON LIPSHUTZ
â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ Heats Up
Summertime pop music used to mean the carefree melodies of early Beach Boys or the nostalgic vibing of DJ Jazzy Jeff & The Fresh Prince â€“ but with the oppressive heat waves sweeping the globe in 2022, likely to get worse before they get better, itâ€™s not surprising folks are turning a different kind of warm-weather pop.
Lana Del Reyâ€™s Cedric Gervais-remixed â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ marked her top 40 breakthrough back 2013, peaking at No. 6 on the Billboard Hot 100 that September, and it looks like itâ€™s coming back in 2022 as something of a seasonal perennial. The song has slowly climbed in U.S. on-demand audio streams all summer, from just under 2 million for the tracking ending June 16 to over 3.2 million in the most tracking week ending Aug. 4, according to Luminate â€“ a 64% gain in all. (The trend has not yet extended to Del Reyâ€™s Lust For Life cut â€œSummer Bummer,â€ which has remained relatively steady in streams all season â€“ maybe a trend for next year, if conditions get even worse.) â€“ AU

title: Stalker van Lana Del Rey krijgt contactverbod opgelegd
content:
Een stalker van Lana Del Rey heeft door de rechter een tijdelijk contactverbod opgelegd gekregen. Volgens entertainmentwebsite TMZ had de man meerdere keren het terrein van de zangeres betreden en heeft hij bovendien geprobeerd om haar auto te stelen.
Volgens de zangeres heeft de man haar minstens twee keer bij haar woning bezocht. De eerste keer was in februari. Hij zou toen ook haar auto hebben gekraakt en ermee zijn weggereden. Eerder deze maand was het opnieuw raak. De man zou naar de woning van Del Rey zijn teruggekeerd, waar hij een tas zou hebben achtergelaten met een briefje waarop stond dat hij haar vaker wou zien.
Daarnaast zou de man via sms contact hebben gehad met de zus van de zangeres. Het is niet duidelijk hoe de man aan dat nummer is gekomen.
Del Rey vreest voor haar veiligheid en voor die van haar familie en eist daarom een contactverbod. De rechter heeft besloten dat de man de komende tijd bij haar uit de buurt moet blijven. Hij mag ook geen contact opnemen met de broer en zus van de artieste. Een volgende zitting staat gepland voor augustus.

title: Taylor Swift's 'I Knew You Were Trouble' Video Was Inspired by Lana Del Rey's 'Ride'
content:
Taylor Swiftâ€˜s â€œI Knew You Were Troubleâ€ was a massive success. The music video for Lana Del Reyâ€™s â€œRideâ€ inspired Swiftâ€™s video. Subsequently, the director of â€œI Knew You Were Troubleâ€ discussed Swiftâ€™s acting.
Taylor Swift | Mat Hayward/GC Images
Lana Del Reyâ€™s â€˜Rideâ€™ was directed by someone who loved Americana as much as Del Rey herself
Anthony Mandler is a music video director. He directed videos for hits such as Rihannaâ€™s â€œDiamondsâ€ and Nicki Minajâ€™s â€œStarships.â€ In 2012, he directed the music video for Del Reyâ€™s â€œRide.â€ During a 2012 interview with Rolling Stone, Del Rey explained the origin of the video.
â€œAfter years of staying true to my own artistic visions, I met Anthony Mandler, who shared my love of all things dark and beautiful and understood my passion and revery for the country that America used to be,â€ she said. â€œHeâ€™s helped me to bring the visions of my imagination to life and tell my different life stories through film.â€
Lana Del Rey | Jason Kempin / Staff
RELATED: Katy Perry Once Called 1 of Taylor Swiftâ€™s Songs â€˜Perfectâ€™
A director named some of the videos that inspired Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€˜I Knew You Were Troubleâ€™
During a 2012 interview with MTV News, Mandler discussed directing the video for Swiftâ€™s â€œI Knew You Were Trouble.â€ He said he drew inspiration from his previous videos, including â€œRide,â€ The Killersâ€™ â€œWhen You Were Young,â€ and Museâ€™s â€œMadness.â€ Notably, â€œRideâ€ and â€œI Knew You Were Troubleâ€ open and close with dramatic monologues.
Mandler praised Swiftâ€™s acting in â€œI Knew You Were Trouble.â€ â€œShe really stepped into this character, she became this girl,â€ Mandler said. â€œShe was able to embrace this journey and let go of Taylor Swift for a couple days and be somebody else. She was 100% in.â€
Mandler discussed how the monologues from â€œI Knew You Were Troubleâ€ came together. â€œAt the end of the shoot, we sat in the car and kind of riffed lines back and forth,â€ he recalled. â€œI wanted to do it right after the shoot was over so she was in that headspace, and just let her talk free-form, and then I organized it later on and cut it together. And I was amazed by just how well she understood this character.â€
RELATED: A$AP Rocky Once Said Lana Del Rey Was His â€˜Dream Girlâ€™ and He Made Songs With Her
How Lana Del Reyâ€™s â€˜Rideâ€™ and Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€˜I Knew You Were Troubleâ€™ performed on the pop charts in the United States
â€œRideâ€ did not chart on the Billboard Hot 100. Its parent EP, Paradise, became far more popular. It peaked at No. 10 on the Billboard 200 and stayed on the chart for 55 weeks.
â€œI Knew You Were Troubleâ€ became a massive hit. It hit No. 2 on the Billboard Hot 100, remaining on the chart for 36 weeks. Swift included it on the album Red. The album reached No. 1 for seven of its 185 weeks on the Billboard 200.
â€œRideâ€ wasnâ€™t a chart juggernaut â€” but its video influenced the video for â€œI Knew You Were Trouble.â€
RELATED: Paul McCartney Told Taylor Swift This Elvis Presley Hit Cured a Headache

title: Taylor Swift Reveals Full Track List for Midnights, Out This Month
content:
Taylor Swift has revealed the titles of all songs on her upcoming album Midnights, set to be released at midnight on Oct. 21.
Side A will have these songs:

Snow On The Beach featuring Lana Del Rey

Midnight Rain
Side B:

Labyrinth
Karma
Sweet Nothing
Mastermind
In a video posted on Instagram, Swift described the song Lavender Haze as being about the act of ignoring all the people trying to pull you out of the real feelings of being in love.
Swift announced upcoming album Midnights in August, describing it as "the stories of 13 sleepless nights scattered throughout my life."

title: Taylor Swift werkt op nieuw album samen met Lana Del Rey
content:
Taylor Swift heeft bevestigd dat ze muziek heeft opgenomen met Lana Del Rey. De twee zangeressen zijn op haar nieuwe album Midnights samen te horen op het nummer Snow On The Beach.
Swift heeft de tracklist voor haar nieuwe album, dat op 21 oktober uitkomt, bekendgemaakt op TikTok. Midnights wordt het tiende studioalbum van de Amerikaanse singer-songwriter.
Vorig jaar bracht Swift haar twee albums Fearless en Red opnieuw uit, als resultaat van een geschil over rechten met haar voormalige platenmaatschappij.

title: Taylor Swift Reveals New Album Midnightsâ€™ Full Tracklist, Including New Song With Lana Del Rey
content:
Taylor Swift has revealed the full tracklist of her new album, Midnights. After sharing several song titles via TikTok in recent weeks, Swift revealed the final track titles overnight, including one, â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ which features Lana Del Rey. See the full tracklist below.
Swift announced Midnights at the end of August, while accepting the award for Video of the Year at MTVâ€™s Video Music Awards. Sheâ€™s described the album as â€œthe stories of 13 sleepless nights scattered throughout [her] life.â€ Midnights is out on October 21.
The record includes a song called â€œKarma,â€ a title that has spawned speculative fan theories for the past six years. Some of them posited that Swift had recorded a secret album by that name amid her 2016 feud with Kanye West and Kim Kardashian.
Midnights is the first album of all-new material from Swift since she issued Evermore at the end of 2020. Between those projects, sheâ€™s released the re-recorded â€œTaylorâ€™s Versionsâ€ of 2012â€™s Red and 2008â€™s Fearless. Evermore was also Swiftâ€™s second album of 2020, arriving less than six months after Folklore. Swift announced both on short notice. In mid-September, Swift confirmed that Jack Antonoff, whoâ€™d worked on Folklore and co-produced Evermoreâ€™s â€œGold Rush,â€ worked with her again on Midnights.
As part of the rollout for Red (Taylorâ€™s Version), Swift released a 10-minute version of her song â€œAll Too Wellâ€ with a short film. Swift directed the visual companion herself, and Stranger Thingsâ€™ Sadie Sink appears as Swiftâ€™s analog alongside Dylan Oâ€™Brien. Swiftâ€™s Video of the Year win at the VMAsâ€”her thirdâ€”set a new record for the ceremonyâ€™s highest honor. Swift picked up additional trophies for Best Direction and Best Longform Video. â€œAll Too Wellâ€ is eligible for a Best Live-Action Short Film Academy Award, but those nominations wonâ€™t be announced until late January. The single itself set a Billboard record for the longest No. 1 song.
Swift has not yet announced which of her previous records will be next in her campaign to re-record all of her material in order to regain control over her master recordings. She revealed the undertaking in the summer of 2019 as she publicly reckoned with Scooter Braun selling the rights to her master recordings, allegedly without her involvement. In a September interview with NPR, Braun said that he had some â€œregretsâ€ over how the situation played out.

title: Taylor Swift Confirms Lana Del Rey Will Feature on â€˜Midnightsâ€™
content:
Taylor Swiftâ€™s hero Lana Del Rey will appear on her forthcoming album, Midnights.
The big reveal came as Swift dropped the LPâ€™s remaining track titles through the night, starting with No. 9, â€œLavender Hazeâ€ (a name inspired by Mad Men, we learned).
Swift has kept her fans glued to her Tiktok account in recent weeks, as sheâ€™s drip-fed the song titles by way of a ballgame, â€œMidnights Mayhem With Meâ€.
When she spins the bingo cage, and retrieves a numbered ball, she then reveals the corresponding track title.
Itâ€™s a simple game, but effective with Swifties, as each video accumulates millions of views.
The balls kept dropping from midnight. Track 5 is called â€œYouâ€™re on Your Own, Kid, track 10 is â€œLabyrinth;â€ track 12 is â€œSweet Nothingâ€.
â€œHello and welcome to the final episode of Midnights Mayhem with Me. Itâ€™s been genuinely chaotic and Iâ€™ve enjoyed every second of it,â€ she said before the final bounce. And with that, the final song was revealed â€“ track 4, â€œSnow On the Beach,â€ featuring Lana Del Rey.
Swift has a mountain of respect for Lana Del Rey. During her speech at the Billboard Women In Music 2019 event, TayTay described the â€œVideo Gamesâ€ singer as â€œone of my favorite artists of this decadeâ€ and â€œin my opinion the most influential artist in pop.â€
With her final rush of ball games, Swiftâ€™s Midnights track list is revealed in full.
Though TayTay hasnâ€™t shared any snippets from her latest set, we do know what sheâ€™s picked as her standout. â€œTrack three, â€˜Anti-Hero,â€™ is one of my favorite songs Iâ€™ve ever written,â€ Swift explained in a previous round of Midnights Mayhem With Me. She continued, â€œI really donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve delved this far into my insecurities in this detail before.â€
Midnights, Swiftâ€™s 10th studio album, is due out Oct. 21.
Check out the full Midnights track list below.
1. â€œLavender Hazeâ€
2. â€œMaroonâ€
3. â€œAnti-Heroâ€
4. â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ (featuring Lana Del Rey)
5. â€œYouâ€™re on Your Own, Kidâ€
6. â€œMidnight Rainâ€
7. â€œQuestionâ€¦?â€
8. â€œVigilante Shitâ€
9. â€œBejeweledâ€
10. â€œLabyrinthâ€
11. â€œKarmaâ€
12. â€œSweet Nothingâ€
13. â€œMastermindâ€

title: Taylor Swift Reveals Lana Del Rey Feature, Full 'Midnights' Song List
content:
Taylor Swift kept the â€œMidnightsâ€ oil burning later than usual late Thursday night and early Friday morning, revealing not just the name of one song at midnight, as has been her custom in the buildup to the Oct. 21 album release, but all five of the remaining mystery track titles, one per hour, until she finally reached a grand finale at 4 a.m. ET.
And that final track reveal had â€” as she promised â€” â€œQUITE the twist of an ending,â€ with Lana Del Rey being revealed as making the only featured appearance by a guest on the album. Del Rey will make her cameo on a song titled â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ which will be track 4 on â€œMidnights.â€
The other four tracks whose titles were revealed over the course of the wee hours were â€œLavender Haze,â€ set to be the first track on the album; â€œYouâ€™re on Your Own,â€ track 5; â€œLabyrinth,â€ track 10; and â€œSweet Nothing,â€ track 12.
As the clock struck 12 on the east coast, Swift revealed â€œLavender Hazeâ€ and left a video message explaining the meaning of the song on Instagram, something she didnâ€™t do for any of the other songs being revealed early Friday, and something she had previously only done with the song â€œAnti-Hero.â€
â€œâ€˜Lavender Hazeâ€™ is Track 1 on â€˜Midnights,'â€ she said in the video, â€œand I happened upon the phrase â€˜lavender hazeâ€™ when I was watching â€˜Mad Men.â€™ And I looked it up because I thought it sounded cool, and it turns out that itâ€™s a common phrase used in the â€™50s where they would just describe being in love. Like, if you were in the lavender haze, then that meant that you were in that all-encompassing love glow â€” and I thought that was really beautiful. And I guess theoretically, when youâ€™re in the lavender haze, youâ€™ll do anything to stay there and not let people bring you down off of that cloud. And I think a lot of people have to deal with this now, not just like â€˜public figures,â€™ because we live in the era of social media, and if the world finds out that youâ€™re in love with somebody, theyâ€™re going to weigh in on it. Like my relationship for six years: weâ€™ve had to dodge weird rumors, tabloid stuff, and we just ignore it. And so this song is about the act of ignoring that stuff to protect the real stuff. I hope you guys like it.â€
In her previous explainer for a new song, Swift talked about â€œAnti-Heroâ€ on Monday, calling that track â€œone of my favorite songs Iâ€™ve ever written. I really donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve delved this far into my insecurities in this detail before. You know, I struggle a lot with the idea that my life has become unmanageably sized, and that I, you knowâ€¦ not to sound too dark, but, like, I struggle with the idea of not feeling like a person. But donâ€™t feel bad for me. You donâ€™t need to. But this song is a real guided tour throughout all the things that I tend to hate about myself. We all hate things about ourselves, and itâ€™s all of those aspects of the things we dislike and like about ourselves that we have to come to terms with if weâ€™re going to be this person. So, yeah, I like â€˜Anti-Heroâ€™ a lot because I think itâ€™s really honest.â€
The other song titles Swift had revealed previously besides â€œAnti-Heroâ€ (which is track 3 on the album) were â€œMaroonâ€ (track 2), â€œMidnight Rainâ€ (track 6), â€œQuestionâ€¦?â€ (track 7), â€œVigilante Shitâ€ (track 8) and â€œMastermindâ€ (the closing track, 13).
Beyond the basic 13 songs, a Target deluxe edition will include a 14th original song â€” that title still remains a mystery â€” along with two remixes.

title: Lana Del Rey course offered to NYU students
content:
No summertime sadness over here.
Lana Del Reyâ€™s ingenious contribution to the pressing issues in the world through her melancholic music is finally set to be studied at New York Universityâ€™s Clive Davis Institute next month.
The university is launching a course dedicated entirely to studying the iconic singer/songwriterâ€™s connection to social justice movements including Black Lives Matter, Me Too, and Times Up, according to Variety.
Titled â€œTopics in Recorded Music: Lana Del Rey,â€ the two-credit course will run from Oct. 20 until Dec. 8, and will be taught by acclaimed journalist and author Kathy Iandoli.
The course will also explore the singerâ€™s relationship to feminism as well as her musical influences, the outlet reports.
According to Variety, the course description reads, â€œOver the course of eight critically-acclaimed albums, the six-time Grammy nominated artist has introduced a sad core, melancholic, and baroque version of dream pop that in turn helped shift and reinvent the sound (and mood) of mainstream music beyond the 2010s.
The 6-time Grammy Award-nominated singer is famed for her sultry vocals and melancholic music. Getty Images
â€œThrough her arresting visuals and her thematic attention to mental health and tales of toxic, damaged love, Del Rey provided a new platform for artists of all genders to create â€˜anti-popâ€™ works of substance that could live in a mainstream once categorized as bubblegum.â€
Iandoli told the outlet that the singer, who graduated from Fordham University in NYC, â€œis both a blueprint and a cautionary tale, a complicated pop star who resonates so much with her fans, not because of how she makes them feel about her, but rather how she makes them feel about themselves.â€
The course will explore the singerâ€™s relationship to feminism as well as her musical influences. Getty Images
â€œShe has changed the parameters of baroque pop and now more specifically â€˜sad girl popâ€™ through her music, by expanding the subject matter which at times is controversial and challenging. There are so many pieces in this mosaic that we have now come to know as Lana Del Rey, and this course examines every dimension of it,â€ she added.
Earlier this year, the universityâ€™s Clive Davis Institute introduced its first-ever course on Taylor Swift, which ran from Jan. 26 until March 9.
The course proved to be so popular that the University of Texas at Austin followed suit, and is now offering students a songwriting course focused on the 11-time Grammy Award winnerâ€™s approach to crafting lyrics.
Dubbed â€œLiterary Contests and Contexts: The Taylor Swift Songbook,â€ English professor Dr. Elizabeth Scala will teach the course starting this fall.

title: Un cours sur Lana Del Rey dans une universitÃ© Ã  New York
content:
L'ex professeure de yoga d'Adam Levine est la quatriÃ¨me femme Ã  prÃ©tendre sâ€™Ãªtre faite draguÃ©e par le musicien. Il lui aurait envoyÃ© des messages quelques heures aprÃ¨s qu'il ait niÃ© avoir trompÃ© sa femme Behati Prinsloo.
Alanna Zabel a fait une story Instagram avec le hashtag #ExposeAdamLevine affirme que le leader des Maroon 5, avec qui elle a travaillÃ© entre 2007 et 2010, lui a envoyÃ© un texto pour la draguer alors qu'il Ã©tait encore en couple avec la serveuse Becky Ginos, qu'il a frÃ©quentÃ©e entre 2006 et 2009.
Alanna affirme que les prÃ©tendus textos ont dÃ©truit sa vie, car son "ex jaloux" les a vus et a Ã©tÃ© "violent" avec elle.
Elle Ã©crit : "Un jour, il m'a envoyÃ© un SMS disant 'Je veux passer la journÃ©e avec toi toute nue'. J'Ã©tais dans le bain, mais mon ex jaloux l'a vu et s'est mis en colÃ¨re.
"J'ai assurÃ© Ã  mon ex que j'Ã©tais sÃ»re que ce message Ã©tait destinÃ© Ã  Becky, la petite amie d'Adam Ã  l'Ã©poque, et que c'Ã©tait une erreur. J'ai envoyÃ© un SMS Ã  Adam pour lui demander si c'Ã©tait le cas. Adam n'a pas rÃ©pondu..."
Elle poursuit en affirmant qu'elle avait essayÃ© de contacter le hitmaker de 'This Love' Ã  ce sujet, mais qu'il l'avait repoussÃ©e et renvoyÃ©e de sa tournÃ©e.
Alanna a dit : "Un moment destructeur qui a changÃ© ma vie, et quand je l'ai dit Ã  Adam, il l'a ignorÃ©, ne s'est jamais excusÃ© (sic), m'a retirÃ©e de la tournÃ©e Ã  venir et m'a refroidie pendant l'un des moments les plus dÃ©vastateurs de ma vie, tout cela Ã  cause d'un seul texte de flirt."
Avant le texte, Alanna a affirmÃ© qu'Adam faisait souvent des commentaires coquets, comme le fait qu'elle "avait le meilleur cul de la ville".
AprÃ¨s que trois autres femmes aient dÃ©jÃ  exposÃ© des expÃ©riences similaires Ã  celle-ci, Adam a admis qu'il avait "dÃ©passÃ© les bornes" avec son comportement de sÃ©ducteur - mais Ã  nier avoir trompÃ© sa femme.
La pop star de 43 ans a dÃ©menti les affirmations du mannequin d'Instagram Sumner Stroh selon lesquelles il aurait trompÃ© Behati.
Dans une dÃ©claration sur Instagram, Adam - qui est mariÃ© Ã  la beautÃ© namibienne depuis 2014 - a dÃ©clarÃ© : "On dit beaucoup de choses sur moi en ce moment et je veux clarifier les choses.
"J'ai fait preuve d'un mauvais jugement en parlant avec quelqu'un d'autre que ma femme. Je n'ai pas eu de liaison, nÃ©anmoins, j'ai franchi la ligne pendant une pÃ©riode regrettable de ma vie."
Adam et Behati - qui ont Dusty, cinq ans, et Gio, quatre ans, ensemble - ont rÃ©cemment annoncÃ© qu'ils attendaient leur troisiÃ¨me enfant.
Et bien qu'Adam ait avouÃ© avoir un comportement "inappropriÃ©", il a promis qu'il ne rÃ©pÃ©terait pas cette erreur.
Il a dit : "Ma femme et ma famille sont tout ce qui m'importe dans ce monde. ÃŠtre assez naÃ¯f et stupide pour risquer la seule chose qui compte vraiment pour moi est la plus grande erreur que je puisse faire. Je ne la referai plus jamais. J'en prends l'entiÃ¨re responsabilitÃ©. On va s'en sortir. Et nous le ferons ensemble."
Sumner a affirmÃ© Ãªtre sortie avec le chanteur pendant environ un an, et a partagÃ© des messages Instagram qui, selon elle, provenaient d'Adam.
Sumner a dÃ©clarÃ© dans une vidÃ©o TikTok : "Ã€ l'Ã©poque, j'Ã©tais jeune, j'Ã©tais naÃ¯ve et, trÃ¨s franchement, je me suis sentie exploitÃ©e".
Le modÃ¨le Instagram a mÃªme suggÃ©rÃ© qu'Adam voulait donner son nom Ã  son troisiÃ¨me enfant avec Behati.
Sumner a expliquÃ© : "Il a dit : 'Ok, question sÃ©rieuse. Je vais avoir un autre bÃ©bÃ© et si c'est [un] garÃ§on, je veux vraiment l'appeler Sumner. Tu es d'accord avec Ã§a ? TRÃˆS sÃ©rieux."

title: Lana Del Rey, un'universitÃ  di New York terrÃ  un corso sulla cantante
content:
Il corso su Lana Del Rey, celebritÃ  pop del 21Â° secolo, esaminerÃ  alcuni contributi dellâ€™artista, il suo rapporto con il femminismo, le sue influenze musicali e il suo legame con i movimenti per la giustizia sociale come #BlackLlivesMatter, #MeToo e #TimesUp. Del Rey Ã¨ stata spesso in prima linea per denunciare violenza e problemi interni alla societÃ , ed Ã¨ stata premiata con il Decade Award durante lâ€™evento Hitmakers di Variety lo scorso dicembre. La descrizione ufficiale del corso riporta queste informazioni: Nel corso di otto album acclamati dalla critica, l'artista sei volte nominato ai Grammy ha introdotto una versione triste, malinconica e barocca del dream pop che a sua volta ha contribuito a cambiare e reinventare il suono (e l'atmosfera) di musica mainstream oltre gli anni 2010. Attraverso le sue immagini accattivanti e la sua attenzione tematica alla salute mentale e ai racconti di amori tossici e danneggiati, Del Rey ha fornito una nuova piattaforma per artisti di tutti i sessi per creare opere di sostanza â€œanti-popâ€.
PerchÃ¨ un corso su Lana Del Rey
GUARDA ANCHE
Tutti i video su musica e concerti
"In tanti modi, sento che Lana Del Rey Ã¨ sia un progetto che un ammonimento, una pop star complicata che risuona cosÃ¬ tanto con i suoi fan, non per come li fa sentire nei suoi confronti, ma piuttosto come li fa sentire riguardo loro stessi. Ha cambiato i parametri del pop barocco e ora piÃ¹ specificamente del "sad girl pop" attraverso la sua musica, ampliando l'argomento che a volte Ã¨ controverso e stimolante. Ci sono cosÃ¬ tanti pezzi in questo mosaico che ora conosciamo come Lana Del Rey, e questo corso ne esamina ogni dimensioneâ€ ha detto Iandoli in unâ€™intervista con Variety. Anche Jason King, musicista e scrittore di musica veterano, ha espresso la sua sul corso: "Quando offriamo corsi a tema artistico al Clive Davis Institute, ci chiediamo sempre: in che modo il lavoro di questo artista aiuta gli studenti a pensare a questioni o movimenti culturali, sociali o politici piÃ¹ ampi e complessi? Lana Del Rey rifrange cosÃ¬ tanti cambiamenti nella cultura contemporanea, soprattutto perchÃ© il ruolo delle donne contemporanee nella musica pop continua a cambiare. Studiare Lana Del Rey significa pensare in modo piÃ¹ critico alla crescente popolaritÃ  del cosiddetto anti-pop. Significa trovare modi per considerare l'accresciuto interesse per la salute mentale e le questioni relative al danno psicologico, e per valutare i cambiamenti nel loro 21Â° modo in cui pensiamo all'identitÃ , soprattutto in termini di razza, genere, nazione e classe. Lana Ã¨ particolarmente rilevante e controversa quando si tratta di cambiare le idee sul femminismo intersezionale negli ultimi dieci anniâ€.
Studiare gli artisti come Lana Del Rey apre la mente
"Lo scopo delle nostre lezioni a tema artistico presso il Clive Davis Institute Ã¨ incoraggiare gli studenti a pensare in modo piÃ¹ profondo e critico alle icone che ammirano e sviluppare una comprensione storica e contestuale di quegli artisti", continua. â€œCi si aspetta che gli studenti si avvicinino allo studio di Lana Del Rey con la stessa lente critica con cui si avvicinano allo studio dei Led Zeppelin o di John Coltrane o di Bob Marley o di Stevie Wonder o di Joni Mitchell in altri corsi di Scrittura/Storia/Emergent Media Studies che offriamo. C'Ã¨ anche un corpo crescente di ricerche accademiche e discorsi accademici su Lana Del Rey che cercano di valutare il suo significato e impatto culturale, e gli studenti leggono e riflettono su alcuni dei lavori in classe".

title: Lana Del Rey Course Launched at NYUâ€™s Clive Davis Institute
content:
Class is in session for Lana Del Rey fans. New York Universityâ€™s Clive Davis Institute of Recorded Music has launched a new course for this fall centered around the singer-songwriter.
The two-credit course, titled â€œTopics in Recorded Music: Lana Del Rey,â€ is taught by journalist and author Kathy Iandoli and will run from October 20 to December 8, according to Variety. According to the course description, â€œOver the course of eight critically-acclaimed albums, the six-time Grammy nominated artist has introduced a sad core, melancholic, and baroque version of dream pop that in turn helped shift and reinvent the sound (and mood) of mainstream music beyond the 2010s. Through her arresting visuals and her thematic attention to mental health and tales of toxic, damaged love, Del Rey provided a new platform for artists of all genders to create â€˜anti-popâ€™ works of substance that could live in a mainstream once categorized as bubblegum.â€
The course will also examine Del Reyâ€™s relationship to feminism, musical influences and connection to social justice movements.
Earlier this year, the Clive Davis Institute also offered a course on Taylor Swift, which delved into the superstarâ€™s journey as a creative music entrepreneur, the legacy of pop and country songwriters that have influenced the star and how discourses of youth and girlhood are exploited in the media and music industry.
In May, Swift delivered the commencement address to New York Universityâ€™s Class of 2022, sharing wisdom as an honorary doctor of fine arts.

title: Lana Del Rey Course Launched at New York University's Clive Davis Institute
content:
As it did with Taylor Swift earlier this year, New York Universityâ€™s Clive Davis Institute has introduced a course on Lana Del Rey for this fall. Taught by journalist and author Kathy Iandoli, the two-credit course, â€œTopics in Recorded Music: Lana Del Reyâ€ runs Oct. 20-Dec. 8.
According to an NYU rep, the course will examine Del Reyâ€™s contributions to 21st Century pop stardom, her relationship to feminism, her musical influences and artists she has influenced, and her connection to social justice movements such as #BlackLlivesMatter, #MeToo and #TimesUp. Del Rey was honored with the Decade Award at Varietyâ€˜s Hitmakers event in December.
The course description reads: Over the course of eight critically-acclaimed albums, the six-time Grammy nominated artist has introduced a sad core, melancholic, and baroque version of dream pop that in turn helped shift and reinvent the sound (and mood) of mainstream music beyond the 2010s. Through her arresting visuals and her thematic attention to mental health and tales of toxic, damaged love, Del Rey provided a new platform for artists of all genders to create â€œanti-popâ€ works of substance that could live in a mainstream once categorized as bubblegum.
Speaking with Variety, Iandoli says, â€œIn so many ways, I feel like Lana Del Rey is both a blueprint and a cautionary tale, a complicated pop star who resonates so much with her fans, not because of how she makes them feel about her, but rather how she makes them feel about themselves. She has changed the parameters of baroque pop and now more specifically â€œsad girl popâ€ through her music, by expanding the subject matter which at times is controversial and challenging. There are so many pieces in this mosaic that we have now come to know as Lana Del Rey, and this course examines every dimension of it.â€
Chaired by veteran music writer and musician Jason King, the Davis Institute has included classes taught by Questlove, â€œDilla Timeâ€ author Dan Charnas, Q-Tip, legendary producer-engineer Bob Power and many others.
Of the Del Rey course, King tells Variety, â€œWhen we offer artist-themed courses at the Clive Davis Institute, we are always asking: how does this artistâ€™s work help students think through larger and complex cultural, social or political issues or movements? Lana Del Rey refracts so many changes in contemporary culture, especially as the role of contemporary women in pop music keeps shifting. Studying Lana Del Rey means thinking more critically the growing popularity of so-called anti-pop. It means finding ways to consider the increased interest in mental health and issues of psychological damage, and to evaluate changes in they 21st way we think about identity, especially in terms of race, gender, nation and class. Lana is especially relevant, and controversial, when it comes to changing ideas about intersectional feminism over the past decade.
â€œThe point of our artist-themed classes at the Clive Davis Institute is to encourage students think more deeply and critically about the icons they admire and to develop a historical and contextual understanding of those artists,â€ he continues. â€œStudents are expected to approach the study of Lana Del Rey with the same critical lens with which they approach the study of Led Zeppelin or John Coltrane or Bob Marley or Stevie Wonder or Joni Mitchell in other Writing/History/Emergent Media Studies courses we offer. There is a growing body of academic research and scholarly discourse on Lana Del Rey as well that seeks to assess her cultural meaning and impact, and students read and think through some of the work in class.â€

title: Taylor Swift sparked rumours of collaboration with Lana Del Rey
content:
Swift posted a behind-the-scenes look at the creation of her next album Midnights.
The singerâ€™s clothing resembles that of Del Rey, real name Elizabeth Woolridge Grant.
The 37-year-old hitmaker has not responded to the rumours of a duet.
Advertisement
Taylor Swift fuelled rumours of a Lana Del Rey duet, on Friday.
In a video posted to her Instagram account, the vocalist of Blank Space provided her admirers a behind-the-scenes glimpse at the creation of her next album Midnights.
Fans saw that Swiftâ€™s clothing in the video resembled the one she wore in an April 2017 shot with the 37-year-old Blue Jeans hitmaker.
Longtime Swift collaborator and producer Jack Antonoff was also seen in the group photograph in black and white.
Swift and Lana Del Rey, real name Elizabeth Woolridge Grant, have not publicly responded to the rumour.
Advertisement
During a performance at the 2022 MTV Video Music Awards last month, Swift made the announcement that she will be releasing a new album.
The singerâ€™s eighth studio album, Evermore, was released in 2020; Midnights will be her first new song since then. It was a follow-up to the album Folklore, which won a Grammy Award.
Last year, she also released re-recordings of a number of her previous albums, including Red (Taylorâ€™s Version).
