title: Taylor Swift sparks rumours of a Lana Del Rey collaboration
content:
Taylor Swift might come up with the pleasant news of a collaboration with Lana Del Rey.
On Friday, The Blank Space singer shared a video on her Instagram account in which she gave her followers a look into the making of her upcoming album Midnights.
Fans noticed that a shirt worn by Swift in the clip looked similar to a top she sported in a photo taken with the 37-year-old Blue Jeans hitmaker this past April.
Also featured in the black-and-white group shot was Swift's longtime collaborator/producer Jack Antonoff.
Neither Swift nor Lana Del Rey, born Elizabeth Woolridge Grant, have commented on the rumour as of yet.
Swift announced that she would be releasing a new album during an appearance at the 2022 MTV Video Music Awards last month.
Midnights will mark the first new music from the singer since 2020, when she released her ninth studio album, Evermore. It was a follow-up to the Grammy Award-winning record Folklore.
She's also released re-recordings of several of her past albums last year, including Red (Taylor's Version).

title: Taylor Swift (and Lana Del Rey) Blocked Men Out of the Top 10 Spots of the Billboard Hot 100
content:
Taylor Swift (and Lana Del Rey) Blocked Men Out of the Top 10 Spots of the Billboard Hot 100
Taylor Swift is officially the first artist in history to take up all of the top 10 spots on the Billboard Hot 100. Following the release of Swiftâ€™s 10th studio album Midnights, 10 of Swiftâ€™s new songs debuted in the top 10 spots of the Billboard chart, including â€œSnow on the Beach (feat. Lana Del Rey).â€ With this accomplishment, Swift and Del Rey ended up blocking any male artists from taking up the top 10 spots of the Hot 100.
(L-R) Taylor Swift and Lana Del Rey | Amy Sussman/Getty Images; Rodin Eckenroth/FilmMagic
Taylor Swift Swift broke a new record on the Billboard Hot 100
On Oct. 31, Billboard revealed the newest ranking of the Billboard Hot 100. Each week, the chart tracks the most popular songs in the U.S. based on sales, streams, and radio play.
Not only did the lead single of Midnights, â€œAnti-Hero,â€ debut at No. 1 on the Hot 100, but nine other songs from Midnights also debuted in the top 10 spots.
With this, Swift became the first artist in history to take up the top 10 places of the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The most recent Hot 100 ranking can be viewed below.
Billboard Hot 100 Top 10:
â€œAnti-Hero,â€ Taylor Swift â€œLavender Haze,â€ Taylor Swift â€œMaroon,â€ Taylor Swift â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ Taylor Swift feat. Lana Del Rey â€œMidnight Rain,â€ Taylor Swift â€œBejeweled,â€ Taylor Swift â€œQuestionâ€¦?,â€ Taylor Swift â€œYouâ€™re on Your Own, Kid,â€ Taylor Swift â€œKarma,â€ Taylor Swift â€œVigilante S***,â€ Taylor Swift
The #Hot100 top 10 (chart dated Nov. 5, 2022) â€” billboard charts (@billboardcharts) October 31, 2022
RELATED: Taylor Swift Laughed When She Announced Her New Song â€˜Karmaâ€™
A breakdown of the singerâ€™s accomplishments on the Billboard Hot 100
By breaking this new record on the Hot 100, Swift also earned other achievements on the chart with the songs from Midnights.
According to Billboard, â€œAnti-Heroâ€ is Swiftâ€™s fifth song to debut at the No. 1 spot, and itâ€™s her ninth song to ever reach No. 1 on the chart.
Billboard also reports that Swift â€œnow boasts the most top 10s among women in the chartâ€™s history, with 40 (surpassing Madonnaâ€™s 38). Among all acts, she trails only Drake (59 top 10s).â€
Previously, Drake had set the record for the most songs in the top 10 spots of the Billboard Hot 100 with nine songs from Certified Lover Boy in 2021. Swift now holds the new record with 10 songs at the top of the chart.
According to Billboard, Swift also passed â€œDrake and The Beatles for the most titles from the top of the Hot 100 in a single week.â€
RELATED: Taylor Swift Wanted to Be in â€˜Twilight,â€™ But the Director Didnâ€™t Want Her in the Movie
Taylor Swift and Lana Del Rey blocked men from the top 10 spots
One of the songs from Midnights found in the top 10 of the Hot 100 is â€œSnow on the Beach (feat. Lana Del Rey).â€ In â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ Del Rey provides backing vocals throughout the track, most notably in the songâ€™s chorus.
While not an official statistic or record, Swiftâ€™s newest accomplishments on the Hot 100 means Swift and Del Rey ended up keeping any male artists from ranking at the top of the chart.
Steve Lacy is the closest male artist to breaking into the top 10 on the Hot 100, and his song â€œBad Habitâ€ is ranked at No. 12. Meanwhile, Harry Stylesâ€™ song â€œAs It Wasâ€ charted at No. 16, and Post Maloneâ€™s â€œI Like You (A Happier Song)â€ featuring Doja Cat ranked at No. 17.
RELATED: Ranking Taylor Swiftâ€™s Albums Based on How We Think She Would Rank Them

title: Lana Del Rey Unsurprisingly Did Not Have a Verse in 'Snow on the Beach' With Taylor Swift
content:
Lana Del Rey Unsurprisingly Did Not Have a Verse in â€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™ With Taylor Swift
On Oct. 21, Taylor Swift released her new album Midnights, and one song, â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ features Lana Del Rey. While Swift hyped up the collaboration leading up to the release of Midnights, some fans of Swift and music listeners remained pessimistic over Del Reyâ€™s involvement. Once Midnights dropped, it was revealed that some fansâ€™ pessimism was well-placed, and Del Rey did not have a verse in the song.
(L-R) Lana Del Rey and Taylor Swift | Kevin Mazur/WireImage
Taylor Swift promoted the collaboration with Lana Del Rey
On Oct. 11, Swift revealed that â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ featured Del Rey, and the singer released an Instagram video giving more details about the song.
â€œâ€¦ I am such a massive fan of Lana Del Rey. More on that later. â€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™ the song is about falling in love with someone at the same time as theyâ€™re falling in love with you,â€ Swift shared on Instagram.
The singer-songwriter continued, â€œLana Del Rey in my opinion is one of the best musical artists ever. The fact that I get to exist at the same time as her is an honor and a privilege. And the fact that she would be so generous as to collaborate with us on this song is something Iâ€™m going to be grateful for for life.â€
RELATED: Taylor Swift Laughed When She Announced Her New Song â€˜Karmaâ€™
Lana Del Rey only provided vocals for â€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™
When Swift announced â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ anticipation was formed around the song, though some fans exercised caution.
In the past, Swiftâ€™s much-hyped collaborations, particularly ones that feature women, have resulted in the featured artist being relegated to background vocals. Because of this, female artists not having a verse when featured in Swiftâ€™s music has become a running theme of criticism about Swift.
In â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ Del Rey does not have her own verse, and instead provides harmonies and background vocals throughout the song.
â€œnot Lana getting the Colbie Caillat/HAIM/The Chicks/Maren Moriss treatment lol,â€ a Reddit user wrote.
â€œWhat a waste of a Lana feature,â€ another Reddit user wrote.
One Reddit user wrote, â€œI barely heard any Lana on Snow on the Beach. Taylorâ€™s refusal to share the spotlight with other female artists is a stain on her career.â€
RELATED: Ranking Taylor Swiftâ€™s Albums Based on How We Think She Would Rank Them
While some fans expressed how much they thought Del Rey should have had a verse in â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ other music lovers thought Del Reyâ€™s vocals were a great addition to the song.
â€œYou can hear lana throughout the song, they just layered their vocals together. Listen with headphones, the production is actually quite nice. But yes they shouldâ€™ve given her a verse,â€ a Reddit user wrote.
â€œYou can hear Lana in the background throughout the song, I think she utilized her pretty well. I actually like that sheâ€™s just in the background too it adds a layer that I canâ€™t really explain,â€ another Reddit user wrote.
Taylor Swiftâ€™s collaboration history
While Swift is known for being generous with songwriting and production credits, her collaboration history is a bit rockier.
Phoebe Bridgers is the only female artist to have a verse of her own on one of Swiftâ€™s songs from when the two collaborated on â€œNothing Newâ€ from the 2021 album Red (Taylorâ€™s Version). Meanwhile, artists like Colbie Caillat, Maren Morris, Haim, The Chicks, and now Del Rey only provided background vocals on songs with Swift.
In comparison, male artists have primarily been given full verses when featured in Swiftâ€™s songs, with the exception of Chris Stapleton on â€œI Bet You Think About Meâ€ from Red (Taylorâ€™s Version).
Even on Swiftâ€™s 2019 album Lover, The Chicks provided background vocals for â€œSoon Youâ€™ll Get Better,â€ while Swift later released a remix of the song â€œLoverâ€ featuring Shawn Mendes, and Mendesâ€™ feature included a new verse and new lyrics in the songâ€™s bridge.
Why Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™ elicited so much criticism
In â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ Del Rey is an effective presence, giving the song an ethereal feel. Her influence is noticeable throughout the song. However, given the praise Swift gave Del Rey and how well Del Rey fits into the track, the singer not having a verse feels like a missed opportunity.
If Swift did not have a history of almost exclusively having female featured artists on backing vocals while male featured artists perform full verses and duets, the disappointment surrounding â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ might not be that strong.
â€œSnow on the Beach (feat. Lana Del Rey)â€ further fuels speculation about why Swiftâ€™s discography has this pattern. Is she afraid to be overshadowed by other female artists? Is it because of a consistent stylistic choice? Does she prefer singing duets with male artists?
While â€œNothing New (feat. Phoebe Bridgers)â€ seemed to hint at a change of direction for Swift, â€œSnow on the Beach (feat. Lana Del Rey)â€ only confirmed some fansâ€™ suspicions that Swift has a controversial pattern and bias.
RELATED: Taylor Swift Wanted to Be in â€˜Twilight,â€™ But the Director Didnâ€™t Want Her in the Movie

title: Taylor Swift volta ao pop em 'Midnights'; leia anÃ¡lise
content:
Taylor Swift nunca esteve tÃ£o confiante como em seu dÃ©cimo Ã¡lbum de estÃºdio, "Midnights", lanÃ§ado na madrugada desta sexta-feira, dia 21. Embora tenha acabado de quebrar o recorde de disco mais tocado em um dia no Spotify, a cantora americana nÃ£o parece estar preocupada em chegar ao topo das paradas ou criar um hit que toque no rÃ¡dio como "Shake it Off" ou "Blank Space", mas em fazer experimentaÃ§Ãµes um tanto quanto arriscadas.
Taylor Swift em ensaio de divulgaÃ§Ã£o de 'Midnights', seu dÃ©cimo Ã¡lbum de estÃºdio - Beth Garrabrant/DivulgaÃ§Ã£o
A crÃ­tica aplaudiu. A Rolling Stone e o The Guardian, por exemplo, deram nota mÃ¡xima para o disco. Ã‰ incontestÃ¡vel a criatividade da cantora e do produtor Jack Antonoff, que tambÃ©m trabalha com Lorde e Lana Del Rey. Em sua volta ao pop, com as batidas e os arranjos eletrÃ´nicos que tinham sumido dos discos anteriores, "Folklore" e "Evermore", Swift vai dos bramidos de elefante que cercam "Labyrinth" a uma distorÃ§Ã£o de vocais tÃ£o profunda que sua voz chega a parecer a de um homem em "Midnight Rain".
O ouvinte pode nÃ£o entender nada a princÃ­pio, mas Ã© uma escolha coesa, jÃ¡ que ambas as composiÃ§Ãµes versam sobre estereÃ³tipos de gÃªnero. "Ele queria uma noiva, mas eu estava fazendo meu nome", protesta uma Swift andrÃ³gina em "Midnight Rain", antes de dizer, em "Labyrinth", que estÃ¡ se apaixonando de novo quando deveria mesmo Ã© estar dando a volta por cima. Ã‰ notÃ¡vel ainda que, enquanto a maioria das mulheres apostem nos agudos, Swift acredite no potencial de seus graves.
No entanto, diferente do que ocorre em Ã¡lbuns anteriores, como "Reputation" e "Lover", tambÃ©m cheios de efeitos que alteram sua voz, muitas faixas de "Midnights" parecem prender Swift numa cÃ¢mara de reverberaÃ§Ã£o que faz seus vocais perderem o brilho e, por vezes, atÃ© a clareza, como ocorre na introduÃ§Ã£o de "Snow on the Beach", sua parceria com Del Rey.
A mÃ©trica, outra aposta alta do disco, tambÃ©m Ã© um desafio. Se em "Anti-Hero" Swift se sai bem com nada menos do que quatro rimas a cada dois versos do prÃ©-refrÃ£o, em "Bejeweled", por exemplo, a pronÃºncia do refrÃ£o parece nÃ£o ser tÃ£o fÃ¡cil.
A produÃ§Ã£o ainda joga contra uma das melhores faixas, "Snow on the Beach". Era esperado um encontro arrebatador entre duas das maiores compositoras da mÃºsica pop contemporÃ¢nea, mas a voz esfumaÃ§ada de Del Rey que tanto poderia favorecer a canÃ§Ã£o mal aparece.
Ã‰ como se Swift cantasse com uma backing vocal de luxo em vez de fazer um dueto, uma decepÃ§Ã£o ainda maior porque nÃ£o Ã© a primeira vez que a cantora faz isso. Para citar um exemplo recente, ela tambÃ©m escondeu as irmÃ£s Haim em "No Body, No Crime", de "Evermore".
Se as experimentaÃ§Ãµes sÃ£o abundantes nas melodias, as composiÃ§Ãµes, o ponto mais forte de Swift, sÃ£o um resgate do eu-lÃ­rico autorreferente deixado para trÃ¡s nos Ãºltimos discos. EstÃ£o por lÃ¡ todos seus temas frequentes, como a relaÃ§Ã£o com a prÃ³pria imagem e a infÃ¢ncia, o cerne de "Anti-Hero" e de "Youâ€™re On Your Own, Kid".
Ã‰ o caso ainda de seus relacionamentos amorosos, tanto os fracassados quanto os bem-sucedidos, como o que ela retrata em "Lavender Haze", a primeira faixa do Ã¡lbum, sobre seu namoro com o ator Joe Alwyn. Ele tambÃ©m escreveu uma faixa, "Sweet Nothing", sob o pseudÃ´nimo de William Bowery.
Swift tambÃ©m continua com as garras afiadas, mas seus sentimentos parecem menos hiperbÃ³licos. "NÃ£o me visto para mulheres, nÃ£o me visto para homens/ ultimamente tenho me vestido para vinganÃ§a", ela canta em "Vigilante Shit", uma composiÃ§Ã£o que poderia fazer parte de "Reputation", assim como "Karma". Mas agora, muito mais contidas e sem os chicotes estalando ao fundo, as faixas dÃ£o lustre a "Midnights".
Embora sejam boas, no entanto, sÃ£o composiÃ§Ãµes que, em termos de autorreferÃªncia, nÃ£o estÃ£o Ã  altura de seus trabalhos anteriores, inclusive dos mais recentes, como a versÃ£o extendida de "All Too Well". Apesar de juntas comporem um Ã¡lbum mais coeso do que qualquer outro de Swift, a impressÃ£o Ã© de que, sozinhas, as canÃ§Ãµes perdem forÃ§a e talvez nÃ£o tenham potencial para ter vida prÃ³pria.
SÃ£o ainda letras que dÃ£o saudade de ouvir Swift, como a boa contadora de histÃ³rias que Ã©, criar personagens e cantar sobre a vida de outras pessoas, como fez com maestria em "Folklore" e "Evermore", que representaram um salto de evoluÃ§Ã£o sem tamanho ante seu trabalho anterior, "Lover", e que seguem como os seus melhores Ã¡lbuns atÃ© agora, intocados por "Midnights".

title: Fans Suspect These 2 Lana Del Rey Songs Are About Her Relationship With G-Eazy
content:
G-Eazy and Lana Del Rey were rumored to have dated in 2017, and their relationship seemingly ended on a sour note. Some fans think two songs from Del Reyâ€™s 2017 album Lust for Life are about her fling with G-Eazy. Hereâ€™s why fans suspect the tracks are about the rapper.
(L-R) Lana Del Rey and G-Eazy | Jon Kopaloff/Getty Images; Valerie Macon/AFP via Getty Images
G-Eazy and Lana Del Rey were first linked in April 2017 when they were spotted together at Coachella. They were seen spending time together several times after that, but their short-lived relationship seemingly ended abruptly.
The rapper dissed Del Rey in his 2020 song â€œMoana,â€ insinuating that the singer wanted him back after their split. The lyrics state, â€œI know a Keisha and I know Lana / They try to get me back, but Iâ€™m like, â€˜No, nah, nahâ€™ / Iâ€™m sorry, I donâ€™t want no drama, nah / Thatâ€™s a hard no, pass.â€
The â€œThese Things Happenâ€ rapper started dating singer Halsey in August 2017, and they had an on-and-off relationship through October 2018. While dating, they released the song â€œHim & I.â€
Some fans think Del Rey was initially supposed to be featured on â€œHim & Iâ€ instead of Halsey, but G-Eazy switched artists when he got a new girlfriend.
G-Eazy Named-Dropped Lana Del Rey In His New Song, Saying She Wants Him Back https://t.co/AFvfXd50Rb â€” BuzzFeed Celeb (@BuzzFeedCeleb) May 4, 2020
Fans think these 2 Lana Del Rey songs are about her relationship with G-Eazy
Some Lana Del Rey fans think her songs â€œWhite Mustangâ€ and â€œIn My Feelingsâ€ are about her relationship with G-Eazy. They discussed the topic in a Reddit thread.
â€œI find it interesting that G-Eazy owns a 1960s model Ford Mustang, although it is black, and the Mustang Lana sings about in â€˜White Mustangâ€™ is [obviously] white,â€ wrote one fan. â€œMaybe she changed the color of the car in the song so it wouldnâ€™t be so obvious that itâ€™s about him.â€
â€œIn My Feelings is almost definitely about the G, during it at the listening party she (paraphrased) said â€˜I could name names, but I wonâ€™tâ€™ then made a G sign with her fingers,â€ wrote another fan.
Some fans think â€œIn My Feelingsâ€ is about G-Eazy, but not â€œWhite Mustang.â€
â€œâ€˜In My Feelingsâ€™ is about G-Eazy; she indirectly confirmed it recently,â€ said one fan. â€œI wouldnâ€™t be surprised if a verse or two references him in â€˜White Mustangâ€™ as well because she often uses one song to talk about a few different things. I, however, very much doubt he was the main inspiration.â€
And another fan wrote, â€œAs others have said, I think In My Feelings is most likely about G-Eazy, but White Mustang has been around since the BTD era so I doubt itâ€™s about him.â€
â€˜White Mustangâ€™ and â€˜In My Feelingsâ€™ both contain lyrics that could be about the rapper
â€œWhite Mustangâ€ was featured on Lana Del Reyâ€™s 2017 album Lust for Life. It tells the story of a summer romance that didnâ€™t work out. The lyrics and music video cast Del Reyâ€™s lover as a fellow musician, seemingly pointing to Del Reyâ€™s relationship with G-Eazy.
She seemingly called out the rapper during a 2018 performance of the song (per Popsugar). She changed the lyrics from â€œCouldnâ€™t stop the way I was feelinâ€™ the day your record droppedâ€ to â€œCouldnâ€™t stop the way I was feeling the day his record dropped â€“ and it wasnâ€™t even that good!â€
â€œIn My Feelingsâ€ is also from Del Reyâ€™s Lust for Life album. She performed the song live for the first time at her Lust for Life listening party in July 2017. Before singing, Del Rey alluded that the song was written about â€œG,â€ leading fans to believe the track is about her past relationship with G-Eazy.
RELATED: G-Eazy Reveals What Happened When He Met â€˜Favorite Artistâ€™ Kanye West: â€˜I Was So Embarrassedâ€™

title: Lana Del Rey says laptop containing her new album was stolen on Melrose Avenue
content:
Lana Del Rey says laptop containing her new album was stolen on Melrose Avenue
Lana Del Rey says she was robbed of a backpack that contained her laptop, which had her new album on it.
Lana Del Rey says she was robbed of a backpack that contained her laptop, which had her new album on it.
The singer said along with the computer, multiple hard drives and a camera were also stolen.
"A few months ago, I parked my car on Melrose Place - actually Melrose Ave. in Los Angeles - and I stepped away for a minute," she said on Instagram. "And the one time I left my backpack inside my car, someone broke all the windows and took it."
Del Rey added that another project, a book she is working on, was stolen as well.
"I had to remotely wipe the computer that had my 200-page book for Simon and Schuster-which I didn't have backed up on the cloud," Del Rey said. And despite that, people are still able to remotely access my phone and leak our songs and personal photos. I loved the book that I lost with all of my heart and put a lot of passion into it."
The artist asked her fans to not to listen to any leaked music, and said she will continue to work on new music.
"I just want to mention that despite all of this happening, I am confident in the record to come, despite so many safety factors at so many different levels. I really want to persist and make the best record I can," she said. "Please don't listen to the music if you hear it, because it's not coming out yet," she said.
Del Rey concluded: "Obviously I won't ever leave anything in the car again, even if it's just for a moment. But we've had the same issues at the house, and it is a constant thing. And although I'm so grateful to be able to share all of the good stuff, I just also want to share that it has been a challenge."

title: Thief steals Lana Del Rey's laptop with unheard tracks and 200 page book manuscript
content:
Lana Del Rey has revealed a laptop containing songs from her upcoming album and a 200 page book manuscript was stolen from her car in a smash and grab.
The 37-year-old singer spoke to her fans in a since deleted Instagram live clip saying her car had been broken into on Melrose Avenue in Los Angeles a few months ago.
The thieves smashed all the windows and made off with a rucksack containing her computer, multiple hard drives and a camcorder.
She said: "The one time I left my backpack inside my car, someone broke all the windows and took it.
"I had to remotely wipe the computer that had my 200 page book for Simon and Schuster - which I didn't have backed up on the cloud.
"And despite that, people are still able to remotely access my phone and leak our songs and personal photos. I loved the book that I lost with all of my heart and put a lot of passion into it.
"I just want to mention that despite all of this happening, I am confident in the record to come - despite so many safety factors at so many different levels. I really want to persist and make the best record I can."
More on Lana Del Rey Lana Del Rey denies racism after she is criticised for comments she made about Beyonce, Nicki Minaj and others
The singer added that she was "confident" the book and the album will eventually be released, but that she does have to effectively "start over" with both projects.
She went on to urge fans not to listen to the stolen record saying, "please don't listen to the music if you hear it, because it's not coming out yet."
Advertisement
"Obviously I won't ever leave anything in the car again, even if it's just for a moment," she added. "But we've had the same issues at the house, and it is a constant thing. And although I'm so grateful to be able to share all of the good stuff, I just also want to share that it has been a challenge."
The singer, who first hit the mainstream in 2012 with the album Born to Die, released two albums last year, Blue Bannisters and Chemtrails Over the Country Club.
Unfortunately being a victim of this type of crime is nothing new for Del Rey who was had possessions stolen over the Christmas period in 2019.

title: All the Major Celebs Involved in Taylor Swift's Midnights Album
content:
Watch : Taylor Swift Drops Midnights Bonus Tracks & New Music Video
This Midnights mastermind has a new squad.
Taylor Swift's 10th album arrived, very fittingly, at midnight on Oct. 21, followed by seven bonus tracks at 3 a.m. While she wrote one song solo ("Vigilante S--t"), she collaborated on several with her Folklorian friends Jack Antonoff and Aaron Dessner, as well as one with boyfriend and muse Joe Alwyn. But those weren't the only stars she tapped for her sleepless nights album.
The self-reflective "Anti-Hero" music video features actors Mike Birbiglia, John Early and Mary Elizabeth Ellis as Swift's adult sons and daughter-in-law, making mayhem at her funeral.
And as Swift revealed on TikTok ahead of its release, Lana Del Rey lent her ethereal talents to "Snow on the Beach," which Swift described as being about "falling in love with someone at the same time as they're falling in love with you, in this sort of in this cataclysmic, faded moment where you realize someone feels exactly the same way that you feel, at the same moment."

title: Taylor Swift and Lana Del Rey Snow on the Beach Lyrics Meaning
content:
Taylor Swift's new album, Midnights, is officially here, and her long-awaited collaboration with alternative-pop darling Lana Del Rey has come along with it. Lana lent her vocals to Midnights' fourth track, "Snow on the Beach," which Taylor described as a dream sequence. And, after Taylor announced she would be featured on the track, mentions of Lana Del Rey grew nine times compared to the previous day on Twitter.
Taylor's longtime collaborator and friend, Jack Antonoff, likely connected her with LDR since he helped produce her albums Norman F***ing Rockwell, Chemtrails Over the Country Club, and Blue Banisters. And, if that weren't enough star power on "Snow on the Beach," Twitter fan account The Swift Society reports that Tay's "All Too Well" short film star Dylan O'Brien is credited as the drummer on the song. He was also pictured in the studio with Taylor, Jack Antonoff, and ZoÃ« Kravitz.
This content is imported from twitter. You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site. â€¦ pic.twitter.com/rRriWVl274 â€” jackantonoff (@jackantonoff) October 21, 2022
"I am such a massive fan," Taylor said of Lana in an Instagram Reel before sharing what inspired the collaboration.
"The song is about falling in love with someone at the same time as theyâ€™re falling in love with you, sort of in this sort of cataclysmic, fated moment where you realize someone feels exactly the same way that you feel," Taylor said of the track, which she explained was like wondering if it's a dream. "'Wait, is this real? Is this a dream?'" she asked, "Kind of like it would be if you were to see snow falling on a beach."
If you're wondering what Taylor Swift's "Snow on the Beach" song lyrics mean, we took a deep dive and broke everything down below.
This content is imported from youTube. You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site.
Snow On The Beach Watch on
Lyrics provided by Genius
[Verse 1: Taylor Swift]
One night, a few moons ago
I saw flecks of what could've been lights
But it might just have been you
Passing by unbeknownst to me
Life is emotionally abusive
And time can't stop me quite like you did
And my flight was awful, thanks for asking
I'm unglued, thanks to you
Based on Taylor's previous statements on the song, we can only assume it's about her boyfriend of six years, Joe Alwyn. Since she publicly revealed her partner following 2017's Reputation, Taylor has written countless songs about their romance, including "Call It What You Want," "Lover," "Invisible String," and "Mastermind," among others.
Related Story Taylor Shares Ship Origin Story in "Mastermind"
In the first verse of "Snow on the Beach," she details the fateful meeting she had with her beau in a similar fashion to evermore's "Long Story Short," where she sings "And heâ€™s passing by / Rare as the glimmer of a comet in the sky."
[Chorus: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey]
And it's like snow at the beach
Weird, but f***ing beautiful
Flying in a dream
Stars by the pocketful
You wanting me
Tonight feels impossible
But it's coming down
No sound, it's all around
Lana's vocals shine in the chorus, where she and Taylor sing about the strange moment when everything lines up in a relationship and you question whether it's a dream or real life.
[Post-Chorus: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey]
Like snow on the beach
Like snow on the beach
Like snow on the beach
Like snow, ah
[Verse 2: Taylor Swift Lana Del Rey]
This scene feels like what I once saw on a screen
I searched "aurora borealis green"
I've never seen someone lit from within
Blurring out my periphery
My smile is like I won a contest
And to hide that would be so dishonest
And it's fine to fake it 'til you make it
'Til you do, 'til it's true
Not only does the first line of the second verse refer back to Taylor's folklore track, "Exile," but it paints the same image with the opposite connotation. In "Exile," she sings "I think Iâ€™ve seen this film before / And I didnâ€™t like the ending," whereas in "Snow on the Beach," it's a beautiful scene she compares to polar lights that she wants to cherish for as long as she can.
[Chorus]
[Post-Chorus]
[Bridge: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey]
I can't speak, afraid to jinx it
I don't even dare to wish it
But your eyes are flying saucers from another planet
Now I'm all for you like Janet
Can this be a real thing? Can it?
In the bridge, she feels that the newfound love is too good to be true and she doesn't want to jinx losing it by making it public information. Taylor and Joe have famously kept their romance under wraps and away from the media since 2016, and it's only seen the light of day when they control the narrative.
Taylor also makes a direct reference to pop culture icon Janet Jackson's 2001 hit, "All for You," before getting into the final chorus of "Snow on the Beach."
Related Story All the Joe Alwyn References on "Midnights"
[Chorus]
[Post-Chorus]
[Outro: Taylor Swift]
Like snow on the beach
(It's coming down, it's coming down)
(It's coming down, it's coming down)
Like snow on the beach
(It's coming down, it's coming down)
(It's coming down, it's coming down)
(It's coming down, it's coming down)
(It's coming down, it's coming down)
(It's coming down, it's coming down)
(It's coming down, it's coming down)

title: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey Shout Out Janet Jackson on â€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™
content:
Two queens certainly deserve a third. Taylor Swift and Lana Del Rey tip their tiaras to another music superstar in the lyrics to â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ from Swiftâ€™s new Midnights album. The fourth track on the collection gives a sly shout-out to Janet Jackson courtesy of Del Rey, whose spare vocal interjections on the gauzy ballad mostly serve as harmonic support to Taylor.
Midway through the song about the ins-and-outs of falling in love the pair team up on a run that pays homage to Ms. Jacksonâ€™s 2001 hit â€œAll For Youâ€ from the album of the same name. â€œI canâ€™t speak, afraid to jinx it/ I donâ€™t even dare to wish it/ But your eyes are flying saucers from another planet,â€ they sing, adding, â€œNow Iâ€™m all for you like Janet/ Can this be a real thing, can it?â€
In advance of the albumâ€™s release, Swift described the inspiration for the song, explaining, â€œThe song is about falling in love with someone at the same time as theyâ€™re falling in love with you, in this sort of in this cataclysmic, faded moment where you realize someone feels exactly the same way that you feel, at the same moment. And youâ€™re kind of looking around going, â€œWait, is this real? Is this a dream? Is this for real? Is it really happening? Kinda like it would be if you were to see snow falling on a beach.â€
At press time it did not appear that Jackson had responded to the tribute, but itâ€™s worth noting that in 2009 Swift revealed that Jackson sent her flowers after Kanye West (who now goes by Ye) famously crashed Taylorâ€™s VMAs acceptance speech. â€œArtists that I didnâ€™t even assume knew who I was [have supported me],â€ a then 19-year-old Swift told radio veteran Elvis Duran in an interview. â€œI woke up the next day and I had flowers in my hotel room from Janet Jackson.â€
Listen to â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ below (Jackson shout-out at 2:50 mark).

title: Taylor Swift et Lana Del Rey sortent leur duo, les fans surpris du rÃ©sultat
content:

title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€˜Midnightsâ€™ Album Is Streaming Now: Listen
content:
Photo: JMEnternational for BRIT Awards/Getty Images
Update, Friday, October 21 at 3:14 a.m.: So you thought the Midnights rollout was over at midnight? Foolish Swifties. At 3 a.m., Taylor Swift revealed the â€œspecial very chaotic surpriseâ€ that she had teased earlier is no less than seven bonus tracks, which she dropped all at once in a new edition of the album. â€œSurprise! I think of Midnights as a complete concept album, with those 13 songs forming a full picture of the intensities of that mystifying, mad hour,â€ she said on Twitter. â€œHowever! There were other songs we wrote on our journey to find that magic 13.â€ Midnights (3am Edition) is out now. Listen to the new bonus tracks â€” â€œThe Great War,â€ â€œBigger Than the Whole Sky,â€ â€œParis,â€ â€œHigh Infidelity,â€ â€œGlitch,â€ â€œWouldâ€™ve, Couldâ€™ve, Shouldâ€™ve,â€ and â€œDear Readerâ€ â€” below.
Original story follows.
Check your watches, Swifties: Itâ€™s finally Midnights oâ€™clock. After a monthslong wait, Taylor Swift has dropped her tenth studio album. Described by the singer as â€œa collection of music written in the middle of the night, a journey through terrors and sweet dreams,â€ Midnights was first announced during Swiftâ€™s acceptance speech at the 2022 MTV Video Music Awards in August. Over the past two months, she revealed her track-list titles through surprisingly straightforward TikToks. The 13 new songs include â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ a collaboration with Lana Del Rey, and â€œLavender Haze,â€ which is inspired by her six-year relationship with Joe Alwyn. Track three, â€œAnti-Hero,â€ will receive the first Midnights-era music video on October 21 at 8 a.m., after fans have had a chance to get a couple hours of sleep (sheâ€™s announcing a â€œspecial very chaotic surpriseâ€ at 3 a.m., so there wonâ€™t be too much time to rest). Swift appears in the songwriting credits for every song on Midnights and teamed up with minion/collaborator Jack Antonoff for most of the album. ZoÃ« Kravitz and Alwyn â€” a.k.a. folklore contributor William Bowery â€” are also credited as writers. Swift has sorted her discography into three different vibes: fountain pen, quill pen, and glitter-gel pen. Which writing utensil did she reach for this time? Listen to Midnights below to find out.

title: Taylor Swift gives glimpse at personal life on electronica-tinged Midnights
content:
T aylor Swiftâ€™s new album Midnights offers rare insight into her personal life and relationship with her boyfriend, British actor Joe Alwyn, while also embracing a dramatic new sound.
The pop megastar, 32, has described the record as the story of â€œ13 sleepless nights scattered throughout my lifeâ€ and â€œa journey through terrors and sweet dreamsâ€.
It sees her turn away from the intimate indie songwriting of her two last albums, Folklore and Evermore, in favour of electronica, synth-pop and sometimes even hip hop-influenced beats.
Swift has once again written the majority of the album with Jack Antonoff, lead singer of rock band Bleachers, although this time they have opted for much darker sounds and lyrics.
Album opener Lavender Haze appears to contain direct references to Swiftâ€™s own life, although many other tracks refer to fictional characters and narratives.
Swift rails against â€œthe 1950s shitâ€ she says many women face and appears to reference media speculation over whether she is engaged or married to Alwyn.
â€œAll they keep asking me is if Iâ€™m gonna be your bride,â€ she sings. â€œThe only kinda girl they see is a one night or a wife.â€
The track also features background vocals from Zoe Kravitz, the Hollywood star daughter of Lenny Kravitz and Lisa Bonet.
The penultimate track, Sweet Nothing, is co-written by Swift and William Bowery, the pseudonym of Alwyn, and describes a holiday to Wicklow in Ireland in July 2021.
The romantic piece recalls a pebble she picked up from the beach and how she finds herself â€œrunning home to your sweet nothingsâ€.
During the semi-acoustic ballad, Swift adds: â€œOutside theyâ€™re push and shoving / Youâ€™re in the kitchen humming.â€
Swift and Alwyn have been together since 2016 and he helped write several songs on Folklore and its sister record Evermore under the pseudonym.
The track Anti-Hero, meanwhile, describes a character haunted by self-loathing in the middle of the night.
Swift sings: â€œWhen my depression works the graveyard shift / All of the people Iâ€™ve ghosted stand there in the room.
â€œI should not be left to my own devices, they come with prices and vices, I end up in crisis / Tale as old as time.â€
The song also sees her admitting, â€œSometimes I feel like everybody is a sexy baby / And Iâ€™m a monster on the hillâ€.
Swift also cryptically references politics, although it is not clear whether she is describing her own feelings or those of a character.
â€œDid you hear my covert narcissism I disguise as altruism like some kind of congressman,â€ she sings.
Swift has been increasingly vocal about her politics in recent years and backed Joe Biden and his vice-presidential pick Kamala Harris during the last US election.
There is a collaboration with Lana Del Rey, who also worked with Antonoff on a recent album, on the song Snow On The Beach.
Midnight Rain, meanwhile, sees Swiftâ€™s voice electronically manipulated to sound deeper and more robotic.
It describes a protagonist whose former partner â€œnever thinks of me except when I am on TVâ€.
Vigilante Shit offers a darker perspective with lyrics about â€œdressing for revengeâ€.
Swift took fans by surprise when she announced the new album in the closing moments of the 2022 MTV VMAs in New Jersey in August.
In a post on her Instagram to mark the albumâ€™s release, she shared a photo of herself with her collaborators, and singled out Antonoff as her â€œco-pilotâ€.
â€œHeâ€™s my friend for life (presumptuous I know but I stand by it) and weâ€™ve been making music together for nearly a decade HOWEVERâ€¦ this is our first album weâ€™ve done with just the two of us as main collaborators,â€ she wrote.
â€œWeâ€™d been toying with ideas and had written a few things we loved, but Midnights actually really coalesced and flowed out of us when our partners (both actors) did a film together in Panama.
â€œJack and I found ourselves back in New York, alone, recording every night, staying up late and exploring old memories and midnights past.â€
She continued: â€œMidnights is a collage of intensity, highs and lows and ebbs and flows.
â€œLife can be dark, starry, cloudy, terrifying, electrifying, hot, cold, romantic or lonely. Just like Midnights. â€
Swift has been busy in recent months, releasing a stand-alone single titled Carolina for the film Where the Crawdads Sing, and continuing to re-record her first six albums after the master recordings were acquired by talent manager Scooter Braun.
By creating new versions of the songs, the star can regain ownership of the music.
Midnights by Taylor Swift is out now.

title: Sad: Lana Del Rey Says Fewer Than 20 Words on Midnights
content:
Besties. Photo-Illustration: Vulture; Photos by Amy Sussman/Getty Images and Emma McIntyre/Getty Images for Interscope Records
When it was first announced, via Taylor Swiftâ€™s TikTok, that Midnightsâ€™ track-four â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ was going to feature Lana Del Rey, gay gasps echoed across the land (on Twitter). The collab didnâ€™t come as too much of a surprise, since both have long worked with the same producer, Mr. Jack Antonoff, and in 2019 Swift called Del Rey â€œthe most influential artist in pop.â€ The gag would obviously be how the two actually sounded together on a song (one fan jokingly thought the title alluded to doing cocaine on the beach for reasons you can look up on Urban Dictionary). Turns out: Itâ€™s about literal snow and we still donâ€™t know what Swift and Lana truly sound like together. Throughout the track, Miss Lana barely gets a full sentence in. Her feature is audibly pretty buried, only rising to sing the tiny chorus phrases â€œSnow on the beach,â€ â€œItâ€™s coming down,â€ and â€œAre we falling?â€ as well as the words â€œAhaâ€ and â€¦ â€œJanet.â€ The track â€” co-written by Swift, Del Rey, and Antonoff â€” also includes a sleigh bell-type ringing, and cheugy lyrics, like: â€œItâ€™s like snow at the beach / weird but fuckinâ€™ beautiful.â€ Maybe Lana originally gave more for us to hear, but pulled them after realizing she was just singing on a Christmas song.

title: Taylor Swift Releases New Album Midnights: Listen and Read the Full Credits
content:
Taylor Swift has released her 10th studio album, Midnights, which she announced while accepting the trophy for Video of the Year at MTVâ€™s Video Music Awards in August. In addition to the Lana Del Rey collaboration â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ Midnights features production and instrumentation from Swiftâ€™s longtime collaborator Jack Antonoff. Listen to the album and check out the credits below. (Pitchfork earns a commission from purchases made through affiliate links on our site.)
Three hours after releasing Midnights, Swift unveiled the â€œspecial very chaotic surpriseâ€ she had promised: a â€œ3am Editionâ€ of the album, featuring seven songs made â€œon the journeyâ€ to the proper album.
Midnights notably features contributions from ZoÃ« Kravitz and Swiftâ€™s boyfriend Joe Alwyn (under his pseudonym William Bowery). There are also numerous contributions from Jahaan Sweet, who is known for his work with Baby Keem and Kendrick Lamar, among others. Other contributors include Sam Dew and Sounwave, who are in the band Red Hearse with Jack Antonoff, as well as members of Antonoffâ€™s Bleachers live band, Evan Smith, Mikey Freedom Hart, Sean Hutchinson, Michael Riddleberger, and Zem Audu.
The â€œ3am Editionâ€ features three songs with Aaron Dessner, who worked closely on Folklore and Evermore but does not appear on the main Midnights album. On one of those three, â€œWouldâ€™ve, Couldâ€™ve, Shouldâ€™ve,â€ the Nationalâ€™s Bryce Dessner and Bryan Devendorf also feature. Bon Iverâ€™s Justin Vernon is credited among studio personnel and as an engineer on the track. Another of Dessnerâ€™s co-writes, â€œHigh Infidelity,â€ features contributions from Big Thief drummer James Krivchenia.
â€œMidnights is a collage of intensity, highs and lows and ebbs and flows,â€ Swift wrote on Twitter shortly after the release of her new LP. â€œLife can be dark, starry, cloudy, terrifying, electrifying, hot, cold, romantic or lonely. Just like Midnights.â€ She added that the record â€œis a wild ride of an album and [she] couldnâ€™t be happier that [her] co pilot on this adventure was @jackantonoff.â€ Swift continued, â€œHeâ€™s my friend for life (presumptuous I know but I stand by it) and weâ€™ve been making music together for nearly a decade.â€ Swift also thanked many of her additional collaborators, such as Del Rey, Kravitz, and more.
Prior to releasing Midnights, Swift shared a teaser trailer for the recordâ€™s forthcoming music videos. The clip compiles several different scenes from as yet unreleased Midnights visuals, indicating appearances from Laura Dern, Jack Antonoff, Haim, John Early, Mike Birbiglia, and Dita Von Teese. Mary Elizabeth Ellis, Pat McGrath, and Laith Ashley are also listed in the credits.

title: Taylor Swift drops â€˜3amâ€™ edition of â€˜Midnights,â€™ music video
content:
NEW YORK (AP) â€” Taylor Swift has said â€œMidnightsâ€ was inspired by certain key sleepless nights â€” something many of her fans undoubtedly experienced as the singer-songwriter dropped seven bonus tracks and a music video just hours after the albumâ€™s release Friday.
â€œMidnightsâ€ was released at, well, midnight Eastern time. With a runtime of around 44 minutes, listeners would have had the opportunity to play the album four times before Swift unleashed â€œMidnights (3am Edition).â€
â€œSurprise! I think of Midnights as a complete concept album, with those 13 songs forming a full picture of the intensities of that mystifying, mad hour,â€ she wrote on Instagram. â€œHowever! There were other songs we wrote on our journey to find that magic 13.â€
The bonus tracks fit tonally with the rest of the darkly electric and moody album, beginning with â€œThe Great War,â€ sweeping across â€œParisâ€ and exploring â€œHigh Infidelityâ€ before ending with â€œDear Reader.â€ In all, the seven additional songs â€” added to the end of the original â€œMidnightsâ€ track listing, encompass about 25 additional minutes.
Swift is the sole credited performer on the bonus tracks â€” the only person to get a featured credit on any â€œMidnightsâ€ track is Lana Del Rey. The extra songs are primarily written by Swift, Jack Antonoff â€” her â€œco pilotâ€ on the album â€” and Aaron Dessner, a founding member of The National and another frequent Swift collaborator who was otherwise absent from â€œMidnights.â€
And five hours after â€œMidnights (3am Edition),â€ Swift treated fans to a visual feast with a muted but lush music video for â€œAnti-Hero.â€
Written and directed by Swift herself, reunited with â€œAll Too Wellâ€ cinematographer Rina Yang, the video sees the singer be chased by chintzy sheet ghosts and do shots with a glammed-up double who instructs her: â€œEveryone will betray you.â€ Dark glitter oozes from the yolks she cuts into at the breakfast table, her wound from an arrow and her mouth after one too many shots.
â€œWatch my nightmare scenarios and intrusive thoughts play out in real time,â€ Swift posted on Instagram.
The video includes references to Swiftâ€™s eating disorder, which she revealed in a documentary, and pokes fun at herself with a cutscene that breaks in midway. It features Mike Birbiglia, John Early and Mary Elizabeth Ellis playing her heirs (Preston, Chad and Kimber) who discover sheâ€™s left them only 13 cents in her will (Swiftâ€™s favorite number is famously 13).
â€œThereâ€™s probably a secret encoded message that means something else!â€ Early exclaims in character, referencing the field of cryptology Swift has created over the years.
â€œP.S. There is no secret encoded message that means something else. Love, Taylor,â€ Birbiglia reads seconds later.
The â€œAnti-Heroâ€ video racked up more than 2 million views in the first three hours of its release and spawned the #TSAntiHeroChallenge. Swift is encouraging people to upload to YouTube Shorts a video of themselves sharing the traits that would make them an antihero. According to a blog post on YouTube, the challenge is â€œall about acknowledging and celebrating the traits that make each of us truly unique and showcasing oneâ€™s true self in a FUN way.â€
â€œAn anti-heroic trait could be as simple as always grabbing the last slice of pizza, clapping at the end of movies, always putting your feet on the car dashboard, using the same word to start your daily Wordle, leaving your clean laundry in the basket until the next time you do it, pretending you didnâ€™t already watch the next episode of the series you watch with your pals, or even treating your cat like a human,â€ the post said. Swift chose that last one for her own submission.
While the challenge adds levity to the release cycle, Swift is clear on the tone sheâ€™s going for with the album and its associated projects.
â€œMidnights is a collage of intensity, highs and lows and ebbs and flows,â€ Swift posted on Instagram when the original album dropped. â€œLife can be dark, starry, cloudy, terrifying, electrifying, hot, cold, romantic or lonely. Just like Midnights.â€
___
Associated Press journalists Sophia Rosenbaum and Christina Paciolla contributed to this report.
Copyright 2022 The Associated Press. All rights reserved.

title: Laptop en harde schijf met muziek en teksten Lana Del Rey kwijt
content:
Lana Del Rey roept fans op om niet naar haar nieuwe muziek te luisteren die online verspreid is. De nummers komen van haar laptop en harde schijf die een tijdje geleden uit haar auto zijn gestolen, zegt ze in een filmpje op social media.
"Luister alsjeblieft niet naar de muziek als je die hoort, want het komt nog niet uit", drukt de zangeres haar fans op het hart. Lana had enkele maanden geleden haar auto ergens in Los Angeles geparkeerd en kwam er bij terugkomst achter dat haar rugzak met haar laptop, harde schijf en drie camcorders waren gestolen.
Op afstand heeft de zangeres de gegevens op haar laptop moeten wissen, maar daarbij heeft ze ook het 200 pagina tellende concept voor haar boek moeten verwijderen. Daarover zegt ze dat ze er "met heel haar hart" van hield en er veel passie in gestopt heeft.

By creating new versions of the songs, the star can regain ownership of the music.

title: "Per favore non ascoltatelo"
content:
Le tracce sono iniziate a circolare in Rete dopo che il suo computer Ã¨ stato rubato dall'auto. "Qualche mese fa ho parcheggiato a Melrose Place e mi sono allontanata per un minuto. Per favore non ascoltate la musica perchÃ© non Ã¨ ancora uscita", ha chiesto ai fan.
"E' stata l'unica volta che avevo lasciato il mio zaino all'interno dell'auto, qualcuno ha rotto tutti i finestrini e lo ha preso. Dentro c'era il mio computer, tre videocamere e i miei hard drive", ha dichiarato la cantante. "Per favore, non ascoltare la musica se la senti, perchÃ© non Ã¨ ancora stata pubblicata"
La cantante ha spiegato che ha cancellato da remoto le tracce del futuro album presenti sul laptop. "Nonostante questo sono ancora fiduciosa nel fatto di registrare. Voglio continuare a fare del mio meglio e il miglior disco possibile, anche se significa ripartire da zero. Ovviamente non lascerÃ² mai piÃ¹ nulla in macchina, nemmeno per un momento", ha dichiarato.
Leggi Anche Chris Evans pubblica per errore una foto hot: la gaffe di Capitan America fa impazzire i follower
Gli hacker sono venuti in possesso non solo dei brani inediti, ma anche di un manoscritto al quale stava lavorando per la casa editrice Simon & Schuster, che nel 2020 pubblicÃ² la sua raccolta di poesie "Violet Bent Backwards Over the Grass". "Ho dovuto cancellare il mio libro di 200 pagine, di cui non avevo fatto il backup nel cloud. Per me Ã¨ stata una sfida scriverlo, amo il libro che ho perso con tutto il mio cuore e ci ho messo molta passione a scriverlo", ha confessato l'artista che ora dovrÃ  rimboccarsi le mani e iniziare da capo il progetto.
Al momento la Del Rey Ã¨ molto preoccupata di quello che potrebbe essere reso pubblico in futuro, inclusi due anni di foto e video che riguardano la sua famiglia. "Queste persone riescono ancora ad aver accesso al mio telefono, a rubare canzoni e foto personali. Spero che nient'altro possa venire rubato, ma purtroppo Ã¨ quello che sta avvenendo. E' difficile e davvero non posso fare nient'altro per rendere i miei dispositivi piÃ¹ sicuri", ha concluso con l'amaro in bocca.

title: Lana Del Rey vit actuellement le cauchemar de tout artiste
content:
Emma McIntyre / Getty Images for Interscope Reco Emma McIntyre / Getty Images for Interscope Reco
MUSIQUE - Câ€™est le cas de figure que beaucoup de gens redoutent : se faire voler ses affaires personnelles et voir ses donnÃ©es dÃ©voilÃ©es sur les rÃ©seaux sociaux. Câ€™est ce qui est malheureusement arrivÃ© Ã  Lana Del Rey et plusieurs de ses chansons inÃ©dites ont Ã©tÃ© dÃ©voilÃ©es.
Dans un post Instagram dont la visibilitÃ© est restreinte, la chanteuse de 37 ans a expliquÃ© mercredi 19 octobre quâ€™elle a Ã©tÃ© victime dâ€™un vol il y a quelques mois. Â« Jâ€™ai parquÃ© ma voiture Ã  Melrose Place (Ã  Los Angeles, ndlr). Je me suis Ã©loignÃ©e rien quâ€™une minute. Câ€™Ã©tait la premiÃ¨re fois que je laissais mon sac dans lâ€™habitacle. Quelquâ€™un a cassÃ© toutes les vitres et lâ€™a pris tout comme mon ordinateur, mes trois camÃ©scopes et mes disques durs Â», a-t-elle tÃ©moignÃ©.
Des chansons dÃ©voilÃ©es, un livre perdu, des images personnelles dans la nature
Lâ€™artiste dit avoir effacÃ© Ã  distance le contenu de son ordinateur qui contenait des morceaux inÃ©dits, mais aussi et surtout un livre sur lequel elle travaillait et qui devait Ãªtre publiÃ© par un Ã©diteur important : Â« Je nâ€™avais pas sauvegardÃ© mon bouquin sur le Cloud. Plus de 200 pages Ã©taient Ã©crites Â». Un livre quâ€™elle a dÃ©cidÃ© de totalement rÃ©Ã©crire : Â« Concernant le livre qui est dÃ©finitivement perdu, sachez que je lâ€™ai aimÃ© de tout mon cÅ“ur et que je lâ€™ai fait avec Ã©normÃ©ment de passion Â», dit-elle.
Pour ce qui est de ses chansons, qui auraient dÃ» Ãªtre sur son neuviÃ¨me album, le mal est visiblement dÃ©jÃ  fait. Elles auraient dÃ©jÃ  fuitÃ©, ainsi que des images personnelles. Â« Il nâ€™y a rien Ã  faire. Je ne peux pas rendre plus sÃ»rs mes appareils quâ€™ils ne les sont dÃ©jÃ . Cette situation est difficile Ã  vivre. Je ne pense pas quâ€™un appel au respect de la vie privÃ©e soit dâ€™une quelconque utilitÃ©, a-t-elle pestÃ©. Oui, je suis inquiÃ¨te par rapport aux images tournÃ©es ces deux derniÃ¨res annÃ©es qui pourraient encore Ãªtre publiÃ©es. Â» Lana Del Rey a ainsi suppliÃ© ses fans de ne pas Ã©coute ces morceaux sâ€™ils venaient Ã  les trouver sur internet.
Â« Ces vols sont un barrage Ã  la crÃ©ativitÃ©. En tout cas, maintenant, je ne laisserai plus jamais rien dans ma voiture. MÃªme pour une petite minute Â», a-t-elle conclu.

title: Everything We Know About Taylor Swiftâ€™s Midnights
content:
Miss Taylor. Photo: Amy Sussman/Getty Images
Taylor Swift doesnâ€™t believe in sleep anymore; she is endorsing late nights with her upcoming album, Midnights, which means sheâ€™s finally catching up to her fans who religiously stay up all night waiting for new social-media clues, legitimate fan theories, and, lately, TikToks from Swift herself, dropped at midnight with no warning. The latest project for Swifties? Trying to figure out what dates leading up to the Midnights release might be an Easter egg. May 13 cannot happen again! While all the Easter eggs and theories are still coming together, hereâ€™s everything we know about the album so far. We will be updating often â€” probably around midnight.
When are we staying up till midnight for Midnights?
After making a surprise album announcement at this yearâ€™s VMAs, Swift is dropping her tenth album, Midnights, at midnight ET on October 21.
Swift revealed a fun little schedule for the other components to her album release on her social channels October 17, animated to look like a bullet journal because of course Taylor Swift is a bullet-journal girlie. First, a teaser trailer will appear on Prime Video during the third quarter of Thursday Night Football on October 20. The next day, we will not only be blessed with a Taylor Swift album, but at 3 a.m., there will be a â€œspecial very chaotic surprise,â€ plus a music-video premiere for the first single off the album, â€œAnti-Hero,â€ and then a lyric video released at 8 p.m. Woo! Big day. Not that she stops there, of course. On Monday, October 24, sheâ€™ll be appearing on The Tonight Show With Jimmy Fallon, and then at midnight the next day, sheâ€™ll be releasing a second music video. Sheâ€™ll be capping off this round of publicity with an appearance on The Graham Norton Show on October 28, for all her Briâ€™ish folk. Is that enough Taylor for you Swifties?
How many songs will be on Midnights?
Swift announced Midnights would have 13 tracks, but she didnâ€™t share the names of the actual songs. Some fans speculated that the names of the songs would be â€œTrack One,â€ â€œTrack Two,â€ etc. However, when she posted a TikTok of limited-edition vinyls, parts of the video were blurred to hide the names of the songs. If you closer at the blurred tracks, you can see they are way longer than in the mock-up photo.
She has a history of working with Target for exclusive merch. The Reputation era had Swift-themed magazines, and the Lover era had the Lover journals. Target announced itâ€™ll be selling special-edition lavender vinyls and CDs; the latter will have three bonus songs: one original song and two remixes (please donâ€™t let this be a â€œwillowâ€ part two).
Whatâ€™s the vibe?
Glad you asked! Based on the three special-edition records with new album art, Midnights may be inspired by the music of the â€™60s, â€™70s, and â€™80s. TikToker @mrperfectlyfine13 pointed out that the electric piano (a Wurlitzer 206A) Swift is laying next to in the jade-green cover was manufactured between the mid-â€™70s and early â€™80s. If used, the sound of Midnights may be more like the Carpenters or the Mamas & the Papas, as TikToker @kelseylikesthings pointed out. Swift revealed that the back covers of the special-edition vinyl become a clock, and the newly released images seemingly confirm the â€™60s-to-â€™70s sound.
Target classified the album as pop, but as TikToker @thethriftyswiftie noticed, folklore, evermore, and Fearless (Taylorâ€™s Version) are categorized as pop albums despite their sounds being very different from one another. At midnight on October 17, a Times Square Spotify billboard shared the first lyric to the upcoming album: â€œI should not be left to my own devices.â€ Spotify posted the occurrence on Insta with the caption â€œWhere to next?â€, which seemingly implies that there will be more lyrics released on billboards throughout the globe. The next lyric was revealed in Londontown (home of a certain â€œLondon Boyâ€) and reads, â€œI polish up real nice.â€ In SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil, Swift debuted the line, â€œJust like clockwork, the dominoes cascaded in a line.â€ Then, Swift went to her career beginnings in Nashville, with the (â€œStory of Usâ€â€“adjacent) line, â€œDid you ever have someone kiss you in a crowded room?â€ The final lyric arrived in Mexico City â€” hola, Swifties! â€” 24 hours before the album is out. â€œBreathe in, breath through, breathe deep, breathe out,â€ it reads, which fans were quick to notice has already been used in her NYU commencement speech. Better hop on a private jet to make it back home by midnight, Swifties. Surely, Taylor has one sheâ€™ll lend you.
Whoâ€™s gonna be on the album?
According to a TikTok that Swift dropped during daylight hours on September 16, Jack Antonoff worked with her on Midnights. An unidentified birthday boy also worked on the album in some way, but fans are shown only a manâ€™s arm in the corner of the video. Could it be Justin Vernon? Probably. After rumors went around that the 1975 would be making a cameo, Matt Healy denied he would be on the album. The only formal feature to be confirmed is with Lana Del Rey; Swift revealed it in a TikTok about â€œSnow on the Beach.â€ â€œSnow on the Beach is about falling in love with someone at the same time theyâ€™re falling in love with you,â€ explained Swift in an Instagram reel. â€œSort of in this sort of cataclysmic, fated moment where you realize someone feels exactly the same way that you feel.â€
Swift prides herself on leaving Easter eggs well in advance, which is why the song in the background of that TikTok is interesting â€” â€œlife you leadâ€ looks like a debut track from a mysterious new artist named â€œniceboy ed.â€ Is he a potential featured artist? Did Swift have something to do with the song? Is he â€¦ Joe Alwyn?
Whatâ€™s on the track list?
Swift has been dropping track names every night at (what else?) midnight, in a TikTok series sheâ€™s been calling â€œMidnights Mayhem With Me.â€ She started on September 21, telling her fans that track 13 would be called â€œMastermind.â€ On October 7 â€” 13 nights before the release of Midnights â€” she dropped the final five tracks in a spree at a rate of one per hour. That included the double reveal that track four, â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ would be her long-rumored Lana Del Rey collaboration. However, Swift has yet to release the name of the bonus track and the two remixes, which some suspect to be â€œVigilante Shitâ€ and â€œAnti-Hero,â€ as Swift is holding the phone upside down during her announcement videos. The songwriters, including Jack Antonoff, Lana Del Rey, and ZoÃ« Kravitz, were found on iTunes ahead of the album drop. Below, the compete track list for Midnights.
1. Lavender Haze: Taylor Swift, Jack Antonoff, ZoÃ« Kravitz, Mark Anthony Spears, Jahaan Akil Sweet & Sam Dew
2. Maroon: Taylor Swift & Jack Antonoff
3. Anti-Hero: Taylor Swift & Jack Antonoff
4. Snow on the Beach (featuring Lana Del Rey): Taylor Swift, Jack Antonoff & Lana Del Rey
5. Youâ€™re on Your Own, Kid: Taylor Swift & Jack Antonoff
6. Midnight Rain: Taylor Swift & Jack Antonoff
7. Question â€¦ ?: Taylor Swift & Jack Antonoff
8. Vigilante Shit: Taylor Swift
9. Bejeweled: Taylor Swift & Jack Antonoff
10. Labyrinth: Taylor Swift & Jack Antonoff
11. Karma: Taylor Swift, Jack Antonoff, Mark Anthony Spears, Keanu Torres & Jahaan Akil Sweet
12. Sweet Nothing: Taylor Swift & William Bowery
13. Mastermind: Taylor Swift & Jack Antonoff
The special Lavender Edition, exclusive to Target, will have three bonus tracks: â€œHits Different,â€ â€œYouâ€™re On Your Own, Kid (Strings Remix),â€ and â€œSweet Nothing (Piano Remix).â€
3 bonus tracks on CD #OnlyAtTarget ğŸ’œ Preorder Taylor Swift's new album Midnights Target Exclusive Lavender Edition now: https://t.co/0taF5xTrOe #TSmidnighTS pic.twitter.com/LZg9t2Oyw2 â€” Target (@Target) September 13, 2022
Is there going to be a tour?
Despite the endless amount of blind items about an upcoming megatour, Swift hasnâ€™t made any announcements â€¦ yet.
This post has been updated.

title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s Midnights tracklist -Lana Del Rey collab, Kimye feud and Mad Men reference
content:
Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Want all the latest Showbiz news direct to your inbox? Share your email for news, gossip and more
Pop star Taylor Swift will release her 10th studio album tomorrow (October 21), titled Midnights.
The Blank Space songstress has been kept busy over the past two years thanks to re-recording her first six albums and the release of her lockdown projects Folklore and Evermore - but now she is back once again with 13 new songs for her loyal fanbase.
The singer announced the new album at the 2022 MTV Video Music Awards in August, 13 years on from the infamous Kanye West incident.
Taylor, who is known for her 'easter egg' surprises, confirmed the tracklist for Midnights via a fun social media game called Midnights Mayhem With Me (MMWM).
But what is the full tracklist for Midnights and what are the songs about?
Here's everything you need to know:
Lavender Haze
(Image: GC Images)
Lavender Haze is the first song on the Midnights album.
The title was confirmed by the singer during the ninth episode of MMWM and following the announcement, Taylor posted a short video on Instagram explaining where she got the idea for this song and what it is about.
In the video, she said she found inspiration for the song from TV series Mad Men and her relationship with long-term partner Joe Alwyn.
She said: â€œI happened upon the phrase â€˜Lavender Hazeâ€™ when I was watching Mad Men and I looked it up because I thought it sounded cool, and it turns out that it was a common phrase that was used in the â€™50s where they would just describe being in love.
â€œLike, If you were in the â€˜Lavender Haze,â€™ that meant you were in that all-encompassing love glow, and I thought that was really beautiful.â€
She went on to reveal that the song reflects on her relationship with Conversations With Friends actor Joe, who she has been dating for the last six years.
The singer added: â€œI guess theoretically, when youâ€™re in the lavender haze, youâ€™ll do anything to stay there and not let people bring you down off of that cloud.
â€œI think a lot of people have to deal with this now, not just â€˜public figuresâ€™, because we live in the era of social media. If the world finds out that youâ€™re in love with somebody, theyâ€™re going to weigh in on it.
â€œWeâ€™ve had to dodge weird rumours, tabloid stuff, and we just ignore it. This song is sort of about the act of ignoring that stuff to protect the real stuff.â€
The actor has also played a role in the songwriting process behind some of Taylor's songs and he has co-writing credits on both Folklore and Evemore under the pseudonym William Bowery.
Maroon
Maroon is the second album on Taylor's Midnights album, which was announced in the fifth episode of MMWM.
The song has been written by both Taylor and her celeb pal Jack Antonoff, who features on 11 songs on the Midnights album.
Jack has joined the Cardigan singer on numerous songs throughout her 16-year career and has songwriting credits on the likes of Lover, Cruel Summer and Look What You Made Me Do.
Anti Hero
Anti-Hero is the third song on Midnights and was announced during the sixth episode of MMWM.
Following the announcement, Taylor took to Instagram to call the song â€œone of my favourite songs Iâ€™ve ever writtenâ€.
She added: â€œI really donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve delved this far into my insecurities in this detail before.
â€œYou know I struggle a lot with the idea that my life has become unmanageably sized, and not to sound too dark, I just struggle with the idea of not feeling like a person.â€
The 32-year-old then went on to say that Anti-Hero is a "guided tour" of all the things she dislikes about herself.
She said: â€œWe all hate things about ourselves and itâ€™s all of those aspects of the things we dislike and like about ourselves that we have to come to terms with if weâ€™re going to be this person.
â€œYeah, I like Anti-Hero a lot because I think itâ€™s really honest.â€
It has also been confirmed that Anti-Hero will be the lead single of Midnights, with a music video set to drop on October 21.
Snow On The Beach
(Image: WireImage)
Snow On The Beach is the fourth song on the album and was announced in the 13th episode of MMWM.
During the announcement, Taylor confirmed that the song was a collaboration with none other than Video Games singer Lana Del Rey.
The Shake It Off singer said in the episode: â€œSnow on the Beach featuring Lana Del Rey is track four on Midnights and I cannot get through that sentence without grinning because I am such a massive fan of Lana Del Rey."
When speaking about the inspiration behind the song, Taylor said it's about â€œfalling in love with someone at the same time as theyâ€™re falling in love with you, in this sort of cataclysmic, fated moment where you realise someone feels exactly the same way that you feel at the same momentâ€,
She added: â€œYouâ€™re kind of looking around going like, â€˜Wait, is this real? Is this a dream? Is this for real? Is this happening? Is it really happening?'
â€œKind of like it would be if you were to see snow falling on a beach.â€
You're On Your Own, Kid
You're On Your Own Kid is the fifth song on Midnights and was announced during the 10th episode of MMWM.
The three minute and 14 second song has been written by both Taylor and Bleachers singer Jack.
Midnight Rain
Midnight Rain is the sixth song on Midnights and was announced during episode four of MMWM.
This song has also been written by Taylor and Jack, and is two minutes and 54 seconds long.
Question...?
(Image: Getty Images for MTV)
Question...? is the seventh song on Midnights and was announced during episode three of MMWM.
The three minutes and 30 seconds song is another hit by Taylor and Jack.
Vigilante Sh*t
Vigilante Sh*t is the eighth song on the album and was announced during episode two of MMWM.
This is Taylor's first song with a swear word in the title and is the only song on the album that is solely written by the All Too Well star.
Bejewelled
(Image: WireImage)
Bejewelled is the ninth song on Midnights and the title was announced during the seventh episode of MMWM.
This is another song that has been written by Taylor and Jack.
Labyrinth
Labyrinth is the 10th song on Midnights and was announced during the 11th episode of MMWM.
During the announcement, Taylor told fans that this song would be "worth the wait".
It has also been written alongside record producer Jack.
Karma
(Image: Getty Images)
Karma is the 11th song on Midnights and the title was announced during the eighth episode of MMWM.
This title announcement noticeably caused a stir with Swifties as Taylor cackled while confirming the 11th track.
Fans questioned whether the laughter was on purpose as a longtime theory suggested that Taylor Swift's 10th album was supposed to be titled Karma.
The theory dates back to 2016 and there has been speculation that the song could be about Taylor's feud with Kanye West and Kim Kardashian.
One fan said on Twitter : "Karma is definitely about Kanye because it's definitely not a coincidence that it's Track 11.
"When Innocent [her song where she initially forgave Kanye for the 2009 VMA incident], is Track 11 too."
The feud between the celebs began after Kanye humiliated Taylor on stage at the VMA's in 2009 by interrupting her acceptance speech for Best Female Video.
The drama seemingly died down between Taylor and Kanye until the rapper released his song Famous.
In the lyrics for the song, Kanye raps: "I feel like me and Taylor might still have sex. Why? I made that b*tch famous."
The feud then erupted once more after Kanye's ex-wife Kim 'leaked' a voice recording of Taylor 'confirming' the lyric after the singer claimed she wasn't aware of the term "I made that b*tch famous".
Taylor went on to disappear from the limelight following the feud, later releasing album Reputation to tell her version of events in songs Look What You Made Me Do and This Is Why We Can't Have Nice Things.
The full phone conversation between the singer and Kanye was later leaked online to reveal the extent of the conversation.
Sweet Nothing
Sweet Nothing is the 12th track on Midnights and was announced during the 12th episode of MMWM.
The song has been penned by Taylor and William Bowery, aka her boyfriend Joe.
Mastermind
Mastermind is the 13th and final song on Taylor's Midnights album.
The title was revealed during the first episode of MMWM and is the last of the collaborations between the singer and Jack on Midnights.

title: Lana Del Rey's cameras, laptop containing new album stolen in smash-and-grab
content:
Lana Del Rey pleaded with fans not to listen to leaked music after some of her prized items were stolen in a California smash-and-grab.
The New York native, 37, told fans that thieves took her backpack containing her computer, multiple hard drives, and a camcorder.
â€œA few months ago, I parked my car on Melrose Place â€” actually Melrose Ave. in Los Angeles â€” and I stepped away for a minute,â€ she said in a now-deleted Instagram Live video Wednesday.
â€œAnd the one time I left my backpack inside my car, someone broke all the windows and took it.â€
The singer was in the process of writing a book for publishing giant Simon & Schuster but revealed the 200-page manuscript was among the items stolen, as well as a camcorder filled with irreplaceable family footage.
Lana Del Rey said her backpack â€” containing her computer and multiple hard drives â€” had been stolen. All About Celebrities Lana Del Rey said her ninth studio album and a book she was in the process of writing were on the laptop. All About Celebrities
â€œI had to remotely wipe the computer that had my 200-page book for Simon and Schusterâ€”which I didnâ€™t have backed up on the cloud,â€ she said.
â€œAnd despite that, people are still able to remotely access my phone and leak our songs and personal photos. I loved the book that I lost with all of my heart and put a lot of passion into it.â€
The â€œRideâ€ hitmaker, whose real name is Elizabeth Grant, said her ninth studio album was also loaded up on the stolen laptop, adding even more stress to the situation.
Lana Del Rey begged fans not to listen to any leaked music, saying if fans do hear anything new â€” itâ€™s because â€œitâ€™s not coming out yet.â€ Getty Images
The singer/songwriter, however, said sheâ€™s â€œconfidentâ€ the album will eventually make it to an official release following last yearâ€™s album titled â€œBlue Banisters,â€ but admitted she has to â€œstart over.â€
Want more celebrity and pop culture news? Start your day with Page Six Daily. Enter your email address Please provide a valid email address. By clicking above you agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. Thanks for signing up!
Want celebrity news as it breaks? Hooked on Housewives? Check out more newsletters
â€œI just want to mention that despite all of this happening, I am confident in the record to comeâ€”despite so many safety factors at so many different levels. I really want to persist and make the best record I can,â€ she said.
She went on to urge fans to ignore anything that gets leaked, including new music and personal footage.
â€œPlease donâ€™t listen to the music if you hear it, because itâ€™s not coming out yet,â€ she said.
â€œObviously I wonâ€™t ever leave anything in the car again, even if itâ€™s just for a moment. But weâ€™ve had the same issues at the house, and it is a constant thing. And although Iâ€™m so grateful to be able to share all of the good stuff, I just also want to share that it has been a challenge.â€
