title: Lana Del Rey Loses 200-Page Book, Family Footage In Car Break-In
content:
Grammy nominee Lana Del Rey has learned an important lesson: always back up your work.
Del Rey was the victim earlier this year of a car break-in. Her backpack containing her computer, multiple hard drives, and a camcorder were taken.
â€œA few months ago, I parked my car on Melrose Place (actually Melrose Ave. in Los Angeles) and I stepped away for a minute,â€ she shared in an Instagram Live video today. â€œAnd the one time I left my backpack inside my car, someone broke all of the windows and took it.â€
Lost in the theft was a 200-page book she was working on for Simon & Schuster. She also lost family footage on the camcorder.
â€œI had to remotely wipe the computer that had my 200-page book for Simon and Schusterâ€”which I didnâ€™t have backed up on the cloud,â€ she continued. â€œAnd despite that, people are still able to remotely access my phone and leak our songs and personal photos.â€
Despite all that, she has a ninth album on the way.
â€œI just want to mention that despite all of this happening, I am confident in the record to comeâ€”despite so many safety factors in so many different levels,â€ Lana said. â€œI really want to persist and make the best art I can.â€
She also has the song â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ on Taylor Swiftâ€˜s upcoming album, Midnights, out Oct. 21.

title: Lana Del Rey Reveals Her Laptop With New Music Was Stolen From Her Car
content:
Watch : Taylor Swift Reveals Meaning Behind Lana Del Rey Collab
Down on the west coast, Lana Del Rey's car was broken into.
"A few months ago, I parked my car on Melrose Place [in Los Angeles] and I stepped away for a minute," the "Young and Beautiful" singer shared in an Instagram Live video Oct. 19. "And the one time I left my backpack inside my car someone broke all of the windows and took it."
Lana went on to explain that inside the backpack was her computer along with multiple hard drives and camcorders.
"I had to remotely wipe the computer that had my 200-page book for Simon and Schusterâ€”which I didn't have backed up on the cloud," she continued. "And despite that, people are still able to remotely access my phone and leak our songs and personal photos."
However, the Grammy nominee isn't letting this stop her from releasing her ninth studio album, despite "so many safety factors."

title: Lana Del Rey loses 200-page manuscript in car theft
content:
Lana Del Rey has revealed that her backpack containing a laptop, three video cameras, and multiple hard drives, was stolen from her car.
Speaking on Instagram the Grammy-nominated artist appealed to fans not to listen to the unfinished songs that have leaked since the robbery. She also shared that a 200-page manuscript for her upcoming book, which was not backed up, has been lost.
She said: "I had to remotely wipe the computer that had my 200-page book for Simon & Schuster, which I didn't have backed up on a cloud.
"And despite that, people are still able this week to remotely access my phone and leak our songs and personal photos."
"Please don't listen to the music if you hear it because itâ€™s not coming out yet," Del Rey added.
"And, in terms of the book, I loved the book that I lost with all of my heart and put a lot of passion into it. And in terms of the camcorders, we shall see what happens with that."
Del Rey is currently working on her ninth studio album and assured fans, that despite the leaks she is "confident in the record".
She said: "I just want to mention that despite all of this happening, I am confident in the record to comeâ€”despite so many safety factors on so many different levels.
"I really want to persist and make the best art I can."
Click here for more music news.

title: Lana Del Rey Lost Music, Manuscript in a Robbery
content:
Photo: Rodin Eckenroth/FilmMagic
Lana Del Rey took to Instagram to inform her fans about a recent robbery and what exactly was taken from her (and us, the fans). On her @honeymoon private account, Del Rey said that her computer, three cam-corders, and multiple external hard drives were stolen from her car. The thieves have leaked songs, and forced LDR to remote wipe a 200-page manuscript that she did not have backed up on the cloud. â€œPeople are still able this week to remotely access my phone and leak our songs and personal photos,â€ she said. â€œDespite all of this happening, I am confident in the record to come.â€ Del Rey also said that sheâ€™s worried about what may come out, including two years of footage of her family. She asked people to not listen to the music, if it leaks. â€œIâ€™m hoping that nothing else becomes available or stole,â€ she said. â€œI donâ€™t really like to share things that are going not to plan. Itâ€™s why Iâ€™ve been private in the first place, and it doesnâ€™t really seem to have any bearing on whether or not things actually stay private.â€

title: Lana Del Rey Lost Her Unreleased Music & Book After Devices Stolen
content:
Lana Del Rey took to social media on Instagram this week to share a series of videos explaining that her laptop, hard drives and camcorders were stolen from her car while she was out on Melrose Place in Los Angeles.
Explore Explore Lana Del Rey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
As a result, the star shared that she lost a 200-page manuscript for her upcoming book from Simon & Schuster, which she had not backed up and must start over. And while she erased the contents of the laptop remotely, Del Rey said she still is noticing unreleased songs being leaked online.
â€œPlease donâ€™t listen to the music if you hear it because itâ€™s not coming out yet,â€ she asked of her fans. â€œAnd in terms of the book, I loved the book that I lost with all of my heart and put a lot of passion into it. And in terms of the camcorders, we shall see what happens with that.â€
On a positive note, Del Rey is just days away from being featured on Taylor Swiftâ€™s upcoming album Midnights on the LPâ€™s track, â€œSnow on the Beach.â€ Swift shared that her collaborator is â€œone of the best musical artists ever. The fact that I get to exist at the same time as her is an honor and a privilege.â€ Midnights arrives on Friday (Oct. 21).
See below for the full message from Del Rey, screen recorded and shared by a fan Twitter page.

title: Lana Del Rey Updates Fans, Says She Lost Music and Book Manuscript on Stolen Hard Drives
content:
Lana Del Rey has said she was recently robbed. The singer-songwriter took to her @honeymoon Instagram account to post a series of videos in which she claimed that a laptop, three video cameras, and multiple hard drives were stolen from her car. Because of this, various unfinished songs have been leaked, and a 200-page manuscript for her upcoming book, which she said was not backed up, has been lost.
â€œI had to remotely wipe the computer that had my 200-page book for Simon & Schuster, which I didnâ€™t have backed up on a cloud,â€ she said. â€œAnd despite that, people are still able this week to remotely access my phone and leak our songs and personal photos.â€
She went on to ask fans not to look for the leaks: â€œPlease donâ€™t listen to the music if you hear it because itâ€™s not coming out yet,â€ Del Rey said. â€œAnd, in terms of the book, I loved the book that I lost with all of my heart and put a lot of passion into it. And in terms of the camcorders, we shall see what happens with that.â€
Lana Del Rey has since deleted the series of videos, and, when reached by Pitchfork, representatives for the musician offered no additional comment. Pitchfork has also reached out to representatives for Simon & Schuster.

title: â€˜How Could I Live 6 Daysâ€™ - WTA No.1 Shares Her Love for Music Stars Taylor Swift and Lana Del Rey and Fans Canâ€™t Get Enough of It
content:
Published 10/18/2022, 7:10 AM EDT
Iga Swiatek has had a splendid year. She claimed two Grand Slam titles and rose to the ranking of WTA No.1. Further, with her latest win in the San Diego Open, she has marked eight titles under her name this season. These marvelous records show how busy she has been on the tour. In fact, if someone asks how busy a person has to be to miss out on oneâ€™s favorite singerâ€™s album, Swiatekâ€™s 2022 WTA season is the standard.
ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad
The Pole shocked herself when she stumbled upon the news of a dream collaboration between Lana Del Rey and her beloved pop star, Taylor Swift. She was sad that the hectic schedule of her sport forced her to be among the last ones to know.
ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad
The WTA no.1 fan-girling over Taylor Swift
Taylor Swift is a multiple Grammy award-winning American singer-songwriter. Swiftâ€™s latest album, â€˜Midnightsâ€™ will reach the market on October 21 and one of the albumâ€™s songs will feature Lana Del Rey. The singer herself broke the news and her fans are over the moon. After hearing about the dream collaboration, Swiatek took to Twitter to vent out her disappointment. She wrote. â€œI definitely play too much tennis if I didnâ€™t know that Taylor Swift & Lana Del Rey recorded song together.â€
â€œHow could I live 6 days without knowing?â€ she added. To her revelation, fans of both the entities had some interesting responses. Many were just happy to know that tennis ace just like them is Swift fan.
Others pointed how down-to-earth Swiatek is and the fame she has earned didnâ€™t stop her from being true to herself. Also, one was taken aback by the innocence in her.
Another fan tweeted, â€œHOW IS IT POSSIBLE THAT THERE ARE PEOPLE WHO DISLIKE THIS LADY?â€ (Google Translate)
Iga Swiatek uses music to calm her nerves
ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad
Almost every player has a playlist to which they tune in before matches to get a hold of their emotions. However, to a few, music means much more than momentary disassociation from the background noise. The 21-year-old is one of those stars.
DIVE DEEPER
â€˜Huge Respect for Everything That You Have Doneâ€™ â€“ Iga Swiatek Shares Her Grand Meeting With Serena Williams at US Open 2022
She is among the athletes who seek calmness and warmth in songs. The most recent example of her opting for the same is when she faced an early dismissal in Wimbledon. Her winning streak, which started at the Qatar Open, came to an end in London. Although she executed a fantastic 37-match win streak, all people could see was her failure.
ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad
Watch this story: The Greatest Comebacks in Tennis
Therefore, in order to get herself from that state of mind and muffle the hatred targeted towards her, she attended an Adele concert. Swiatek, after her third-round defeat in Wimbledon, took a break and cheered herself up with the famous singerâ€™s melodies and thanked her later on Twitter for the same.

title: Taylor Swift Reveals â€˜Midnightsâ€™ Track List on TikTok
content:
The Riddler (Taylorâ€™s Version). Photo: TikTok
A few weeks ago, Taylor Swift released her most cryptic, impenetrable riddle yet. On TikTok, Swift posted that track 13 of her latest album, Midnights, would be called â€œMastermind.â€ Like, what could that even mean? Okay, letâ€™s think it through, Batman â€™66 style. She said the track title into a red phone. Red is an album that she has already done the â€œTaylorâ€™s Versionâ€ of. Repetition. Reputation? â€œThe old Taylor canâ€™t come to the phone right now. Why? Oh, â€™cause sheâ€™s dead.â€ Taylor Swift is a clone. Itâ€™s the only thing that fits. No possible other meaning could come from â€œTrack 13 is called â€˜Mastermind.â€™â€
In all seriousness, Taylor Swift has been dropping straightforward announcements of Midnightsâ€™ track names on TikTok. Now, weâ€™ve cracked the full track list. Swift revealed the first eight tracks (at midnight, naturally) with the help of a bingo-ball cage to randomize which track names get announced when. Then, on October 7 (with 13 nights left to Midnights), she decided that she wanted to â€œmayhem til the morningâ€ and began announcing a track every hour. For the majority of her reveals, she had the same nails on as she did at TIFF, so make of that what you will.
Track 11 is titled â€œKarma,â€ which may be a reference to the alleged secret unreleased 2016 album of the same name. Meanwhile, the albumâ€™s first track, â€œLavender Haze,â€ is inspired by her six-year relationship with Joe Alwyn. And the final reveal, â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ (No. 4), is her long-rumored collaboration with Lana Del Rey. Below is the albumâ€™s full track list â€” yes, including track five.
1. Lavender Haze
2. Maroon
3. Anti-Hero
4. Snow on the Beach (featuring Lana Del Rey)
5. Youâ€™re on Your Own, Kid
6. Midnight Rain
7. Question â€¦ ?
8. Vigilante Shit
9. Bejeweled
10. Labyrinth
11. Karma
12. Sweet Nothing
13. Mastermind
The special (sigh) Lavender Edition, exclusive to Target, will have three bonus tracks: â€œHits Different,â€ â€œYouâ€™re On Your Own, Kid (Strings Remix),â€ and â€œSweet Nothing (Piano Remix).â€
3 bonus tracks on CD #OnlyAtTarget ğŸ’œ Preorder Taylor Swift's new album Midnights Target Exclusive Lavender Edition now: https://t.co/0taF5xTrOe #TSmidnighTS pic.twitter.com/LZg9t2Oyw2 â€” Target (@Target) September 13, 2022
This post has been updated.

title: Taylor Swift gives insight into â€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™ featuring Lana Del Rey
content:
File footage
Taylor Swift details her experience on working with Lana Del Rey for their latest collaboration on Snow on the Beach.
The new track is one of the most anticipated songs from Taylorâ€™s upcoming project Midnights.
Taking to her Instagram handle, the Folklore singer, 32, shared a video and detailed her experience on working with the Summertime Sadness crooner.
Taylor revealed that she is â€˜such a massive fan of Lana Del Reyâ€™ and shared the meaning behind the pairâ€™s latest collaboration.
â€œSnow On The Beach is about falling in love with someone at the same time as theyâ€™re falling in love with you,â€ Taylor explained.
The Wildest Dreams singer continued, saying, â€œAnd youâ€™re kind of looking around going, â€˜Wait, is this real? Is this a dream? Is this really happening?â€™ Kind of like it would be if you were to see snow falling on a beach.â€
Taylor also expressed her love for Lana, saying, â€œLana Del Rey, in my opinion, is one of the best musical artists ever. The fact that I get to exist at the same time as her is an honour and a privilege.â€
â€œAnd the fact that she would be so generous as to collaborate with us on this song is something Iâ€™m gonna be grateful forâ€¦ for life. Absolutely love her, and really I hope you love this song as much as I do,â€ she concluded.
Snow on the Beach will appear on Taylorâ€™s 10th studio album Midnights, which is due for release on October 21.

title: Taylor Swift Opens Up About How Mad Men Inspired A Track On Her New Album Midnights And Working With Lana Del Rey
content:
Taylor Swift has finally released her entire track list for her album, and there are a lot of incredible songs and references that fans will be dissecting until Midnights is finally released on October 21st. However Swift is currently giving fans at least some insight into what to expect from the album, including some of her inspirations behind her music --some of which comes surprisingly from the show Mad Men. The â€œAugustâ€ singer also opened up about what it's like working with Lana Del Rey, who will be excitingly featured on this album.
Taylor Swift Injecting Mad Men Into Midnights
In a series of intermittently released Instagram videos, Swift has opened up on some of the strongest influences on her new album. This has given fans insight into her writing process, and what to expect from the new album, which many fans have pointed out is aesthetically different from her last album, evermore. In one of her recent videos, the pop star revealed how she came up with the title for the song, â€œLavender Haze,â€ and how the popular Jon Hamm-led AMC show is involved. Swift divulged:
I happened upon the phrase â€˜Lavender Hazeâ€™ when I was watching Mad Men and I looked it up because I thought it sounded cool. It turns out itâ€™s a common phrase that was used in the 50s where they would just describe being in love. Like if you were in the â€˜Lavender Hazeâ€™ it meant that you were in an all-encompassing love glow, and I thought that that was really beautiful.
The singer goes on to talk about how the song is about how people on the outside of a relationship will try to take people out of a lavender haze when those in love try to stay in it. She relates it back to her six year relationship with Joe Alwyn, and how the media and tabloids constantly weigh in on their relationship. Alwyn has been a subject for her music in the past, and has even contributed to some of Swift's albums in a songwriting capacity.
Who knew Mad Men had such an effect on Swift and her writing? I wonder if the cast knows she is such a fan! Swift has admittedly been an avid television fan in the past, even admitting her song off Reputation, â€œI Did Something Badâ€ is partially inspired by Game of Thrones, proving not all of her songs are about her relationships. She also famously named her cats â€œOliviaâ€ after Olivia Benson on Law and Order: SVU, and "Meredith" after Meredith Grey on Grey's Anatomy. I guess the â€œShake it Offâ€ singerâ€™s creative inspiration comes from everywhere, including the small screen.
Working With Lana Del Rey
While â€œLavender Hazeâ€ was an exciting song for Swifties to learn more about, itâ€™s not the only track Swift has detailed in her Instagram videos. The pop icon also talked about the fourth track on the album, Snow on the Beach. This song is particularly interesting for Swift fans, because it marks her first ever collaboration with another iconic pop star, Lana Del Rey. Swift could not be more excited to talk about another strong female voice in the pop music world she had the pleasure to collaborate with. Swift revealed:
'Snow on the Beach featuring Lana Del Rey' is Track 4 on Midnights, and I can not get through that sentence without grinning because I am such a massive fan of Lana Del Rey, more on that laterâ€¦.Lana del Ray is in my opinion one of the best musical artists ever. The fact that I get to exist at the same time as her is an honor and a privilege, and that she would be so generous to collaborate with us on this song is something I am going to be grateful for, for life. Absolutely love her, and I really hope you love this song as much as I do.
I love that Taylor Swift is just as obsessed with Lana Del Rey as many of us are. Many of Swiftâ€™s more ethereal tracks off of folklore have been noted as emulating Del Rey in the way they are constructed, and Swift has been a rumored fan for a long time. Iâ€™m so excited to see how these unique sounds intersect. Swift has collaborated with other amazing talents before like Bon Iver on â€œExileâ€ (which was featured on the Netflix show, You), and Phoebe Bridgers on â€œNothing New (Taylorâ€™s Version).â€ Both songs are beautiful and capture the artistsâ€™ sensibilities, so I feel â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ should be just as exquisite.
Midnights will be releasing on October 21st, so it wonâ€™t be long before Swifties get to hear what their favorite pop princess has been working on and teasing. In addition, Swift is part of the ensemble cast in David Oâ€™Russellâ€™s Amsterdam, which is currently in theaters now. For more information on other movies releasing in theaters later this year, check out our 2022 movie schedule.

title: Taylor Swift Talks Lana Del Rey on â€˜Midnightsâ€™ Track â€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™
content:
Taylor Swift pulled back the curtain on one of the most anticipated tracks on her upcoming Midnights project on Tuesday night (Oct. 11) â€” at midnight, naturally â€” when she described the inspiration for her collaboration with Lana Del Rey on â€œSnow on the Beach.â€
â€œâ€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™ featuring Lana Del Rey is track four on Midnights and I cannot get through that sentence without grinning because I am such a massive fan of Lana Del Rey,â€ said Swift, who wore an appropriately fall-colored stripey top for the latest missive about her 10th studio album, which is due out on Oct. 21.
The singer described the song as being about, â€œfalling in love with someone at the same time as theyâ€™re falling in love with you, sort of in this sort of cataclysmic, fated moment where you realize someone feels exactly the same way that you feelâ€¦ at the same moment.â€ She described that moment as feeling like, â€œâ€™Wait, is this real? Is this a dream? Is this for real? Is this happening? Is this really happening?â€™ Kind of like it would be if you were to see snow falling on a beach.â€
Though she said she would reveal more about working with LDR in the future, Taylor could not help but gush a bit about her â€œSnowâ€ collaborator, saying that in her opinion Lana is â€œone of the best musical artists ever. The fact that I get to exist at the same time as her is an honor and a privilege.â€ In fact, Taylor said she will be â€œgratefulâ€¦ for lifeâ€ for the chance to work with Lana on the track.
Itâ€™s not the first time Swift has had high praise for LDR. During her speech at the Billboard Women In Music 2019 event, TayTay described the â€œVideo Gamesâ€ singer as â€œone of my favorite artists of this decadeâ€ and â€œin my opinion the most influential artist in pop.â€
Click here to review everything we know so far about Midnights.
Check out Swiftâ€™s post below.

title: Whatâ€™s Your Favorite New Release of the Week? Vote!
content:
Weâ€™re still two weeks away from Christmas but the gifts keep coming early for music fans with long-awaited albums and surprise singles arriving from their favorite stars. And as always, Billboard wants to know which new release youâ€™re most grateful for this holiday season!
On Friday (Dec. 9), SZAâ€˜s hotly anticipated sophomore album SOS finally arrived after a five-and-a-half year wait. Preceded by lead single â€œShirtâ€ and a tease of â€œNobody Gets Me,â€ the studio set follows the recent Billboard cover starâ€˜s smash 2017 debut album Ctrl, which spawned hits like â€œDrew Barrymore,â€ â€œLove Galoreâ€ and â€œThe Weekend.â€
Then thereâ€™s Lana Del Rey, who shocked her fans earlier this week with the surprise announcement of her upcoming ninth album, Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd. The pop songstress even sweetened the reveal by unveiling the title track â€” a reflective, choir-backed ballad in the form of her early releases â€” in all its sweeping, wistful glory.
Polo G and Paramore also released new singles on Friday, with the rapper previewing his forthcoming project set for 2023 with â€œMy Allâ€ and the pop-punk stalwarts unfurling â€œThe Newsâ€ ahead of their comeback LP This Is Why dropping on Feb. 10.
A Boogie wit da Hoodie, meanwhile, shared his combatively titled fourth studio album, Me vs. Myself, which includes collabs with the likes of H.E.R. (â€œPlayaâ€), Roddy Ricch (â€œB.R.O. (Better Ride Out)â€), Kodak Black (â€œWater (Drowning Pt. 2)â€) G Herbo (â€œLast Timeâ€) and more.
Vote for the new music youâ€™re loving the most in BIllboardâ€˜s weekly poll below.

title: SZA and Phoebe Bridgersâ€™s Team-Up, and 8 More New Songs
content:
The name of Lana Del Reyâ€™s new single â€” the title track from her forthcoming eighth album â€” may seem like a mouthful, but as she repeats it across this nearly five-minute ballad, it becomes a hypnotic incantation. â€œOcean Blvdâ€ continues in the pleasantly meandering, piano-driven style that has served Del Rey so well on her last few albums, spotlighting her lyrical musings and the swells of emotion in her vocals. She moves elegantly between the minute and the universal here, making an observation about a specific time stamp in a Harry Nilsson song one moment, and the next imploring, vulnerably, â€œLove me until I love myself.â€ ZOLADZ
Caroline Polachek, â€˜Welcome to My Islandâ€™

title: New Music Releases: SZA, A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie, Polo G
content:
Billboardâ€™s First Stream serves as a handy guide to this Fridayâ€™s most essential releases â€” the key music that everyone will be talking about today, and that will be dominating playlists this weekend and beyond.
Explore Explore SZA See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
This week, SZAâ€™s SOS marks the return of a queen, A Boogie Wit da Hoodie fights inner demons and Lana Del Rey has a beautiful-sounding fun fact for you. Check out all of this weekâ€™s First Stream picks below:
SZA, SOS
Five years after dropping a jaw-dropping debut with Ctrl, SZA has finally returned with a follow-up that somehow sounds both pored-over, the product of endless hours in the studio sharpening edges and refining ideas, and as natural as the R&B starâ€™s inherent gifts as a vocalist and songwriter. No one else could sing the words of SOS with an ounce of the personality that SZA brings to each track â€” in part because these songs are breathtakingly intimate, photographs of years of personal evolution as relationships scale up and sometimes crumble â€” but mostly because SZA is just that special of a performer, with every syllable on SOS popping out from the dense, varied production. SOS takes plenty of time to unpack across its 23 tracks, but whatever expectations you may have had for SZAâ€™s second album probably werenâ€™t high enough.
A Boogie Wit da Hoodie, Me vs. Myself
If Me vs. Myself, A Boogie Wit da Hoodieâ€™s fourth studio album, ends up being the final major rap release of 2022, the NYC rapper will end up closing out the year on a triumphant note: his latest full-length meets the local-to-national hype that A Boogie has been incubating for years, and features the most complete songs of his career. That list begins with the Lil Durk team-up â€œDamn Homie,â€ which augments both rappersâ€™ melodic instincts, and also includes the solo showcase â€œBallinâ€ and â€œWater (Drowning Pt. 2),â€ a sequel to A Boogieâ€™s recent collaboration with Kodak Black that improves upon the original.
Lana Del Rey, â€œDid you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvdâ€
The Jergins Tunnel, the passageway in Long Beach, Calif. that was abandoned in 1967, is a closed-off tunnel to a California beach â€” perfect lyrical fodder for Lana Del Rey, who sings on her stirring new track, â€œI canâ€™t help but feel somewhat like my body marred my soul / Handmade beauty sealed up by two man-made walls.â€ The title track to her next full-length, â€œDid you knowâ€¦â€ marries Del Reyâ€™s sweeping approach to orchestral pop with an ideal subject, upon which the singer-songwriter can translate her longstanding curiosities with faded American beauty.
Polo G, â€œMy Allâ€
â€œIâ€™m just tryna drop a hit and make the club jump / But I hate that I was too deep in so young,â€ Polo G admits at the end of the chorus to â€œMy All,â€ a new single to close out the year before it appears on his much-anticipated new project dropping in 2023. Most popular rappers wouldnâ€™t close out a hook with a moment of such succinct honesty â€” at 23 years old, Polo G is already a veteran who has the ability to entertain the masses yet has witnessed too much personal strife â€” but vulnerability has always been the key to his mainstream appeal, and â€œMy Allâ€ sets the stage for more intricate stories to be unfurled next year.
Paramore, â€œThe Newsâ€
Five years ago, Paramore preceded their album After Laughter with â€œHard Times,â€ a brilliant bit of sociopolitical satire on which Hayley Williams begged to be excluded from realityâ€™s narrative. Ahead of follow-up album This Is Why, the band grapples with everyday life in more serious fashion: â€œThe Newsâ€ questions how much space in our minds our modern atrocities, specifically wars in far-off countries, can take up before we explode with uselessness, as the band locks in to a jagged groove and Williams oscillates her tone between jittery and outraged to sell the songâ€™s concept.

title: Lana Del Rey komt in maart met negende album
content:
Lana Del Rey brengt op 10 maart volgend jaar haar negende studioalbum uit. De plaat heet Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, kondigde de Amerikaanse zangeres woensdag aan op Instagram. De eerste single, met dezelfde titel als haar nieuwe album, is woensdag uitgekomen.
De 37-jarige Del Rey had vorige week al laten weten dat ze met een aankondiging zou komen. Haar fans kunnen de nieuwe plaat alvast bestellen.
Het nieuwe album is de opvolger van Blue Banisters, dat in oktober vorig jaar verscheen. Een paar maanden daarvoor bracht de zangeres ook al een plaat uit: Chemtrails over the Country Club.

title: Lana Del Rey to release 'Did You Know' album in March 2023
content:
1/5
Lana Del Rey announced the album "Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd" and released the title track of the same name. File Photo by Jim Ruymen/UPI | License Photo
Dec. 7 (UPI) -- Lana Del Rey will release a new album in March 2023. The 37-year-old singer announced the album Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd on Wednesday. Advertisement
Del Rey will release the new album March 10.
Cover art for Did You Know lists Mike Hermosa, Jack Antonoff, Drew Erickson, Zach Dawes and Benji as producers and teases collaborations with Jon Batiste, Bleachers, Father John Misty, Judah Smith, Tommy Genesis and SYML.
Del Rey also released the title track from the album.
Did You Know will mark Del Rey's first album since Blue Banisters. The singer released Blue Banisters and Chemtrails Over the Country Club in 2021.
In January, Del Rey released the single "Watercolor Eyes" for the HBO series Euphoria.

title: Lana Del Rey Announces New Album â€˜Ocean Blvd,â€™ Drops Single
content:
Lana Del Rey. Photo: Kevin Winter/Getty Images
If the simple title Blue Banisters had you worried last time, donâ€™t be: Lana Del Rey is still in her wordy era. And after 2020â€™s Violet Bent Backward Over the Grass and 2021â€™s Chemtrails Over the Country Club, her new one takes the cake. Del Reyâ€™s next album is called Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd, out March 10, 2023. She released the title track as a lead single on December 7, one of her most orchestral, lush songs in recent memory. â€œWhenâ€™s it gonna be my turn?â€ Del Rey wails in the chorus between references to the Eaglesâ€™ â€œHotel Californiaâ€ and Harry Nilssonâ€™s â€œDonâ€™t Forget Me.â€ (So she really has been listening to a lot of Nilsson.) The song returns to her partnership with Jack Antonoff, who was absent from Blue Banisters, with additional production from key Banisters collaborators Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes. And on the topic of partnerships, Del Rey co-wrote â€œOcean Blvdâ€ with Mike Hermosa, a director and her rumored ex-boyfriend.
Antonoff, Erickson, Dawes, and Hermosa, along with Benji, are part of the albumâ€™s core creative team with Del Rey, per album covers. But Ocean Blvd looks to be a more collaborative album than Del Reyâ€™s past few, with features from Antonoffâ€™s band Bleachers, past collaborator Father John Misty, Grammy darling Jon Batiste, rapper Tommy Genesis, singer-songwriter SYML, and even her pastor, Judah Smith. (Sheâ€™s still in her church-girl era, too.) News of Ocean Blvd caps off an otherwise quiet year from Del Rey â€” literally, considering how few words she sang on one of her only releases, Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€œsnow on the beach.â€ She previously released two albums, Chemtrails and Banisters, in 2021 and fought a war with the culture in the years before.

title: Lana Del Rey Announces New Album, Releases New Song
content:
Did you know that â€¦ Lana Del Reyâ€˜s ninth studio album is coming out next year? On Wednesday (Dec. 7), the 37-year-old alt-pop star put an end to fansâ€™ anticipation for new music by announcing her new record, titled Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, will arrive March 10, and to tide them over in the meantime, she also dropped its title track.
Explore Explore Lana Del Rey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
Del Rey also unveiled Ocean Blvdâ€˜s cover art, a black-and-white portrait of the â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ singer resting her head in one of her hands. In chunky yellow lettering reads the albumâ€™s title, and in white are the names of its featured artists: Jon Batiste, Jack Antonoffâ€™s Bleachers, Father John Misty, Judah Smith, Tommy Genesis and SYML.
Antonoff, who previously worked with the singer-songwriter on 2021â€™s Chemtrails Over the Country Club, is also listed on the cover as a producer, as are Mike Hermosa, Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes, who worked on Blue Bannisters, also released in 2021. The new record is available now for pre-order on the New York nativeâ€™s website, as are vinyls with several alternate covers.
Ocean Blvdâ€˜s brand new title track, meanwhile, finds Del Rey in her element, her voice billowing out like smoke over somber piano and dark strings. â€œWhenâ€™s it gonna be my turn?â€ she sings on the single. â€œOpen me up, tell me you like it/ Love me until I love myself / Thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Boulevard.â€
The Grammy-nominated artist hasnâ€™t released a full album since Blue Bannisters last year, but she did drop an ethereal single titled â€œWatercolor Eyesâ€ in January for Euphoriaâ€˜s soundtrack. She also worked with Father John Misty on the EP Buddyâ€™s Rendezvous this year, and was featured on Taylor Swiftâ€™s Midnights track â€œSnow On the Beach,â€ which became Del Reyâ€™s second Billboard Hot 100 top 10 hit.
Listen to â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ below:

title: Lana Del Rey Announces New Album, Shares New Song: Listen
content:
Lana Del Rey has announced her new album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, and shared its title song. The follow-up to Blue Banisters is out March 10 via Interscope. The cover artwork lists various album contributors, including producers Jack Antonoff, Drew Erickson, Zach Dawes, as well as guests Jon Batiste, Father John Misty, and Tommy Genesis, engineer Laura Sisk, and others. Find the new song below.
In 2021, Lana Del Rey shared a pair of new records, Chemtrails Over the Country Club and Blue Banisters. With the release of the second LP, she set a new record for the most No. 1 albums on Billboardâ€™s Alternative Albums chart. The musician has more recently released the Euphoria song â€œWatercolor Eyesâ€ and covered Father John Mistyâ€™s â€œBuddyâ€™s Rendezvous.â€
Earlier this fall, Del Rey gave an update on new music and a manuscript for a book on which she was apparently working. She claimed in a series of since-deleted videos that a laptop, three video cameras, and multiple hard drives were stolen from her car. As a result, she said, a number of unfinished tracks got leaked, and she lost the manuscript for her book.

title: Lana Del Rey Announces New Album With Surprise Single Drop
content:
Lana Del Rey surprised fans this morning with a release of a new single titled â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd,â€ the title track from her ninth studio album, set for release on March 10, 2023.
The album features guest appearances from Jon Batiste (who cleaned up at the Grammys earlier this year), Father John Misty, long time Del Rey producer Jack Antonoffâ€™s band Bleachers and others
The title track to the singerâ€™s ninth full-length studio record was written by Del Rey and Mike Hermosa and produced by Del Rey, Antonoff, Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes.
The album will arrive nearly a year and a half after her most recent releases: She released two albums and a book and audiobook of her poetry during a 15-month period in 2020 and 2021, â€œBlue Banistersâ€ and â€œChemtrails Over The Country Club.â€
Around this time last year, Del Rey was honored with the Decade Award at Varietyâ€˜s annual Hitmakers event. In an interview with Variety, Del Rey reflected on her career from â€œVideo Gamesâ€ to â€œBlue Banisters.â€
â€œI canâ€™t say to what extent Iâ€™ve influenced anything,â€ Del Rey said. â€œBut I can say all of my creative cosplay â€” aka notes from my real life â€” did widen up the sound in popular music for people to make a departure from a pure pop sound to something more diarist.â€
Del Rey teased the album release in an interview with HOLA TV about a week ago. Antonoff followed up by posting a photo of Del Rey on his Instagram story, indicating that he would again be involved in her albums, as he started working with Del Rey in 2018 for her â€œNorman Fucking Rockwell!â€ and her seventh studio album, â€œChemtrails Over the Country Club.â€
â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ is available for pre-order, with CD, cassette and various exclusive vinyl formats available at select retailers and http://www.lanadelrey.com

title: Britney Spears: Is it time to reconsider the singer's legacy?
content:
Because she broke through in the late 1990s, at the tail end of an era dominated by powerhouse vocalists like Celine Dion and Mariah Carey, Spears' distinctive singing voice was often woefully undervalued. Kheraj points to her more mature third album, 2001's Britney, which saw her embrace R&B on I'm A Slave 4 U and soft rock on I'm Not a Girl, Not Yet a Woman, as the point at which she really honed her vocal style. "She pushes her voice into more whispery textures, playing with the different sounds that she's able to create in order to elevate a song," Kheraj says, comparing her to Kylie Minogue and Janet Jackson in this respect. "Though in my opinion," he adds, "Spears' ability to be an actress with her own voice, taking on different tones, timbres and vibrations, is second to none." This assessment of Spears' vocal technique is echoed by Andrew Watt, a producer who worked with her on this year's Elton John duet Hold Me Closer. "She's unbelievable at layering her voice and doubling, which is one of the hardest things to do," he told The Guardian in August, adding: "She's so good at knowing when she got the right take. She took complete control."
Finding her voice
As Spears' career progressed, she also took more control of her music from the very start of the creative process. Kheraj says she had a predilection for finding collaborators who "would disrupt the status quo of pop" â€“ like envelope-pushing R&B duo the Neptunes, who produced her early 2000s hits I'm a Slave 4 U and Boys, and Moby, who worked on her trance-influenced track Early Mornin'. The latter appeared on Spears' 2003 album In the Zone, her fourth, on which she co-wrote eight of 12 songs including the beautifully subdued ballad Everytime. "The video was always on MTV when I was about 11, and I remember feeling so sad for her," says Styrke, referring to the song's regretful lyrics as well as its video depicting the dark side of fame. "Hearing it [now] still makes me really feel for her."
In the Zone was another step up for Spears, but her magnum opus came four years later with 2007's Blackout, an incredibly innovative album that she executive produced. Home to the huge hits Gimme More and Piece of Me, Blackout didn't just feature cutting-edge production blending elements of techno, EDM and dubstep (then a very new genre); it also underlined Spears' fearlessness. Piece of Me, a song that savagely sends up negative perceptions of her at the time, is as self-referential as pop music gets. "Guess I can't see the harm in working and being a mama," Spears sings. "And with a kid on my arm, I'm still an exceptional earner." It doesn't matter that Spears didn't write it; she said everything she needed to just by putting it out. Blackout was a high-water mark, but Spears has displayed a knack for picking winning material throughout her career. "Have you heard her albums? They're so intelligent," avant-garde singer-songwriter Charli XCX said in 2014. "The way her songs are crafted is really amazing. I think that [her] music is really interesting and clever."
In February 2008, just three months after Blackout came out, Spears was involuntarily placed under a conservatorship that would last for 13 years. She released four albums during this period, 2008's Circus, 2011's Femme Fatale, 2013's Britney Jean and 2016's Glory. Though Femme Fatale was sonically spectacular and spawned the stunning singles Hold It Against Me and Till the World Ends, it's arguable that only Glory was the work of a fully invested Spears. "I was really specific about who I worked with and I've been learning to say no," she told NME shortly after Glory's release. "I'm a people-pleaser, so that's hard for me â€“ even if I don't like something, I'll do it just to make a person happy. I made sure this album was everything I wanted it to be. I was really selfish with it."

Elles sont toutes rÃ©unies dans "Queen of Me", son sixiÃ¨me album studio. On y trouve les singles "Waking Up Dreaming", "Last Day of Summer", "Giddy Up!" ainsi que "Not Just a Girl". "This Is Why" de Paramore
Câ€™est sans nul doute lâ€™un des opus les plus attendus de lâ€™annÃ©e. Le groupe Paramore sortira prochainement un nouvel album studio, "This Is Why", six ans aprÃ¨s "After Laughter". Il fait suite Ã  lâ€™EP "Meanwhile" (2021) et Ã  la collection de titres "Song Machine, Season One: Strange Timez" (2020), dans laquelle la part belle Ã©tait dÃ©jÃ  faite aux collaborations.La sortie de "Cracker Island" de Gorillaz est prÃ©vue le 24 fÃ©vrier.

"Mais quand quelque chose arrive, un Ã©vÃ©nement comme celui-ci dans votre vie, les chansons changent : elles prennent des formes diffÃ©rentes et ont des significations diffÃ©rentes quand vous les chantez". "Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd" de Lana Del Rey
La sortie de "Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd", le neuviÃ¨me album studio de Lana Del Rey, a Ã©tÃ© plus que compromise lorsquâ€™elle sâ€™est fait voler en octobre un disque-dur contenant les morceaux de cet opus. MalgrÃ© ce contretemps, le disque sortira en mars. Lana Del Rey lâ€™a conÃ§u avec lâ€™aide de lâ€™auteur-compositeur-interprÃ¨te et producteur amÃ©ricain, Jack Antonoff, avec qui elle a dÃ©jÃ  collaborÃ© Ã  de multiples reprises. Plus Ã©tonnant, la chanteuse amÃ©ricaine y a Ã©galement conviÃ©â€¦ son pasteur Judah Smith. La sortie de "Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd" de Lana Del Rey est prÃ©vue le 10 mars.
"72 Seasons" de Metallica
Metallica est prÃªt Ã  faire, une fois, plus trembler la planÃ¨te avec son douziÃ¨me album studio. Il sâ€™agit de leur premier opus depuis 2016. Il rassemble douze morceaux, dont "Lux Aeterna". Le titre de "72 Seasons" fait rÃ©fÃ©rence aux "18 premiÃ¨res annÃ©es de nos vies qui forment notre vrai ou notre faux moi", comme lâ€™a expliquÃ© le chanteur et guitariste James Hetfield. Le lÃ©gendaire groupe de heavy metal assurera la promotion de leur nouveau disque lors dâ€™une tournÃ©e en Europe et en AmÃ©rique du Nord en 2023 et 2024. La sortie de "72 Seasons" de Metallica est prÃ©vue le 14 avril.
"Broken by Desire to Be Heavenly Sent" de Lewis Capaldi
Lewis Capaldi revient avec son deuxiÃ¨me album studio, "Broken by Desire to Be Heavenly Sent", quatre ans aprÃ¨s "Divinely Uninspired to a Hellish Extent". Le chanteur Ã©cossais a annoncÃ© en mars 2021 quâ€™il ne comptait plus se produire momentanÃ©ment pour se consacrer Ã  lâ€™Ã©criture et Ã  la composition de son nouvel opus. Il a repris la route lâ€™Ã©tÃ© suivant, et a sorti en septembre le morceau "Forget Me", issu de "Broken by Desire to Be Heavenly Sent". title: Lana del Rey, Metallica, Rihanna y mÃ¡s artistas lanzarÃ¡n nuevos discos en 2023
content:
Rihanna, Metallica y Lana del Rey apuntalan nuevos proyectos para este 2023. | Fuente: ComposiciÃ³n (Instagram)
Nuevos discos de Metallica, Depeche Mode, Sam Smith, Lana del Rey y Shania Twain calentarÃ¡n el arranque de 2023 a la espera de otros grandes lanzamientos aÃºn no confirmados que podrÃ­an llevar la firma de artistas como Dua Lipa, Kylie Minogue, Ed Sheeran, Miley Cyrus y, especulando por enÃ©sima vez, Rihanna.
Ya son varios aÃ±os los que se da por hecha la salida del noveno Ã¡lbum de estudio de la de Barbados. Esta vez algunos motivos alientan aÃºn mÃ¡s la esperanza: serÃ¡ la protagonista del intermedio musical del Superbowl en febrero, se especula que podrÃ­a salir de gira y hace unas semanas lanzÃ³ "Lift Me Up", su primer tema original desde la publicaciÃ³n del disco previo "Anti" (2016).
Casi tanto han tenido que esperar los seguidores de Cardi B desde "Invasion of Privacy" (2018), pero la rapera parece haberse autoimpuesto esta vez que, aunque "aÃºn le falta algo", su nuevo material verÃ¡ la luz en los prÃ³ximos meses, igual que el disco de versiones de Metallica que prepara Miley Cyrus y el primero de Depeche Mode sin Andrew Fletcher, "Momento Mori".
Otros artistas que podrÃ­an lanzar en 2023 sus nuevos trabajos son Dua Lipa, que sÃ­ ha confirmado recientemente que su tercer disco, de momento a medias, supondrÃ¡ un "giro completo" respecto a "Future Nostalgia" (2020), asÃ­ como Selena Gomez y Kylie Minogue, quien tambiÃ©n ha hablado de un "nuevo sonido".
Karol G se asoma con un nuevo proyecto
"Nos vemos el prÃ³ximo aÃ±o con nuevo Ã¡lbum", anticipÃ³ Ed Sheeran a travÃ©s de su cuenta de Instagram, una confirmaciÃ³n que se une a la de Jennifer Lopez, quien no desvelÃ³ la fecha pero sÃ­ el tÃ­tulo: "This Is Me... Now", en clara alusiÃ³n a su disco "This Is Me... Then" (2002).
En espaÃ±ol, el disco que podrÃ­a adquirir la relevancia mundial que en 2022 tuvieron "Un verano sin ti" de Bad Bunny y "MOTOMAMI" de RosalÃ­a es el cuarto trabajo de Karol G, que ya puso a bailar al pÃºblico durante la espera con el tema "Provenza".
Grimes, Kelly Clarkson, The Cure o Kali Uchis se encuentran entre los mÃºsicos que tambiÃ©n podrÃ­an tener buenas nuevas antes de 2024, al igual que Morrissey con un Ã¡lbum, "Meet Me At The Bonfire", que incluirÃ¡ colaboraciones de figuras como Miley Cyrus e Iggy Pop.
Los discos confirmados
Precisamente el artista apodado "La iguana" serÃ¡ el encargado de abrir fuego en el calendario con la salida el 6 de enero de "Every Loser". Le tomarÃ¡n el relevo ese mes la artista de country Margo Price ("Strays", dÃ­a 13), los italianos Maneskin ("Rush!", 20) y otro de los lanzamientos mÃ¡s esperados gracias al Ã©xito del sencillo "Unholy": "Gloria" de Sam Smith, que aterrizarÃ¡ el dÃ­a 27.
En febrero llegarÃ¡ "Queen Of Me", el primer Ã¡lbum de estudio de Shania Twain en un lustro. SerÃ¡ el dÃ­a 3, el mismo que se publicarÃ¡n "Higher Than Heaven" de Ellie Goulding y "Heavy Heavy" de Young Fathers.
El 10 de febrero, otros dos retornos mediÃ¡ticos que se han hecho esperar 5 aÃ±os serÃ¡n los de Paramore con "This is why" y el de Kelela con "Raven".
Hay igualmente mucha expectaciÃ³n en torno a "Desire, I Want To Turn Into You" de Caroline Polacheck, que llegarÃ¡ el dÃ­a 14 de ese mes, seguido de "Trustfall" de P!nk el 17 y, ya el 24, de "Shook" de la banda Algiers y de "Cracker Island" de Gorillaz, uno de los proyectos paralelos al margen de Blur de Damon Albarn.
De lo poco confirmado antes de que concluya la primera mitad del aÃ±o cabe destacar tres lanzamientos que sÃ­ contarÃ¡n con mucho pÃºblico deseoso, empezando por "Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Boulevard" de
el 10 de marzo.
Y una semana antes de "Atum" de The Smashing Pumpkins el 21 de abril, Metallica publicarÃ¡ "72 Seasons", doce temas nuevos que toman el relevo seis aÃ±os despuÃ©s a "Hardwired... To Self Destruct" y que les llevarÃ¡ por todo el mundo en una de las giras mÃ¡s colosales y ambiciosas del aÃ±o.
En EspaÃ±a, uno de los discos mÃ¡s esperados serÃ¡ el tercer LP de estudio de Aitana, que verÃ¡ la luz en algÃºn momento de 2023 segÃºn confirmÃ³ a EFE, asÃ­ como el del rapero canario Quevedo. AdemÃ¡s habrÃ¡ nuevos lanzamientos de Dani FernÃ¡ndez, IvÃ¡n Ferreiro, Bunbury, Rayden, Coque Malla y Ãlvaro de Luna, entre otros.

La precuela de Juego de Tronos ha hecho que vuelva el romance de esperar cada domingo en la noche. Laura AmasifuÃ©n, Diego Pajares Herrada y David Honores comentan los 9 episodios de esta primera temporada como una suerte de previa del final de temporada de este domingo. title: Lana del Rey wirbt fÃ¼r neues Album - im Wohnort ihres Ex-Freundes
content:
von Laura Hindelang Die SÃ¤ngerin Lana del Rey bringt im MÃ¤rz ihr neuntes Album heraus. FÃ¼r die Platte gibt es erst ein Werbe-Plakat. Und das steht ausgerechnet im Wohnort ihres Ex-Freundes.
FÃ¼r ihr kommendes Album "Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd" hat die SÃ¤ngerin Lana del Rey erst ein einziges Webe-Plakat platzieren lassen. Und dieses hÃ¤ngt weder in New York noch in Los Angeles, sondern in Tulsa im Bundesstaat Oklahoma, dem Wohnort ihres Ex-Freundes. Die ungewÃ¶hnliche Marketing-Aktion teilte die 37-JÃ¤hrige auf ihrem privaten Instagram-Account. Unter das Foto von dem Werbe-Banners schrieb sie den zweideutigen Satz "There is only one", auf Deutsch also "Es gibt nur eins" â€“ oder "Es gibt nur einen". FÃ¼r jeden zu sehen ist das Bild auf einem Fan-Account, der die Aufnahme von Lana del Reys privatem Account auf einem Ã¶ffentlichen Kanal teilt.
Gemeint ist laut Medienberichten ihr frÃ¼herer LebensgefÃ¤hrte, der Polizeibeamte Sean Larki, der auch in der beliebten TV-Serie "Live PD" mitspielte. Die SÃ¤ngerin lernte ihn 2019 kennen. Wie die "Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung" berichtet, sei das Paar in den darauffolgenden sechs Monaten das Paar zwischen den beiden Wohnorten Los Angeles und Tulsa gependelt.
Lana del Rey hat "keinen Platz fÃ¼r Farbe"
Bei einigen Gelegenheiten zeigten sie sich zusammen auf dem roten Teppich, unter anderem bei den 62. Grammy Awards im Jahr 2020. Noch im selben Jahr folgte die Ã¼berraschende Trennung. Grund sei der "volle Terminkalender" gewesen, zitiert die "Los Angeles Times" die damalige Aussage der SÃ¤ngerin.
AuffÃ¤llig ist auch, dass Lana del Rey ihre neue Single, den ersten Track des gleichnamigen Albums, am 7. Dezember verÃ¶ffentlich hat, dem Geburtstag ihre Ex-Freundes. Das Lied beschreibt die "Los Angeles Times" als "eine langsam rollende Piano-Ballade", die auch eine Hommage an einen lÃ¤ngst vergessenen FuÃŸgÃ¤ngertunnel. Das Bauwerk im Art-dÃ©co-Stil liegt unter dem Ocean Boulevard in der Pine Avenue in der kalifornischen Stadt Long Beach. Das Album soll am 10. MÃ¤rz folgen. Es ist Lana del Reys neuntes Album, nachdem sie 2021 mit "Chemtrails over the Countryclub" und "Blue Banisters" gleich zwei Werke hausgebracht hatte.
Auf ihrer neunen Platte gibt es "keinen Platz fÃ¼r Farbe", verriet sie bereits vor einigen Monaten im GesprÃ¤ch mit dem "W-Magazin". Es werde ein sehr wortreiches Album, die Lieder seien sehr gesprÃ¤chig. "Es ist eher so: Ich bin wÃ¼tend", erzÃ¤hlte die 37-JÃ¤hrige. "Ich singe einfach alles, was mir in den Sinn kommt, in meine Sprachnotizen-App. Es ist offensichtlich nicht perfekt", berichtet sie Ã¼ber den Entstehungsprozess hinter ihren neuen Liedern.
Quellen: "Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung", "Los Angeles Times" (I), "Los Angeles Times" (II), "Rolling Stone", "W-Magazine"

title: 2023 promises some great movies, music stage shows and more
content:
New music from Metallica and breakout R&B star Kelela.
A movie about a coked-out bear running rampage in Georgia, and another about the father of the atomic bomb.
The return of Blink-182 to the concert stage.
And a musical based on the classic comedy â€œMean Girls.â€
If 2022 marked a return to a full slate of live entertainment options and regular visits to movie theaters, 2023 beckons (knock on wood) as a chance to revel in entertainment on its own merits. And, as our writers can attest, there is much to look forward to.
Movie theaters will host such anticipated releases â€œCocaine Bear,â€ â€œOppenheimerâ€ and â€œBarbie,â€ which has been on our radar since the early film posters featuring Margot Robbie and Ryan Gosling (Barbie and Ken) started making the rounds.
Besides iconic SoCal band Blink-182, the concert season will offer the farewell tour of Dead & Company and the always-sensational SZA. And we can look forward to albums by the aforementioned Metallica and Kelela, as well as Lana Del Rey, Gorillaz, and others.
And besides â€œMean Girls,â€ stages will boast such musicals as â€œTina Turnerâ€ and â€œSix,â€ which is kind of what would happen if the wives of Henry VIII formed their own rock band.
Itâ€™s looking like a fun year â€” fingers crossed. Hereâ€™s a roundup of whatâ€™s headed our way. Keep in mind that release dates are subject to change.
Movies
Besides the onrush of sequels and superhero movies, movie houses will be serving up some intriguing and keenly anticipated releases in 2023. Hereâ€™s a look.
â€œCocaine Bearâ€: From its kitschy title to its cheeky trailer, this bit of dark-humor ridiculousness claims to be rooted in a semblance of truth â€“ the key word here being â€œsemblance.â€ Itâ€™s about a black bear in Georgia that ingests a duffel bag full of cocaine and wreaks tabloid-ready murderous havoc. The talented Elizabeth Banks directs with tongue in cheek.
Details: Opens Feb. 24 in theaters only.
â€œOppenheimerâ€: Christopher Nolan follows up his head-scratching â€œTenetâ€ with a film on J. Robert Oppenheimer, the brilliant scientist and UC Berkeley physics professor who played a pivotal role in the creation of the atomic bomb. Will it be a traditional biopic? We doubt it, given that itâ€™s Nolan behind the camera. Heâ€™s assembled an A-list cast, including Cillian Murphy in the title role, Emily Blunt, Florence Pugh, Robert Donwey Jr. and Matt Damon.
Details: Opens July 21 in theaters only.
â€œBarbieâ€: From Bratz to Battleship to G.I. Joe, seems like Hollywood canâ€™t stop turning dolls and toys into movies. But Greta Gerwigâ€™s cinematic refashioning of statuesque Barbie, an American phenom thatâ€™s both revered as an iconic toy and piece of Americana and reviled as a symbol of womenâ€™s objectification, apparently puts a feminist spin on the proceedings. Certainly, itâ€™s inspired casting to have Margot Robbie as the lead and Ryan Gosling flexing his washboard-ready abs as surfer boyfriend Ken.
Details: July 21 in theaters only.
Sequels, sequels, sequels â€¦: They have become synonymous for Hollywoodâ€™s utter lack of original thinking, but there are several in 2023 weâ€™re psyched about, including Keanu Reevesâ€™ return to action in â€œJohn Wick: Chapter 4,â€ in which there will be blood and a high body count, for sure. (March 24); forever-young Paul Rudd reprising his superhero role in Marvelâ€™s â€œAnt-Man and the Wasp: Quantumaniaâ€ (Feb. 17); Michael Jordan back in fighting shape and ready for a TKO in the directorâ€™s ring with â€œCreed IIIâ€ (March 3); James Gunn returns to the Marvel Cinematic Universe to helm â€œGuardians of the Galaxy: Vol. 3â€ (May 5); Diane Keaton, Jane Fonda, Candice Bergen and Mary Steenburgen book it to Italy for â€œBook Club 2 â€“ The Next Chapterâ€ (May 12); â€œSpider-Man: Across the Spider-Verseâ€ hopes to weave more animated magic from the superhero character (June 2); Tom Cruise buckles up for another thrill ride with â€œMission: Impossible â€“ Dead Reckoning Part One,â€ the seventh installment in the film franchise (July 14, Part 2 is slated for June 2024); and Denis Villenevue hopefully wonâ€™t leave us stranded in the desert again at the end of â€œDune: Part Twoâ€ (Nov. 23).
Concert tours
Top concert picks for 2023 include the return of SoCal pop-punk favorites, the farewell to Bay Area jam-band royalty and the debut arena tour from an awesome R&B talent.
Blink-182: To be honest, we didnâ€™t even realize that weâ€™d missed Blink until the Pride of Poway, California, announced it was coming back. Then the thought of bouncing around in our Vans sneaks and Dickies shorts to â€œWhatâ€™s My Age Again?â€ started to sound mighty appealing. So, weâ€™re definitely ready to welcome back the pop-punk bandâ€™s signature lineup â€“ vocalist-bassist Mark Hoppus, vocalist-guitarist Tom DeLonge and drummer/omnipresent celebrity Travis Barker, who will be performing in concert together for the first time in over eight years.
Details: June 16-17 at Banc of California Stadium, Los Angeles, ticketmaster.com; June 19-20 at Pechanga Arena, San Diego, axs.com; June 22 at SAP Center, San Jose, ticketmaster.com; June 23 at Golden 1 Center, Sacramento, ticketmaster.com.
Dead & Company: Itâ€™s time to say goodbye to this beloved jam band, which is embarking on one last giant summer tour before calling it quits. The Bay Area group is opening and closing its run in California, kicking things off with a pair of shows in L.A. before winding things up with three concerts back in San Francisco. So, get your miracle ticket and plan to spend one last night (or several nights) with Grateful Dead alums Bob Weir, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann and their pals John Mayer, Oteil Burbridge and Jeff Chimenti.
Details: May 19 and 20 at Kia Forum in Los Angeles, July 14-16 at Oracle Park in San Francisco, ticketmaster.com.
SZA: The singer-songwriterâ€™s 2017 debut, â€œCtrl,â€ was a smash success that ended up being certified triple platinum and certifying the arrival of a new star in the R&B circuit. Rather than strike while the iron was hot, SZA made fans wait five long years for a follow-up before finally dropping the winning â€œSOSâ€ in December. SZA, who delivered a terrific headlining set at San Franciscoâ€™s Outside Lands music festival in 2022, is supporting her sophomore release with her first-ever headlining arena tour.
Details: March 14 at Oakland Arena, March 22 at Kia Forum, Los Angeles, ticketmaster.com.
â€” Jim Harrington, Staff
Touring Broadway shows
Musicals adapted from movies and the music of iconic pop stars continue to drive the touring theatrical business. Here are three touring Broadway shows hitting California this year.
â€œMean Girlsâ€: It was only a matter of time until somebody made a Broadway musical out of the iconic 2004 high school movie â€œMean Girls,â€ about the cruelest clique of high school girls since â€œHeathersâ€ (or maybe since â€œJawbreakerâ€). And who better to write the book of the musical than the movieâ€™s screenwriter, Tina Fey? â€œLegally Blonde: The Musicalâ€ songwriter Nell Benjamin wrote the lyrics, and the music is by Feyâ€™s husband, Jeff Richmond, who also composed the score of the film (as well as the music for Feyâ€™s shows â€œ30 Rockâ€ and â€œUnbreakable Kimmy Schmidtâ€ and film â€œBaby Mamaâ€). After a hit 2018 Broadway run cut short in 2020 by the COVID shutdown, the devilishy witty musical comedy finally makes it out West on its US tour.
Details: Jan. 4-29 at Pantages Theatre, Los Angeles; www.broadwayinhollywood.com; Jan. 31-Feb. 26 at Golden Gate Theatre, San Francisco; www.broadwaysf.com; March 7-19 at Segerstrom Center for the Arts, Costa Mesa; www.scfta.org
â€œSixâ€: It often feels like original new musicals are few and far between these days. The British West End and Broadway hit â€œSixâ€ certainly qualifies, revisioning six wives of Henry VIII as a pop supergroup in concert, competing to determine which queen suffered the most and gets to become lead singer. The show was co-written and co-composed by Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss when they were still students at Cambridge and went from the 2017 Edinburgh Festival Fringe to the West End in 2019 and Broadway in 2021, where Moss became the youngest ever director of a Broadway musical and both won a 2022 Tony Award for best original score. Still running in London and New York, it now hits California on its U.S. â€œAragonâ€ tour while a second US â€œBoleynâ€ tour makes a separate run across the country.
Details: Feb. 21-Apr. 9; Orpheum Theatre, San Francisco; www.broadwaysf.com; May 9-June 10 at Pantages Theatre, Los Angeles; www.broadwayinhollywood.com; June 13-25 at Segerstrom Center for the Arts, Costa Mesa; www.scfta.org
â€œTina â€” The Tina Turner Musicalâ€: Everybody knows by now that Tina Turner has quite a story to tell, and the only surprise about her life story being made into a jukebox musical is that itâ€™s taken this long. The musical follows Turner from her childhood as Anna Mae Bullock in Nutbush, Tennessee, through her rocky marriage and musical partnership with Ike Turner to solo superstardom. Helmed by British director Phyllida Lloyd, â€œTinaâ€ premiered in 2018 on Londonâ€™s West End (where itâ€™s still running) and opened in 2019 Broadway. The book is by Katori Hall, the Pulitzer Prize winning playwright of â€œThe Mountaintopâ€ and â€œHurt Village,â€ with Frank Ketelaar and Kees Prins. You can expect a heaping helping of familiar favorites from â€œRiver Deep Mountain Highâ€ to â€œPrivate Dancerâ€ and â€œWhatâ€™s Love Got to Do with Itâ€ when it comes around on tour.
Details: Aug. 1-27 at Golden Gate Theatre, San Francisco; www.broadwaysf.com; Aug. 29-Sep. 3 at Center for the Performing Arts, San Jose; broadwaysanjose.com; June 13-July 9 at Pantages Theatre, Los Angeles; www.broadwayinhollywood.com; July 11-23 at Segerstrom Center for the Arts, Costa Mesa; www.scfta.org
â€˜Beetlejuiceâ€™
The musical by Eddie Perfect, Scott Brown and Anthony King, based on the 1980s movie, kicked off its national tour in San Francisco earlier this month. But after several stops in the East Coast, it will return to California this summer.
Details: July 11-30, Hollywood Pantages Theatre; www.broadwayinhollywood.com; Aug. 1-6 at San Jose Center for the Performing Arts; broadwaysanjose.com
â€” Sam Hurwitt, Correspondent
Albums
Last year was a great year for new albums â€“ thanks to acclaimed offerings by Beyonce, Kendrick Lamar, Slipknot, Taylor Swift and many others. But now itâ€™s time to flip the calendar and check out five of the album releases weâ€™re looking forward to in 2023.
Metallica, â€œ72 Seasonsâ€ (April 14): The biggest Bay Area band of all time â€“ with worldwide album sales eclipsing the 125 million mark â€“ returns with its 11th full-length studio outing. Expectations are mile high, especially given that the previous outing, 2016â€™s epic â€œHardwired â€¦ to Self Destruct,â€ turned out to be the bandâ€™s best record since 1991â€™s legendary self-titled affair (aka â€œThe Black Albumâ€). Yet, we never bet against Metallica and fully expect that James Hetfield, Lars Ulrich, Kirk Hammett and Robert Trujillo will once again deliver the goods. (April 14)
Lana Del Rey, â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€: Nobody does the whole dreamy alt/baroque-pop thing better than Del Rey, who is following up not just one, but two magnetic offerings from 2021 â€“ â€œChemtrails over the Country Clubâ€ and â€œBlue Banisters.â€ The singer-songwriterâ€™s 16-track ninth album should be another winner, and ]reportedly includes collaborations with Jon Batiste, Father John Misty, Bleachers and others. (March 10)
Kelela, â€œRavenâ€: The Washington, D.C.,-born alt/electro/R&B artist finally returns for her sophomore effort, which follows the critically championed 2017 debut â€œTake Me Apart.â€ Judging by what weâ€™ve heard thus far â€“ the singles â€œHappy Ending,â€ â€œWashed Awayâ€ and, best of the bunch, â€œOn the Runâ€ â€“ â€œRavenâ€ will likely help Kelela reach new artistic and commercial heights. (Feb. 10)
John Cale, â€œMercyâ€: The Velvet Underground legend, who has also produced landmark records for Patti Smith, the Stooges, the Modern Lovers and others, is set to drop his 17th studio effort and first album of new original songs in more than a decade. â€œMercyâ€ finds the Rock and Roll Hall of Famer collaborating with Weyes Blood, Tei Shi, Sylvan Esso and more. Also, weâ€™re very happy to see longtime sideman and expert guitarist Dustin Boyerâ€™s name once again listed in the credits. (Jan. 20)
Gorillaz, â€œCracker Islandâ€: The popular â€œvirtualâ€ band, powered by Blurâ€™s Damon Albarn and other real-life talents, returns with a follow-up to 2020â€™s â€œSong Machine, Season One: Strange Timez.â€ The album, Gorillazâ€™s eighth to date, features such A-List guests as Tame Impala, Thundercat, Stevie Nicks, Adeleye Omotayo, Bad Bunny, Beck and the Pharcydeâ€™s Bootie Brown, as well as production work by Grammy-winner Greg Kurstin. (Feb. 24)
â€” Jim Harrington, Staff
Music festivals
Hereâ€™s a rundown of several or Californiaâ€™s best music fests.
Rolling Loud Cali Festival: The nationally known hip-hop festival brand will make its mark in Southern California at its new home at Hollywood Park that sits perfectly adjacent to the SoFi Stadium. The West Coast edition will have performances by Playboi Carti, Travis Scott, Future, Lil Wayne, Saweetie, City Girls, Ice Spice and many more.
Details: March 3-5 at Hollywood Park Grounds, 1001 Stadium Drive, Inglewood; tickets to come at rollingloud.com/cali2023 but merchandise is on sale now.
Coachella Valley Music & Arts Festival: One of the biggest parties in the desert made its big return in 2022 with headlining sets from Harry Styles, Billie Eilish and Swedish House Mafia with The Weeknd. Though the 2023 lineup has yet to be announced, itâ€™s sure to be an eclectic mix of artists and sounds with a global appeal.
Details: April 14-16 and 21-23; Empire Polo Club, Indio; 3-day general admission tickets $499-$599; VIP passes $1,069-$1,269; camping, shuttle, parking passes and other add-ons will also be available at coachella.com.
Stagecoach Country Music Festival: The annual three-day Coachella country music sister fest will be headlined by Luke Bryan, Kane Brown and Chris Stapleton. Other performances include Jon Pardi, Riley Green, ZZ Top, Old Dominion, Gabby Barrett, Brooks & Dunn, Tyler Childers, Parker McCollum and many more.
Details: April 28-30; Empire Polo Club, Indio; 3-day passes start at $389; general admission & shuttle combo packages start at $449; Saloon admission passes are $799; Corral reserved seats start at $829-$1,999; Corral standing pit access starts at $1,499; 3-day Desert Diamond VIP passes are $2,749; Gold Rush VIP passes are $1,749; Hi Ho Silver passes are $1,249. various VIP packages are sold out, but check stagecoach.com for more ticket information.
BottleRock Napa Valley: The three-day extravaganza blending terrific food and drink and A-List performers and celebrity chefs has become one of Californiaâ€™s hottest tickets. The lineup has not been announced yet.
Details: May 26-28, Napa Valley Expo, Napa; 3-day presale passes are sold out, check website for updates; BottleRockNapaValley.com.
Outside Lands: The massive three-day festival offering frontline and emerging rock, pop, hip-hop, R&B and other performers has yet to announce its 2023 lineup or tickets.
Details: Aug. 11-13; Golden Gate Park, San Francisco, check for updates at www.sfoutsidelands.com.
Hardly Strictly Bluegrass: Heck, the annual festival would craw thousands of folks just because itâ€™s free and takes place in lovely Golden Gate Park. The fact that it draws an eclectic lineup featuring a mix of famed Americana performers and along with hip-hop, jazz and rock stars is just icing on the cake.
Details: Sept. 29-Oct. 1; Golden Gate Park, San Francisco; lineup TBA, check website for details; www.hardlystrictlybluegrass.com.
â€” Staff reports

title: Courtney Love: Kurt Cobain en Lana Del Rey enige muzikale genieÃ«n
content:
Courtney Love vindt dat alleen Lana Del Rey qua muzikaal talent in de buurt komt van Kurt Cobain. In een aflevering van de WTF Podcast noemt zij haar overleden partner en Del Rey "de enige twee echte muzikale genieÃ«n" die zij ooit heeft gekend.
De 58-jarige Love sprak lovend over haar jongere collega, die ze een "echte, geweldige vriend" noemt. "Ze is een genie. Ze heeft dezelfde integriteit die Kurt had", vindt Love. "Lana heeft iets magisch", voegde ze daar aan toe. "En ze is niet eens gestoord".
Love heeft in het verleden samen getourd met Del Rey. Zo trad zij in 2015 een aantal keer op tijdens de Endless Summer Tour van de Summertime Sadness-zangeres.

title: FÃ¼r Courtney Love gibt es nur noch ein wahres Musikgenie: Lana Del Rey
content:
Love bezeichnet Del Rey, mit der sie 2015 gemeinsam auf Tour war, als eine "wahre, groÃŸartige Freundin". Zudem erinnert sie die Musikerin an ihren Ex Kurt Cobain: "Sie hat die IntegritÃ¤t, die auch Kurt hatte. Es sind die einzigen beiden Menschen, von denen ich das behaupten kann." Del Reys Version von "Howl", im Original ein Monolog des Dichters Allen Ginsburg (1926-1997), verglich Love mit den Nirvana-Coverversionen der Meat Puppets, die die Band wÃ¤hrend ihres legendÃ¤ren MTV Unplugged Specials gespielt hatte.
Love hatte Del Rey auch Singer/Songwriter-Legende Joni Mitchell (79) vorgestellt. Eine Begegnung, die "das ganze verfi***e Ding", womit wohl Del Reys Karriere gemeint ist, verÃ¤ndert hÃ¤tte, so die Hole-SÃ¤ngerin. Nachdem 2019 Del Reys Album "Norman Fucking Rockwell" herausgekommen war, hÃ¤tten ihre "Rockkritiker-Boomer-Freunde" sie angerufen und gesagt: "Hey, deine Freundin, die ist ziemlich gut", erinnert sich Love. "Und ich sagte zu ihr: 'Willkommen im Wirbelsturm, Frau Del Rey."
spot on news
