title: Lana Del Rey uses billboard to remind ex she's thriving
content:
If you canâ€™t get even, get advertising space.
Queen of sad girl bops Lana Del Rey has purchased just one billboard to promote her new album, and itâ€™s in the hometown of her ex-boyfriend, People reports.
Advertisement
The Manhattan-born â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ singer, 37, reportedly took to her private Instagram account to say the lone billboard for â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd.â€ exists in Tulsa, Oklahoma.
Lana Del Rey and Sean Larkin attend the Pre-GRAMMY Gala and GRAMMY Salute to Industry Icons Honoring Sean "Diddy" Combs on January 25, 2020 in Beverly Hills, California. (Jon Kopaloff/Getty Images)
â€œThereâ€™s only one and itâ€™s in Tulsa â˜ ï¸,â€ read the post, also shared by a fanâ€™s public version of the account.
Advertisement
â€œItâ€™s. Personal,â€ the 6-time Grammy nominee subsequently noted in the comments section, according to People.
Del Rey dated retired Tulsa cop Sean â€œSticksâ€ Larson for six months between 2019 and 2020, according to the outlet.
Larson isnâ€™t just known for dating the musician. â€œLive PDâ€ fans will recognize him as the star of the A&E series for the majority of its 2016 to 2020 run.
Del Rey took Larsonâ€™s birthday, Dec. 7, as an opportunity to announce the upcoming album, slated for a March 10 drop, according to People.
Romance might take center stage in much of Del Reyâ€™s music, but her relationship status isnâ€™t entirely clear.
Back in late 2020, insiders told the outlet that â€œYoung and Beautifulâ€ singer was engaged to country singer Clayton Johnson.
Their reported plans to say â€œI doâ€ appear to have fallen through, and she is now rumored to be seeing musician Jack Donoghue.

title: Le Nail Art, un artisanat 100% pop culture
content:
Issu de la pop culture, le Nail Art s'est fait une place non seulement sur les rÃ©seaux sociaux, mais aussi sur les doigts d'artistes cÃ©lÃ¨bres tels que Lana Del Rey, Rosalia ou encore ASAP Rocky. Excessive et minutieuse, cette tendance ornementale est en rÃ©alitÃ© un art ancestral.
Depuis les annÃ©es 2000, le Nail Art, ou stylisme ongulaire, a pris une ampleur dÃ©lirante Ã  la fois sur les rÃ©seaux sociaux, tels que TikTok, Instagram, mais aussi sur les ongles de nombreux musiciens et musiciennes: Rosalia, Billie Eilish, Cardi B, Lana Del Rey et mÃªme sur les dix doigts du rappeur ASAP Rocky.
Une technique ornementale qui peut paraÃ®tre moderne, mais qui, en rÃ©alitÃ©, ne fait que prolonger une pratique ancestrale. Entre 5'000 et 3'000 avant JÃ©sus-Christ, dans l'Egypte antique, les femmes se peignaient les ongles au hennÃ©, tandis qu'Ã  Babylone, le sud de Bagdad actuel, les guerriers maquillaient leurs ongles par un trait de kÃ´hl noir ou vert, une maniÃ¨re visuelle d'affirmer une Ã¢me combative.
Câ€™est ensuite en Chine, Ã  lâ€™Ã¨re de la dynastie Ming au XIVe siÃ¨cle, que les premiers faux ongles auraient vu le jour, ornant les mains de la famille impÃ©riale de longues protections en mÃ©tal incrustÃ©es dâ€™or et de pierres prÃ©cieuses. Pendant des siÃ¨cles et Ã  travers les diffÃ©rentes cultures, avoir les ongles longs indiquait un statut social Ã©levÃ© et privilÃ©giÃ©, symbolisant le fait de ne pas avoir Ã  accomplir de travail manuel.
Aujourd'hui, la symbolique aristocratique est devenue dÃ©suÃ¨te, mais le succÃ¨s de cet artisanat n'a pour sa part - de l'AntiquitÃ© au XXIe siÃ¨cle - pas bougÃ© d'un pouce!
Le Nail Art de l'art avec un grand A?
Pour la styliste ongulaire genevoise Eva Torres Morgado, il ne fait aucun doute que cette pratique minutieuse est une forme d'artisanat, une technique qui commence par ailleurs Ã  se dÃ©mocratiser aussi auprÃ¨s de la gent masculine. A ses dÃ©buts, la styliste raconte avec un sourire complice Ã  la RTS s'Ãªtre exercÃ©e Ã  la fois sur elle, mais aussi et surtout, sur les doigts de son petit-ami, qui a Ã©tÃ© d'une certaine maniÃ¨re, "son premier panneau publicitaire".
Et la styliste ongulaire d'ajouter: "Pour moi, le Nail Art est un moyen d'expression artistique, bien que je puisse comprendre que cette affirmation puisse porter Ã  confusion. En tant que styliste ongulaire, on rÃ©pond certes Ã  une demande, mais Ã  la fin il y a toujours la touche de l'artiste derriÃ¨re." Un artisanat donc, sans aucun doute, prÃ©cis et dÃ©licat, Ã  la lisiÃ¨re du soin et de l'oeuvre art.
DerniÃ¨rement, j'ai dÃ©couvert un style de peinture, l'acri-gouache qui me permet de crÃ©er un effet texturÃ©. J'ai reproduit la peinture "Le Bassin aux nymphÃ©as" de Claude Monet sur les dix doigts de l'une mes clientes. Eva Torres Morgado
Contenu externe Ce contenu externe ne peut pas Ãªtre affichÃ© car il est susceptible d'utiliser des cookies. Pour voir ce contenu vous devez autoriser les cookies.
Un artisanat protÃ©iforme
La rappeuse Cardi B en concert. [Erika Goldring - Getty Images via AFP]Pour sa collÃ¨gue Jessica Furlan, avec qui elle partage son atelier, il ne fait aucun doute que le succÃ¨s du Nail Art est dÃ» aux rÃ©seaux sociaux et Ã  l'influence des stars. Elle cite, entre autres, l'exemple de Cardi B, une rappeuse devenue en quelques annÃ©es une vÃ©ritable icÃ´ne musicale et visuelle. La chanteuse, originaire du Bronx, joue de maniÃ¨re excessive et jubilatoire de sa fÃ©minitÃ©. Et ses ongles sont voyants, imposants, brillants, presque architecturaux. Sans eux, le look de la chanteuse serait incomplet. Sur scÃ¨ne, ils accentuent ses mouvements, soulignent son caractÃ¨re affirmÃ© et lui donnent une stature fÃ©line.
"Dans les annÃ©es 2000 les ongles longs Ã©taient perÃ§us comme vulgaires et 'guettos', poursuit Jessica Furlan. En Europe, on se cantonnait Ã  des couleurs sobres sur des ongles naturels. Depuis la dÃ©mocratisation du rap, du hip-hop et des rÃ©seaux sociaux un peu partout dans le monde, les ongles longs sont devenus une maniÃ¨re d'Ãªtre puissante, forte et non conventionnelle."
Un empowerment embrassÃ© par de nombreuses stars donc, comme pour la chanteuse Rosalia qui affirme sans dÃ©tour que ses ongles sont une "une arme".
Le Nail Art, un artisanat protÃ©iforme, qui permet de crÃ©er des minuscules peintures, de la 3D et mÃªme des griffes pour prendre de l'ampleur dans l'espace public et qui, Ã  force de se redÃ©finir depuis de millÃ©naires, n'a pas terminÃ© de faire parler de lui, et surtout... de nous surprendre!
Layla Shlonsky

title: Lana Del Rey Posts Billboard in Exâ€™s Hometown Promoting Upcoming Album
content:
Lana Del Rey is beloved by millions all around the world. But the new micro-targeted billboard promoting her upcoming Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. album appears to pointedly have an audience of one.
According to screenshots from LDRâ€™s private @honeymoon Instagram, the singer posted an ad for Tunnel in Oklahoma, explaining, â€œThereâ€™s only one and itâ€™s in Tulsa,â€ adding in comments, â€œItâ€™s personal.â€ Fans are speculating that the one-off promotion is aimed at her ex-boyfriend, a Tulsa cop she reportedly broke up with in 2020 who used to appear on the popular Live PD series. Fans also noticed that Del Rey made her album announcement and dropped the title track on Dec. 7, her exâ€™s birthday.
The singer-songwriter surprised fans earlier this month with the announcement of her upcoming ninth album, which shares its name with the title of her new song that was also unveiled. The collection, with featured artists including Jon Batiste, Jack Antonoffâ€™s Bleachers, Father John Misty, Judah Smith, Tommy Genesis and SYML, will arrive on March 10.
Antonoff, who previously worked with Del Rey on 2021â€™s Chemtrails Over the Country Club, is also listed on the cover as a producer, as are Mike Hermosa, Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes, who worked on Blue Bannisters, also released in 2021. The title track finds the singer firmly in her element, her voice billowing out like smoke over somber piano and dark strings. â€œWhenâ€™s it gonna be my turn?â€ she sings on the single. â€œOpen me up, tell me you like it/ Love me until I love myself / Thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Boulevard.â€
See a screenshot of the billboard below.

title: Lana Del Rey Promotes New Album With Only 1 Billboard
content:
Lana Del Rey Promotes New Album With Only 1 Billboard â€” in Her Exâ€™s Hometown and Announced on His Birthday
While promoting new music, fans think singer Lana Del Rey is purposefully acting petty toward an ex-boyfriend. Del Rey is set to release a new album called Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd in 2023. The singer released the albumâ€™s title track on Dec. 7. Del Rey released the song on her ex-boyfriend Sean Larkinâ€˜s birthday, and the only billboard advertising Del Reyâ€™s new album is in Larkinâ€™s hometown.
Lana Del Rey | Rodin Eckenroth/FilmMagic
Lana Del Rey seemingly called out her ex-boyfriend with her album promotions
On Dec. 7, Del Rey announced the release of Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd and released the audio of the albumâ€™s title track. Dec. 7 happens to be Larkinâ€™s birthday.
In addition to announcing the album and song, Del Rey seemingly made a pointed choice to advertise the album in Tulsa, Oklahoma, Larkinâ€™s hometown.
Instead of advertising the album on billboards across the U.S., Del Rey chose to only have one billboard promoting Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd in Tulsa.
According to the Los Angeles Times, Del Rey posted a photo of the lone billboard on her private Instagram page.
In the photo, Del Rey took a selfie of herself sitting in the car with the billboard in the background.
She captioned the photo, â€œThereâ€™s only one and itâ€™s in Tulsa,â€ and in a comment on the post she wrote, â€œItâ€™s. Personal.â€
Fans reacted to the singerâ€™s Instagram post
While Del Reyâ€™s Instagram account is private, it did not take long for the alleged screenshot of the singerâ€™s billboard post to circulate online. On social media, fans shared their admiration for the singerâ€™s seeming pettiness.
â€œGod I need this level of petty-strength, advertising your album probably about how sad you are in your exâ€™s hometown â€“ only Lana, this is why I love her,â€ one fan wrote on Reddit.
Another fan wrote on Reddit, â€œShe announced her new album on December 7th, which is also Seanâ€™s birthday. And now she posts this Tulsa billboard thing. Sure seems like sheâ€™s trying to send him a message.â€
â€œHonestly Iâ€™m all about Lana doing this s***. Flex, and be petty lmao,â€ wrote a Reddit user.
One Reddit user wrote, â€œThe best part of this is it feels like a f*** you to not just Sean but at least 2 other exes bc imagine youâ€™re a more recent ex but she only chose to put one in Tulsa.â€
Who is Lana Del Reyâ€™s ex, Sean Larkin?
In 2019, Del Rey was photographed with Larkin for the first time. Before dating Del Rey, Larkin was known for appearing on A&Eâ€™s show Live PD.
After being photographed together, Del Rey defended her relationship with the cop to the Los Angeles Times, saying, â€œWell, the thing is, heâ€™s a good cop. He gets it. He sees both sides of things.â€
Larkin attended the 62nd Annual Grammy Awards with Del Rey in 2020. At the 2020 Grammy Awards, Del Rey was nominated for Album of the Year and Song of the Year.
A few months later in March 2020, it was reported that Larkin and Del Rey broke up.

title: Lana del Rey promoot nieuw album in de geboorteplaats van haar ex
content:
Zangeres Lana del Rey heeft een billboard dat haar nieuwe album aanprijst laten plaatsen in de geboorteplaats van haar ex-vriend Sean Larkin. "Het is persoonlijk", schrijft de 37-jarige del Rey bij een foto van het billboard in de Amerikaanse plaats Tulsa in de staat Oklahoma.
Het negende studioalbum van Lana del Rey komt op 10 maart 2023 uit en heet Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. Het album is aangekondigd op 7 december, de verjaardag van acteur Sean Larkin. De eerste single, met dezelfde titel als haar nieuwe album, is begin december uitgekomen.
Het nieuwe album is de opvolger van Blue Banisters, dat in oktober vorig jaar verscheen. Een paar maanden daarvoor bracht de zangeres ook al een plaat uit: Chemtrails over the Country Club.

title: Lana Del Rey promotes new album with just one billboard
content:

Lana Del Rey appears to be taking aim at her ex-boyfriend Sean Larkin as she chose his hometown to put up the singular billboard she has to promote her new album.
The 37-year-old singer posted a selfie on her private Instagram account on Tuesday as she showed off the billboard for her ninth studio album and revealed its location.
"Thereâ€™s only one and itâ€™s in Tulsa," Lana wrote, referring to the Oklahoma city her ex calls home.
In the comments section, she seemed to open up about the reasoning behind the location as she wrote: "It's. Personal."
Fans flocked to social media to applaud the Summertime Sadness hitmaker for her "pettiness".
(Image: Instagram) (Image: Getty Images)
"She sets the pettiness bar higher and it is my duty to achieve," one person tweeted.
"She just like us," another said. A third fan wrote: "Queen behavior honestly."
Another fan remembered: "This girl also dropped her album title track & the album announcement on his birthday."
Lana announced her upcoming album, Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, earlier this month and also shared the record's cover art.
(Image: AFP via Getty Images) (Image: Getty Images)
She also told fans the album will be released on March 10 next year.
Lana wrote the title track with Mike Hermosa and co-produced it with long-time collaborators Jack Antonoff, Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes.
Lana and Sean, an actor and real-life policeman, dated from September 2019 until March 2020.
The former couple made their first public appearance together at the Pre-Grammy Gala in January 2020.
Speaking about her relationship with Sean, Lana said they were still in touch but that they struggled to find time for one another.
(Image: GC Images)
"We still talk and whatnot, we just have busy schedules right now," she told The New York Times.
Now, the singer is rumoured to be dating musician Jack Donoghue of the band Salem.
In December 2020, Lana was engaged to musician Clayton Johnson before calling it quits sometime in 2021. The couple are thought to have parted ways after "lockdown struggles".

title: Lana Del Rey promotes new album with one billboard
content:
Sheâ€™s not playing â€œ[Video] Games.â€
Singer/songwriter Lana Del Rey, 37, has posted one billboard â€” and one billboard only â€” to promote her album, â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd,â€ due out March 10.
But instead of targeting popular marketing areas like New York City or Los Angeles, the billboard sits in Tulsa, Oklahoma â€” the hometown of her ex-boyfriend, Sean Larkin.
â€œThereâ€™s only one and itâ€™s in Tulsa,â€ Del Rey captioned a photo of the billboard on her private Instagram page. A screenshot of the post is circulating on Twitter.
â€œItâ€™s. Personal,â€ she added in the comments.
Adding insult to injury, Del Rey dropped her album title track and album announcement on Larkinâ€™s birthday, Dec. 7.
Sean Larkin and Lana Del Rey attend the Grammy Awards on Jan. 26, 2020. Patrick McMullan via Getty Image
Del Reyâ€™s billboard is located in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Twitter/@gabrimoonn
Fans lost their minds and applauded Del Reyâ€™s savage move.
â€œThe fact that Lana Del Rey only put up a billboard in her exâ€™s town is the amount of petty I strive for,â€ one fan laughed.
â€œLana Del Rey placing the only billboard to promote her album in Tulsa, Oklahoma (her exâ€™s hometown) is the level of shady I aspire to be. Taylor Swift taught her well,â€ another fan tweeted of Del Reyâ€™s â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ collaborator.
â€œLana Del Rey putting her ONLY billboard in her exâ€™s city is so me,â€ another related.
â€œDate idea: Who wants to drive to Tulsa and take photos at the Lana Del Rey billboard?â€ another asked.
Del Rey and Larkin broke up in 2020, calling it quits because of their â€œbusy schedules.â€ During their six-month relationship, they split their time between Los Angeles and Tulsa, where Larkin was a police sergeant. He retired last year.
He appeared on A&Eâ€™s reality show â€œLive PDâ€ and co-hosts the podcast â€œCoptales and Cocktails.â€
â€œWhen we were in Tulsa we hung out with my law enforcement friends and their spouses. We all Super Bowl partied together, dinners and things like that,â€ he told the New York Times in March 2020. â€œNormal things couples do with their friends.â€
In an interview with former Gucci creative director Alessandro Michele published in May, Del Rey said her new album has a more aggressive tone than her previous works.
Del Rey and Larkin dated for six months, breaking up in 2020. FilmMagic
â€œFor the first song, I pressed record and sang, â€˜When I look back, tracing fingertips over plastic bags, I think I wish I could extrapolate some small intention or maybe get your attention for a minute or two.â€™â€
â€œItâ€™s a very wordy album. So thereâ€™s no room for color. Itâ€™s almost like Iâ€™m typing in my mind,â€ she added.

title: Lana del Rey's 'Young and Beautiful' song is being used by TikTokers in a new trend that some are calling out as ageist
content:
Lana Del Rey's "Young and Beautiful" song is being used as part of a recent TikTok trend where people juxtapose how celebrities look now with how they looked earlier in their careers.
But some say they believe the trend â€” which features a clip of the song's lyric "Will you still love me when Iâ€™m no longer young and beautiful?" alongside images of celebrities â€” is problematic because it's ageist.
Critics of the trend, who have made videos or written comments calling it out, have noted that some of the celebrities featured, who are usually women, are still relatively young and have not aged much. Some simply appear to have gained weight.
In one video featuring Adriana Lima, a user juxtaposed images of the model when she was a Victoria's Secret model with a photo of her when she was pregnant. Even Del Rey, 37, was used as a subject in a video, which uses images of her taken by paparazzi.
â€œItâ€™s such a backhanded compliment. I just donâ€™t know how I would feel if someone said that about me,â€ said singer and TikToker Geralyn Oâ€™Connor, 20, who made a video calling out the trend. â€œAs a woman, youâ€™re obviously going to gain weight as you get older. We need to normalize weight gain."
The â€œYoung and Beautifulâ€ controversy comes on the heels of other ageist and fatphobic memes and trends. A recent viral tweet proclaimed that singer and actor Miley Cyrus is â€œloved by Godâ€ because of her youthful appearance at age 30. Itâ€™s unclear if the tweet was earnest or in jest, but many replied saying that age 30 isnâ€™t old. Meanwhile, on TikTok, a common insult is calling someone â€œ30â€ if theyâ€™re out of touch or appear to not be a teenager.
â€œI think thereâ€™s this trend in our generation to be scared of aging,â€ Oâ€™Connor said.
It is unclear when the "Young and Beautifulâ€ trend started. TikTok did not immediately respond to a request for comment on Thursday. The platform referred Buzzfeed News to its community guidelines, which states that content that could cause adverse health outcomes, such as those that promote disordered eating, aren't allowed on the platform.
"We are committed to maintaining a supportive environment for our growing community," the guidelines read.
TikTok also offers a guide around disordered eating and encourages its users to talk to someone, take a break, and to learn individual triggers if a user is "frequently feeling stressed, anxious, upset, or confused about food, or your weight or shape."
I think thereâ€™s this trend in our generation to be scared of aging -Geralyn Oâ€™Connor, singer and tiktok creator
Linda Charmaraman, director of the Youth, Media & Wellbeing Research Lab at the Wellesley Centers for Women, said it's not just Gen Z's fear of aging that has driven some of the stigmatizing social media trends, but also youthful ignorance.
Social media trendsetters are often thought to be high school age, but actually skew even younger nowadays. Many are roughly middle school age, she said.
"The middle schoolers are setting the trends and if they are 13 then 30 is actually quite a long way to go," Charmaraman said.
For teens in that age range, their brain development makes it difficult for them to imagine themselves as 30-year-olds one day. During that phase of development, teens, and especially teenage girls, are frequently comparing bodies.
"There's a lot of consciousness, and physical consciousness, of appearance and appearance-related cultures especially on TikTok and places like Instagram," Charmaraman said.
Still, seeing anti-aging content can be harsh for those who are nearing or have entered their 30s.
TikTok content creator Nathaly Juarez, 32, wanted to dispel some of the stigma around aging on TikTok. She posted a video in October about aging, in which she said, "30s are the best. Have pride in your age."
She said she feels like, in general, things are trending more positively for both age acceptance and body positivity, and that some of the more harmful memes and trends are likely from young people who don't know better.
"I think it is just a lack of experience from these kids making these edits," she said.
Celebrities have also begun speaking out about the ageism they have experienced.
In an interview with Elle Magazine earlier this year, actor and director Olivia Wilde, 38, said sheâ€™s faced ageist hate on social media from other women.
â€œItâ€™s so interesting for me when that comes from women because Iâ€™m like, â€˜Do you plan on not getting older? Or if you already are older, do you feel that you donâ€™t deserve the same opportunities in life?â€™â€ she said. â€œItâ€™s so sad to me to look at that and realize people have such small expectations for their own lives and they are projecting those expectations onto me. And I reject your projections.â€
Both Juarez and O'Connor said that they feel people in their 20s and 30s feel enormous pressure to be accomplished in their personal lives and careers. They both said at their respective ages, many of their peers feel like they're running behind, which leads to their internalized stigmatization of aging.
â€œWeâ€™re 20 and we feel like weâ€™re so old," O'Connor said. "I think itâ€™s a pressure, especially as a woman, to [not] age.â€
Having the ability to age should be looked at as a gift, and that includes turning 30, Oâ€™Connor said.
â€œI find it so weird that as a society weâ€™ve made 30 like this terrible thing," she said, "when I feel like being 30 is such a beautiful thing."

title: Mark Tuan Rules Top Hot Trending Songs Chart
content:
Mark Tuanâ€™s â€œBrokenâ€ lands atop Billboardâ€™s Hot Trending Songs chart, ranking at No. 1 on the Dec. 17-dated survey.
Billboardâ€™s Hot Trending charts, powered by Twitter and sponsored by Xfinity Mobile, track global music-related trends and conversations in real-time across Twitter, viewable over either the last 24 hours or past seven days. A weekly, 20-position version of the chart, covering activity from Friday through Thursday of each week, posts alongside Billboardâ€™s other weekly charts on Billboard.com each Tuesday, with the latest tracking period running Dec. 2-8.
Originally released as part of Tuanâ€™s album The Other Side on Aug. 26, â€œBrokenâ€ â€“ along with â€œLet U Go,â€ which swoops in at No. 7, from the same album â€“ ranks high as fans reminisce about and post videos from Tuanâ€™s fall North American tour.
Itâ€™s followed by Lana Del Reyâ€™s new song â€œDid You Know Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ at No. 2, the first taste of Del Reyâ€™s upcoming album of the same name, due March 10, 2023. Concurrently, â€œBlvd,â€ which was released Dec. 7, bows at No. 34 on the Hot Rock & Alternative Songs chart with 1.7 million official U.S. streams and 1,000 downloads.
SZAâ€™s â€œSOS,â€ the title track from her new album released Dec. 9, starts at No. 3 as prospective listeners discussed the albumâ€™s tracklist after she shared it Dec. 5. More gains are possible for the album on the Hot Trending Songs tally dated Dec. 24.
Keep visiting Billboard.com for the constantly evolving Hot Trending Songs rankings, and check in each Tuesday for the latest weekly chart.

content:
Lana Del Reyâ€˜s latest song release, â€œDid you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd,â€ has topped this weekâ€™s new music poll.

title: Lana Del Rey has announced the new album: listen to the first single
content:
In recent days he had anticipated the arrival of news and so it was. Lana Del Rey announced his new album, titled â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ and revealed that it will be released on March 10, 2023.
To while away the wait, the American singer-songwriter has meanwhile shared the first single, which is also the piece that gives the title to the entire work. A dreamy and timeless ballad, in perfect Lana Del Rey style, which thus gives us a new pearl of his repertoire.
â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ will be Lana Del Reyâ€™s ninth studio album and comes following the 2021 double release of â€œChemtrails over the Country Clubâ€ And â€œBlue Banistersâ€. He also recently published â€œWatercolor Eyesâ€, song featured in the soundtrack of the second season of Euphoria.
The new album will feature songs produced by Mike Hermosa, Jack Antonoff, Drew Erickson, Zach Dawes And Benji. Among the guests of the disc there will be Jon Batiste, bleachers, Father John Misty, Tommy Genesis, SYM file And Judah Smith (the pastor of the church Lana attends).
Therefore, among the collaborators on the disc there is also Jack Antonoff, also present with his musical project Bleachers, who has already worked with Lana Del Rey in the past and is a historical collaborator of Taylor Swift who also produced his latest album â€œMidnightsâ€.
Disc that also contains Taylor Swiftâ€™s lucky duet with Lana Del Rey, â€œSnow on the beachâ€, became the song that got the most streams on Spotify in the first 24 hours of release, surpassing even â€œRain on Meâ€ Of Lady Gaga And Ariana Grande.

title: 2023 Billboard Women in Music Awards: Lana Del Rey, Kim Petras & More
content:
The Billboard Women in Music Awards are returning March 1, 2023, with Billboard honoring todayâ€™s most influential female powerhouses who are shaping the music landscape.
Emmy-winning writer/actress Quinta Brunson will host the 2023 ceremony, which will take place at the YouTube Theater at Hollywood Park in Los Angeles, Calif. The event will honor Becky G with the Impact Award presented by American Express, Doechii with the Rising Star Award presented by Honda, Ivy Queen with the Icon Award, Kim Petras with the Chartbreaker Award, Latto with the Powerhouse Award, Lainey Wilson with the Rulebreaker Award, Lana Del Rey with the Visionary Award, and TWICE with the Breakthrough Award.
More performances and talent â€” including the 2023 Woman of the Year recipient â€” will be announced at a later date. Sponsors for the ceremony include American Express, presenter of the Impact Award; Honda, presenter of the Rising Star Award; Mugler; and Nationwide.
â€œWeâ€™re thrilled to recognize these groundbreaking artists across genres and generations who are defining todayâ€™s sound â€“ and paving the way for tomorrowâ€™s women in music,â€ said Billboard Editorial Director Hannah Karp. â€œWith the inspiring Quinta Brunson as our host, this yearâ€™s Billboard Women in Music Awards is going to be an incredible night.â€
Tickets to attend the Women in Music Awards are available to the public. American Express card members can take part in the ticket presale taking place Tuesday and Wednesday, Jan. 31 and Feb. 1, before the public on-sale Friday, Feb. 3, at 1 p.m. ET/10 a.m. PT, at billboardwomeninmusic.com. Prices range from $85 to $275.
The 2023 Women in Music Awards will also stream live with more details about the livestream to be announced soon.

title: Bob Dylan's 'Lay Lady Lay' Made Madonna Cry Over and Over
content:
TL;DR:
Bob Dylanâ€™s â€œLay Lady Layâ€ made Madonna cry over and over.
She does not think â€œLay Lady Layâ€ was a sad song.
â€œLay Lady Layâ€ influenced a Lana Del Rey track.
Bob Dylan | Bettmann / Contributor
Madonna used to listen to Bob Dylanâ€˜s â€œLay Lady Layâ€ repeatedly while crying. Subsequently, she discussed why she may have reacted to the song that way. Notably, â€œLay Lady Layâ€ influenced a Lana Del Rey track.
Bob Dylanâ€™s â€˜Lay Lady Layâ€™ couldâ€™ve lent its title to an album but Dylan decided against that
Of the songs from Dylanâ€™s Nashville Skyline, â€œLay Lady Layâ€ was the biggest hit on the Billboard Hot 100. During a 1969 interview with Rolling Stone, Dylan said he didnâ€™t want to name the album after the song.
â€œI always like to tie the name of the album in with some song,â€ he explained. â€œOr if not some song, some kind of general feeling. I think that just about fit because it was less in the way, and less specific than any of the other ones on there.
â€œCertainly couldnâ€™t call the album Lay Lady Lay. I wouldnâ€™t have wanted to call it that, although that name was brought up. It didnâ€™t get my vote, but it was brought up. Peggy Day â€” Lay, Peggy Day, that was brought up.â€ Dylan also considered naming Nashville Skyline after the track â€œGirl from the North Country,â€ but he decided that didnâ€™t fit the album.
Madonna said she only listened to that 1 Bob Dylan song and it made her cry even though itâ€™s not sad
During a 1994 with Paul Du Noyer that was posted to his website, Madonna was asked her feelings about Dylan. â€œI used to listen to that one record, â€˜Lay Lady Lay,â€™ in my brotherâ€™s bedroom in the basement of our house,â€ she said. â€œIâ€™d lie on the bed and play that song and cry all the time.â€
The â€œLike a Virginâ€ singer attempted to explain why â€œLay Lady Layâ€ made her weep. â€œI was going through adolescence, I had hormones raging through my body,â€ she recalled. â€œDonâ€™t ask me why I was crying, itâ€™s not a sad song. But thatâ€™s the only record of his that I really listened to.â€
â€˜Lay Lady Layâ€™ outperformed all of the other singles from â€˜Nashville Skylineâ€™
â€œLay Lady Layâ€ reached No. 7 on the Billboard Hot 100, staying on the chart for 14 weeks. It lasted longer on the chart than any of Dylanâ€™s other singles released up to that point. The track impacted popular culture when Lana Del Rey mentioned â€œLay Lady Layâ€ in her tune â€œReligionâ€ from the album Honeymoon.
Two other singles from Nashville Skyline charted. â€œI Threw It All Awayâ€ reached No. 85 on the Billboard Hot 100 and â€œTonight Iâ€™ll Be Staying Here with Youâ€ reached No. 50. â€œLay Lady Layâ€ was the most popular song from the record by far. Meanwhile, the album reached No. 3 on the Billboard 200 and stayed on the chart for 47 weeks.
Madonna liked â€œLay Lady Layâ€ and Dylanâ€™s American audience enjoyed the song as well.

title: "Kurt Cobain and Lana Del Rey are the only true musical geniuses I've known" SparkChronicles
content:
In a new interview with Marc Maron for the podcast WTF, Courtney Love stated that Lana Del Rey and her late husband, the frontman of NirvanaKurt Cobainthey are the only onesâ€true musical geniusesâ€ Iâ€™ve ever known.
There Love is preparing to release a new album, the first in over 12 years, following Holeâ€™s 2010 â€œNobodyâ€™s Daughterâ€, which he co-released with former guitarist Dirty Pretty ThingsAnthony Rossomando.
During the chat with maronthe artist has revealed that his next album will not be a rock album: â€œpeople donâ€™t rock anymoreâ€œhe said (as transcribed by Stereogum), even though he prepared a couple of â€œmessed up guitar songsâ€œ: the tentative opener â€œKill Fuck Marry,â€ inspired by legal dramas between Johnny Depp And Amber HeardAnd â€œan ear plugâ€ called â€œJustice For Kurtâ€.
This last song is said to be about who spreads the idea that the Love is responsible for the death of Cobain in 1994, but probably wonâ€™t be on the album because the Love he says that â€œit would swallow the entire narrativeâ€œ.
Later in the interview the Love praised the Del Reywith whom she toured in support of the 2014 album â€œUltravioletâ€, as â€œa real, great friendâ€œ. He compared his musical talent to that of Cobain And Spielbergcarrying on: â€œLana and Kurt are the only two true musical geniuses Iâ€™ve ever met. She has the integrity that Kurt had. They are the only two people I know that I can talk to. stipes? Good? Yes, they are people I know and love. Billie Joe, sure. But Wool? She has a magical thing. And sheâ€™s not even messed up!â€œ.
The upcoming album of Love it will most likely be a solo work: although he has raised the hypothesis of a reunion of the Hole in 2020 (and said in 2019 that the band was â€œdefinitely speakingâ€œ), then dismissed the idea altogether, stating that a return â€œreally wonâ€™t happen any time soonâ€.
Love has so far released only one solo album, 2004â€™s â€œAmericaâ€™s Sweetheart,â€ which she said last year was one of â€œgreat shames of his lifeâ€œ.

title: Lana Del Rey Poses Topless On Upcoming Album Artwork
content:
After delivering Chemtrails Over The Country Club and Blue Banisters in 2021, Lana Del Rey took something of a well-deserved break last year. However, now that 2023 is settling in, the â€œDealerâ€ singer is more than eager to begin releasing new music again.
Her ninth studio album was previously announced as Did You Know Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. Aside from that, the public knew little â€“ until the 37-year-old gave an update earlier this week.
Lana Del Rey attends the Pre-GRAMMY Gala and GRAMMY Salute to Industry Icons Honoring Sean â€œDiddyâ€ Combs on January 25, 2020 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Gregg DeGuire/Getty Images for The Recording Academy)
In a black-and-white Instagram post that violates nudity guidelines, Lana poses topless. She sits on the floor, one arm behind her head. Her button-down shirt is left open, exposing her right breast. As NME reports, the NSFW image is the alternate artwork for the project.
The other accompanying photos see the singer in a lace bra and cardigan. A silk bow also hangs in her hair. Along with the cover, Lizzy Grant also gave fans a look at the tracklist and features. Standout titles include â€œCandy Necklace,â€ â€œTaco Truck x V8,â€ and â€œParis, Texas.â€
She was the sole guest appearance on Taylor Swiftâ€™s Midnights late last year. Still, Lana opted to work with all male collaborators for her album. Father John Misty, Bleachers, Tommy Genesis, and Jon Batiste will all appear on the forthcoming project in different capacities.
The 11th track of Lana Del Reyâ€™s new album is titled â€œGrandfather Please Stand On The Shoulders Of My Father While Heâ€™s Deep-Sea Fishing.â€ pic.twitter.com/vX20WLIOE3 â€” Pop Crave (@PopCrave) January 14, 2023
Lanaâ€™s initial release date for Ocean Blvd was March 10. â€œMarch 24 now, thanks,â€ she wrote to her followers earlier this week. â€œBox set, and merch.â€
In December she shared her â€œDid you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvdâ€ single. It was produced by the vocalist herself, alongside Jack Antonoff, Drew Erickson, and Zach Dawes.
Find a censored version of Lana Del Reyâ€™s next album cover below, and check back later for more pop culture updates.
Lana Del Rey looking gorgeous photographed for her new upcoming album. pic.twitter.com/XjDzCf67RI â€” Pop Hive (@thepophive) January 14, 2023
[Via]

title: Lana Del Rey Delays New Album â€˜Ocean Blvd,â€™ Drops Track List
content:
Lana Del Rey. Photo: Kevin Winter/Getty Images
If the simple title Blue Banisters had you worried last time, donâ€™t be: Lana Del Rey is still in her wordy era. And after 2020â€™s Violet Bent Backward Over the Grass and 2021â€™s Chemtrails Over the Country Club, her new one takes the cake. Del Reyâ€™s next album is called Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd. On Friday, she dropped the track list on her private Instagram and announced that the 16-track albumâ€™s release has been pushed two weeks from March 10 to March 24. She also shared a preview of the album art, but it was removed for violating nudity guidelines. Del Rey previously released the title track as a lead single on December 7, one of her most orchestral, lush songs in recent memory. â€œWhenâ€™s it gonna be my turn?â€ she wails in the chorus between references to the Eaglesâ€™ â€œHotel Californiaâ€ and Harry Nilssonâ€™s â€œDonâ€™t Forget Me.â€ (So she really has been listening to a lot of Nilsson.) The song returns to her partnership with Jack Antonoff, who was absent from Blue Banisters, with additional production from key Banisters collaborators Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes. And on the topic of partnerships, Del Rey co-wrote â€œOcean Blvdâ€ with Mike Hermosa, a director and her rumored ex-boyfriend.
Antonoff, Erickson, Dawes, and Hermosa, along with Benji, are part of the albumâ€™s core creative team with Del Rey, per album covers. But Ocean Blvd looks to be a more collaborative album than Del Reyâ€™s past few, with features from Antonoffâ€™s band Bleachers, past collaborator Father John Misty, Grammy darling Jon Batiste, rapper Tommy Genesis, singer-songwriter SYML, and even her pastor, Judah Smith. (Sheâ€™s still in her church-girl era, too.) News of Ocean Blvd caps off an otherwise quiet year from Del Rey â€” literally, considering how few words she sang on one of her only releases, Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€œsnow on the beach.â€ She previously released two albums, Chemtrails and Banisters, in 2021 and fought a war with the culture in the years before. See the full track list, including an especially intriuging Track 11, below:
1. The Grants
2. Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd
3. Sweet
4. AW
5. Judah Smith Interlude
6. Candy Necklace
7. Jon Batiste Interlude
8. Kintsugi
9. Fingertips
10. Paris, Texas
11. Grandfather Please Stand on The Shoulders of My Father While Heâ€™s Deep-Sea Fishing
12. Let the Light In (ft. Father John Misty)
13. Margaret (ft. Bleachers)
14. Fishtail
15. Peppers (ft. Tommy Genesis)
16. Taco Truck x VB
This post has been updated throughout.

title: Lana Del Rey Details New Album, Pushes Back Release Date
content:
Lana Del Rey has shared the tracklist to her forthcoming album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. The update arrived in an Instagram post along with the album art, which has since been deleted for violating the platformâ€™s nudity guidelines. Sheâ€™s also announced a new release date for the project, pushing it back by two weeks to March 24. Father John Misty, Tommy Genesis, Jon Batiste, and Jack Antonoff all appear on the record, find more details below (via Consequence).
Since releasing Chemtrails Over the Country Club and Blue Banisters in 2021, the singer-songwriter has covered â€œBuddyâ€™s Rendezvousâ€ (by Father John Misty) and released the one-off â€œWatercolor Eyesâ€ for the second season of Euphoria. She shared the title track to her next LP at the beginning of December after joining Taylor Swift for Midnightsâ€™ â€œSnow on the Beach.â€ Late last year, the artist claimed that a laptop, plus multiple cameras and hard drives, were stolen from her car, resulting in the loss of song demos and a 200-page manuscript of an as yet unannounced book.
Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd:
01 The Grants
02 Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd

11 Grandfather Please Stand on the Shoulders of My Father While Heâ€™s Deep-Sea Fishing

15 Peppers [ft. Tommy Genesis]
16 Taco Truck x VB

title: Lana Del Rey Reveals â€˜Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€™ Track List
content:
Weâ€™re officially two months away from the arrival of Lana Del Reyâ€˜s ninth studio album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, and on Friday (Jan. 13), the singer unveiled the official track listing for the much-anticipated release in a post on her private Instagram page.
Explore Explore Lana Del Rey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
The 16-track set out on March 10 includes the previously released title track, as well as a number of collaborations. Del Rey is teaming up with Father John Misty on â€œLet the Light In,â€ Tommy Genesis on â€œPeppersâ€ and Bleachers on â€œMargaret,â€ seemingly a sweet reference to frontman Jack Antonoffâ€˜s fiancÃ©e Margaret Qualley. Both Jon Batiste and Judah Smith have their own respective interludes on the forthcoming album.
Lana Del Rey reveals the official track list for her new album, â€˜Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd,â€™ releasing March 10. pic.twitter.com/TFnqdr0KSi â€” Pop Crave (@PopCrave) January 13, 2023
Antonoff, who previously worked with Del Rey on 2021â€™s Chemtrails Over the Country Club, is also listed on the cover as a producer, as are Mike Hermosa, Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes, who worked on Blue Bannisters, also released in 2021. The new record is available now for pre-order on the New York nativeâ€™s website, as are vinyls with several alternate covers.
The Grammy-nominated artist hasnâ€™t released a full album since Blue Bannisters last year, but she did drop an ethereal single titled â€œWatercolor Eyesâ€ in January for Euphoriaâ€˜s soundtrack. She also worked with Father John Misty on the EP Buddyâ€™s Rendezvous this year, and was featured on Taylor Swiftâ€™s Midnights track â€œSnow On the Beach,â€ which became Del Reyâ€™s second Billboard Hot 100 top 10 hit.

title: Lana Del Reyâ€™s Songs Get Spliced With Movies
content:
Photo: YouTube
Move aside, Daniels. Thereâ€™s a new king (or queen) of postmodern cinema, and itâ€™s the YouTube channel Lana Del Radio. This editing wizard has, for the past several years, been splicing together LDR songs with some of cinemaâ€™sâ€¦some of cinema. The choices for source material are bizarre. Who still thinks about Observe and Report, or the American Death Note movie? Lana Del Radio, thatâ€™s who. Courtney Love recently said while guesting on WTF that the only two true geniuses sheâ€™s ever known are Kurt Cobain and Lana Del Rey. But, to the best of my knowledge, Love hasnâ€™t met the genius behind Lana Del Radio. The channel has been dormant for a minute, but with a new Lana album dropping this March, one can only hope Lana Del Radio will come out of retirement for one last job. Maybe a mashup of Heat with â€œDid You Know Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Boulevard?â€ In the meantime, please spend an afternoon watching what may be the cultural zenith of western civilization: an anonymous YouTuber cutting scenes from The Wolf of Wall Street with Lana Del Reyâ€™s â€œNational Anthem.â€
â€œSalvatoreâ€/Wild Things
Trashy, sexy Florida crimes? Murder? Threesomes? Completely inexplicable plot twists? Wild Things is deeply Lana Del Rey coded, so it makes sense to do this lovely little video set to â€œSalvatore,â€ a song that compares getting murdered by a hot guy to eating ice cream.
â€œBreak Stuffâ€/The Evil Dead Franchise
Itâ€™s important to note, Lana Del Radio doesnâ€™t just make videos for Lana songs. Yes, the bulk of the canon are LDR. But every year, Lana Del Radio does horror mashups, with non-Lana songs. This one is so good it briefly convinced me NuMetal was good again. This Limp Bizkit/Sam Raimi jawn is the highlight. But thereâ€™s also a good Bruno Mars/Leprechaun video, an ode to the monstrous feminine set to â€œWAP,â€ and a killer Misfits/Night of the Comet quickie.
â€œSwan Songâ€/Jackie
No part of me ever wanted to watch Jackie until I saw this video. Lana Del Ray is already known for her Kennedy chick imagery, so this mashup is a no-brainer. Still, the work this video does is transformative. It changes Jackie Kennedy from someone trapped by their own grief into someone in love with it. You have to start romanticizing your life, as the TikTok sound says.
â€œRideâ€/Hot Rod
One thing Lana Del Radio excels at is bringing pathos out of a truly stupid comedy. It doesnâ€™t take an editing genius to mashup â€œWest Coastâ€ with Baz Luhrmanâ€™s William Shakespeareâ€™s Romeo + Juliet, but it does take some sort of mad god to find the elegiac tenderness inside films like Hot Rod and Tommy Boy. Speaking of that Tommy Boy one, hereâ€™s what Lana Del Radio commented on their own video: â€œI see myself in this video, makes me think about all the lives Iâ€™ve touched and how I am the best thing to happen to those lives.â€
â€œHoneymoonâ€/Austin Powers Trilogy
â€œWe both know itâ€™s not fashionable to love me.â€ She really said it all right there, didnâ€™t she? Each video Lana Del Radio makes creates more connections between LDR and the great heroes of our age. Thereâ€™s a James Bond one, a Jay Gatsby one, and this quintessential 20th century hero: Austin â€œDangerâ€ Powers. Austin Powers and Lana Del Rey are both swinging lovers unstuck from time. Jumbles of contradictions about political correctness, love, longing, feminism, eros and thanatos. â€œSwinginâ€™ 60â€™s here I come, baby, yeah!â€ -Lana Del Rey
â€œDark Paradiseâ€/The Twilight Saga
Nobody has ever personified the early LDR â€œI want to die from love, but even more than that I just want to dieâ€ thing like Bella Swan. (A runner up for â€œMost LDR-esque character everâ€ is every other person in Twilight.) The Twilight Saga is a psycho source text, with overwrought backstories around every turn. Everyone is so sexy about how unhappy they are. This video is a perfect combo of text and subtext.

title: Women arenâ€™t really allowed to age but Keira and Carey show us how
content:
T here are some celebrities I like to keep a particularly watchful eye on. Specifically, Carey Mulligan, Keira Knightley, Lana Del Rey and Amanda Seyfried. Itâ€™s not a random â€œultimate dinner party guestâ€ wishlist, but because they are the same age as me (Iâ€™ll wait while you Google it).
Of course weâ€™re all aware after a decade of scrolling manically through Instagram that comparison is the thief of joy, yet compare myself I do to these four. Not their careers and achievements â€” Iâ€™m not actively trying to reach new levels of self-loathing â€” but I monitor how theyâ€™re growing older.
I forensically chart the changes in their faces. How theyâ€™re approaching ageing. Are they starting to paper over the slowly emerging cracks or are they allowing the lines to form and the grey hairs to multiply? I once interviewed Seyfried â€” she was lovely, beautiful and I was pleased to see wrinkles on her expressive forehead. I saw the gorgeous Carey Mulligan walking through Soho not long ago and noted, happily, that she too looked like how most of my friends and I look â€” natural and like a woman of a certain age.
In a magazine interview this week, Knightley, 37 (there you go, saved you the Googling), said the topic of ageing had come to dominate her chats with friends. â€œA lot of the conversations Iâ€™ll have with my girlfriends are, â€˜oh, my God, Iâ€™ve got a line!!â€ Same, Keira, I thought. I also find myself having the â€œIs It Time?â€ [for Botox/chemical peels/injectables] conversation. My friends veer from the â€œnot just yetâ€ to those who are already Botoxed up to their immovable eyebrows.
The problem is that women still arenâ€™t really allowed to age. Weâ€™re damned if we do (remember the bullying Madonna received after her appearance at the Grammys?) and damned if we donâ€™t (cut to an older female celebrity being labelled â€œunrecognisableâ€ online). There is a special brand of misogyny aimed at women post-45. As Keira said this week, â€œChange is always tricky. Weâ€™re taught that itâ€™s bad. Weâ€™re taught that we donâ€™t want grey hair. How are we, culturally, meant to age?â€ Itâ€™s a good question. The only example she could think of â€” of a woman ageing well â€” was Dame Helen Mirren. The perennial mid-life pin-up, who is apparently the only woman in the world who has nailed the art of getting older.
Itâ€™s not just vacuous vanity (though I certainly have a bit of that) â€” but gendered ageism is very real. Itâ€™s not just beautiful women in the public eye, like Keira, who have to worry about the onset of crowâ€™s feet and dwindling collagen, meaning they miss out on movie parts and suffer trolling on social media.
Studies show that as women show visible signs of ageing they are seen as less competent and valuable in the workplace; men, though, gain respect as their hair thins and faces become craggy.
So how best to approach ageing? However the hell you want â€” just donâ€™t beat yourself up for worrying about it.
Me, Iâ€™ll be watching Keira and Co for my next move. No pressure, ladies.
Victoriaâ€™s Secret show is back
Famous for its skinny models and unachievable aesthetic, the Victoriaâ€™s Secret fashion show was â€” not that long ago â€” a highlight of the showbiz calendar. The likes of Adriana Lima, Gisele and Heidi Klum would shimmy down the runway while journalists asked questions like â€œwhatâ€™s the first thing youâ€™re going to eat after the showâ€? After a number of controversies, the show was axed.
Well, like all bad smells, itâ€™s back. The lingerie brand has announced it will put on â€œa new version of our fashion showâ€ this year. A teaser video showed more than one â€œplus-sizeâ€ model and some unsexy pyjamas,
along with the usual supermodel suspects like Bella Hadid.
Singer Lizzo labelled it â€œinclusivity for inclusivityâ€™s sakeâ€. Iâ€™m inclined to agree.

title: Suzanne Jackson felt having husband Dylan in the audience helped during emotional week
content:
Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Get the latest showbiz news and gossip every day by signing up to our FREE newsletter
Suzanne Jackson felt having her husband Dylan O'Connor in the audience on Sunday night helped during emotional week on Dancing with the Stars.
The entrepreneur and TV presenter danced a rumba to Lana Del Rey's Young and Beautiful, the song Suzanne and Dylan chose for the first dance at their wedding.
Now her attention is turning to reaching the final in two weeks time.
Read more: Suzanne Jackson explains Eileen Style Queen's absence on The Style Counsellors
Suzanne told RSVP Live: "Michael has been saying from the beginning that I need to get lost in the music and I need to not remember the dance by the end.
"This was the one dance where I didnâ€™t remember it. That song was so personal and it brought me back to that time.
"Two weeks ago it clicked that if you hammer the steps into the body enough the head can let go with the music and emotion.
"You need emption and a connection with your partner with the rumba. You have to learn that, that is a skill."
Suzanne misses her family while she is busy with training and that added to her excitement of having Dylan there to cheer her on in person.
She said: "I miss my friends and I miss my family. My mum and dad came in to see us training on Friday.
"I was missing them because I am a real family person. Having them there helped and they were genuinely blown away by our routine.
"The nerves are getting less and less and the excitement is building.
"I want to perform the routine because I have worked so hard and the energy from the audience makes it even more enjoyable. It has taken nine weeks to feel like this, I wish I felt it from the beginning."
(Image: Kyran Oâ€™Brien/kobpix)
Suzanne and her pro partner Michael Danilczuk got 30 for their outstanding routine - her first 30 of the season and the highest score ever given for a rumba across all six seasons.
She said: "I canâ€™t believe it. I love detail and the rumba is so detailed. It is so slow so it is all about technique and I flourished in that regard."
The Dubliner added: "I have been so into since the beginning and when I put my mind to something I do it 100 percent.
"At the beginning I put too much pressure on myself. We got great points on week one and week two but I couldnâ€™t sustain it and keep it going by week three.
"We slipped in the dress rehearsal for week twoâ€™s waltz. I had a really long dress, Michael slipped on it and the two of us fell to the floor. You donâ€™t think that can happen and it got into my head."
Suzanne has had a lot of self-growth on this journey.
She said: "It is not just about Dancing with the Stars, I have learned so much about myself. I have loved every minute of it.
"I love to see someone grow and I feel like I am growing. When you are successful and you have built something that you are very proud of, you think â€˜Is this it?â€™ and â€˜Where am I going to grow?â€™ because I love a challenge."
Ahead of the semi-final on Sunday night, Suzanne and Michael have one eye on reaching the final.
She said: "At the end of the day, everyone is here to try and get to the final because that is what it is all about.
"I do say that the journey is sometimes more important than the destination. I am enjoying this time with Michael, the celebrities and the pros."
Suzanne is the bookies favourite to win Dancing with the Stars, but she is not caught up with that.
She said: "These things fluctuate, it changes every week.
"I never thought Panti was going to go home on Sunday night. It is anyoneâ€™s game and there is a journey for every celeb out there. Everyone deserves to be here too."

title: IMS Ibiza 2023: TaP's Ben Mawson, Warner Music's Max Lousada to Speak
content:
Newly acquired by the Beatport Group, IMS Ibiza will hold its 14th International Music Summit on April 26-28 at Destino Pacha Ibiza resort. Among the industry figures scheduled to participate are: Warner Music Groupâ€™s CEO of recorded music Max Lousada, Ben Mawson of TaP Management, whose clients include Lana Del Rey, Ellie Goulding and Noah Cyrus, the artist Tokimonsta with attorney and former Roc Nation counsel Jennifer Justice, and Wassermanâ€™s Tom Schroeder, among others.
Established in 2007, the thought leadership conference is dedicated to covering the greater electronic music ecosystem and features live seminars, keynote interviews, technology masterclasses, performances, and networking opportunities. It also publishes the annual IMS Business Report. The event is hosted every year by co-founder Pete Tong with fellow BBC Radio 1 dance presenter Jaguar.
Per the Beatport acquisition announcement, IMS Ibiza will continue to operate under the direction of its co-founders, Tong, Ben Turner, Danny Whittle, Mark Netto and Simeon Friend.
Said Beatport CEO Robb McDaniels: â€œIMS has become one of the most impactful gatherings for the global DJ and dance music industries, and everyone at Beatport is excited to take this brand to the next level. We look forward to partnering with Pete, Ben and the entire IMS team to broaden the IMS footprint as a major component of our plan to expand the Beatport brand around the world through community, education, and thought leadership initiatives.â€
â€œWe are very proud of what weâ€™ve built at IMS over these past 16 years, driving the narrative and agenda of the culture forward from the genreâ€™s spiritual home of Ibiza,â€ said the IMS founders. â€œAligning with Beatport, who have been supporters of IMS from our inception, will enable us to action many of our ideas on how to continue to grow the platform all year round; to further educate and mentor the next generation; and to help focus the industryâ€™s attention on the issues that matter. It will help increase our ability to have more impact for the genre.â€
For the full schedule, head to www.internationalmusicsummit.com.

title: Outside Lands 2023 lineup boasts Kendrick Lamar, Foo Fighters, ODESZA
content:
Hip-hop star Kendrick Lamar, Rock and Roll Hall of Famers the Foo Fighters and ultra-popular electronic music act ODESZA are set to headline the 2023 Outside Lands festival in San Francisco
Other acts on the bill, which was announced on Tuesday morning, March 7, include Lana Del Rey, The 1975, Megan Thee Stallion, Zedd, Janelle MonÃ¡e, Maggie Rogers, FISHER, Ethel Cain, Noah Kahan, J.I.D, Lil Yachty, Father John Misty, Cigarettes After Sex, Orville Peck, Willow, Beabadoobee, Cuco, Alvvays, aespa and NIKI.
And even NBA legend Shaquille Oâ€™Neal is set to perform at the festival under his stage name Diesel.
The complete lineup is listed below.
The event, which is celebrating 15 years of delighting festivalgoers at picturesque Golden Gate Park, takes place Aug. 11-13.
â€œWhen we started Outside Lands back in 2008, we had a vision to create a unique festival experience that had never been done before,â€ says Allen Scott, co-founder of Outside Lands and president of concerts and festivals at Berkeleyâ€™s Another Planet Entertainment. â€œFifteen years later, Outside Lands continues to be a bright spot for the city of San Francisco and pushes boundaries in music, food, drink, art and cannabis programming, as well as providing space for environmental and social initiatives.
â€œThe festival celebrates everything we love about the Bay Areaâ€™s rich cultural history. Weâ€™re proud of the positive financial impact the festival has on San Francisco, injecting more than $1 billion into the S.F. economy since its inception.â€
Three-day passes start at $449 and go on sale at 10 a.m. March 8 at SFOutsideLands.com. The festival also offers payment plans for those who donâ€™t want to part with all the dough upfront.

content:

A vontade de morar no Brasil foi anunciada atravÃ©s dos Stories do Instagram e veio poucos dias apÃ³s um mÃºsico da cantora xingar o Brasil apÃ³s ser assaltado. Na rede social Charlie diz que Ã© agente imobiliÃ¡rio.

No mesmo post temporÃ¡rio feito neste sÃ¡bado, dia que a cantora canta em SÃ£o Paulo, ele ainda escreveu "America" isoladamente, sem especificar se era em referÃªncia aos Estados Unidos ou ao continente americano.

MÃºsico teve opiniÃ£o diferente
