title: Lana Del Rey Posed Nude For â€˜Ocean Blvdâ€™ Album Cover But â€˜Got Nervousâ€™
content:
Lana Del Reyâ€˜s upcoming album originally had a very different cover. While speaking with Billie Eilish for Interview Magazine in a Tuesday (Feb. 14) profile, the singer-songwriter revealed that the original cover for Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, her new album arriving March 24, was going to be a photo of her in the nude â€” but she ended up scrapping it for a couple reasons.
â€œMy original cover was nude, then I thought about it, and I was like, maybe not right now, because there are some other things I want to do where I feel like that could get in the way,â€ she explained to Eilish. â€œThe idea behind it was, instead of being exposed for things that werenâ€™t true, I wanted to reveal something about myself that I actually thought was beautiful, but in the end, I got nervous about doing that because I was like, â€˜Is this an artistic inspiration that came to me or is this a reaction to something I feel is critical about me?â€™
â€œI never liked to do anything in response to something thatâ€™s fear-based or based on what people think about me,â€ she continued. â€œI donâ€™t know if thatâ€™ll ever come out, but if it did, I would just want to make sure it came out when I thought it was super fun and not because I had to show something to people.â€
Designed by Neil Krug, the Ocean Blvd cover ended up being a blue-toned black and white image of Lana, lying on her stomach with ribbons in her hair, resting her head in her hand as she stares moodily at the camera. â€œI wanted to take my time and think about what I wanted to express in my face,â€ she said of the photo shoot.
â€œThat part of the process was a little tumultuous, because I was feeling open, but then I closed down again and wanted to play it safe,â€ added the â€œA&Wâ€ singer. â€œBut the good thing is that the songs are so wordy that if you listen to them carefully, theyâ€™re revealing in the same way the photo wouldâ€™ve been. I was like, â€˜Okay, Iâ€™ll let the songs do the talking for now.â€™â€
Lana â€” this yearâ€™s Billboard Women in Music Visionary Award honoree â€” also bonded with Eilish about the throes of rising to fame and dealing with hate as young female artists. â€œEveryone gets their fair share of thinkpieces, but there were definitely some 60-page articles about me being the face of feminine submission and the pro-domestic whatever,â€ she recalled. â€œThat was quite tough, because at the time, I was just trying to figure things outâ€¦ For me, it was trial by fire,â€ she added. â€œItâ€™s definitely a different era now.â€
On the same day of the interview with Eilish, Lana released a seven-minute new song off Ocean Blvd called â€œA&W.â€ Listen here.

title: Inside the Unlikely New York Record Store That Sells Vinyl to the Stars
content:
When a 20-year-old Jamal Alnasr moved to New York City in 1990, he barely spoke English and only knew the names of 10 artists, like Madonna and Boney M, whom heâ€™d heard on the radio. A native Palestinian, he arrived in the city after a few years spent living in Jordan as a teenager. He used music to teach himself English, then landed his first job at a record shop on Bleecker Street in Greenwich Village, where he read CD pamphlets, learned lyrics, and researched artistsâ€™ influences. After four and a half years, he opened up his own shop, Village Music, down the street, with the money he had saved from working.
On opening day, Alnasr decided to put his collection of rare records up for sale, and made $5,000. â€œIf people came in and meant to spend $20, they would spend $200,â€ he recalls. â€œI had a lot of rare stuff.â€ Word eventually got out that he was the man to see if you were looking for an impossible-to-find record. Upon receiving a request, Alnasr would raise his eyebrows and tell people to come back in four days, when he would undoubtedly have the record packaged up and waiting in the back room.
Even with this personal touch, Village Records eventually met the same sad fate as so many downtown music stores. In 2017, Alnasr could no longer afford his rentâ€”which he says went up from about $160 in the â€™90s to $5,000â€”and shuttered the shop. â€œI was broke as hell,â€ he admits. He went back to Palestine and sold some real estate his father had owned. When he returned to New York, he met a sympathetic landlord and opened Village Revival Records next door to his old shop. â€œI want to revive the Village because Iâ€™m really scared of change,â€ he says of the storeâ€™s new moniker. â€œI want to rebuild the â€™90s.â€
Over the last few years, the humble shop has become an unlikely magnet for stars such as RosalÃ­a and Lana Del Rey, who are devoted customers. Bella Hadid didnâ€™t have a record collection before she met Alnasr at Village Revival. An unlikely friendship soon formed between the 53-year-old store owner and the 26-year-old supermodel, who bonded over their shared Palestinian heritage and love for music. Hadid was interested to learn more about Alnasrâ€™s journey to America, he says, and soon brought her mother, father, and sister Gigi to the shop. One night, Alnasr went to dinner with Hadid and her boyfriend at the nearby Minetta Tavern, where he gave the couple a turntable. â€œNow you guys are going to party tonight,â€ he told them.

title: Lana Del Rey, in arrivo l'album con la copertina in topless?
content:
"Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd" Ã¨ il nono disco di lana del Rey e segue il successo dei precedenti album "Blue Banisters" e "Chemtrails Over The Country Club", entrambi molto acclamati dalla critica di tutto il globo. E' stato scritto dalla stessa cantante insieme a Mike Hermosa e prodotto con Jack Antonoff, Drew Erickson e Zack Dawes. Le tracce saranno sedici con le collaborazioni di Father John Misty, Bleachers, Jon Batiste e Tommy Genesis.
Lo stupore dei fan per la copertina
Lana Del Rey ha sorpreso i fan svelando gli artwork del nuovo album, con la cantante stessa che posa in topless con un seno scoperto. Ãˆ una scelta sorprendente per una cantante che in passato ha suscitato polemiche per aver criticato altre cantanti per "essere sexy" e "non indossare vestiti". Nel 2020, difendendosi dalle accuso di razzismo che le sono piovute addosso aveva scritto su Instagram: "Ora che Doja Cat, Ariana Grande, Camila Cabello, Cardi B, Kehlani, Nicki Minaj e BeyoncÃ© hanno scalato le classifiche con canzoni che parlano solo di essere sexy, di non indossare vestiti, di fare sesso, di tradire, etc, posso tornare a cantare il fatto di sentirmi bella perchÃ© sono innamorata anche se la relazione non Ã¨ perfetta, di ballare in cambio di soldi o di qualsiasi altra cosa io voglia senza essere crocifissa o sentirmi dire che sto rendendo glamour gli abusi nei miei testi?", prendendosela con l'ipocrisia di certi benpensanti.

title: Lana Del Rey Has a Lot to Say
content:
Queen of Ocean Blvd. Photo: Daniel Knighton/Getty Images
â€œI just recently realized that I talk a lot,â€ Lana Del Rey told Billie Eilish in the pairâ€™s new conversation for Interview magazine. And what a time for that conversation to arrive, with Del Rey also dropping her new single â€œA&W,â€ which clocks in as one of the longest Lana songs ever at seven minutes, 13 seconds. The highly anticipated single, a.k.a. â€œAmerican Whore,â€ starts in Del Reyâ€™s lush, â€™70s-pop sweet-spot, with murmured lyrics resembling a stream of consciousness. (â€œI havenâ€™t done a cartwheel since I was 9 / I havenâ€™t seen my mother in a long, long time,â€ she opens.) Then, halfway through, a synth bass kicks in and the song pivots, with Del Rey rapping â€œJimmy Jimmy Cocoa Puffâ€ and declaring, â€œYour mom called / I told her youâ€™re fucking up big time!â€ Let the girl talk her shit.
The seven-minute odyssey is the latest offering from Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd, Del Reyâ€™s ninth album, out March 24. The album, as she told Eilish in Interview, originally had an even longer title: Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd pearl watch me on ring a bell psycho lifeguard. Del Rey said she only told her designer, Neil Krug, the original title, but when he designed an album cover, â€œWe realized that maybe it was a bit much to have six titles in one.â€ Del Rey continued, â€œThat was a really psychotic day because I was like, â€˜Am I willing to literally burn everything down to the ground by having some strange, nonsensical title?â€™â€
As for the rest of the album, Del Rey admitted the songs are â€œwordyâ€ in a way thatâ€™s â€œrevealing in the same wayâ€ as the topless photo she scrapped for the album cover. She said the album started as a collaboration with her rumored ex Mike Hermosa, a cinematographer who would mess around on guitar, and whom Del Rey eventually got into a studio with collaborators like Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes. The last song she wrote, meanwhile, was â€œMargaret,â€ for her other longtime collaborator Jack Antonoff and his fiancÃ©e Margaret Qualley, and featuring his band Bleachers. â€œI was like, â€˜You know what? I want to write a song for him,â€™â€ Del Rey said. Just donâ€™t read too far into it. â€œWhen I did Norman Fucking Rockwell! it was about world-building, whereas this was straight vibing,â€ she added.

title: Lana Del Rey Shares New Song â€œA&Wâ€: Listen
content:
Lana Del Rey has shared the second single from her forthcoming album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. She co-wrote and co-produced the new song, â€œA&W,â€ with frequent collaborator Jack Antonoff. Listen below.
Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, the follow-up to 2021â€™s Blue Banisters, is out March 24. Lana Del Rey shared the albumâ€™s title trackâ€”which she co-produced with Jack Antonoff, Drew Erickson, and Zach Dawesâ€”back in December. Collaborators on the new album include Father John Misty, Jon Batiste, Syml, Riopy, and Tommy Genesis.
Del Rey discussed her new LP in a new conversation with Billie Eilish for Interview. â€œAt first, the title was definitely going to be Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, and then I fucking panicked and I went to [photographer Neil Krugâ€™s] house and said, â€˜I know this is fucked up, but Iâ€™ve changed the title,â€™â€ she revealed. â€œâ€˜Itâ€™s going to now be called, â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd Pearl Watch Me on Ring a Bell Psycho Lifeguard.â€â€™ He was like, â€˜What the fuck?â€™ I was like, â€˜Iâ€™m not telling anyone. Just mock it up.â€™ He mocked it up, but we realized that maybe it was a bit much to have six titles in one.â€
Del Rey also discussed a song on the album that she made with Jack Antonoffâ€™s Bleachers. â€œSeptember 2022 was the very last song I wrote. Itâ€™s a song called â€˜Margaret,â€™ about Jack Antonoffâ€™s fiancÃ©e [Margaret Qualley],â€ she said. â€œI was like, â€˜You know what? I want to write a song for him.â€™ It lands right in the middle of the album. Itâ€™s funny, this album felt totally effortless. When I did Norman Fucking Rockwell! it was about world-building, whereas this was straight vibing.â€

title: Young Chicago artist Leezy has a debut album â€˜Metanoiaâ€™ and a show at Golden Dagger
content:
At only 23 years old, Leezy is not afraid to get vulnerable. For many young artists, it may take time and pressure to open up to the world about their personal and emotional challenges. But Leezy (born Lia Jimenez) said sharing her story â€” her truth â€” has been freeing more than anything else.
â€œAs a music listener, I love to hear songs that are very raw and authentic and come from a place of real, true feeling. I basically just want to contribute to that,â€ Jimenez said.
Advertisement
Born to what she described as a â€œpunk rock dadâ€ and a â€œraver mom,â€ Jimenez said music was an early part of her DNA. â€œMusic for me has been in my life for as long as I can remember,â€ she said. Jimenez joined the choir at a young age, a place where she found her initial love of singing. Later in high school, she began to write her own songs after her mother gifted her a piano on her 16th birthday.
A daily journaler, she began incorporating the â€œteen angstâ€ of her journal entries and poems into the songs she wrote. â€œIt was more so something I was using as an outlet, and it was very cathartic for me to let those emotions out,â€ she said. After moving to Chicago to attend college at Loyola University, she soon met her producer, who encouraged her to work together and begin releasing music. Jimenez still uses the same songwriting process from her youth â€” beginning at the piano, reviewing old journal entries or thoughts on her Notes app on her phone â€” to make her newer music.
Advertisement
Most recently, that has resulted in her debut album, â€œMetanoia.â€ Released in October, â€œMetanoiaâ€ traverses an emotionally fraught personal landscape. In some ways, the album can be divided into three parts representing three different, yet transformative times in her life: before, during and after rehab for drug and alcohol misuse. The record details everything that comes with that experience, which can be relatable even if one is not struggling with addition. From toxic relationships and self-sabotage to the weight of isolation and feelings of loneliness, Jimenez dives deep into the ways in which personal struggle may manifest in oneâ€™s life.
â€œI feel like Iâ€™m thinking and writing 24/7. Like if I have a thought that pops into my head, Iâ€™ll think, â€˜Oh, thatâ€™s a lyric,â€™ and Iâ€™ll go and write it down right away,â€ she said. Her phone is filled with many one-liners that she returns to when she is feeling inspired.
Still, with all of that work to pull from, Jimenez is picky about what she puts out into the world. She describes herself as her worst critic. Deciding what to double down on, rework and ultimately release to the world is a matter of thinking from the listenerâ€™s perspective, she said. Will this resonate? And with whom?
â€œHow could this be a lifeline for someone else whoâ€™s listening?â€ she said she asks herself. â€œIâ€™ve written a lot of songs about my sobriety journey, but I decided they were important to release not only for someone who is also dealing with a struggle with addiction but also anyone who is going through it and is feeling like they want to start making some changes. I try to listen from a listenerâ€™s point of view, and if I feel like itâ€™s good enough for my standards as a listener, then itâ€™s good enough to go out into the world.â€
Listening to the music, Jimenez said she can hear the differences sonically between those moments in her life. In fact, writing was a key factor in her personal recovery. â€œItâ€™s just so cathartic for me, and itâ€™s been a healthy coping mechanism in my healing journey,â€ she said. â€œHonestly, for me, itâ€™s less scary just putting it into a song and throwing it out into the world than, for example, opening up to a friend. Itâ€™s a release to me.â€
Despite the raw, unfiltered examination of her life, Jimenez is not afraid to share it with the world. Since sheâ€™s begun releasing songs that detail her own journey of sobriety, she said she has received messages from others navigating a similar path. It is her ability to be open and forthright about her experiences that has made her music so compelling in the first place.
The result is a collection of music that is mature, sophisticated and compelling. Jimenezâ€™s ability to push herself, lyrically and stylistically, is sure to capture new fans. Her confident blend of hip-hop-inspired beats paired with captivating percussion and piercing synths may draw comparisons to the likes of Billie Eilish or early Lana Del Rey. But unlike some of her predecessors like Rey who write from a place of make-believe, Jimenez bares all, emotionally, with a glimpse into her life.
â€œWhen Iâ€™m in a place and I listen to a song where I think, â€˜Oh wow, they really understand and Iâ€™m not alone in this moment,â€™ thatâ€™s kind of what I want to put out into the world. Itâ€™s kind of a give-and-take kind of vibe,â€ she said.
Advertisement
9:30 p.m. Feb. 11 at Golden Dagger, 2447 N. Halsted; tickets are $12, 21+ at goldendagger.com
Britt Julious is a freelance critic.

title: Behind Lana Del Reyâ€™s Best Vinyl Sales Week Ever
content:
This week, Lana Del Rey released her ninth straight top 10 album on the Billboard 200, with Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd debuting at No. 3 on the chart. But it was the manner of that debut that caught the eye: of the 115,000 equivalent album units the record racked up in its first week, 58,500 units were vinyl â€” the biggest vinyl sales week of the year so far and the best of her career, with it also available on CD and cassette. And the remainder of the sum equated to some 36.14 million on-demand streams, the biggest streaming week of her career, to boot.
That success was no accident: the singer has always sold well at the vinyl format, according to her label Interscope Geffen A&M, and the label and her management team at TAP prioritized the format, as well as the other sales variants, in order to have them available the day the album came out, resulting in the big sales week. And that strategy helps earn Interscope Geffen A&M chief revenue officer and global head of streaming and strategy Gary Kelly earn the title of Billboardâ€™s Executive of the Week.
Here, Kelly breaks down what went into the big vinyl and sales week for Lana Del Rey, as well as how that major streaming activity helped play into the overall success of the album. â€œWe always like to begin with what the demands of the fans are,â€ Kelly says. â€œThis is what you see here, so every music product we created was based on our insights for what the fans would want to own.â€
This week, Lana Del Reyâ€™s Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd debuted at No. 3 on the Billboard 200 with 115,000 equivalent album units, with vinyl making up 58,500 units â€” the best vinyl sales week of the year so far and best of her career. What key decision did you make to help make that happen?
Lana has been at the forefront of the vinyl resurgence, so our strategy was based on years of historical data and her overall growth with the Gen Z audience, who we know love vinyl to listen to and also to show their fandom. The Interscope revenue team worked closely with [her management team] Ben [Mawson], Ed [Millett] and Wendy [Ong] at TAP Management to ensure the album was delivered in time to ensure we had the master and the packaging in time to deliver for street date.
Related Metallica Sells So Much Vinyl It Just Bought Its Own Pressing Plant
The album had six vinyl variants, with several exclusives available in different stores. How did you develop that strategy and how did you see it pay off?
On previous releases we had productive campaigns with partners like Target, indie retail, Amazon and Urban Outfitters. We looked at that historical data to determine the best path for Lanaâ€™s new project.
Have production delays for vinyl gotten easier, or does it still require long lead times? And how did you navigate that?
The supply chain issues that we experienced at the height of the pandemic are improving and we were able to manage inventory to ensure that we had plenty of the vinyl. Long lead times however still exist, but Universal Music Logistics has done a good job turning around reorders quickly. That helped tremendously, as some of the initial allocations sold out and we had to re-run additional inventory that arrived in time for street date. That would not have been possible in 2021 or 2022.
The album was also released through nine different CD variants, and also five different cassette versions. Why lean so much into those formats?
We always like to begin with what the demands of the fans are. This is what you see here, so every music product we created was based on our insights for what the fans would want to own.
Related CD Sales Are Up and Merch Tables May Be the Reason
The debut also marked the biggest streaming week in Lana Del Reyâ€™s career. How did the streaming and sales strategies dovetail and feed off each other?
Lana having the largest streaming week of her career is tied to her making a brilliant album. She is a true artist and she pushes boundaries with every new project. New fans and audiences are catching up to her. That said, we look at streaming and sales audiences as having overlap, so when we launched the preorder and first single in December, we were driving pre-sales, but also driving fans to listen on the DSPs.
We had Lana in our Santa Monica recording studios in January and while listening to the album, there was a general feel from the marketing, digital and revenue teams that â€œA&Wâ€ would be the ideal song to release to further connect the streaming audience and pre-sales. It worked perfectly as the song reacted incredibly well with fans across the world and drove a substantial number of preorders. In fact, preorders jumped around 20%, which is unusual given that we had already amassed thousands of preorders because they had been available for almost three months by that point.
The album also reached No. 1 in the U.K., Australia and several other countries around the world. What was the global strategy with regards to this release?
We worked with Ben Mortimer, Stephen Hallows and the rest of the Polydor team to craft an in-depth global strategy with the UMG teams across the world. The Interscope international team did a great job working with the local affiliates to ensure the best plans were in place and executed. The results show how deeply connected we were with all of them between DSP campaigns, physical partner campaigns along with our direct relationship with fans across the world with our D2C strategy.
Do you see the future of physical sales as being more merch item or niche consumer product?
Most of the physical music products are built for segments of the fans that want to own something from their favorite artist to show off their fandom. That said, I do not see these as niche as much as reflective of what these fans want. Will those tastes change in the coming years? That most likely will be the case and we will want to adjust what we, and the artist, create to match fan interests and preferences.
Previous Executive of the Week: Joseph Oerke of Decca

title: Lana Del Rey & Fall Out Boy Lead Rock & Alternative Album Charts
content:
Lana Del Rey lands her seventh No. 1 on Billboardâ€™s Top Alternative Albums chart, and sixth in a row, while Fall Out Boy claims its fifth Top Rock Albums ruler, both on the April 8-dated tallies.
Del Reyâ€™s Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd crowns both the Top Rock & Alternative Albums and Top Alternative Albums surveys with 115,000 equivalent album units earned in its first week (March 24-30), according to Luminate. Of that sum, 87,000 units are via album sales and 28,000 from streaming units.
Tunnel is Del Reyâ€™s second No. 1 on Top Rock & Alternative Albums and first since it shifted to a model inclusionary of alternative-leaning albums not necessarily within the rock genre, following Born to Die in 2012.
As for Top Alternative Albums, her domination dates back to Die, followed by six straight leaders beginning with 2015â€™s Honeymoon. Del Rey extends her lead for the most Top Alternative Albums No. 1s in the chartâ€™s 16-year history, with the next-closest acts all boasting five rulers apiece.
Most No. 1s, Top Alternative Albums:
7, Lana Del Rey
5, Coldplay
5, Disturbed
5, Foo Fighters
5, Imagine Dragons
5, Jack White
5, Pearl Jam
Concurrently, Tunnel tops Vinyl Albums (58,000 vinyl copies sold). On the all-genre Billboard 200, it opens at No. 3, marking Del Reyâ€™s ninth top 10.
The latest Hot Rock & Alternative Songs tally features 14 Del Rey songs from the album. Leading the way is â€œA&W,â€ which jumps 43-18 in its seventh week on the survey with 3.3 million official U.S. streams. The Jon Batiste-featuring â€œCandy Necklaceâ€ follows at No. 22 (3.1 million streams).
Meanwhile, Fall Out Boyâ€™s So Much (for) Stardust bows at No. 1 on Top Rock Albums on the strength of 64,000 units, 49,000 of which are from album sales.
Each of Fall Out Boyâ€™s last four studio albums has led Top Rock Albums, dating to 2007â€™s Infinity on High. The band last reigned with 2018â€™s M A N I A prior to Stardust.
Stardust also starts at No. 2 on both Top Rock & Alternative Albums and Top Alternative Albums. On the Billboard 200, it begins at No. 6, becoming the bandâ€™s seventh top 10.
Three songs from Stardust place on Hot Rock & Alternative Songs, paced by lead single â€œLove From the Other Side,â€ which jumps 29-15. It earned 7.1 million radio audience impressions, 2.4 million streams and 1,000 downloads March 24-30.
â€œSideâ€ became Fall Out Boyâ€™s first-ever Alternative Airplay No. 1 in March and also boasts new highs of No. 24 on Mainstream Rock Airplay and No. 40 on Pop Airplay.

La chanteuse de Summertime Sadness, 37 ans, s'est apparemment fiancÃ©e Ã  son manager Evan Winiker, 40 ans, rapporte le magazine People, citant Billboard. Lors de l'Ã©vÃ©nement du Billboard, l'ex du musicien Jack Donoghue et du musicien Clayton Johnson portait une bague en diamant Ã  la main gauche. Le manager de Lana Del Rey, associÃ© gÃ©rant chez Range Media, a Ã©tÃ© aperÃ§u avec l'interprÃ¨te d'origine amÃ©ricaine pour la premiÃ¨re fois en septembre 2022 lors du festival Malibu Chili Cook-Off, d'aprÃ¨s Billboard. Le magazine People nous rappelle que Del Rey et son ex Donoghue avaient apparemment officialisÃ© leur relation sur Instagram en juillet 2022.

title: Lana Del Rey Gets Secretly Engaged to Artist-Manager Evan Winiker
content:
Lana Del Rey has kept her high-profile relationship with Range Media Partnersâ€™ Evan Winiker successfully under the wraps for a few months now. However, Billboard recently stunned fans and the media with a congratulatory message to the couple. "Congratulations are in order for Lana Del Rey and Range Media Partnersâ€™ Evan Winiker, who are engaged," the iconic music site published on March 28.
While the beginning timeline of the relationship is uncertain, the two love birds have been spotted together on several occasions, including at the Malibu Chili Cook-Off in September and a dinner date at a restaurant in Pioneertown, California, earlier this month.
According to Billboard, Lana Del Rey and Evan Winker are now engaged!
Congratulations, Lana! ğŸ’ğŸ’Œ pic.twitter.com/jGmUTDGP6K â€” Lana Del Rey Online (@LanaDReyOnline) March 29, 2023
W Magazine reports that Winiker is a talent manager and managing partner at Range Media Partners. He manages an elite list of clients including MAX, Daya and Disco Biscuits. A passionate musician himself, he previously played bass for the band Steel Train, which included Jack Antonoff, one of Del Reyâ€™s frequent producers and collaborators. Most recently, Antonoff worked with the singer on Ocean Blvd.
Speaking exclusively to Variety, Winiker spoke about his goals as a manager at the time of first joining the media company in 2021. "As a manager, it's always my goal to surround my clients with the best teams in all areas. This ecosystem is truly that. It's an environment of forward-thinking people who look beyond the boundaries and walls that are categorically put in place, allowing them to open new doors and reach new peaks that we dream up."
Del Rey was previously linked to musician Jack Donoghue in May 2022, People reports. The dating rumors with the band member of Salem began swirling after Jack shared a since-deleted Instagram video of the pair at a monster truck race. In the video, Del Rey even referred to Donoghue as "babe." In May, the singer attended a family event and the photos taken at Donoghue's birthday party went viral. The low-key couple made things Instagram official in July 2022. Del Rey and Donoghue took photos in front of Chicago's Cook County Jail, which he captioned, "family visit." The photos have since been deleted.
When Del Rey received a special gift of flowers around this year's Valentine's Day, fans were quick to speculate that the sweet flowers were from Donoghue, as the bouquet was spotted on both of their Instagram Stories. "It's a love-hate thing," she captioned her story, though the Summertime Sadness singer didn't specify who and what her Story was about.
Image Source: GettyImages| Photo by Monica Schipper
Del Rey did attend the Billboard Women in Music event earlier this month wearing a stunning diamond ring on her finger, but as of now, neither she nor Winiker has confirmed the engagement. The couple has chosen to remain silent about their recent development from the public eye, but it hasn't stopped fans from going in a tizzy over the possibility.

title: The shallow depths of Lana Del Rey
content:
After a brief false start to her career under her given name of Lizzy Grant, the pop chanteuse Lana Del Rey emerged fully formed with her 2012 debut Born to Die. Her music â€” self-consciously retro, Xanax-glazed, minor-key balladry laden with Twitter-ready punchlines â€” has not changed much since then. But the critical consensus around its artistic and cultural merit has profoundly, and with it, our conception of what it takes to be a true pop star.
The year Born to Die was released, Pitchfork, at a crossroads between its indie roots and its current status as the millennial equivalent of 1990s-era Rolling Stone, lauded on its year-end list art-damaged freaks such as Swans and Death Grips, fussy indie traditionalists Grizzly Bear and Tame Impala, and the 1990s veteran Fiona Apple alongside cusp-of-mega-stardom performers Kendrick Lamar and Frank Ocean.
OUTER BANKS IS A PIONEER IN MOODBOARD TV
Lana, as she is now most frequently, mononymically referred to, was nowhere to be found. Maybe it was her decidedly un-indie origins, as a child of Grey Group yuppies who helped launch her career. Or maybe it was the self-consciously sophomoric lyrics of her breakout single â€œVideo Gamesâ€ (â€œHeaven is a place on earth with you, tell me all the things you wanna do / I heard that you like the bad girls, honey, is that true?â€). Or it could have been a catastrophic Saturday Night Live performance that nearly killed her career in the cradle and sent the era-defining music blog Hipster Runoff into an infamous existential tailspin.
â€œThe indie blogosphere is over the hill. Our opinions are old, tired, uninspired,â€ Carles, the pseudonymous author of Hipster Runoff, wrote, capping a dayslong Lana-inspired meltdown. â€œTo music and indie purists, Lizzy Grant is the AntiChrist. To indie modernists and loveslaves of internet content, Lana Del Rey is our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.â€
The modernists won, and Lana had the last laugh: Six Grammy nominations, multiple platinum and gold albums, the ritual genuflection of younger stars such as Billie Eilish, and, yes, a full-armed critical bear hug, with her 2019 record Norman Fucking Rockwell! named Pitchforkâ€™s album of the year. Her new record, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, released March 24, is poised to continue that dominance after landing to widespread acclaim as, again in that websiteâ€™s words, â€œa sweeping, sterling, often confounding work of self-mythology and psychoamericana.â€
Need a cigarette? Lanaâ€™s 180-degree turnabout from a punchline to an institution is one of the most remarkable cultural stories of the past decade, especially considering how relatively static her aesthetic and musical style have remained. Lana has definitively answered the question her fellow immaculately coiffed, gloomy, torch-singing icon Steven Patrick Morrissey once posed: â€œHas the world changed, or have I changed?â€ No doubt, itâ€™s the world.
Speaking of the world, Lanaâ€™s stubbornly consistent view of it is out of a big convertible on a long drive through an imagined Americana seen through a digital sepia tone filter (and invariably with a guy named â€œJimmy,â€ â€œJoe,â€ or â€œJohnâ€). We get the â€œRoadrunner Cafeâ€; â€œSome friends of mine down in Florence, Alabamaâ€; â€œMarathons in Long Beach by the sea.â€ And, of course, the recordâ€™s titular tunnel, a shuttered pedestrian walkway under said beach.
Opening track â€œThe Grantsâ€ is a weepy, maximalist tribute to a departed uncle and â€œmy grandmotherâ€™s last smileâ€ filtered through John Denverâ€™s â€œRocky Mountain High.â€ As she asked in a recent Rolling Stone interview, â€œWould it probably, plausibly, get to the point where [the music] became a body of work that made me a vessel that was sequestered to the point where only family would have access to the metaphorical tunnel?â€ (If you torture a metaphor long enough, itâ€™ll confess to anything.)
Placing her family front and center here is a nasty, clever bait-and-switch from one of the best in the business. Hate me for my provocations (and my success), you big meanie â€” at the end of the day, donâ€™t I just want what everyone else does, to snuggle in the â€œmetaphorical tunnelâ€ with meemaw and peepaw? And if the lyrics donâ€™t seem particularly deep, couldnâ€™t they be so inscrutably personal as to obscure meaning to anyone outside my inner circle (where you, parasocially, long to be?)
On the other hand, Lanaâ€™s knack for said provocations is one of the most amusing and effective tools in her arsenal as a pop star. There were her early, garbled comments on feminism when she declared herself â€œmore interested in ... SpaceX and Tesla, what's going to happen with our intergalactic possibilities.â€ She cryptically posted and deleted a video of looters during the 2020 George Floyd protests. She dated â€” gasp â€” an officer. (A personal favorite: She responded to a particularly tendentious criticism of a recent album cover by saying she was â€œnot the one storming the capital.â€)
The overall effect has been to keep her in the headlines while coming up just short of cancellation. On Tunnel, her weapon of choice as such is a nearly five-minute â€œJudah Smith Interlude,â€ featuring a sermon from the Seattle-based celebrity megachurch pastor. A writer for the Daily Beast attempted to defend her against criticism from gay fans galled by her association with the socially conservative Smith: â€œExamined against [previous track] â€˜A&W,â€™ â€˜Judah Smith Interludeâ€™ plays as wholly ironic,â€ the author writes. â€œDel Rey is exactly the type of person who would attend a celebrity-studded mega-church, both for a cleansing of the soul and to lambaste its intrinsic flamboyance with her friends.â€
Uh-huh.
Lanaâ€™s greatest skill as a pop star might be to inspire this level of Herculean projection-slash-wishcasting from her defensive liberal boosters. Its apotheosis is the rave Pitchfork review of 2019â€™s Norman Fucking Rockwell! â€” Thereâ€™s a swear word in the old-timey Americana, get it? â€” that declared her â€œone of Americaâ€™s greatest living songwriters.â€
â€œWhatever it was that brought Joni Mitchell and Leonard Cohen together half a century ago, that middle ground is in the solemn mood, hollowed space, and spiritual fortitude ofâ€ the albumâ€™s closing track, wrote Pitchforkâ€™s Jenn Pelly, with zero trace of irony or awareness of the need for an editor. She invokes Eve Babitz, Bob Dylan, and Walt Whitman. Listing off a few couplets of Lanaâ€™s refrigerator poetry, she declares that â€œin the vacant spaces between [Lanaâ€™s] dark phrases is the unassailable fact that people bury their pasts in order to endure them.â€ The operant phrase here is vacant spaces.
Since the beginning of her career, Lana has deployed the same basic lyrical style: Pithy schoolyard rhymes littered with topical references contrasted within a couplet with gloomy nostalgia or yearning. The song â€œA&Wâ€ contains a signal example that interpolates Nellyâ€™s â€œCountry Grammar,â€ more or less millennialsâ€™ equivalent of â€œDancing In the Streetsâ€: â€œJimmy, Jimmy, cocoa puff, Jimmy, get me high / Love me if you love or not, you can be my light / Jimmy only love me when he wanna get high â€¦ Your mom called, I told her, you're f***in' up big time.â€
Itâ€™s catchy! But the sweeping political and cultural import of the Lana songbook has been conjured entirely by critics who are desperate to raise a transgressive Camille-Paglian world-spirit from adolescent composition-book poetry.
CLICK HERE TO READ MORE FROM THE WASHINGTON EXAMINER
Wherein lies Lanaâ€™s victory. She conquered the pop world by waiting savvily for it to come to her. She correctly sussed that the compositional element of music itself could more or less be jettisoned as long as the correct signifiers are in place and got there before damn near everybody else. You donâ€™t have to enjoy it, or even listen to it â€” in fact, you hardly have to listen to it to enjoy it. But to credit Lanaâ€™s modernity by invoking a meme: You do, in fact, â€œgotta hand it to her.â€
Once seen as a glib poseur among indie-world artistes, Lana Del Rey is now second only to Taylor Swift as the avatar of revisionary-feminist pop criticism. Her lyrics were always written to be aggregated, to have Very Deep Thoughts projected onto their Netflix-and-barbiturates stream of consciousness. The dolorous, forgettable, repetitive music itself is secondary to her mastery of the altar at which we all now worship: that of the vibe. The content, you could say, is the point.
Derek Robertson co-authors Politico's Digital Future Daily newsletter and is a contributor to Politico Magazine.

title: Lana Del Rey cruelly trolled over weight: â€˜Worse than 9/11â€™
content:
Sheâ€™s no thin Lizzy â€” and her fans love her for it.
After briefly disappearing from the app, Lana Del Rey â€” whose given name is Elizabeth â€œLizzyâ€ Grant â€” is back in the Twitter crosshairs as debate swirls over the pop starâ€™s weight, all thanks to one mean tweet.
The cruel post, which was uploaded earlier this month by user @OxAutismo, featured a composite of the 37-year-old Grammy Winnerâ€™s figure â€œbeforeâ€ and â€œafterâ€ she ostensibly put on a few pounds, News.com.au reported. The cretin captioned it â€œworse than 9/11.â€
The userâ€™s account has since been deleted, but only after the tweet had amassed thousands of views. Thankfully, responses to the most recent tweet were overwhelmingly positive with one Del Rey defender writing, â€œThe way boys act out when celebrities gain weight is so strange.â€
Another wrote, â€œEww lana del rey gained weightâ€™ yeah sheâ€™s finally off drugs and happy lmao like thank god.â€
â€œLana Del Rey does not owe us thinness,â€ said one supporter. â€œJust because someone was a certain size at a certain age doesnâ€™t mean they have to maintain that size forever.â€
They concluded, â€œBodies change. Weight changes. And most importantly all bodies of all shapes and sizes are sexy, beautiful and worthy.â€
Twitter user @OxAutismoâ€™s mocking message. Ox Autismo/Twitter
Lana Del Rey pictured in September (left) and November 2022. The Daily Stardust / BACKGRID; Getty Images
Unfortunately, the â€œYoung and Beautifulâ€ singerâ€™s physique has been a magnet for body-shamers of late with trolls inundating Twitter with cruel comments regarding her body.
â€œLana del Reyâ€™s weight gain is the perfect visual representation of the decadence of society,â€ pot-shotted online entrepreneur David Mendes.
The fat-shaming hit a fever pitch in September after photos emerged of the Manhattan-born vocalist hanging out at the Malibu Chili cook-off.
â€œ40 ainâ€™t looking good for her,â€ lamented one gawker, while another quipped, â€œLooking like Lana Del Taco.â€
Del Rey arrives at the 2023 Billboard Women In Music at YouTube Theater on March 01, 2023 in Inglewood, California. FilmMagic,
One Twitter troll even took a screenshot of his iPhone playing her song â€œDiet Mountain Dewâ€ with the word â€œDietâ€ crossed out.
Del Rey isnâ€™t the first celeb to be fat-shamed of late. Last year, rapper 50 Cent was bombarded with body-shaming barbs after performing his signature hit â€œIn Da Clubâ€ at the Super Bowl halftime show.
â€œ50 cent got fat now he a dollar,â€ tweeted one heckler.

title: Details on Lana Del Rey's engagement ring from Evan Winiker
content:
Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)
Heâ€™s her sun, he makes her shine like diamonds.
Congratulations are in order for Lana Del Rey and music manager Evan Winiker; as Billboard reported Tuesday, the private couple recently got engaged.
While the Grammy-nominated singer â€” who recently released her ninth studio album, â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ â€” has only been spotted in public with Winiker a few times, she flashed her engagement ring on the Billboard Women in Music Awards red carpet on March 1.
And Mike Fried, CEO of The Diamond Pro, tells Page Six Style Del Reyâ€™s â€œstunning three-stone designâ€ is as meaningful as it gets.
Three-stone rings like Del Reyâ€™s are highly symbolic, representing a coupleâ€™s past, present and future. FilmMagic,
The songstress paired her new bling with a lacy yellow Zimmermann dress. FilmMagic,
â€œThree-stone rings represent a coupleâ€™s past, present, and future together â€” a beautiful symbol for this artistic couple,â€ Fried says, estimating the ringâ€™s center gem, which â€œappears to be a round cut,â€ at around 3 carats â€œwith a value of $100,000.â€
Olivia Landau, GIA-certified gemologist and founder of The Clear Cut, agrees on the cut of Del Reyâ€™s â€œtimelessâ€ ring, though she estimates the baubleâ€™s carat count at closer to 1.5.
Del Reyâ€™s not the only star rocking a triple-stone sparkler set in yellow gold.
Winiker, who is a managing partner at Range Media, previously played alongside Del Reyâ€™s friend and collaborator Jack Antonoff in the band Steel Train. evanwiniker/Instagram
Meghan Markle famously accepted a similar ring from Prince Harry in 2017, which included two stones that once belonged to Princess Diana.
For more Page Six Style you love â€¦
â€œThe main stone itself I sourced from Botswana, and the little diamonds either side are from my motherâ€™s jewelry collection to make sure that sheâ€™s with us on this â€” on this crazy journey together,â€ Prince Harry told the BBC at the time.
Nicole Kidman, Jessica Simpson and Kat Dennings are among the other celebrities whoâ€™ve worn three-stone engagement rings.

title: Lana Del Rey Is Engaged to Evan Winiker, Wearing a Ring
content:
On her fingertips. Photo: Steve Granitz/FilmMagic/FilmMagic,
Lana Del Rey got a ring to go with her candy necklace. Just days after she released her ninth album, Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd, Billboard reports that Del Rey is engaged to Evan Winiker, a talent manager and musician. Vulture has reached out to representatives for Del Rey and Winiker for confirmation. The news came after Del Rey sported a shimmering diamond on the red carpet of the Billboard Women in Music Awards earlier this month. Itâ€™s unclear when Del Rey began dating Winiker, a managing partner at Range Media Partners, but the couple were first spotted together last September at the Malibu Chili Cook Off. But even before they began dating, Del Rey was only a few degrees of separation from Winiker, who formerly played bass in Steel Train, an early band fronted by Jack Antonoff, Del Reyâ€™s go-to producer. One thing we do know: They did not meet at the Beverly Center.
Ocean Blvd is colored by Del Reyâ€™s dating history. She worked on the album with Mike Hermosa, a filmmaker she was dating and began writing songs with. She also alludes to her relationship with Jack Donoghue, of witch-house band Salem. On her previous album, 2021â€™s Blue Banisters, Del Rey collaborated with Clayton Johnson, another musician she was dating (and thought to be engaged to) at the time. And, as if we can ever forget, before all of these men, she dated a cop, Sean â€œSticksâ€ Larkin of Live PD. Del Rey brought things full circle when she put up just one Ocean Blvd billboard in Tulsa, Oklahoma, where Larkin lives. But nowâ€™s not the time for more antics â€” sheâ€™ll have a Honeymoon to plan before long.

title: Lana Del Rey soll sich verlobt haben!
content:
Los Angeles (Kalifornien/USA) - Was fÃ¼r freudige Nachrichten: Die "Summertime Sadness"-SÃ¤ngerin Lana Del Rey (37) soll sich verlobt haben!
Beim "2023 Billboard Woman in Music"-Event trug Lana Del Rey (37) einen verdÃ¤chtigen Klunker am Finger: Handelt es sich hierbei um einen Verlobungsring? Â© Bildmontage: Monica Schipper / GETTY IMAGES NORTH AMERICA / Getty Images via AFP (2)
Liebe liegt in der Luft! Wie Billboard berichtet, soll die Musikerin Ja gesagt haben! Und zwar zum Heiratsantrag von Evan Winiker (40) - dem GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrer der KÃ¼nstleragentur "Range Media Partners". Dies habe ein Insider gegenÃ¼ber dem US-Entertainment-Portal verraten.
Bereits in den vergangenen Monaten wurden Lana und Winiker immer wieder gemeinsam gesichtet und abgelichtet. So zum Beispiel beim "Malibu Chili Cook-Off"-Festival sowie in einem Restaurant in Kalifornien, wo sie gemeinsam mit ein paar Fans Fotos machten. Wie lange die beiden nun schon ein Paar sind, ist unklar.
Offiziell bestÃ¤tigt haben die zwei ihre Beziehung bisher nicht. Auch ist nicht bekannt, wie sich Winiker und Elizabeth Grant, wie die "Young and Beautiful"-Interpretin mit bÃ¼rgerlichem Namen heiÃŸt, Ã¼berhaupt kennengelernt haben.
Da der 40-JÃ¤hrige bis 2013 Teil der Indie-Rock-Band "Steel Train" war, genau wie Lanas Produzent Jack Antonoff (38), besteht jedoch die MÃ¶glichkeit, dass dieser die beiden verkuppelt haben kÃ¶nnte.
Erst vor wenigen Wochen hatte Lana beim "2023 Billboard Woman in Music"-Event einen groÃŸen Klunker an ihrer Hand getragen. Ob es sich dabei bereits um einen Verlobungsring gehandelt haben kÃ¶nnte?

title: Lana Del Rey engaged to music manager Evan Winiker: report
content:
Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)
Lana Del Rey is reportedly engaged to music manager and musician Evan Winiker, Billboard reports.
The â€œCandy Necklaceâ€ songstress, who last week released her hotly anticipated ninth studio album, â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd,â€ has kept her rumored romance with Winiker under wraps.
The pair, who have reportedly been dating for a few months, were seen together only a handful of times.
Del Rey and Winiker, who is a managing partner at Range Media, have remained pretty tight-lipped on their relationship even on social media.
Page Six has reached out to Del Reyâ€™s reps for comment.
The â€œRideâ€ singer, 37, sparked engagement rumors after she was seen wearing a huge diamond sparkler at the Billboard Women In Music Awards on March 1.
Evan Winiker, who is a managing partner at Range Media, was previously in a band with Jack Antonoff. Instagram/@evanwiniker
Winiker looks after talent including Disco Biscuits, MAX, and Daya.
The 40-year-old comes from a music background himself, having previously been in a band called Steel Train with songwriter/producer Jack Antonoff.
The â€œBorn To Dieâ€ hitmaker was seen wearing a diamond ring at the Billboard Women In Music Awards earlier this month. FilmMagic
Antonoff has worked closely with Del Rey on several of her projects, including her 2019 album â€œNorman Fâ€“king Rockwell,â€ her 2021 album â€œChemtrails Over The Country Club,â€ and her most recent project, released on March 24.
Prior to her rumored romance with Winiker, the â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ hitmaker was last romantically linked to musician Jack Donaghue, 33.
Del Rey, whose real name is Elizabeth Grant, was rumored to be dating the Salem frontman for a few months in early 2022, although the exact timeline of their relationship remains unclear.
Winiker has reportedly been dating the Grammy-nominated singer for a few months. Instagram/@evanwiniker
Prior to that, Del Rey was in a relationship with country singer Clayton Johnson after they met on a dating app in 2020.
They were rumored to be engaged later that year, but ultimately called it quits and did not address the breakup.
Del Reyâ€™s past romantic interests include Scottish singer-songwriter Barrie-James Oâ€™Neill, whom she dated from 2011 until 2014.
The â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ hitmaker was last romantically linked to musician Jack Donaghue, 33. Instagram/@lanadelrey
The singer also dated cop Sean Larkin and even attended the 2020 Grammys red carpet with him. WireImage
She then dated Italian photographer Francesco Carrozzini from 2014 until 2015, before enjoying a brief romance with rapper G-Eazy in 2017.
She also dated cop Sean â€˜Sticksâ€™ Larkin and even attended the 2020 Grammys red carpet with him.
However, they broke up just months later.
Speaking in 2014, Del Rey told Rolling Stone that she has â€œan affinity for really good, strong, self-assured people.â€
The following year, the â€œBorn To Dieâ€ singer told Harperâ€™s Bazaar that she likes â€œto come home and have someone there.â€
â€œFor someone like me â€“ and itâ€™s not a codependent thing â€“ I just like having someone there. Iâ€™ve been alone, and thatâ€™s fine. But I like to come home and have someone there,â€ she told the outlet at the time.

title: Lana Del Rey is ENGAGED to musician Evan Winiker after just months of dating
content:
Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Want all the latest Showbiz news direct to your inbox? Share your email for news, gossip and more
Lana Del Rey is engaged to partner Evan Winiker, according to reports.
The duo are reportedly set to say "I do" after just months of dating and a handful of public appearances.
Songstress Lana, 37, recently released her ninth studio album and has largely kept her relationship with the talent agency managing partner and musician, 40, out of the public eye.
But the duo are said to be happier than ever as they look to take their relationship to the next level. They were spotted with big smiles earlier this month as they made a rare appearance at a restaurant in California and posed with fans.
(Image: Instagram) (Image: Getty Images)
Sources have told Billboard the happy couple are now engaged, with the Grammy-nominated star enjoying her time with her man, who is close with fellow Steel Train bandmate Jack Antonoff who often works with Lana.
The Mirror has contacted Lana's representatives for comment.
Jack recently worked on Lana's latest album titled Did You Know There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd.
Evan, who is a managing partner at Range Media, works with clients including MAX, Skyer Stonestreet and Wall Off the Earth.
Earlier this month Lana was honoured with the Visionary Award at Billboard's 2023 Women in Music Ceremony. At the awards event she said: "I feel like being happy is the ultimate goal. So I did it."
She is said to have debuted her huge diamond ring at the ceremony as she appeared on the red carpet of the event.
(Image: Billboard via Getty Images)
Prior to her relationship with Evan, the Summertime Sadness singer had been linked with Jack Donaghue, who is a member of the electronic band Salem.
Similarly to her time with Evan, she kept the rumours at bay by keeping any relationship out of the public eye. The duo were said to have been dating since early 2022, but the time of their breakup is unknown.
Past links also include Country singer Clayton Johnson, whom she was engaged to before splitting in 2021.
She was also romantically connected to Scottish singer-songwriter Barrie-James O'Neill and a brief relationship with rapper G-Eazy.
Back in 2014, she told Rolling Stone how she had an "affinity for really good, strong, self-assured people."

title: Who Is Evan Winiker? 5 Things On Lana Del Reyâ€™s Reported New Fiance
content:
Lana Del Rey is best known as a singer with many hit songs.
She and Evan Winiker reportedly recently got engaged.
The singer showed off what is believed to be her engagement ring at a recent event.
Lana Del Rey, 37, is reportedly getting ready to marry Evan Winiker, 29. The private lovebirds recently got engaged, according to Billboard, but are keeping the details about their upcoming wedding on the down low. Although neither one of them have confirmed the engagement yet, Lana was spotted wearing a diamond ring on her left hand ring finger during her appearance at the 2023 Billboard Women in Music event, where she was honored with the Visionary Award.
Find out more about Evan and his romance with Lana below.
Evan works for a media company.
The successful businessman has a job as a managing partner at Range Media and itâ€™s led him to work with many different clients, including MAX, Daya, Disco Biscuits, Skyler Stonestreet and Walk Off the Earth. He joined the company in 2021.
â€œAs a manager, itâ€™s always my goal to surround my clients with the best teams in all areas,â€ Evan told Variety. â€œThis ecosystem is truly that. Itâ€™s an environment of forward-thinking people who look beyond the boundaries and walls that are categorically put in place, allowing them to open new doors and reach new peaks that we dream up.â€
He was in a band.
Like Lana, Evan is also a musician and was in the band Steel Train with Jack Antonoff, who is known for being a member of the band fun. and producing and writing with Taylor Swift. Steel Train toured with other successful artists, including Tegan and Sara, Ben Folds, The Fray, Silversun Pickups and more.
Evanâ€™s a dog lover.
The hunk has an adorable dog named Harry and he often shares memorable photos of the pooch on his Instagram account. Whether heâ€™s showing off the cutie to wish his followers a â€œHappy Thanksgivingâ€, or photographing himself taking Harry for a walk, their bond is apparent.
Heâ€™s also worked for a management company.
Before his time at Range Media, Evan reportedly worked at Full Stop Management for four years. It followed his work at Brandon Creedâ€™s Creed Co. for five years. Brandon Creedâ€™s Creed Co. merged with Jeffrey Azoffâ€™s shop in 2017 to form Full Stop.
Evan and Lana were spotted on previous outings together.
Although they lead a very private life together and itâ€™s unclear when they first started dating, the reportedly soon-to-be husband and wife have been seen at various outings together over the past few months. One of them was at the Malibu Chili Cook-Off festival in Sept. and another was at Pappy and Harrietâ€™s restaurant in Pioneertown, CA in March 2023.

title: Lana Del Rey Reportedly Engaged To Evan Winiker After Wearing Ring
content:
Lana Del Rey, 37, is getting married! The singer is engaged to Range Media Partnersâ€™ Evan Winiker, according to Billboard. Although the lovebirds are very private about their relationship, they were recently seen in public together a few times over the past several months, including an outing at the Malibu Chili Cook-Off festival in Sept. and an outing at Pappy and Harrietâ€™s restaurant in Pioneertown, CA earlier this month.
Their engagement news also comes after Lana was seen wearing a diamond ring on her left hand ring finger at the 2023 Billboard Women In Music event, which took place just a few weeks ago. She posed for photos on the carpet and wore cream-colored lace dress with a belt and gold shoes. She didnâ€™t hold up her hand to put her ring on display, but it could clearly be seen as she held her arms by her sides.
Like Lana, Evan has a successful career. His job at Range Media has led him to work with many different clients, including MAX, Daya, Disco Biscuits, Skyler Stonestreet and Walk Off the Earth. Heâ€™s also worked as a musician as a part of the band Steel Train, and toured with Tegan and Sara, Ben Folds, The Fray, Silversun Pickups and more. Fellow musician and producer Jack Antonoff, who is known for being a member of the band fun. and teaming up musically with Taylor Swift, was also a member of Steel Train.
When Lanaâ€™s not making headlines for her love life, sheâ€™s doing so for her own epic music. She just released her ninth studio album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, on March 24, and itâ€™s already been getting rave reviews. She was also honored with the Visionary Award at Billboardâ€˜s 2023 Women in Music ceremony and gave a memorable acceptance speech.
â€œI donâ€™t exactly have a long-term vision at all, but if you were curious, I am very, very happy,â€ Lana said during the epic speech. â€œWhen I released my first album 14 years ago, the waters were not quite as warm. Iâ€™m really happy for everyone who feels like itâ€™s a wonderful time in the culture to be themselves and express themselves. It didnâ€™t feel that way in 2008. I feel like being happy is the ultimate goal. So I did it.â€

title: Lana Del Reyâ€™s going viral for having gained weight and her experience is similar to Selena Gomez
content:
Singer Lana Del Reyâ€™s weight gain has become a viral discussion on the internet thanks to one particularly gross tweet.
A tweet has gone viral that showed a â€˜beforeâ€™ and â€˜afterâ€™ shot of Lanaâ€™s body and captioned it, â€œThis is worse than 9/11â€.
The tweet has now been deleted after accruing hundreds of thousands of views, but the reaction remains alive on the internet.
The tweet has since been deleted. Source: Twitter
Lana looking fabulous. Photo by Gareth Cattermole/Getty Images.
To nobodyâ€™s surprise this kicked off an extensive conversation online.
Someone tweeted: â€œLana Del Rey does not owe us thinness. Just because someone was a certain size at acertain age doesnâ€™t mean they have to maintain that size forever. Bodies
change.
â€œWeight changes. And most importantly, all bodies of all shapes and sizes are
sexy, beautiful and worthy.â€
Another added: â€œâ€™Eww Lana del rey gained weight.â€™ Yeah sheâ€™s finally happy.â€
â€œBeing a woman in the public eye is torturous because if you age/become less desirable to men people crucify you at the stake no matter what you do to prevent it,â€ someone wrote.
â€œThe way boys act out when celebrities gain weight is so strange,â€ another added.
Lana Del Rey looking fabulous Pictured: Lana Del Rey BACKGRID.
Lana in 2013 also looking fabulous. Picture:cBackGrid
Lana just dropped her latest album, Did You Know Thereâ€™s A Tunnel under Ocean Blvd.
To promote it, she even put up a billboard in her ex-boyfriendâ€™s home town and sheâ€™s back in the cultural conversation and because sheâ€™s a woman, that means her body is back to being discussed at length.
The general reaction, as youâ€™d expect, is outrage that someone would compare Lanaâ€™s body changing to a terrorist attack, but it does highlight how womenâ€™s bodies are shamed whenever they change.
Selena Gomez weight has long been a topic of chat. Picture: La Mariette
Lanaâ€™s recently had to deal with trolls over her weight. Picture: Amy Sussman/Getty Images
Weâ€™ve seen this recently with Selena Gomez, who has openly shared that sheâ€™s gained weight thanks to the medication she takes for Lupus, and yet sheâ€™s frequently trolled because she doesnâ€™t look like she did at 18 anymore.
Similarly, weâ€™ve seen this with Netflix star Lana Condor getting trolled for her body changing. She came to fame when she was only a teenager and recently went viral because her body now looked like a womanâ€™s.
In response to the scrutiny surrounding Lanaâ€™s body, plenty of people online have come out in support of the singer.
