title: les fans franÃ§ais de Lana Del Rey ravis aprÃ¨s une Ã©coute privÃ©e de son nouvel album
content:
En quelques annÃ©es, Lana Del Rey est devenue une icÃ´ne mondiale. Sa maison de disques franÃ§ais organisait, mercredi soir, une sÃ©ance d'Ã©coute particuliÃ¨re de son nouveau disque "Did you know that there's a tunnel under Ocean Boulevard", attendu vendredi.
L'impatience avant Lana Del Rey, c'est dÃ©jÃ  du Lana Del Rey. En l'occurrence, une longue file d'attente formÃ©e trÃ¨s tÃ´t, vers 18 heures, mercredi 22 mars, sur un trottoir parisien. Ici, dans un sous-sol trÃ¨s bien amÃ©nagÃ© d'Universal Music, Ã  un jet de pierre du PanthÃ©on, chacun a dÃ©couvert le matin-mÃªme qu'il avait Ã©tÃ© sÃ©lectionnÃ© pour cette Ã©coute privÃ©e.
Alors, religieusement, le regard tournÃ© vers un Ã©cran sur lequel seule la pochette est affichÃ©e, on ferme les yeux et on Ã©coute.
Une centaine de fans se sont rÃ©unis mercredi soir dans une salle spÃ©cialement amÃ©nagÃ©e pour l'occasion. (Yann Bertrand / Radio France)
Seize titres et quasiment une heure et demie d'Ã©coute plus tard, au grÃ© des invitÃ©s de l'album (Jon Batiste, Father John Misty ou Tommy Genesis), ainsi que quelques surprises dans le son, certains fans sont trop Ã©mus pour parler Ã  chaud. L'un d'eux explique, d'une phrase qui se veut dÃ©finitive : "Si tu veux pleurer, tu l'Ã©coutes. Et si tu veux danser, tu l'Ã©coutes aussi".
Un peu en retrait, il y a Amine. Lana Del Rey, pour lui, c'est quelqu'un d'important : "Pour la faire courte, elle a Ã©tÃ© lÃ  dans ma vie quand trÃ¨s peu de gens l'ont Ã©tÃ©, sa musique a Ã©tÃ© pour moi un moyen de trouver du rÃ©confort".
La chanteuse, qui n'est Ã©videmment pas venue, et pire, n'a pas encore annoncÃ© de concert en France, poursuit son rythme de sorties, quasiment un disque par an ces trois derniÃ¨res annÃ©es. Celui-ci, plus long, surprenant et touffu que les autres, n'a dÃ©Ã§u personne. Et certainement pas Marie : "Le dernier morceau de l'album m'a transcendÃ©e, je ne m'en suis pas remise, je suis dans une bulle ! Je suis KO". Une vÃ©ritable histoire d'amour.

title: Glastonbury Festival releases new poster after apparent criticism from Lana Del Rey
content:
Glastonbury Festival has changed its poster in an apparent response to criticism from one of the Other Stage headliners Lana Del Rey.
Del Rey implied she might pull out of performing at the festival because it hadn't announced her as a headliner.
When the official Glastonbury account posted the original line-up poster on Instagram, Del Ray sarcastically commented below from her private Instagram, honeymoon: "Thanks for announcing that I was headlining the other stage. Thumbs up." The comment appears to have now been deleted.
The singer's name was also below more than 20 other acts in the poster, which, apart from the headliners, had performers in alphabetical order. Lizzo will play immediately before headliner Guns N' Roses, but has joint headline billing on the line-up poster.
Image: The original line-up poster - Lana Del Rey's name is in the seventh row
Image: On the old poster Lana Del Rey is in the seventh row
Del Rey, 37, is then reported to have suggested on her private Instagram account that she might pull out of performing.
She is said to have written: "Well I'm actually headlining the second stage. But since there was no consideration for announcing that. We'll see."
Glastonbury Festival has now released an updated poster with Del Rey moved up to the second row. It also includes new acts after the West Holts stage line-up was revealed on Tuesday.
Image: The latest Glastonbury poster, with Lana Del Rey's name in the second row
Image: A closer look at the new poster
US rapper Lil Nas X, Nigerian singer Wizkid and British singer-songwriter Yusuf Islam, commonly known as Cat Stevens, have also had their names moved up to the second row.
Glastonbury Festival also attracted criticism on social media after it emerged the top three headliners were all male acts - with Sir Elton John being joined by Arctic Monkeys and Guns N' Roses.
Advertisement
One social media user wrote: "During Women's History Month, Glastonbury Festival announced an all-male headline bill. In 2023. Tell me why we don't need this month one more time."
Another said: "@glastonbury do better!!! All male headliners? You can't even blame lack of talent, there is a overwhelming WEALTH of amazing women to choose from."
When the line-up was announced co-organiser Emily Eavis told The Guardian a previously confirmed female headliner pulled out because she "changed her touring plans".
Sky News has contacted Glastonbury Festival for comment.

title: We Are Messengers, Lana Del Rey, Yazmin Lacey release new music
content:
Here are three new releases for music fans to check out this month:
â€œHills of Tyrone,â€ We Are Messengers
The Irish pop-rock act, known for the multiweek No. 1 hit â€œCome What Mayâ€ as well as â€œImage of God,â€ â€œPower,â€ â€œMaybe Itâ€™s Ok,â€ â€œGod With Us,â€ â€œThis Is Jesusâ€ and a number of other top-10-charting contemporary Christian music singles, returns with a new EP. Itâ€™s a great listen from start to finish, delivering seven memorable songs â€” including the lovely title track and the gorgeous â€œFather Would You Hold My Handâ€ â€” in just over 23 minutes.
â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd,â€ Lana Del Rey
We are digging the two singles weâ€™ve heard â€” the title track and â€œA&Wâ€ â€” and fully expect the rest of Del Reyâ€™s 16-track ninth album will be excellent as well. The recording, which follows the 2021 releases â€œChemtrails over the Country Clubâ€ and â€œBlue Banisters,â€ features Jon Batiste, Father John Misty, Bleachers and others. Itâ€™s due out March 24.
â€œVoice Notes,â€ Yazmin Lacey
Having already charmed listeners on three EPs, the British soul singer definitely appears ready to take her career to the next level with the release of her full-length debut. The album is jazzy cool, brimming with great lines and a voice that deserves to be heard by millions.

title: The Mythologies of Lana Del Reyâ€™s Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd
content:
Our weekly podcast includes in-depth analysis of the new records we find extraordinary, exciting, and just plain terrible, as well as interviews with some of our favorite artists. This week, Reviews Director Jeremy D. Larson hosts Senior Editor Anna Gaca and Contributing Writer Olivia Horn to break down all the references and personal themes embedded into Lana Del Reyâ€™s ninth album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd.
Listen to this weekâ€™s episode below, and follow The Pitchfork Review here. You can also check out an excerpt of the podcastâ€™s transcript below.
Jeremy D. Larson: What are some of the recurring motifs that you noticed on this record?
Olivia Horn: There are definitely a couple of thematic throughlines that are really helpful in orienting the listener. One of them being family, one of them being the idea of child rearing. Thereâ€™s a lot about death. Thereâ€™s a lot about the idea of legacy and questions about the future too.
Thereâ€™s also the lyric â€œlet the light in,â€ which is itself the throughline in the song â€œKintsugi.â€ Itâ€™s also a reference to Leonard Cohen, and then thereâ€™s an echo of it in the song â€œLet the Light In,â€ featuring Father John Misty. Those reverberations are internal in terms of Lanaâ€™s discography and then external in terms of all of the references that she is making to other artists.

title: The Dos and Donâ€™ts of Referencing Leonard Cohen
content:
Photo: kpa/United Archives via Getty Images
Are we living in a golden age of Leonard Cohen references? The great songwriting master has been gone six years, but his spirit seems to be everywhere these days â€” haunting Lana Del Rey, Lucy Dacus, and even the fictitious nepo baby known as Connor Roy. But some Cohen references land better than others. Hereâ€™s a little guide to how you should and shouldnâ€™t be referencing and/or covering a Leonard Cohen track.
DO: Lean into the eternal melancholy of Cohen
Last Sundayâ€™s Succession episode featured a memorable karaoke gag in which large adult son/rancher Connor Roy (Alan Ruck) croons a dour rendition of â€œFamous Blue Raincoatâ€ at a karaoke gathering to the horror of the other Roy children. (â€œThis is GuantÃ¡namo-level shit,â€ quips Roman.) Look, thereâ€™s nothing wrong with moping your way through a downbeat classic at karaoke night, particularly after being abandoned by your fiancÃ©e (sad karaoke is an underrated category), but you gotta know your audience!
DO: Harness the prophetic wisdom of â€œAnthemâ€
Few late-period Cohen songs have haunted our modern era quite like â€œAnthem,â€ a dirgelike examination of brokenness, renewal, and moral responsibility, infused with Kabbalistic influences. The songâ€™s most recognizable lyric, â€œThere is a crack, a crack in everything / Thatâ€™s how the light gets in,â€ has been referenced in recent tunes by both indie supergroup boygenius and Lana Del Rey, whose six-minute slow-burner â€œKintsugiâ€ repeats the phrase: â€œThatâ€™s how the light gets in.â€ The Lana interpolation ultimately rings more true â€” both because she artfully weaves the lyric into a song about grief and heartbreak and because it slots right in with the singerâ€™s long-running fixation on â€™70s singer-songwriters (Bob Dylan, Joni Mitchell, et al.).
But DONâ€™T: Quote the lyrics ironically
Which brings us to that new boygenius tune, a one-and-a-half-minute ditty fittingly titled â€œLeonard Cohen.â€ Lucy Dacus sings: â€œLeonard Cohen once said / â€˜Thereâ€™s a crack in everything, thatâ€™s how the light gets inâ€™ / And I am not an old man having an existential crisis / At a Buddhist monastery writing horny poetry / But I agree.â€ No disrespect to Dacus, who has emerged as one of the most talented songwriters of her generation, but why quote Cohen at all if youâ€™re only going to cheapen the sentiment while adding little insight of your own? (Not to mention the nitpicky point that Cohen wrote â€œAnthemâ€ well before his five-year stint at the Mount Baldy Zen Center.) The lyric has the same tossed-off-tweet energy as Phoebe Bridgersâ€™s 2020 dig at Eric Claptonâ€™s â€œTears in Heavenâ€ (a far worse song, granted, than â€œAnthemâ€).
DO: Consider lesser-known songs for your Cohen cover
Cohen wrote a lot of brilliant songs that arenâ€™t called â€œHallelujahâ€ or â€œSuzanneâ€ â€” and some of them arrived just last decade during the end-of-life swell that produced three haunting, autumnal albums: 2012â€™s Old Ideas, 2014â€™s Popular Problems, and 2016â€™s You Want It Darker. A husky-voiced Iggy Pop recently put an apocalyptic spin on â€œYou Want It Darker,â€ the 2016 single that Cohen released as a kind of chilling prophecy just before he died, for the tribute album Here It Is: A Tribute to Leonard Cohen, which also features stars like Peter Gabriel, Norah Jones, and James Taylor covering less-celebrated Cohen gems. Meanwhile, PJ Harvey took a more soulful approach to â€œWho by Fireâ€ last year for the Bad Sisters soundtrack.
And obviously DONâ€™T: Cover â€œHallelujahâ€
Cohen once suggested it was time for a moratorium on â€œHallelujahâ€ covers in movies and television. That was in 2009! A whole lifetime (and a certain fateful SNL episode) ago. And yet, even in the year of our Lord 2023, the clichÃ© of the American Idol â€œHallelujahâ€ cover improbably lives on, like the disposable camera or Henry Kissinger. Just last week, a contestant named Cam Amen delivered a typically overheated â€œHallelujahâ€ performance and earned a â€œPlatinumâ€ ticket. Donâ€™t American Idol hopefuls know any other Cohen tunes? How about â€œDonâ€™t Go Home With Your Hard-onâ€?
Though you can ALWAYS: Thoughtfully trace the cultural journey of â€œHallelujahâ€
Last year, Cohenâ€™s most recognizable song was the subject of Hallelujah: Leonard Cohen, A Journey, A Song, a fine documentary that offers both an overview of Cohenâ€™s career and a revealing deconstruction of the songâ€™s journey from Various Positions deep cut to â€™90s John Cale/Jeff Buckley gem to Shrek needle-drop to modern standard. Worth a watch! Itâ€™s on Netflix. (Also check out Alan Lightâ€™s incisive book The Holy or the Broken, on which the doc is based.)
DO: Deliver a stirring â€œEverybody Knowsâ€ needle drop
Iâ€™m Your Man may well be Cohenâ€™s best album, but it doesnâ€™t get an awful lot of attention in the film-and-TV sync department, that one very NSFW Take This Waltz scene notwithstanding. Yet Ted Lasso ended a recent episode with â€œEverybody Knows,â€ one of Cohenâ€™s most alluringly dark and prophetic tunes. Was there a larger meaning to the needle drop? Maybe. Some critics have argued that the songâ€™s references to infidelity and casual sex obliquely comment on Tedâ€™s marital problems. But itâ€™s also just an incredible song that epitomizes Iâ€™m Your Manâ€™s uneasy juxtaposition of glitzy synth-pop timbres with Cohenâ€™s gruff indictments of a broken society.
DONâ€™T EVER: Use â€œFirst We Take Manhattanâ€ lyrics to romanticize missile strikes
Ok, fine, Brian Williams did this back in 2017, but itâ€™s still ingrained in my memory. Bad Brian!

title: Lana Del Rey Snags U.K. No. 1 With â€˜Ocean Blvdâ€™
content:
Lana Del Rey hits the U.K. albums chart for six with Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean Blvd (via Polydor), the new leader.
Ocean Blvd blasts to No. 1 on the Official U.K. Albums Chart, the fastest-selling LP of 2023 so-far, passing the opening week of Pinkâ€™s recent leader Trustfall, the Official Charts Company reports.
The U.S. alternative pop artistâ€™s ninth studio album becomes her sixth leader, after Born to Die (from 2012), Ultraviolence (2014), Lust for Life (2017), Norman F*cking Rockwell! (2019) and Chemtrails Over the Country Club (2021).
According to the OCC, Ocean Blvd delivers Del Reyâ€™s strongest first week in the U.K. since 2014â€™s Ultraviolence.
With her latest crown, Del Rey ranks fifth all-time among female solo artists with the most U.K. No. 1s. Only Madonna (with 12), Taylor Swift (9), Kylie Minogue (8) and Barbra Streisand (7) have more.
â€œThe achievement of Lana Del Rey in scoring six Number 1 albums in just 11 years is quite something, especially given she has done so with the biggest first week numbers of any album this year,â€ comments Martin Talbot, CEO of Official Charts Company. â€œShe is a genuine superstar of our era.â€
Coming in hot at No. 2 on the latest chart, published March 31, is Depeche Modeâ€™s Memento Mori (Columbia), the legendary British synth-pop bandâ€™s first album since the 2022 death of bandmate Andy Fletcher. Memento Mori is the most downloaded album of the week, and becomes DMâ€™s 18th U.K. top 10, and best chart position in a decade.
Reunited U.S. alternative rock outfit Fall Out Boy bags a fifth top 5 record with So Much (for) Stardust. Itâ€™s new at No. 3.
Pink Floydâ€™s epic 1973 album Dark Side of the Moon rockets back into the chart, thanks to a 50th anniversary reissue campaign. A vinyl pressing powers The Dark Side of the Moon â€“ Live at Wembley 1974 (Parlophone) into fourth spot on the all-genres albums chart, while The Dark Side of the Moon â€“ 50 Years (Rhino) reissue returns at No. 17, for its 558th week on the survey.
The album last appeared in the top 20 almost 12 years ago, back in October 2011, the OCC reports, but has never led the chart. Its peak spot is No. 2.
Finally, U.S. country star Luke Combs completes the U.K. top 5 with Gettinâ€™ Old (Sony Music CG), his fourth studio album. Gettinâ€™ Old bows at No. 5 for Combsâ€™ U.K. career-best position.

title: Estos son los discos del mes: lo nuevo de Depeche Mode, Lana del Rey, Yves Tumor y otros Ã¡lbumes de marzo
content:
La muerte les sienta tan bien
Por Xavi Sancho
Depeche Mode Memento Mori
Mute / Columbia
El 28 de mayo de 1996, Dave Gahan, vocalista de Depeche Mode, estuvo muerto durante dos minutos, vÃ­ctima de una sobredosis de speedball en un hotel de Los Ãngeles. Cuando despertÃ³, le preguntÃ³ al doctor si habÃ­a sufrido otra sobredosis. â€œNo, has estado muertoâ€, le respondiÃ³ el mÃ©dico. Casi un aÃ±o mÃ¡s tarde, Depeche Mode publicaban Ultra, acaso su Ãºltimo gran Ã¡lbum, la obra que culminaba su exitosa travesÃ­a de los aÃ±os noventa, una dÃ©cada que arrancaba en las antÃ­podas de su idiosincrasia, pero que terminaron no solo por domar, sino por dominar. Depeche Mode parecen hoy un grupo mucho mÃ¡s joven de lo que realmente son porque, durante aquellos noventa, en vez de perder poco a poco seguidores, como hacÃ­an sus coetÃ¡neos, ellos los fueron ganando.
El 26 de mayo de 2022, Andy Fletcher, miembro fundador de Depeche Mode, falleciÃ³ en su casa de Londres a los 60 aÃ±os. Fletcher era el que debÃ­a sobrevivir a Martin Gore y Dave Gahan, los dos componentes hoy vivos de la banda, y en cuya tormentosa relaciÃ³n el finado siempre mediÃ³, hasta el punto de que sus responsabilidades musicales resultaban cada vez mÃ¡s difusas. En lo sonoro, tal vez las pÃ©rdidas anteriores de miembros clave como Vince Clarke o Alan Wilder se antojan mÃ¡s relevantes en la biografÃ­a del grupo. Pero, en lo emocional, la desapariciÃ³n de Fletcher ha sido devastadora. Diez meses despuÃ©s de su fallecimiento, la banda lanza Memento Mori, su mejor disco desde aquel Ultra que llegÃ³ tras la breve, pero se adivina intensa, experiencia de Gahan en el averno.
En el primer sencillo de adelanto del largo, â€˜Ghosts Againâ€™, la melodÃ­a era demasiado buena, las guitarras demasiado prÃ­stinas. Pero tampoco cabÃ­a confiarse
El primer sencillo de adelanto del largo fue â€˜Ghosts Againâ€™, un maravilloso tema que llegaba acompaÃ±ado de un vÃ­deo crepuscular con homenaje a Ingmar Bergman incluido. La melodÃ­a era demasiado buena, las guitarras demasiado prÃ­stinas. Pero tampoco cabÃ­a confiarse: la jugada del gran single como adelanto del mal disco llevaban perfeccionÃ¡ndola los de Basildon desde el cambio de siglo. El segundo adelanto, aunque menos inmediato y espectacular, inducÃ­a a empezar a creer en este Memento Mori como algo realmente serio. â€˜My Cosmos Is Mineâ€™, Ã¡spera, chirriante y directamente conectada con el pasado pospunk de la banda, es tan buen tema como mal sencillo.
Este Memento Mori, producido por James Ford (Arctic Monkeys, Simian Mobile Disco) y Marta Salogni (BjÃ¶rk, Frank Ocean), y en el que Richard Butler (Psychedelic Furs) colabora como compositor en cuatro temas, fluctÃºa entre el espÃ­ritu triste pero juguetÃ³n del primer sencillo y el rugoso, oscuro e industrial del segundo. Dos formas de ver y tratar de entender la muerte. Por un lado, ese melÃ³dico y ochentero â€˜Wagging Tongueâ€™ â€”Â­primera composiciÃ³n de Gore y Gahan juntos, Fletcher estarÃ­a orgullosoâ€”, la apabullante â€˜People Are Goodâ€™, tan grandiosa que lleva al oyente directamente a aquella histÃ³rica noche de 1988 en Pasadena (California) donde la banda grabÃ³ su directo 101. Por el otro lado del cuadro, transitan cortes como â€˜Carolineâ€™s Monkey,â€™ a medio camino entre Nick Cave y Eurythmics, y tal vez la mejor canciÃ³n del disco, o â€˜Speak to Meâ€™, que es algo asÃ­ como un â€˜A Day in the Lifeâ€™ reinterpretado para una nueva versiÃ³n de Blade Runner rodada en un ascensor. Con ella termina el Ã¡lbum, y tal vez la carrera discogrÃ¡fica de Depeche Mode. Hay formas peores de morir.
Un continente por canciÃ³n
Por Laura FernÃ¡ndez
Lana del Rey Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd
Polydor / Universal
A algo sagrado, majestuoso, profundo e inabarcable. A eso suena el ambicioso noveno Ã¡lbum de la cada vez mÃ¡s incomparable Lana del Rey. Edifica una obra magna â€”magnÃ¡nimaâ€” que parte, esta vez mÃ¡s que nunca, de su yo mayestÃ¡tico, herido aquÃ­, roto y rehecho a partir de los pedazos, sin tratar de disimular que una vez fueron pedazos, como parece decir en la intimista â€˜Kintsugiâ€™. Desde el estallido soul a cappella del tema que abre el disco, â€˜The Grantsâ€™, hasta el cierre con â€˜Taco Truck x VBâ€™ â€”una versiÃ³n mugrienta y casi irreconocible de su clÃ¡sico â€˜Venice Bitchâ€™â€”, el Ã¡lbum no deja de crecer, de derramarse por todas partes, consciente de su condiciÃ³n incontenible. Porque sÃ­, Lana del Rey parece fundar casi un continente por explorar en cada canciÃ³n. Y asÃ­, hay, ya desde su propio tÃ­tulo, cuentos de hadas delicadamente tormentosos (â€˜Fingertipsâ€™), pequeÃ±os universos de elegantÃ­simo alt folk de intensidad deliciosamente variable (â€˜Let the Light Inâ€™, con Father John Misty) y valses con aspecto de suntuosos y desmitificadores viajes (â€˜Paris, Texasâ€™).
El suelo que la artista pisa es, cada vez, ella misma. Si mira alrededor en algÃºn momento, contempla aquello que ha sido y sale disparada en una nueva direcciÃ³n (ahÃ­ estÃ¡ â€˜A&Wâ€™ y la forma en que enloquece, y se vuelve pop industrial y luego rap metarreferencial). Ajena a lo trendy, Lana del Rey solo construye. Con una generosidad nada corriente en estos tiempos, la cantante amplÃ­a, no abandonando su hondÃ­sima americana pop, las posibilidades de lo contemporÃ¡neo, tan a menudo limitado por aquello que se lleva, en este metaverso de gustos que son como mareas que se mueven, en masa, siempre en la misma direcciÃ³n. Y hay reflexiÃ³n, futuro inminente y calma en la apasionante â€˜Sweetâ€™, irÃ³nicos manifiestos â€”con risas de fondoâ€” en forma de interludios, prÃ©stamos â€”'Margaretâ€™ o la â€œcanciÃ³n sencillaâ€ que le escribe a la novia de Jack Antonoff, su productorâ€”, y la sensaciÃ³n de que esta vez ha llegado tan lejos que solo ella, en algÃºn otro momento, podrÃ¡ superarse. SÃ­, es su obra maestra, y tambiÃ©n una de las de la dÃ©cada.
Sobre el deseo y la huida
Por Beatriz G. Aranda
Yves Tumor Praise a Lord Who Chews...
Warp / Music as Usual
ImÃ¡genes inquietantes adornan las portadas de los discos de Sean Bowie. Pero el mÃºsico conocido como Yves Tumor no venera la oscuridad, sino la imaginaciÃ³n desbocada. Creador exuberante, apasionado de las transferencias entre gÃ©neros, Tumor diseÃ±a un ejercicio de guitarras grumosas, artificios vocales y versos sobre el deseo y la huida, donde no hay canciones en el sentido convencional, sino paisajes cercanos al shoegaze y al grunge, subgÃ©neros que tambiÃ©n supieron convertir el ruido en melancolÃ­a y en ira. El artefacto resultante es uno de los discos del aÃ±o, producido por Noah Goldstein, mano derecha del malogrado Kanye West, y Alan Moulder, mÃ­tico colaborador de My Bloody Valentine y The Smashing Pumpkins.
Chispa para las melodÃ­as
Por Carlos Marcos
Ginebras Â¿QuiÃ©n es Billie Max?
Vanana Records
Ginebras es un caso paradigmÃ¡tico de grupo por el que suspiran festivales, plataformas digitales y marcas de refrescos y cervezas: gente joven haciendo pop ligero con mensajes despreocupados para toda la familia. Los papÃ¡s solo tendrÃ¡n que tapar los oÃ­dos a sus peques cuando el grupo diga â€œfollarâ€ o â€œcojonesâ€. Lo demÃ¡s podrÃ­a consistir en una versiÃ³n gamberrilla de ParchÃ­s. El nuevo indie. Este es el segundo disco de estas cuatro chicas de aquÃ­ y de allÃ¡ que se formaron en Madrid durante la pandemia. Son 11 canciones que encajan en 32 minutos y donde exhiben una indudable chispa para las melodÃ­as. â€œEstar en bolas en la cocina es mi placer favorito de la vidaâ€, cantan en un tema. Â¡CÃ³mo lo van a disfrutar los pequeÃ±os de la casa!
Arrobadora quietud
Por Javier Losilla
Arooj Aftab Love in Exile
Verve / Universal
El amor y el exilio provocan la misma desazÃ³n, viene a decirnos este disco armado a trÃ­o por Arooj Aftab, cantante paquistanÃ­ residente en Estados Unidos, el pianista Vijay Iyer y el multiinstrumentista Shahzad Ismaily. Es el resultado de una relaciÃ³n iniciada en 2018 y desarrollada bÃ¡sicamente sobre el escenario. Arooj, que canta en urdu, tiene una voz esplÃ©ndida que se desliza por la versiÃ³n mÃ¡s contemporÃ¡nea de las notas largas de la mÃºsica ghazal, aunque en ocasiones se acerque sutilmente a los melismas del canto devocional (â€˜To Remain/To Returnâ€™). Con ella, las vibrantes improvisaciones del piano minimalista de Iyer y las atmÃ³sferas de bajos saturados y zumbidos del sintetizador moog de Ismaily componen un paisaje sonoro de arrobadora quietud.
Revisionista, no revivalista
Por YahvÃ© M. de la Cavada
Christian McBrideâ€™s New Jawn Prime
Mack Avenue / Distrijazz
Si nos remitimos a la confluencia de excelencia instrumental, versatilidad, personalidad y consistencia artÃ­stica, hay pocos jazzistas vivos con la talla de Christian McBride. Su mÃºsica es tan sÃ³lida como brillante: sin altibajos, pero siempre evitando lo rutinario. Para ello alterna entre diferentes grupos: su Big Band, su trÃ­o, su quinteto Inside Straight o este New Jawn, un cuarteto sin piano que en su segundo Ã¡lbum se revela como una banda colosal. El mayor mÃ©rito de Prime es que bebe de todo tipo de tradiciones, desde la ortodoxia bop hasta lo modal, el calipso, el funk o la vanguardia â€”ese East Broadway Rundown de Sonny Rollinsâ€”, para entregar algo muy compacto. Revisionista, que no revivalista, pero modelado a partir de la carismÃ¡tica visiÃ³n de McBride.
Puedes seguir a BABELIA en Facebook y Twitter, o apuntarte aquÃ­ para recibir nuestra newsletter semanal.

title: Lana Del Rey equals Arctic Monkeys and Radiohead with sixth number one album
content:
Lana Del Rey has drawn level with other acts like Arctic Monkeys, Radiohead and Blur to secure a sixth number one album, the Official Charts Company said.
Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd has become the fastest-selling LP of 2023 so far and makes Del Rey the female solo artist with the fifth-most number one albums.
Martin Talbot, chief executive at Official Charts Company, said her â€œachievementâ€ over 11 years is â€œquite somethingâ€ as â€œshe has done so with the biggest first week numbers of any album this yearâ€.
â€œShe is a genuine superstar of our era,â€ Mr Talbot added.
Ed Sheeran with his Official Charts number one single award (Mushroom Creative House/Liam Pethick/PA)
The 37-year-old singer-songwriterâ€™s latest chart-topper follows 2012â€™s Born To Die, 2014â€™s Ultraviolence, 2017â€™s Lust for Life, 2019â€™s Norman F****** Rockwell! and 2021â€™s Chemtrails Over The Country Club.
Advertisement
Madonna still leads the female pack with 12 chart-topping records to her name as Taylor Swift sits on nine number ones, Kylie Minogue has eight and Barbra Streisand has seven.
Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd has also taken the top position in the Official Vinyl Albums Chart.
In the UK albums chart, synth-pop band Depeche Mode earned their highest-charting album in a decade with Memento Mori at number two as indie rock band Fall Out Boy made it to number three with So Much (For) Stardust.
In the UK singles chart, Ed Sheeran has debuted his new single Eyes Closed at number one, his fourteenth chart-topper.
The singer-songwriter â€“ who also released a music video for the song which sees him being followed by a blue monster, serving as a metaphor for grief â€“ is now level with Sir Cliff Richard and Irish boyband Westlife.
Sheeran, who has the third-most chart-toppers in UK chart history, said: â€œIâ€™m over the bloody moon, thank you so much. I canâ€™t wait for you to hear (my album) Subtract. Iâ€™m so glad youâ€™ve connected to this song. Lots of love!â€
His sixth studio album is billed for release on May 5th.
Advertisement
Elvis Presley, who has claimed 21 number one singles, and The Beatles on 17 are the two for Sheeran to beat if he wants to break a record.
Sheeran also knocked Miley Cyrusâ€™s Flowers down to number two â€“ which had enjoyed 10 weeks at the top â€“ as well as pushing other singles further down the charts.
DJ and record producer Calvin Harris and singer Ellie Gouldingâ€™s collaboration Miracle is now at number three in the charts as Die For You by Canadian singer The Weeknd slid to number five.
Cameroonian American singer Libianca Fonji has leaped up to fourth place with afrobeat song People.

title: Lana Del Rey Lands at No. 1 In Australia With â€˜Ocean Blvdâ€™
content:
Lana Del Rey drives straight to No. 1 on the Australian chart with Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd (via Interscope/Universal), her ninth studio album.
With its fast start, Ocean Blvd becomes the U.S. alternative pop singerâ€™s eighth top 10 LP in these parts, and fifth leader following Born To Die (from 2012), Ultraviolence (2014), Honeymoon (2015) and Lust For Life (2017).
Itâ€™s one of four new releases impacting the top 10 on the latest ARIA Albums Chart, published Friday, March 31.
Coming in at No. 2 is Luke Combsâ€™ Gettinâ€™ Old (Columbia/Sony). Itâ€™s the U.S. country starâ€™s fourth album and fourth top 10 in Australia, following This Oneâ€™s For You (No. 7 peak in 2017), What You See Is What You Get (No. 1 in 2019) and Growinâ€™ Up (No. 2 in 2022).
Further down the list, Fall Out Boyâ€™s So Much (For) Stardust (Atlantic/Warner) starts at No. 4, for the reunited U.S. alt-rock veteransâ€™ sixth top 10 effort in Australia. The bandâ€™s peak performance to date came a decade ago, when 2013â€™s Save Rock and Roll hit No. 2.
Also, Australian singer-songwriter Matt Corby blasts into the top 10 with Everythingâ€™s Fine (Island/Universal), his third album. Itâ€™s new at No. 8. Everythingâ€™s Fine is the followup to Corbyâ€™s 2018â€™s LP Rainbow Valley (which peaked at No. 4), and his chart-leading debut from 2016, Telluric.
As it celebrates its 50th anniversary with a reissue project, Pink Floydâ€™s Dark Side of the Moon (Columbia/Sony) roars back into the chart. The 14-times platinum album vaults 220-12, to notch its 103rd week on the chart.
Over on the ARIA Singles Chart, Miley Cyrusâ€™ â€œFlowersâ€ (Columbia/Sony) flourishes for an 11th consecutive week at No. 1, while Ed Sheeran returns to the top tier with â€œEyes Closedâ€ (Atlantic/Warner), new at No. 6. Produced with Max Martin and Shellback, and lifted from his forthcoming album Subtract, â€œEyes Closedâ€ is Sheeranâ€™s 28th top 10 appearance in Australia, a feat that includes two tracks as a featured artist, ARIA reports.

title: Livres, disques, tÃ©lÃ©s : nos choix de la semaine
content:
Par Philippe Chevilley, Laura Berny, Isabelle Lesniak
PubliÃ© le 31 mars 2023 Ã  6:02
Des romans Ã©trangers addictifs et un livre franÃ§ais poignant, des chanteuses ensorcelantes et des madrigaux envoÃ»tants, des sÃ©ries stars et un concert filmÃ© d'exception : pas le temps de s'ennuyer ce week-endâ€¦
A LIRE
Un roman d'apprentissage, une saga suÃ©doise et un tÃ©moignage bouleversant : nos trois livres prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©s cette semaine.DR
Â« Ecoutez-moi jusqu'Ã  la fin Â», Tess Gunty
Traduit de l'amÃ©ricain par Jacques Mailhos, Gallmeister, 560 p., 26,60 euros
Tess Gunty signe avec son premier opus, Ecoutez-moi jusqu'Ã  la fin, une version choc, ultracontemporaine, du roman d'apprentissage et de trahison, ancrÃ© dans un Midwest dÃ©sindustrialisÃ©. RÃ©compensÃ©e du National Book Award pour cet ouvrage, l'Ã©crivaine amÃ©ricaine est la plus jeune laurÃ©ate du prestigieux prix amÃ©ricain depuis Philip Roth en 1960. Un signeâ€¦ I. L.
Â« Celui qui a vu la forÃªt grandir Â», Lina Nordquist
Traduit par Marina Heide, Buchet Chastel, 447 p., 24 euros
Entre fable sociale Ã  la Dickens, drame psychologique Ã  la Bergman et thriller nordique, Celui qui a vu la forÃªt grandir de Lina Nordquist est un ouvrage addictif, aussi poignant qu'effrayant. Une histoire d'amour et de mort, dans le HÃ¤lsingland suÃ©dois, qui rÃ©sume l'horreur et la beautÃ© du monde. Un premier roman rÃ©compensÃ© du prix du meilleur livre en SuÃ¨de en 2022. Ph. C.
Â« Vivre aprÃ¨s Marc Â», NoÃ©mie Sylberg
Hermann, 190 p., 16 euros
C'est le rÃ©cit vrai d'un coup violent frappÃ© Ã  la porte du malheur. A 38 ans, NoÃ©mie, maman de deux tout jeunes enfants, se retrouve veuve de Marc, son mari, l'homme avec lequel elle vit depuis dix ans le grand amour. En huit mois, Marc est emportÃ© par un cancer fulgurant. De cette odyssÃ©e tragique, racontÃ©e avec une force poignante, NoÃ©mie fait une oeuvre lumineuse. Plus qu'une rÃ©silience, une renaissance. J.-FR. P.
A ECOUTER
De la pop, de la chanson franÃ§aise et du classique : une sÃ©lection des plus Ã©clectiques.DR
Â« Did you know that there's a tunnel under Ocean Blvd Â», Lana Del Rey
1 album, Interscope/Polydor
AprÃ¨s un passage Ã  vide, l'Ã©toile pop-rock revient avec un opus bouleversant apte Ã  la faire rebondir au firmament. Avec son titre Ã  rallonge (Â« Did you knowâ€¦ ) , le neuviÃ¨me album studio de Lana Del Rey sort de sa zone de confort. A cÃ´tÃ© de sublimes ballades acoustiques, elle s'essaie au gospel, Ã  l'Ã©lectro, au rock Ã©nervÃ© et mÃªme au rap, au grÃ© de textes intimes et poignants. title: Lana Del Rey Is Engaged
content:
Lana Del Rey is getting married!
The singer-songwriter is engaged to Evan Winiker, a managing partner at Range Media, Billboard reported.
The two have largely kept their relationship out of the limelight, so it's uncertain when their romance began. Del Rey and Winiker have been publicly spotted together on multiple occasions over the past few months, including at the Malibu Chili Cook-Off in September and while dining at a restaurant in San Bernardino earlier this month, per Billboard.
More From Seventeen play icon The triangle icon that indicates to play
Previously, Del Rey was linked to musician Jack Donoghue in May 2022.
Evan Winiker Variety // Getty Images
Though much is unknown about their relationship, it's entirely possible that Winiker and Del Rey first met by virtue of both being entrenched in the music industry.
Since joining Range Media in 2021 as an artist-manager, Winiker brought with him a host of clients from his previous agency, Full Stop Management, including MAX, Daya, Disco Biscuits, Skyler Stonestreet, and Walk off the Earth.
"As a manager, it's always my goal to surround my clients with the best teams in all areas. This eco system is truly that," he told Variety. "It's an environment of forward thinking people who look beyond the boundaries and walls that are categorically put in place, allowing them to open new doors and reach new peaks that we dream up."
Prior to becoming a manager, Winiker dabbled in music himself, playing in indie rock band Steel Train alongside famed music producer Jack Antonoff.
Meanwhile, Del Rey released her ninth studio album, Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, earlier this month.

content:
C ongratulations are in order as Lana Del Rey has got engaged to boyfriend Evan Winiker following a whirlwind romance, according to reports.
The Summertime Sadness singer, 36, recently released her ninth studio album and has largely kept her relationship with the talent agency managing partner and musician, 40, out of the public eye.
Now, sources have told Billboard that Grammy Award winner Del Rey â€“ real name Elizabeth Woolridge Grant â€“ is set to walk down the aisle with her other half after only a couple of months of dating and a handful of public appearances.
Winiker, a managing partner at Range Media, was previously a member of band Steel Train. His former bandmate Jack Antonoff often works with Del Rey.
They recently worked together on Del Reyâ€™s latest album, titled Did You Know Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd.
Lana Del Reyâ€™s boyfriend Evan Winiker is a talent agency managing partner and musician / Instagram
Earlier this month, Del Rey was honoured with the Visionary Award at Billboardâ€™s 2023 Women in Music Ceremony. Speaking at the star-studded event, she said: â€œI feel like being happy is the ultimate goal. So I did it.â€
Before the ceremony took place, she is said to have debuted a huge diamond ring on a certain finger when walking the red carpet.
The Standard has contacted a representative for Lana Del Rey for comment.

title: Evan Winiker: 5 Facts About Lana Del Rey Fiance
content:
Lana Del Rey found that heaven is a place on earth, as Billboard learned that sheâ€™s engaged to Evan Winiker of Range Media Partners.
Itâ€™s unclear how long the couple has been together, but over the past six months, theyâ€™ve been spotted hanging out in public together a few times. Back in September, they attended the Malibu Chili Cook-Off festival with a group of friends, and earlier this month, they enjoyed dinner and drinks at Pappy and Harrietâ€™s restaurant in Pioneertown, Calif., where they were approached by fans for pictures.
Itâ€™s been an exciting year for Del Rey, whose just-released ninth studio album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, leads the midweek U.K. chart. If it keeps its position at the summit, Ocean Blvd would mark the singerâ€™s sixth U.K. chart crown in just over a decade, following Born to Die (2012), Ultraviolence (2014), Lust for Life (2017), Norman F*cking Rockwell! (2019) and Chemtrails Over the Country Club (2021).
She was also honored with the Visionary Award at Billboardâ€˜s 2023 Women in Music ceremony earlier this month. â€œI feel like being happy is the ultimate goal. So I did it,â€ Del Rey said during her moving acceptance speech.
In celebration of the good news, weâ€™ve compiled five things you need to know about Del Reyâ€™s fiancÃ©. See below.

title: Lana Del Rey: Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd review - bold and enthralling
content:
For all the lacquer and haze of Lana Del Reyâ€™s heavily stylised albums, they have often been cries of pain that cut near the bone. â€œFuck me to death, love me till I love myself,â€ she sings on the title track of this sprawling ninth album. On the extraordinary A&W, she despairs of ever being loved: â€œThis is the experience of being an American whore,â€ she offers, almost offhand. At 16 tracks, â€¦Ocean Blvd leans heavily on a combination of muted piano, hovering strings and Del Reyâ€™s voice. That instantly recognisable instrument is by turns ghostly or Joni Mitchell-pristine, often multitracked, or accompanied by the backing vocalists whose first take opens the album (The Grants; Grant is Del Reyâ€™s real family name).
But although one mood is uppermost, spine-tingling stylistic swerves happen too, where the songwriterâ€™s old-timey atmospheres abruptly turn digital (Fishtail is just one example). Del Rey appears to have recorded a sermon from a pew and put it straight on the record (Judah Smith Interlude), while on closer Taco Truck x VB she reuses great swathes of her old song Venice Bitch, with added textures and trap beats. Elsewhere, the act of remembering, family and metacommentaries on her own fame enliven this engrossing, audacious record.

title: Did You Know That There's A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd
content:
When Lana Del Rey first introduced herself as the "Gangster Nancy Sinatra" on 2011's career-making 'Video Games', she posed a ribald question:
'I heard that you like the bad girls, honey / Is that true?'
The resounding answer was yes.
Audiences swooned over the Queen of Summertime Sadness and her dark, intoxicating take on good ol' White American nostalgia that quietly revolutionised pop music over the course of a decade. Hit songs could be sweeping rather than just sugary, sorrow could be as seductive as sexiness.
Del Rey's transition from glamorous pop idol to generation-defining songwriter was cemented with 2019 high point Norman Fucking Rockwell! and she continues to capitalise on her cultural cache with Did You Know That There's A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, her fourth album in as many years.
Loading
Now, nine records and 12 years on from her debut, Lana Del Rey is asking far more complicated questions. And from the title on down, Did You Know That There's A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd is full of them.
'What you doin' with your life? Do you think about it?'
'When's it going to be my turn?'
'Did you know a singer can still be looking like a sidepiece at 33?'
'Will the baby be alright? Will I have one of mine?' Can I handle it even if I do?
Those Big Life questions signal how Del Rey is shifting from her fixation with American fable-making to a preoccupation with her own legacy, security, and family.
On the Gospel-leaning opener 'The Grants' she sings of her 'grandmother's last smile' as well as the first of multiple name checks to her sister and her newborn baby.
On the raw 'Fingertips', she pleads her brother to quit smoking and shades her mother. Then there's the song 'Grandfather please stand on the shoulders of my father while he's deep-sea fishing'.
This newfound lyrical intimacy is matched by Del Rey experimenting with new sounds.
She alternates between labyrinthine ballads â€“ 'Kintsugi' and 'Fingertips' are all dreamy pianos and ghostly vocals eschewing conventional verse-chorus structures â€“ and distorting those same swooning songs with trap beats and buzzy bottom end, as on 'Fishtail'.
Those two halves merge triumphantly on 'A&W' a stunningly dense centrepiece that instantly ranks among LDR's finest moments, morphing from misogyny-skewering folk song into a brooding, bass-driven chant.
Loading
Another achievement is 'Peppers', which successfully fuses a sample of Canadian rapper Tommy Genesis with hallucinogenic verses and a playful surf-rock bridge. Meanwhile, closing cut 'Taco Truck x VB' is â€“ spoiler alert â€“ essentially a gritty reimagining of her 2019 track 'Venice Bitch' with woozy beats.
However, these late-album highlights do come after a long stretch of similarly sounding, slower-paced numbers that really make you feel the album's 77-minute run time.
There are two fairly indulgent interludes â€“ one featuring Grammy-winning RnB artist and bandleader Jon Batiste, and another dedicated to a four-minute sermon from celebrity pastor Judah Smith. A bold inclusion but a skippable one.
Far better is the romantic duet with Father John Misty on 'Let The Light In' and 'Paris, Texas' featuring SYML, a piano waltz where the keys dance alongside Del Rey's melody.
But even at the album's sleepiest, there's always some signature Lana Del Rey-ism to grab your ear, such as the chorus of the title track: 'Fuck me to death, love me until I love myself'. Or the charmingly snarky moment amid the syrupy, symphonic 'Sweet' where she sings, 'If you want some basic bitch go to the Beverly Center'.
Loading
â€¦Ocean Blvd is an album rooted in the past while also looking to the future.
There's material that treads familiar territory (especially to her pair of 2021 albums Blue Banisters and Chemtrails Over The Country Club) but also LDR at her very best, in music that's as progressive and accomplished as anything she's ever done.
It's a knotty listen that's ultimately well worth the time to untangle. Another impressive entry in an increasingly important body of work from an artist that continues to carve their own unique space in the contemporary American Songbook.

title: Lana Del Rey Talks Back to the Songbook
content:
Dear listeners,
I love these lyrics from the title track of Lana Del Reyâ€™s sprawling ninth album, â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd,â€ which comes out today:
Harry Nilsson has a song, his voice breaks at 2:05
Something about the way he says â€œDonâ€™t forget meâ€
Makes me feel like
I just wish I had a friend like him
Someone to get me by
Del Reyâ€™s music is both vividly intimate and highly referential. She writes like a devoted but conversational fan of music history â€” talking back to the modern songbook and to many of her favorite artists, guided by popular song to her own personal epiphanies.
Del Reyâ€™s old-soul reverence collapses the distance between generations, too. People listening to Harry Nilssonâ€™s â€œDonâ€™t Forget Meâ€ when it first came out â€” on â€œPussy Catsâ€ from 1974, the notorious chronicle of his â€œLost Weekendâ€ with John Lennon â€” were just as likely to be moved by that wrenching part when his voice breaks, but they probably wouldnâ€™t have known its precise time stamp. Del Reyâ€™s homage speaks the language of digital-era listening (â€œhis voice breaks at 2:05â€), but her emotional connection to Nilsson is so deeply felt, it seems to transcend time and turn him into a peer.
Elsewhere on the album, the much-covered, centuries-old folk standard â€œFroggy Went a Courtinâ€™â€ makes Del Rey feel connected to her ancestors when she hears it at a funeral. Leonard Cohenâ€™s famous lyric â€œthere is a crack in everything, thatâ€™s how the light gets inâ€ echoes throughout â€œOcean Blvdâ€ like a cherished mantra. On â€œThe Grants,â€ the albumâ€™s stirring, gospel-tinged opening number, she interprets the words of a pastor by likening them not to, say, a particular Bible verse, but to â€œâ€˜Rocky Mountain High,â€™ the way John Denver sings.â€
â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ is as rich, challenging and singular as anything Del Rey has released yet, and given that its run time is a daunting hour and 17 minutes, itâ€™s going to require a little time to sink in. Todayâ€™s playlist puts some of its best songs in conversation with the other artists it references or, in the case of Father John Misty, features. May it serve as an entry point, or maybe just as a means to tunnel deeper into Lana Del Reyâ€™s slow, subterranean sound.

On notera l'incontournable nouvel album de Lana del Rey, Did You know that there's a tunnel under Ocean Blvd, mais aussi Memento Mori, quinziÃ¨me disque de Depeche Mode, prÃ¨s d'un an aprÃ¨s la disparition d'Andrew Fletcher, ou encore IntÃ©rieur vie, deuxiÃ¨me album de la rÃ©vÃ©lation HervÃ©.
Lana del Rey - Did You know that there's a tunnel under Ocean Blvd
Lana del Rey est de retour avec un neuviÃ¨me album, baptisÃ© Did You know that there's a tunnel under Ocean Blvd, nouvelle illustration de la plume et de l'esthÃ©tique de la chanteuse amÃ©ricaine. Avec ce nouveau projet qui compte seize titres, dont plusieurs collaboration, notamment avec Jon Batiste, Lana del Rey confirme son statut d'icÃ´ne, incontournable.
Depeche Mode - Memento Mori
PrÃ¨s d'un an aprÃ¨s la disparition brutale d'Andy Fletcher, Dave Gahan et Martin Gore reviennent avec l'album Memento Mori, un quinziÃ¨me projet, comptant douze titres inÃ©dits portÃ©s par Ghosts Again, single prÃ©cÃ©demment paru. Un disque sombre et intense, qui rappelle les premiers projets de Depeche Mode.
HervÃ© - IntÃ©rieur vie
La sensation HervÃ© acÃ¨ne un nouveau coup de poing Ã  l'Ã©lectro-pop franÃ§aise avec un deuxiÃ¨me disque confession, baptisÃ© IntÃ©rieur vie et comptant onze morceaux. CouronnÃ© d'une Victoire de la musique pour son premier album, HYPER, le Breton souhaite livrer un peu plus de ses racines et de ce qui l'anime.
La pÃ©pite de la semaine
Coline Rio - Ce qu'il restera de nous
Notez bien le nom de cette jeune artiste : Coline Rio. L'ancienne chanteuse du groupe nantais InuÃ¯t publie son tout premier album, baptisÃ© Ce qu'il restera de nous et qui rassemble treize morceaux, entre Ã©motion, douceur et force.

title: 5 Takeaways From Lana Del Reyâ€™s New Album Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd
content:
Lana Del Reyâ€™s ninth album is her longest yet, with 16 tracks spanning 77 minutes, from the monumental recent single â€œA&W,â€ which includes a gum-snapping outro that nods back to her earlier work, to â€œTaco Truck x VB,â€ featuring a previously unheard alternate version of â€œVenice Bitch,â€ from her 2019 masterpiece Norman Fucking Rockwell! After years of filling her songs with savvy references to the history of pop music, it feels apt that sheâ€™s so overtly calling back to her own work here.
Since Lanaâ€™s previous record, 2021â€™s Blue Banisters, which made her the artist with the most No. 1s on Billboardâ€™s Alternative Albums chart, she appeared on â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ off Taylor Swiftâ€™s Midnights, released a wafting ballad called â€œWatercolor Eyesâ€ for the HBO series Euphoria, and heard her 2017 track â€œWhite Mustangâ€ covered by one of her heroes, Cat Power. But then, last October, Lana announced on Instagram that a laptop, three video cameras, and multiple hard drives were stolen from her car, leading to leaks of unfinished songs and the loss of a manuscript for an upcoming book. And now, after those ups and downs, she is back with another transmission from the Lana-verse. Here are five takeaways.
Itâ€™s Lanaâ€™s world (and sheâ€™s living in it)
On recent records, Lana has moved away from the hyper-curated imagery of her early daysâ€”femme-fatale melancholy, romantic Americana, ambiguous nihilismâ€”towards more autobiographical songwriting. â€œWhen I did Norman Fucking Rockwell! it was about world-building, whereas this was straight vibing,â€ she recently told Billie Eilish in an Interview cover story. Accordingly, the songs on Ocean Blvd are freewheeling explorations of perception and identity that feel particularly spontaneous.
For insight into where Lanaâ€™s mind is at these days, consider the titleâ€™s source of inspiration. There is indeed a tunnel under Ocean Boulevard in Long Beach, California. Originally built as an underground walkway to the beach, the Jergins Tunnel has been closed since the late â€™60s. In an interview with Rolling Stone, Lana explained how the mothballed passage related to the albumâ€™s themes. â€œWould it be a worrisome concept to be boxed out and sealed up with all these beautiful things inside with no one able to gain access except maybe family,â€ she said. â€œWould it probably, plausibly, get to the point where it became a body of work that made me a vessel that was sequestered to the point where only family would have access to the metaphorical tunnel?â€
The Grant family reunion soundtrack
On opening track â€œThe Grants,â€ Lana (nÃ©e Elizabeth Grant) establishes family as a central throughline on the album and in her life: â€œDoinâ€™ the hard stuff, Iâ€™m doinâ€™ my time/Iâ€™m doinâ€™ it for us, for our family line.â€ Later, on â€œFingertips,â€ she ruminates on people and places who have impacted her 37 years on Earth: an uncle who died in Rocky Mountain National Park; a childhood sweetheart from Lake Placid, New York who was killed in a car accident at age 23; the memories of tears shed in Monaco. Poignantly, she reflects on a troubled relationship with her mom (â€œWhat kind of mother was she to say Iâ€™d end up in institutions?â€) while also asking maternal questions of herself. Then thereâ€™s â€œGrandfather Please Stand on the Shoulders of My Father While Heâ€™s Deep-Sea Fishing,â€ which paints a lingering familial picture with its title alone.
A guest list only Lana could put together
Ocean Blvd once again reunites Lana with Norman Fucking Rockwell! and Chemtrails Over the Country Club producer Jack Antonoff, but he is one of several people who contributed to the albumâ€™s sound. Lanaâ€™s ex-boyfriend, cameraman Mike Hermosa, also appears as a producer and writer. The pair wrote a handful of songs together during informal Sunday-afternoon sessions including â€œThe Grants,â€ the title track, â€œLet the Light In,â€ â€œPeppers,â€ and â€œTaco Truck x VB.â€
The album features the most guests on a Lana record since 2017â€™s Lust for Life. Father John Misty stops by for the duet â€œLet the Light In.â€ â€œThe Grantsâ€ begins with vocals from Whitney Houstonâ€™s former backup singers Melodye Perry and Pattie Howard. â€œJudah Smith Interludeâ€ includes four-and-a-half minutes of a sermon from the titular pastor of the celebrity-approved megachurch Churchome, who previously appeared on Justin Bieberâ€™s 2021 Freedom EP. Jon Batiste appears on â€œCandy Necklaceâ€ and â€œJon Batiste Interludeâ€ (â€œI rarely have new friends sit at my old piano,â€ Lana said of the composer in a note to fans). â€œParis, Texasâ€ features piano from SYML, the solo venture of Brian Fennell, previously of the indie rock group Barcelona. The Franco-British pianist Riopy contributes keys to â€œGrandfather Please Standâ€¦â€ And Antonoff sings on â€œMargaret,â€ which makes sense considering that the song was written as an ode to his fiancÃ©e, actress Margaret Qualley. â€œPeppersâ€ samples Canadian rapper Tommy Genesisâ€™ 2015 track â€œAngelina,â€ which appeared on her album World Vision. Phew!
Lana the role model
In the early years of her career, Lana was often maligned for what some critics considered to be unempowering feminism. By 2017, honest storytelling about complex inner worlds in the Lana mold became popularâ€”and lucrativeâ€”in pop music. In an interview with Pitchfork from that year, Lana noted her role in this shift, saying, â€œThere was just such a long time where people had to fit into that pop box.â€ Now, a younger generation of songwriters are giving Lana her flowers for pushing the boundaries and staying true to herself. â€œPeople have been trying to look and sound like you since you first started,â€ Eilish told her. â€œYou changed the way the music industry hears and sees music, and you changed the way people sing.â€
Similarly, earlier this month, Olivia Rodrigo awarded Lana with the Visionary Award at the 2023 Billboard Women in Music Awards. In a speech, Rodrigo remarked that Lanaâ€™s songwriting raised a generation and â€œtaught them that thereâ€™s beauty in the vulnerability and power in their melancholy.â€ Rodrigo added, â€œShe never sacrificed her unique voice and perspective on a world and an industry that constantly tries to put people in a box.â€ At this point in her career, Lana is a singular totem for an entire generation of songwriters, and Ocean Blvd offers another round iconoclastic inspiration.
Choice Lana-isms

title: Lana Del Rey, la lumiÃ¨re au bout du tunnel
content:
Par Christian Eudeline

Ses derniers disques n'avaient pas beaucoup marquÃ© les esprits, Lana Del Rey renaÃ®t telle le phÃ©nix. A 37 ans, elle sort un neuviÃ¨me album studio bouleversant. MaÃ®tresse dans l'art de composer des ballades angÃ©liques et mÃ©lancoliques, elle ne peut s'empÃªcher de nous en proposer, encore et toujours. Mais, afin d'Ã©viter d'emblÃ©e une possible lassitude, le disque commence par quelques mesures faÃ§on gospel, la langue de l'Ã©motion. Elle y rend hommage Ã  sa grand-mÃ¨re et Ã  son oncle, tous deux disparus, et Ã©voque l'accident de la circulation de sa soeur qui a failli Ãªtre fatale pour son neveu. Sa priÃ¨re est si Ã©mouvante qu'on ne peut que la partager.
Sa famille reste plus importante que tout. Un autre morceau est dÃ©diÃ© Ã  son grand-pÃ¨re, Â« Grandfather Please stand on the shoulders of my father while he's deep-sea Â» est un sublime piano-voix enregistrÃ© Ã  partir d'un d'une mÃ©lodie du pianiste franÃ§ais Riopy. La phrase : Â« When you leave, all you take is your memoriesâ€¦ Â» (Â« Quand tu pars, tu n'emportes que des souvenirs Â» ) fait Ã©galement rÃ©fÃ©rence au passage Ã  vide de l'artiste. C'est la thÃ©matique de la chanson-titre Â« Did you know that there's a tunnel under Ocean Blvd Â», formidable Ã©vocation du succÃ¨s qui soudain se dÃ©robe.
Deux morceaux importants
Jusqu'ici la forme s'inscrit dans la galaxie Lana Del Rey, Ã  savoir une pop Ã©vanescente irrÃ©sistible, mais c'Ã©tait sans compter deux morceaux importants Â« AW Â» et Â« Peppers Â». Â« AW Â» est l'abrÃ©viation d'American Whore (pute amÃ©ricaine). La chanson commence par le rÃ©cit d'une mÃ©sentente avec sa mÃ¨re, puis s'Ã©largit Ã  une rÃ©flexion sur la place de la femme dans la sociÃ©tÃ© moderne, Ã  commencer par la sienne.
Ce morceau de 7 minutes se divise en deux parties distinctes : aprÃ¨s le calme du dÃ©but, un moment de tempÃªte qui se traduit par une sorte de dÃ©rÃ¨glement musical oÃ¹ les machines (ordinateurs-synthÃ©tiseurs-filtres) l'emportent sur le cÃ´tÃ© charnel (la voix de Lana). L'apport du producteur Jack Antonoff (dÃ©jÃ  prÃ©sent sur l'album Â« NFR ! Â», producteur Ã©galement de Lorde ou Taylor Swift) transcende la mÃ©tamorphose qui se dÃ©roule sous nos oreilles.
Â« Peppers Â» est peut-Ãªtre encore plus surprenant, dÃ©sarmant mÃªme, car pour la premiÃ¨re fois la jeune femme sort vraiment de sa zone de confort. Elle s'essaie au rap avec l'aide d'un certain Bleachers, qui n'est autre que l'avatar de Jack Antonoff. Ce n'est plus du piano-voix, mais du hip-hop electro, et Ã§a lui va comme un gant.
Le disque va ainsi crescendo - on aurait tout aussi bien pu Ã©voquer le duo avec Father John Misty Â« Let The Light In Â» - avec une seconde partie bien plus aventureuse que la premiÃ¨re. De nombreux internautes lui souhaitent un sacre Ã  la cÃ©rÃ©monie des prochains Grammy Awards, il serait en effet amplement justifiÃ©. Son disque est magique. D'ici lÃ , souhaitons que Lana Del Rey vienne dÃ©fendre son disque sur scÃ¨ne de ce cÃ´tÃ©-ci de l'Atlantique.

title: Lana Del Rey Releases New Album Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd
content:
A little more than three months after its initial announcement, Lana Del Rey has released her new album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. The singer-songwriter previewed her LP with the title track, â€œA&W,â€ and â€œThe Grants.â€ Contributors to the new album include Jack Antonoff (who worked with Del Rey on 2019â€™s Norman Fucking Rockwell), Father John Misty, Jon Batiste, and producers Drew Erickson and Zach Dawes, among others. Listen to Lana Del Reyâ€™s Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd below. (Pitchfork earns a commission from purchases made through affiliate links on our site.)
Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd is Lana Del Reyâ€™s first album since 2021 when she released Chemtrails Over the Country Club and Blue Banisters. Since issuing the latter record, she shared the Euphoria song â€œWatercolor Eyesâ€ and joined Father John Misty for an updated edition of â€œBuddyâ€™s Rendezvous.â€
Earlier this fall, Del Rey told fans in a series of since-deleted videos that multiple hard drives had been stolen from her car, resulting in the leak of a few unfinished tracks. She claimed that the manuscript for a book she was working on was also lost. â€œI had to remotely wipe the computer that had my 200-page book for Simon & Schuster, which I didnâ€™t have backed up on a cloud,â€ she said at the time. She also asked fans to not listen to any of the leaked music.
In 2020, Del Rey published a collection of poetry titled Violet Bent Backwards Over the Grass, which she also released in an audiobook format. Upon announcing the project, she told fans that half of proceeds would benefit Native American organizations around the country, â€œwhether it was for preserving their rights or trying to help keep their land intact.â€
Revisit â€œLana Del Reyâ€™s Audiobook Grapples With the Absurdity of Pop Star Poetryâ€ over on the Pitch.

title: Lana Del Rey: Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd - Long, maudlin and one of her best albums yet
content:
Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd is the ninth studio album by Lana Del Rey
Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd î§™ î§™ î§™ î§™ î§— Artist : Lana Del Rey Genre : Pop Label : Interscope/Polydor
Lana Del Rey has always liked to keep her fans guessing. Even when glimmers of truth about her life have poked through her songs, the New Yorker has made sure to shroud her thoughts in a protective layer of oblique references: is she singing about her own experiences or slipping into a character thatâ€™s introspective, slightly tongue-in-cheek, indubitably a little weird? Whatever her method, it has worked: at 37, the enigmatic star is regularly hailed as one of the most important musicians of her generation.
Del Reyâ€™s ninth album is one of her most confounding to date, although thatâ€™s not necessarily a bad thing. Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd contains some of her most personal songs to date: Fingertips is cumbrous with the weight of a complex family history, its lyrics reading like a journal entry as she refers to her siblings and her fractious relationship with her mother, while also musing on her own future. Following the recent birth of her niece, she ponders, â€œWill the baby be all right? Will I have one of mine? Can I handle it?â€ The 1970s balladry of Sweet ruminates on similar topics, as she inquires of a partner â€œDo you want children, do you wanna marry me?â€ Kintsugi lays her vulnerabilities bare: â€œI donâ€™t trust myself with my heart,â€ she murmurs, â€œbut Iâ€™ve had to let it break a little more, cos thatâ€™s what they say itâ€™s for.â€ Itâ€™s safe to say that Del Reyâ€™s customary tendency to soul-search has been reinforced.
Yet there are songs here about other people, too. Margaret, a twinkling love ballad with soft flourishes of brass, is about the actor Margaret Qualley and her producer fiance, Jack Antonoff. Father John Misty guests on Let the Light In, a humdrum duet about a destructive affair, while other guests â€“ the jazz/R&B star Jon Batiste, the Canadian musician SYML, the contemporary classical pianist Riopy â€“ keep the track list moderately varied.
Del Rey is still capable of generating her own surprises, too: Taco Truck X VB is essentially an experimental R&B/trap reworking of Venice Beach, a song from her earlier album Norman Fucking Rockwell! That same trap influence can be felt on the album highlight A&W (which samples the title track from NFR!), a skewed, somewhat damning self-examination that veers from eerie, melancholic balladry to a grimy, menacing, syncopated burble over the course of seven trippy minutes.
READ MORE
As the cumbersome title might suggest, this album is a lot to take in, and with a run time of 77 minutes it is undoubtedly too long. In years to come, however, it may well go down as one of Del Reyâ€™s best records â€“ or at least one of her most honest.

title: Piano : Riopy, l'Ã©tonnant parcours d'un ovni musical
content:

A peine Jean-Philippe Rio-Py est-il descendu du train en cette froide aprÃ¨s-midi de la fin janvier qu'il fonce Ã  la salle Poirel rÃ©gler les dÃ©tails de sa date nancÃ©enne. Pas de spots agressifs, un Ã©clairage le plus tamisÃ© possible, un son moins mÃ©tallique : Riopy - de son nom d'artiste - profite de la balance pour passer un message clair aux techniciens locaux. Â« Plus c'est intime, plus j'aime. Â»
Ce soir-lÃ , les 800 spectateurs ayant achetÃ© leur billet pour son ultime concert du trimestre en France vont vivre avec lui une heure et demie de communion collective, suivie d'une audience personnelle pour ceux qui le souhaitent. Le cadre s'y prÃªte. Sous le splendide vitrail de cet Ã©crin du XIXe siÃ¨cle Ã  l'acoustique impeccable, les reflets sont doux et l'atmosphÃ¨re chaleureuse.
Riopy a pris soin de placer son piano face au parterre, de maniÃ¨re Ã  Ã©tablir une relation directe avec ceux que ses compositions transportent. Dans la vie comme sur scÃ¨ne, l'allure de cet autodidacte, de son propre aveu dÃ©nuÃ© de culture musicale, n'a rien de formel. Sa patte est plus sensorielle qu'intellectuelle - son troisiÃ¨me album, sorti en 2021, s'intitulait justement Â« Emotive piano Â». Avec sa jambe gauche toute raide qui bat la mesure et ses mains virtuoses habitÃ©es par un tempo endiablÃ©, celui qui fÃªtera en mai ses 40 ans est vivant et spontanÃ©. Seule concession Ã  la solennitÃ© : il a troquÃ© son jean et son col roulÃ© pour un costume sombre, sans cravate.
Dix-huit ans dans une secte
Entre deux mÃ©lodies simples et entÃªtantes, qui peuvent rappeler Philip Glass, il saisit le micro pour raconter ses traumatismes d'enfance dans la secte des Deux-SÃ¨vres oÃ¹ sa mÃ¨re, cÃ©libataire, l'avait embrigadÃ©, tout jeune, avec ses frÃ¨res et soeurs. Il Ã©voque sa longue phase d'errance et de perdition quand, Ã  sa majoritÃ©, il passa de l'enfermement Ã  la rue sans savoir que faire de sa vie. C'est au piano, qu'il apprivoisa seul dÃ¨s l'Ã¢ge de 2 ans sur un instrument abandonnÃ© dans la secte, qu'il doit son salutâ€¦
Riopy sur scÃ¨ne Ã  Nancy le 28 janvier 2023.Â© Sarah Aubel pour Les Echos Week-End
La majoritÃ© des fans connaissent cette douloureuse histoire, sur laquelle il s'Ã©panche plus volontiers depuis un an. Riopy Ã©grÃ¨ne ses souvenirs de maniÃ¨re dÃ©cousue, ne terminant pas toujours ses phrases, mÃ©langeant le franÃ§ais et l'anglais que le Franco-Britannique maÃ®trise parfaitement aprÃ¨s dix-sept annÃ©es passÃ©es en Angleterre. C'est sans regrets qu'il a, Ã  l'automne dernier, quittÃ© le fog local pour le climat lisboÃ¨te rÃ©putÃ© plus doux.
Face Ã  ses fans, Riopy alterne avec simplicitÃ© confessions et exercices de mÃ©ditation : Â« Maintenant, je vous demande de fermer les yeux et de vous imaginer dans un lieu idÃ©al avec un Ãªtre cher. Â» Les spectateurs, de tous Ã¢ges et de tous milieux, sont venus parfois de loin en solo, en couple ou en famille. Ils jouent le jeu Ã  fond. Le public est plus jeune et plus fÃ©minin que celui des amateurs traditionnels de classique, et pas spÃ©cialement connaisseur. Il est au moins aussi intÃ©ressÃ© par l'interaction avec l'artiste que par ses gammes. Typique du phÃ©nomÃ¨ne des Â« pianistes nÃ©oclassiques Â», comme les qualifie Yannick Fage, responsable des playlists classique, jazz, soul et funk chez Deezer : Â« Cette gÃ©nÃ©ration de jeunes artistes, qui inclut aussi Sofiane Pamart ou Max Richter, ne rÃ©interprÃ¨te pas le rÃ©pertoire classique mais crÃ©e des compositions originales dans le but de les jouer sur scÃ¨ne. Je trouve cette dÃ©marche rafraÃ®chissante. Â»
Durant le concert de Riopy Ã  Nancy le 28 janvier 2023. Â© Sarah Aubel pour Les Echos Week-End
On remarque beaucoup de visages bouleversÃ©s dans l'assistance, des yeux quelquefois mouillÃ©s. Le pianiste dÃ©tend l'atmosphÃ¨re : Â« Combien de profs de yoga et de dÃ©pressifs dans la salle ? Â» Lorsqu'il assure que Â« dÃ©sormais, il va bien Â» - vivant de son art, mariÃ© et papa de deux enfants en bas Ã¢ge, Â« sain de corps et presque d'esprit Â» - le public s'esclaffe comme devant une bonne blague. On ne vient pas Ã  un concert de Riopy pour assister Ã  un rÃ©cital parfait ou passer un bon moment entre amis, mais pour vivre une sÃ©ance de libÃ©ration affective.
Â« L'artiste qui vous fait du bien Â»
Une fois les lumiÃ¨res rallumÃ©es, la catharsis se poursuit dans le hall oÃ¹ plusieurs dizaines de personnes, timides ou dÃ©monstratives, toujours Ã©mues, dÃ©filent Ã  la queue leu leu pour expurger leur mal-Ãªtre. Le compositeur met ses propres fÃªlures de cÃ´tÃ© pour encaisser tout le malheur du monde. Il trouve des mots de consolation, sourit pour les selfies, signe les disques et les partitions achetÃ©es au stand de produits dÃ©rivÃ©s tenu par sa souriante Ã©pouse. Â« J'aurais envie de faire un cÃ¢lin Ã  chacun mais je dois me blinder, confesse-t-il Ã  l'issue de cet Ã©prouvant exercice. J'ai une fan base petite mais solide et je trouve normal de lui rendre un peu de ce qu'elle me donne. Si ma musique peut rÃ©conforterâ€¦ Â»
Il se souvient de ce garÃ§on qui lui confia avoir Ã©coutÃ© Â« Drive Â» en boucle aprÃ¨s l'accident de son grand frÃ¨re, plongÃ© dans le coma. Dans un registre plus gai, de jeunes femmes dÃ©clarent avoir bercÃ© leur grossesse avec Â« I Love You Â» et Â« On a Cloud Â», dans l'attente de l'heureux Ã©vÃ©nement. Aux Etats-Unis, les Ã©quipes de Warner Classics et de Warner Records, exceptionnellement rÃ©unies au service de ce cas singulier, le positionnent d'ailleurs comme Â« l'artiste qui fait du bien Â» sans trop se prÃ©occuper du genre dans lequel il s'inscrit.
Le roi des playlists
Les scÃ¨nes de thÃ©rapie se rÃ©pÃ¨tent hors de l'Hexagone. Si ce svelte rouquin n'est pas encore assez cÃ©lÃ¨bre pour qu'on le reconnaisse dans la rue - sauf une fois Ã  Londres - il est d'ores et dÃ©jÃ  un artiste qui compte sur le marchÃ© amÃ©ricain. Sa participation Ã  des publicitÃ©s grand public (Ikea , Armani, Peugeot) et les musiques de bande-annonce qu'il a signÃ©es pour des films de prestige (Â« Danish Girl Â», Â« Mr Turner Â», Â« La Forme de l'eau Â») l'ont lancÃ© avant mÃªme la sortie de son premier album en 2018.
Depuis 2019, ses compositions figurent en bonne place dans les playlists d'ambiance, notamment celles que les adeptes du yoga ou de la mÃ©ditation plÃ©biscitent sur les applis comme Peloton ou Calm. 129 semaines que Riopy s'illustre dans le Top 10 du Billboard (le classement amÃ©ricain de rÃ©fÃ©rence qui agrÃ¨ge ventes physiques et Ã©coutes sur les plateformes) dans les catÃ©gories classique et new age. Avec son album Â«Tree of LightÂ», il a mÃªme devancÃ© Lang Lang dÃ©but 2022.
Fin janvier, Â« Nocturne Â», le premier extrait de Â« Thrive Â», dans les bacs Ã  partir du 14 avril, a totalisÃ© 530.000 streams la semaine de sa sortie. Ses trois premiers albums en ont cumulÃ© 646 millions toutes plates-formes confondues, dont les deux tiers aux Etats-Unis, oÃ¹ Amazon Music a considÃ©rablement aidÃ© Ã  installer sa notoriÃ©tÃ©. Son titre Â«UkiyoÂ» agrÃ¨ge Ã  lui seul 100 millions d'Ã©coutes et est en train d'Ãªtre certifiÃ© single d'or. Par rapport Ã  la plupart des pianistes, Riopy prÃ©sente la particularitÃ© d'avoir une audience numÃ©rique Ã  plus de 90 %. Il agrÃ¨ge diffÃ©rents types d'auditeurs outre-Atlantique. La prestigieuse marque de pianos Steinway & Sons l'a nommÃ© parmi ses ambassadeurs juniors, les Young Steinway Artists. Et Lana Del Rey a suffisamment apprÃ©ciÃ© Â« Flo Â», une composition de Riopy dÃ©couverte sur une plateforme, pour la reprendre en intÃ©gralitÃ© sur son neuviÃ¨me album, qui sort le 24 mars (lire encadrÃ©).
Le coup de pouce de Lana Del Rey Improbable coup de tÃ©lÃ©phone que celui passÃ© par le manager de Lana Del Rey Ã  Riopy ! Il lui annonÃ§ait que la reine de la pop planante avait Ã©tÃ© suffisamment inspirÃ©e par Â« Flo Â», un morceau de son album de 2019 Â« Tree of Light Â», pour l'accompagner de ses paroles et en faire l'une des seize chansons de son neuviÃ¨me album, Â« Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd Â», qui paraÃ®t ce 24 mars. Polydor sait faire monter l'attente, parlant d'Â« une nouvelle page de l'oeuvre de Lana Del Rey, entre expÃ©rimentations et collaborations Â», avec des interludes de son pasteur Judah Smith et du compositeur Jon Batiste et une multitude de featurings prestigieux. Dans un morceau au drÃ´le de titre Ã  rallonge (Â« Grandfather Please Stand on the Shoulders of My Father While He's Deep-Sea Fishing Â»), la chanteuse reprend l'intÃ©gralitÃ© de l'enregistrement de piano du FranÃ§ais, y ajoute ses mots et ses instrumentations de maniÃ¨re Ã  le personnaliser dans son style singulier. Pas un simple sample, mais un vrai featuring pour lequel il est crÃ©ditÃ© sur la pochette. Bien que ses dix-huit premiÃ¨res annÃ©es dans une secte l'aient privÃ© de beaucoup de rÃ©fÃ©rences culturelles, Riopy connaissait et apprÃ©ciait la voix d'ange de la New-Yorkaise. Il reconnaÃ®t qu'il fut Â« flattÃ© mais un peu inquiet Â» de son initiative. La premiÃ¨re Ã©coute suffit Ã  balayer ses doutes : Â« Elle livre une version Ã©lÃ©gante et classe de mon travail. Â» De quoi Ã©largir sa notoriÃ©tÃ© Ã  un public bien plus vasteâ€¦
Son harassante tournÃ©e commencÃ©e il y a un an a donnÃ© une nouvelle dimension au compositeur. Â« Avant, il Ã©tait un algorithme ; maintenant, c'est un homme aux yeux du public Â», avance son attachÃ© de presse, Pascal Aznar. Â« Comme son succÃ¨s a jusque-lÃ  Ã©tÃ© surtout dÃ» aux playlists, beaucoup de gens connaissent sa musique mais pas forcÃ©ment l'artiste, expose Bertrand Castellani, chargÃ© de Warner Classics. Depuis quelques mois, la scÃ¨ne lui permet de franchir une nouvelle Ã©tape. Â»
A Nancy, le 28 janvier 2023.Â© Sarah Aubel pour Les Echos Week-End
A un premier CafÃ© de la Danse rempli sans mal en mars 2022 ont succÃ©dÃ© le Trianon puis La Cigale Ã  Paris, ainsi que des salles de province d'une capacitÃ© de 1.000 places ou plus. Il a Â« jouÃ© en premiÃ¨re partie de Mozart Â» avant la projection du film Â« Amadeus Â» dans la cour CarrÃ©e du Louvre, Ã  l'initiative de MK2, s'est produit au Montreux Jazz Festival, participera au Festival Chorus Ã  La Seine Musicale le 31 mars.
Un artiste bien entourÃ©
Avant NoÃ«l, il a enfin pu rencontrer son public amÃ©ricain aprÃ¨s ces annÃ©es de Covid, Ã  la faveur de showcases organisÃ©s Ã  New York, San Francisco et Los Angeles. Il a ensuite enchaÃ®nÃ© une petite tournÃ©e franÃ§aise avec une dizaine de dates en Grande-Bretagne, souvent complÃ¨tes. DÃ¨s que la Chine aura Ã©clairci ses consignes sanitaires concernant la venue d'artistes Ã©trangers, Riopy y fera le dÃ©placement. Â« Outre son cÃ´tÃ© inclassable, ce qui est compliquÃ© Ã  gÃ©rer avec lui, c'est que son niveau de dÃ©veloppement est trÃ¨s variable selon les marchÃ©s, reconnaÃ®t sa manageuse StÃ©phanie Giraud, par ailleurs fondatrice de Bonus Track, spÃ©cialisÃ© dans le conseil musical pour le cinÃ©ma, les marques et la publicitÃ©. On ne peut pas faire le mÃªme marketing ni la mÃªme promo partout. Â»
PassionnÃ© par les neurosciences, Riopy pratique la mÃ©ditation plusieurs fois par jour. Â© Sarah Aubel pour Les Echos Week-End
Cette vie sur les routes laisse peu de temps Ã  Riopy pour ses deux centres d'intÃ©rÃªt en dehors du piano : sa famille et ses recherches en neurosciences. Pratique du rÃªve lucide, pauses de mÃ©ditation de vingt-deux minutes plusieurs fois par jour, hypnose, bains en eau glacÃ©e dÃ¨s qu'il en a l'occasion, rÃ©gime vÃ©gÃ©talien, jeÃ»ne occasionnel, surtout lorsqu'il compose : cet hypersensible a des techniques bien Ã  lui pour l'Â« emmener plus loin Â». Â« Je suis sur ma planÃ¨te et j'ai la chance de pouvoir y rester car j'ai un entourage fiable auquel dÃ©lÃ©guer l'organisation du quotidien. Â»
Outre son Ã©pouse, Sabra, qui fait tourner la boutique avec son sens pratique et sa patience Ã  toute Ã©preuve, il peut compter sur un label qui mise dÃ©sormais gros sur son nom, sa manageuse attitrÃ©e depuis l'Ã©tÃ© 2021, un attachÃ© de presse qui a veillÃ© Ã  relooker ses vidÃ©os et ses visuels parfois trÃ¨s kitsch, un tourneur expÃ©rimentÃ© (Junzi Arts, qui s'occupe aussi de Woodkid, MÃ©lissa Laveaux ou Dita von Teese). Ce petit monde lui permet de rester dÃ©tachÃ© des contingences ordinaires. Il n'Ã©coute pas les infos, se tient Ã  l'Ã©cart des rÃ©seaux sociaux et refuse le jeu des collabs destinÃ©es Ã  rÃ©cupÃ©rer les fans de l'artiste partenaire (Â« de la prostitution musicale Â»).
Du cauchemar au conte de fÃ©es
MalgrÃ© tout, on le sent encore fragile, marquÃ© par son passÃ© tragique qui n'a que rÃ©cemment virÃ© au conte de fÃ©es. AprÃ¨s son Â« enfance volÃ©e Â», qu'il a subie en vase clos, maltraitÃ©, non-scolarisÃ© et privÃ© de libertÃ©, il a connu la prÃ©caritÃ© Ã  travailler dans les fast-foods, Â« nettoyer les chiottes Â», exercer comme pion tout en louant des pianos avec le peu d'argent qui rentrait.
AprÃ¨s une expÃ©rience dÃ©sastreuse Ã  Los Angeles, il s'installe en Angleterre, Ã  Reading, oÃ¹ il gagne sa vie comme vendeur dans une boutique de pianos. Un philanthrope, Michael Freeman, convaincu de son talent, lui propose de financer ses Ã©tudes de musique contemporaine Ã  Oxford - il y rencontrera son Ã©pouse, Sabra, une FranÃ§aise d'origine algÃ©rienne. A Londres, il fait la tournÃ©e des pianos-bars. Nick Saunders, un producteur de films rencontrÃ© par hasard, lui propose de devenir son agent.
Lors d'un gala organisÃ© par Â« Vanity Fair Â», Riopy a la chance de se produire devant Chris Martin et son Ã©pouse de l'Ã©poque Gwyneth Paltrow. Le leader de Coldplay est subjuguÃ© par son jeu, lui offre un piano et lui donne un coup de pouce dÃ©terminant. L'artiste en herbe y voit un signe d'un destin auquel il a toujours cru en dÃ©pit de l'adversitÃ©. Â« De toute ma vie, je n'ai achetÃ© qu'un album, 'Parachutes', le premier de Coldplay, lorsque je me suis retrouvÃ© Ã  la rue en 2001. Je chialais toutes les larmes de mon corps en l'Ã©coutant lors de mes promenades seul dans Paris. J'Ã©tais intimement convaincu que partager mes vibrations grÃ¢ce Ã  la musique reprÃ©sentait ma mission de vie, mais de lÃ  Ã  savoir comment survivre dans l'immÃ©diatâ€¦ Â»
Riopy dans sa loge Ã  Nancy, le 28 janvier 2023.Â© Sarah Aubel pour Les Echos Week-End
Vingt ans plus tard, le voilÃ  suffisamment apaisÃ© pour composer un quatriÃ¨me album, Â« Thrive Â», en rupture avec ceux qui ont fait son succÃ¨s. A cÃ´tÃ© des morceaux Â« Melancholia Â» et Â« A Secret Place Â», s'y glisse un titre intitulÃ© Â« Inner Peace Â» (Â« Paix intÃ©rieure Â»). Â« J'ai le sentiment que mon piano est dÃ©sormais Ã©tabli. Je peux proposer autre chose Ã  ceux qui m'aiment Â», confie-t-il. InspirÃ© de Chopin, Â« Nocturne Â» intÃ¨gre pour la premiÃ¨re fois des cordes. Les arrangements Ã©crits pour un orchestre de 22 musiciens insufflent une puissance inÃ©dite Ã  plus de la moitiÃ© des dix-sept titres.
BoudÃ© par le monde du classique, l'autodidacte attend Â« le moment oÃ¹ il sera suffisamment acceptÃ© dans le milieu pour Ãªtre commissionnÃ© par un orchestre philharmonique Â». Â« Je composerai un truc de fou, une oeuvre totale, avec des cuivres et tout le reste Â», s'emballe-t-il.
Pour le moment, il va devoir imaginer une nouvelle Ã©quation, Ã  la fois artistique et Ã©conomique, pour interprÃ©ter son nouvel album sur scÃ¨ne avec des musiciens qui lui restent Ã  trouver. La raison financiÃ¨re lui dicte de rÃ©arranger ses morceaux pour passer de 22 instruments Ã  un quartet, comme l'a fait avec succÃ¨s l'Islandais Olafur Arnalds. Une nouvelle aventure commence, sans doute moins solitaire et moins marquÃ©e par l'improvisationâ€¦

title: Une affiche coulÃ©e dans le rock
content:
