title: Lana Del Rey - Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd review: wonderful wallowing in Lanaâ€™s world
content:
Review at a glance
E ver since she emerged as Americaâ€™s dark sweetheart over a decade ago, Lana Del Rey has been dogged by accusations that sheâ€™s a phoney. Obsessives â€“ and she has always attracted obsessives â€“ speculated on the possible contrivance of that smokey Twin Peaks vampishness, as though we should want our pop stars to arrive on stage straight off the school bus with no thought whatsoever given to image. Her real name isnâ€™t even Lana Del Rey â€“ lock her up!
Well, while she may look in photographs like the last 70 years never happened, since Chemtrails Over the Country Club which featured 10 of her real friends on the cover, on record Del Reyâ€™s life is increasingly an open book. This far into her career thereâ€™s no sense that sheâ€™s looking for hit singles. She doesnâ€™t sit neatly next to others on Spotify playlists. We must enter her world â€“ she doesnâ€™t care what our world might expect of her â€“ and thereâ€™s plenty to see.
The album (weâ€™ll save time by calling it Ocean Blvd) is her longest, and gets personal from the beginning. Opening song The Grants, one of umpteen languid piano ballads, mentions her grandmother, her sister and her neice. Another long title, and one of the stronger tunes, is Grandfather Please Stand on the Shoulders of my Father While Heâ€™s Deep-Sea Fishing.
On the outlier oddity Peppers, with its electronic hip hop beat and a strange chorus from female rapper Tommy Genesis, sheâ€™s at home with her boyfriend, listening to the Red Hot Chili Peppers before â€œI take off all my clothes/dance naked for the neighbours.â€ Margaret is titled for Margaret Qualley, the actress fiancÃ©e of her co-writer Jack Antonoff, and has a chorus that appears to be Antonoffâ€™s band Bleachers gathered around the piano, singing together, making it up as they go.
This is an album where the music sits back in service to the words, of which there are many. She has spoken of â€œpractising meditative automatic singing, where I donâ€™t filter anythingâ€. Early versions of some songs were made with Mike Hermosa, a filmmaker and ex-boyfriend with a casual attitude to music making because he isnâ€™t a pro.
It means the structure is extremely loose, and it often feels indulgent. But what do Lana Del Rey fans want to do but indulge in their idol? The less obsessed can look elsewhere in her bulging catalogue for stronger songs with sharper focus. This is one for wallowing.
Polydor

title: Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish, Karol G to headline Lollapalooza festival
content:
1/5
Kendrick Lamar will headline Lollapalooza music festival in August. File Photo by Jim Ruymen/UPI | License Photo
March 21 (UPI) -- Lollapalooza has announced the lineup for its 2023 music festival. This year's festival will take place Aug. 3-6 at Grant Park in Chicago. Advertisement
Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Odesza, Lana Del Rey, Karol G, The 1975 and Tomorrow X Together, aka TXT, will headline the event.
Carly Rae Jepsen, Diplo, Pusha T, Rina Sawayama, Sabrina Carpenter, Lainey Wilson, NewJeans and other artists will also perform.
Pre-sale begins Thursday at 11 a.m. EST, with general sale to follow for any remaining tickets.
This year's festival will feature more than 170 artists on nine stages across four days. The day-by-day lineup has yet to be announced.
Advertisement
In other festival news, organizers announced Friday that Rolling Loud New York has been canceled this year due to "logistical factors."
Megan Thee Stallion will headline the March Madness Music Festival this month, while Lil Wayne, Maren Morris and Machine Gun Kelly will perform at Pharrell's Something in the Water festival in April.

title: Lollapalooza lineup 2023: Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish and Red Hot Chili Peppers
content:
Billie Joe Armstrong performs with Green Day on the final day of Lollapalooza, July 31, 2022, in Chicago. (Erin Hooley/Chicago Tribune)
Lollapalooza has announced its lineup for summer 2023 in Grant Park. Headliners include Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish, Red Hot Chili Peppers and ODESZA.
Tickets go on sale first through a SMS Presale that begins 10 a.m. March 23, including with limited numbers of 4-Day General Admission tickets at $365. The four-day Lollapalooza music festival will be Aug. 3-6 in the lakefront park, with more than 170 bands on nine stages.

Chicago artists include Louis the Child, Dehd, Sincere Engineer, Friday Pilots Club, Motherfolk and Kidd Kenn.

Karol G will be the first female Latin artist to headline Lollapalooza.
(C3 Presents)
Lollapalooza is presented by Austin, Texas-based C3 Presents, a division of Live Nation. Tickets include General Admission, 4-Day General Admission, General Admission+, VIP and Platinum Tickets; www.lollapalooza.com

dgeorge@chicagotribune.com

title: Lollapalooza Unveils 2023 Lineup: Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish, More
content:
Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Odesza, Lana Del Rey, Karol G, the 1975 and Tomorrow X Together are the top-billed artists for the Lollapalooza 2023 festival, taking place at its longtime home of Chicagoâ€™s Grant Park from August 3-6.
This yearâ€™s lineup also includes Fred again, Noah Kahan, A Boogie Wit da Hoodie, J.I.D., Maggie Rogers, Carly Rae Jepsen, Diplo, Thirty Seconds to Mars, Tems, the Rose, Rina Sawayama, Lil Yachty, Rema, Morgan Wade, Lainey Wilson, Lâ€™ImpÃ©ratrice, Ivan Cornejo, Sudan Archives, and many others (see the full 170-plus-artist lineup below). The festival, which celebrated its 30 th anniversary in 2021, will take place across nine stages and four days.
Fans can sign up now for the SMS Presale that begins this Thursday, March 23 at 10am CT at http://www.lollapalooza.com to secure 4-Day General Admission at the Tier 1 price of $365 (while supplies last) as well as 4-Day GA+, VIP, and Platinum Tickets. A public on-sale will follow with any remaining tickets.
1-Day Tickets, along with the lineup-by-day will be available at a later date. Kids eight and under may attend for free with a ticketed adult and enjoy Kidzapalooza Presented by Lifeway Kefir, an interactive music playground within the festival, featuring a lineup of family-friendly performances, activities, music, and dance workshops and more.
Lollapalooza supports the local community in multiple ways, notably via the Lollapalooza Arts Education Fund, a $2.2 million donation to support arts and education in Chicago Public Schools. In addition, Lollapalooza also partners with After School Matters, hosts an annual Lollapalooza and SueÃ±os Job Fair, and engages with the Chicago arts and culture community year-round through ongoing partnerships with the African American Heritage Festivals, Teens in the Park Fest, Black Culture Fest, and Musically Fed.
Lollapalooza is supported by T-Mobile, Bud Light, Coinbase, Titoâ€™s Handmade Vodka, BACARDÃ, PayPal, Hulu, Toyota, BMI and Lifeway Kefir.

title: New this week: â€˜Top Gun,â€™ Lana Del Rey and â€˜Rabbit Holeâ€™
content:
Hereâ€™s a collection curated by The Associated Pressâ€™ entertainment journalists of whatâ€™s arriving on TV, streaming services and music and video game platforms this week.
MOVIES
â€” The Oscar-nominated â€œAll the Beauty and the Bloodshedâ€ was one of the high points in documentary in the past year. In it, Laura Poitras chronicles the pioneering photographer Nan Goldin, juxtaposing an intimate survey of her groundbreaking work in 1970s and 1980s New York and her contemporary crusade against the Sackler family, owners of the Oxycontin-maker Purdue Pharma. Goldin, who has herself wrestled with addiction, led the campaign to eradicate the Sackler name from many of the worldâ€™s top museums. Though the film didnâ€™t win at the Oscars â€” something Goldin told me she was surprised to find she wanted â€” it took the top prize of the Venice Film Festival. In her review, AP Film Writer Lindsey Bahr called the filmâ€ a â€œholistic portrait of an artistâ€™s battle cry.â€ After debuting Sunday, March 19, â€œAll the Beauty and the Bloodshedâ€ is available to stream on HBO Max.
â€” â€œTop Gun: Maverickâ€ did come away with an Academy Award, for best sound. But one of the biggest box office hits of the year otherwise struck out at the Oscars. After an uncommonly long run in theaters, a lucrative stop on video on demand and a streaming launch on Paramount+, â€œTop Gun Maverickâ€ arrives on a larger streaming platform Friday, March 24, when it touches down on Amazonâ€™s Prime Video. In his review, AP Entertainment Writer Mark Kennedy called â€œMaverickâ€ â€œa textbook example of how to make a sequel.â€
â€” This month, the Criterion Channel has been paying tribute to the greatest comic artist of the 20th century: Buster Keaton. With five features and more than a dozen shorts, the series is an unbeatable feast. You canâ€™t go wrong but a few highlights: Keatonâ€™s glorious Olympic finale in â€œCollegeâ€; his deft ladder balancing act in â€œCopsâ€; and his escape, through a high window, from an angry police chief-slash-furious-father in â€œThe Goat.â€ With apologies to Charlie Chaplin and Harold Lloyd, nobody did it better.
â€” AP Film Writer Jake Coyle
MUSIC
â€” Fans of Lana Del Rey got two albums in 2021 â€” â€œChemtrails Over the Country Clubâ€ and Blue Banistersâ€ but nothing full-length in 2022. Now sheâ€™s got â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ set to drop Friday, March 24. One of the singles, â€A&W,â€ offers a glimpse at the sing-songwriterâ€™s bleak poetry: â€œPuts the shower on while he calls me/Slips out the back door to talk to me/Iâ€™m invisible, look how you hold me/Iâ€™m a ghost now.â€ The album features Jack Antonoff, Father John Misty, Jon Batiste and more.
â€” Back in 1984, Phil Collins and Philip Bailey had a hit with the song â€œEasy Lover.â€ These days, UK pop star Ellie Goulding and Big Sean have a song with the same title thatâ€™s just as infectiously fun, part of Gouldingâ€™s 11-track album â€œHigher Than Heaven.â€ The songs marry her ethereal voice to strong dance hooks, from the â€™80s-inspired â€œBy the End of the Nightâ€ and â€œJust 4 Youâ€ to the modern pop of â€œCure for Love.â€
â€” Do you have what it takes to be a country musicâ€™s next big star? Then tune into Apple TV+â€™s â€œMy Kind of Country,â€ in which Jimmie Allen, Mickey Guyton and Orville Peck search for talented amateur artists and invite them to Nashville, Tennessee, for a showcase. Reese Witherspoon and Kacey Musgraves also are featured in the series, set to premiere globally on Friday, March 24.
â€” 6lack is 6ack! The Atlanta singer-songwriter and rapper known as 6lack â€” pronounced â€œblackâ€ â€” returns with â€œSince I Have a Lover,â€ his first album in nearly five years. The title track is a airy, sweet ode to love with the lyrics: â€œFeel like a million bucks or somethinâ€™/ Feel like we need to be up to somethinâ€™/ Not tryna press my luck or nothinâ€™/Donâ€™t wanna love you just for fun.â€ The artist, raised in Zone 6 of Atlanta, has been doing a lot of collaborations since his last album, including Lil Tjayâ€™s â€œCalling My Phoneâ€ and more recently Jessie Reyezâ€™s â€œForever.â€
â€” AP Entertainment Writer Mark Kennedy
TELEVISION
â€” Fans of shows including â€œJack Ryanâ€ and â€œThe Recruit,â€ about low-level government agency workers who get pulled into danger and secret missions, should check out â€œThe Night Agentâ€ on Netflix. It follows an FBI agent tasked with manning an overnight emergency phone that surprisingly rings during one of his shifts. A desperate civilian is on the other end of the call and together, they find themselves embroiled in a major government conspiracy. The series stars Gabriel Russo and Luciane Buchanan and is based on the novel by Matthew Quirk. â€œThe Night Agentâ€ debuts Thursday.
â€” Mae Whitman, best-known for her roles in â€œParenthoodâ€ and â€œGood Girls,â€ demonstrates she can also sing in her new rom-com series â€œUp Hereâ€ for Hulu. Set in 1999 in New York, Whitman plays Lindsay who falls for Miguel â€” played by Carlos Valdes (â€œThe Flashâ€ and â€œGaslitâ€) â€” and the will-they, wonâ€™t-they find a happily ever after ensues. The series boasts some major behind-the-scenes musical talent. EGOT winners Kristen Anderson-Lopez and Robert Lopez, behind that little animated film that could â€œFrozen,â€ are co-executive producers and wrote the showâ€™s original music. The show has a whimsical, â€œZoeyâ€™s Extraordinary Playlistâ€-vibe, plus there are fun late-â€™90s references including Y2K. All eight-episodes drop Friday, March 24, the same day the soundtrack drops
â€” Kiefer Sutherland is back with another high-stakes TV drama in â€œRabbit Holeâ€ for Paramount+. He plays John Weir, a corporate spy skilled in the art of deception â€“ until he finds the rug pulled out from underneath him and he is framed for murder. Weir goes from having total control to none, and unsure of who can be trusted. â€œRabbit Holeâ€ premieres with two episodes on Sunday, March 26.
â€” Alicia Rancilio
VIDEO GAMES
â€” Annapurna Interactive has developed a nearly impeccable reputation among connoisseurs of indie video games, from 2017â€™s groundbreaking mystery What Remains of Edith Finch to 2022â€™s futuristic cat sim Stray. The publisherâ€™s latest release is Storyteller, a long-brewing project from Argentine designer Daniel Benmergui. The premise is simple: You have a library of characters, objects, events and other plot devices, and your job is arrange them to tell a particular type of tale. Itâ€™s a puzzle game that pays homage to classic literature, and the graphics ooze charm. Start spinning your own yarns Thursday, March 23, on Nintendo Switch and PC.
â€” Death, the CEO of Death Inc., is burned out. His top minions â€” the executives in charge of Natural Disasters, Modern Warfare, Toxic Food-Processing and other misery-producing departments â€” are going about their business way too enthusiastically, and Death needs them to settle down before he drowns in paperwork. In Have a Nice Death, from Franceâ€™s Magic Design Studios, you wield Deathâ€™s scythe as he hacks and slashes his way through the red tape. The vibrant, angular 2D graphics are reminiscent of the classic Rayman, which some members of Magic Designâ€™s team worked on. The not-so-grim reaping comes to Nintendo Switch and PC on Wednesday.
â€” Lou Kesten
RELATED: New this week: â€˜Ted Lasso,â€™ U2 and â€˜The Boston Stranglerâ€™
RELATED: New this week: Miley Cyrus, â€˜Lutherâ€™ and Oscars viewing

title: Lana Del Rey: Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd review - arresting introspection
content:
You could describe Lana Del Reyâ€™s career thus far as a Benjamin Button-type situation: the more hushed, insular, formally experimental and self-referential her music gets, the more popular she seems to become. Last year, she collaborated with Taylor Swift as the only featured artist on her 10th album, Midnights; every other week, a new song from 2014â€™s Ultraviolence or 2019â€™s Norman Fucking Rockwell! (NFR!) goes viral. Popâ€™s new generation seems to look to her as a guiding light, perhaps more than any other star; her impact on culture is outsized, evidenced by a recent artist-on-artist interview in which Billie Eilish gushes about Del Rey, revealing that a photo of her was the background on her first ever phone.
The artwork for Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. Photograph: AP
Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, her ninth album, fits Del Reyâ€™s curious career arc: it is her quietest, most wilfully inscrutable record in a long time, perhaps since 2015â€™s glacially paced, rebelliously quiet Honeymoon. Many of the songs here donâ€™t have choruses or hooks, and instead feel like the result of Del Rey simply standing in front of a microphone and vibing out. As on 2021â€™s Blue Banisters, her usual US iconography has been largely replaced with specifics from her own life â€“ the names of her siblings recur; one song is named for Margaret Qualley, the actor girlfriend of Del Reyâ€™s producer, Jack Antonoff; five songs were written with Mike Hermosa, an ex-boyfriend. Del Reyâ€™s artistic universe has long been a closed feedback loop, and in Ocean Blvdâ€™s most dramatic, dynamic moments â€“ the jaw-dropping A&W and hazy closer Taco Truck x VB â€“ she outright samples herself, reusing elements of two NFR! songs to create a psychedelic, unexpected time warp.
Little of the album is as ostentatious as A&W, an excoriation of the misogyny that dogs perceptions of Del Rey, a vivid portrait of an affair and a bratty trap rave-up wrapped into seven impossibly tense minutes. Instead, many songs here are subtle, vaporous, but potent all the same. On Fingertips, a fluid, ambling poem set to reserved piano and strings, Del Rey evokes a flood of scenes from her family history, some distressing and others remarkably quotidian. It feels like leafing through someoneâ€™s diaries, some lyrics possessing an almost uncomfortable openness even for a lyricist like Del Rey, who has never shied away from disarming truthfulness: â€œWhat kind of mother was she to say Iâ€™d end up in an institution?â€
The albumâ€™s prevailing atmosphere is heavy, beginning with an interlude in which celebrity pastor Judah Smith sermonises for four minutes. Del Rey frequently sings about wanting to escape and feeling misunderstood, and sings about herself with a withering gaze. On Fishtail, a diffuse highlight that begins like an austere folk ballad from 2021â€™s Chemtrails Over the Country Club, before suddenly sharpening its focus with the introduction of a metallic trap beat, she whispers a meek word of self-defence: â€œIâ€™m not that smart / But Iâ€™ve got things to say.â€
Lana Del Rey: A&W â€“ video
It would be wrong, though, to characterise Ocean Blvd as a purely introspective record. As on Blue Banisters (for my money, Del Reyâ€™s best album) thereâ€™s an appealing aesthetic looseness to many of these songs. At this point, it feels like Del Rey is in a wild west of genre, something she takes full advantage of here. Peppers, which takes its sampled hook from a song by the Canadian â€œfetish rapperâ€ Tommy Genesis, begins as a strutting, louche rap track, Del Rey singing with a brilliantly insouciant mumble (â€œMy boyfriend tested positive for Covid / It donâ€™t matter, weâ€™ve been kissing / So whatever he has I haveâ€) before the whole thing morphs into a rollicking psych-rock song. On Let the Light In, Del Reyâ€™s third collaboration with Father John Misty, she revives the soporific drawl of her early records to sing about a dead-end, almost cartoonishly toxic affair. And she is still prone to sharp, casually tossed-off one-liners: â€œIf you want some basic bitch go down to the Beverly Centre and find her,â€ she sings on Sweet. On one of her longest, most emotionally raw records, these moments provide much-needed variation and relief, and provide pockets of pop structure on an album that tends toward tangled, labyrinthine melodies.

We use Google reCaptcha to protect our website and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. after newsletter promotion
Ocean Blvd ends with Taco Truck x VB â€“ essentially a trap remix of the NFR! single Venice Bitch, with a new verse added at the beginning. Itâ€™s a fitting closer: much of the album feels like past iterations of Del Rey remixed, mashed up and reworked, less in a way that suggests reheated material as an artist who feels there might be more to wring from an already vast and conceptually dense catalogue.
The Del Rey of Taco Truck x VB aligns with the mercurial, occasionally irascible figure who recently threatened to pull out of Glastonbury over a lineup placement issue â€“ a side of her that hasnâ€™t always made it on to her records. â€œBefore you talk let me stop what youâ€™re saying,â€ Del Rey sings, â€œI know, I know, I know that you hate me.â€ At this point in her career â€“ 12 years in, more popular than ever, teasing out the complexities of a project that seems to be metamorphosing in real time â€“ the opposite seems true.

title: Listen to Lana Del Reyâ€™s New Song â€œThe Grantsâ€
content:
Lana Del Rey has released the new song â€œThe Grants.â€ Itâ€™s the opening track on her upcoming album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. Listen below.
Del Rey, who was born Elizabeth Woolridge Grant, co-wrote â€œThe Grantsâ€ with Mike Hermosa. The track also has backing vocals from Melodye Perry, Pattie Howard, and Shikena Jones. It follows the songs â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€ and â€œA&W.â€ The new album, Del Reyâ€™s follow-up to Blue Banisters, is out March 24.
Read about Lana Del Reyâ€™s Chemtrails Over the Country Club cut â€œWhite Dressâ€ at No. 5 in Pitchforkâ€™s â€œThe 100 Best Songs of 2021.â€

title: Ed Sheeran secures fastest-selling album of 2023 so far
content:
Ed Sheeran has beaten Lana Del Reyâ€™s record to secure the UKâ€™s fastest-selling album of 2023 so far, the Official Charts Company has said.
The album â€“ (Subtract) is on the way to earning the 32-year-old pop superstar a sixth consecutive number one album at the midweek mark, securing more than 56,000 chart units, which is more than any other album released this year, it was announced on Tuesday.
The previous record was held by American singer Del Reyâ€™s album Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd which scored 41,000 chart units in total during its first week.
We need your consent to load this Social Media content. We use a number of different Social Media outlets to manage extra content that can set cookies on your device and collect data about your activity. Please review your details and accept them to load the content
Subtract is set to follow the success of Sheeranâ€™s other albums Plus, Multiply, Divide, No 6 Collaborations Project and Equals â€“ which featured number one singles Bad Habits and Shivers.
The newest album comes after his UK number one single Eyes Closed, which was released alongside a four-part Disney+ documentary The Sum Of It All, which marks the end of his decade-long mathematics era.
The chart-topping singer wrote and recorded the 14-track offering after a series of difficult events impacted his life last year, including his wife Cherry Seaborn being diagnosed with a tumour while pregnant and the death of his close friend Jamal Edwards.
During the same time period, Sheeran won a high court battle after two songwriters claimed his 2017 hit Shape Of You infringed copyright of their song Oh Why, later speaking openly about the mental strain the case caused him.
The new album was also released after Sheeran won a US copyright lawsuit which alleged he used parts of Marvin Gayeâ€™s hit song Letâ€™s Get It On for his own track, Thinking Out Loud.

title: Harry, sing Lana Del Rey! How AI is making pop fansâ€™ fantasies come true
content:
Last month, a video of Harry Styles covering a song from 2003 Disney film The Lizzie McGuire Movie went viral on TikTok. Except Styles has never â€“ at least not publicly, or to anyoneâ€™s knowledge â€“ performed this song. Instead, it joins the many examples of fake performances created by artificial intelligence.
Fans were delighted. â€œSuddenly I am no longer afraid of AI,â€ commented one listener, and on videos of other AI-generated Styles songs (heâ€™s made to duet with Taylor Swift, for example) there are multiple requests for more. â€œMake him sing take me to church [by Hozier],â€ writes one fan, and â€œSING SAD GIRL BY LANA [del Rey]â€, bellows another. Fans wanting their favourite artists to cover songs they enjoy is hardly a new phenomenon, but with advances in AI, thereâ€™s no need to involve the artist at all.
Musicians are therefore worried â€“ about being made to perform material they otherwise wouldnâ€™t, or being usurped by a fantasy. â€œI canâ€™t help but think that I can be easily replaced,â€ says Flora Rose, a singer-songwriter on TikTok. â€œIâ€™m spending months crafting my debut EP, [and meanwhile] people can make tracks in one click.â€
When it comes to the arts, AI tends to provoke horror or ridicule â€“ as when an AI photograph won a major photography competition, or when ChatGPT declared young adult weepie The Fault in Our Stars â€œone of the best books of all timeâ€. In February, the lawyer behind a lawsuit on behalf of visual artists whose work was being used to generate AI art called any generative image â€œan infringing derivative workâ€.
The music industry has taken a similar stance. Last month, Universal Music Group asked streaming platforms to decide whether they wanted to be on â€œthe side of artists, fans and human creative expression,â€ or â€œthe side of deep fakes, fraud and denying artists their due compensationâ€.
The problem with UMGâ€™s statement is that it assumes fans and artists are on the same side of this debate. A report by JP Morgan in April argued that â€œAI music is just not very good,â€ and â€œpeople donâ€™t listen to it.â€ But the popularity of AI covers â€“ over 9m views on a fake collaboration between Drake and the Weeknd before it was taken down â€“ puts this into question, and in the comments of these covers on TikTok, sentiment is overwhelmingly positive. Phoebe, 23, a Styles fan from London, says she loves â€œthe idea of hearing Harry cover one of my favourite songs, without relying on him to sing it on stageâ€.
Singer-songwriter Victoria Canal says she doesnâ€™t think AI covers can â€œreplace the heart of an artistâ€™s original voice. Itâ€™s fun and shocking to hear an AI Drake song, but I donâ€™t think it has the potential to take work away from Drakeâ€. But AI music is still sounding alarm bells across the industry: Drake recently called an AI cover of himself rapping an Ice Spice song â€œthe last strawâ€.
That JP Morgan report insists that â€œsuperfans fall in love with the artist, not just the music.â€ Canal agrees, saying AI â€œcanâ€™t replace the heart of an artistâ€™s original voice and recording, and people can feel thatâ€. But existing artists with strong personal brands such as Styles, Drake, or Taylor Swift, already have an emotional connection in place with their fans. â€œPop stars are a projection of our desires,â€ says Holly Herndon, a musician who has experimented with Holly+, an AI clone of her own voice. â€œWe resonate most with idealised fantasiesâ€, she says, rather than the artist themselves.
AI covers are â€œlinked to [Styles], but separate,â€ Phoebe says. â€œBeing a fan of someone is about the community around it, and I love how AI covers give us more content to talk about.â€
skip past newsletter promotion Sign up to Sleeve Notes Free weekly newsletter Get music news, bold reviews and unexpected extras. Every genre, every era, every week Privacy Notice: Newsletters may contain info about charities, online ads, and content funded by outside parties. For more information see our Newsletters may contain info about charities, online ads, and content funded by outside parties. For more information see our Privacy Policy . We use Google reCaptcha to protect our website and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. after newsletter promotion
But itâ€™s not just fan service which AI is facilitating. Stan culture â€“ fervent internet-based fandom â€“ has become increasingly critical and demanding of its idols. Consider the online reaction to Frank Ocean, whose radio silence over new music annoyed fans long before his Coachella set was found wanting, or to Charli XCX, who is often besieged by fan criticism of new music or concert setlists.
Fandoms often â€œtreat pop stardom like sports,â€ says DJ Louie XIV, host of the pop-music podcast Pop Pantheon. â€œYou pick a favourite artist and become very invested in the idea of them â€˜winningâ€™ over the others in the field.â€ As fans ask for more, sometimes at the cost of an artistâ€™s own creative freedom, AI could be satisfying those needs more than the artists themselves.
But many fans see AI covers as an opportunity for collaboration and communication. â€œAI songs could give artists the chance to grasp what their fan bases want from them,â€ says Sara, who runs a Taylor Swift fan account on Twitter. Herndon believes that in the near future, it will be just as common for artists to â€œassume the identities of other peopleâ€ as it is to use samples, and â€œartists will experiment with letting others perform as them, and share in the profitsâ€. UMG and Drake might not agree â€“ but last week, Canadian singer Grimes tweeted that she would split royalties by 50% on any successful AI song using her voice. â€œI like the idea of open sourcing all art and killing copyright,â€ she wrote.
But as AI programs advance, it will become difficult to tell the difference between real and generated music â€“ and fans could end up horrified by what their idols are being made to sing. Grimes later wavered, writing in another tweet a few days later that she â€œmay do copyright takedowns â€¦ donâ€™t wanna be responsible for a Nazi anthem.â€

title: The best selling vinyl albums of 2023 so far: Lana Del Rey tops the list
content:
L ana Del Rey has been confirmed by the Official Charts Company to have the highest-selling vinyl so far this year in the UK.
The announcement is further proof the singer is in demand in the UK after having been announced as the final headliner for the Hyde Park BST festival.
Her ninth LP Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd has shifted 21,000 copies on the older format since being released last month, placing her ahead of a string of big names.
Gorillaz are second with Cracker Island, and Paramore are sixth with This is Why, as Depeche Modeâ€™s Memento Mori and Inhalerâ€™s Cuts & Bruises round out the top 10. All four were released in 2023.
But the majority of the rest of the list comprises older albums. Pink Floydâ€™s live album from a 1974 concert is fourth, and Taylor Swiftâ€™s 2022 offering Midnights is fifth. Courteeners have reissued St Jude in 2023 and it is in third, after making history by taking number one on a weekly sales chart a full 15 years after it was originally released.
However, the order could be shaken up with news that Pink has recorded the strongest first-week sales of the year so far with her record, Trustfall.
New Order have claimed the best-selling vinyl single of 2023 so far, with a 12-inch re-release of 1985 song The Perfect Kiss hitting the top spot.
Scottish alt-rock band Frightened Rabbit earned three entries in the singles list, thanks to the tenth anniversary celebration of their major label debut Pedestrian Verse.
The top 10 vinyl albums of 2023 so far
1. Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd â€” Lana Del Rey
Lizzy Grant has released nine albums under her stage name and Ocean Blvd is the most expansive yet, clocking in at 77 minutes. The long-running time did not put off criticism, however, with Metacritic finding it achieved 80 out of 100 in total. It also debuted at number one in the UK - her sixth in the country - with 10,000 CD sales, 21,000 vinyl pressings, and even 2,500 cassettes.
2. Cracker Island â€” Gorillaz
Damon Albarn and Jamie Hewlettâ€™s virtual band have now released eight albums, as many as Albarnâ€™s original band Blur. Cracker Island invites the listener to hear the ways of The Last Cult, which â€œmembersâ€ Murdoc, Noodle, Russel and 2D have joined. There are features from Thundercat, Stevie Nicks and Tame Impala.
3. St Jude â€” The Courteeners
The Manchester indie rock band re-released their 2008 debut on vinyl which secured them their first number one. It represented the longest time between release and climbing the summit in UK chart history. The band had previously released an orchestra version of St Jude to mark its tenth anniversary in 2008.
4. The Dark Side Of The Moon, Live at Wembley 1974 â€” Pink Floyd
An iconic concert that saw the band perform much of the legendary album at Wembley Empire, now known as Wembley Arena. The performance was towards the end of their 1974 tour in promotion of The Dark Side of the Moon and a high point in their career.
5. Midnights - Taylor Swift
Released in October last year, Midnights has been one of the best-received albums of Swiftsâ€™s career. Its inclusion is another coup for Lana Del Rey, who is a featured vocalist on the fourth track Snow on the Beach.
6. This Is Why â€” Paramore
The US rock band reportedly channelled British indie influences into their sixth studio album - their first since After Laughter in 2017. It reached the top spot of the British chart upon release in February.
7. The Dark Side of the Moon - Pink Floyd
The original 1973 album led to the tour (above).
8. Rumours â€” Fleetwood Mac
Another oldie but goodie, the 1977 album has rarely dropped out of public consciousness upon release. It has an almost unheard-of 100/100 rating on Metacritic. A perk in interest recently might have been brought about by news of the death of Christine McVie, who passed in November 2022.
9. Memento Mori â€” Depeche Mode
The bandâ€™s fifteenth studio record was a long-awaited one for fans as it represented their first release since 2017. Still going strong after more than 40 years, the band have just set off on a world tour but the composition came at a difficult time with the now duo losing founding member Andy Fletcher last May.
10. Cuts & Bruises â€” Inhaler
The newest band on the list, Inhaler released their second LP in February having broken into the mainstream during the pandemic. Frontman Elijah Hewson can claim family bragging rights over his dad, Bono, with Cuts & Bruises pipping U2â€™s album of rearranged classics Songs of Surrender to the top ten of vinyl sales.

title: Espanhol recebe nota com mensagem crÃ­ptica e causa agitaÃ§Ã£o no Twitter
content:
Um utilizador espanhol foi surpreendido por um funcionÃ¡rio de uma cafetaria, recebendo na quarta-feira, como troco, uma nota de cinco euros com uma mensagem peculiar, repleta de mistÃ©rio e... teorias da conspiraÃ§Ã£o.
AtravÃ©s do Twitter, o utilizador publicou a imagem da nota, na qual estava escrita, a caneta, a mensagem "Olha para o cÃ©u. EstÃ£o-nos a fumegar" (do espanhol 'Mira al cielo. Â¡Nos fumigan!).
A curiosidade do incidente vai para alÃ©m da desvalorizaÃ§Ã£o dos cinco euros que, agora, podem ser recusados (a nota pode ser considerada como vandalizada). Ã‰ que a mensagem remete para uma teoria da conspiraÃ§Ã£o muito particular, relacionada com... aviÃµes.
Me acaban de dar este billete en el cambio en una cafeterÃ­a pic.twitter.com/49HAKlfRsW â€” AdriÃ¡n (@Anarcarural) April 26, 2023
A teoria, que em inglÃªs Ã© denominada pela Universidade de Harvard como 'Chemtrail Theory', e que reÃºne milhares de seguidores atravÃ©s das redes sociais, sugere que os rastos deixados pelos aviÃµes que circulam no cÃ©u sÃ£o, na verdade, parte de um plano governamental para libertar quÃ­micos para a terra e, assim, criar uma sÃ©rie de circunstÃ¢ncias nocivas para a populaÃ§Ã£o - desde a esterilizaÃ§Ã£o em massa, reduÃ§Ã£o do tempo de vida, controlo mental sobre as pessoas, controlo meteorolÃ³gico ou, claro, para matar os cidadÃ£os.
NÃ£o existe, claro, qualquer prova cientÃ­fica que comprove que os governos mundiais tÃªm um plano para largar quÃ­micos sobre a populaÃ§Ã£o para a controlar, nem que haja qualquer relaÃ§Ã£o com extraterrestres e os rastos de fumo dos aviÃµes.
A Universidade de Harvard explica que "se realmente houvesse um programa Ã  larga escala para largar materiais de aeronaves nas escalas descritas, teria de ser um programa operacional grande para manufaturar, carregar e dispersar os materiais", esclarecendo que tal envolveria dezenas de milhares de pessoas e, por isso, seria praticamente impossÃ­vel manter o segredo.
Ainda assim, a teoria Ã© tÃ£o famosa que os 'chemtrails' sÃ£o mesmo mencionados no nome de um Ã¡lbum de Lana Del Ray, o 'Chemtrails Over the Country Club' - a referÃªncia no disco, e na faixa com o mesmo nome, Ã© meramente visual, e a artista nÃ£o disserta sobre a hipÃ³tese de um vasto programa internacional para conter a populaÃ§Ã£o mundial.

title: BST Hyde Park 2023 line-up: Lana Del Rey named as final headliner
content:
L ana Del Rey has been announced as the final headliner for the British Summer Time [BST] concerts that will be held over several weekend days this summer in Hyde Park.
This summer will be the tenth year that the series of performances have been held and Del Rey will perform on Sunday, July 9.
The announcement on Friday (April 21) generated a buzz on Twitter. One fan asked if she would be the only performer, to which the BST Hyde Park account replied: â€œNo, there will be other acts announced soon. But she will play a full headlining set! Itâ€™s gonna be amazing.â€
Del Rey released her album Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd last month and received a four-star review in the Evening Standard.
Here is all we know about BST Hyde Park 2023.
What are the dates for BST Hyde Park 2023?
These concerts will be held in late June and early July, beginning on Saturday, June 24 and ending on Sunday, July 9 â€” when Del Rey performs.
There are nine dates for concerts and all will be held on a Thursday, Friday, Saturday, or Sunday.
Who is playing at BST Hyde Park 2023?
This is the full line-up as of April 21. More acts could be announced.
Saturday, June 24: Pink and Gwen Stefani
Sunday, June 25: Pink and Gwen Stefani
Friday, June 30: Guns Nâ€™ Roses
Saturday, July 1: Take That, Sugababes, The Script
Sunday, July 2: Blackpink, Sabrina Carpenter, The Rose Caity Baser, Mae Stephens
Thursday, July 6: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band, The Chicks, Frank Turner
Friday, July 7: Billy Joel, Daryl Hall
Saturday, July 8: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band, The Chicks
Sunday, July 9: Lana Del Rey
Tickets will be on sale soon for Lana Del Rey / Alberto E Rodriguez / Getty Images for CBS Radio Inc
When do the Lana Del Rey tickets go on sale for BST Hyde Park 2023?
For AMEX (American Express) cardholders, the presale has already started. It ends at 9am on Thursday, April 27. Tickets start at Â£78.95 for general admission. You can follow that link here: https://www.bst-hydepark.com/lanadelreyamex/
The Lana Del Rey general presale will go live at 10am on Tuesday, April 25, and will run until 9am on Thursday, April 27.
To sign up to the presale email, click here: https://www.bst-hydepark.com/lana-del-rey-presale-signup/
BST has said you will receive your email right before the presale and to remember to check the junk and spam folders for the link.
How to get tickets for BST Hyde Park 2023 for other acts?
Tickets are sold out for shows headlined by Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band (both dates), Billy Joel, and Pink (June 24 date).

title: Lana Del Rey announced as final BST Hyde Park headliner
content:
L ana Del Rey has been announced as the final headliner for this yearâ€™s British Summer Time festival in Hyde Park.
The US singer-songwriter will close the festival on Sunday July 9, with special guests yet to be announced.
Del Rey joins an already star-studded line-up for the 10th anniversary festival, which includes other US musical superstars Pink, Billy Joel, Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band, and Guns Nâ€™ Roses.
Since the release of her debut album Born To Die 11 years ago, Del Rey has produced a slew of chart-topping and award-winning hits.
Her latest studio album Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, released earlier this year, topped the UK charts in March.
Her headline performance at BST Hyde Park will be one of the first times she has played the tracks live.
Del Rey has previously performed at the biggest festivals across the world, including Coachella and Lollapalooza.
BST Hyde Park 2023 will be the first time that rock band Guns Nâ€™ Roses have performed at the London festival.
The band â€“ featuring singer Axl Rose, guitarist Slash and bassist Duff McKagan â€“ will top the bill on Friday June 30.
It was also previously announced that British superstars Take That will reunite on Saturday July 1 for their only UK live date this year.
Gary Barlow, Howard Donald and Mark Owen will be joined by chart-topping Irish band The Script and the recently reformed classic line-up of Sugababes.
Tickets for 2023 BST Hyde Park go on general sale at 10am on Thursday April 27.

title: Lana Del Rey to Headline Londonâ€™s Hyde Park in July
content:
Lana Del Rey is set to headline Londonâ€™s Hyde Park music festival this summer.
The â€œBorn to Dieâ€ singer will play BST Hyde Park in central London, which is celebrating its tenth anniversary, on July 9. BST Hyde Park is a concert series that takes place over two or three weekends every summer with a variety of headliners. BST (not to be confused with K-pop band BTS) stands for British Summertime.
Del Rey will be joined by special guests at the gig, who are yet to be announced.
She recently returned to music with her latest album, â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd,â€ which she will include in her Hyde Park set.
Also headlining the BST Hyde Park series of gigs this summer are Pink, Guns N Roses, Take That, Blackpink, Bruce Springsteen and Billy Joel, among other artists.
Del Rey is also set to play Glastonbury this summer, although she obliquely threatened to pull out of the world-famous festival last month after reportedly perceiving the organizersâ€™ announcement of the lineup as a snub. Del Rey is booked to play Glastonburyâ€™s Other Stage, a fact that was omitted from Glastoâ€™s initial lineup announcement in June.
Meanwhile in the U.S. she is set to play Washington, D.C.-areaâ€™s longrunning All Things Go festival this fall.
More info and tickets for BST Hyde Park can be found on www.bst-hydepark.com.

title: Outside Lands releases daily lineups, single-day ticket information
content:
The daily lineups for the 2023 Outside Lands festival have been announced.
And now weâ€™re worried that there might end up being a scheduling conflict when it comes to our goal of seeing both the Foo Fighters and Lana Del Rey on Day Two.
Guess weâ€™ll just have to wait and see how things play out when the actual set times are announced at a later date for the three-day event, which runs Aug. 11-13 in Golden Gate Park.
Looking beyond the Foos and Del Rey, other highlights include Kendrick Lamar, Janelle MonÃ¡e and J.I.D on Day One; Maggie Rogers and Alvvays on Day Two; and ODESZA, Megan Thee Stallion and Lil Yachty on Day Three.
Also, single-day tickets go on sale at 10 a.m. April 19, sfoutsidelands.com. Prices run $199-$2,199. There are also some three-day passes still available.

title: Lana Del Rey, Boygenius, Maggie Rogers, and Carly Rae Jepsen Headline All Things Go Music Festival 2023
content:
All Things Go Music Festival is returning to Merriweather Post Pavilion in Columbia, Maryland, on September 30 and October 1. Itâ€™s headlined by Lana Del Rey, Boygenius, Maggie Rogers, and Carly Rae Jepsen. The lineup also includes Alvvays, Muna, Tegan and Sara, Arlo Parks, Ethel Cain, Alex G, Sudan Archives, Beabadoobee, and more. Find the full lineup below.
This yearâ€™s women-led bill follows last yearâ€™s edition of the festival, which was headlined by Lorde, Mitski, and Bleachers.

title: All Things Go Festival 2023: Lana Del Rey, Boygenius, Maggie Rogers
content:
Lana Del Rey, Boygenius and Maggie Rogers will headline the Washington, D.C.-areaâ€™s longrunning All Things Go festival, taking place at Marylandâ€™s Merriweather Post Pavilion for two days: Saturday September 30 and Sunday October 1. Also on the bill are Carly Rae Jepsen, Mt. Joy, Muna, Arlo Parks, Lizzy McAlpine, Tegan And Sara and Fletcher and more.
Last yearâ€™s edition sold out with Lorde, Mitski and Bleachers headlining.
ALL THINGS GO FESTIVAL 2023 LINEUP
SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 30, 2023
Maggie Rogers

Founded in 2011, in past years All Things Go has featured Billie Eilish, Lorde, HAIM, Charli XCX, St Vincent, CHVRCHES, Carly Rae Jepsen, Foster the People, Kygo, Sylvan Esso, Vince Staples, Future Islands, Tove Lo, Young Thug, Empire of The Sun and many more.
The Merriweather Post Pavilion is one of the most iconic venues in the U.S.: In addition to Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin and the Grateful Dead, it hosted the only time the Who and Led Zeppelin played on the same bill (in 1969). Recent enhancements include new concession stands, skylawn seating, an enormous kitchen , a Music Pinball Arcade, award-winning sculptures and the tripling of restroom facilities.
Directions, transportation and other information is available at http://www.merriweathermusic.com.

title: Lana Del Rey has best-selling vinyl album of 2023 so far
content:
Lana Del Rey has the best-selling vinyl album of 2023 so far, the Official Charts Company has said (Danny Lawson/PA) â€” Â© Danny Lawson
Lana Del Rey has the best-selling vinyl album of 2023 so far, the Official Charts Company has said.
Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd has already earned the 37-year-old American singer a sixth number one record in the UK charts and the fastest-selling LP to date this year.
She also last month became the female solo artist with the fifth-most number one albums, after Madonna on 12, Taylor Swift on nine, Kylie Minogue with eight and Barbra Streisand with seven.
We need your consent to load this Social Media content. We use a number of different Social Media outlets to manage extra content that can set cookies on your device and collect data about your activity. Please review your details and accept them to load the content
Reyâ€™s ninth studio album follows her other chart-toppers including 2012â€™s Born To Die, 2014â€™s Ultraviolence, 2017â€™s Lust for Life, 2019â€™s Norman F****** Rockwell! and 2021â€™s Chemtrails Over The Country Club.
Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd has sold 20,800 copies on vinyl so far this year.
Coming in at number two in this yearâ€™s vinyl charts is Gorillazâ€™s Cracker Island â€“ the virtual bandâ€™s first number one album in 17 years.
At number three this year so far is English band The Courteeners with St Jude â€“ which became a number one 15 years after its original release following an anniversary re-issue.
To date, Pink Floydâ€™s live-pressing of The Dark Side Of The Moon, released to mark the recordâ€™s 50th anniversary, has reached number four, as Swiftâ€™s Midnights continues to hold sway at number five this year.
Upon release, American singer-songwriter Swiftâ€™s album immediately broke a string of records, including becoming Spotifyâ€™s most streamed album in a single day.
In the vinyl single charts, New Orderâ€™s song The Perfect Kiss has claimed the top 2023 slot so far.
The track was originally released in 1985 and re-released on 12 inch as part of the release of remastered January reissue Low-Life Definitive Edition.
We need your consent to load this Social Media content. We use a number of different Social Media outlets to manage extra content that can set cookies on your device and collect data about your activity. Please review your details and accept them to load the content
Inhaler have the only 2023 new song release to make the top five list as the Irish rock band reaches number three with their hit Valentine.
English rock band New Orderâ€™s 1983 single Blue Monday, which celebrates its 40th anniversary this year, makes number three as the new wave band also reached number five with their 1985 track Sub-Culture.
Swedish rock band Ghostâ€™s Kiss The Go-Goat, released in September 2019, has sold the fourth most vinyl singles to date this year.

Jag Ã¤r inte ensam om att drabbas av henne. TvÃ¤rtom har den amerikanska artisten som slog igenom med â€Born to dieâ€-albumet 2012, lagt grunden fÃ¶r en hel generation av â€sad girlsâ€. Det vill sÃ¤ga unga, vita tjejer som mÃ¥r dÃ¥ligt och uttrycker det online. Men Lana del Rey-kulturen Ã¤r egentligen betydligt rikare Ã¤n sÃ¥, den Ã¤r en allt mer avlÃ¤gsen amerikansk drÃ¶m. Den Ã¤r rÃ¶da Marlboros och Chateau Marmont. Bensinmackar och biljardhallar, svartvita portrÃ¤tt och Ã¶verblommade rosor. Leonard Cohen och Sylvia Plath. Den Ã¤r att vara ihop med en narkoman och att susa Ã¶ver en scen i en gunga. TonÃ¥rsalkoholism och tvÃ¥ngsvÃ¥rd. Diners. DÃ¶den.
Den livsbejakande dÃ¶dsdriften som Lana del Rey gestaltat i sin musik Ã¤r den samma som Tone Schunnesson och Emma BromÃ© lyckats fÃ¶rmedla i deras fullstÃ¤ndigt geniala uppsÃ¤ttning av Anna Karenina som gÃ¥r att se pÃ¥ Orionteatern just nu. â€Will you still love me when I'm no longer young and beautiful?â€, sjunger Lana del Rey i en av sina stÃ¶rsta hits. â€Ã„lskar du mig fast att jag Ã¤r jobbig?â€, frÃ¥gar Anna Karenina sin Ã¤lskare i en av de starkaste scenerna av Schunnessons uppsÃ¤ttning. De bÃ¥da kvinnorna fÃ¶rstÃ¥r pÃ¥ nÃ¥got plan att svaret pÃ¥ deras frÃ¥gor Ã¤r nej. Men eftersom de Ã¤r freaks, sexhÃ¤xor, irrationella kÃ¤nslostormar, blundar de fÃ¶r det.
Som musikskribenten Tali da Silva nyligen konstaterade i en utmÃ¤rkt Expressen-artikel sjÃ¶ng Lana del Rey om destruktiv kÃ¤rlek under ett 10-tal dÃ¥ det minst sagt var tabu fÃ¶r kvinnor, nÃ¤r dÃ¥liga relationer â€bara gick att sjunga om i imperfekt, efter att man gjort slut och gÃ¥tt starkare dÃ¤rifrÃ¥n, och enligt artister som BeyoncÃ© och Taylor Swift verkade allt mÃ¶jligt att fÃ¶rÃ¤ndra bara med tankens kraft. Om nÃ¥gon sÃ¤ger nÃ¥got taskigt? Shake it off. Who run the world? Girlsâ€.
Under samma period citerade Lana Vladimir Nabokov och sjÃ¶ng sjÃ¤lvutplÃ¥nande rader om att vara ihop med kriminella killar och ha en grej fÃ¶r mÃ¤n som Ã¤r Ã¤ldre. I lÃ¥t efter lÃ¥t skapade hon ramaskri med sina grÃ¤nslÃ¶sa och politiskt inkorrekta rader om sex, vÃ¥ld och kÃ¤rlek. Vissa feminister rasade och hÃ¤vdade att hon bidrog till en romantisering av vÃ¥ldsamma relationer och kvinnlig underlÃ¤gsenhet. Jag ger dem delvis rÃ¤tt.
Men i samband med hennes senaste skivslÃ¤pp, â€Did you know that thereâ€™s a tunnel under Ocean blvdâ€, bÃ¶rjade rykten spridas om att Lana del Rey fÃ¶rlovat sig med den gulliga musikern Evan Winiker. Han har lockigt hÃ¥r, en lurvig hund och en sÃ¥dan dÃ¤r teddyjacka som bara riktigt snÃ¤lla killar har. Om skvallret stÃ¤mmer har alltsÃ¥ ansiktet utÃ¥t fÃ¶r den passionerade kÃ¤rleken, kvinnan som brukade sjunga om att ligga med Harvey Weinstein, slagit sig ned med en medelÃ¥ldersgullis och gjort sig redo fÃ¶r ett vanligt vovve-liv. Det Ã¤r nedslÃ¥ende nyheter fÃ¶r den stora romantiken, men antagligen det bÃ¤sta som hade kunnat hÃ¤nda Lana del Rey.
Vi alla vet hur det slutade fÃ¶r Anna Karenina.

title: Tudo sobre os melhores momentos do MITA Festival em SÃ£o Paulo
content:

A simpatia de Sabrina Carpenter
No inÃ­cio da tarde deste domingo (4), Sabrina Carpenter fez a galera danÃ§ar ao som de Read Your Mind, Vicious e Sue Me. Ela brincou de pedra, papel e tesoura com uma fÃ£ (e se gabou por ter ganhado), disse que os brasileiros sÃ£o o melhor pÃºblico e que estÃ¡ animada para voltar pra cÃ¡ em novembro, quando vai participar dos shows da The Eras Tour, de Taylor Swift. A volta do NX Zero
A turnÃª Cedo ou Tarde, que marca a volta do NX Zero aos palcos, comeÃ§ou, e o show do MITA foi o primeiro desse retorno em SÃ£o Paulo. â€œMuita saudade de tocar aqui em casa, nesse dia abenÃ§oado, nesse dia lindo. A apresentaÃ§Ã£o foi pura nostalgia, e o pÃºblico reviveu memÃ³rias afetivas com SÃ³ Rezo, Daqui Pra Frente, Onde Estiver, RazÃµes e EmoÃ§Ãµes, entre outras.

As irmÃ£s Haim vivendo o Brasil

De biquÃ­ni verde e amarelo com a bandeira do Brasil, Alana, Danielle e Este mostraram todo seu talento tocando teclado, guitarra, bateria, baixo e atÃ© na icÃ´nica dancinha sincronizada, e deu para ver que elas estavam entretidas e realmente animadas no show. Sem contar que elas realmente viveram enquanto estiveram aqui, nÃ©? Foram em botecos, visitaram a quadra da Portela, deram rolÃª na Avenida Paulistaâ€¦ Maravilhosas!
Este do HAIM contando que estava passeando mais cedo e encontrou um bonÃ© da Xuxa em uma loja aleatÃ³ria. Um sinal do universo! ğŸ˜‚ğŸ¤@mitafestival #HAIM pic.twitter.com/1ybvHeIoGB â€” We In The Crowd (@weinthecrowd) June 4, 2023
As anjas do @HAIMtheband entregaram tuuuudo no show em SÃ£o Paulo e ainda cantaram "IlariÃª"! Ãcones âœ¨ #MITA #MusicIsTheAnswer pic.twitter.com/qSlXPgzUso â€” MITA Festival (@mitafestival) June 4, 2023
E aÃ­, qual foi o melhor momento do MITA Festival pra vocÃª? Queremos saber!

title: Mita: Lana del Rey tem passagem religiosa pelo Brasil

"Deus te abenÃ§oe, Brasil", mostrava uma mensagem no telÃ£o para os fÃ£s presentes no show no centro paulistano, no vale do AnhangabaÃº â€”que embora tenha atrasado, no decorrer da noite fria, os deixou empolgados.
A cantora Lana del Rey - Instagram/lanadelrey
Antes da apresentaÃ§Ã£o, a cantora pop visitou a comunidade indÃ­gena Tatuyo, em Manaus, e participou de um ritual com danÃ§a. Quando passou pela capital fluminense, a cantora visitou o Cristo Redentor em passeio turÃ­stico.
JÃ¡ no Rio, ela recebeu a bÃªnÃ§Ã£o de um padre apÃ³s assistir a uma missa em uma capela da cidade. O irmÃ£o da pop star, Charlie Grant, postou um registro do momento nas redes sociais. "Cristo Ã© amor incondicional", escreveu.

title: Produtor de Lana del Rey depÃµe Ã  polÃ­cia por xenobofia
content:

PublicaÃ§Ã£o feita pelo produtor Will Whitney, da equipe de Lana Del Rey, em que conta que ter sido assaltado no Rio de Janeiro e xinga o Brasil - @will.w.whitney no Instagram
Na publicaÃ§Ã£o, Whitney relatava um furto de seu celular por um motoqueiro. "Acabei de ter o meu iPhone furtado da minha mÃ£o por um merda em cima de uma moto. Foda-se este paÃ­s inteiro. Eles nÃ£o merecem mÃºsica ao vivo. Mal posso esperar para ir para casa", escreveu.

title: Investigado por xenofobia, tÃ©cnico de Lana Del Rey presta depoimento
content:
Membro da equipe de Lana Del Rey acusado de xenofobia, Will Whitney prestou depoimento Ã  polÃ­cia. O depoimento do tÃ©cnico de baterista da artista internacional aconteceu nesse sÃ¡bado (3/6), apÃ³s o show de Lana em SÃ£o Paulo.

title: Lana Del Rey no MITA Festival SÃ£o Paulo
content:
Houve quem sentiu falta de um dos maiores hits de Lana Del Rey, â€œNational Anthemâ€, no show de quase duas horas que cativou o pÃºblico do MITA Festival em SÃ£o Paulo. Mas Ã© realmente difÃ­cil botar defeito no setlist que cantora trouxe ao paÃ­s cinco anos depois de sua Ãºltima passagem por aqui. Isso porque Lana nÃ£o somente passou por toda sua carreira - entregando, claro, aqueles hits clÃ¡ssicos como â€œBlue Jeansâ€ e â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ - mas tambÃ©m flutuou por recentes e Ã³timas faixas, desde â€œArcadiaâ€ atÃ© â€œDid You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€. Mais do que tudo isso, a melhor coisa de assistir a um show da Lana Ã© ver sua disposiÃ§Ã£o de sair do planejamento e atender aos pedidos dos fÃ£s, e em SÃ£o Paulo nÃ£o foi diferente. Aqui, ela se comoveu com a vontade do pÃºblico de ouvir â€œGet Freeâ€ e â€œCinnamon Girlâ€.
Tudo isso ajudou bastante a descontrair dos quarenta minutos de atraso para o comeÃ§o do show da headliner do primeiro dia de MITA - SP. NÃ£o houve exatamente uma explicaÃ§Ã£o ou reconhecimento do problema, mas Lana surgiu ao palco Ã s 21h (o show estava anunciado para Ã s 20h20) sem a peruca loira que marcou o inÃ­cio da mesma apresentaÃ§Ã£o no MITA do Rio de Janeiro. Mais do que isso, suas danÃ§arinas surgiram junto parecendo fazer ajustes em seu figurino. Se toda a espera foi pelo atraso no preparo do visual, tudo isso foi esquecido rapidamente, quando ela emendou o final de â€œA&Wâ€ com â€œYoung and Beautifulâ€, criando um clima de luzes quase apoteÃ³tico para uma jornada que foi atÃ© Ã s 22h45.
Lana permanece a mesma que passou por aqui em 2018, isto Ã©, amiga do pÃºblico, cheia de charme e mais do que tudo, personalidade. O playback faz parte da performance - Lana sobe ao palco com o conforto de quem estÃ¡ lÃ¡ para apresentar suas Ã³timas composiÃ§Ãµes, assistir o pÃºblico se empolgar com suas letras, e cantar quando tem vontade, o que tem vontade. Pode ser que a apresentaÃ§Ã£o afaste quem nÃ£o Ã© familiarizado com sua discografia, mas Lana nÃ£o se importa muito. E a sua postura de diva, cercada de danÃ§arinas, Ã© cativante. O conforto com as gravaÃ§Ãµes Ã© visÃ­vel desde o comeÃ§o, quando ela se perdeu no meio de â€œBartenderâ€ e desistiu de tentar acompanhar. â€œNÃ£o, vai do comeÃ§o e vamos de novoâ€, ela diz, e a faixa de Norman Fucking Rockwell comeÃ§a novamente.
Mas o show empolga de verdade quando Lana deita no chÃ£o do palco ao lado das danÃ§arinas e parte para uma seleÃ§Ã£o melancÃ³lica, que inicia com â€œPretty When You Cryâ€, passa por â€œRideâ€ e â€œBorn to Dieâ€ e encerra com â€œBlue Jeansâ€. O entusiasmo na emenda dos hits Ã© visÃ­vel e Lana reconhece, pausando para agradecer nÃ£o sÃ³ o pÃºblico como o paÃ­s inteiro. â€œObrigada por cantarem minhas mÃºsicas comigoâ€, ela diz, antes de agradecer o Brasil pelos 10 dias que passou por aqui. Antes da reta final, a americana desceu para o pÃºblico, aceitou uma coroa de flores de um fÃ£, comprimentou os primeiros da pista premium. Tudo isso antes de ouvir e entender os pedidos dos fÃ£s por uma faixa fora do setlist. â€œNÃ£o sei se lembroâ€, ela diz sobre â€œGet Freeâ€ antes de pedir para o pÃºblico cantar. O momento, o mais bonito de assistir da apresentaÃ§Ã£o, mostrou a potÃªncia do coro do pÃºblico e deixou Lana emocionada. Para presentear, ela tambÃ©m topou um â€œCinammonâ€ quase a cappella, na reta final do show que, como tradiÃ§Ã£o, encerrou com â€œVideo Gamesâ€. Deu atÃ© pra ignorar o fato de que o festival acendeu as luzes bem antes do show terminar, fato totalmente ignorado pela headliner.
Tudo isso foi lindo de assistir - do telÃ£o. Isso porque o MITA Festival de SÃ£o Paulo, apesar de bem localizado e fazer bom proveito de um espaÃ§o bonito da cidade, nÃ£o entregou exatamente uma disposiÃ§Ã£o agradÃ¡vel. A Ã¡rea Ã© muito comprida e estreita e Ã© fÃ¡cil demais ficar distante do palco. Para quem nÃ£o Ã© imprensa, claro, o perrengue Ã© muito maior: a ideia de um festival com pista premium Ã© realmente frustrante, porque o fim desta â€œÃ¡rea vipâ€ Ã© feita quase completamente de pÃºblico que nÃ£o Ã© realmente fÃ£, que em um Lollapalooza, por exemplo, estaria distante do palco, sem atrapalhar quem queria muito mais estar lÃ¡ - mas que, aqui, se aglomerou na boca da pista comum. E por falar em pista premium, inclusive, boa sorte em chegar lÃ¡: a entrada Ã© no meio do evento, e claro que recheada de gente que busca a melhor visualizaÃ§Ã£o do palco. Isto Ã©, acessar a Ã¡rea tambÃ©m foi uma jornada ingrata. Ainda, o MITA tambÃ©m sofreu de problemas de sistema e nÃ£o deu conta da demanda de bebidas, com filas quilomÃ©tricas de gente que esperava que as maquininhas de cartÃ£o voltassem a funcionar.
Tudo isso faz parte do jogo claro, e o MITA SP pode servir como um aprendizado de como fazer uma disposiÃ§Ã£o melhor para um evento - um, talvez, que nÃ£o tenha uma headliner do porte de Lana, que talvez demandasse mais espaÃ§o e visibilidade. Mas o que a cantora entregou aqui nÃ£o foi pouco, e Ã© difÃ­cil nÃ£o se contagiar com o seu visÃ­vel amor tanto pelo Brasil quanto pela seu prÃ³prio trabalho. Lana Ã© uma artista que claramente gosta de fazer o que faz e faz de um jeito que sÃ³ ela pode. Flutuar pelos seus versos timidamete e deslizar em suas prÃ³prias letras tambÃ©m faz parte do charme de Lana, uma diva bem confortÃ¡vel no papel que interpreta. O que resta, assim como em 2018, Ã© a vontade que ela retorne fora de festival, em um show para chamar de seu.

title: Mita: Lana Del Rey faz show de muitos hits e glamour
content:
SÃ£o Paulo
Quando Lana Del Rey subiu ao palco do Mita Festival, neste sÃ¡bado, no vale do AnhangabaÃº, em SÃ£o Paulo, o pÃºblico variava entre vaias e pedidos para que ela comeÃ§asse logo o show. A reaÃ§Ã£o nÃ£o durou muito depois que ela finalmente apareceu e os gritos foram substituÃ­dos por juras de amor.
A cantora, que jÃ¡ havia comeÃ§ado seu show com atraso na ediÃ§Ã£o carioca do festival, no final de semana passado â€”e reclamado por ter tido o Ã¡udio cortado antes de terminar sua setlistâ€”, subiu ao palco em SÃ£o Paulo com 40 minutos de atraso, telÃµes com um pequeno delay, o som da banda por vezes mais baixo do que o ideal e um cigarro eletrÃ´nico azul preso em seu cinto.
A cantora Lana Del Rey se apresenta no Mita Festival, no vale do AnhagabaÃº, em SÃ£o Paulo - Adriano Vizoni/Folhapress
Com o atraso prontamente perdoado pelos fÃ£s, a cantora interpretou hits, cantou mÃºsicas que demoraram anos para serem tocadas ao vivo e fez coreografias e trocas de roupa em um cenÃ¡rio meio burlesco e meio clÃ¡ssico, com danÃ§arinas se apresentando em volta de mesas e castiÃ§ais.
Foi o segundo show da artista americana depois de um hiato de quatro anos nas performances ao vivo â€”sua Ãºltima apresentaÃ§Ã£o foi na turnÃª do Ã¡lbum "Norman Fucking Rockwell!", em novembro de 2019, encerrada antes da hora por causa da pandemia.
A reestreia aconteceu na ediÃ§Ã£o carioca do Mita, no Jockey Club do Rio de Janeiro, no fim de semana passado. O Brasil pÃ´de ouvir a cantora apresentar pela primeira e segunda vez canÃ§Ãµes de seus Ãºltimos trÃªs Ã¡lbuns, incluindo "Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd", lanÃ§ado hÃ¡ pouco mais de dois meses.
Del Rey dedicou cerca de um terÃ§o do seu show em SÃ£o Paulo a mÃºsicas desses Ã¡lbuns, como "The Grants", executada em tom quase que religioso, "Candy Necklace", que ela cantou sentada num piano dourado, e "Arcadia". Todas foram celebradas por um pÃºblico fiel, que comemorava cada aceno da artista.
Foi palpÃ¡vel, no entanto, o efeito da parte do repertÃ³rio que foi na direÃ§Ã£o de seus primeiros e mais incensados Ã¡lbuns, que ela jÃ¡ tinha em seu currÃ­culo quando tocou no Brasil pela Ãºltima vez, na ediÃ§Ã£o de 2018 do Lollapalooza.
Acompanhada por um coro que ecoava pelo AnhangabaÃº, a artista passou por mÃºsicas como "Blue Jeans", "Pretty When You Cry", "Summertime Sadness", "Cinnamon Girl" e uma "Ultraviolence" cantada em cima da grade, tirando selfies e de mÃ£os dadas com fÃ£s.
Entrou na setlist atÃ© "Get Free", que a americana incluiu no repertÃ³rio num truque, deixando para o pÃºblico a responsabilidade de cantar a mÃºsica que ele mesmo passou o show inteiro pedindo. Ã‰ que a cantora foi processada pela banda Radiohead, que a acusou de plagiar seu sucesso "Creep".
O furor do show que fechou o evento neste sÃ¡bado chegou a ser maior que aquele visto no festival no AutÃ³dromo de Interlagos, ainda que na Ã©poca sua performance tenha sido considerada maior que o palco secundÃ¡rio ao qual foi relegada.
Na ocasiÃ£o, a artista jÃ¡ tinha no currÃ­culo "Born to Die", de 2012, seu segundo trabalho com ao menos cinco hits, "Ultraviolence", de 2014, e "Honeymoon", do ano seguinte. "Lust for Life", que havia sido lanÃ§ado meses antes do evento, ainda garantiu a ela uma indicaÃ§Ã£o ao Grammy na categoria de melhor Ã¡lbum pop.
Neste sÃ¡bado, em horÃ¡rio e palco mais nobres, a americana foi chamariz do evento que teve ingressos esgotados apenas para este dia.
Sua setlist encorpada e cheia de inÃ©ditas que ela provavelmente teria tocado em seu show no Lollapalooza de 2020, cancelado por causa da Covid-19, foi encerrado com o sucesso "Video Games", cantado em cima de um balanÃ§o florido.
Ela deixou o palco aplaudida depois de tirar o atraso com seus fÃ£s e cantar no centro de SÃ£o Paulo seu glamour decadente, sua aura nostÃ¡lgica e suas canÃ§Ãµes de amores que deram errado â€”tudo o que faz Lana Del Rey ser quem Ã©.

title: Mita: Lana del Rey danÃ§a em vila indÃ­gena no Amazonas
content:
SÃ£o Paulo
Lana del Rey visitou uma aldeia em Manaus, no Amazonas, na Ãºltima quinta-feira, onde foi vista danÃ§ando com indÃ­genas. O momento foi divulgado nas redes sociais.
A cantora se apresentou no Mita Festival hÃ¡ uma semana, no Rio de Janeiro, e tem nova apresentaÃ§Ã£o neste sÃ¡bado em SÃ£o Paulo, tambÃ©m pelo evento.
A cantora Lana del Rey na comunidade indÃ­gena Tatuyo, em Manaus - ReproduÃ§Ã£o
Por causa do intervalo curto, Del Rey estÃ¡ no paÃ­s hÃ¡ uma semana e aproveitou para fazer a viagem Ã  regiÃ£o Norte. Ela desembarcou em Manaus na terÃ§a-feira, depois de fazer turismo no Cristo Redentor e no Corcovado, no Rio de Janeiro, no domingo.
A comunidade indÃ­gena que a artista visitou foi a Tatuyo. LÃ¡, ela danÃ§ou num ritual indÃ­gena do povo, alÃ©m de interagir com a influenciadora local Maira Gomes Godinho, conhecida tambÃ©m como Cunhaporanga Tatuyo.
O namorado de Gomes Godinho, Henrique, celebrou o momento no Instagram. "Simplesmente a Lana del Rey vindo visitar a comunidade Tatuyo e conhecer um pouco mais dessa cultura maravilhosa", escreveu. "Que momento lindo."

title: Mita: Cercadinho VIP revolta fÃ£s de Lana del Rey no evento
content:
SÃ£o Paulo
Dedos do meio sÃ£o levantados em meio a gritos enraivecidos nas primeiras fileiras da plateia que preenche a pista comum do festival Mita neste sÃ¡bado.
A ediÃ§Ã£o paulistana do evento ocorre neste final de semana, no vale do AnhangabaÃº, no centro da capital paulista. Os destaques sÃ£o os shows de Lana Del Rey, que deve se apresentar Ã s 20h20 desde sÃ¡bado, e da banda Florence + the Machine, que encabeÃ§a a programaÃ§Ã£o do domingo.
PÃºblico durante o primeiro dia do Mita Festival, realizado no Vale do AnhagabaÃº - Adriano Vizoni/Folhapress
O Mita foi xingado pelo pÃºblico por cercar com grades o pedaÃ§o mais prÃ³ximo do palco principal, onde sÃ³ entram pessoas que comparam ingressos para pista premium â€”as entradas chegaram a custar atÃ© R$ 2.200.
A prÃ¡tica nÃ£o Ã© comum em festivais. Ainda que tenham porte muito maior que o Mita, o Lollapalooza e o Rock in Rio, por exemplo, nÃ£o criam esse tipo de divisÃ£o. O C6 Festival, por outro lado, dividiu seus ingressos por Ã¡rea â€”era possÃ­vel comprar apenas para ver os shows da tenda, ou somente da Ã¡rea externa.
A divisÃ£o Ã© mais frequente em shows individuais, que contam com espaÃ§os menores ou fazem uma separaÃ§Ã£o melhor dos lugares. Essa decisÃ£o ameniza o problema da distÃ¢ncia, em boa parte desses casos.
O pÃºblico se revoltou porque mais da metade da pista premium estava vazia atÃ© Ã s 18h30, apenas duas horas antes da entrada de Lana Del Rey. Pessoas espremidas na grade da pista comum diziam que as grades foram colocadas exageradamente distantes do palco, entoavam palavrÃµes e apontavam o dedo do meio para cima. Por volta das 19h, a pista premium comeÃ§ou a encher.
PÃºblico durante o primeiro dia do Mita Festival, no Vale do AnhagabaÃº - Adriano Vizoni/Folhapress
Procurado, o Mita diz que nÃ£o divulga o tamanho dedicado Ã  pista premium. A Ã¡rea total Ã© de 58 mil m 2.
A ediÃ§Ã£o paulistana do evento comeÃ§ou morna. Os destaques da programaÃ§Ã£o deste sÃ¡bado foram os brasileiros Duda Beat e Djonga, figurinhas carimbadas em festivais do paÃ­s. Se apresentaram ainda a banda canadense BadBadNotGood e o DJ Flume, da AustrÃ¡lia. SÃ³ parte do pÃºblico se empolgou â€”a maioria estava ali querendo sÃ³ ver Lana Del Rey mesmo.
As pessoas tambÃ©m reclamavam do preÃ§o da comida. Um hambÃºrguer com carne e queijo cheddar custa R$ 32, enquanto uma pizza individual sai a R$ 30. Vegetarianos precisavam desembolsar R$ 42 para uma versÃ£o sem carne do lanche choripÃ¡n.
A garrafa de Ã¡gua com 500 ml sai a R$ 10. Uma lata de 269 ml de Mikeâ€™s, mistura de suco de limÃ£o e vodca, Ã© vendida a R$ 20. O copo de chope, da Heineken, com 400 ml, custa R$ 18.
Os valores seguem o padrÃ£o dos Ãºltimos festivais. No C6 Fest, hÃ¡ duas semanas, foram cobrados preÃ§os parecidos pelos produtos.
O line-up de domingo deve empolgar mais com a presenÃ§a da banda alternativa Haim, que cantou Xuxa no Mita do Rio de Janeiro na semana passada. HaverÃ¡ tambÃ©m a estreia da americana Sabrina Carpenter no Brasil e o show nostÃ¡lgico do NX Zero, que faz turnÃª depois de um hiato de seis anos.

title: Lana Del Rey Asked the Audience to Help Find Her Vape: Watch
content:
There was no snow on the beach when Lana Del Rey played Brazil. There was, however, a problem with a missing vape.
Lanaâ€™s drama was shared with the audience at the MITA Festival, Saturday (May 27) in Rio De Janeiro, her first live performance in more than three years.
As the alternative pop artist and her band kicked into the song â€œNorman Fâ€”ing Rockwell,â€ she went off-piste with the audible comment: â€œAnd also if you see my vape on stage, can you find my vape on stage?â€
Explore Explore Lana Del Rey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
In a video capturing the moment, Del Rey can be heard chatting with someone up front.
â€œYou did? Where, though? Oh, all the way in the pit?â€
She wasnâ€™t going there. â€œFâ€” it,â€ she said, accepting defeat.
Del Rey has a habit of losing her vaping device. According to Page Six, she lost her little nicotine buddy during a Portland concert in 2019. In a scene not dissimilar to what played out in Rio, Del Rey paused proceedings to start the search. Cue frustrated swearing â€” â€œWhereâ€™s my fâ€”ing vape?â€ â€” which culminated in Del Rey giving up and moving along with her set.
Lana Del Rey loses her vape on stage ğŸ’” pic.twitter.com/k3MMmX9Ugv â€” LDR Crave (@LDRCRAVE) May 28, 2023
Forgetfulness aside, Del Rey has a lot to be happy about. Her belated release from 2012, â€œSay Yes To Heaven,â€ debuted in the U.K. top 10, and a new edit of â€œSnow On The Beach,â€ her collaboration with Taylor Swift, could propel the track into the top 10 when the Official U.K. Singles Chart is published Friday.
Billboardâ€™s 2023 Women In Music Visionary dropped a ninth studio album in March, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, peaking at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 chart, and No. 1 in the U.K. and Australia.
During her set in Brazil, Del Rey delivered the live debut of numerous songs from her latest LP, including set opener â€œA&W,â€ â€œCandy Necklace,â€ â€œThe Grantsâ€ and the title track. Check out some of her performances from the fest here.
The MITA Festival reportedly marked Del Reyâ€™s first full concert since November 2019. Since then, sheâ€™s appeared on such TV programs as The Late Show With Stephen Colbert and The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, and made an onstage appearance with Bleachers at High Water Festival in 2023.

title: Lana Del Rey Delivers Live Debut of â€˜Ocean Blvdâ€™ Songs in Brazil
content:
Lana Del Rey returned to the live stage for the first time in more than three years at the MITA Festival 2023 in Rio De Janeiro.
During her headlining set on Saturday (May 27), the alternative-pop princess delivered the live debut of numerous songs from her latest album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, including set opener â€œA&W,â€ â€œCandy Necklace,â€ â€œThe Grantsâ€ and the title track. Check out some of her performances from the fest here.
Ocean Blvd, Del Reyâ€™s ninth album, debuted at No. 3 on the Billboard 200 albums chart in March 2023. The 16-song set includes guest appearances by Jon Batiste, Bleachers, Father John Misty, Judah Smith, Tommy Genesis, and SYML.
The Brazilian music fest also found the songstress giving first-time performances of â€œArcadiaâ€ (from 2021â€™s Blue Banisters) and â€œFlipsideâ€ (from 2014â€™s Ultraviolence), according to Rolling Stone.
The MITA Festival reportedly marked Del Reyâ€™s first full concert since November 2019. Since then, sheâ€™s appeared on such TV programs as The Late Show With Stephen Colbert and The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, and made an onstage appearance with Bleachers at High Water Festival in 2023.
Del Rey received the Visionary Award at the 2023 Billboard Women in Music. Speaking at the annual ceremony earlier in early March, the singer admitted to being happy with how itâ€™s all going.
â€œI donâ€™t exactly have a long-term vision at all, but if you were curious, I am very, very happy,â€ Del Rey said during her speech. â€œWhen I released my first album 14 years ago, the waters were not quite as warm. Iâ€™m really happy for everyone who feels like itâ€™s a wonderful time in the culture to be themselves and express themselves. It didnâ€™t feel that way in 2008.â€

title: Lana Del Rey UNRECOGNISABLE with platinum blonde hair as she returns to the stage
content:
Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Want all the latest Showbiz news direct to your inbox? Share your email for news, gossip and more
American singer-songwriter Lana Del Rey looks totally unrecognisable after undergoing a faux hair transformation.
The alternative-pop singer, 37, looked worlds away from the brunette beauty her fans know and love when she stepped out on-stage donning a platinum blonde wig.
Performing solo for the first time in three years, Lana looked sensational while crooning her hits at the Mita Festival in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil this weekend.
Looking sultry and akin to Marilyn Monroe, Lana could be seen sporting a voluminous platinum blonde wig that concealed her natural brunette locks.
Sizzling up a storm while on-stage, Lana wore a black button-up blouse, a black midi-length skirt and some heels with what looked like feather embellishments on the front strap.
(Image: AFP via Getty Images)
The Summertime Sadness singer completed her classic look, which was incredibly reminiscent of old Hollywood glamour, with some gold earrings and bracelets.
She sported a soft makeup look which comprised of a smokey-eye look on her lids and a pale pink hue on her lips.
Usually Lana sports her natural hair colour of brunette, which she tends to wear down and in a straight or loosely curled style - which is why this new look is a huge change for the star.
(Image: Getty Images) (Image: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)
Lana's first solo performance has happened just weeks after her return to the stage last month, which saw her make her comeback at Charleston's High Water Fest with a friendly face by her side.
Taking to the stage and leaving fans in awe, Lana performed alongside pal and collaborator Jack Antonoff and his band the Bleachers.
Lana's performance at Mita comes just mere days after Taylor Swift dropped a new version of their hit Snow On The Beach.
(Image: AFP via Getty Images)
It was announced last autumn that Lana would feature on Taylor's album Midnights, but fans seemed a little disappointed when the Born To Die singer could only be heard faintly throughout the track.
But just last week, Taylor acknowledged what fans were saying and released a new version of the hit with "more Lana Del Rey" - with the updated version of Snow On The Beach featuring Lana sing an entire verse.
Lana shot to fame in the early 2010s, with the singer soon becoming a globally known and loved musician.
Her debut major label album Born to Die was released in 2012, which contains some of Lana's biggest and greatest hits such as: Summertime Sadness, Born To Die, Video Games, National Anthem and Blue Jeans.
Fans in England will get to see Lana take to the stage this summer, which comes as she gears up perform at Glastonbury Festival, which takes place from June 21 until June 25.
