title: SZA, Lana Del Rey, Miley Cyrus could come out on top
content:
SZA leads the pack with nine nominations at the 2024 Grammy Awards, which certainly speaks to all that this amazing R&B vocalist has accomplished over the last year or so.
And she certainly could end up winning enough awards to fill a cabinet or two during â€œMusicâ€™s Biggest Night.â€
Or, as shocking as it might sound, she could come up empty-handed when the trophies are handed out.
Yes, the level of competition at this yearâ€™s Grammy Awards is remarkably impressive. Thatâ€™s especially true in the three of the eveningâ€™s biggest categories â€” album, song and record of the year â€” where SZA will go up against such heavyweights as Lana Del Rey, Olivia Rodrigo, Jon Batiste, Billie Eilish, Miley Cyrus and, as you can probably guess, Taylor Swift.
So many great artists. So many compelling storylines.
And we wonâ€™t know how it all turns out until the last award is handed out on Feb. 4 at Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles.
Yet, that wonâ€™t stop us from trying to predict who will win the biggie â€œgeneral fieldâ€ categories, where artists from all different genres compete for top honors. Besides the three mentioned above, there is also the hotly contested best new artist category, where hip-hop star Ice Spice will square off against country/rap talent Jelly Roll, R&B/pop singer Victoria MonÃ©t and others.
Here are predictions for who will take home Grammy gold. Beyond the awards, the show will also feature performances by Dua Lipa, Eilish, Rodrigo, Luke Combs, Travis Scott and others. Follow all the action beginning at 5 p.m. on CBS and Paramount +.
Album of the Year
The nominees: â€œWorld Music Radio,â€ Jon Batiste; â€œthe record,â€ boygenius; â€œEndless Summer Vacation,â€ Miley Cyrus; â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd,â€ Lana Del Rey; â€œThe Age of Pleasure,â€ Janelle MonÃ¡e; â€œGUTS,â€ Olivia Rodrigo; â€œMidnights,â€ Taylor Swift; â€œSOS,â€ SZA
The skinny: The music industry has finally realized something that fans have long known â€” Lana Del Rey is one of popular musicâ€™s greatest artists of the last 10-plus years. So, a victory for â€œTunnelâ€ would serve as further confirmation of that status.
Thereâ€™s also a case to be made for Olivia Rodrigo, who followed up the blockbuster debut â€œSourâ€ â€” and the resulting best new artist triumph at the 2022 Grammys â€” by releasing a sophomore effort that some consider to be the best album of 2023.
Of course, the indie supergroup boygenius â€” featuring Julien Baker, Phoebe Bridgers and Lucy Dacus â€” is a massive critical favorite and canâ€™t be counted out. Same for Jon Batiste, who just won this category in â€™22 with â€œWe Are.â€
Yet, none of those artists seem to have much a chance against Taylor Swift, who set record after record with her 10th studio album. Crowning Swift in this category â€” for a landmark fourth time â€” would serve as a fitting punctuation mark on what was most certainly the Year of Taylor.
So, why does it seem like the wrong choice?
The answer is â€œSOS.â€
â€œMidnightsâ€ is a terrific effort, yet it doesnâ€™t really stand out from Swiftâ€™s many other equally enjoyable albums. Itâ€™s just a piece of the puzzle in what is arguably the single best discography that any artist has put together in the 21st Century.
On the other hand, â€œSOSâ€ feels like nothing short of a stone-cold classic, which people will long be referencing among the most soulful platters of the 2020s. It also was the album that really took its author to a whole new level of superstardom.
Itâ€™s wild to think that a win for such a wonderfully artistic and commercially successful album could be seen as an upset. Yet, in world that seems to view pop music as Taylor Swift and everyone else, thatâ€™s exactly what a â€œSOSâ€ victory would be.
Weâ€™d be fine with â€œMidnightsâ€ winning. But thatâ€™s not where our vote would go. So, weâ€™re calling the upset.
The winner: â€œSOSâ€
Record of the Year
The nominees: â€œWorship,â€ Jon Batiste; â€œNot Strong Enough,â€ boygenius; â€œFlowers,â€ Miley Cyrus; â€œWhat Was I Made For?â€ Billie Eilish; â€œOn My Mama,â€ Victoria MonÃ©t; â€œVampire,â€ Olivia Rodrigo; â€œAnti-Hero,â€ Taylor Swift; â€œKill Bill, SZA
The skinny: Award shows love Billie Eilish, who has already won seven Grammys (as well as an Oscar) in her still-quite-young career. Yet, she seemingly has a much better chance of winning her second Academy Award in March with her â€œBarbieâ€ number than she does record of the year on Sunday.
And we donâ€™t feel like â€œAnti-Heroâ€ is anywhere close to first-tier Swift material, a statement that we realize probably will result in 418,467 angry emails from Swifties.
The category probably breaks down as a three-way race between â€œKill Bill,â€ â€œVampiresâ€ and â€œFlowers,â€ the last of which would seemingly be the favorite.
Although we prefer the SZA and Rodrigo offerings, â€œFlowersâ€ is indeed exactly the type of empowering self-love anthem that Grammy voters tend to embrace.
The winner: â€œFlowersâ€
Song of the Year
(Award given to songwriters)
The nominees: â€œA&W,â€ Jack Antonoff, Lana Del Rey and Sam Dew, songwriters (Lana Del Rey); â€œAnti-Hero,â€ Jack Antonoff and Taylor Swift, songwriters (Taylor Swift); â€œButterfly,â€ Jon Batiste and Dan Wilson, songwriters (Jon Batiste); â€œDance the Night,â€ Ailin, Dua Lipa, Mark Ronson and Andrew Wyatt, songwriters (Dua Lipa); â€œFlowers,â€ Miley Cyrus, Gregory Aldae Hein and Michael Pollack, songwriters (Miley Cyrus); â€œKill Bill,â€ Rob Bisel, Carter Lang and SolÃ¡na Rowe, songwriters (SZA); â€œVampire,â€ Daniel Nigro and Olivia Rodrigo, songwriters (Olivia Rodrigo); â€œWhat Was I Made For?â€ Billie Eilish Oâ€™Connell and Finneas Oâ€™Connell, songwriters (Billie Eilish)
The skinny: â€œDance the Nightâ€ and â€œWhat Was I Made For?â€ both hail from the same film so itâ€™s easy to see those two numbers splitting the â€œBarbieâ€ vote.â€ â€œFlowersâ€ makes sense, but letâ€™s assume that it wonâ€™t win both song and record of the year trophies. After all, there are just too many great artists deserving to be recognized on Grammy night, so we donâ€™t see any one act dominating these biggie awards.
Along that same line of reasoning, weâ€™d love to see â€œKill Billâ€ get the â€œw,â€ but weâ€™ve already placed our bet on â€œSOSâ€ triumphing in the album category. â€œVampireâ€ could sneak out a victory here, though, for sure.
Yet, the safe money is that Jack Antonoff will end up with this award in his hand â€“ for one of the two nominees that he co-wrote.
You already know our feeling on the Antonoff-Swift offering. Well, we feel the exact opposite way about the brilliant avant-garde work that he did with Del Rey.
But, come on. Is there any conceivable way that the mighty Swift ends up losing in all three of these general field categories?
Well, let us finish off our root beer floats and think about it for a minute.
The winner: â€œA&Wâ€
Best New Artist
The nominees: Gracie Abrams, Fred Again, Ice Spice, Jelly Roll, Coco Jones, Noah Kahan, Victoria MonÃ©t, The War and Treaty
The skinny: There are some fascinating choices here. Start with the country-folk-soul duo The War and Treaty, whose major label debut, â€œLoverâ€™s Game,â€ is nothing short of astounding. Then thereâ€™s Jelly Roll, the Tennessee country/rap/rock artist who had millions singing along to â€œSon of a Sinner.â€
And you canâ€™t count out Noah Kahan, whose legions of fans donâ€™t seem to realize that heâ€™s really not all that good, or the talented Gracie â€œdaughter of J.J.â€ Abrams.
The award could well go go to Victoria MonÃ©t, whose seven overall nods ties her with Phoebe Bridgers for second-most nominations this year. (In case you missed it up top, SZA leads all comers with nine nominations).
Still, the favorite in the race appears to be Ice Spice, who seemed to go from relative unknown to household name in the blink of the eye as she collaborated with Taylor Swift and Nicki Minaj, charted several top 10 songs and had us all singing along to â€œBarbieâ€™s World.â€
Itâ€™s hard to call for an upset here â€” but â€œLoverâ€™s Gameâ€ is such a great album and its authors could be making terrific music for decades to come. So, well, letâ€™s go for it and hope voters agree.
The winner: The War and Treaty
Other races
Best Pop Vocal Album â€” Swifties need not worry that their favorite music star will go home empty-handed, since â€œMidnightsâ€ will likely triumph over Miley Cyrusâ€™ â€œEndless Summer Vacationâ€ and Olivia Rodrigoâ€™s â€œGutsâ€ as the top pop platter.
Best MÃºsica Mexicana Album â€” Peso Pluma will win for the amazing â€œGÃ©nesis,â€ yet that wonâ€™t quite make up for the ridiculous snub of being left out of the best new artist category.
Best Rock Album â€” Weâ€™re partial to Metallicaâ€™s excellent â€œ72 Seasons,â€ but our hunch is that the gold will go to the Foo Fighters, who dealt with the loss of Taylor Hawkins and still delivered a fine â€œBut Here We Are.â€
Best Contemporary Christian Music Performance/Song â€” So many great offerings here, including Cody Carnesâ€™ â€œFirm Foundation (He Wonâ€™t)â€ and the For King & Country/Jordin Sparks collaboration â€œLove Me Like I Am,â€ yet Lauren Daigleâ€™s â€œThank God I Doâ€ is the clear favorite.
Best R&B Performance â€” Sorry Robert Glasper, Coco Jones, Victoria MonÃ©t and Chris Brown, but nobody is beating SZAâ€™s â€œKill Billâ€ here.
Best Rap Album â€” Weâ€™re calling for Killer Mike to top the bigger names (like Drake, Travis Scott and Nas) and walk away with the trophy for â€œMichael.â€
Best Musical Theater Album â€” â€œSweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street,â€ with Annaleigh Ashford and Josh Groban as the principal vocalists, will surely win. Yet, we much prefer â€œKimberly Akimbo.â€
Best Country Solo Performance â€” Anything other than Luke Combsâ€™ cover of â€œFast Carâ€ is fine with us.
THE 66TH GRAMMY AWARDS
When: 5 p.m. Sunday, Feb. 4
Where: CBS (KPIX-TV Channel 5); Paramount+; live.grammy.com
Host: Trevor Noah

title: Lana Del Rey Net Worth 2024: Updated Wealth Of The Singer
content:
Lana Del Rey, born Elizabeth Woolridge Grant, has become a household name in the music industry. Her unique blend of cinematic pop, melancholy lyrics, and vintage aesthetics has captivated audiences worldwide. But what does this success translate to in terms of net worth? As of 2024, the acclaimed singer is estimated to be worth a staggering $30 million, according to Celebrity Net Worth.
Del Rey's journey to stardom was not an overnight success. Born in New York City in 1985, she began her music career in 2005, performing in clubs under various names. Her first album, released under the name Lizzy Grant in 2010, did not gain much traction. However, her breakthrough came in 2011 with the viral success of her single "Video Games." The haunting melody and nostalgic visuals resonated with listeners, propelling Del Rey into the spotlight.
The Success Of Born to Die
LAS VEGAS, NV - FEBRUARY 16: Singer/songwriter Lana Del Rey performs during a stop of her LA to the Moon Tour in support of the album "Lust for Life" at the Mandalay Bay Events Center on February 16, 2018 in Las Vegas, Nevada. (Photo by Ethan Miller/Getty Images)
In 2012, Del Rey released her second studio album, Born to Die. The album was a commercial success, peaking at No. 2 on the Billboard 200 and selling over seven million copies worldwide. The success of Born to Die significantly contributed to Del Rey's net worth, establishing her as a force to be reckoned with in the music industry. Moreover, Del Rey's success did not stop with Born to Die. She has since released several critically acclaimed albums, including Ultraviolence (2014), Honeymoon (2015), Lust for Life (2017), Norman F*cking Rockwell! (2019), and Chemtrails over the Country Club (2021). Each album has added to her wealth with robust sales and successful world tours.
Endorsements & Other Ventures
FRANKFURT AM MAIN, GERMANY - NOVEMBER 11: Singers Taylor Swift (L) and Lana Del Rey attend the MTV EMA's 2012 at Festhalle Frankfurt on November 11, 2012 in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. (Photo by Kevin Mazur/WireImage)
In addition to her music, Del Rey has also increased her net worth through various endorsements and business ventures. She has collaborated with several high-profile brands, including H&M and Jaguar. Furthermore, her music has been featured in numerous films and television shows, providing additional income. Del Rey's investments in real estate have also contributed to her net worth. She reportedly owns several properties in Los Angeles, including a $3 million home in the Hollywood Hills and a $5.87 million Malibu beachfront property. These investments provide a luxurious lifestyle and are a smart financial move, adding to her overall wealth.
The Impact Of Lana Del Rey's Net Worth
LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA - DECEMBER 04: Lana Del Rey accepts the Decade Award onstage during attends Variety's Hitmakers Brunch presented by Peacock | Girls5eva on December 04, 2021 in Downtown Los Angeles. (Photo by Kevin Winter/Getty Images for Variety)
Lana Del Rey's net worth of $30 million is a testament to her talent. It reflects her success as a singer and her savvy as a businesswoman. Despite her wealth, Del Rey remains dedicated to her craft, consistently producing music that resonates with her fans. Her net worth reflects her successful career in the music industry. Her unique sound, combined with her business ventures and investments, has led to an impressive net worth of $30 million. As she continues to produce music and explore new opportunities, there's no doubt that Del Rey's net worth will continue to grow.

title: 'Eyeliner' para ponerse los ojos como Priscilla o quemadores de incienso de â€˜Midsommarâ€™: los fetiches son el nuevo â€˜merchandisingâ€™
content:
2023 serÃ¡ recordado como el aÃ±o en el que Saint Laurent se hizo con unas camisetas de Nirvana de los 90, y las vendiÃ³ bajo su marca a miles de euros. La mÃ¡s cara, con un precio de unos 3.500 euros, fue una con el diseÃ±o de su Ã¡lbum, de 1992 Incesticide. Buenas noticias para todos aquellos que guardaron sus camis aÃ±ejas de Iron Maiden, pero malas noticias para el merchandising del rock. En ese momento se llegÃ³ al pico de esa obsesiÃ³n por las camisetas de bandas.
Pero la fiebre del merchandising no se ha destruido, solo se ha transformado, haciÃ©ndose mÃ¡s sofisticado y yendo mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de los recuerdos de gira. RosalÃ­a pone su nombre a cartas de tarot, Phoebe Bridgers vende joggers con estampado de esqueleto, Devendra Banhart hace grabados, y Lana del Rey lanza toallas, mecheros y collares de perlas. PodrÃ­a decirse que el merch, o ese cosismo que los artistas usan para promocionar su trabajo, es el nuevo streetwear, con ediciones limitadas que se esfuman en instantes y direcciÃ³n creativa propia de una firma. Una sudadera de BeyoncÃ©, Lorde o Tyler, the Creator puede despertar el mismo furor que unas adidas Samba de Wales Bonner, y ademÃ¡s no hay bots comprando zapatillas para acto seguido revenderlas.
Toalla de Lana del Rey.
Sin embargo, es la industria del cine la que estÃ¡ impulsando esta corriente, con el merch mÃ¡s deseable del momento. Los productos promocionales de pelÃ­culas se han convertido en la manera mÃ¡s efectiva de comunicar que te enteras de quÃ© va el tema. Estas prendas tienen un diseÃ±o atractivo y envÃ­an mensajes sobre preferencias estÃ©ticas y culturales, pero a diferencia de las camisetas rockeras, nadie pedirÃ¡ a quien las lleva que nombre tres canciones de la banda para demostrar que la sigue de verdad.
La tendencia estÃ¡ liderada por A24, la distribuidora estadounidense de pelÃ­culas y series como Midsommar, Todo a la vez en todas partes o Euphoria. Esta productora independiente actÃºa como una firma de moda, con prendas exclusivas, colecciones cÃ¡psula, sorprendentes colaboradores y un servicio de miembros que da acceso prioritario a sus entregas. Aparte de la sudadera de Priscilla con su propia lista de espera, en la web de A24 se venden quemadores de incienso de Midsommar, gorras con el logo de la productora, y fanzines de artistas. Entre otros muchos productos sin stock, estÃ¡ el kit de eyeliner y mÃ¡scara de pestaÃ±as para recrear el maquillaje de ojos de Priscilla en colaboraciÃ³n con la Half Magic, la marca de belleza creada por la maquilladora de Euphoria Donni Davy. La directora creativa de A24, Zoe Beyer, ha sabido cÃ³mo enfrentarse al fin de la cultura pop hegemÃ³nica, y atraer a una audiencia con criterio muy personal, que acude a menudo a la web para â€˜cazarâ€™ las Ãºltimas piezas o improbables colaboraciones.
La sudadera de Priscilla tiene lista de espera.
El director de cine Chino Moya considera que los artÃ­culos promocionales cinematogrÃ¡ficos principalmente han cambiado de pÃºblico. â€œCrecÃ­ en los ochenta, la Ã©poca dorada del merch y por esta razÃ³n me gusta. En aquella Ã©poca se comercializaban productos de las pelÃ­culas mÃ¡s taquilleras, enfocados a un pÃºblico infantil y juvenilâ€, razona. â€œEn cambio, hoy se dirige a adultos que buscan nostalgia y un elemento de culto. Sobre todo se hacen cosas interesantes en gÃ©neros como la ciencia ficciÃ³n o el terror. Mandy, de Panos Cosmatos es un buen ejemplo.â€
Para el estreno de su largo Undergods, Moya vendiÃ³ posters creados por diferentes artistas, ademÃ¡s de camisetas, lobby cards y vinilos de la banda sonora de la pelÃ­cula. â€œY hubiera producido mÃ¡s cosasâ€, explica el realizador. â€œPero el merchandising supone una inversiÃ³n. No se hace dinero con Ã©l, incluso a veces ni siquiera se recupera el gasto, pero sÃ­ ayuda a la identidad de la pelÃ­cula y contribuye a su visibilidad.â€
En el nÃºcleo de este fenÃ³meno estÃ¡ la evoluciÃ³n del fenÃ³meno fan, que ha pasado de ser un elemento tangencial de carÃ¡cter casi underground para hoy ser incluido dentro de las estrategias de marketing. Su rol hoy tiene menos que ver con las seguidoras de los New Kids On The Block llorando en el aeropuerto, y mÃ¡s con el de accionistas que invierten en piezas de coleccionista y contribuyen a la propagaciÃ³n del trabajo creativo. En la industria del cine, que todavÃ­a depende de festivales y convenciones, los fans tienen un nuevo poder, pero han entrado de lleno en la rueda de la comodificaciÃ³n. En los 90 los fanÃ¡ticos de Pulp Fiction tenÃ­an que fabricarse ellos mismos el merchandising imprimiendo carÃ¡tulas en camisetas de Fruit Of The Loom. Hoy hay prendas dedicadas al mÃ­tico tÃ­tulo de Tarantino hasta en las marcas de moda pronta.
â€œGran parte de la cultura popular sucede online, y el concepto de fan se ha desmaterializado y virtualizado. Este tipo de merchandising ofrece a los seguidores souvenirs fÃ­sicos de la cultura que adoran, talismanes que pueden tocar y llevarâ€, reflexiona Jonah Weiner, coautor y cofundador de la newsletter dedicada al anÃ¡lisis del estilo no obvio BlackBird Spyplane. â€œPersonalmente considero que el merch vintage, que encuentras en eBay, tiene mÃ¡s encanto, pero cuando se estrenÃ³ la pelÃ­cula Uncut Gems en 2019, Online Ceramics sacÃ³ una camiseta y una sudadera conmemorativas. Me encantÃ³ la pelÃ­cula y el diseÃ±o estaba bien, asÃ­ que comprÃ© una. No la llevo desde hace tiempo, pero es un recuerdo que me gusta tener.â€
La pregunta del millÃ³n es si nos estamos pasando de rosca y llegando a una banalizaciÃ³n de la cultura, justo lo opuesto de lo que pretendÃ­an las intenciones originales. El hype ha propulsado la notoriedad de las prendas promocionales en otras industrias como la literatura. La pÃ¡gina Minor Canon vende una colecciÃ³n de gorras y camisetas titulada Autores muertos con referencias a figuras literarias como Roberto BolaÃ±o, Clarice Lispector o Lucia Berlin. Weiner cree que es un aviso similar al de las camisetas de Nirvana de lujo. â€œEstas gorras de Minor Canon me parecieron un tipo de momento bisagra, donde alcanzamos la saturaciÃ³n y comenzamos a entender que no necesitamos marcadores fÃ­sicos para conmemorar y publicitar cada rincÃ³n de la cultura que nos gustaâ€, argumenta â€œTal vez haya un punto en el que corremos el riesgo de perjudicar a la cultura que amamos, al convertirla en simple indumentaria.â€
La gorra de Italo Calvino de Minor Canon
La novela sobre videojuegos MaÃ±ana, y maÃ±ana y maÃ±ana, de Gabrielle Zevin, dice algo asÃ­ como que llega un momento en el que el gusto supera a las capacidades creativas, y la Ãºnica manera de superarlo es seguir haciendo cosas con pasiÃ³n. Enlazando con el esnobismo que pueda despertar el merchandising de los productos artÃ­sticos, serÃ­a muy descorazonador que viÃ©semos al arte como un vehÃ­culo del gusto. Llevemos la prenda teÃ±ida a mano por el propio artista, compremos el maravilloso pÃ³ster exclusivo, pero no nos olvidemos de temblar a oscuras viendo la pelÃ­cula, no dejemos de emocionarnos en el concierto.

title: Rising Irish star CMAT nominated for a Brit Award
content:
Dublin singer CMAT will battle it out with Taylor Swift, Miley Cyrus, Lana Del Rey, and Olivia Rodrigo at the Brit Awards this March after she was nominated for an international artist of the year award.
CMAT, who released her acclaimed second album, Crazymad, for Me, last year will also face tough competition in the category from Kylie Minogue, US singers SZA and Caroline Polachek, and Nigerian singers Asake and Burna Boy.
i, like my contemporary Kylie Minogue, am nominated for the @BRITs for international artist of the year . if you dont know who i am thats ok i dont either!!! welcome !!! #BRITs pic.twitter.com/dAge1SJHWd â€” cmat (@cmatbaby) January 24, 2024
The nominations for this year's Brits were announced on Wednesday afternoon and saw British singer-songwriter Raye making Brit Award history by securing seven nominations - the most for an artist in one year.
The 26-year-old Londoner earned nods for the coveted album of the year prize for her studio debut, My 21st Century Blues, and two spots in the song of the year category for her viral hit, Escapism, featuring US rapper 070 Shake; and dance track, Prada, with Casso and D-Block Europe.
The genre-spanning musician is also nominated for artist of the year and best new artist as well as best pop act and best R&B act.
It comes after the singer, real name Rachel Keen, delivered a show-stopping performance on the main stage at Glastonbury last summer and received a Mercury Prize nod for her album.
3 Brit noms!!!! and i'm so excited to be back on that stage! See you at the @brits 2nd March 2024!!! â¤ï¸ğŸ pic.twitter.com/6HE11d5ZyU â€” DUA LIPA (@DUALIPA) January 24, 2024
Reacting to the news, the Brit School alumnus said: "Itâ€™s really too much. The only way I can describe it is as a miracle."
She added: "A year and a half ago, as far as the industry was concerned, I was down and out.
"Never in my wildest dreams would I think trying again would mean seven Brit nominations."
The record of six nominations in any single year was previously held by animated band Gorillaz, singer Craig David and Robbie Williams.
After last yearâ€™s award ceremony sparked criticism over a lack of female representation in the gender-neutral British artist category, the award show has increased the number of nominees for the prize this year from five to 10.
Following the move, female artists tip the scale for 2024 with six being recognised including pop stars Dua Lipa and Jessie Ware; newcomer Olivia Dean; Mercury Prize winners Little Simz and Arlo Parks as well as Raye.
They will go up against rappers J Hus, Central Cee and Dave and dance music DJ Fred Again.. for the prize.
Little Simz and J Hus have also been nominated for best album for their records No Thank You, and Beautiful And Brutal Yard respectively, alongside veteran rock band Blurâ€™s comeback album, The Ballad Of Darren, and hip-hop outfit Young Fathersâ€™ Heavy Heavy.
The Rolling Stonesâ€™ album Hackney Diamonds, their first record of original material in 18 years, was notably missing from the list as well as Lewis Capaldiâ€™s second studio album, Broken By Desire To Be Heavenly Sent.
However, the Stones did receive a nod for the alternative rock act gong alongside Blur, Bring Me The Horizon, Young Fathers and Yussef Dayes.
Blur and Young Fathers picked up a third nomination each in the group of the year category and are set to go head-to-head with electronic outfits Chase & Status and Jungle as well as drill artists Headie One & K-Trap.
The British song of the year category also features a star-studded line-up with viral hit, Sprinter, by Central Cee and Dave; Ed Sheeranâ€™s Eyes Closed and Dua Lipaâ€™s Dance The Night from the Barbie soundtrack among the nominees.
The international group of the year category also features a strong line-up with Blink-182, Boygenius, Foo Fighters, Paramore and British-American trio Gabriels up for the prize.
This year, five genre categories will be decided by the public: alternative rock act; hip hop/rap/grime act; dance act; pop act; and R&B act.
It was also confirmed that pop star Dua Lipa will perform during the award show.
Indie pop/rock group The Last Dinner Party were previously announced as the winners of the 2024 Rising Star award.
The gong seeks to identify future stars of the UK music scene, and the winner is selected by a panel of music editors and critics from across the industry.
Across the 13 categories, 77 artists or acts were nominated â€“ with 38 being female artists or all-women groups.
The nominations were announced by radio presenter Yinka Bokinni during a livestream on Wednesday.
The Brit Awards 2024 will take place on 2 March at the O2 Arena in London and will be broadcast live on ITV1 and ITVX.
Source: Press Association
More music news, reviews and interviews here

title: Lana Del Rey & SKIMS Partner for Valentineâ€™s Day Collection: Shop Here
content:
All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes.
SKIMS has asked Lana Del Rey to be its Valentine this year, as the face of the lingerie brandâ€™s popular Valentineâ€™s Day Shop. The campaign is now available to shop on Skims.com and features a collection thatâ€™ll not only be love at first sight, but will make the perfect Valentineâ€™s Day gift for your partner.
Within the collection are 29 limited-edition intimates, sleep sets, loungewear and more featuring styles that aim to fit every body and aesthetic. You can even shop gifts for her and him to help inspire you for the upcoming holiday and beyond.
The â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ singer poses in key pieces from the collection for the campaign, including the bestselling Fits Everybody bodysuit, the heart-print Sleep set and the new Woven Shine dress, which the Grammy-winning singer was excited to be a part of.
â€œIâ€™ve been a big fan of SKIMS since the beginning, so being featured in their Valentineâ€™s campaign is so exciting,â€ said the â€œDoin Timeâ€ singer in a press release. â€œTheir collection is so pretty and dreamy, which made collaborating with [photographer] Nadia Lee Cohen on the creative so fun. I hope you love it as much as I do.â€
Lana Del Rey Skims
The new V Day-themed collectionâ€™s price range from $16 to $124, and are also available from select retailers, including Nordstrom, SSENSE, Net-a-Porter and more. Last yearâ€™s Valentineâ€™s Day Shop quickly sold out after its release, which means you wonâ€™t want to hesitate before adding these Del Rey-approved pieces to your cart.
Keep reading to shop the â€œCinnamon Girlsâ€ singerâ€™s picks.
Lana Del Rey & SKIMS Valentineâ€™s Day Shop
Skims Woven Shine Lace Long Dress Buy Now on skims $108 Exude sultry elegance beyond V-Day in this maxi slip dress featuring a lace hem and silky material that you can wear for date night or to bed â€” itâ€™s that comfortable.
SKIMS Stretch Satin Lace Low Rise Slip Skirt Buy Now on skims $54 This miniskirt boasts a sexy pink lace design on the hem and slit. It comes with a low-rise waist, and you can pair it with the matching corset (see below) or your favorite bra.
SKIMS Stretch Satin Lace Cropped Corset Buy Now on skims $78 Complete the look with this gorgeous cropped corset that you can wear out with friends for a Galentineâ€™s Day night on the town, or layer it under a sheer slip.
Skims Velvet Lace Teddy Buy Now on skims $78 Go for a comfortable yet alluring vibe in this lace teddy that comes in three colors. The material is made with a soft velvet material so comfortable you may just find yourself wearing it to bed after dinner with your beloved.
Skims Fits Everybody Lace Cami Bodysuit Buy Now on skims $64 SKIMSâ€™ Lace Cami Bodysuit is the ultimate layering piece, as you can wear it with jeans, trousers, a skirt and more. The soft cotton material aims to be lightweight and breathable, while the lace hem adds a touch of elegance to your looks.
Skims Mini Heart Hair Clips Pack Buy Now on skims $24 Elevate your hairstyles with these cute hair clips shaped like hearts. Each pack comes with four clips in pink and red shades that you can mix and match.
Skims SKIMS Cotton Menâ€™s Classic T-Shirt Buy Now on skims $44 Bring a touch of bubblegum pink to your wardrobe with this soft cotton T-shirt from SKIMS. Itâ€™s designed with a crew neckline and 100% cotton material thatâ€™s breathable and lightweight to keep you cozy yet stylish whether youâ€™re going to the office or stopping at your go-to cafÃ©.
For more product recommendations, check out our roundups of the best corsets, sticky bras and pleated skirts.

title: Lana Del Rey surge de lingerie em campanha da marca de Kim Kardashian
content:
A cantora Lana Del Rey Ã© a nova estrela da marca de Kim Kardashian, a Skims. Em comemoraÃ§Ã£o ao Valentineâ€™s Day, celebrado em fevereiro nos Estados Unidos, a empresÃ¡ria convidou a artista para protagonizar a nova campanha.
Vem conferir!
A novidade foi compartilhada, em primeira mÃ£o, por Kim Kardashian no Instagram. Inspirada no glamour retrÃ´ da Era de Ouro de Hollywood, a coleÃ§Ã£o se assemelha a estÃ©ticas jÃ¡ trabalhadas por Lana Del Rey na prÃ³pria discografia.
Nas imagens, a cantora norte-americana aparece com peÃ§as que mesclam delicadeza e sensualidade, como camisolas, vestidos de renda e bodies. Ao todo, serÃ£o disponibilizadas 29 peÃ§as em ediÃ§Ã£o limitada, no e-commerce da Skims, a partir de 23 janeiro. Com cada vez mais forÃ§a no cenÃ¡rio de vestuÃ¡rio internacional, a marca de Kim Kardashian Ã© uma da especialistas em gerar engajamento nas redes sociais.
Lana Del Rey para Skims
A relaÃ§Ã£o da cantora com a etiqueta vem de longa data. â€œSou uma grande fÃ£ da Skims desde o inÃ­cio, entÃ£o aparecer na campanha do Dia dos Namorados Ã© muito importanteâ€, destacou Lana Del Rey em comunicado Ã  imprensa.
Criada em 2019, a Skims chegou ao mercado com o foco em peÃ§as de lingerie e para atividades fÃ­sicas. Ao longo dos anos, a marca jÃ¡ teve um time estrelado nas campanhas. Nomes como Nelly Furtado, Kim Cattrall, Hari Nef, Coco Jones e Lana Condor posaram, recentemente, para a empresa da socialite e empresÃ¡ria norte-americana.
No processo de se estabilizar como uma magnata da indÃºstria fashion, Kim Kardashian utiliza na Skims os ensinamentos que conquistou no show business. O convite a artistas, esportistas e celebridades, como Lana Del Rey, indica que ela sabe bem o que estÃ¡ fazendo, principalmente na era das redes sociais.

content:

A companhia SKIMS, co-fundada por Kim Kardashian e o empresÃ¡rio Jens Grede em 2019, foi selecionada pela revista TIME, nos Estados Unidos, como uma das empresas mais influentes de 2022. title: lana del rey
content:
Lana Del Rey is teasing a new song, â€œHenry, Come On.â€ The singer shared a brief snippet to her Instagram today featuring the caption â€Henry, come on,â€ also tagging the country producer and songwriter Luke Laird. Check it out below.
The audio, which played over a Polaroid of Lana, featured finger-picked guitar and opened with the lyrics: â€œI mean Henry, come on/ Do you think Iâ€™d really choose it/ All this off and on/ Henry, come on.â€ Pitchork has reached out to Del Reyâ€™s representatives for comment.
Del Rey shared her most recent album, the Grammy-nominated Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, in March 2023. Since then, sheâ€™s shared a cover of John Denverâ€™s â€œTake Me Home, Country Roadsâ€ and been confirmed as a 2024 Coachella headliner.

title: Lana Del Rey stars in SKIMS' new Valentines campaign
content: Del Rey also nods to the '60s in retro-look underwear from the collection. In one campaign shot the GRAMMY winner stares into camera from the inside of a giant crushed velvet jewellery box in a matching baby blue set, all doe eyes and flaxen, bow-adorned hair. In another she kneels in a black slip worn with knee-high boots and veil, a cupid's arrow through her heart. And in a third, she sits in a fluffy red blanket wearing the cult Fits Everybody body, with a pair of white cats cosying up with her. It's kitsch to the max and the images have viral written all over them.

title: Lana Del Rey Teases Unreleased Song â€˜Henry, Come Onâ€™: Listen Here
content:
From her brief stint as a Waffle House waitress in Alabama to her recent cover of â€œTake Me Home, Country Roads,â€ Lana Del Rey has been embracing a rootsier aesthetic â€“ and her latest song teaser is no exception.
On Wednesday (Jan. 17), the 38-year-old alt-pop star shared a snippet of an unreleased recording on Instagram, which she simply captioned, â€œHenry, come on.â€ â€œDo you think Iâ€™d really choose it?/ All this off and on, Henry come on,â€ she croons over folksy acoustic guitar, her sultry voice drenched in her trademark reverb.
â€œBaby come on, do you think Iâ€™d really lose it on ya?/ If you did nothing wrong, Henry come on,â€ she continues in the clip, whispering in some places. â€œLast call, hey ya, hang his hat up on a wall.â€
Del Rey provided no other details about the project, although she did pair the audio with a hazy black-and-white Polaroid of her wiping her eye with her thumb. â€œcountry era is coming,â€ one fan commented, while another person added, â€œAh, so is this what youâ€™ve been cooking up here down south? ğŸ˜ Sounds absolutely beautiful!â€
Indeed, the â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ singer has been spending a lot of time below the Mason Dixon Line in recent months. In addition to mysteriously serving customers at a Waffle House in Florence, Ala., she was also spotted getting her nails done at a seemingly random salon in Birmingham over the summer. And just days before she released her take on John Denverâ€™s â€œCountry Roads,â€ she stopped by Memphis, Tenn., to perform â€œUnchained Melodyâ€ in Elvisâ€™ honor on the live NBC special Christmas at Graceland.
Del Reyâ€™s potential song teaser comes less than a month ahead of the 2024 Grammys, at which sheâ€™s nominated for five awards, including album of the year for Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd and song of the year for â€œA&W.â€ She was also recently announced as one of three headliners at this yearâ€™s Coachella alongside Tyler, the Creator and Doja Cat, about which she wrote on Instagram: â€œItâ€™s a little bit crazy but weâ€™re going back to Coachella! I think you should come itâ€™ll be fun.â€
Listen to Del Reyâ€™s â€œHenry, Come Onâ€ clip below:

title: 5 takeaways from the lineup and one crazy prediction
content:
The lineup for the 2024 edition of the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival finally arrived Tuesday, delivering a trio â€“ or maybe a quartet? â€“ of headliners with deep Southern California ties one year after the festival featured artists from Puerto Rico and South Korea at the top of the bill.
Singer-songwriter Lana Del Rey headlines both Fridays of the festival held this year April 12-14 and April 19-21 at the Empire Polo Club in Indio. Originally from the East Coast, her music has long had a hazy Southern California vibe, and sheâ€™s been based here for years now.
Rapper-singers Tyler, the Creator, who headlines Saturdays, and Doja Cat, who tops the bill on Sundays, were born and raised in Los Angeles and its surrounding communities.
ALSO SEE: Coachella 2024 lineup: Lana Del Rey, Tyler, The Creator, Doja Cat â€” and No Doubt
And then thereâ€™s No Doubt, the much-loved Orange County band, which announced just before the lineup dropped that it would be reuniting to play for the first time in nearly a decade. When and where No Doubt plays isnâ€™t yet clear â€“ the lineup poster simply lists them in headliner-sized font at the bottom as â€œâ€¦ and No Doubt.â€
Thatâ€™s a spot where Coachella often lists a late-night performance that takes place after one of the official headliners is finished, so stay tuned for more on that.
Dozens of other artists fill out the lineup as usual. We quickly scanned the names for highlights and trends for 2024 and soon settled on these 5 themes for 2024.
Itâ€™s a little smaller
Among the many hot takes on social media after the lineup dropped was this: The lineup poster didnâ€™t look nearly as robust as it has in past years.
So we did what journalists try to avoid at all costs: Math.
In 2023, there were 166 acts on the Coachella poster. This year, the poster lists 147.
Which, assuming our math is correct, and there isnâ€™t a late rush of additions to the lineup, means Coachella has approximately 11 percent fewer artists performing this year compared to last year.
Maybe more acts get added â€“ Sunday looks particularly light â€“ but performers also drop off the poster, too.
Still a big world
Last year, the booking of K-pop girl group Blackpink and Puerto Rican rapper-singer Bad Bunny as headliners drew, well, headlines. But just because Coachella is back to its Southern California roots for 2024 doesnâ€™t mean the lineup is chockful of artists from around the globe.
Latin artists hold the significant second-billed spots on Friday â€“ Mexican singer Peso Pluma, whoâ€™s career has soared over the last year â€“ and Sunday â€“ Colombian superstar J Balvin, who at Coachella in 2019 played the highest profile set of any Latin artist at the festival at the time.
ALSO SEE: The 2024 Coachella lineup has the internet divided
Asian and Asian American artists are also scattered across the lineup. The K-pop boy band Ateez plays Friday, and on Sunday, thereâ€™s a listing for 88Rising Futures, which might be a showcase for emerging acts from the 88Risiing label that also puts on the annual Head In The Clouds festival in Pasadena of artists of Asian backgrounds from around the world.
The Japanese duo Yaosobi, who were one of the biggest draws at Head In The Clouds in 2023, play Friday at Coachella. Atarashii Gakko! is on my early must-see list. The Japanese quartet have also played Head In The Clouds a few times, and their highly choreographed and very energetic sets â€“ performed in Japanese school uniforms â€“ are pure fun.
Other corners of the world also slipped into the lineup again this year. The French electronic disco group Lâ€™Imperatrice was a delightful surprise at Coachella in 2022. The French DJ Gesaffelstein has a has a prominent spot on the lineup, too, and the deeper you dig, the more the world is revealed.
Under the rock
Coachella will never again be the rock festival it once was, but if you look closely, there are a good number of bands that fit that genre in 2024, especially if youâ€™re willing to stretch rockâ€™s boundaries a little.
Brittany Howard, lead singer and guitarist of the roots rock band Alabama Shakes, plays Fridays, as does the alternative metal band Deftones. The emo-ish Taking Back Sunday play on â€“ well, câ€™mon, what other day could they possibly play?
The Brit-pop heroes Blur are back again, holding down the second-billed slot on Saturdays. Iâ€™m excited to check out the Scottish group Young Fathers, who opened for Depeche Mode in 2023 and mix together rap, electronic and rock into their work. The English female rock band the Last Dinner Party, which just played ALTer Ego fest is also a rising act worth checking out.
Hermanos GutiÃ©rrez are an Ecuadorian-Swiss instrumental rock duo. And if you want to know what Jimi Hendrix might have sounded like if heâ€™d been raised on the Tuareg guitar music of Northern Africa, well, donâ€™t sleep on Mdou Moctar on Sundays.
Hip-hop, ya donâ€™t stop
At first glance there doesnâ€™t seem to be nearly as much rap in the lineup as in years past.
Sure, Doja Cat and Tyler, the Creator both are headliners, and Ice Spice and Lil Uzi Vert are third-billed on Saturday and Sunday, respectively.
ALSO SEE: No Doubt hints at reunion just before Coachella announcement
But after that, well-known hip-hop artists arenâ€™t that easy to find. Kevin Abstract of Brockhampton is back for a solo set on Saturdays, and given how packed the Coachella crowd was for Brockhamptonâ€™s farewell shows in 2022, he should draw well.
Then youâ€™ve got Lil Yachty on Sunday, and â€¦ well, there are a few more, here and there, but none of the fame of those already named here.
Strange and beautiful
Related Articles Music | Coachella 2024 lineup: Lana Del Rey, Tyler, The Creator, Doja Cat â€” and No Doubt
Coachella 2024 lineup: Lana Del Rey, Tyler, The Creator, Doja Cat â€” and No Doubt Music | The 2024 Coachella lineup has the internet divided One of the joys of each Coachella is spending time with performers who donâ€™t fit neatly into boxes. The Houston trio Khruangbin, for instance, play mostly instrumental rock, but itâ€™s transcendent in a floating-in-space kind of way.
New Orleans pianist and singer Jon Batiste is not a particularly expected choice for Coachella, but Iâ€™m betting heâ€™ll be fantastic, and youâ€™ll be glad you caught his set.
Hatsune Miku will be equally special, at least as long as there isnâ€™t a power outage. Miku is a 16-year-old Japanese pop star who is â€“ let me check my notes â€“ virtual. As in not a real person, but a simulation.
Pop singer Sabrina Carpenter might be the first Disney Channel star to be booked to play Coachella. Which raises the question why have havenâ€™t Miley Cyrus or Justin Timberlake or, heck, even Britney Spears, made it there yet?
And then thereâ€™s Clown Core, two guys who wear bad clown masks, play the drums, keyboards and saxophone, and recorded their music video for â€œHellâ€ inside a Port-a-Potty. These are the weirdos I am looking for, and Iâ€™ll be there with on Friday afternoon.
A bold prediction
Taylor Swift is gonna be at Coachella this year.
Stop laughing.
The theory works like this: Coachella falls during a break in her Eras Tour. Her frequent collaborator Jack Antonoff is playing Coachella on Saturdays with his band Bleachers. She also collaborated with Del Rey on the song â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ off her 2022 album, â€œMidnights.â€
And Ice Spice, with whom Taylor collaborated on a remix of â€œKarmaâ€ last year, and she also brought out for a guest spot at three Eras shows, too, is also playing Saturdays.
â€œWe talk all the time,â€ Ice Spice told People magazine last summer.
So, câ€™mon, it has been foretold. By me, sure, and I ainâ€™t no Nostradamus. But the opportunity is there.
Maybe she doesnâ€™t perform. But sheâ€™s gonna be on the grounds. Write it down.

title: From Glastonbury tickets to designer handbags: All the freebees MPs got last year
content: Short-serving former Prime Minister Liz Truss hasnâ€™t let her political humiliation get in the way of the high life. Since leaving Number 10, Truss has been jet-setting across the world and taking freebees from airports. She has used the VIP Windsor suite at Heathrow Airport no less than eleven times and the corresponding Sussex suite at Gatwick on four occasions. A stay in Heathrowâ€™s Windsor suite would set mere mortals back by Â£1,800 while a stop off in Gatwickâ€™s Sussex suite costs Â£1,380. But the airports have extended this courtesy to Truss for free.

title: Lana Del Rey Signs Publishing Deal With UMPG
content:
Lana Del Rey has signed a publishing agreement with Universal Music Publishing Group, sources tell Billboard. The singer-songwriter was previously affiliated with Sony Music Publishing.
Explore Explore Lana Del Rey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
News of the UMPG deal arrives just a day after Del Rey was announced as one of the headliners for this yearâ€™s Coachella alongside Tyler, The Creator and Doja Cat. It also follows a banner year for Del Rey, who released her ninth studio album Did You Know That Thereâ€™s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd? to critical acclaim on March 24, 2023. The album is now Grammy-nominated in five categories: album of the year, best alternative music album, best alternative music performance (â€œA&Wâ€), best pop duo/group performance (â€œCandy Necklacesâ€ with Jon Batiste) and song of the year (â€œA&Wâ€).
A source says the publishing agreement was signed in 2023, but the deal was never formally announced. On Wednesday (Jan. 17), UMPG seemingly nodded to its platinum-selling signee in an Instagram post, featuring Del Rey with UMPG CEO and chairman Jody Gerson. The caption reads: â€œSee you in the desert LDR ğŸ¡ğŸŒµ.â€
Since her first album, Born To Die, in 2012, Del Rey has released music with Polydor Records and Interscope Records. Her publishing agreement unites her publishing and recorded music under the Universal Music Group umbrella.
Throughout her career, Del Rey has notched 15 songs on the Hot 100 Chart, including two top 10s: â€œSnow On The Beachâ€ by Taylor Swift (ft. Lana Del Rey) and â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ by Lana Del Rey and Cedric Gervais. All nine of her studio albums have peaked in the top 10 of the Billboard 200 albums chart.
Del Rey is managed by TaP musicâ€™s Ben Mawson and Ed Millet.

Esta vez estarÃ¡n, ademÃ¡s de los citados Peso Pluma, Bizarrap y J Balvin, actuarÃ¡n la puertorriqueÃ±a Young Miko, el sonorense Carin Leon, la banda angelina de raÃ­ces mexicanas The Red Pears, los tambiÃ©n mexicanos Santa Fe Klan, Son rompe pera y Latin Mafia, los suizoecuatorianos Hermanos GutiÃ©rrez y el vallecano DepresiÃ³n Sonora. Las entradas se pueden comprar en preventa a partir del viernes 19 de enero a las 11 de la maÃ±ana (las ocho de la tarde en la EspaÃ±a peninsular) a partir de 500 dÃ³lares por fin de semana, o por 1.069 el pase VIP. En la zona se puede acampar y tambiÃ©n hay unas nada asequibles cabaÃ±as, donde alojarse el fin de semana cuesta a partir de 3.200 dÃ³lares para dos personas. Sobre el retorno de No Doubt por el momento se sabe poco: si estarÃ¡n ambos fines de semana, si solo uno, quÃ© dÃ­as... Su Ãºltima vez juntos sobre los escenarios fue en el festival KAABOO celebrado en Del Mar, en su California natal, en septiembre de 2018. Para entonces celebraban sus 30 aÃ±os juntos. La banda empezÃ³ a formarse a mediados y finales de los ochenta, y fue en 1992 cuando publicaron su primer Ã¡lbum, con poco Ã©xito. Ya en 1995 sacaron dos, The Beacon Street Collection, con bastante Ã©xito (vendiÃ³ unas 100.000 copias) y sobre todo Tragic Kingdom. En un juego de palabras con el Magic Kingdom del parque Disney de Anaheim, su ciudad natal, el Ã¡lbum fue un Ã©xito absoluto con 10 millones de copias vendidas en todo el mundo. Si su primer single, Just a Girl, fue un gran hit, mÃ¡s lo fue el tercero, Donâ€™t Speak, todo un himno generacional.
La figura de Gwen Stefani, su vocalista, y su caracterÃ­stica voz, asÃ­ como la mezcla de gÃ©neros, entre el reggae, el ska y el rock con toques new age, alzaron a la banda en las listas de Ã©xitos. Estuvieron casi tres aÃ±os de gira y siguieron grabando mÃºsica: en 2001 lanzaron el disco Return to Saturn y al aÃ±o siguiente Rock Steady, aunque ya con menos Ã©xito. DespuÃ©s, la banda decidiÃ³ tomarse un descanso para que cada uno siguiera con sus proyectos personales, y Stefani empezÃ³ a moverse sola: sacÃ³ dos discos en 2004 y 2006 con cierto Ã©xito, y tambiÃ©n hizo una pequeÃ±a gira, aunque en 2012 y tras 11 aÃ±os lanzÃ³ un Ã¡lbum con No Doubt, Push and Shove.
Aunque nunca hubo una separaciÃ³n oficial, fue en 2016 cuando la propia Stefani, en una entrevista con la revista Rolling Stone, comentÃ³ que no sabÃ­a cuÃ¡l iba a ser el futuro de la banda. â€œCuando Tony [Kanal, bajista y lÃ­der de la banda] y yo conectamos creativamente, es mÃ¡gico. Pero creo que nos hemos distanciado en el tipo de mÃºsica que queremos hacerâ€, reconocÃ­a, hablando de dificultades con la producciÃ³n y el lanzamiento de su Ãºltimo disco. Un aÃ±o despuÃ©s, el propio Kanal afirmaba en la misma publicaciÃ³n: â€œNo Doubt siempre estarÃ¡ ahÃ­, hemos vivido cosas juntos que nadie nunca jamÃ¡s vivirÃ¡ con nosotros. AhÃ­ siempre tendremos una familia, y la mÃºsica que hemos creado permanecerÃ¡. Solo estamos en una fase donde cada uno hace sus cosasâ€. Hace apenas un mes, Stefani anunciÃ³ que despuÃ©s de siete temporadas no seguirÃ­a como jurado en el programa de televisiÃ³n La Voz y que se iba a centrar en sus proyectos musicales. Ahora se ha sabido que esos proyectos son, en parte, el retorno de la banda.
Toda la cultura que va contigo te espera aquÃ­. SuscrÃ­bete

Get your flower crowns, mesh crop tops and fanny packs ready.
Coachella just announced their 2024 lineup and this year is going to be a doozy.
Taking place over two weekends â€” April 12-14 and 19-21 â€” at Indio, CAâ€™s Empire Polo Field with the same acts each go-round, this yearâ€™s edition features some of the biggest names in pop, â€™90s indie rock, Hip-Hop, reggaeton and K-Pop.
Just a few of the megastars set to grace the Indio stages this year include iconic singer-songwriter Lana Del Rey, throwback party starters No Doubt, Britpop legends Blur, reggaeton hitmaker J Balvin and Hip-Hop hero Tyler, The Creator.
Theyâ€™ll be joined by Doja Cat, Sublime, The Rose, Everything Always and Peso Pluma.

In total, roughly 150 acts will entertain audiences on each of the long weekends.

title: Coachella 2024 lineup: Lana Del Rey, Tyler, The Creator, Doja Cat
content:
The lineup is finally here!
Lana Del Rey will headline Friday evenings, Tyler, the Creator on Saturday nights and Doja Cat will close out both weekends on Sundays at the 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival at the Empire Polo Club in Indio on April 12-14 and April 19-21.
After teasing a reunion on Instagram less than an hour before the Coachella lineup dropped, Anaheim rock band No Doubt has been added to the lineup as well, though the poster has the band listed as â€œand â€¦ No Doubt.â€ Other performers include J Balvin, Blur, Ice Spice, Peso Pluma, Lil Uzi Vert, Justice, Sublime, Jungle, Bleachers and dozens more.
Lana Del Rey last performed at Coachella in 2014 and was originally scheduled to play the main stage just before headliner Frank Ocean in 2020. She did pop up at Coachellaâ€™s country sister fest Stagecoach in 2022 to sing a few songs alongside Nikki Lane on the Horseshoe Stage inside Laneâ€™s annually curated Stage Stop Marketplace. Last year, she dropped â€œDid You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd,â€ which received a Grammy nomination for best pop duo/group performance for the single â€œCandy Necklace,â€ featuring Jon Batiste.
Tyler, The Creator, who just brought back his Camp Flog Gnaw Carnival to Los Angeles last year, has performed numerous times at Coachella both as a solo performer and as part of the hip-hop collective, Odd Future. Last year, he released â€œCall Me If You Get Lost: The Estate Sale,â€ which included songs recorded for his 2021 album, â€œCall Me If You Get Lost,â€ but never appeared on the final album like â€œDogtooth,â€ â€œSorry Not Sorryâ€ and â€œWharf Talk.â€
Related Articles Music | The 2024 Coachella lineup has the internet divided Highly speculated possible headliner Rage Against the Machine seems to be permanently out of the running as drummer Brad Wilk announced on Instagram on Jan. 3 that â€œRATM (Tim, Zack, Tom and I) will not be touring or playing live again.â€ The band was expected to return to the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival in Indio in 2024 after having been originally scheduled to perform in 2020.
Goldenvoice announced the dates for the 2024 installment of the mega festival back in June and put advance tickets on sale for both weekends, which swiftly sold out. Fans will get a second crack at tickets starting at 11 a.m. on Friday, Jan. 19 coachella.com.
Coachella 2023 included headliners Bad Bunny, Blackpink and Frank Ocean during weekend one (April 14-16). Bad Bunny and Blackpink returned for weekend two, but Ocean was out after an apparent leg injury and brief weekend one set. He was replaced by weekend one surprise band, Blink-182, which was upgraded from the Sahara Tent to headlining the main Coachella Stage on the final evening of the festival on April 23.
The festivalâ€™s sister event, the Stagecoach Country Music Festival, which takes place at the same venue the weekend after both Coachella events on April 26-28, completely sold out in advance. That lineup is topped by Eric Church, Miranda Lambert and Morgan Wallen. It will also include turns from Jelly Roll, Post Malone, Luke Grimes, Elle King, Dwight Yoakam, Willie Nelson & Family, Leon Bridges, The Beach Boys, Clint Black, Pam Tillis and more.

title: Ludmilla Ã© anunciada no Coachella, principal festival musical dos EUA
content:
Â´Ludmilla, 28, vai representar o Brasil na ediÃ§Ã£o 2024 do Coachella, principal festival musical dos Estados Unidos.
O festival anunciou a cantora como atraÃ§Ã£o confirmada para os dias 14 e 21 de abril. Ela se apresentarÃ¡ no mesmo dia de nomes como Doja Cat, J Balvin, Bebe Rexha, Lana Del Rey, Tyler The Creator, No Doubt e Peso Pluma.
Nas redes sociais, Ludmilla compartilhou o line-up do evento e nÃ£o escondeu a alegria de ter a presenÃ§a confirmada no festival gringo. "Avisa lÃ¡ na gringa que a vilÃ£, a danada, a maliciosa tÃ¡ chegando pra botar pra fod** no Coachella", escreveu a artista nas redes sociais.
JÃ¡ no X, antigo Twitter, ela confidenciou que estava agoniada em nÃ£o poder contar da novidade. "Estava guardando esse segredo e agora finalmente posso comemorar mais essa conquista! Estamos no Coachella", contou.
A danÃ§arina Brunna GonÃ§alves, esposa de Ludmilla, vibrou com a conquista da amada. "Ludmilla in the house", postou ela no Instagram.
Ludmilla nÃ£o Ã© a primeira brasileira ilra a se apresentar no Coachella. Nomes como Anitta, Pabllo Vittar e Emicida estÃ£o entre os outros brasileiros que jÃ¡ tocaram no evento.
Anote na agenda: O Coachella acontecerÃ¡ em dois finais de semana do mÃªs de abril: nos dias 12, 13 e 14 e, depois, nos dias 19, 20 e 21. (Folhapress)

title: Where to Buy Tickets Online, Prices, More
content:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.
Coachella has officially announced their 2024 lineup, which means itâ€™s time to buy tickets to the famed festival.
Lana del Rey, Doja Cat, Tyler, the Creator and No Doubt will headline this yearâ€™s three-day music festival, which will return to its home at the Empire Polo Grounds in Indio, Calif. on the weekends of April 12-14 and April 19-21. Those who purchased tickets for the 2023/2022 festival have early access to passes during the loyalty presale starting Jan. 18 at 2 p.m. PT. The general presale begins Jan. 19 at 11 a.m. PT.
Also on the lineup are Peso Pluma, Blur, J Balvin, Ice Spice, Sublime, Lil Uzi Vert, Grimes, Victoria Monet, Jon Batiste, Bleachers, Justice, Deftones and Lil Yachty, with big looks for rising artists like Bizarrap, Khruangbin and others.
If tickets sell out during the general presale, tickets will also be available on resale sites such as VividSeats, Ticketmaster and Seatgeek. In fact, last year tickets actually appeared to be selling for significantly less money on resale sites compared to Coachellaâ€™s website.
While resale sites almost always sell tickets at marked up prices, the same doesnâ€™t tend to be the case with weekend events like Coachella, likely because festival-goers prefer to have their tickets secured weeks or months in advance. But people who live in the area, or are prone to spontaneity, can save a lot of money by buying tickets only a week or so before the festival.
If you arenâ€™t able to attend the festival in person, you can stream performances online. YouTube returns this year as the exclusive livestream partner for both Coachella weekends on the festivalâ€™s official YouTube channel.
Check out more of the best 2024 music festivals.

title: Coachella 2024: No Doubt to reunite, Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat and Tyler, the Creator to headline
content:
Coachella 2024: No Doubt to reunite, Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat and Tyler, the Creator to headline
Music festival obsessives, the wait is over. The 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival lineup is here.
Music festival obsessives, the wait is over. The 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival lineup is here.
Music festival obsessives, the wait is over. The 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival lineup is here.
Music festival obsessives, the wait is over. The 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival lineup is here.
COACHELLA, Calif. -- The lineup for Indio's legendary, desert-centric Coachella music festival has officially been announced, and there's no doubt it'll be a good time.
On Tuesday, Goldenvoice, the company that produces the long-running festival, revealed that the 2024 lineup features popular ska/punk/rock band No Doubt as one of the four headlining acts.
The band's appearance will mark a reunion between the members, which include frontwoman Gwen Stefani. No Doubt has not performed live as a band since at least 2015.
Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat and rapper Tyler, The Creator are also set to headline the festival, with other notable artists such as Peso Pluma, Ice Spice, Blur, Sublime and J. Balvin slated to take one of the festival's many stages.
Just before the official lineup announcement was made on Tuesday, the No Doubt X page teased a reunion when it posted a video of Stefani reminiscing about her early days with the band.
The video culminated in Stefani setting up a video call with her No Doubt bandmates - Tony Kanal, Tom Dumont, and Adrian Young - after noting how much she missed them.
"You guys want to do a show?" Stefani asked, to which Kanal, Dumont and Young all replied with an enthusiastic "yes!"
While No Doubt did not announce any additional concert dates, their upcoming Coachella gig marks nearly 10 years since the band has toured together. No Doubt originally formed in the mid-90s and became known for their classic hits "Don't Speak," "Just a Girl" and "Spiderwebs," among many others.
In the early aughts, the band went on to pursue solo projects after releasing a number of albums together. In 2004, Stefani released her first solo album "Love. Angel. Music. Baby." and has released three more solo albums since then.
Last year's Coachella headliners included Puerto Rican superstar Bad Bunny, Korean pop group Blackpink and singer Frank Ocean. Due to an injury, Ocean pulled out of performing the festival's second weekend, with band Blink-182 filling in.
The live music festival will return to Indio's Empire Polo Field for two consecutive weekends on April 12-14 and April 19-21 this year.
The CNN Wire â„¢ & Â© 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

title: Weyes Blood, cantante: â€œAlgo que me resulta raro de entender de los Z es que no tienen ningÃºn tipo de interÃ©s en el sexoâ€
content:
La mÃºsica de Weyes Blood (Santa MÃ³nica, 35 aÃ±os) podrÃ­a calificarse como romÃ¡ntica, porque sin duda hay en ella sonidos que evocan los referentes de lo romÃ¡ntico en el sentido mÃ¡s filosÃ³fico y trascendental de tÃ©rmino: tan pronto un laÃºd misterioso y parnasiano se choca con un sintetizador, como el aullido de una guitarra elÃ©ctrica se mezcla con un Ã³rgano decadente y quejumbroso. Y sin embargo, la californiana Natalie Mering (su nombre artÃ­stico es un homenaje a la una novela de Flannery Oâ€™Connor, Wise Blood) no es una romÃ¡ntica en el sentido convencional: â€œPor supuesto que sufro por amor y es un tema que me preocupa. Pero no soy un escritora moderna que diga de forma literal: â€˜Ay, no me contestaste al WhatsAppâ€™. Y a la vez, mi Ãºltima canciÃ³n, con conceptos mucho mÃ¡s abstractos, en realidad va sobre que te dejen en vistoâ€, explica la cantante con el mismo gesto hierÃ¡tico, misterioso y bellÃ­simo que es parte de su identidad personal.
Weyes Blood con top de manga acampanada y falda, ambos de CHARO RUIZ, y zapatos rojos de MANOLO BLAHNIK.
En el estudio fotogrÃ¡fico de TetuÃ¡n donde se desarrolla la sesiÃ³n de fotos, con su pose de sacerdotisa psicodÃ©lica, parece capaz hasta de controlar cÃ³mo la luz afecta sobre las ondas de los vestidos que ella misma ha escogido. Por la noche, en el concierto que ofrecerÃ¡ en una conocida sala madrileÃ±a para presentar su quinto disco, And in the Darkness, Hearts Aglow, su control del estado de Ã¡nimo de la audiencia serÃ¡ igualmente impresionante.
Natalie Mering es una de esas cantautoras que disfruta en el estudio experimentando con el sonido (sus gustos musicales son inauditamente eclÃ©cticos: le encantan la mÃºsica medieval, la clÃ¡sica renacentista, Demis Roussos, Aphroditeâ€™s Child, Joni Mitchell, Neil Young y Enya), pero al mismo tiempo es un animal del directo. Es especialmente feliz en Europa, donde su alma antigua (asÃ­ la define ella) entra en conexiÃ³n con legados del pasado remoto: â€œPor ejemplo, he sido feliz en Portugal. Vale, quizÃ¡ los trenes tengan unos retrasos brutales y la burocracia sea una locura, pero la gente come alimentos de altÃ­sima calidad y se toma todo con otra filosofÃ­a. Me encanta venir a lugares donde ha habido grandes imperios que se derrumbaron porque creo que el imperio americano estÃ¡ ahora mismo en ese proceso de descomposiciÃ³n, asÃ­ que estar en lugares como Grecia, Italia o EspaÃ±a, que fueron incuestionables hace cientos de aÃ±os y siguen existiendo, resulta un cierto alivioâ€, asegura echando mano de un sentido del humor algo lÃºgubre que tambiÃ©n aplica cuando explica por quÃ© una milenial como ella nunca se ha sentido parte de su generaciÃ³n sino mÃ¡s bien de varias a la vez: â€œHay formas en las que me siento prÃ³xima a los boomers. Mis padres eran mÃºsicos y mi madre fue la tÃ­pica chica de Laurel Canyon, pero al mismo tiempo son muy cristianos y nos hicieron crecer viendo El mago de Oz. Luego mi hermano era el tÃ­pico de la generaciÃ³n X, lo cual fue increÃ­blemente formativo para mÃ­ porque soy capaz de escuchar a Nirvana y encontrar refugio en ese ruido, me chifla el noise. A la vez, de la cultura milenial naciÃ³ esa especie de nostalgia del pop y sus pastiches en la que me puedo reconocer. Por Ãºltimo estÃ¡n los Z, que estÃ¡n totalmente defraudados por el mundo que no les ofrece futuro, con sus sentimientos profundamente heridos porque tienen que vivir con sus padres. Y esa decepciÃ³n con el presente y el futuro les lleva a adorar lo que quizÃ¡ para otras generaciones fue el mainstream: les gustan las bandas solo por criterios estÃ©ticos, por ejemplo Mazzy Star, y encuentran que cosas tan inanes como Bob Esponja son lo mÃ¡ximo. Y eso, la verdad, tambiÃ©n lo puedo comprenderâ€.
La cantante con top de malla con la espalda descubierta de RABANNE.
Â¿Le cuesta comprender el lenguaje y la jerga con la que se comunican los que son 25 aÃ±os mÃ¡s jÃ³venes que ella? â€œEn absoluto. Muchas de las palabras que usan proceden de la escena queer, cosa que sÃ­ me desconcierta porque algo que me resulta raro de entender de los Z es que no tienen ningÃºn tipo de interÃ©s en el sexo. Es buenÃ­simo que las nuevas generaciones no quieran follar por follar, pero me extraÃ±a que no estÃ©n mÃ¡s cachondos...â€. Incluso esta afirmaciÃ³n viene acompaÃ±a de una muy discreta risa. Natalie Mering es misteriosa, una rara avis hasta para lo ideolÃ³gico. Aunque como ella misma ha contado sus padres fueran catÃ³licos fervorosos, se considera socialista y agnÃ³stica. Y feminista, claro: â€œLa verdad es que es cierto que en mi industria es muy fÃ¡cil que si hay mayorÃ­a de hombres en un estudio acaben explicÃ¡ndote las cosas y adoptando una actitud paternalista. Por eso yo muy rÃ¡pidamente me pongo en mi sitio. En realidad no creo que sea culpa de los hombres: el patriarcado es un sistema con raÃ­ces histÃ³ricas que a los Ãºnicos que ha servido es a los hombres blancos. Y ahora mismo ni siquiera a ellosâ€.
Weyes Blood tiene ya varias canciones para su nuevo disco, aunque no tiene la prisa con la que compuso el anterior: â€œEn la pandemia pensÃ© que de verdad nunca mÃ¡s podrÃ­a hacer mÃºsica. Y al final ya ves, aquÃ­ estamos de nuevoâ€.

title: Coachella 2024 lineup: No Doubt to reunite after almost 10 years with Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat also headliners
content:
CNN â€”
The lineup for Southern Californiaâ€™s legendary, desert-centric Coachella music festival has officially been announced, and thereâ€™s no doubt itâ€™ll be a good time.
On Tuesday, Goldenvoice, the company that produces the long-running festival, revealed that the 2024 lineup features popular ska/punk/rock band No Doubt as one of the four headlining acts.
The bandâ€™s appearance will mark a reunion between the members, which include frontwoman Gwen Stefani. No Doubt has not performed live as a band since at least 2015.
Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat and rapper Tyler, The Creator are also set to headline the festival, with other notable artists such as Peso Pluma, Ice Spice, Blur, Sublime and J. Balvin slated to take one of the festivalâ€™s many stages.
Just before the official lineup announcement was made on Tuesday, the No Doubt X page teased a reunion when it posted a video of Stefani reminiscing about her early days with the band.
The video culminated in Stefani setting up a video call with her No Doubt bandmates â€“ Tony Kanal, Tom Dumont, and Adrian Young â€“ after noting how much she missed them.
â€œYou guys want to do a show?â€ Stefani asked, to which Kanal, Dumont and Young all replied with an enthusiastic â€œyes!â€
While No Doubt did not announce any additional concert dates, their upcoming Coachella gig marks nearly 10 years since the band has toured together. No Doubt originally formed in the mid-90s and became known for their classic hits â€œDonâ€™t Speak,â€ â€œJust a Girlâ€ and â€œSpiderwebs,â€ among many others.
In the early aughts, the band went on to pursue solo projects after releasing a number of albums together. In 2004, Stefani released her first solo album â€œLove. Angel. Music. Baby.â€ and has released three more solo albums since then.
Last yearâ€™s Coachella headliners included Puerto Rican superstar Bad Bunny, Korean pop group Blackpink and singer Frank Ocean. Due to an injury, Ocean pulled out of performing the festivalâ€™s second weekend, with band Blink-182 filling in.
The live music festival will return to Indioâ€™s Empire Polo Field for two consecutive weekends on April 12-14 and April 19-21 this year.

title: Coachella 2024 lineup: Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat and Tyler, the Creator to headline in April
content:
Lana Del Rey, Tyler, the Creator and Doja Cat will headline the 2024 Coachella music festival, with the Gwen Stefani-fronted ska band No Doubt reuniting as part of the lineup after last playing together in 2015.
Announced on Tuesday, the 23rd instalment of the festival will take place over two weekends on 12 to 14 April and 19 to 21 April at Empire polo club in Indio, California, and will also feature Blur and the breakout rap star Ice Spice.
All three headliners have appeared at the festival in the past. Del Rey last played Coachella in 2014 and was booked for the 2020 edition that was scuppered by Covid.
Doja Cat last performed at Coachella in 2022, while Tyler, the Creator has become a mainstay since debuting at the festival in 2011 with his hip-hop group Odd Future, and playing solo sets in 2015 and 2018. He has also performed in guest appearances at the festival with fellow rappers Earl Sweatshirt and Schoolboy Q, as well as the Latin soul singer Kali Uchis.
Dua Lipa and Shakira were both in contention to headline, according to the entertainment industry publication Variety. Sources told Variety that Lipa had declined because of a timing issue, while festival organisers had passed on Shakira.
Also on this yearâ€™s bill are Deftones, the Mexican singer Peso Pluma, and Jack Antonoffâ€™s group Bleachers.
Coachella has been rocked by headliner controversies in the past two years, with Kanye West and Frank Ocean both pulling out last minute. Ocean cancelled on his second weekend appearance after playing a much-lampooned set at the first weekend filled with pre-recorded vocals and unorthodox gimmicks.
The music festival is North Americaâ€™s largest and has already sold all of its 125,000 day tickets. Three-day passes will be available from Friday at 11am PT as part of Coachellaâ€™s pre-sale.

title: Doja Cat, Lana, Tyler, the Creator
content:
Photo-Illustration: Vulture; Photos: Katherine Bomboy/NBC via Getty Images, Jason Kempin/Getty Images
Doja Cat, Lana Del Rey, and Tyler, the Creator will bring their fans to the California desert â€” and to the deserts of Twitter, to defend them â€” when they headline the premiere music festival. Itâ€™s each artistâ€™s first time with top billing at Coachella. Doja arrives off her rough-edged fourth album, Scarlet, and ready to surprise after a headline-making Coachella set in 2022. Del Rey, meanwhile, spent last summer on the festival circuit losing her vape, getting cut off at Glastonbury, and playing her ninth album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. And Tyler, a perennial festival showman, would seem to be readying new music for the desert, after he last played the festival circuit in 2021 and 2022 with his raucous sixth album, Call Me When You Get Lost.
Coachella will be hoping to put on a smoother festival than 2023, when Frank Oceanâ€™s messy week-one headlining set led to online fighting, ice-rink rumors, and an injury-related cancellation for week two. Blink-182 ended up surprise-headlining the second weekend, alongside the previously scheduled Bad Bunny and Blackpink. Whatever mess goes down in the desert this year, the stans will be making sure we hear about it.
Which stans will be watching?
In addition to the headliners, the lineup also includes No Doubt, Peso Pluma, Blur, J Balvin, Lil Uzi Vert, Justice, Bizarrap, Deftones, ATEEZ, Everything Always, Peggy Gou, Young Miko, Ice Spice, Gesaffelstein, Sublime, Jungle, Dom Dolla, Bleachers, Grimes, Jon Batiste, LE SSERAFIM, JhenÃ© Aiko, Khruangbin, Carin LeÃ³n, Anyma, John Summit, Lil Yachty, DJ Snake, LUDMILLA, the Rose, Sabrina Carpenter, Anti Up, Steve Angello, Ken Carson, Skepta, Faye Webster, Tyla, Yoasobi, Cloonee, Gorgon City, Tinashe, ANOTR, Charlotte de Witte, ISOxo & Knock2, Sante Fe Klan, Blxst, Purple Disco Machine, the Drums, Skream & Benga, Destroy Lonely, Orbital, AP Dhillon, ReneÃ© Rapp, Bebe Rexha, Coi Leray, NAV, Tems, BICEP, Victoria MonÃ©t, Taking Back Sunday, and 88RISING FUTURES. Squint at the picture below for the rest of the full lineup.
D.A.N.C.E
Register now for access to passes at https://t.co/qujCsdlTip. Presale begins Friday, 1/19 at 11am PT. pic.twitter.com/DlApQGXnBb â€” Coachella (@coachella) January 17, 2024
Wait, weâ€™re getting a No Doubt reunion?
Yes, and it comes after a long hiatus. Singer Gwen Stefani, bassist Tony Kanal, guitarist Tom Dumont, and drummer Adrian Young last performed together as a band in 2015.
When will influencers take over the desert?
Coachella 2024 will take place April 12-14 and 19-21.
Where can I watch online?
Take a wild guess. YouTube first became the festivalâ€™s exclusive livestream partner in 2011, and you will once again be able to tune in this year on Coachellaâ€™s official YouTube channel.
What about Revolve Fest?
Shut up. (But weâ€™re sure itâ€™s happening.)

title: Coachella 2024 Full Lineup Announced
content:
The 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festivalâ€™s full lineup has been revealed: Lana Del Rey, Tyler, the Creator, and Doja Cat will headline the Empire Polo Club in Indio, California. Elsewhere on the bill are a reunited No Doubt, Blur, Ice Spice, J Balvin, Peso Pluma, and dozens more; check out the poster and full lineup below. As usual, the festival takes place across two weekends: April 12-14 and 19-21.
The Fridaysâ€™ lineups include Del Rey, Peso Pluma, Lil Uzi Vert, Justice, Deftones, Peggy Gou, Young Miko, Bizarrap, Skepta, Ken Carson, Faye Webster, Tinashe, Brittany Howard, Chappel Roan, ChlÃ¶e, and Black Country, New Road.
On the Saturdays, Tyler, the Creator shares a lineup with Blur, Ice Spice, Sublime, Bleachers, Grimes, Jon Batiste, Orbital, Kevin Abstract, the Blessed Madonna, Oneohtrix Point Never, Bar Italia, Erika de Casier, Militarie Gun, and Mandy, Indiana.
The Sundays will feature Doja Cat, J Balvin, Khruangbin, Lil Yachty, Victoria MonÃ©t, ReneÃ© Rapp, Bebe Rexha, Coi Leray, Taking Back Sunday, Boy Harsher, Jockstrap, Mdou Moctar, and Feeble Little Horse.
Organizers will be hoping for a smoother experience with headliners than in the two years past, when Kanye West and Frank Ocean both pulled out last-minute. In 2022, the Weeknd and Swedish House Mafia replaced West, and, last year, Ocean dropped out of his second-weekend set, blaming a purported ankle injury. (His first-weekend set had proven divisive, with some heralding the irreverent approach to his catalog while others bristled at the setlist and long sections of pre-recorded vocals.) Ocean was replaced by Skrillex, Four Tet, and Fred Again.., with Blink-182 bumped up the bill to precede them.
Last yearâ€™s Coachella also featured Jai Paulâ€™s live debut, surprise appearances from the Weeknd, Billie Eilish, and Tyler, the Creator, and headline sets from Bad Bunny and Blackpink. Read Pitchforkâ€™s interview with Coachella 2023 MVP Morgandoesntcare, â€œAn Interview With the Teenager Who Livestreamed Frank Oceanâ€™s Coachella Set.â€
