title: No Doubt reunion with Gwen Stefani tops Coachella 2024 line-up
content:
A surprise No Doubt reunion with Gwen Stefani has topped the 2024 Coachella line-up announcement, alongside headline acts Lana Del Rey, Tyler, The Creator and Doja Cat.
The two-time Grammy winning band, best known for songs including Just A Girl and Donâ€™t Speak, are named on the bill but it is unclear which dates they will feature.
Advertisement
The world famous event, which takes place in the Southern Californian desert, is due to return this year over two weekends â€“ April 12 to 14 and April 19 to 21.
â€œWeâ€™ll see you in the desert this April!!!,â€ the official Instagram for No Doubt said, which tagged Stefani.
It comes almost a decade since their last reunion in 2015, having sporadically performed together since their hiatus in the early noughties.
Advertisement
Advertisement
The Coachella line-up will also see US singer Del Rey, who rose to fame in 2012 with Born To Die, headline the Friday slots.
It comes after she arrived late for her performance at the British Summer Time (BST) festival in London, just weeks after her microphone was cut off at Glastonbury when her set overran because of her late arrival.
Lana Del Rey will headline the Friday sets (Danny Lawson/PA)
Advertisement
Fridayâ€™s line-up also includes Mexican singer Peso Pluma, South Korean DJ Peggy Gou, and British singer-turned-actress Suki Waterhouse â€“ who is pregnant with her first child with Robert Pattinson.
Meanwhile Tyler, The Creator, who last played at the festival in 2018, will headline the Saturday shows alongside British rock band Blur, US rapper Ice Spice and Brits Rising Star 2024 winners The Last Dinner Party.
Doja Cat, who performed at the festival in 2022, will top the Sunday shows with US singer Bebe Rexha billed to perform alongside British star Olivia Dean.
It comes after the festival ran into problems with headline acts over the last two years.
Advertisement
Last year, Frank Ocean pulled out of his second headline performance due to a leg injury, while Kanye West, also known as Ye, was due to headline in 2022 but the line-up was updated weeks before the event.

title: Lana Del Rey, More to Headline
content:
Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat, Tyler, the Creator and No Doubt will headline the 2024 Coachella festival, promoters Goldenvoice announced on Tuesday. The lineup poster appears below.
Also on the list are Peso Pluma, Blur, J Balvin, Ice Spice, Sublime, Lil Uzi Vert, Grimes, Victoria Monet, Jon Batiste, Bleachers, Justice, Deftones and Lil Yachty, with big looks for rising artists like Bizarrap, Khruangbin and others. The 23rd installment of the festival takes place at its home at the Empire Polo Grounds in Indio, Calif., on the weekends of April 12-14 and April 19-21.
Those who purchased tickets for the 2023/2022 festival have early access to passes during the loyalty presale starting Jan. 18 at 2 p.m. PT. The general presale begins Jan. 19 at 11 a.m. PT.
YouTube returns in 2023 as the exclusive livestream partner for both Coachella weekends on the festivalâ€™s official YouTube channel.
This year marks the third with a curious fourth headlining slot at the bottom of the festival poster, which gives the artist headliner billing â€” via the all-important font-size heirarchy â€” but without a a specific date; the first three headliners top the bills for each of the festivalâ€™s three days. Its meaning has never been fully clear: At first it seemed that the billing was either a late-night dance slot or sort of insurance headliner in case one of the main headliners pulled out (which ended up being the case with Swedish House Mafia in 2022, who took over the Sunday-night slots with the Weeknd when Kanye West canceled just days before the festival). However, last year, when Frank Ocean pulled out of the second weekend after his controversial headlining slot during the first, his place was taken by Blink-182 while Harris played late-night DJ sets. This year, with veteran alt-rock act No Doubt in that position, the significance is even more confusing.
Sources say that Dua Lipa and Shakira, both of whom have new albums on the way in 2024, were also in contention to headline; Lipa reportedly bowed out because the timing did not work, while festival organizers reportedly passed on Shakira.
Rage Against the Machine were scheduled to headline Coachellaâ€™s 2020 installment, which was announced in January of that year and ultimately postponed four times due to the pandemic. While the group relaunched second reunion tour in 2022 and played 19 shows, singer Zach de la Rocha suffered a serious knee injury and the dates were postponed indefinitely but any future plans are apparently off the table: Drummer Brad Wilk posted on Jan. 3 that the group â€œwill not be touring or playing live again.â€
Last yearâ€™s headliners were Bad Bunny, Blackpink and, for the first weekend, originally scheduled 2020 headliner Frank Ocean. While the elusive singer had planned an elaborate ice-skating rink, complete with dozens of skaters, for his performance, at the last minute it was dismantled and he ended up playing a loose, low-key set that started late and disappointed many fans. He canceled his appearance during the second weekend and was replaced by Blink-182.
It was the second consecutive year with a last-minute headliner switch: 2022â€™s headliners were Harry Styles, Billie Eilish, and a tag-team set from the Weeknd and Swedish House Mafia, with the latter performance replacing one from Kanye West, who pulled out just days before the festivalâ€™s first weekend.
Coachella is North Americaâ€™s largest music festival and has already sold all of its 125,000 per-day tickets.

title: Hangout Festival 2024 Lineup: Lana Del Rey, Zach Bryan & ODESZA
content:
Get your flip-flops ready, because the annual beachside Hangout Festival is returning to Gulf Shores, Alabama, this spring with a megawatt lineup. Taking place May 17-19, the festival will feature headliners ODESZA, Lana Del Rey and Zach Bryan.
Explore Explore ODESZA See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
The genre-spanning lineup also including Dominic Fike, ReneÃ© Rapp, Cage the Elephant, Jessie Murph, Doechii, Nelly, NLE Choppa, Sexyy Redd, A Day to Remember, All Time Low and more. The event will also feature sets from a gaggle of electronic acts, including The Chainsmokers, Alison Wonderland, Dom Dolla and Subtronics. See the complete lineup below.
Tickets for the fest go on sale Friday (Jan. 12) and start at $299. 2024 marks the 13th iteration of Hangout Fest, which hosts approximately 40,000 fans over its three days. Taking place right on the beach, the Hangout site features beach clubs and in-ground swimming pools at the main stage, along with other amenities.
Hangout was started by entrepreneurs and restaurant owners Shaul and Lilly Zislin, who envisioned a luxury festival that differed from the experiences they were having at festivals back in 2009.
â€œFrom day one we saw this as a destination, a vacation first and foremost,â€ a representative for the festival told Billboard in 2019. â€œPeople come for the music and then get swept away from the beach and the experience.â€ The event â€œtakes an empty beach and completely transforms it. We bring in hundreds of palm trees and roll out the same grass you see at the Super Bowl or the World Series. A music festival isnâ€™t just stages. It is all these other things.â€

title: Ice Spice shares sheâ€™s â€˜obsessedâ€™ with Lana Del Rey
content:
Ice Spice is a fan of Lana Del Rey and Taylor Swift as well
Ice Spice has recently expressed her admiration for Lana Del Rey.
Ice, whoâ€™s honoured as the 2024 Billboard Women in Music Hitmaker at the upcoming March 6 ceremony, gave â€œshout-outâ€ to fellow honourees Charli XCX and Dolly Parton.
In a new interview with Billboard, Ice also revealed Lana as one of her favourites among singers.
â€œI would say Lana Del Rey,â€ said the 24-year-old.
She told the outlet, â€œIâ€™m obsessed with her, and I feel like all of her songs are hits, even the ones that arenâ€™t as big as the others.â€
Elsewhere in the interview, Ice shared she received valuable advice from Taylor Swift with whom she collaborated on the remix of Midnights single Karma in 2023.
â€œWhen I was in the studio with Taylor, like, Iâ€™ll never forget that,â€ remarked the Deli hit-maker.
Ice added, â€œTaylor told me, â€˜No matter what, just keep making music and everythingâ€™s going to be fine.â€™â€
Meanwhile, Ice also opened up about her upcoming project, calling it some of her â€œbest workâ€ while looking for â€œa really hard beatâ€.
â€œIf the beat doesnâ€™t instantly move me â€” like if I donâ€™t physically feel the beat of the speakers â€” then Iâ€™m just going to keep moving on to the next one,â€ she told the outlet.
Ice added, â€œAs soon as I know, I know I have that beat. Itâ€™s up from there.â€

title: Taylor Swift, Drake, Lana Del Rey muted on TikTok amid multibillion-fight with Universal Music over royalties, use of AI
content:
People familiar with the matter said when talks fell apart last month, TikTok had been offering to pay Universal a â€œlow single-digitâ€ percentage of its advertising revenue for the use of its music, which includes the repertoire of stars such as Taylor Swift, Drake, The Weeknd and Lana Del Rey.
TikTok recently came back with an offer that was higher but still well below the 20 per cent cut of advertising revenue that YouTube pays to the music industry, according to people familiar with the matter.
AI sticking point
The other big sticking point is AI. Universal wants TikTokâ€™s royalty money to go towards musicians, while TikTok wants the â€œroyalty potâ€ to also be shared with fans who use AI to make their own tracks. Universal views this as a non-starter, people familiar with the matter said.
In a statement on Wednesday, TikTok said it remained â€œcommitted to reaching an equitable agreementâ€ with Universal but was in the process of carrying out the music companyâ€™s requirement to remove all songs written or co-written by one of its songwriters.
â€œTheir actions not only affect the songwriters and artists that they represent, but now also impact many artists and songwriters not signed to Universal,â€ TikTok said.
Advertisement
The stand-off is among the most heated clashes between tech giants and media groups in recent memory, as they battle for control over the future of entertainment.
Big music companies earn billions of dollars a year through royalty payments from streaming service and social media platform operators including Spotify, Apple and Meta. They typically renegotiate these contracts every couple of years, in licensing talks that are often tense but almost always result in a deal.
This is the first time in the streaming era that Universal has gone as far as removing its music from a tech companyâ€™s platform. The outcome of the TikTok-Universal dispute will affect music revenues for years to come.
Stars such as BeyoncÃ©, who is signed with Universalâ€™s rival Sony, maybe also be hit by the dispute. Getty
Mr Obermann, a former Warner Music executive who joined TikTok in 2019 to lead its negotiations with the big music labels, has been at the forefront of the talks. His boss at ByteDance, Mr Zhen, has also been involved in recent weeks, with the communications sometimes appearing unco-ordinated, according to people familiar with the matter. Mr Chew, TikTokâ€™s Singapore-based chief executive, has also been in touch with Universal to try to restart talks.
The stand-off has left Universal artists without their biggest marketing tool, while TikTok users are seeing their posts muted en masse.
Advertisement
Beyond Universal
BeyoncÃ©, who is signed with Universalâ€™s rival Sony, seems to have benefited from the stand-off. Her new song Texas Hold â€™Em has soared to the top of the Billboard charts, helped by its prominence on TikTok, where users are posting hundreds of thousands of videos using the track.
However, this weekâ€™s expansion of the licensing take-downs will affect even artists who are not affiliated with Universal, such as BeyoncÃ©.
Every song has two sets of copyrights: one for the recording, and one for the â€œpublishingâ€, meaning the writing and composition. Starting late on Monday, TikTok began removing songs tied to Universalâ€™s publishing arm. This means that artists who collaborate with songwriters signed to Universal will have their work removed, too.
According to these rules, Texas Hold Em, which was co-written with Raphael Saadiq, who is signed with Universal, would also be muted on TikTok.
Some executives and analysts estimate that 60 to 80 per cent of all the popular music on TikTok will be muted this week. TikTok disputes this, saying the figure is closer to 30 per cent.
Advertisement
People close to TikTok said it had not lost users since the removal of Universalâ€™s catalogue, but argued that the dispute was hurting the wider industry.
On Universalâ€™s earnings call on Wednesday last week, Mr Grainge said: â€œWeâ€™re friendly people. My phone is open, unfortunately, 24 hours a day â€¦ We negotiate and deal with platforms that combined are worth trillions. Iâ€™ve spent my entire career creating win-win situations.â€
The waiting music before the call included Sophie Ellis-Bextorâ€™s Murder on the Dance Floor, a song Universal owns the rights to, which exploded in popularity on TikTok in recent months.
Financial Times

title: Are Skims campaigns the new Vogue covers?
content:
Before hitting the stage at this yearâ€™s Super Bowl Halftime Show, R&B singer Usher graced the cover of Vogueâ€™s 2024 Winter Digital issue. It wasnâ€™t totally obvious, though, that he was meant to be the publicationâ€™s guest of honor.
The styling is tasteful enough, with Usher dressed in a cream-colored autumnal outfit like a fashion-forward sports dad. However, not only is he upstaged by a group of school-aged football players on the cover, heâ€™s joined by supermodel Carolyn Murphy. Critics on X and TikTok quickly expressed their frustration over the direction of the shoot, which seemed intent on minimizing Usherâ€™s presence. Along with LeBron James and Kanye West, he is one of only a handful of Black men to be featured on US Vogue covers. (Maybe not so coincidentally, the three mentioned share their cover shoots with white women.)
Then a few weeks later came a steamy underwear ad for Skims, Kim Kardashianâ€™s shapewear and loungewear brand. Social media users praised Usher and Skims for the timely collaboration. The simple shoot featured the â€œU Remind Meâ€ singer decked out in chains, holding a peach, and flaunting his six-pack abs while wearing briefs. It was received as a more rewarding press stop than the Vogue cover by many of his fans.
Itâ€™s safe to say that thereâ€™s no real challenger to the 131-year-old institution that is Vogue. Utilizing elite photographers and A-list designers â€” not to mention editor-in-chief Anna Wintourâ€™s unwavering dominance in the fashion industry â€” the magazine has remained one of the ultimate curators of celebrity image. But itâ€™s hard not to notice that Skimsâ€™ star-studded ads generate the kind of positive buzz that Vogue and other legacy magazine covers have frequently failed to achieve â€” and that are often met with controversy regarding poor photography, underwhelming styling, and a lack of diversity.
Meanwhile, Skims shoots have seen a more consistently positive reception. Before Usherâ€™s campaign, the e-commerce brand set social media ablaze with its annual Valentineâ€™s Day campaign starring singer Lana Del Rey. And the holiday shoot the year before featured Beatrice GrannÃ² and Simona Tabasco, two Italian actresses from the hit HBO series The White Lotus.
More recently, Skims recruited Call Her Daddy podcast host Alex Cooper for a bridal lingerie campaign, capitalizing on her massive listenership. And pop girl du jour Sabrina Carpenter is the brandâ€™s latest spokesperson, donning the new lace lingerie collection in a â€˜90s-inspired shoot.
The ads have also arrived at a time when celebrity endorsements and influencer sponcon have become an integral part of the online experience. Itâ€™s maybe not so surprising that the mastermind behind all of this is Kim Kardashian, a modern pinup with a penchant for opening our wallets and making things go viral.
Skims put a â€œcoolâ€ stamp on shapewear
Since launching Skims in 2019, Kardashianâ€™s juggernaut of a business (currently valued at $4 billion) has managed to give consumers a new outlook on body-sculpting innerwear.
Leading up to its debut, Kardashian and her influencer sisters were controversially shilling waist trainers on social media. Presumably, the media mogulsâ€™ seal of approval helped shed some of the not-so-marketable associations with foundation garments. For most of the 2000s and 2010s, shapewear was largely a punchline, even with its not-so-secret widespread use throughout Hollywood and the fashion industry. Spanx were for imperfect women trying to conceal their love handles on a date. The word â€œgirdleâ€ still brings to mind an older demographic of women. Maybe the most telling sign that Spanx and other body-cincher products were â€œmeantâ€ for older women was an early cosign by Oprah Winfrey.
As the body-positivity movement has made strides over the past two decades â€” infiltrating marketing for just about everything, from dating apps to soap â€” the standard of physical perfection that made the use of body-cinching products embarrassing has started to dwindle. By the time Skims released its first set of inventory, it seemed like shapewear was something young women were not only comfortable admitting they owned but sporting as outerwear as well. It certainly helped that trendy labels like Mugler, Charlotte Knowles, and Rui Zhou (and their fast-fashion dupes) have repopularized slimming, paneled bodysuits and underwear-inspired clothes. The shapewear fad is apparently so huge that forecasters predict a market share of $3.8 billion in the next seven years.
The impetus for Skims Solutionwear â€” initially controversially called â€œKimonoâ€ â€” isnâ€™t that different from shapewear founder Sara Blakelyâ€™s story. Blakely cut the legs off her control-top pantyhose to maintain a cinched look under her pants, creating what would essentially be the groundbreaking product Spanx. Kardashian similarly claims she was forced to cut her shapewear to complement her cutout and high-slit dresses. A more important selling point for the company was that Kardashian also said she couldnâ€™t find shapewear to match her olive-y tan skin tone, leading her to go so far as to dye her undergarments with tea and coffee.
â€œFor me, I was just looking for a solution to the fact that I love to wear shapewear,â€ Kardashian said at the Time 100 summit last year. â€œThere wasnâ€™t a color tone that fit my skin tone, let alone most of my friendsâ€™.â€
A few years prior, Rihannaâ€™s makeup brand Fenty Beauty proved that inclusivity â€” especially when paired with A-list celebrity branding â€” sells. Likewise, Skims relied heavily on the message of diversity, with the slogan â€œsolutions for every body.â€ Its 36-piece debut collection offered bras, underwear, shorts, and various bodysuits in nine shades from sand to onyx. Significantly, the brand offered an extensive size range, XXS to 5X, and used models representing that spectrum. In its first few minutes after launching, the brand made $2 million.
You could liken the online response [to a] Skims ad to older generations seeing their pop culture idols in a government-sponsored â€œGot Milk?â€ ad or even a beloved athlete on a Wheaties cereal box
Of course, branding shapewear designed to make the body look slimmer as â€œinclusiveâ€ is a bit ironic, if not totally regressive. Still, itâ€™s clear that millennial and Gen Z women felt more embraced by Skims and other direct-to-consumer companies, like ThirdLove and Savage X Fenty, than legacy brand Victoriaâ€™s Secret by the late 2010s. Since about 2015, the lingerie retailer has seen a cultural and financial decline due to public controversies, decreasing sales, internal issues, and a general inability to keep up with the times.
Things ultimately took a turn for the worse in 2018, when Edward Razek, former chief marketing officer of L Brands (which owns Victoriaâ€™s Secret), defended excluding plus-size and transgender models from the annually televised Victoriaâ€™s Secret Fashion Show. Since then, the company has attempted more inclusive messaging, expanded its size range, and retained high-profile spokesmodels. However, sales, particularly its in-store performance, have continued to plunge.
Celebrity Skims ads have filled a void in pop culture.
Aside from the inclusivity angle, Skims has remained a dominant force in the fashion world thanks to its internet-breaking collaborations. In a short amount of time, the brand has linked up with high-fashion label Fendi for a capsule collection and sports organizations like the US Olympic team, the NBA, and the WNBA.
Campaigns featuring some of the internetâ€™s most beloved celebrities have made Skims a premier platform for viral photo shoots. You could liken the online response when a high-profile actor, athlete, or musician appears in a Skims ad to older generations seeing their pop culture idols in a government-sponsored â€œGot Milk?â€ ad or even a beloved athlete on a Wheaties cereal box. Commercials for Calvin Klein in the â€™80s and â€™90s, starring then up-and-comers such as Mark Wahlberg and Brooke Shields, generated similar excitement, if also controversy. In the social media era, when everyone is constantly self-promoting, celebrity photo shoots have lost a bit of their novelty. Still, Skims has managed to harness social media and the zeitgeist to deliver capital-M Moments.
Adrianne Pasquarelli, special projects editor and senior reporter for Ad Age, notes that timeliness is one aspect that works in Skimsâ€™ favor. She emphasizes that being a DTC brand helps Skims roll out these celebrity ads more quickly.
â€œAs a direct-to-consumer brand, theyâ€™re able to be very nimble with their marketing,â€ she said. â€œ[Kim Kardashian] handles a lot of the creative and can turn out that stuff on a dime, especially for a digital campaign. Itâ€™s harder to be as flexible and as fast with marketing for heritage companies with a bunch of brick-and-mortar stores and just decades of retailing.â€
It seems like Skims is doing something that legacy brands have struggled to deliver in the age of the internet: spotlighting diverse talent in the right way at the right time and creating the sort of impactful images that fans want. While Vogue has attempted to feature more people of color in and on the cover of their magazines â€” albeit at a slow pace â€” and Victoriaâ€™s Secret now caters to a larger range of bodies, these brands havenâ€™t been able to totally shed the below-par reputation they developed in the past or produce branding work that resonates with consumers.
Some of Skimsâ€™ illustrious spokesmodels include SZA, Cardi B, the Mahomes family, Ice Spice, PinkPantheress, Kate Moss, Lana Del Rey, Snoop Dogg, Brooke Shields, and RosalÃ­a. One of the most eye-catching photo shoots was appropriately named â€œIconsâ€ and featured fashion and lingerie models such as Heidi Klum, Tyra Banks, Candice Swanepoel, and Alessandra Ambrosio, all previous Victoriaâ€™s Secret Angels. Interestingly enough, Skims buyers called out Victoriaâ€™s Secret for allegedly copying the campaign with its â€œIcons Collection,â€ which similarly cast â€™90s supermodels.
Skims is doing something that legacy brands have struggled to: spotlighting diverse talent in the right way at the right time
So far, unlike Calvin Kleinâ€™s ads of yore, thereâ€™s hardly any controversy involved. For the most part, Skimsâ€™ photo shoots have yet to stir an overwhelmingly negative response. The company was briefly in hot water for featuring San Francisco 49ers player Nick Bosa in a Skims Men ad last year after some problematic tweets resurfaced. However, a short-lived, largely forgettable scandal is ironically a feat for Kardashian, whose name is practically synonymous with backlash.
The shoots are all tastefully sexy and, in some cases â€” like with the Mahomeses â€” family-friendly. Rather than leaning into a hypersexualized, male-gaze aesthetic like Victoriaâ€™s Secret shoots, they rely on beauty, brand synergy, and the cultural climate and donâ€™t attempt to truly shock or titillate â€” well, except maybe in the case of some of their menâ€™s ads.
Many of Skimsâ€™ splashier celebrity ads have also featured and targeted older adults. Sorilbran Stone, head of content marketing at influencer marketing company the Shelf, notes that older millennial and Gen X consumers have a more traditional, â€œold-schoolâ€ idea of celebrity that Skimsâ€™ ads often hit upon.
â€œI think Skims focuses on content for young consumers and campaigns for older consumers, which makes it accessible for everyone,â€ she said.
For example, in one brilliant 2020 campaign, Kardashian unveiled Skimsâ€™ velour loungewear collection with the help of her best friend, Paris Hilton. The girly, tabloid-style photo shoot shows the pair exiting a grocery store and walking through a parking lot, harkening back to their early socialite days being followed by paparazzi. The casual shoot wasnâ€™t just leaning into Y2K aesthetic trends. It was also capitalizing on Hiltonâ€™s reemergence as a foregone cultural figure that millennials were beginning to appreciate again and Gen Zers were presumably becoming familiar with.
Stone says Skims has managed to reflect the interests of a wide range of consumers with its diverse casting.
â€œIf you donâ€™t listen to hip-hop, then youâ€™ve got Kim Cattrall,â€ Stone said. â€œIf you donâ€™t know who SZA is or whatever â€” thereâ€™s someone standing in the gap who can loop you into that world.â€
Weâ€™re living in peak celebrity endorsement culture
It canâ€™t be overstated that Skims is a billion-dollar business because of extremely famous founder Kim Kardashian, whoâ€™s constantly posting Skims products on Instagram to her 364 million followers. But the company has also been a word-of-mouth success, with many reluctantly praising the quality of its products. Of course, there have also been detractors, regarding its alleged unsustainability.
â€œIt does have to do with the extensive reach of Kim Kardashian,â€ Pasquarelli said. â€œShe just commands a celebrity that a lot of others donâ€™t. â€
Itâ€™s fair to suggest that Skimsâ€™ ads also thrive because of the landscape of celebrity branding and sponcon that she helped foster. Of course, the Skims founder isnâ€™t totally responsible for influencer marketing as a concept. Celebrity advertisements in the 1980s and â€™90s really set the stage for much of what the scene looks like today, with Michael Jordanâ€™s myriad brand deals and Pepsi and Coca-Cola commercials starring huge pop stars.
Still, in 2024, thereâ€™s a noticeable level of excitement on social media when a celebrity collabs with a popular brand and the partnership feels just right. Ben Affleck and his long-running, heavily memed relationship with Dunkinâ€™ is a prime example. Ironically, his trilogy of Dunkinâ€™ ads, the third installment of which aired at this yearâ€™s Super Bowl, feels like the biggest cinematic event heâ€™s partaken in recently.
â€œI think the appeal of Ben Affleck for Dunkinâ€™ is because of how much it plays into meme culture,â€ said Vulture writer Rebecca Alter, who writes about celebrity endorsements. â€œWeâ€™ve all seen images of Affleck looking exhausted fetching his Dunkies, and I think people find it really endearing and amusing when a celebrity plays into the meme image of themselves, because itâ€™s an image that fans helped create.â€
Usherâ€™s Skims campaign leaned into the sexy image heâ€™s always projected himself but certainly amped up in recent years as the singer went viral for serenading his largely female guests at his Las Vegas residency. The same can be said about Lana Del Rey, who was a somewhat surprising spokesmodel. Del Rey is more of a private figure and not particularly known for shilling anything aside from her albums and poetry books. But it seemed like her fans appreciated the direction of the shoot, a callback to the 1960s pinup look sheâ€™s embraced throughout her career. The photo shoot even earned Skims a whopping $13.7 million in media exposure.
Ultimately, Skimsâ€™ success formula for advertising is admittedly simple; itâ€™ll always have the ability to impress as long as other legacy brands are getting it wrong. Time will tell whether it can adapt to ever-changing trends in fashion and body image. But for now, itâ€™s proven to be more agile and forward-thinking than your older sisterâ€™s lingerie shop or the glossy editorials resting in a pile on your motherâ€™s nightstand.

title: Moda 'coquette': cÃ³mo sumarse al estilo viral que marca tendencia en redes sociales
content:
El estilo 'coquette', ha invadido las redes sociales. Y es que esta tendencia â€”que mezcla actitud y modaâ€” ha ganado popularidad en diferentes partes del mundo, incluyendo EspaÃ±a. Se trata de una mezcla de prendas de estilo vintage romÃ¡ntico con un punto de coqueterÃ­a, de ahÃ­ su nombre.
A medio camino entre Lana del Rey y Maria Antonieta, encontramos en esta tendencia de cuento, el romanticismo en su mÃ¡ximo exponente, con mangas abullonadas, volantes, blusas con detalles de encaje y accesorios femeninos como perlas y lazos.
Â¿QuÃ© es la moda 'coquette'
Dior HC S24, a la izq. Carlo Pignatelli brd S23, a la drcha. Launchmetrics.
Si bien los lazos, como accesorio para el pelo, estÃ¡n viviendo su Ã©poca dorada; estos adornos, vuelven a ganar protagonismo en la moda, junto a volantes, encajes y colores blancos y rosas. Se trata de viajar en el tiempo a cuando Ã©ramos pequeÃ±as y nos encantaba disfrazarnos de princesas.
Con un toque rococÃ³, esta tendencia no es nueva. De hecho, se inspira en los brocados, corsÃ©s y guantes que se llevaban en ParÃ­s hace mÃ¡s de 200 aÃ±os. Maria Antonieta llevÃ³ una vida llena de excesos y lujos. Fue decapitada a los 37 aÃ±os durante la RevoluciÃ³n Francesa, pero tanto su estilo como su historia sigue inspirando a diferentes diseÃ±adores. Fue una influencer del siglo XVIII, en una Ã©poca en la que las damas de Versalles y ParÃ­s competÃ­an por lucir los vestidos y complementos mÃ¡s sofisticados.
Actualmente, aunque una de sus claras precursoras es Lana del Rey, que mezcla este estilo con una tendencia aÃ±os sesenta, otras famosas como Alexa Chung tambiÃ©n apuestan por estilismos de este tipo.
La moda 'coquette' en la pasarela
Una prueba de que es una tendencia al alza, es la apuesta por parte de los grandes diseÃ±adores, que se inspiraron en este estilo para sus nuevas colecciones. En sus correspondientes pasarelas, diseÃ±adores como Chanel, Dior o Jean-Paul Gaultier, abrazaron esta tendencia, en la que pudimos ver pieles pulidas y rubor acentuado, peinados trenzados y con lazos y, por supuesto, un toque dramÃ¡tico a base de un 'eyeliner' marcado. Los 'looks beauty' van acordes a una sucesiÃ³n de prendas que no dejan indiferente a nadie.
Chanel apuesta por el tejido tweed mezclado con un estilo 'coquette', muy en tendencia. Launchmetrics.
Por su parte, Chanel se inspira en el estilo 'coquette' en su bÃºsqueda por reescribir la hiperfeminidad, pero sin perder el espÃ­ritu de la marca. Con su colecciÃ³n, apuesta por la parte femenina mÃ¡s romÃ¡ntica, integrando en cada prenda esa nostalgia de la niÃ±ez. Sin perder su tejido icÃ³nico, el tweed, la marca apuesta por una silueta elegante, una mujer poderosa y sofisticada, que puede aportar pequeÃ±os detalles 'coquette' sin perder su esencia.
Chanel apuesta por el estilo 'coquette'. Launchmetrics.
Tampoco se olvidan de las faldas en tul abullonado y los brillos, con 'crop top' debajo. Un estilo que nos recuerda al ballet. No olvidemos que la tendencia 'coquette' va muy de la mano del 'balletcore', por lo que las versiones mÃ¡s actualizadas del clÃ¡sico tutÃº y las bailarinas, son mÃ¡s que bienvenidas.
Estilo 'coquette' en el desfile de Dior. Launchmetrics.
Con un estilo mÃ¡s sobrio, pero con muchas transparencias, Dior reinventa el estilo 'coquette' en su parte mÃ¡s atrevida. En la pasarela pudimos ver algÃºn fleco y tejidos aterciopelados. La versiÃ³n mÃ¡s 'royal' del estilo 'coquette'.
Desfile de Jean Paul Gaultier, estilo 'coquette'. Launchmetrics.
Por su parte, Jean Paul Gaultier apuesta por el lado mÃ¡s lencero, mÃ¡s parisino, de esta tendencia. Una mezcla entre el estilo mÃ¡s Versalles del XVIII y un toque pÃ­caro del cancÃ¡n del Moulin Rouge, con mangas abullonadas, tiras lenceras y corsÃ©s.
Desfile 'coquette' de Jean Paul Gaultier. Launchmetrics.
CÃ³mo llevar el estilo 'coquette'
Montaje con artÃ­culos de Zara. ZARA.
Un vestido de volantes o encaje, un buen lazo a conjunto y, por supuesto, unos zapatos de charol, serÃ¡n tu mejor aliado si quieres unirte a esta tendencia. AdemÃ¡s, las bailarinas tipo Baby Jane son tendencia, asÃ­ que es posible que las encuentres sin esfuerzo.

title: Beyonce, Ed Sheeran, Lana Del Rey & More
content:
In 1994, country music legend Alan Jackson released the hit â€œGone Country,â€ an observation of artists and writers who were leaving music and entertainment hotspots such Las Vegas and Los Angeles and making their foray into the country music scene.
Thirty years later â€“ and on the heels of 2023, which saw country music artists including Morgan Wallen, Jason Aldean and Luke Combs dominating the upper-echelons of the all-genre Billboard Hot 100 for nearly half of the year â€“ the music industry seems primed for a new wave of pop-to-country crossovers, with a new cluster of pop-world artists signaling their intentions to release country or country-adjacent projects in the next year or so.
Of course, numerous rock and pop artists, among them Don Henley, Cyndi Lauper, Jessica Simpson, Steven Tyler, Bret Michaels and Nelly, have previously released country (and/or country-inspired) music to varying degrees of success.
In 1962, Ray Charles released his signature album Modern Sounds in Country & Western Music, unique in that it took country standards and arranged them in R&B and jazz styles. The album reached the top 25 on the Billboard 200, and became a key influence on generations of artists. Charles would also reach the Hot Country Songs top 20 in 1983 with â€œBorn to Love Meâ€ and earned a No. 1 hit with the Willie Nelson duet â€œSeven Spanish Angelsâ€ in 1985. Charles was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2021.
In 1969, Bob Dylan wrote and recorded the love letter to country music with Nashville Skyline, which was recorded at Columbia Studios in Nashville, and featured musicians including Charlie Daniels, Pete Drake, and Charlie McCoy, Country icon Johnny Cash also duetted with Dylan on a new version of his folk standard â€œGirl From the North Country.â€
In 1984, Lionel Richieâ€™s hit â€œStuck on Youâ€ topped the Adult Contemporary chart, but also reached No. 24 on the Hot Country Songs chart. 2012, Richie (who was also the sole writer on the Kenny Rogers hit â€œLadyâ€) released the album Tuskegee, reworking several of his own hits as collaborations with a slew of country artists. The album topped the Billboard Hot Country Albums chart. Linda Ronstadtâ€™s multi-faceted, genre-spanning career has included her charting pop hits such as â€œLong, Long Timeâ€ before adding country hits such as â€œSilver Threads and Golden Needlesâ€ to her resume.
Apart from occasional dabbling in country music, other artists such as Darius Rucker and Country Music Hall of Fame members Kenny Rogers and Conway Twitty had towering successes in the pop world and later committed to the country genre.
In 1958, Twitty earned a pop smash with â€œItâ€™s Only Make Believe,â€ which spent two weeks atop the Hot 100; he followed that with the top 10 hits â€œDanny Boyâ€ and â€œLonely Blue Boyâ€ before later earning his first top 20 country hit in 1966; he would go on to earn 40 No. 1 Hot Country Songs hits. As part of Hootie & the Blowfish, Rucker earned massive pop hits including â€œHold My Handâ€ and â€œOnly Wanna Be With You.â€ He released his debut country album in 2008 and has gone on to earn nine Country Airplay hits. Prior to his decades-long country career, Rogers was part of the folk group New Christy Minstrels, and earned a pop hit as part of the group First Edition with â€œJust Dropped In (To See What Condition My Condition Was In).â€ More recently, prior to dominating the Country Airplay chart with songs including â€œSon of a Sinnerâ€ and â€œNeed a Favor,â€ Jelly Roll had already released more than a dozen rap and hip-hop projects.
Here, we look at a new crop of pop stars who have signaled their intentions to â€œgo countryâ€ â€” or have outright released new country-flavored music.

title: Lana Del Rey Covers Irving Berlinâ€™s â€œBlue Skiesâ€: Listen
content:
Lana Del Rey is the latest artist to release a cover song for Jack Antonoffâ€™s The New Look soundtrack. Her contribution is Irving Berlinâ€™s 1920s song â€œBlue Skies.â€ Listen to the new track below.
Del Reyâ€™s â€œBlue Skiesâ€ follows the 1975â€™s â€œNow Is the Hourâ€ and Florence and the Machineâ€™s â€œWhite Cliffs of Dover.â€ The New Look, created by Todd A. Kessler, premieres today (February 14) on Apple TV+.
Del Rey has a storied collaborative relationship with producer Jack Antonoffâ€”who just won the 2024 Grammy Award for Producer of the Year, Non-Classical, in part, due to his work on Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvdâ€”and the two apparently worked together again on a new project: the country album Lasso. â€œIf you canâ€™t already tell by our award winners and our performers, the music business is going country. Weâ€™re going country. Itâ€™s happening,â€ Del Rey said recently. â€œThatâ€™s why Jack has followed me to Muscle Shoals, Nashville, Mississippi, over the last four years.â€
Check out Pitchforkâ€™s â€œThe 50 Best Albums of 2023,â€ featuring Lana Del Reyâ€™s Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd at No. 11.

title: Lana Del Rey Falls Over Celebrating The Chiefs Winning The Super Bowl
content:
Down goes Lana! Lana Del Rey, 38, got knocked over while she was celebrating the Kansas City Chiefs winning Super Bowl LVIII with Taylor Swift and the rest of Taylorâ€™s star-studded squad on February 11. In a video thatâ€™s gone viral on social media, Lana â€” who is actually a fan of the San Francisco 49ers â€” joined the whole suite erupting in cheers after the Chiefs beat the 49ers in overtime. But Lana got bumped into and fell in her seat in the midst of the chaos. Luckily, some of the people helped her up as the celebrations continued.
Lana Del Rey falls down while celebrating The Chiefsâ€™ #Superbowl win. pic.twitter.com/kdPohhvUVK â€” Pop Crave (@PopCrave) February 12, 2024
Lana wasnâ€™t originally sitting with Taylor at Super Bowl LVIII, but she eventually joined the â€œCruel Summerâ€ singer and the rest of Taylorâ€™s pals â€” including Keleigh Teller, Ice Spice, and Blake Lively â€” in a suite to watch the end of the game. Lana took off her red leather 49ers jacket and had on a black top and jeans when she was sitting with Taylor and company.
Taylor Swift and Lana Del Rey together at the #SuperBowl. pic.twitter.com/XyJ52Qj8rh â€” Pop Base (@PopBase) February 12, 2024
Lana and Taylor have been friends for years and even collaborated on the song â€œSnow On the Beachâ€ from Taylorâ€™s 2022 album Midnights. The two stars went to the 2024 Grammy Awards together on February 4, where Midnights won Album of the Year. Lana, whose album Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd was also nominated for AOTY, went on stage with Taylor as she accepted the award.
In an interview with Harperâ€™s BAZAAR in November, Lana revealed how her and Taylorâ€™s collaboration on Midnights came to be.
â€œWhat happened with â€˜Snow on the Beachâ€™ was, that was actually the song Taylor wanted me to sing on. If I think somebodyâ€™s song is perfect, I will act as producer in it. I can mimic almost anyone, so I am all over the first version of â€˜Snow on the Beach,â€™ but I layer and match her vocals perfectly so you would never even know that I was all over that first song,â€ Lana explained. â€œShe wanted me to sing the whole thing, but if it ainâ€™t broke, donâ€™t fix it.â€
Speaking to Billboard in February 2023, Lana, who wrote â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ with Taylor and Jack Antonoff, revealed that she initially had â€œno ideaâ€ she was â€œthe only featureâ€ on the song. â€œHad I known, I would have sung the entire second verse like she wanted,â€ Lana said. â€œMy job as a feature on a big artistâ€™s album is to make sure I help add to the production of the song, so I was more focused on the production.â€

title: Who is Lana Del Rey? Age, Career & Net Worth
content:
Lana Del Rey was born on June 21, 1985, in New York City.
Rey is known for her haunting voice, evocative lyrics, and vintage aesthetic.
She gained international fame with her debut single, â€œVideo Games,â€ in 2011.
Advertisement
Lana Del Rey, born Elizabeth Woolridge Grant on June 21, 1985, in New York City, is a singer-songwriter known for her hauntingly beautiful voice, evocative lyrics, and vintage aesthetic. With her captivating blend of indie pop, dream pop, and alternative rock, Lana Del Rey has carved out a unique niche in the music industry, earning critical acclaim and a devoted fan base worldwide.
Growing up in Lake Placid, New York, Lana Del Rey was drawn to music from a young age. Influenced by the sounds of artists like Frank Sinatra, Elvis Presley, and Nirvana, she began writing her songs as a teenager, channeling her experiences and emotions into her music.
Del Reyâ€™s career began to gain traction in the late 2000s when she released her debut single, â€œVideo Games,â€ in 2011. The songâ€™s atmospheric sound and poignant lyrics struck a chord with listeners, propelling Lana Del Rey into the spotlight and paving the way for her debut album, â€œBorn to Die,â€ which was released in 2012.
â€œBorn to Dieâ€ catapulted Lana Del Rey to international fame, debuting at number two on the Billboard 200 chart and spawning hit singles such as â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ and â€œBlue Jeans.â€ Her distinctive voice, coupled with her cinematic style and lyrical depth, captivated audiences and critics alike, earning her comparisons to iconic figures like Nancy Sinatra and Marilyn Monroe.
Since her breakthrough, Lana Del Rey has released a string of critically acclaimed albums, including â€œUltraviolenceâ€ (2014), â€œHoneymoonâ€ (2015), and â€œLust for Lifeâ€ (2017). Each album showcases her evolution as an artist, exploring themes of love, longing, and the darker aspects of fame and fortune.
As of 2022, Lana Del Reyâ€™s net worth is estimated to be in the range of $30 million to $40 million. Her wealth stems from various sources, including album sales, touring revenue, endorsements, and royalties from her extensive catalog of music. Additionally, Lana Del Rey has ventured into other creative endeavors, such as fashion and acting, further bolstering her financial success.
Advertisement
While Lana Del Reyâ€™s music often delves into themes of love and heartache, she tends to keep her personal life out of the spotlight. However, she has been open about her struggles with anxiety and depression, using her music as a form of catharsis and self-expression.
In recent years, Lana Del Rey has become increasingly vocal about social and political issues, using her platform to advocate for causes such as environmental conservation and LGBTQ+ rights. Her willingness to speak out on important issues has endeared her to fans and solidified her reputation as an artist with depth and substance.

title: Lana Del Rey Gets Knocked Over During Super Bowl Celebration
content:
Taylor Swift had a variety of celebrity friends in the VIP suite celebrating the Kansas City Chiefs' win on Sunday, including singer Lana Del Rey.
Following a nail-biting showdown, Travis Kelce's Chiefs squeezed a 25-22 victory in overtime against the San Francisco 49ers at the Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas. Chiefs fans were over the moon with the win and videos online have shown people celebrating in the crowd.
Unfortunately, when Swift and the likes of Ice Spice and Blake Lively were celebrating the Chiefs' win, Del Rey was knocked over.
The entertainment X account (formerly Twitter) posted a video of the incident and wrote: "Lana Del Rey gets knocked over during the #SuperBowl celebration in Taylor Swift's suite." At the time of writing, it had been viewed 1.1 million times.

title: Lana Del Rey makes it to Taylor Swiftâ€™s suite after ditching rivalâ€™s jacket
content:
Lana is a diehard San Francisco 49ers fan â€“ the team playing against Travis Kelceâ€™s Kansas City Chiefs
Taylor Swift wasnâ€™t going to fraternize with the enemy â€“ even if it was her long-time bestie Lana Del Rey.
During the Super Bowl LVIII on Sunday, fans were left outraged when Lana seemingly wasnâ€™t let into Taylor suite at the Allegiant Stadium in Paradise, Nevada as the latter cheered on her boyfriend Travis Kelce.
The music icons were spotted saying hello to each other â€“ Taylor from within her suite and Lana reaching up to her from down below.
â€œLet Lana into your suite, Taylor,â€ one fan implored on X (previously Twitter), while another demanded, â€œget lana in that damn suite.â€
Notably, in the photographs circulating social media, the Summertime Sadness hitmaker was proudly sporting a red San Francisco 49ers jacket.
To paint the full picture, the 49ers were the rival team that played (and lost) against the Kansas City Chiefs â€“ Travisâ€™ team.
Hence, speculations arose that the multi-Grammy winner simply couldnâ€™t allow rival fans in her suite â€“ be it her close friend and musical collaborator.
Interestingly, the Video Games songstress was later photographed in Taylorâ€™s suite after ditching the enemyâ€™s jacket.

title: Lana Del Rey Reacts to 2024 Grammys After Losing: â€˜Loved Being Thereâ€™
content:
Lana Del Rey had a great time at the Grammys! Even though she didnâ€™t take home any awards herself this year, the Born to Die singer, 38, told her fans that she didnâ€™t have any hard feelings about the award show in an Instagram comment on Thursday, February 8. She assured fans that she was simply happy to attend the event in a short comment.
Lana had been nominated for five awards. Her LP Did You Know Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Boulevard? was nominated for both Best Alternative Album and Album of the Year. Her single â€œA&Wâ€ was up for Song of the Year and Best Alternative Music Performance. Her Jon Batiste collaboration â€œCandy Necklaceâ€ was up for Best Pop/Duo Group Performance.
Responding to a fanâ€™s post on Instagram, Lana reassured her fans that she was totally fine after the award show. â€œI literally just loved being there. I love to see everyone, get the tea and hang out. Get dressed up,â€ she wrote. â€œI literally did not feel 1 once of negative emotion at any point in that award ceremony. It was pure funniness and laughter.â€
ğŸš¨ CONFIRMED! Lana Del Rey does not give a f*ck about the Grammys pic.twitter.com/eA4rI9xNiP â€” The Cult Of Del Rey (@CinamonSluh) February 8, 2024
Besides her five nominations this year, the â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ singer has been nominated six times prior, with her first nominations coming in 2014. In her first year as a nominee, she was up for Best Pop Vocal Album for Paradise and Best Song Written for Visual Media for â€œYoung and Beautiful.â€
While Lanaâ€™s latest album may not have been awarded any Grammys, she does seem to be looking to the future and already be gearing up for her next full-length. She teased that her next effort will be a country record during an appearance at a Billboard event before the Grammys. She revealed that the record will be called Lasso and said that it would drop by September 2024. â€œIf you canâ€™t already tell by our award winners and our performers, the music business is going country. Weâ€™re going country. Itâ€™s happening,â€ she said.

title: Lana Del Rey says 'I Just Loved Being There,' despite Grammy losses
content:
Lana Del Rey at Grammys 2024.
Lana Del Rey, despite not securing any wins in her nominated categories at the 2024 Grammys, remains optimistic and upbeat.
The 38-year-old singer took to social media on Wednesday to reassure fans of her positive experience during the event.
"I literally just loved being there. I love to see everyone, get the tea and hang out. Get dressed up," she commented on a fan's Instagram post.
Nominated for Best Alternative Music Album, Best Alternative Music Performance, Best Pop Duo/Group Performance, Song Of The Year, and Album Of The Year at the 66th annual gala, Del Rey shared her perspective on the evening.
"I literally did not feel 1 ounce of negative emotion at any point in that award ceremony," she added. "It was pure funniness and laughter."
Lana's recent upbeat demeanor follows a notable Instagram post where she posed with a gun in a hotel room, captioning it "Always chillin."
Despite not having received a Recording Academy award yet, Del Rey's album Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd positioned her as a contender for Best Alternative Music Album and Album of the Year.
However, these accolades ultimately went to The Record by boygenius and Taylor Swift's Midnights, respectively.
While her song A&W earned Del Rey nominations for Best Alternative Music Performance and Song of the Year, these awards were clinched by The Record by boygenius and Billie Eilish's What Was I Made For? respectively.

title: Lana Del Rey sparks major concern after fans spot disturbing detail in new photo taken inside hotel room
content:
Lana was recently revealed to the the face of Kim Kardashian's Skims brand's Valentine's Day campaign
HOLD UP Lana Del Rey sparks major concern after fans spot disturbing detail in new photo taken inside hotel room
LANA Del Rey has sparked major concern after fans spotted a disturbing detail in a new photo taken inside her hotel room.
On Tuesday, the Summertime Sadness singer posted the photo to Instagram with the caption, "felt cute."
5 Lana Del Rey sparked major concern after fans spotted a disturbing detail in a new photo taken inside her hotel room Credit: Instagram/honeymoon
5 On Tuesday, the Summertime Sadness singer posted the photo to Instagram with the caption, 'felt cute' Credit: Getty
The mirror selfie showed a make-free Lana, 38, standing inside her hotel room while wearing a white, babydoll dress.
The Ultraviolece artist took the photo with her phone in one hand and in the other, somewhat hidden from immediate view, she held a handgun.
Her hair appeared to be somewhat hastily done and even though she "felt cute," the expression on her face was a solemn one.
In the post's comment section were both surprised and delighted by the weapon as many theorized the meaning behind its inclusion in the snapshot.
One person wrote, "The GUN."
A second fan asked, "Wait is that a gun lmao."
"That was literally my reaction!" commented another before adding, "I was like yesss queen but then I was like wait is that a gun."
A fourth commenter speculated, "itâ€™s her Grammys rebuttal."
"Go get your Grammy back," joked a fifth.
Elsewhere in the comment section, one fan warned, "girl, finger off the trigger."
Lana Del Rey booed by Glastonbury crowd after turning up 30 minutes late for headline set
"Okay sheâ€™s strapped," mentioned another.
A third commenter remarked, "Youâ€™re just so iconic for this LMFAOOO."
'SKIMS VALENTINE'
Lana was recently seen in Kim Kardashian's new campaign nearly a decade after the two were previously linked.
The singer was recently featured in the new Skims Valentine's Day campaign, capturing Lana in 1960s vintage-inspired lingerie.
Kim, 43, shared a new video that showed Lana in blue and pink lingerie, labeling the hitmaker as the "Skims Valentine."
While the pairing may have been unexpected, Kim has been a longtime fan of the Grammy-winning songstress.
Lana performed during the wedding rehearsal for Kim and her ex-husband Kanye West, 46, in 2014.
Lana performed her hit songs Young and Beautiful, Blue Jeans, and Summertime Sadness for the couple's rehearsal dinner at the ChÃ¢teau of Versailles, according to W Magazine.
DISAPPOINTED FANS
Since Lana was shown in Skims' latest campaign, fans have been giving their opinions on the mash-up between the singer and the reality star.
"Iâ€™m disappointed for the association because Lana is so wonderful.. that said if it were someone elseâ€™s brand it would kind of make sense?" one person asked in an online thread.
"She has the coquette style which does include lots of lingerie-type outfits and fitted tops," they added.
"Kim sure made a smart move with this new campaign knowing how rabid Lana's fans are and how they'll eat up and buy anything she does. Hating this for her!!!" wrote a second.
"Love Lana, hate the campaign. The lingerie looks like cheap, camp Halloween costumes," a third said.
"SO EMBARRASSING, but not at all shocking," commented a fourth.
"I adore Lana with every part of me, but I really don't understand some of the choices she's made over the years," said a fifth.
They continued, "I can forgive but I don't forget, but not sure if I can even do the former here, really disappointed."
LANA X SKIMS
Last month, the Skims founder took to Instagram to promote the brand's new holiday collection.
"Our @SKIMS Valentine LANA DEL REY. Musicâ€™s queen of hearts @honeymoon opens our dedicated Valentineâ€™s Shop on Tuesday, January 23 at 9AM PT / 12PM ET," she captioned the post.
The photos, taken by Nadia Lee Cohen, captured the West Coast singer in a look that gave an ode to the glamour of Old Hollywood.
The first photo showed Lana reclined inside a giant, plush candy box, where she donned a beau blue, silk bodysuit that matched her heart-shaped enclosure.
The shoulder-strapped one-piece featured a plunging neckline that showed off the star's ample cleavage and side cut-outs that highlighted her curvy figure.
The second shot had the singer in a silk dress that featured a lace trim, which contrasted against the deep red backdrop and blanket.
The washed-out colors of the third photo included in the Skims post continued with the vintage tone.
Looking like a page ripped out of a 70s lingerie catalog, Lana was shown leaning on the inside of a heart-shaped floral wreath.
Lana was also shown modeling a heart-print longsleeved crop top and later Skims "ruby red thong bodysuit."
5 Lana took the photo with her phone in one hand and the other, somewhat hidden from immediate view, she held a handgun Credit: GC Images
5 One fan joked that the photo was her 'rebuttal' for losing out at the Grammys Credit: Getty

title: Lana Del Reyâ€™s Country Album: Everything to Know About â€˜Lassoâ€™
content:
Lana Del Rey has a new album coming out â€“ with a twist! For the first time in her career, Lana, 38, is releasing a country album, titled Lasso, that she officially announced on January 31. â€œWeâ€™re going country,â€ Lana said at a Billboard event ahead of the 2024 Grammy Awards.
Lasso will be Lanaâ€™s tenth studio album. Her ninth album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, was released on March 24, 2023. It received critical acclaim from music critics and was nominated for five Grammys, including Album of the Year and Best Alternative Music Album.
Since she started her career, Lana has always been on the top of her game. Her music is typically alternative pop and folk, but sheâ€™s experimenting with a whole new genre for her next album. Keep reading for everything you need to know about Lanaâ€™s country album.
When Does Lana Del Reyâ€™s New Album Come Out?
Lana confirmed at the Billboard event that Lasso will be released in September 2024.
However, as Lana fans know, plans for any of her albums are subject to change. After releasing her seventh album, Chemtrails over the Country Club, in March 2021, Lana announced that her next album titled Rock Candy Sweet was coming out in June 2021. Instead, her eighth album ended up being titled Blue Bannisters, and it didnâ€™t come out until October 2021.
What Songs Are On Lana Del Reyâ€™s New Album?
Aside from the fact that Lasso is a country album, Lana hasnâ€™t revealed much about the specific music on the LP.
Lana has explored the country genre before, though not in the case of a full-length album. She covered Tammy Wynetteâ€˜s â€œStand By Your Manâ€ during a performance in Nashville in September 2023. Two months later, Lana did a rendition of Elvis Presleyâ€˜s â€œUnchained Melodyâ€ for the Christmas at Graceland NBC special. And in December, Lana released her cover of John Denverâ€˜s â€œTake Me Home, Country Roads.â€
What Has Lana Del Rey Said About Her New Album?
Lana talked about her upcoming country album at the Billboard event on January 31. â€œIf you canâ€™t already tell by our award winners and our performers, the music business is going country. Weâ€™re going country. Itâ€™s happening,â€ she said.
The â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ singer also confirmed that Jack Antonoff and Luke Laird are producing the album, which will be released through Interscope Records and Polydor Records. Jack, who is Taylor Swiftâ€˜s most frequent collaborator, has worked with Lana since her sixth album, Norman F***ing Rockwell!

title: SZA, Olivia Rodrigo and Men Come Up Short
content:
Everybody gets a trophy! Well, we donâ€™t want to sound that dismissive of the way the Grammys like to spread the love. But it did seem as if the Recording Academy votership was determined to give nearly all the major nominees at least one significant award. And not allowing any of the multiply nominated artists a sweep means fewer of them come in for so-called snubs. Still, if weâ€™re focusing on the top three all-genre categories, especially, in as strong a year of candidates as this one, there are going to be a fair amount of deserving superstars who will have to have their genre-specific awards to keep them warm tonight.
Letâ€™s just point out before we get into the snubs that Variety correctly picked all four top winners: Taylor Swift for album of the year, Miley Cyrus for record of the year, Billie Eilish for song of the year and Victoria Monet as best new artist. So can any of those count as surprises? To much of the viewing audience, maybe, but not to us, and few other soothsayers in our midst.
So letâ€™s make this a (nearly) all-snubs edition of Snubs & Surprisesâ€¦ even though everyoneâ€™s a winner, etc.
SNUB: Men. It turns out they really arenâ€™t Ken-ough!
Well, this was a foregone conclusion, even going into the telecast. In the top three categories, the only male artist to get even a single nomination was Jon Batiste â€” and unlike 2022, he was not due for a series of upsets this time. But a telecast in which not one male artist wins one of the televised awards? This imbalance is historicâ€¦ and some of us love it, knowing the pendulum will likely swing back to an era in which someone is tempted to say women need to step up.
SNUB: SZAâ€™s slaying streak doesnâ€™t extend to the top categories.
SZA came into the ceremony with the most nominations â€” nine â€” but only picked up a third of those. â€œOnlyâ€ is a relative thing; most other candidates would kill Bill, or anyone else, to rack up that many. But her failure to come through in any of the top all-genre categories was either (a) just the product of too many juggernauts to reward in a big way this year, or (b) a failure of diversity, continuing in the tradition of Beyonce being unable to win album of the year even once. Expect to see these and probably many other theories discussed in the hours and days to come.
SNUB: New artists... MIA on the telecast.
Of course there was a win in the best new artist category â€” for Variety cover star Victoria Monet, as we predicted in these pages. But in watching the telecast, youâ€™d be hard-pressed to know there are any new artists in music at all, despite the most potent lineup in that category in years and years. When you have performers as galvanizing as Monet, Noah Kahan (currently one of the top ticket draws in America with his sold-out coming tour, with a perennial top 5 album), Jelly Roll (already a country superstar) and The War and Treatyâ€¦ not one of them is deserving of a prime-time spot? We may love our Billy Joel, but somethingâ€™s wrong with this formula.
SNUB: Lana Del Rey: still a cult artist, according to the Recording Academy.
Still Grammy-less for an unshared award of her own after all these years, and after 11 nominations. Thatâ€™s not flash flooding hitting the Los Angeles area tonight: thatâ€™s the tunnel under Ocean Blvd. overflowing with Lana fansâ€™ tears. But she did share in Taylor Swiftâ€™s album win for their duet, and her iconography will hardly be tarnished if the Academy didnâ€™t acknowledge what almost everyone else did: that â€œDid You Knowâ€¦â€ was the best album of her career, with probably still greater peaks to come.
SNUB: Olivia Rodrigoâ€™s slightly sour shutout.
Rodrigo was the other biggest artist to get shut out this year, although, unlike Del Rey, she already has some silver on her shelf. Itâ€™s hard to imagine an album as universally acclaimed and as wildly commercial as â€œGutsâ€ could come home empty-handed, yet it did. Only in considering the strength of the competition does it seem even conceivable that we didnâ€™t just dream Rodrigo not having an armful. Will this matter a whit when Rodrigo shortly gets underway on the tour that is one of the toughest tickets of 2024? Not likely â€” and voters practically figured that she has about six decades ahead of her to rack up wins.
SNUB: Jon Batiste canâ€™t make lightning quite strike twice.
Batiste was the surprise success story two years ago, and itâ€™s hard to pull off a shockeroo twice in close succession, even with as many nominations as he once again got this time. But the most joyful man in music still came away a winner for his tribute to Bill Withers in the In Memoriam segment, with Oscar contention still to look forward to â€” and a currently widely seen documentary that has the potential to change lives.
SURPRISE: Miley Cyrus finally wins a Grammy, and cuts to the head of the line.
Maybe we can count â€œFlowers'â€ win as record of the year as a surprise. Yes, Variety correctly predicted it, but most other forecasters were going with the Taylor Swift, SZA or Billie Eilish singles â€” and not without good reason, because not only were all three of those strong contenders, but Cyrus had never won any Grammy before, let alone a pinnacle prize. Her cocky self-intro and acceptance speech were funny enough to give the telecast a taste of what itâ€™d been missing by shutting her out all these years.
SURPRISE: Phoebe Bridgers educates the Grammys, better late than never.
Again, given the year Boygenius had, there was nothing truly shocking about the four awards picked up by Bridgers, three of them with the band. But this stands in radical contrast to the zero she picked up as the hottest artist of the moment her last time at the Grammys, in 2021, contending for the star-making â€œPunisher.â€ So, remembering just how recently the Academy voters got it completely wrong in regards to Bridgers, it was reassuring to see they can be fast learners â€” well-semi-fast â€” when they need to.

title: Quavo & Lana Del Rey Sighting Sparks Relationship Rumors
content:
Quavo and Lana Del Rey were spotted out in Los Angeles this week, sparking rumors of a potential relationship. The pair were spotted walking together and were later seen laughing in the back of a chauffeured vehicle. Could this be the next big musical power couple? It's unclear how the couple met but safe to say, people are confused by the pairing.
"This wasn't on my 2024 bingo card!" one X user wrote. "This is so random...watch them get married and have five kids," added another. The link-up also led people to contemplate how it might affect their onward musical projects. "She gonna make a song about BBC and summer time sadness," theorized one user. However, others were surprised it had taken her this long to date a Black man. "Honestly I always wondered why never [she] dated a black guy she always seem to be one of those white girls that do," said someone else. However, rumors did once persist about Del Rey and A$AP Rocky after he starred in her "National Anthem" video.
Read More: Quavo Invites Fan Wearing Young Thug Shirt On Stage In Dubai
Quavo Surprises Fans With Fashion Week Concert
Del Rey is from New York City, where Quavo surprised fans during fashion week last year. The former Migos rapper drew a massive crowd in the center of New York City as the former Migos rapper pulled up for an impromptu concert. The Atlanta rapper is in the Big Apple for New York Fashion Week but decided to make some headlines away from the runways. In a clip uploaded to social media, Quavo could be heard performing "Hotel Lobby" to the assembled crowd. Furthermore, the concert appears to come courtesy of SideTalk NYC, the viral "one-minute street interview" show.
Fans were overjoyed by the surprise concert. Additionally, many were surprised (and excited) to see that True Religion, Quavo's fashion line, may be making a return. "If you stopped wearing Tru because rappers did you corny ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚," one person said. "Damn... true religion back??? I just roasted a Walmart worker for ..... nvm... Go crazy," added another. However, some people pointed out the double standard that Quavo could do this and be fine but Kai Cenat was arrested for "the same thing". On this note - the Quavo concert was probably planned, while the Cenat giveaway was not. Meanwhile, people were not fully rioting at Quavo's concert.
Read More: Quavo Joins Popcaan At Unruly Fest In Jamaica
[via]

title: Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce keen to attend 2024 Coachella festival: Hereâ€™s why
content:
Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce were spotted spending time together in a throwback clip
Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are keen to attend 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival later this month in California for Lana Del Rey and Jack Antonoff.
A source spilled to the US Weekly, â€œThey both want to see Lana Del Rey and [Jack Antonoffâ€™s band] Bleachers.â€
For the unversed, both Lana and Jack are close friends and collaborators of Taylor.
The outlet reported that songstress and Travis would â€œrent a house in the areaâ€ for one of the two festival weekends, which will run back-to-back weekends April 12-14 and 19-21.
The source shared that Travis would stay with Taylor until late April. However, the NFL star would also shoot a commercial in Los Angeles on April 12.
Reflecting on ad shooting, the second source pointed out, â€œTaylor is very excited about the opportunities Travis is getting and fully supports him.â€
â€œBut she wants him to be conscious of his schedule. The only issue is making sure they can see each other,â€ stated a third source.
Taylor and Travis, who began dating in summer 2023, had been together since the singer completed her Eras Tour shows in Singapore in early March.
Before that, Travis joined the pop icon in both Australia and Singapore to support her after she flew to Las Vegas in February to cheer him on in the Super Bowl.
Interestingly, Taylor is on a two-month hiatus from touring before she resumes her Eras Tour in May Travis will reportedly return to Kansas City in July for training camp.
Looking at the couple, the third source added, â€œTheyâ€™re having so much fun and enjoying things,â€ while they are also â€œthinking of next stepsâ€.

title: Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce plan to attend Coachella 2024
content:
Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)
Taylor Swift and Travis Kelceâ€™s next adventure is taking them to the desert.
The â€œLoverâ€ singer and the Kansas City Chiefs tight end are planning to attend Coachella 2024 to see some of their A-list friends perform, according to Us Weekly.
â€œThey both want to see Lana Del Rey and [Jack Antonoffâ€™s band] Bleachers,â€ an insider told the magazine Wednesday.
8 Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce will reportedly attend Coachella. Danny Mahoney/Wynn Las Vegas / MEGA
8 A source told Us Weekly they plan to rent a house in the area for the music festival. AFP via Getty Images
Both Del Rey, 38, and Antonoff, 40, have collaborated with Swift.
Del Rey, who attended the 2024 Super Bowl with Swift, is serving as one of the headliners for the music festival, which will take place April 12 to 14 and April 19 to 21 at the the Empire Polo Club in Indio, Calif. Bleachers will take one of the stages on April 13 and April 20.
Swift and Kelce, both 34, will be â€œrenting a house in the areaâ€ for one of the two festival weekends, the source added.
8 The â€œCruel Summerâ€ singer is expected to watch headliner and close friend Lana Del Rey perform. Getty Images
8 The couple also wants to see Jack Antonoffâ€™s Bleachers take the stage. Getty Images for The Recording Academy
Want more celebrity and pop culture news? Start your day with Page Six Daily. Thanks for signing up! Enter your email address Please provide a valid email address. By clicking above you agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. Want celebrity news as it breaks? Hooked on Housewives? Check out more newsletters
Reps for Swift and Kelce didnâ€™t immediately return Page Sixâ€™s requests for comment.
The famed athlete, who is currently in the offseason from the NFL, is expected to stay with the newly minted billionaire until late April, the insider added, with a second source noting that Kelce is shooting a commercial in Los Angeles the weekend of April 12.
â€œTaylor is very excited about the opportunities Travis is getting and fully supports him,â€ a third source told Us Weekly. â€œ[But] she wants him to be conscious of his schedule. The only issue is making sure they can see each other.â€
8 The Kansas City Chiefs tight end already confirmed he would fly to Europe to watch some of Swiftâ€™s Eras Tour dates. Todd Leabo / X
8 â€œAny chance that I can show my support to her â€” knowing that she has shown me all the support in the world throughout the season,â€ he told â€œEntertainment Tonight.â€ AFP via Getty Images
The â€œOut of the Woodsâ€ singer resumes her Eras Tour in May, and Kelce already confirmed that he will fly to Europe to watch her perform.
For more Page Six you loveâ€¦
â€œOh, you know I gotta go support,â€ he told â€œEntertainment Tonightâ€ when asked whether he would be â€œpacking [his] bagsâ€ soon, adding that he had to pay back the favor after she attended numerous football games.
8 Unfortunately, Swift wonâ€™t be able to attend the athleteâ€™s Kelce Jam in May. AP
8 Sheâ€™ll be taking the stage in Stockholm during Kelceâ€™s music festival. Megan Fox / Instagram
â€œWe are both very career-driven. I think we both love what we do, and any chance that I can show my support to her â€” knowing that she has shown me all the support in the world throughout the season â€” itâ€™s just been an amazing experience getting to know Tay,â€ he added.
Unfortunately, Swift will not be able to attend Kelceâ€™s music festival, Kelce Jam, in May because she will be performing in Sweden.
The couple started dating last summer.

title: How to master the lip contour hack behind pop starsâ€™ perfect pouts
content:
Page Six may be compensated and/or receive an affiliate commission if you buy through our links.
Looking to pump up your pout without using filler? Lip contouringâ€™s the viral technique youâ€™ve got to try.
And few know more about makeupâ€™s mouth-perfecting powers than Etienne Ortega, the go-to glam guru for pop stars including Lana Del Rey, Christina Aguilera, Mariah Carey and Demi Lovato.
â€œThe ombrÃ© lip has definitely become my signature. People love it,â€ Ortega tells Page Six Style. â€œA lip always gives you confidence and when itâ€™s a little overdrawn, it just makes it look more sexy.â€
Etienne Ortega has worked with Christina Aguilera for years; the â€œBeautifulâ€ singer presented him with the makeup artist of the year award at the 2022 Daily Front Row Fashion Los Angeles Awards. WireImage
Heâ€™s also Kris Jennerâ€™s go-to glam guru. FilmMagic
As such, the in-demand makeup artist (whoâ€™s also worked with the Kardashian-Jenners) focused on lips for the launch his new makeup line, Ortega, offering up an oil, clear gloss, liners and crayon-style color sticks so fans of his star clients can replicate their dreamy contoured lip combos at home.
Of course, using a mix of light and dark shades to create the illusion of a fuller, more shapely mouth is an art unto itself â€” so we asked the artist to demonstrate three of his favorite lip combos on Page Six staffers. Read on for a trio of tutorials.
Lana Del Reyâ€™s Cinnamon Girl Glam
Brian Zak/NY Post; Getty Images
â€œMy signature look with Lana is a very cool-toned lip,â€ Ortega explains. â€œHer look is so simple but yet so iconic and timeless.â€
Step 1: Prep
Brian Zak/NY Post
Start by prepping the lips with a balm like Blu Nectar Lip Oil, a jelly-like formula made with hydrating blue agave nectar, jojoba oil, vitamin E, aloe and squalane that â€œfeels like silk,â€ per Ortega. Leave on for several minutes (or however long you like), then remove.
â€œYou have the smoothest surface after; even when you wipe it off, you just feel super hydrated and rejuvenated,â€ he says.
Step 2: Liner
Brian Zak/NY Post
Line the lips with your choice of a caramel or mauve liner. Ortega regularly uses two shades of his own Soft Contour Lip Liner on Del Rey: Cinnamon Girl (the name was inspired by one of her songs) and LA Chic.
When it comes to liner, the artist swears by his own signature technique: â€œI like to start in the Cupidâ€™s bow and draw a little line down the middle. Then, I start to draw a heart on the Cupidâ€™s bow, slightly overlined. Thatâ€™s how you get that very pouty look that Lana has,â€ he explains. â€œAfter Iâ€™m done doing the heart on the top, I like to underline the bottom of the lip, and this kind of helps us as our guide.â€
After â€œconnecting the dotsâ€ by lining the entire mouth, Ortega continues, â€œI like to start filling in at the corners of the lip for an ombrÃ© effect. I usually like to get a brush and then just blend out the edges for a much more diffused look. That helps soften everything up.â€
Just donâ€™t fill in the entire lip with liner: â€œFor that ombrÃ© look, you want to make sure that you are separating the deeper tone from the lighter tone,â€ he cautions. â€œIf I start to mix it all together, youâ€™re not going to have that dimension, so you want to keep certain areas open for the lip color.â€
Step 3: Color
Brian Zak/NY Post
Fill in those open spaces using Agave Color Glow Stick in Nubes, or the pale pink-nude lipstick of your choice.
â€œIâ€™m keeping it very center-focused to keep that ombrÃ© effect,â€ Ortega says. â€œFrom there, Iâ€™ll go back with my brush and start to blend out the edges and blend it into the liner.â€
Step 4: Gloss
Brian Zak/NY Post
Finish with a slick of clear gloss, like the Liquid Icon Hyper Gloss from Ortegaâ€™s new line.
â€œI really worked hard on this formula because I didnâ€™t want it to be really sticky, but I did want it to be very shiny. I like to focus this mostly in the center,â€ he shares, adding that applying gloss mainly to the middle of the mouth creates the illusion of fuller, more luscious lips.
Demi Lovatoâ€™s Dreamy Nude Hues
Brian Zak/NY Post; Getty Images
Lovato often gravitates toward a nude lip, like the one Ortega created for this yearâ€™s Vanity Fair Oscar Party.
â€œWe got a lot of hype. Everyone loved the look,â€ he recalls.
Step 1: Prep
Brian Zak/NY Post
Apply a balm like Blu Nectar Lip Oil to hydrate the lips. Leave on for several minutes (or however long you like), then remove.
Step 2: Liner
Brian Zak/NY Post
Apply a rich, chocolatey brown liner like Soft Contour Lip Liner in Xola (the name nods to Ortegaâ€™s and Lovatoâ€™s shared Mexican roots), using the aforementioned technique of drawing a heart on the Cupidâ€™s bow, connecting it around the mouth and then filling in the corners.
â€œMy girls love an overlined lip,â€ he says. â€œIt creates a very pouty effect.â€
Step 3: Color
Brian Zak/NY Post
Fill in the rest of the mouth using a warm nude lipstick like Agave Glow Color Stick in Para Siempre, a hue whose name nods to another of Ortegaâ€™s clients: Mariah Carey.
â€œShe has a song called â€˜Forever,'â€ he notes. â€œThereâ€™s a little meaning to each shade.â€
For more Page Six Style â€¦
Christina Aguileraâ€™s Muse-Worthy Mauves
Brian Zak/NY Post; Getty Images
â€œMy mauve shades are definitely inspired by Christina,â€ Ortega says.
â€œMusa is one of the shades, which means â€˜muse.â€™ I named it after her because sheâ€™s my muse! Weâ€™ve been rocking the mauves for a minute, and itâ€™s kind of our go-to right now.â€
Step 1: Prep
Brian Zak/NY Post
Apply a balm like Blu Nectar Lip Oil to hydrate the lips. Leave on for several minutes (or however long you like), then remove.
Step 2: Liner
Brian Zak/NY Post
Apply a mauve liner like Soft Contour Lip Liner in Musa (Aguileraâ€™s signature shade) using Ortegaâ€™s aforementioned technique: Draw a small heart at the Cupidâ€™s bow, underline the bottom lip, connect to the corners and fill in the sides of the mouth to create an ombrÃ© effect.
â€œA lot of the time I use a little bit of foundation to clean up the edges if you want a really defined, sharp lip,â€ he says, sharing one of his go-to tricks.
Step 3: Color
Brian Zak/NY Post
Fill in the open spaces in the middle of the mouth using a pale pink-nude lipstick like Agave Color Glow Stick in Nubes, blending with a lip brush as desired.
â€œItâ€™s a very versatile shade for you to create that pop of lightness at the center,â€ Ortega says.
