content:
Visitantes del festival de mÃºsica en el valle de Coachella en abril de 2023.
Hoy se enciende la mÃºsica en el Empire Polo Club de pueblo Indio (California) para inaugurar la ediciÃ³n 2024 de Coachella, uno de los festivales de mÃºsica mÃ¡s importantes del mundo. Como ya es tradiciÃ³n, el cartel del evento se dividirÃ¡ en dos fines de semana e incluirÃ¡ una amplia oferta musical para todos los gustos, y la asistencia de mÃ¡s de 125.000 personas por dÃ­a.
Desde que fuera anunciado a principios de este aÃ±o, el line up del festival no es solo uno de los mÃ¡s variados hasta la fecha, tambiÃ©n uno de los mÃ¡s prometedores porque incluye el regreso de la agrupaciÃ³n estadounidense No Doubt tras varios aÃ±os alejada de los escenarios. Otra que reaparecerÃ¡ cantando en el desierto es Lana de Rey y los artistas Doja Cat y Tyler The Creator.
Los hispanos estarÃ¡n muy bien representados con Peso Pluma, J Balvin, CarÃ­n LeÃ³n, Bizarrap, y propuestas mÃ¡s emergentes como la del dÃºo ecuatoriano Hermanos GutiÃ©rrez, los mexicanos Girl Ultra y Deftones, el rapero Santa Fe Klan, y los espaÃ±oles DepresiÃ³n Sonora y Bb Trickz, entre otros. En total, serÃ¡n unas veinte propuestas de origen hispano las que se verÃ¡n en el festival.
El aÃ±o pasado, Bad Bunny se convirtiÃ³ en el primer artista latinoamericano en encabezar el cartel en la historia de Coachella, mientras que RosalÃ­a revalidÃ³ su tÃ­tulo de superestrella en el evento, dejando en evidencia la plataforma que este representa para cualquier artista que busque una proyecciÃ³n a escala global.
Â¿CuÃ¡les son los dÃ­as de Coachella 2024?
El festival iniciarÃ¡ el viernes 12 y culmina su primer fin de semana el domingo 14. Luego harÃ¡ una pausa de cuatro dÃ­as para retomar las presentaciones el viernes 19, el sÃ¡bado 20 y domingo 21 de abril.
Actuaciones del primer fin de semana y horarios
La primera jornada tendrÃ¡ como platos fuertes a Peso Pluma, cuya presentaciÃ³n estÃ¡ pautada para las 21.05, y a Lana del Rey a las 23.20 (hora de Los Ãngeles), ambos en el escenario Coachella. En medio de estos dos conciertos, actuarÃ¡ Justice, en el Outdoor Theatre, a las 22.15, y un poco mÃ¡s temprano, especÃ­ficamente a las 19.45, estarÃ¡ Bizarrap en el escenario Sahara.
El sÃ¡bado 12 actuarÃ¡ Jungle a las 20.40 en el Outdoor Theatre, mientras que en el escenario Coachella, cantarÃ¡ No Doubt a las 21.25, y cerrarÃ¡ Tyler The Creator a las 23.40. Para terminar el primer fin de semana, CarÃ­n LeÃ³n se presentarÃ¡ en el escenario Coachella a las 17.25, y le seguirÃ¡n J Balvin a las 20.20 y Doja Cat a las 22.25.
El Ãºltimo fichaje de Coachella 2024 fue la banda de los neoyorquinos Vampire Weekend, que acaban de lanzar su quinto Ã¡lbum, pero actuarÃ¡n solo el primer fin de semana del evento, especÃ­ficamente el sÃ¡bado 13 a las 17.00, en el Outdoor Theatre. El resto de las actuaciones sÃ­ se repetirÃ¡n el segundo fin de semana, pero los horarios aÃºn no han sido anunciados.
Â¿DÃ³nde ver en vivo las actuaciones de Coachella 2024?
El canal de YouTube del festival volverÃ¡ a transmitir en streaming todas las actuaciones del festival de forma gratuita. EstarÃ¡n disponibles las seÃ±ales de cada uno de los escenarios del evento:
Precio de las entradas
En Coachella, no se compran accesos por dÃ­a sino el abono para el primer o segundo fin de semana. Estos son los precios de los pases:
Pase general : solo estÃ¡ disponible para el segundo fin de semana por 499 dÃ³lares mÃ¡s gastos. Permite la entrada al recinto, estacionamiento durante los tres dÃ­as y la posibilidad de visitar el camping.
Pase general y traslado : solo estÃ¡ disponible para el segundo fin de semana por 619 dÃ³lares mÃ¡s gastos. Permite la entrada al recinto, ademÃ¡s de la posibilidad de visitar el camping.
Pase VIP: solo estÃ¡ disponible para el segundo fin de semana por 1.069 dÃ³lares mÃ¡s gastos. Permite la entrada al recinto, el estacionamiento durante los tres dÃ­as, y el acceso a las zonas VIP del festival. Estos espacios disponen de baÃ±os con aire acondicionado, zonas de sombra y alimentos y bebidas premium.
Todos los precios y posibilidades para disfrutar de la mÃ­tica acampada de Coachella en este enlace.
Â¿CuÃ¡l es la trascendencia de Coachella en la industria de la mÃºsica?
Para festejar el 25 aniversario de Coachella, YouTube Originals ha producido un documental llamado Coachella: 20 aÃ±os en el desierto para reunir las actuaciones e historias que dieron forma a uno de los eventos mÃ¡s importantes de la mÃºsica. La pelÃ­cula incluye entrevistas y las actuaciones de varios de los artistas mÃ¡s importantes de nuestro tiempo, como Billie Eilish, Daft Punk, LCD Soundsystem, BjÃ¶rk, Madonna, Moby, Radiohead y muchos mÃ¡s.
Siga toda la informaciÃ³n de El PAÃS AmÃ©rica en Facebook y X, o en nuestra newsletter semanal.

title: Doja Cat, Lana Del Rey, Tyler the Creator & More At Coachella
content:
Coachella takes LA by storm this weekend, with headliners like Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat and Tyler the Creator taking the stage and many more exciting artists playing at the iconic desert festival. Hereâ€™s all the artists and parties you should look out for during the yearâ€™s hottest music festival.
Tetris Kelly:
The desert is open for business and with weekend one of Coachella kicking off, weâ€™re telling you what you can expect from one of musicâ€™s biggest weekends. Doja Cat, Tyler the Creator and Lana Del Rey are the weekendâ€™s headliners with a special super hyped appearance by No Doubt. But the excitement doesnâ€™t stop there. Latin music is bigger than ever at the fest with Peso Pluma taking the stage and we hear J Balvin has an epic set on the way. We canâ€™t wait for the weekend surprises. Weâ€™ll also be at all the biggest parties hanging out at Revolve Fest kicking it with Celsius, Neon Carnival and so much more. Thank you Saweetie. Our full recap will be out on Monday.

title: Lana Del Rey duets with Billie Eilish during Coachella headline performance
content:
Lana Del Rey performed a surprise duet with Billie Eilish during her star-studded headline performance at Coachella.
The US singer arrived early on stage, after hitting the headlines last year for delayed performances at Glastonbury and BST Hyde Park festival, before singing a host of hits including Summertime Sadness and her 2012 hit Born To Die.
Advertisement
The headline show saw Del Rey bring on Grammy-winner Jon Batiste, who had performed at the festival earlier in the day, to play the piano on her hit Candy Necklace.
Billie Eilish appeared during Lana Del Reyâ€™s headline performance (Jonathan Brady/PA)
â€œYou know sometimes you just need somebody elseâ€™s spirit to move with you and (itâ€™s) always going to be Jon Batiste,â€ 38-year-old Del Rey said.
Advertisement
Immediately after the track, Del Rey manoeuvred up the on-stage stairs to a Juliet balcony, where she hugged two-time Oscar Winner Eilish to rapturous applause.
Advertisement
The pair performed Eilishâ€™s 2016 track Ocean Eyes, before duetting on Del Reyâ€™s 2012 hit song Video Games.
Eilishâ€™s surprise appearance comes days after she announced that her third album, Hit Me Hard And Soft, will be released next month.
The headline slot also saw Jack Antonoff, Taylor Swiftâ€™s long-time collaborator, play the piano on Hope Is A Dangerous Thing For A Woman Like Me To Have â€“ But I Have It.
Advertisement
do you ever just pic.twitter.com/jhqXtkBwRd â€” Coachella (@coachella) April 13, 2024
Advertisement
Del Rey, whose last appearance at the festival was her debut in 2014, was scheduled to feature in the 2020 Coachella line-up which was cancelled amid the Covid pandemic.
â€œWeâ€™re here 10 years ago exactly to the day,â€ she told the audience.
Del Rey closed her performance to her 2013 hit Young And Beautiful, with an extensive firework display.
Advertisement
The first day of the Californian festival also saw Shakira announce an upcoming world tour during a surprise appearance at Coachella.
The Colombian singer appeared as a guest during the set of Argentinian music producer and DJ Bizarrap to perform their new track La Fuerte and BZRP Music Sessions, Vol 53.
During her performance, the backdrop behind her changed to say â€œShakira, Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran World Tourâ€.
Advertisement
The 47-year-old told the crowd at the Californian festival: â€œFinally, we are going on tour. Starting here, this November in this city, canâ€™t wait.â€
The Hips Donâ€™t Lie star also told the festival audience â€œthis is amazingâ€ when she first appeared wearing a red glittery ensemble with matching red boots.
Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran, released last month, is the 12th studio album from the singer and first in seven years.
The announcement comes a day after the She Wolf singer posted a message on Instagram in Spanish, which translated to â€œthe wolf is comingâ€.
Coachella, renowned for attracting celebrities and influencers from across the world, also saw performances from Mexican singer Peso Pluma and South Korean DJ and singer Peggy Gou.
The return of Coachella comes after it ran into problems with headline acts over the last two years.
Last year, Frank Ocean pulled out of his second headline performance because of a leg injury while Kanye West, also known as Ye, was due to headline in 2022 but the line-up was updated weeks before the event.

title: Lana Del Rey mesmerises audience with soulful performance at Coachella
content:
Lana Del Rey performed at Coachella
Lana Del Rey mesmerised her fans with a soulful performance at Coachella 2024.
On Friday night, the singer made an iconic entry standing on the back of a motorcycle as she headed towards the stage.
Dressed in a stunning sparkly blue dress, Lana looked beautiful while singing her hit tracks for the music festival attendees.
Notably, Billie Eilish made a surprising appearance during Lana's headlining set as a special guest.
The duo sang Lana's 2012 song Video Games together, leaving the internet in a frenzy.
Moreover, the Summertime Sadness singer's breathtaking look for Coachella has been lauded by her fans.
Previously, Lana's makeup artist Etienne Ortega told People magazine that they are "going to switch up" her style "a little bit."
The makeup artist shared, "We're still going to have a liner. Lana can't be Lana without her infamous liner!"
Etienne added, "But tonight's colour story is a bit more warm tones. Usually, we do a cool-tone eye, a very black, bold liner."
"We're going for a little bit more of browns, like a brown warm sandy palette with gold, with a little bit of a golden, radiant skin."

title: Lana Del Rey: Stars machen sich fÃ¼r das Coachella warm
content:
Am heutigen Freitag beginnt das diesjÃ¤hrige Coachella-Festival. Zu den Headlinern gehÃ¶ren Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat und Tyler, the Creator.
Das diesjÃ¤hrige Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival steht kurz vor dem Startschuss. Ab 19 Uhr mitteleuropÃ¤ischer Zeit werden am heutigen 12. April bei dem legendÃ¤ren Musikevent in Kalifornien die ersten Bands eine der insgesamt acht BÃ¼hnen erklimmen.
Obwohl sich auch in diesem Jahr mit Lana Del Rey, 38, Doja Cat, 28, Tyler, the Creator, 33, oder den extra wiedervereinigten Neunzigerjahre-Ikonen von No Doubt wieder einige groÃŸe Namen im Line-Up finden, lief der Vorverkauf Ã¼berraschend schleppend. WÃ¤hrend im letzten Jahr alle Tickets innerhalb weniger Tage vergriffen waren, kam es dieses Jahr offenbar zu einem eklatanten RÃ¼ckgang des Interesses. Wie der britische "Guardian" berichtet, dauerte der Verkauf von 125.000 Tickets fÃ¼r das erste Wochenende diesmal ganze 27 Tage. FÃ¼r das zweite Wochenende sollen sogar noch einige Tickets verfÃ¼gbar sein.
Lana Del Rey freut sich auf "groÃŸe und gewaltige" Show
US-SÃ¤ngerin Lana Del Rey, die 2014 zum ersten Mal bei dem Festival auftrat, lieÃŸ sich im Vorfeld von den mÃ¤ÃŸigen Verkaufszahlen nicht beirren. In einem Interview mit der "Vogue" sagte sie: "Ich freue mich sehr darauf, als Headliner aufzutreten. Es ist lustig, weil es auf den Tag genau zehn Jahre her ist, dass ich dort war, was verrÃ¼ckt ist." FÃ¼r ihre Show habe sie "eine Menge Dinge in Bewegung gesetzt" und hoffe nun, dass diese auch so "groÃŸ und gewaltig" werde, wie geplant. "Architektonisch wird es von der Struktur abhÃ¤ngen, und davon, ob ich es schaffen kann", so die SÃ¤ngerin. "Aber ich freue mich sehr darauf. Ich bin aufgeregt, also kÃ¶nnen sich meine Fans auch freuen."
Kommt Superstar Taylor Swift auch vorbei?
GerÃ¼chten zufolge wird sich auch Lana Del Reys gute Freundin Taylor Swift, 34, zusammen mit ihrem Freund Travis Kelce, 34, auf dem Festival blicken lassen. Ob sie bei dieser Gelegenheit fÃ¼r einen gemeinsamen Song zu Lana auf die BÃ¼hne steigt, bleibt abzuwarten. Ihr Freund Travis gab sich gegenÃ¼ber dem Magazin "People" vor wenigen Tagen noch zuversichtlich, dem Event beiwohnen zu kÃ¶nnen. Dort sagte er: "Ich bin ein Coachella-Typ. Ich liebe es, zum Coachella zu gehen. Ich liebe Live-Musik im Allgemeinen. Vielleicht seht ihr mich also irgendwann dort drÃ¼ben auftauchen."
Das Festival im Livestream
Musikfans, die leider nicht anreisen kÃ¶nnen, um ihre Stars dort live zu erleben, mÃ¼ssen nicht traurig sein. Auf ihrem YouTube-Kanal bieten die Veranstalter des Festivals kostenlose Live-Streams an, Ã¼ber die sich das Geschehen auf den BÃ¼hnen auch vom heimischen Sofa aus mitverfolgen lÃ¤sst.

title: Lana, Tyler, Doja headline Coachella where Swift rumored to appear
content:
Hordes of music fans were arriving in California's Coachella Valley for the premier arts festival that begins Friday and features headliners Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat and Tyler, the Creator.
No Doubt -- the group fronted by Gwen Stefani, which reached peak fame in the 1990s -- will also reunite onstage for the first time since 2015.
And rumors are flying that none other than Taylor Swift, the megastar currently on break from her blockbuster, billion-dollar Eras tour, could make a surprise appearance on the festival grounds dramatically flanked by the San Jacinto Mountains.
Swift is not on the lineup but speculation is abuzz that she could appear on stage with friend Lana Del Rey or with rock band Bleachers -- which is fronted by Jack Antonoff, her longtime producer.
It would also be the perfect moment to promo her forthcoming album, "The Tortured Poets Department," which drops April 19.
But hopeful fan gossip aside, it's far from Coachella's buzziest year.
Ticket sales were sluggish compared to seasons past, although prices have remained in the $500 range for general admission and over $1,000 for VIP passes.
A decade ago, Coachella entries were snapped up within an hour. This year, weekend one took a month to sell out, while the second round -- for which the lineup essentially remains the same -- still has tickets up for grabs.
The 2024 edition follows a hard act. Last year, Bad Bunny helmed a historic year in which none of the major acts were white for the first time and where the reggaeton titan was the first Spanish-language and Latin American act ever to headline.
And another group with an insatiable fan base, K-pop group Blackpink of South Korea, was in 2023 the first top-billed Asian act.
Meanwhile, reclusive R&B artist Frank Ocean notoriously dropped out of the second weekend after his initial set was inordinately delayed over a leg injury, angering many fans.
- Virtual star, Latin revolution -
Despite the slump in sales, Coachella 2024 features an eclectic line-up including many international acts, a consistent trend at the festival originally centered on alternative rock.
Japan's famed virtual singer Hatsune Miku -- a Vocaloid software voicebank whose personification is a teen girl with turquoise hair -- will make a Coachella debut after originally being booked for 2020.
The "artist" -- who is not real -- began as a virtual instrument in 2007, and has grown into a cultural icon, touring since 2014.
The stage production will include visuals and a live band.
"We have no idea what to expect from the crowd...and the crowd doesn't know what to expect," said Riki Tsuji, who is on the business team of Crypton Future Media, the company behind Hatsune Miku.
"I'm sure we're going to have a ton of people who... have probably never heard of Hatsune Miku before," Tsuji told AFP.
The Grammy-nominated Cimafunk will become the first Cuban-born artist to ever play Coachella, bringing his brand of Afro-Cubano funk inflected with disco and horns to the desert.
He is among the plethora of Latin acts that also include Puerto Rico's fast-rising star Young Miko along with Peso Pluma, the Mexican superstar who broke into the global mainstream with a string of hits over the past year.
Both are among the artists who have collaborated with Argentina's Bizarrap, one of the most streamed Latin American artists in the world whose recording partnerships have also included Shakira and Residente.
Saint Levant, the Jerusalem-born artist of Palestinian, Algerian, French and Serbian origins -- who spent much of his childhood in Gaza -- will take the stage after finding fame across social media, including for his 2023 hit "From Gaza With Love."
Britain's influential grime star Skepta will also perform, his second turn at the festival after debuting in 2017.
And none other than Sublime -- the 1990s stoner reggae rock group beloved for hits including "Santeria" -- will perform, with the late frontman Brad Nowell's son Jakob leading the way.
Coachella 2024 will take place April 12-14 and 19-21.

title: Lana Del Rey's Top 10 Songs on Billboard Hot 100
content:
Lana Del Rey was crowned Billboardâ€˜s Visionary Award-winner at its 2023 Women in Music event â€” but the angel-voiced New York native had already been an alt-pop pioneer for over a decade at that point.
Born Elizabeth Grant, Del Rey has been challenging the norms of songwriting since the very beginning of her career, sometimes garnering controversy in the process. Sheâ€™s known for pairing unflinching lyrics with sprawling, cinematic arrangements, exploring all corners of Americanaâ€™s sonic landscape from dreamy old Hollywood soundtracks to folksy Western elegies.
Lana earned her first entry on the Billboard Hot 100 when â€œVideo Games,â€ the lead single to her 2012 debut album Born to Die, entered the chart at No. 91. From there, she would slowly work her way up the listing, earning her first top 10 hit in 2013 thanks to her timeless single â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ peaking at No. 6 â€” a feat she wouldnâ€™t top until nearly a decade later, when her â€œSnow on the Beachâ€ duet with Taylor Swift would open at No. 4.
From her early 2010s debut to her 2024 headlining set at Coachella, keep reading to see the 10 biggest Hot 100 hits Lana Del Rey has scored so far over the course of her career.
Lana Del Reyâ€™s Biggest Billboard Hot 100 Hits ranking is based on weekly performance on the Hot 100 through the charts dated April 13, 2024. Songs are ranked based on an inverse point system, with weeks at No. 1 earning the greatest value and weeks at lower spots earning the least. Due to changes in chart methodology over the years, eras are weighted differently to account for chart turnover rates during various periods.

title: Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce staying at luxe members-only resort for Coachella
content:
Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)
Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce will be living it up while supporting Lana Del Rey at Coachella.
The couple is reportedly planning to stay at the exclusive, members-only Madison Club in La Quinta, Calif., during the music festival.
â€œThey want privacy so The Madison Club is perfect for them, because not just anyone can stay there,â€ a source told the Daily Mail Thursday.
10 Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce will reportedly stay at an exclusive resort during Coachella. Getty Images
10 â€œThey want privacy so The Madison Club is perfect for them,â€ a source said Thursday. The Madison Club/Instagram
10 The property is a members-only resort. The Madison Club/Instagram
10 â€œThey want to be able to let their guard down and be comfortable,â€ the insider added. The Madison Club/Instagram
â€œThey donâ€™t want a ton of eyes on them, they want to be able to let their guard down and be comfortable,â€ the insider added.
The luxurious resort, where Lori Loughlin and Mossimo Giannulli reportedly celebrated the end of their jail stints in 2021, also boasts a world-class golf course designed by Tom Fazio.
â€œHe loves to golf in the desert,â€ the source said of the three-time Super Bowl champ. â€œAnd The Madison Club is a great place to do just that.â€
10 The property boasts swimming pools and a golf course. The Madison Club/Instagram
10 â€œThe Madison Club is a tranquil sanctuary,â€ the website description reads. The Madison Club/Instagram
Want more celebrity and pop culture news? Start your day with Page Six Daily. Thanks for signing up! Enter your email address Please provide a valid email address. By clicking above you agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. Want celebrity news as it breaks? Hooked on Housewives? Check out more newsletters
Other amenities include a day spa and a luxe fitness facility equipped with swimming pools and fitness instructors.
Homes in the Madison Club community range from $3 to $10 million, while a golf membership initiation fee is $250,000 with an annual fee of $70,000.
â€œThe Madison Club is a tranquil sanctuary, offering sophisticated dining, and modern fitness and wellness programs. Escape to the spa and revive with a regimen of wellness treatments against a striking backdrop of the surrounding mountain ranges,â€ the website description reads.
Reps for Kelce and Swift did not immediately return our request for comment. A rep for Madison Club also didnâ€™t immediately get back to us.
Loughlin and Giannulli were spotted on the property after pleading guilty to conspiracy to commit wire and mail fraud for paying $500,000 to get their daughters, Olivia, 24, and Bella, 25, into the University of Southern California as crew recruits. The â€œFull Houseâ€ alum, 59, spent two months behind bars.
10 Lori Loughlin reportedly stayed at the hotel in 2021. AFP/Getty Images
10 The actress went to jail after pleading guilty to conspiracy to commit wire and mail fraud. Getty Images
Swift and Kelce, both 34, are expected to attend the famed festival â€” and stay at Madison Club â€” either this weekend or the following.
For more Page Six you loveâ€¦
â€œThey both want to see Lana Del Rey and [Jack Antonoffâ€™s band] Bleachers,â€ an insider told Us Weekly earlier this month.
10 Swift and Kelce started dating in 2023. Getty Images
10 The couple are expected to attend the festival while on brief breaks from their respective careers. Instagram/patty_cuts
Del Rey, 38, who attended the 2024 Super Bowl with the â€œLoverâ€ songstress, is featured on her 2022 track â€œSnow on the Beach.â€
Meanwhile, Antonoff, 40, became fast friends with the pop star after meeting in 2012, and the pair have since collaborated on multiple Grammy-winning albums.
Swift is set to release her new album, â€œThe Tortured Poets Department,â€ next Friday while on a break from her blockbuster Eras Tour. Kelce is also on a break from football after leading the Kansas City Chiefs to Super Bowl victory in February.

title: Get Ready for a Very Online Coachella
content:
Photo-Illustration: Vulture; Photos: Katherine Bomboy/NBC via Getty Images, Jason Kempin/Getty Images
Doja Cat, Lana Del Rey, and Tyler, the Creator will bring their fans to the California desert â€” and to the deserts of Twitter, to defend them â€” when they headline the premiere music festival. Itâ€™s each artistâ€™s first time with top billing at Coachella. Doja arrives off her rough-edged fourth album, Scarlet, and ready to surprise after a headline-making Coachella set in 2022. Del Rey, meanwhile, spent last summer on the festival circuit losing her vape, getting cut off at Glastonbury, and playing her ninth album, Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. And Tyler, a perennial festival showman, would seem to be readying new music for the desert, after he last played the festival circuit in 2021 and 2022 with his raucous sixth album, Call Me When You Get Lost.
Coachella will be hoping to put on a smoother festival than 2023, when Frank Oceanâ€™s messy week-one headlining set led to online fighting, ice-rink rumors, and an injury-related cancellation for week two. Blink-182 ended up surprise-headlining the second weekend, alongside the previously scheduled Bad Bunny and Blackpink. The festival dropped one good surprise already: a 5 p.m. Vampire Weekend set in the weekend-one schedule. Whatever mess goes down in the desert this year, the stans will be making sure we hear about it, starting with the mess.
What are the schedule conflicts looking like?
The weekend-one schedule dropped April 9, three days out from the beginning of the festival, so itâ€™s time to start complaining about set conflicts. Faye Webster, Chappell Roan, and Sabrina Carpenter will all be competing for Gen Zâ€™s attention around 6 p.m. on Friday, while fans of moody pop might have to book it from Suki Waterhouseâ€™s set at the Gobi stage to Lana Del Reyâ€™s headlining set. Saturday, donâ€™t miss the surprise Vampire Weekend set hiding in the 5 p.m. slot at the Outdoor Theatre, after which the millennial and Gen-X rock fans can stake out the Coachella stage for Sublime, Blur, and No Doubt back to back. Sundayâ€™s chill vibes will be abundant, especially around 8 p.m., when Khruangbin and Tems will be competing for your ears. Or, follow the party to the new Quasar Stage, where Jamie xx, Floating Points, and Daphni will be winding down a three-hour set.
Which stans will be watching?
In addition to the headliners, the lineup also includes No Doubt, Peso Pluma, Blur, J Balvin, Lil Uzi Vert, Justice, Bizarrap, Deftones, ATEEZ, Everything Always, Peggy Gou, Young Miko, Ice Spice, Gesaffelstein, Sublime, Jungle, Dom Dolla, Bleachers, Grimes, Jon Batiste, LE SSERAFIM, JhenÃ© Aiko, Khruangbin, Carin LeÃ³n, Anyma, John Summit, Lil Yachty, DJ Snake, LUDMILLA, the Rose, Sabrina Carpenter, Anti Up, Steve Angello, Ken Carson, Skepta, Faye Webster, Tyla, Yoasobi, Cloonee, Gorgon City, Tinashe, ANOTR, Charlotte de Witte, ISOxo & Knock2, Sante Fe Klan, Blxst, Purple Disco Machine, the Drums, Skream & Benga, Destroy Lonely, Orbital, AP Dhillon, ReneÃ© Rapp, Bebe Rexha, Coi Leray, NAV, Tems, BICEP, Victoria MonÃ©t, Taking Back Sunday, and 88RISING FUTURES. Squint at the picture below for the rest of the full lineup.
D.A.N.C.E
Register now for access to passes at https://t.co/qujCsdlTip. Presale begins Friday, 1/19 at 11am PT. pic.twitter.com/DlApQGXnBb â€” Coachella (@coachella) January 17, 2024
Wait, weâ€™re getting a No Doubt reunion?
Yes, and it comes after a long hiatus. Singer Gwen Stefani, bassist Tony Kanal, guitarist Tom Dumont, and drummer Adrian Young last performed together as a band in 2015.
When will influencers take over the desert?
Coachella 2024 will take place April 12-14 and 19-21.
Where can I watch online?
Take a wild guess. YouTube first became the festivalâ€™s exclusive livestream partner in 2011, and you will once again be able to tune in this year on Coachellaâ€™s official YouTube channel.
What about Revolve Fest?
Shut up. (But weâ€™re sure itâ€™s happening.)
This post has been updated.

title: How to Stream Every Performance on YouTube
content:
No more running across Coachella to try to catch two acts booked at the same time. You can spend your weekend with Vampire Weekend without stepping foot in the sun and you donâ€™t even have to sleep outside to enjoy headliners like soda enthusiast Lana Del Rey, fan critic Doja Cat, and Jerrod Carmichael muse Tyler, the Creator. YouTube once again partnered with Coachella to bring unobstructed views of the six stages in Indio April 12 through the 14th and April 19 through the 21st. And this year, thereâ€™s even a multi-view option, which should help you avoid FOMO by letting you watch up to four stages at once. April 2024 um 15:06 Uhr Sabine Tobias Das Coachella-Festival wird 2024 live im Stream Ã¼bertragen. Lana Del Rey, Tyler the Creator und Doja Cat gehÃ¶ren zum diesjÃ¤hrigen Line-up. So kÃ¶nnt ihr die Konzerte vom zweiten Wochenende sehen.
Tyler, the Creator auf dem Frauenfeld Openair 2022 (Quelle: benhoudijk /depositphotos.com)
Das zweite Coachella-Wochenende findet vom 19. bis 21. April statt.
Auf YouTube seht ihr ausgewÃ¤hlte Konzerte von allen BÃ¼hnen im Live-Stream.
Wir haben euch die Streams gesammelt und verraten, wer auftritt.
In diesem Jahr treffen sich erneut Stars, Musikfans und Modebegeisterte auf dem Trend-Festival im Coachella Valley in Kalifornien. 2024 seht ihr bei Youtube wieder beide Wochenenden im Live-Stream.
Das Coachella-Festival 2024 findet vom 12. bis zum 14. April 2023 und vom 19. bis zum 21. April statt. AusgewÃ¤hlte Konzerte von allen sechs BÃ¼hnen werden Ã¼bertragen. Da das erste Wochenende bereits vorbei ist, kÃ¶nnt ihr ausgewÃ¤hlte Konzerthighlights auf dem Coachella-YouTube-Channel sehen.
Die Ãœbertragung des zweiten Festival-Wochenende beginnt am 20. April 2024 um 1 Uhr nachts deutscher Zeit. Wir binden euch nachfolgend alle Streams zu allen BÃ¼hnen ein.

Bedenkt, dass es zwischen Deutschland und Kalifornien eine Zeitverschiebung von neun Stunden gibt. An den Festival-Freitagen seht ihr Lana Del Rey, Peso Pluma, Lil Uzi Vert, Justice und Co. An den Samstagen treten unter anderem Tyler the Creator, Blur und Ice Spice auf. Sonntags erwarten euch Doja Cat, J Balvin und JhenÃ© Aiko. Auch No Doubt ist auf dem Festival vertreten.

title: Coachella 2024 Weekend 2 Lineup & Schedule: All the Set Times You Need to Know
content:
With weekend one behind us, the 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival will return to Indio, California, on Friday, April 19. Now, the complete weekend two schedule has been revealed, with a few tweaks, including the addition of Kid Cudi. See the stage and set time breakdown below.
Lana Del Rey, Tyler, the Creator, and Doja Cat are headlining Coachella. The festival also features a No Doubt reunion, as well as performances from Ice Spice, Blur, J Balvin, Peso Pluma, Ken Carson, JhenÃ© Aiko, Justice, and many others. There is no scheduled performance from Vampire Weekend, who were billed as a late addition to weekend one. 88rising Futures, too, is replaced by Skream on the Sunday, and instead of Jamie xxâ€™s set with Floating Points and Daphni, second weekend-goers have Diplo x Mau P.

title: Billie Eilish: SchÃ¶ner leiden, noch mal ganz neu
content:
Solange die Millennials noch ihre seit Tagen andauernde Schnappatmung kurieren, holen wir kurz auch alle anderen in den sogenannten Loop â€“ immerhin ereignete sich am ersten Coachella-Wochenende etwas AuÃŸerordentliches: Lana Del Rey, Headlinerin dieses amerikanischen Musikfestivals, holte Billie Eilish auf die BÃ¼hne, um gemeinsam die Songs zu performen, die sie jeweils berÃ¼hmt gemacht haben. Damit war die offizielle AmtsÃ¼bergabe zum Oberhaupt der "Sad Girls" vollzogen.
Lana Del Rey, die live nicht sonderlich gut, aber dafÃ¼r eine Ikone ist, wurde 2011 mit ihren melancholischen Balladen Ã¼ber hoffnungslose Liebe zu Ã¤lteren MÃ¤nnern bekannt. Ihre Ã„sthetik, in der viel traurig geraucht wurde, verwies auf das weiÃŸe Arbeiter-Amerika der Nachkriegsjahre; ihr Erfolg fiel mit dem der sozialen Medien zusammen, in denen sich fortan junge Frauen Ã¼ber ihre psychischen Probleme und die UnterdrÃ¼ckung im Patriarchat austauschten und zur Internetbewegung der "Sad Girls" wurden. Sie deuteten das seit Langem fetischisierte Stereotyp der leidenden jungen Frau â€“ gerne auch als vorzeitig Verstorbene, wie die "Unbekannte aus der Seine", die Ende des 19. Jahrhunderts angeschwemmt und als "Anne" zur Vorlage fÃ¼r Reanimationspuppen wurde, weswegen Michael Jackson in seinem Song Smooth Criminal fragt, "Annie, are you okay?", aber wir geraten ins Plaudern â€“ jedenfalls deuteten sie ihre Traurigkeit als politischen Widerstand um.

title: Courtney Love criticizes Taylor Swift, BeyoncÃ© and more
content:
Swifties are working overtime after Courtney Love had some harsh words for Taylor Swift.
The rock artist made controversial comments about the â€œKarmaâ€ superstar in a recent interview with The Standard, saying Swift is â€œnot important.â€ Love added that the â€œEras Tourâ€ star was â€œsafe space for girlsâ€ and called her this generationâ€™s Madonna.
Love went on to say that Swift is â€œnot interesting as an artist.â€ Ironically, Loveâ€™s interview was centered on promoting her new series about empowering women in music.
And the â€œVioletâ€ singer didnâ€™t hold back on expressing her displeasure with Madonna, either. â€œI donâ€™t like her and she doesnâ€™t like me,â€ she added. While she also mentioned her love for the 1985 film â€œDesperately Seeking Susan,â€ which starred Madonna, Love says it was â€œfor the city of New York as much as her.â€
The â€œHoleâ€ artist didnâ€™t stop there. She also offered her opinion about Lana Del Rey: â€œI havenâ€™t liked Lana since she covered a John Denver song, and I think she should really take seven years off. Up until â€˜Take Me Home Country Roadsâ€™ I thought she was great,â€ she told the outlet. â€œWhen I was recording my new album, I had to stop listening to her as she was influencing me too much.â€
Though Love expressed respect for BeyoncÃ©, she said sheâ€™s not a fan of her music.
â€œI mean, I like the idea of doing a country record because itâ€™s about Black women going into spaces where previously only white women have been allowed, not that I like it much,â€ Love continued. â€œAs a concept, I love it. I just donâ€™t like her music.â€
The conversation about other women in the music industry was provoked by the launching of her eight-part series â€œCourtney Loveâ€™s Womenâ€ on Monday.
Love says she started the series to â€œredeem some of the women who have been treated so badly by the record industry.â€
â€œCourtney Loveâ€™s Womenâ€ is on BBC Radio 6 Music and BBC Sounds.

title: Taylor Swift und die Pop-Poeten: Welche Stars haben Gedichte verfasst?
content:
von Oliver vom Hofe "Tortured Poets Department" heiÃŸt das neue Album von Taylor Swift. Dabei kann die SÃ¤ngerin gar keinen eigenen Gedichtband vorweisen â€“ im Gegensatz zu anderen Stars. Hier kommen die besten und peinlichsten Poeten der Popgeschichte.
Ihre Songtexte dienen an UniversitÃ¤ten als Studienobjekt, einen Ehrendoktor fÃ¼r Kunstwissenschaften hat sie auch. FÃ¼r ihre Lyrics lÃ¤sst Taylor Swift sich gerne von Shakespeare inspirieren, und der Name ihres neuen Albums "Tortured Poets Department", das Freitag erscheint, kÃ¶nnte auch Titel eines Schreibseminars sein. Selbst eine eigene BÃ¼cherei hat Swift gerade erÃ¶ffnet, wenn auch nur fÃ¼r drei Tage: In Los Angeles' Shopping Mall â€The Grove" kÃ¶nnen Fans sich die Wartezeit bis zur Platte mit StÃ¶bern und BlÃ¤ttern verkÃ¼rzen. Doch eines haben Tupac Shakur, Patti Smith und Drake der 34-JÃ¤hrigen dann doch voraus: Sie haben eigene GedichtbÃ¤nde herausgebracht. Wobei freilich nicht alle ihre Reime so nobelpreisverdÃ¤chtig geraten sind wie die eines Bob Dylan. Oder?
Â© mauritius images/Cinema Legacy Collection
John Lennon: der Wortspieler
Er war der erste Popstar, der ein eigenes BÃ¤ndchen mit Gedichten und Kurzgeschichten verÃ¶ffentlichte. Damit spaltete er den Literaturbetrieb 1964 in zwei Lager â€“ in â€Huch, der kann ja schreiben!â€œ und â€Hilfe, der kann ja gar nicht schreiben!â€œ. Passenderweise hieÃŸ das Buch auch â€In seiner eigenen Schreibeâ€œ (erhÃ¤ltlich Ã¼ber Amazon): ein Sammelsurium von Nonsens, Klamauk und bizarren Wortspielen, das manche an Lennons kognitiven und grammatikalischen FÃ¤higkeiten zweifeln lieÃŸ. Es beginnt schon mit dem ersten Satz: â€Es war einmal ein Mann, der teilweise Dave war â€¦â€œ und setzt sich fort mit Titeln wie â€Keine Fliegen auf Frankâ€œ, â€Beim Zahnarschtâ€œ, â€Die Albernsbagger Meinungsdummfrage Ã¼ber das FernsÃ¤genâ€œ oder â€Heilbutt kehrt ZÃ¼richâ€œ. NatÃ¼rlich war Lennon sehr wohl des Englischen mÃ¤chtig und lieÃŸ sich vor allem von Lewis Carrolls â€Alice im Wunderlandâ€œ inspirieren.
Â© mauritius images / Tracksimages.com / Alamy / Alamy Stock Photos
Bob Dylan: der NobelpreistrÃ¤ger
Der einzige Popstar mit Nobelpreis â€“ verliehen fÃ¼r â€neue poetische Ausdrucksformen in der amerikanischen Song-Traditionâ€œ, wie 2016 die BegrÃ¼ndung lautete. Von sich selbst sagte Dylan einmal, dass ihm die Dichtung so wichtig gewesen sei wie die Musik, und trotzdem verÃ¶ffentlichte er seine Lyrik lieber auf TontrÃ¤gern als in Buchform. Die Gedicht- und Prosasammlung â€Planetenwellenâ€œ (Hoffmann und Campe, 2017) gibt Einblick in Dylans frÃ¼he Werke, in denen er etwa Ã¼ber seine Heimatstadt und ersten Idole schreibt. Sehr launig, aber ein Hit wÃ¤re es wohl nicht geworden, wie die AuszÃ¼ge aus â€Mein Leben in einem gestohlenen Momentâ€œ zeigen:
â€¦ Hibbing ist eine gute alte stadt
Ich lief aus ihr fort als ich 10,12, 13, 15, 15 Â½, 17 und 18 war
Ich wurde immer wieder erwischt und zurÃ¼ckgebracht bis auf ein mal
Ich schrieb meinen ersten song fÃ¼r meine mutter und nannte ihn â€FÃ¼r Mutterâ€œ
Ich schrieb ihn in der fÃ¼nften klasse und der lehrer gab mir eine 2 plus
Ich fing mit elf zu rauchen an und hÃ¶rte nur einmal kurz auf um luft zu holen â€¦
Â© mauritius images/TT News Agency/Alamy/Alamy Stock Photos
Leonard Cohen: der schwarze Romantiker
Eigentlich habe er nur deshalb zur Gitarre gegriffen, weil er als Dichter noch weniger verdiente denn als ein Feierabend-Musiker, sagte Leonard Cohen mal im Scherz. Seit seinem ersten Lyrikband â€Parasiten des Himmelsâ€œ 1956 verÃ¶ffentlichte der Kanadier immer wieder GedichtbÃ¤nde, auch wenn keiner an den Erfolg von Songklassikern wie â€Suzanneâ€œ oder â€Hallelujahâ€œ heranreichen konnte. Verdient wÃ¤re es gewesen, wie auch die posthum erschienene Lyrik- und Notizsammlung â€Die Flamme â€“ The Flameâ€œ (Kiepenheuer & Witsch, 2016) beweist. Denn auch hier zeigt sich Cohen als der â€schwarze Romantikerâ€œ, den die Fans so liebten:
Ich bin alt geworden / auf Hunderte Arten / doch mein Herz ist jung / & es singt noch immer / Ã¼ber die Liebe / Ã¼ber den Todâ€œ
Â© Raul Arboleda/AFP
Patti Smith: die Punk-Poetin
Bei Patti Smith stand am Anfang das Wort und nicht der Akkord: Sie begann ihre Karriere als Dichterin mit Lesungen in New Yorker Clubs. Doch die Poesie und ihre Vorbilder William S. Burroughs und Arthur Rimbaud haben sie niemals losgelassen â€“ rund zwei Dutzend BÃ¼cher hat Smith in den vergangenen 50 Jahren geschrieben, Sammlungen wie â€Babelâ€œ und die gefeierten Biografien â€Just Kidsâ€œ und â€M Trainâ€œ. Immer wieder erkundet sie dabei ihre Kindheit, und die Bilder, die sie dabei findet, sind wie Musik. Wie die Anfangszeilen von â€Tanz in der Scheuneâ€œ aus â€Traumsammlerinâ€œ (Kiepenheuer & Witsch, 2013):
â€Die Gedankenwelt eines Kindes ist wie ein Kuss auf die Stirn â€“ offen und unbefangen. Sie dreht sich wie die Ballerina auf einer mehrstÃ¶ckigen Geburtstagstorte mit viel Zuckerguss, giftig und sÃ¼ÃŸ.â€œ
Â© Robyn Beck/AFP
Lana Del Rey: die Poppige
Zuerst sollte es nur ein schmales Heftchen werden, das Lana del Rey selbst binden und zum Preis von bloÃŸ einem Dollar verkaufen wollte. Dann aber erschien â€Violent Bent Backwards Over The Grassâ€œ (Simon & Schuster, 2020) als 128-Seiten-Band, begleitet von einem opulenten Spoken Word Album mit Hintergrundmusik. Leider ein Prachtbeispiel dafÃ¼r, dass Pop-Lyrik als Songtext sehr poetisch und tief sein kann, aber als Gedicht sehr prosaisch und seicht.
â€Paradise Is Very Fragile
And It Seems Like Itâ€™s Only Getting Worse
Our Leader Is A Megalomaniac
And Weâ€™ve Seen That Before
But Never â€˜Cause It Was What The Country Deservedâ€
(Das Paradies ist sehr zerbrechlich
Und es scheint, dass es immer schlimmer wird.
Unser FÃ¼hrer ist ein GrÃ¶ÃŸenwahnsinniger
Und das haben wir schon zuvor gesehen,
aber nicht, weil es das war, was das Land verdient)
Â© Chris Delmas / AFP
Drake: der Aufgeblasene
â€Ich weiÃŸ nicht, ob ich mir jemals in meinem Leben sehnlicher gewÃ¼nscht habe, dass die Leute etwas mehr kaufen oder unterstÃ¼tzen.â€œ Das verlautbarte der Rapper Drake, als vergangenes Jahr sein erster Gedichtband erschien â€“ mit dem hÃ¼bschen Titel â€Titel ruinieren allesâ€œ. Das Problem von â€Titles Ruin Everythingâ€œ (Phaidon, 2023): Drakes Reime ruinieren auch so einiges. Oft sind es nur kurze Sinn- und UnsinnsprÃ¼che, die auf zwei Seiten aufgeblasen werden. Kleine Geschmacksprobe? Triggerwarnung: Sie werden sich danach die ZÃ¤hne putzen wollen! Bitte schÃ¶n:
â€There Are Two Types Of Women In This World / Women Who Like Giving Head And Women Who I Donâ€™t Likeâ€
(Es gibt zwei Arten von Frauen auf dieser Welt / Frauen, die gerne einen blasen, und Frauen, die ich nicht mag)
Â© mauritius images/Pictorial Press Ltd/Alamy/Alamy Stock Photos
Tupac Shakur: der Rap-Reimer
Nicht nur die Musik des 1996 erschossenen Rappers war ein PhÃ¤nomen â€“ auch sein knapp zehn Jahre spÃ¤ter bei Simon & Schuster verÃ¶ffentlichte Lyrik-Kollektion mit Gedichten, die er als Teenager geschrieben hatte. Tupac-Fans pilgerten in die Buchhandlungen, und als die Audio-Version herauskam, knackte sie sogar die Top 200 der Pop-Charts. Die Gedichte behandeln den Ghetto-Alltag, sind aber auch ganz verblÃ¼mt romantisch wie das zuckrig betitelte â€The Rose That Grew From Concreteâ€œ (Simon & Schuster, 2005):
Did You Hear About The Rose That Grew From A Crack In The Concrete?
Proving Natureâ€™s Law Is Wrong It Learned To Walk With Out Having Feet.
Funny It Seems, But By Keeping Itâ€™s Dreams, It Learned To Breathe Fresh Air.
Long Live The Rose That Grows From Concrete When No One Else Cared
(Hast Du von der Rose gehÃ¶rt, die aus einem Riss im Beton wuchs?
Sie widerlegte das Gesetz der Natur und lernte ohne FÃ¼ÃŸe zu laufen.
Lustig so scheintâ€™s, aber indem sie ihre TrÃ¤ume verfolgte, lernte sie frische Luft zu atmen.
Lang lebe die Rose, die aus einem Riss im Beton wuchs, wÃ¤hrend es niemanden sonst kÃ¼mmerte)
Â© Brynn Anderson/AP/dpa
Alicia Keys: die TrÃ¤nenreiche
Darauf konnten sich nicht einmal ihre Fans einen Reim machen: Mitte der 2000er, Alicia Keys war eine der erfolgreichsten SÃ¤ngerinnen der Welt, erhielt sie ein Angebot, zu dem sie besser nein gesagt hÃ¤tte â€“ ob sie ein Buch verÃ¶ffentlichen wolle? Es erschien â€Tears for Waterâ€œ (Penguin, 2005) mit den Texten ihrer ersten beiden Hit-Alben und 27 Gedichten. Die Kritiken waren vernichtend. Gerne hÃ¤tte man die damals erst 24-JÃ¤hrige verteidigt, doch leider machten Zeilen aus dem Poesiealbum das unmÃ¶glich:
â€Sometimes I feel/ like I donâ€™t belong anywhere/And itâ€™s going to take so long/for me to get somewhereâ€
(Manchmal fÃ¼hle ich mich / als ob ich nirgendwo hingehÃ¶re / Und es wird so lange dauern / bis ich irgendwo ankomme)

title: Courtney Love critica BeyoncÃ© e Taylor Swift
content:
SÃƒO PAULO, SP (FOLHAPRESS)
Courtney Love nÃ£o poupou crÃ­ticas a diversas cantoras famosas. A artista declarou nÃ£o achar Taylor Swift relevante, assim como Lana Del Rey. Ela tambÃ©m afirmou nÃ£o gostar das mÃºsicas de BeyoncÃ©.
â€œTaylor nÃ£o Ã© importante. Ela pode ser um espaÃ§o seguro para as meninas e provavelmente Ã© a nova Madonna, mas nÃ£o Ã© interessante como artistaâ€, disse em entrevista ao jornal britÃ¢nico Standard.
JÃ¡ sobre Lana, Courtney disse que o que a desagradou na americana foi o cover de uma mÃºsica de John Denver e sugeriu que ela desse uma pausa na carreira.
â€œAcho que ela deveria tirar sete anos de folga. AtÃ© â€˜Take Me Home Country Roadsâ€™ [canÃ§Ã£o de Denver] eu achava ela Ã³tima. Quando estava gravando meu novo Ã¡lbum, tive que parar de ouvi-la porque ela estava me influenciando demais.â€
Outro nome citado pela ex-mulher de Kurt Cobain foi BeyoncÃ©, cujo trabalho ela desgosta. Courtney diz reconhecer a importÃ¢ncia do novo disco country da cantora e de mulheres negras ocupando novos espaÃ§os, mas o estilo de BeyoncÃ© nÃ£o Ã© para ela.
â€œComo conceito, adoro. Eu simplesmente nÃ£o gosto da mÃºsica dela.â€ A cantora tambÃ©m nÃ£o poupou Madonna e disse que a relaÃ§Ã£o Ã© mÃºtua: â€œeu nÃ£o gosto dela e ela nÃ£o gosta de mim.â€
Por fim, Courtney acrescentou que as artistas pop de hoje sÃ£o todas iguais. â€œSe vocÃª toca algo no Spotify, Ã© bombardeado com um monte de coisas exatamente iguais.â€

title: Beyonce's Country Album, Taylor Swift, And Lana Del Rey Don't Have Courtney Love's Approval
content:
In her new interview with Standard, Courtney Love had a lot to say. For starters, she doesn't mind being the villain in someone else's story. "People used to say that I was so difficult," she told the UK-based outlet. "They said I was disagreeable. Yes, I am completely disagreeable and Iâ€™m never going to apologize for that. I always wanted to be known as a b**ch," the blonde icon said. According to her, the late Kurt Cobain sought social approval, while Love couldn't be bothered wasting her energy on such things.
The musician has been promoting her new eight-part BBC Radio 6 Music series, which follows her as she reflects on other women in the industry who have shaped her journey. Among them are Black classics like Billie Holiday and Nina Simone, though Love had plenty to say about female entertainers she's less fond of too. "I like the idea of Beyonce doing a country record because itâ€™s about Black women going into spaces where previously only White women have been allowed, not that I like it much. As a concept, I love it. I just donâ€™t like her music," the Hole frontwoman said.
Read More: Courtney Love Claims Johnny Depp Gave Her CPR During 1995 Overdose
Courtney Love Has Plenty to Say About Other Women in the Music Industry
Elsewhere, her comments about another modern starlet are catching major heat online. "Taylor [Swift] is not important. She might be a safe space for girls, and sheâ€™s probably the Madonna of now, but sheâ€™s not interesting as an artist," Love declared. Of Lana Del Rey, the 59-year-old added, "I havenâ€™t liked Lana since she covered a John Denver song, and I think she should really take seven years off. Up until â€˜Take Me Home Country Roadsâ€™ I thought she was great."
No matter how Courtney Love might feel about Beyonce's eighth studio album, we can't deny the impact COWBOY CARTER has had so far. While the vocalist's first-born, Blue Ivy Carter, joined her for most of the RENAISSANCE World Tour, it was Rumi's turn to shine on the country-based LP. Thanks to the young girl's work, she broke a record on the Billboard Hot 100 previously set by her older sister. Read all about that at the link below, and check back later for more hip-hop/pop culture news updates.
Read More: Beyonce's Daughter Rumi Carter Breaks Blue Ivy's Hot 100 Record
[Via]

title: Courtney Love thinks Taylor Swift is â€˜not importantâ€™ and has some thoughts about BeyoncÃ©, Lana Del Rey and Madonna, too
content:
CNN â€”
Courtney Love has a new radio show about women in music, but she is not much of a fan of several of the biggest female artists of our time.
Love, the frontwoman for the band Hole, this month launched the BBC Radio eight-part series, titled â€œCourtney Loveâ€™s Women.â€ The 59-year-old rocker, who has lived in London since 2019, promoted the project in an interview to â€œThe Standardâ€ in which she expressed her admiration for artists such as Patti Smith, Nina Simone, PJ Harvey, Debbie Harry, Julie London and Joni Mitchell.
But some contemporary artists, including Taylor Swift, are not to Loveâ€™s liking.
â€œTaylor is not important,â€ Love said of Swift. â€œShe might be a safe space for girls, and sheâ€™s probably the Madonna of now, but sheâ€™s not interesting as an artist.â€
Love used to be an admirer of Lana Del Reyâ€™s music but that changed.
â€œI havenâ€™t liked Lana since she covered a John Denver song, and I think she should really take seven years off,â€ Love said. â€œWhen I was recording my new album, I had to stop listening to her as she was influencing me too much.â€
Not even the aforementioned Madonna was spared Loveâ€™s criticism.
â€œI donâ€™t like her and she doesnâ€™t like me,â€ Love said. â€œI loved [Madonnaâ€™s 1985 film] â€˜Desperately Seeking Susan,â€™ but for the city of New York as much as her.â€
And while she said, â€œItâ€™s great that there are so many successful women in the music industry,â€ to Love, â€œlots of them are becoming a clichÃ©.â€
â€œNow, every successful woman is cloned, so there is just too much music. Theyâ€™re all the same,â€ she said. â€œIf you play something on Spotify, you get bombarded with a lot of stuff thatâ€™s exactly the same.â€
â€œI mean, I like the idea of BeyoncÃ© doing a country record because itâ€™s about Black women going into spaces where previously only white women have been allowed, not that I like it much,â€ Love added. â€œAs a concept, I love it. I just donâ€™t like her music.â€

content:
Es ist eines der berÃ¼hmtesten und begehrtesten Musikfestivals der Welt: Knapp 500 Dollar muss man mindestens fÃ¼r ein Ticket zum Coachella-Festival in Indio, Kalifornien hinblÃ¤ttern, wer es gern luxuriÃ¶s hat, zahlt Ã¼ber 1000 Dollar. Nelly Furtado, Grimes, Lana del Rey, No Doubt, Doja Cat oder Tyler, the Creator standen dieses Jahr unter anderem auf der BÃ¼hne. Das Line-up ist hochkarÃ¤tig und oft mit ÃœberraschungsgÃ¤sten gespickt - und das Publikum ebenso. Vor allem am ersten der zwei Coachella-Wochenenden feiern zahlreiche Promis traditionell in der kalifornischen WÃ¼ste. Dieses Jahr unter anderem mit dabei: Taylor Swift und Travis Kelce, sowie Heidi Klum und ihre TÃ¶chter.
Highlights auf der BÃ¼hne war etwa Shakira, die unerwartet beim Set von Bizarrap auftauchte, zwei Songs sang und eine Welttournee ankÃ¼ndigte. Lana del Rey Ã¼berraschte mit zwei Duetten mit Billie Eilish und einem Auftritt von Grammy-Gewinner Jon Batiste.

title: Partito il Coachella, da Lana Del Rey alla reunion dei No Doubt: i protagonisti del primo weekend
content:
Tgcom24
I protagonisti Lana Del Rey Ã¨ stata una delle protagoniste piÃ¹ attese Al debutto come headliner e di ritorno al Coachella dopo essersi esibita dieci anni fa. Romantica e malinconica Ã¨ arrivata in moto e ha portato sul palco le sue canzoni piÃ¹ importanti e alcune tratte ovviamente dal suo ultimo album, "Did you know there's a tunnel under Ocean Blv!" un lavoro personale e autobiografico. Con eleganza e delicatezza ha conquistato tutti. Ha voluto sul palco con lei Jon Batiste, Billie Eilish e Jack Antonoff. Altro protagonista Ã¨ stato Tyler, The Creator che al suo debutto qui nel 2011 aveva promesso che sarebbe arrivato il momento in cui sarebbe stato l'artista principale. Nella sua esibizione sul palco, tra ambientazioni fantastiche sono apparsi con lui, Donald Glover, A$AP Rocky, Charlie Wilson e Kali Uchi. I Blur sono tornati al Coachella dopo undici anni dal loro concerto. La band capitanata da un intrattenitore doc come Damon Albarn ha sciorinato tante hit, da "Song 2" a "Girls & Boys", e brani dell'ultimo album "The Ballad of Darren".
Il K-Pop Ã¨ tornato protagonista a Coachella con la boyband ATEEZ! e il girl group delle Sserafim. Shakira Ã¨ stata protagonista sul palco, ospite di Bizarrap, produttore e artista con cui ha spesso collaborato. Hanno eseguito "La Fuerte", che fa parte del suo ultimo album in studio "Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran" ("Ho trasformato le lacrime in diamanti"' ha raccontato) e la hit "Shakira: Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53. â€œOggi devo condividere qualcosa. Biza, vado in tour. AndrÃ² in tour, finalmente. Iniziando qui, questo novembre, questâ€™anno, in questa cittÃ . Non vedo lâ€™ora. Non potrei chiedere di meglioâ€, ha annunciato la popstar.
Leggi Anche Coachella 2024: i look eccentrici dal festival piÃ¹ â€œcoolâ€
Il ritorno dei No Doubt E' stata l'organizzazione del Coachella a far tornare insieme i No Doubt. La band guidata da Gwen Stefani ha fatto il suo debutto al festival, tra l'altro. Non si esibivano dal vivo dal 2015 quando apparvero al KAABOO Festival in California. Nel loro live di oltre un'ora sono filate via tutte le hit che hanno conquistato molto fan a livello mondiale, oltre alla prova di una sempre carismatica Gwen Stefani. Tutto come il tempo si fosse fermato agli anni 90. Sul palco Ã¨ stata ospite a sorpresa Olivia Rodrigo.

title: Billie Eilish teases fans with 'Lunch' at do lab party during Coachella
content:
Billie Eilish 'not doing singles,' declares release strategy for new album.
Billie Eilish delighted her fans with a preview of her upcoming album at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival.
Having appeared as a guest during Lana Del Rey's performance on Friday, the singer took the stage at a Do Lab party on the festival grounds to debut three fresh tracks.
Announcing the event on her Instagram Stories, the Grammy winner drew a large crowd eager to hear snippets from her forthcoming album Hit Me Hard And Soft.
Among the showcased tracks were Chihiro and Lâ€™Amour De Ma Vie, but it was Lunch that received the most enthusiastic reception, noted UpRoxx.
In a video circulating on X, fans were captured enthusiastically embracing Billie Eilish's new song, with one enthusiast even dubbing it potentially the 'gay anthem of the year.'
The song, featuring seductive lyrics like "I could eat that girl for lunch / Yeah, she dances on my tongue / Tastes like she might be the one / And I can never get enough / I could buy you so much stuff / Itâ€™s a craving, not a crush," sparked excitement among listeners.
Expressing relief, one fan took to social media to celebrate Eilish's comfort in addressing the topic of sexuality, exclaiming, "FINALLY A GAY BILLIE SONG WE ARE OUT OF THE TRENCHES."
Eilish herself had earlier announced the release date for her upcoming albumslated for May 17th, alongside the album's cover artwork.

title: Hailey Bieber and Justin Bieber spotted at Coachella 2024
content:
Originally appeared on E! Online
The Biebers take Coachella!
Hailey Bieber and Justin Bieber were spotted sharing a sweet moment at the 2024 music festival in Indio, Calif. on its opening day. While watching Lana Del Rey perform her headlining set, the "Stay" singer stood behind his wife, who wore a black hoodie and glasses, and gently rubbed her head before laying a tender kiss in her forehead, as seen in a video posted on Rolling Stone's TikTok account.
Get Boston local news, weather forecasts, lifestyle and entertainment stories to your inbox. Sign up for NBC Bostonâ€™s newsletters.
Earlier that day, the Rhode Skin founder, 27, was spotted in nearby Palm Springs at the Revolve Festival's VIP Pool Party. One of her friends, surfer Kelia Moniz, posted a video of the two enjoying an ice cream treat. Hailey Bieber wore a green pinstriped T-shirt, white lace-trimmed shorts, white socks and black Mary Janes. The model, who recently debuted a shorter, lighter hairstyle, wore her hair pulled back.
The couple were spotted in the area more than a month after her father, Stephen Baldwin, fueled concern about the couple, who have often been the subject of breakup rumors.
Justin Bieber and Hailey Bieber's Cutest Pics
The actor reposted Victor Marx's Instagram video that read, "Christians, please when you think of Justin & Hailey, take a moment to offer a little prayer for them, to have wisdom, protection and to draw close to the Lord. There are special challenges that folks in high visibility positions face."
Days later, she appeared to respond to the speculation by sharing a tribute to Justin Bieber on his 30th birthday. "Words could never truly describe the beauty of who you are. Happy Birthday to you," she wrote on her Instagram March 1. "Love of my life, for life."
Then on March 5, she wrote on her Instagram Stories, "Just FYI the stories and constant 'blind items' I see on Tik Tok are 100% of the time wrong. Made out of thin airâ€¦Come from the land of delusionâ€¦So I know it may be fun feeding into these stories but just know they're always false. xx sorry to spoil it."

title: Shakira actÃºa por sorpresa en la gran noche de Bizarrap y Peso Pluma en Coachella
content:

Pero sobre el escenario, los artistas siguen siendo los mayores productos de consumo. Shakira, una de las marcas mÃ¡s valiosas de la industria musical, apareciÃ³ este viernes sin aviso previo con el argentino Bizarrap. Ante la sorpresa de todos los que desbloqueaban sus telÃ©fonos para grabar el momento, hizo un anuncio:
â€•Me les voy, dijo la colombiana.
â€•Â¿A dÃ³nde te nos vas? â€•respondiÃ³ Bizarrap, quien apenas habÃ­a hablado hasta entonces.
â€•Me les voy de gira mundial, por fin â€•decÃ­a emocionada la cantante.
Una enorme pantalla anunciaba a sus espaldas Las mujeres ya no lloran world tour.
El instante quedÃ³ en la memoria como un anuncio mÃ¡s en un mar de impactos publicitarios. Shakira detallÃ³ que comenzarÃ¡ en noviembre en Los Ãngeles la gira de promociÃ³n del Ã¡lbum que ha lanzado este aÃ±o. Esta es de momento la Ãºnica ciudad confirmada. Minutos antes, la estrella habÃ­a cantado la ya famosa SesiÃ³n 53, con la que saldÃ³ cuentas con su expareja el futbolista Gerard PiquÃ©. El tema se convirtiÃ³ en un Ã©xito internacional y ayudÃ³ a Bizarrap a consolidar su reputaciÃ³n de productor capaz de conquistar las listas globales. A esta primera colaboraciÃ³n entre ambos siguiÃ³ La fuerte, incluido en el disco que da nombre a la nueva gira de Shakira. El dÃºo mostrÃ³ buena quÃ­mica. â€œBiza, tÃº eres mi parce, mi coleguisâ€, dijo Shakira a Bizarrap. Cuando la cantante se fue, el argentino dijo, sobrado, al micrÃ³fono. â€œY me preguntaban si iba a tener invitados en Coachella...â€.
Antes del fugaz paso de la estrella, Bizarrap (Gonzalo JuliÃ¡n Conde), vestido de riguroso chÃ¡ndal, habÃ­a ejecutado un gran set de DJ con muestras de sus sesiones. Desde su arranque con el tema que lanzÃ³ hace tres aÃ±os con Nathy Peluso hasta otros mÃ¡s recientes como el que hizo junto a la cantante puertorriqueÃ±a Villano Antillano o con el mexicano Natanael Cano, estrenado hace menos de 10 dÃ­as. Del argentino Milo J pinchÃ³ dos temas. Pero el viaje por la regiÃ³n no lo hizo saltando de gÃ©nero en gÃ©nero, sino uniendo las voces en un sÃ³lido empaque de mÃºsica electrÃ³nica que pasÃ³ por el house, el tecno clÃ¡sico y hasta el dubstep popularizado por Skrillex. CerrÃ³ con otro de sus temas mÃ¡s virales, QuÃ©date, del canario Quevedo.
Una hora mÃ¡s tarde llegÃ³ el momento de Peso Pluma, quien ocupÃ³ el escenario principal del festival. Su presencia allÃ­ deja claro su ascenso meteÃ³rico. El aÃ±o pasado, el artista conocido tambiÃ©n como Doble P, cuyo nombre verdadero es Hassan Emilio Kabande, tuvo su debut en Coachella. Su participaciÃ³n se limitÃ³ a unos minutos, como invitado de Becky G en Chanel. Este viernes fue Ã©l quien devolviÃ³ la invitaciÃ³n de la artista estadounidense de raÃ­ces mexicanas. Peso Pluma fue el penÃºltimo antes del melancÃ³lico cierre de Lana del Rey y sus invitados, entre los que figuraron los multipremiados Jack Antonoff, Jon Batiste, con quien cantÃ³ la apertura de Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd; y Billie Eilish, con quien interpretÃ³ Ocean Eyes, compuesto por la dos veces ganadora del Oscar.
Peso Pluma y Becky G, durante su actuaciÃ³n en el festival de Coachella, este viernes. Getty Images (Getty Images for Coachella)
AsÃ­ como 1986 fue el aÃ±o del rap o 1991 el de la irrupciÃ³n del grunge, 2023 quedÃ³ marcado como el del despegue del regional mexicano, una sola etiqueta que la industria ha utilizado para vender una amplia oferta sonora que incluyen los corridos tradicionales, la banda sinaloense, el grupero y el tex mex. Sobre esa ola se montÃ³ GÃ©nesis, el Ã¡lbum que ha servido a Peso Pluma para darse a conocer al gran pÃºblico despuÃ©s de dos lanzamientos mÃ¡s modestos. Esta noche tocÃ³ varios temas del disco, entre ellos el que ha generado polÃ©mica fuera de su paÃ­s por su apologÃ­a del narcotrÃ¡fico y el cartel de Sinaloa. â€œBien forrados los paquetes van. / No hay pendiente, no puedo fallar. / Siempre estoy listo para cruzar. / Polvo, ruedas y tambiÃ©n cristalâ€, cantaba en PRC, uno de sus corridos tumbados. A sus espaldas se proyectaban titulares de la prensa mundial que han recogido su â€œincÃ³modaâ€ relaciÃ³n con el crimen organizado.
â€œÂ¡Arriba MÃ©xico, a la verga, viejo!â€, fue su grito de guerra durante el concierto. Tuvo como invitado a ArcÃ¡ngel, el rapero Santa Fe Klan y Junior H, a quien tambiÃ©n rindiÃ³ tributo en el vÃ­deo que cerrÃ³ el espectÃ¡culo. En las imÃ¡genes, el artista mexicano de 24 aÃ±os contÃ³ la que considera la historia del corrido, que va desde Chalino SÃ¡nchez hasta Ã©l, autoproclamado heredero de esa tradiciÃ³n.
A la misma hora, en el interior de una carpa, un inclasificable fenÃ³meno mostraba uno de los rostros mÃ¡s alternativos de Coachella. Clown Core ha hecho su debut en el festival dando una muestra de su nÃºmero, mitad performance, mitad pesadilla. El trÃ­o de Nevada estÃ¡ conformado por mÃºsicos que se han mantenido en el anonimato detrÃ¡s de mÃ¡scaras de payaso, dejando que hablen por ellos los vÃ­deos que publican de tanto en tanto y que son grabados en vehÃ­culos en movimiento o letrinas pÃºblicas. Son enigmÃ¡ticos videoclips que dejan un pasajero sabor a un mal viaje musicalizado con una mezcla de easy listening, jazz y ruido. El grupo se ha convertido en una sensaciÃ³n en Los Ãngeles, donde agotan rÃ¡pidamente las entradas de sus conciertos.
El dueto francÃ©s de mÃºsica electrÃ³nica Justice volviÃ³ a Coachella en un estiloso nÃºmero en vivo. En Ã©l han presentado su nuevo Ã¡lbum, Hyperdrama, que estarÃ¡ disponible el 26 de abril y cuenta con una colaboraciÃ³n con Tame Impala. Es la primera vuelta al desierto californiano desde que la agrupaciÃ³n de Xavier de Rosnay y Gaspard AugÃ© se diera a conocer en 2007 con una memorable actuaciÃ³n. Esta noche apostaron por un increÃ­ble set de luces mÃ³viles que subÃ­an y bajaban para formar un techo sobre sus cabezas. De traje y lentes oscuros, los franceses dejaron otro gran espectÃ¡culo visual solo usando el color blanco y su gran cruz, con la que suelen acompaÃ±ar el evangelio de la mÃºsica electrÃ³nica bailable.
Toda la cultura que va contigo te espera aquÃ­. SuscrÃ­bete

title: Coachella 2024 YouTube Livestream Schedule & Details
content:
Much of the 2024 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival will stream live on YouTube, and, today, the festival has announced the schedule. As we head into the grand opening, watch the stage-by-stage livestreams below. Check to see when to catch your favorite artists.
This yearâ€™s Coachella headliners are Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat, and Tyler, the Creator, but plenty of huge names can be found further down the bill, too. Among them are a reunited No Doubt, as well as Ice Spice, Blur, J Balvin, Peso Pluma, Grimes, and late additions Vampire Weekend. You can also find Two Shell, Jockstrap, Mdou Moctar, Bicep, Lil Yachty, Oneohtrix Point Never, Faye Webster, and Brittany Howard sets dotted throughout the weekend. The livestream operates on a delay; you can also check out the live schedule.
Follow along with all of Pitchforkâ€™s coverage of Coachella 2024. The second weekend takes place from April 19-21.

title: Lana Del Rey, Taylor, The Creator... La programmation de Coachella 2024
content:
Le mythique festival amÃ©ricain de Coachella dÃ©bute ce week-end avec de grands noms Ã  sa programmation.
Coachella 2024, Ã§a commence ce vendredi ! Pour cette nouvelle Ã©dition, le mythique festival amÃ©ricain devrait attirer encore des milliers de festivaliers, avec une programmation ambitieuse, dÃ©voilÃ©e en dÃ©but d'annÃ©e. Quatre artistes sont annoncÃ©s en tÃªte d'affiche : Lana Del Rey, Tyler, The Creator, Blur et Doja Cat.
On note Ã©galement la prÃ©sence du phÃ©nomÃ¨ne de K-pop ATEEZ, Jon Batiste, Jungle, J Balvin ou Lil Yachty. La France sera aussi reprÃ©sentÃ©e au festival de Coachella, avec le groupe L'ImpÃ©ratrice et DJ Snake pour la deuxiÃ¨me annÃ©e consÃ©cutive, le duo Justice ou encore Gesaffelstein.
Cette annÃ©e encore, le festival de Coachella a lieu sur deux week-end consÃ©cutifs : les 12, 13 et 14 avril, puis les 19, 20 et 21 avril.
Combien coÃ»te le festival Coachella ?
Si la rÃ©putation du Coachella Festival n'est plus Ã  faire et que les billets d'entrÃ©e se vendent chaque annÃ©e en seulement quelques minutes, leurs prix restent assez Ã©levÃ©s... Pour assister au festival californien, le prix d'un pass s'Ã©lÃ¨ve Ã  499 dollars (environ 460 euros) et Ã  1 269 dollars (environ 1 167 euros) pour un pass VIP. Le ticket classique comprend l'accÃ¨s au festival et au parking, mais pas le camping, et encore moins le billet d'avion.
Le festival se dÃ©roule chaque annÃ©e dans la vallÃ©e de Coachella, Ã  proximitÃ© de Palm Springs. Pour prendre part aux festivitÃ©s, plusieurs possibilitÃ©s s'offrent Ã  vous : vous pouvez opter pour un vol Paris - Los Angeles puis louer une voiture jusque Palm Springs (comptez entre 250 et 400 euros pour une semaine de location) ou atterrir directement Ã  l'aÃ©roport de Palm Springs, qui se situe Ã  moins de 35 kilomÃ¨tres de l'endroit du festival. Dans tous les cas, comptez entre 330 euros en tarif basique avec WOW Air et plus de 600 euros pour vos billets d'avion.

title: Coachella 2024: music A-listers hit the desert after a struggle to sell tickets
content:
Musicâ€™s biggest names head to the desert this weekend for a troubled edition of the Coachella festival, which has seen its slowest ticket sales for a decade.
Lana Del Rey, Doja Cat and Tyler, the Creator will headline, with other acts including Ice Spice, Blur, Grimes, Justice, ReneÃ© Rapp, Vampire Weekend, Victoria MonÃ©t and J Balvin also performing.
But while last yearâ€™s tickets were all gone within four days, this year saw a slump in interest with 125,000 first weekend tickets taking 27 days to sell and some for weekend two still available. A pass for the first weekend costs $499, while a VIP pass goes up to $1,399.
The underwhelming response comes after a record year for live music in the US. Live Nation, the entertainment company that owns Ticketmaster, reported its biggest ever year with more than 145 million fans attending more than 50,000 events, up 20% over 2022.
Del Rey first appeared at the festival in 2014 and has teased what fans can now expect with her graduating to headliner.
â€œIf all goes well, itâ€™ll be as big and bold as I hope it will be,â€ she said to Vogue. â€œArchitecturally, itâ€™s going to depend on the structure, and whether I can make it â€¦ But Iâ€™m really excited about it. Iâ€™m excited, so my fans can get excited.â€
View image in fullscreen Gwen Stefani performing. Photograph: Kevin Lamarque/Reuters
The starâ€™s close friend Taylor Swift is expected to be in attendance with her football-playing boyfriend Travis Kelce. Rumours that Swift will be performing either with Del Rey or with tourmate Sabrina Carpenter are as yet unconfirmed.
â€œI am a Coachella guy,â€ Kelce said to People recently. â€œI love going to Coachella. I love live music in general. So you might see me pop up over there at some point.â€
The weekend will also see the much-anticipated reunion of No Doubt, performing for the first time since 2015.
â€œItâ€™s gonna be amazing,â€ singer Gwen Stefani said to Jimmy Kimmel in February. â€œIâ€™m so excited. And I think what is gonna be hilarious is, I know whatâ€™s gonna happen, Iâ€™m gonna get onstage and look around and just start like, cracking up because itâ€™s just gonna be like riding a bike. Weâ€™re gonna be like: â€˜What are we doing? Weâ€™re in the future right now, weâ€™re at Coachella.â€™ Itâ€™s gonna be bizarre.â€
She also called the performance â€œa really nice bow to tie on the relationshipâ€ between the band members.
Last year saw headliners Blackpink, Bad Bunny and Frank Ocean perform, with the latter artist coming under fire for a chaotic set before he cancelled his second weekend appearance.

title: Coachella to kick off with first headline performer Lana Del Rey
content:
Lana Del Rey will return to Coachella music festival to kick off headline performances across the first weekend.
The Californian festival takes place over two weekends from April 12 to 14 and April 19 to 21 and will feature other headline performances from Tyler, The Creator; Doja Cat; and a No Doubt reunion with Gwen Stefani.
Advertisement
US singer Del Rey, who rose to fame in 2012 with Born To Die, will headline the Friday slot at the Empire Polo Club in Indio, California, having last appeared at the festival during her debut in 2014.
No Doubt with lead singer Gwen Stefani will reunite at Coachella (Rich Lee/PA)
The Summertime Sadness star was scheduled to feature in the 2020 line-up, which was cancelled amid the Covid pandemic.
Advertisement
The 38-year-old hit the headlines last year after she arrived late for her performance at the BST Hyde Park festival in London, just weeks after her microphone was cut off at Glastonbury when her set overran because of her late arrival.
Advertisement
Coachella, renowned for attracting celebrities and influencers from across the world, will also see Friday performances from Mexican singer Peso Pluma, South Korean DJ and singer Peggy Gou and US star Sabrina Carpenter â€“ who has just finished opening for Taylor Swiftâ€™s Eras tour.
British musical stars descending on the desert also include British DJ duo Anti Up and Gorgon City, MC and rapper Skepta, and indie pop star The Japanese House, real name Amber Bain.
Advertisement
Advertisement
Daisy Jones And The Six star Suki Waterhouse, who recently gave birth to her first child with Twilight actor Robert Pattinson, is also billed to perform at the festival on Friday.
The British actress, model and singer confirmed she had given birth earlier this month by sharing a sun-kissed Polaroid of her cradling her child, who was wrapped in a blanket adorned with love hearts.
She later described having her first child as a â€œhumblingâ€ experience.
Advertisement
The return of Coachella comes after it ran into problems with headline acts over the last two years.
Last year, Frank Ocean pulled out of his second headline performance because of a leg injury, while Kanye West, also known as Ye, was due to headline in 2022 but the line-up was updated weeks before the event.

title: Coachella com show de Ludmilla serÃ¡ transmitido ao vivo
content:
SÃ£o Paulo
Neste ano, o YouTube farÃ¡ a transmissÃ£o ao vivo do festival Coachella no formato multiview, que permite assistir atÃ© quatro palcos simultÃ¢neos na TV. O evento acontece nos dias 12, 14, 19 e 21 de abril e terÃ¡ seis palcos transmitidos ao vivo na plataforma.
Ludmilla em show no The Town, em SÃ£o Paulo, em setembro de 2023 - Zanone Fraissat/Folhapress
Ludmila serÃ¡ a brasileira a se apresentar nessa ediÃ§Ã£o do festival, que acontece em Indio, na CalifÃ³rnia. A cantora acabou de lanÃ§ar o seu primeiro hit internacional em espanhol, "PinÃ£ Colada", em parceria com Ryan Castro.
A funkeira se apresentarÃ¡ no palco principal nos dias 14 e 21. Em 2022, Anitta e Pabllo Vittar foram as primeiras brasileiras a se apresentarem no Coachella, em um show que fez homenagem ao funk.
Outros destaques para o Coachella deste ano sÃ£o Lana Del Rey, Tyler, The Creator, Doja Cat, Bleachers, Ice Spice, J. Balvin, Justice, LE SSERAFIM e Sabrina Carpenter.
