title: Las claves para recrear el cardado que rescatÃ³ Miley Cyrus: â€œEs muy elaborado y necesitas llevar un bote de laca en el bolsoâ€
content:
En el nuevo videoclip de Miley Cyrus, Doctor (Work It Out), publicado hace unas semanas, la artista baila con movimientos de inspiraciÃ³n yeyÃ© mientras su larga melena mantiene un espectacular volumen a pesar del potente ventilador que la enfoca. Tanto el estilismo como el peinado nos recuerdan mucho a su alabadÃ­simo paso por los premios Grammy y confirman que Cyrus estÃ¡ dispuesta a explotar esta nueva faceta de tintes retro. Una estÃ©tica que no solo se alimenta de recuperar diseÃ±os vintage Â­â€“como el vestido de Bob Mackie que llevÃ³ para la citada actuaciÃ³nâ€“ sino tambiÃ©n del icÃ³nico peinado que la acompaÃ±a desde entonces. Un cardado de proporciones considerables obra de Bob Recine. â€œEl aÃ±o pasado realicÃ© un look de efecto mojado para Mileyâ€, explica el peluquero en su cuenta de Instagram, â€œeste aÃ±o decidimos que querÃ­amos algo seco y mÃ¡s grande, con el pelo mÃ¡s voluminoso, pero sexy, despeinado y palpableâ€.
El peluquero Juandiegoteo apunta al claro referente musical que todos evocamos inevitablemente cuando vemos este peinado: Dolly Parton, madrina artÃ­stica de Cyrus: â€œeste pelo es un claro homenaje al cardado de la reina indiscutible del countryâ€, afirma. La clave para conseguir este peinado, segÃºn Juandiegoteo, hair designer y embajador de Redken, es aportar volumen y densidad con ayuda de una buena cantidad de laca. â€œEl primer paso serÃ­a, despuÃ©s de lavar el cabello con champÃº de volumen y acondicionador, aplicar una lociÃ³n o espuma de volumen para crear estructura en la raÃ­z y comenzar a secar con mucho volumen. Se marca la melena con ondas muy anchas, redirigiÃ©ndolas hacia atrÃ¡s para crear una melena muy esponjosa. Con la ayuda de un peine crepamos la zona superior de la cabeza acomodando el cabelloâ€.
Para Raquel Moreno, estilista del salÃ³n The Beauty Concept Hair, es imprescindible preparar muy bien la base para que aguante en todo momento y no se desmorone ya que de lo contrario el efecto es muy feo. Es un peinado, apunta, muy elaborado y que exige mucho tiempo porque se debe trabajar muy bien, siendo la parte interna la mÃ¡s compleja, pues es con la que se consigue esa estructura ahuecada. TambiÃ©n el uso de productos adecuados, tanto para la base como para el acabado, son fundamentales, â€œpara conseguir que el cabello se eleve y que este volumen no se estropee por culpa, por ejemplo, de la humedad. El cepillo o los cepillos con los que se va a rematar el peinado y la habilidad manual son muy importantesâ€, apunta. La estilista de The Beauty Concept Hair no recomienda este peinado para cabellos muy finos o con poco volumen ya que â€œse partirÃ­a de una base poco sÃ³lida sobre la que construir y cardarâ€. TambiÃ©n influyen las condiciones del clima a las que nos expongamos, que aguante bien durante horas â€œdepende mucho del tiempo, mÃ¡s de lo que creemos porque, por ejemplo, si va a hacer mucho viento y se va a estar al aire libre, no lo recomendarÃ­aâ€, seÃ±ala. Juandiegoteo nos aconseja llevar un pequeÃ±o bote de laca en el bolso para ir retocando el peinado a lo largo de la noche: â€œsi el peinado estÃ¡ bien fijado no hay que tener miedo. Pero si vamos a estar mucho rato fuera de casa: una cena, luego salimos, etc. lo ideal es llevar un bote pequeÃ±o con espray de fijaciÃ³n en el bolso para retocar de vez en cuando. Al igual que se lleva un pintalabios o unos polvos de sol, Â¿por quÃ© no un bote de laca pequeÃ±o?â€.
MÃ¡s allÃ¡ de Dolly Parton, lo cierto es que el cardado ha estado presente en la estÃ©tica femenina a lo largo de varias dÃ©cadas, adoptando el volumen en diferentes zonas de la cabeza. En los aÃ±os 50 era la zona de la coronilla la que cobraba protagonismo gracias al peinado bouffant, creado por Raymond Bessone. Lo llevaron desde Jacquie Kennedy hasta Priscilla y la manera de peinarlo es totalmente diferente, tal y como nos explica Juandiegoteo: â€œEn varios documentos de la Ã©poca se dice que sus estilistas cardaban el pelo en la coronilla, para elevar y redondear el peinado y, posteriormente, lo fijaban con laca. Luego lo demÃ¡s se peinaba liso y se marcaba ligeramente una onda en las puntas. Es un look que hemos visto mÃ¡s recientemente en celebrities, por ejemplo, como la cantante Lana del Reyâ€.
El cardado pasarÃ­a despuÃ©s a considerarse un peinado vulgar que resultaba ostentoso o relegado a las mujeres de avanzada edad que todavÃ­a llevaban a rajatabla la visita diaria a la peluquerÃ­a. Miley Cyrus parece estar decidida a darle a la melena cardada la relevancia de dÃ©cadas atrÃ¡s. Y solo ella podrÃ­a conseguirlo.

title: Un Primavera sin la sombra de Madrid: el festival devuelve su centralidad a Barcelona y espera repetir los resultados de la pasada ediciÃ³n
content:
Alargada es la sombra de la pandemia, tanto que la inminente ediciÃ³n del Primavera Sound serÃ¡ la primera normal desde 2019. Como ocurre desde 2005 el festival ocuparÃ¡ el Parc del FÃ³rum de Barcelona, donde celebrarÃ¡ sus dÃ­as fuertes entre la jornada inaugural y gratuita del miÃ©rcoles y la madrugada del domingo. Tras los dos aÃ±os de barbecho pandÃ©mico volviÃ³ el festival hÃ­per vitaminado, con dos fines de semana de programaciÃ³n en una ediciÃ³n que generÃ³ ciertos roces con el Ayuntamiento en 2022. La del aÃ±o siguiente trajo consigo la doble capitalidad, con Ada Colau e Isabel DÃ­az Ayuso, a la guisa de Breznev y Hoenecker, besÃ¡ndose en un cartel a las puertas de la explanada de los grandes escenarios. Tras el aguado desembarco en Madrid, con los rectores del festival emulando a Felipe II al decir que no enviaron naves a luchar contra los elementos, uno de los hijos predilectos de la ciudad vuelve a su seno maternal, ya sin interferencias, ni debates, ni arranques de celos. Una ediciÃ³n por fin normal, junto a Oporto las dos Ãºnicas en la PenÃ­nsula hasta que vuelva a fraguar otra ediciÃ³n en la capital, que con el BernabÃ©u a todo trapo musical enaltece la libre contaminaciÃ³n acÃºstica.
Tras tantas ediciones de ajetreo y el eje un poco descentrado de lo estrictamente musical, en las cabezas de los responsables del festival sÃ³lo cabe repetir la normalidad, una normalidad que ellos encuentran en la ediciÃ³n del aÃ±o pasado. Lo pone en palabras Joan Pons, Director de ComunicaciÃ³n del Primavera Sound: â€œLa consecuencia final de la cita en Madrid fue que a la postre acabÃ³ empaÃ±ando la de Barcelona, que fue casi perfecta, clavada, no sÃ³lo desde un punto de vista artÃ­stico y de cifras sino como gestiÃ³n del recinto, ausencia de problemas destacables y comportamiento general de la asistenciaâ€, apunta. Ya en el balance de la pasada ediciÃ³n la organizaciÃ³n celebrÃ³ haber encontrado la medida idÃ³nea para el festival, que entonces convocÃ³ en el FÃ³rum alrededor de 65.000 personas diarias sin problema alguno de fluidez : â€œEn un festival que quiere ser mejor que el del aÃ±o anterior y peor que el siguiente siempre se hacen cambios atendiendo a las quejas o peticiones articuladas que formula el pÃºblico, y la Ãºnica variaciÃ³n sustancial de este aÃ±o es la reubicaciÃ³n en la misma zona de la PÃ©rgola Fotovoltaica del escenario Albini a causa de unas obras que se estÃ¡n haciendo en esa parte del recintoâ€. No tocar nada si todo funciona se apunta como lema del Primavera Sound 2024.
Por lo tanto ya en el olvido y sin traza de volver estÃ¡ la playa de Sant AdriÃ , que ademÃ¡s de la escasa disposiciÃ³n del Ayuntamiento de la localidad generaba problemas de acceso, yugulado por el puente que se alza sobre el puerto deportivo: â€œSin Sant AdriÃ  tenemos unas dimensiones cÃ³modas para la asistencia. No queremos crecer a lo loco, porque si es necesario crecer se harÃ¡ sÃ³lo en funciÃ³n de la demanda. Veremos si este aÃ±o hay gente que se queda fuera y si esa cantidad es considerable, pero las estimaciones nos indican que en conjunto estaremos en cifras muy similares a las de aÃ±o pasado, en una horquilla que va de las 65.000 a 72.000 personas diariasâ€. Como ejemplo de comedimiento, la organizaciÃ³n ya avanza que para el viernes casi no quedan entradas de dÃ­a, sÃ­ abonos, lo que no significarÃ¡ ampliar el aforo de la jornada. La distribuciÃ³n del pÃºblico entre nacional e internacional tambiÃ©n se moverÃ¡ en los porcentajes de otros aÃ±os no excepcionales como el 2022, situÃ¡ndose en un 60% de pÃºblico internacional y un 40% nacional. â€œQuiero dejar constancia de que en el Primavera hay mucho pÃºblico local y que es el festival del FÃ³rum, lo que ocurre es que tambiÃ©n viene mucha gente de fueraâ€, recalca Pons.
Asistentes al Festival Primavera Sound (Barcelona). Getty
Esta cantidad de pÃºblico y su impacto en el barrio aÃ±ade la variable del vecindario en la complejidad que implica organizar un acontecimiento como el Primavera Sound. El mejor antÃ­doto que ha encontrado el festival para limitar roces y eliminar molestias evitables es el diÃ¡logo y la implementaciÃ³n de las medidas que sugieren los vecinos: â€œEstamos en permanente contacto con ellos, y por ello hemos aumentado seguridad, limpieza, servicios de movilidad y monitorizaremos en tiempo real el sonido del recinto para minimizar el impacto de la mÃºsica en las inmediacionesâ€, asegura Joan Pons desde las nuevas oficinas del festival, ahora pegadas al recinto, en el mismo barrio de Sant MartÃ­. Con contrato de estancia en el FÃ³rum hasta 2027, el festival califica como â€œexcelentesâ€ sus relaciones con BSM (Barcelona Serveis Municipals, gestora del recinto), y no imagina el traslado a ninguna otra parte. â€œTenemos muy claro que el Primavera tiene dos cabezas de cartel extras, por un lado la misma ciudad de Barcelona y por otro el recinto en sÃ­, urbano y con el mar de fondo. El festival no serÃ­a lo mismo en otro lugarâ€, avisa Joan Pons. La sintonÃ­a con las autoridades municipales â€”â€œes de Perogrullo, un festival de estas dimensiones no puede hacerse de espaldas a las autoridades localesâ€, dice Ponsâ€”-, es un argumento complementario para no temer â€œdestierrosâ€ que alejen al Primavera de su vocaciÃ³n urbana.
Lo que mÃ¡s afecta es lo que sucede mÃ¡s cerca. Para no perderte nada, suscrÃ­bete. SuscrÃ­bete
En el apartado emotivo cabe destacar la consagraciÃ³n a la memoria de Steve Albini de uno de los escenarios en la zona de la pÃ©rgola fotovoltaica. En un sÃ­mil futbolÃ­stico, Pons asegura que el reputado productor y miembro de Shellac, banda que casi cada aÃ±o tocaba en el Primavera, es su Cruyff particular: â€œÃ‰l, que no amaba los festivales musicales, venÃ­a al Primavera, actuaba y luego deambulaba como pÃºblico de a piÃ©. Este aÃ±o iba a estar de nuevo con nosotros, en cierto modo nos marcaba un estÃ¡ndar con su fidelidadâ€. Si nada cambia, este escenario ya estarÃ¡ dedicado indefinidamente a la memoria del recientemente fallecido artista. El Primavera sigue en la casa con su mochila de recuerdos.
MUJERES, POP Y RHYTHM AND BLUES
En el apartado artÃ­stico el Primavera Sound vuelve a hacer justicia a una realidad: las mujeres pautan la mÃºsica contemporÃ¡nea. Al menos componiÃ©ndola e interpretÃ¡ndola, porque lo de mandar sigue siendo harina de otro costal. Contratarlas para las zonas nobles de un cartel ya no sugiere un esfuerzo por normalizar su presencia, sino seguridad de que hacerlo es garantÃ­a de calidad y de nivel artÃ­stico. Por otro lado, en el apartado estilÃ­stico, mandan en la programaciÃ³n del Primavera el pop con todas sus mutaciones, dominante de la Ã©poca que vivimos, el r&b con sus pulsiones urbanas, el folk y su vocaciÃ³n acÃºstica e introspectiva, rock y hip-hop, Ã©ste Ãºltimo con la sempiterna dificultad de seducir a las grandes figuras del gÃ©nero para que crucen el charco.
MÃ¡s allÃ¡ de los clÃ¡sicos y figuras que son carta ganadora, encabezados por Vampire Weekend y su sofisticaciÃ³n, una SZA que debuta en EspaÃ±a, Lana del Rey que parece venida de otras Ã©pocas, con su glamur que merecerÃ­a el blanco y negro, o Pulp, la inteligencia del brit-pop con mirada y canciones, artistas como Jessica Pratt, artista que suena como de antaÃ±o, con deje bossa pero sin ser revivalista; Joana Sternberg y su desnudez acÃºstica, MItski y su elegancia o Faye Webster con su pop-folk de impecables melodÃ­as, se antojan como algunos de los nombres a considerar. Como la inglesa Tirzah, un misterio que sus enigmÃ¡ticos directos no desvanece o Amaraee, una propuesta de urbanidad menos angulosa y satinada por las producciones que hoy se llevan, sofisticadas y pulidas. Veteranas como Beth Gibbons, con reciente disco en solitario, severo, PJ Harvey y su rock adusto, Bikini Kill con su femenino activismo punk-rock o la veteranÃ­a de unos incombustibles Yo La Tengo, son otros nombres que brillarÃ¡n en el FÃ³rum. Tal que Charlie XCX o RÃ³isÃ­n Murphy, una verdadera dama del pop sintetizado y bailable, cartas ambas seguras. Y para echar una mirada a Asia, el cuarteto, sÃ­, tambiÃ©n femenino Atarashii Gakko!, mirada japonesa al pop en uniformes de colegiala.
Tirzah, que actuarÃ¡ en el Primavera, en un concierto en Londres. Burak Cingi (Redferns)
En la electrÃ³nica habrÃ¡ propuestas como Mount Kimbie, Justice, Disclosure, Kode 9 o el productor y ahora tambiÃ©n cantante AG Cook, autor de un disco hipervitaminado y mutante como Britpop. Y de nuevo dos mujeres, Ã©stas como enseÃ±a hedonista, por un lado Sofia Kourtesis y por otro Romy, ambas entrando en el mundo del house con aderezo vocal. Y en un hip-hop que se nos ha hecho mayor, ni mÃ¡s ni menos que 50 aÃ±os, un clÃ¡sico con sÃ³lo 10, la recuperaciÃ³n del disco PiÃ±ata por parte de sus creadores, Freddie Gibbs y Madlib. Billy Woods, con una voz y recitado que evocan a Common, los desplegarÃ¡ sobre sus cÃ¡lidas bases jazzys, construidas por Kenny Segal en el fantÃ¡stico Maps.
Las sorpresas tienen como candidatos a nombres nuevos. Uno es el de Lankum, grupo irlandÃ©s que mezcla estremecedoramente folk y mÃºsica ruidista e industrial (agua y aceite que en sus manos mezcla), el otro viejo aunque nuevo nombre por su falta de popularidad, el del simpar Charlemagne-Palestine, un mÃºsico experimental que hace de sus conciertos unas performances cargadas de profundidad, expuesta con la ligereza de los mÃºsicos juguetones ajenos a la pretenciosidad. Por su lado Mandy Indiana y Model/Actriz pueblan esas fronteras entre el rock y la electrÃ³nica que no necesariamente apuesta por el hedonismo mÃ¡s bailable.
Y en el capÃ­tulo local, nombres a espuertas. Destaca el morbo del cristianismo hecho pop por Hidrogenesse para Stella Maris, el grupo de la serie de Los Javis La MesÃ­as , pero la oferta del festival tambiÃ©n incluye la vocaciÃ³n pop experimental de la fantÃ¡stica Marina Hein, el perfeccionismo de Guillem Gisbert, la imaginativa calidez ahora mÃ¡s electrÃ³nica de Ferran Palau, el rock desencuadernado y meridional de Derby Motoretaâ€™s Burrito Kachimba, el pop electrÃ³nico de Renaldo & Clara, los sonidos urbanos de la emergente Mushkaa, el calambre post-hardcore de los avasalladores LisÃ¤bo o el rock sin tapujos de Mujeres. Nombres para un festival que este aÃ±o desea se hable sÃ³lo de mÃºsica. Desde Barcelona.
Puedes seguir a EL PAÃS Catalunya en Facebook y X, o apuntarte aquÃ­ para recibir nuestra newsletter semanal

title: Lana Del Rey Feels 'Playful' Amid Upcoming Country Era
content:
Lana Del Rey is gearing up to release her upcoming country album, Lasso, and the superstar opened up about her incredible career trajectory in a new interview with NME.
Explore Explore Lana Del Rey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
When asked about how she feels about proving haters wrong amid her success, the superstar replied, â€œNo, maybe three years ago there would have been a sense of vindication, but now it just feels playful. I donâ€™t know why. If you hang in long enough, it just feels easy. Thereâ€™s no vindication, no nothing â€“ Iâ€™m just kind of happy to be here. Itâ€™s easy-going in that way.â€
As for her foray into the country world, Del Rey recalled a moment she had with friend and producer Jack Antonoff before the Billboard and NMPA Songwriter Awards in February, where she initially announced the forthcoming album. â€œWhen I gave Jack Antonoff his award for Best Producer Of The Year, I said, â€˜Welcome Nashville to Hollywood and Hollywood, welcome to Nashville because the music business has gone, gone country. And it went silent; 5000 people, dead silent. Then the next week, we had three major artists announce big country albums.â€
Trending on Billboard
She continued, â€œSo whereâ€™s â€˜Lassoâ€™ going? I really have no idea now!â€
The project is slated for release in September, and marks her 10th studio LP. The release is the followup to 2023â€™s Did You Know That Thereâ€™s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd, which peaked at No. 3 on the Billboard 200 chart.

title: Lana Del Rey revela que teve mÃºsica para 007 recusada
content:
O mundo perdeu a oportunidade de ter uma mÃºsica de Lana Del Rey como mÃºsica-tema de um filme da saga 007. Segundo a prÃ³pria cantora, inclusive, ela chegou a oferecer uma faixa, que foi recusada pelos produtores.
"Como serÃ¡ que isso nunca aconteceu?" Perguntou a cantora em entrevista cedida Ã  BBC. Logo em seguida, ela cantarolou a faixa 24, do Ã¡lbum Honeymoon (2015), e disse: "Eu escrevi essa para eles". Dada a cronologia, a faixa teria sido oferecida para 007: Contra Spectre, lanÃ§ado no mesmo ano. Na Ã©poca, a MGM ficou com Writing's On the Wall, de Sam Smith, que chegou a conquistar um Oscar.
No passado, a cantora jÃ¡ havia dito que, se fosse a ela pedido, faria uma mÃºsica para a saga. "Eu amo todas as mÃºsicas da saga Bond, eu amo trilhas sonoras em geral", disse Del Rey ao NME. AtÃ© hoje, porÃ©m, nada feito.
Enquanto isso, a saga segue sem previsÃ£o para seu novo filme e ainda busca um ator para protagonizar a sÃ©rie.
A continuaÃ§Ã£o da franquia Bond ainda nÃ£o tem previsÃ£o de estreia. Enquanto isso, os filmes anteriores da franquia estÃ£o disponÃ­veis para streaming no Brasil pelo Prime Video.

title: Lana Del Rey 2024 Ivor Novello Awards Speech, McCartney Ribs pringsteen
content:
The vibe at the 2024 Ivor Novello Awards at Grosvenor House in London on Thursday night (May 23) swung from gentle ribbing among two of rockâ€˜s most active seniors to a serious moment from one of todayâ€™s most influential songwriters about the importance of speaking out about domestic violence.
Lana Del Rey, 38, accepted a Special International Award celebrating her career and influence, during which she decried the rise of relationship-based violence. â€œWhen I started, I think a lot of things were written about how the songs were sort of navel-gazing and just about me and my experience with challenging relationships,â€ Del Rey said, according to the Evening Standard.
â€œNow I think what weâ€™ve seen is that those songs were not written about a small microcosm of people and women, weâ€™re seeing a huge amount of things written about difficult relationships,â€ Del Rey continued. â€œAnd even when COVID began, the second epidemic in the United States (we saw for) interpersonal relationships violence, it increased by 300%. So, you know, I just think itâ€™s amazing that female singer-songwriters, you know, have the freedom to write about absolutely whatever they want.â€
Trending on Billboard
The singer added, â€œIt was always nerve wrecking to think that writing about your relationships were maybe something that could be seen as self-gratuitous, feigning vulnerability. I heard that a lot. But I mean itâ€™s a very vulnerable thing, not just for women. But for men. Iâ€™ve learned so much in the last few years, from my peers about having a challenging time in music.â€
The mood we decidedly lighter when Sir Paul McCartney, 81 ribbed youngster Bruce Springsteen, 74, while presenting the Boss with the Fellowship of the Ivors Academy prize, the highest honor the organization gives out. While ushering in the first international songwriter the Academy has included in the Fellowship â€” following in the footsteps of Elton John, Kate Bush and Macca himself â€” the former Beatle had fun while handing the award to the Jersey rock icon, according to NME.
â€œLike Bruceâ€™s concerts, Iâ€™m going to keep this brief,â€ McCartney said in a joke about Bruceâ€™s legendarily lengthy shows, adding the quip that he couldnâ€™t think of a more fitting recipient for the honor, â€œexcept maybe Bob Dylan, or Paul Simon, or Billy Joel, or BeyoncÃ©, or Taylor Swift. The list goes on.â€
Sir Paul then got in a final razz about Springsteenâ€™s performance stamina. â€œHeâ€™s known as the American working man, but he admits heâ€™s never worked a day in his life,â€ the equally indefatigable pop legend said.

title: Stars Shine at Ivors and Cannes: Springsteen Honoured, Cher Dazzles, and Scarlett Johansson Sparks AI Debate
content:
Following is a summary of current entertainment news briefs.
Bruce Springsteen, Lana Del Rey, Raye honoured at Ivor songwriting awards
Bruce Springsteen, Lana Del Rey and Raye were among the music stars honoured at the Ivors in London on Thursday, the annual awards for songwriters and screen composers. U.S. rocker Springsteen became the first international songwriter to receive an Ivors Academy Fellowship, the highest honour bestowed by the UK-based association.
Cher, Demi Moore entertain guests at glamorous Cannes fundraiser for AIDS
From Cher to Demi Moore and Magic Johnson, the fashion and entertainment industry's biggest names decamped to Antibes on Thursday night to raise money for AIDS research in one of the most luxurious, and secluded, settings on the French Riviera. This year's gala, where a seat at dinner costs at least $25,000, marked the 30th edition of the glitzy charity gala organized by amfAR, The Foundation for AIDS Research, that is held annually alongside the nearby Cannes Film Festival.
Gary Oldman says he jumped at chance to be in Cannes drama 'Parthenope'
Gary Oldman jumped at the chance to be in Italian director Paolo Sorrentino's new coming-of-age drama, "Parthenope," even if it was just a small role, the Oscar-winning actor told Reuters. "I was in anyway. I didn't care what it would have been either," said Oldman on Wednesday at the Cannes Film Festival, where the competition film celebrated its premiere.
'The Garfield Movie' gave Chris Pratt a reminder of his lazy side
Voicing the iconic lazy, orange cat in "The Garfield Movie" reminded Chris Pratt of himself when he was in his late 20s and early 30s. "I ate so much all the time, and I was very lazy," he told Reuters.
Taylor Swift's 'Tortured Poets Department' proves on-Target for retailer
Music superstar Taylor Swift's latest album, "The Tortured Poets Department," was released just two weeks before the end of Target's quarter - and yet sales were enough to buoy the retailer's entertainment business. Target said the category grew high-single-digits in the latest quarter, benefiting from exclusive offers for Swift's latest release.
Reliance, Disney seek India antitrust nod with cricket rights assurance, sources say
Reliance Industries and Walt Disney have sought antitrust clearance for their $8.5 billion India media merger by arguing their combined power, especially on cricket broadcasting, will not hit advertisers, two people with direct knowledge told Reuters. The deal, announced in February, has been expected by experts to face intense scrutiny as it will create India's biggest entertainment player with 120 TV channels and two streaming services. It will also own lucrative rights for cricket, India's top sport.
Scarlett Johansson's OpenAI feud rekindles Hollywood fear of artificial intelligence
OpenAI's apparent homage to the movie "Her" featuring the voice likeness of Scarlett Johansson is fueling a backlash against artificial intelligence across Hollywood, executives told Reuters. Johansson's accusation that the ChatGPT-maker copied her performance in the Spike Jonze-directed feature film, after failing to strike an agreement, rekindled the creative class's anxiety about the existential threat posed by AI, even as Hollywood studios test new tools and mull alliances with OpenAI.
Tennessee AG investigating company that tried to auction Graceland
Tennessee's attorney general said on Thursday that his office was investigating a company's effort to auction off Graceland, singer Elvis Presley's famed mansion in Memphis. Attorney General Jonathan Skrmetti said in a statement that his office was investigating if any fraud was carried out by Naussany Investments & Private Lending, which on Wednesday abandoned its plan to auction Graceland.
US Justice Department, states file lawsuit against Live Nation
The U.S. Department of Justice and a group of states have filed a lawsuit against Live Nation Entertainment, according a court docket on Thursday.
Cassie Ventura thanks people who supported her over Diddy assault video
Singer Cassie Ventura, ex-girlfriend of rapper Sean "Diddy" Combs, on Thursday publicly thanked the people who supported her after the release of a 2016 surveillance video that appeared to show him assaulting her at a Los Angeles hotel.
"Thank you for all of the love and support from my family, friends, strangers and those I have yet to meet," the "Me & U" vocalist wrote in a post on Instagram.
(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

title: Raye and Lana Del Rey triumph at Ivor Novello awards
content:
British singer-songwriter Raye, American rock star Bruce Springsteen and US musician Lana Del Rey have all been honoured at the 2024 Ivor Novellos.
London-born Raye capped off her incredible recent run of successes by being presented with the songwriter of the year prize at the ceremony held at Grosvenor House, London, on Thursday.
Advertisement
The 26-year-old was described by Ivor judges as having â€œthe voice of a generationâ€ after the release of her chart-topping album, My 21st Century Blues.
She previously made history at the Brits in March, where she won six awards, the most of any artist in one year, including album of the year.
Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band (Jordan Pettitt/PA)
Advertisement
However, at the Ivor Novellos, she lost out on best album to Black Classical Music, written by Yussef Dayes, Rocco Palladino and Charlie Stacey.
Skepta, Del Rey, KT Tunstall and Bernie Taupin are all gift of the academy recipients so were honoured at the event with their awards.
Advertisement
The 2024 special international award celebrated the career and influence of Del Rey, who has had six UK number ones, and Springsteen made history by picking up an Ivors Academy fellowship.
He was previously named the first international songwriter to be inducted into the fellowship. Springsteen follows in the footsteps of Sir Elton John, Kate Bush, and Beatles star Sir Paul McCartney who have been given the bodyâ€™s highest honour.
Advertisement
Lana Del Ray (Ian West/PA)
Tom Gray, chairman of the Ivors Academy, said: â€œOn behalf of the Ivors Academy and all the songwriters and composers we represent, itâ€™s an honour to recognise extraordinary work and brilliant individuals behind it.
â€œWe know that, because they are chosen by our peers, our awards are incredibly meaningful to their recipients. Ultimately, everyone knows that the Ivors define exceptional craft so a huge congratulations to all our winners.â€
Advertisement
The rising star award was given to new-wave indie artist Master Peace, while Sir Elton Johnâ€™s songwriting partner Taupin was honoured with the Ivor Novello for outstanding contribution to British music and Scottish singer Tunstall picked up her gong for outstanding song collection.
Taupin has previously been given nine gongs at the event and this one came 50 years on from his first win for Daniel with Sir Elton in 1974.
Advertisement
Central Cee (Ian West/PA)
Advertisement
The PRS for music most performed work went to London-born rappers Dave and Central Cee for the UKâ€™s biggest song of 2023 Sprinter, while grime star Skepta picked up the visionary award.
London jazz ensemble Speakers Corner Quartet and poet Kae Tempest won their first Ivor Novello when Geronimo Blues was named best contemporary song.
The 2023 rising star recipient, Victoria Canal, won best song musically and lyrically for Black Swan alongside Jonny Lattimer and Eg White. The 25-year-old German born musician, who has lived in Spain and the US, also performed her track on the evening.
Winners of best score for films, TV and games went to Oscar-nominated British composer Jerskin Fendrixâ€™s music for surreal black comedy Poor Things, which starred Emma Stone; Arthur Sharpe for BBC comedy drama, The Following Events Are Based On A Pack Of Lies; and Stephen Barton and Gordy Haabâ€™s Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, respectively.

title: Lana Del Rey uses Ivor Novello award speech to call out relationship violence
content:
Lana Del Rey has used her Ivor Novello award speech to call out a rise in relationship-based violence in America.
The American singer-songwriter, 38, picked up her special international award, which celebrated her career and influence, at the ceremony at Grosvenor House hotel in London on Thursday.
Advertisement
After receiving a standing ovation, she told the audience that people thought she was â€œnavel gazingâ€ while singing about her experience of â€œchallenging relationshipsâ€.
Lana Del Rey at the Met Gala (Matt Crossick/PA)
Del Rey added: â€œI think what weâ€™ve seen is that likeâ€¦ those songs were not written about a small microcosm of people and women, weâ€™re seeing a huge amount of things written about difficult relationships.
Advertisement
â€œAnd even when Covid began, the second epidemic in the United States (we saw for) interpersonal relationships violence, it increased by 300%.
â€œSo, you know, I just think itâ€™s amazing that female singer-songwriters, you know, have the freedom to write about absolutely whatever they want.
Advertisement
â€œ(Itâ€™s) nerve wrecking to think that like writing about your relationships, were maybe something that could be seen as, like, self gratuitousâ€¦. feigning vulnerability. I heard that a lot.
â€œBut I mean itâ€™s a very vulnerable thing, not just for women. But for men. Iâ€™ve learned so much in the last few years, from my peers about having a challenging time in music.â€
Advertisement
She also gave a shout out to British singer Paloma Faith who she called a â€œsweetheartâ€ and said she was â€œso happy youâ€™re hereâ€.
Paloma Faith (Lucy North/PA)
Reflecting on the importance of her speech in the winnersâ€™ room, Del Rey told the PA news agency: â€œThe climate is so warm, the waters are so warm, to be whatever you want to be to say, whatever you want to say, to change, however you want to change, itâ€™s so much less rigid.
Advertisement
â€œItâ€™s so nice for everyone whoâ€™s starting and I can like, I never know where Iâ€™m going personally in my life.
â€œBut I have such a good feeling on the pulse of like, the musical culture, I see exactly where itâ€™s going. I really can sense that spoken word is coming back.â€

title: Ivor Novello Awards 2024: Paloma Faith, KT Tunstall and more on the threat of AI
content:
Paloma Faith, KT Tunstall and other songwriters at the Ivor Novello Awards have spoken out about the use of AI in music, saying meaningful songs cannot be written by "robots".
The awards ceremony, which honours the craft of songwriting, was held in London this afternoon, with artists including Raye, Bruce Springsteen, Lana Del Rey and Skepta honoured.
It comes at a time of instability for songwriters as artificial intelligence has grown in its capabilities. Dozens of artists have called for more protections against the use of their identities without consent, and the use of their music to train AI models.
Image: KT Tunstall was recognised for her 20-year career. Pic: PA
Tunstall, who received the outstanding song collection prize recognising her 20-year career - 18 years after claiming her first Ivor Novello for Suddenly I See in 2006 - told Sky News she finds the issue "worrying", but also trusts that humans can recognise when music is heartfelt.
"If you look at all the songs that have stayed in popular culture from the '50s, '60s, '70s, '80s, there were tonnes of songs coming out then as well that haven't been remembered, but the ones that we all still sing at karaoke, the ones we still play, are the ones that are lived, real, authentic experiences by the writers. And that emotion comes through.
"We recognise as a fellow human being that they're talking about something we've gone through and something we understand. And a robot's never going to do that."
Image: Bruce Springsteen is the first international artist to be inducted into the Ivors Fellowship. Pic: AP/Chris Pizzello
'One of the most harrowing, traumatic experiences I've ever had'
Faith, who presented an award at the ceremony, released her sixth studio album, The Glorification Of Sadness, earlier this year.
"That is about probably one of the most harrowing, traumatic experiences I've ever had, which is breaking up with the father of my children after 10 years," she said. "I don't understand how AI can get to such a personal level of explanation that I can only articulate because it's my personal experience, my first-hand experience... not just of writing about a female role as a mother but also heartbreaking stuff.
Advertisement
"It's all from a feminist angle and I think it's so nuanced that I don't believe [AI could match it]. But what I think the danger is and what the worry is... is that our emotional range and our emotional intellect will be guided by computers and eventually maybe we'll lose part of our brains, because we will believe that there is only the emotional range that a computer has dictated to us. That to me is worrying."
Image: CMAT was nominated for best album. Pic: PA
'It's already creeping in'
Up-and-coming Irish singer-songwriter CMAT, who was nominated for best album and has won acclaim for her heartfelt, playful pop, believes there is no place for AI in making music.
"I understand there's people making arguments in tech and data, I can understand arguments for AI being used scientifically, but what is the point, artistically? I don't get it. It has to be from the human experience. I need to know that a person is behind what I'm hearing. And it's already creeping into music - and I know it's been happening with songwriters, where they're putting in AI prompts into music and using that as a jumping off point for the writing of their song. That's crazy to me. I think it's gross."
Former Mercury Prize winner Sampha, who was nominated for best song musically and lyrically at the Ivors, said while he does not use AI himself and can see it "presents issues", it also "presents possibilities".
Read more:
The gigs, sports events and festivals that clash with the election
Masked rapper who claims to be a Premier League footballer announces first live gig
Be the first to get Breaking News Install the Sky News app for free
Some 26 songwriters and composers collected awards at the event, with Raye - who made history at the Brits earlier this year - named songwriter of the year.
She was described as "the voice of a generation" by judges, who praised not just her own work as a solo artist, but also her work for others including Charli XCX, Little Mix, BeyoncÃ©, John Legend, Ellie Goulding and Zara Larsson.
Springsteen was also in attendance to receive the Ivors Fellowship, the highest honour at the awards - making history as the first international artist to be inducted.
Best album was awarded to Black Classical Music, written by Yussef Dayes, Rocco Palladino and Charlie Stacey, while this year's special international Award celebrated the career and influence of Lana Del Rey.
Rap legend Skepta was recognised with the visionary award, while esteemed songwriter Bernie Taupin, renowned for his partnership with Sir Elton John, was honoured with the gong for outstanding contribution to British music.

title: Lana Del Rey to Receive Songwriter Icon Award at NMPA Annual Meeting
content:
Lana Del Rey will be honored by the National Music Publishersâ€™ Association (NMPA) during the organizationâ€™s Annual Meeting at Lincoln Centerâ€™s Alice Tully Hall on June 12.
Del Rey will receive this yearâ€™s NMPA Songwriter Icon award in recognition of her â€œcompletely original aesthetic that has been emulated by an entire generation,â€ per the NMPAâ€™s official announcement.
Additionally, Warner Music Group CEO Robert Kyncl will sit down for a keynote conversation and Register of Copyrights Shira Perlmutter to discuss the protection of intellectual property. The event will also award Savan Kotecha with the NMPA Non-Performing Songwriter Icon award for his successes in pop music that range from penning hits for Ariana Grande, One Direction, Britney Spears and many more. The song â€œCanâ€™t Help Falling in Love,â€ co-written by Luigi Creatore, Hugo Peretti and George David Weiss, will be honored as an NMPA Iconic Song.
Congressman Darrell Issa (R-CA) will receive the NMPA Presidentâ€™s award for his efforts in supporting artists and creators.
Popular on Variety
+ Dominican artist Tokischa is set to launch SOL, her own record label, in partnership with her manager Angelica Piche and Warner Music Latina. Tokischa will release her own music through SOL and will also have the ability to sign new artists to the imprint. The deal is supported by Atlantic Records.
â€œWe are thrilled to launch SOL, a label that will be a home for misunderstood artists. Itâ€™s very important for us to give a voice and a space to people who, like us, started from scratch,â€ said Piche, SOLâ€™s co-founder.
â€œTokischa is a one of one artist. We could not be more excited to be part of this next chapter of her career and working alongside Angelica, Alejandro and the entire team,â€ said Atlantic Music Group Chairman/CEO Julie Greenwald and Atlantic Records Chairman/CEO Craig Kallman.
Tokischaâ€™s trajectory includes collaborations with superstars such as Madonna, RosalÃ­a, J Balvin, Ozuna, and Marshmello.
Pictured above (L-R): Memo Parra, Brenda Carrasco, Alejandro Duque, Angelica Piche, Tokischa, Natalie Cotton, Roberto Andrade Dirak, Francisco Granados and Aton Ben-Horin.
+ Sony Music Publishing UK has renewed an exclusive global publishing agreement with electronic dance music duo Gorgon City. Additionally, Gorgon City has launched Realm Publishing in partnership with SMP and announced UK producer and DJ Riordan as Realmâ€™s first signing.
Recently, Gorgon City shared the news of their upcoming fifth album â€œReverieâ€ (slated for July 19), along with the albumâ€™s lead singles â€œBiggest Regretâ€ with Bbyafricka, and â€œAll That You Needâ€ with Caroline Byrne. The duo will also be performing shows all summer with their residency at LIV Las Vegas, as well as at The Brooklyn Mirage, Los Angelesâ€™ Shrine and Ushuaia Ibiza.
+ UTA has hired Lucy Pullin and Virgil Thomas as agents in the Music Crossover division. Pullin joins the team from ie: entertainment ltd and Thomas from Endeavor. Pullin will be based out of the London office and Thomas in Los Angeles.
Thomas recently signed executive music producer and music editor Jason Ruder, whose notable credits include â€œThe Color Purple,â€ â€œMaestro,â€ â€œBabylon,â€ â€œLa La Land,â€ â€œThe Great Gatsbyâ€ and â€œJoker.â€ Currently, Ruder is leading music production for â€œJoker: Folie Ã  Deux.â€
Additionally, the Music Crossover group recently signed Emmy Award-winning composer Laura Karpman, coming on the heels of her first Oscar nomination for her â€œAmerican Fictionâ€ score, as well as Grammy-winning music supervisors Julia Michels and Julianne Jordan, best known for their work on â€œA Star is Bornâ€ and the â€œPitch Perfectâ€ franchise.
+ Warner Chappell Music (WCM), in partnership with the Roots and Live Nation Urban, will be hosting its first â€œMessage in the Musicâ€ songwriting camp from May 28 â€“ June 1 in Philadelphia, parallel to the â€œRoots Picnicâ€ 2024 festival.
Hosted by Ryan Press (WCM), Shawn Gee (Live Nation Urban), Pop Wansel, and Questlove and Black Thought (the Roots) â€“ in conjunction with Sons of Legends (Caliph Gamble, Rob Murray Jr., Abijah Preston) â€“ the inaugural camp will host a series of sessions designed to expand opportunities for local writers and producers and cultivate a range of creative collaborations.
WCM is expecting 50+ writers and artists to attend the camp, including high profile artists from the Philadelphia area, as well as chart-topping songwriters and producers from WCMâ€™s roster.
Wednesday, May 22
Warner Music has revealed its plans to expand into Nigeria by opening its first full-owned office hub in Lagos.
In a press release, Warner Music Africa (WMA) explained its new hub will â€œenable Warner Music Group to provide more of its A&R, Operations and Marketing expertise to Nigeriaâ€™s creative ecosystem.â€
WMAâ€™s management team â€” comprised of Alfonso Perez-Soto, president of emerging markets; Laverne Thomas, operations lead for WMA; Temi Adeniji, managing director for WMA, and Yoel Kenan, CEO of Africori â€” recently met with African government officials to establish the companyâ€™s plans for growth.
Adeniji and Perez-Soto have spearheaded the signing and development of CKay (Atlantic Records), whose viral single â€œLove Nwantitiâ€ has been certified platinum in the U.S. Additionally, WMA recently signed 26-year-old Nigerian singer-songwriter Joeboy, who has created his own label, Young Legend, with WMA providing global distribution for the venture.
+ Brandon Silversteinâ€™s S10 Publishing and Avex USA have inked a co-publishing deal with Kavi, the producer behind the Hot 100-topping â€œMillion Dollar Babyâ€ by Tommy Richman. Kavi is also closely collaborating with Richman on his forthcoming self-titled album while continuing to work with acts including Playboi Carti, Lil Tecca, Swae Lee, Yeat, Destroy Lonely and others.
Kavi shared, â€œBrandon and Naoki have amazing energy, and Iâ€™m excited to bring more of my musical ideas to life, supported by the incredible teams at S10 and Avex.â€
â€œKavi is a creative force of nature and I am so excited to be working with Benny, Alix and the Avex team on this,â€ said Silverstein.
+ Sony Music Publishing Nashville and CAM Creative have signed country music artist Ryan Larkins to a global publishing deal. Notably, Larkins co-wrote Bill Andersonâ€™s Grammy nominated song â€œSomeday Itâ€™ll All Make Senseâ€ featuring Dolly Parton.
Larkins said, â€œI am so thankful for the opportunity to write for Sony Music Publishing. Rusty, Aubrey and team have been huge champions of mine. I am so excited to see what the future holds. I am so excited to partner with Trisha McClanahan. Her success, experience and belief in me and my music left me with no doubt she was the right person for me. Carole-Ann has believed in me from the beginning and Iâ€™m so thankful to continue to work with her. I canâ€™t wait to see the great things weâ€™re going to achieve together.â€
Sony Music Publishing Nashville CEO Rusty Gaston said, â€œFrom the moment I first met Ryan, it was obvious he had the heart of a true American storyteller. His songs carry the spirit, emotions, and images that make country music special. It has been amazing to watch him celebrate his first #1 single and now his first major award nomination, and we look forward to many more of his successes in the future.â€
+ Janis Ian has signed an exclusive deal with Sony Music Publishing to manage her entire catalog worldwide (excluding Japan).
â€œIâ€™ve worked with Sony Music Publishing for years, and Esther Friedman and her team have shown their love of music beyond just the business side,â€ said Ian. â€œAlthough my catalogâ€™s been with various publishers through the years, Iâ€™m tremendously excited about having it all in one place, with people I trust.â€
The award-winning artist has been making music, entertaining people, and tackling important topics for more than 60 years. She wrote her first song at the age of 12 and two years later wrote and recorded her first hit single, â€œSocietyâ€™s Child.â€ The controversial song about an interracial couple in the 1960s reached No. 14 on Billboardâ€™s Hot 100 chart and No. 13 on Cash Box Pop Singles and Canadaâ€™s RPM charts, but was banned by many radio stations because of its subject matter. The song was later inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame in 2002.
Throughout the years, Ian has released 23 studio albums, along with five live albums. Her songs have been covered by countless artists across all genres and eras, including Celine Dion, Joan Baez, Shirley Bassey, Nina Simone, Glen Campbell, Cher, Patti LuPone, Jeff Beck and Johnny Depp, Mel Torme, and more.
Monday, May 20
The estate of Otis Redding, otherwise known as Big O Holdings LLC, has selected Sony Music Publishing to administer Reddingâ€™s music catalog across the U.S.
Redding was a renowned soul and rhythm and blues musician, otherwise known as â€œThe King of Soul.â€ He released his debut album, â€œPain In My Heartâ€ in 1964 which produced his first No. 1 hit, â€œThese Arms of Mine.â€ The song reached No. 20 on the R&B charts, and was included on several soundtracks, and most prominently in the 1987 film â€œDirty Dancing.â€ He was posthumously inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1989, the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1994 and honored with a Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award in 1999.
â€œFor over 50 years I have been diligent to make sure Otisâ€™ legacy remains relevant and recognizable around the world. I feel that the Sony Music Publishing team can assist my family in this never-ending effort,â€ said Reddingâ€™s wife, Zelma Redding.
â€œAs one of the most significant songwriters of our lifetime, Otis Redding remains an American treasure,â€ stated Sony Music Publishing Chairman/CEO Jon Platt. â€œOtisâ€™ songs have shaped the cultural landscape across genres and generations, and it is a privilege to partner with the Redding family as stateside custodians of this singular music catalog.â€
SMP
Pictured above (L-R ) â€“ (rear left) Arron Saxe, Walter Jones, Derek Crownover, Jarred Andrews, Dexter Redding (rear center) Justin Andrews, Zelma Redding, Karla Redding-Andrews, Brian Monaco, Liz Lewis, Jon Platt.
+ Big Loud Texas has tapped Brendon Anthony as vice president of the imprint, effective immediately. Based in Austin, Anthony will oversee the Texas operation across label functions, working with Big Loud Texasâ€™ co-founders Miranda Lambert and Jon Randall, as well as key members of the Big Loud Records team.
â€œI am very proud to join the amazing team at Big Loud and look forward to working with Miranda and Jon to create something truly special in Big Loud Texas,â€ Anthony said â€œBeing a part of growing and supporting the Texas music industry has been my focus for over 25 years and I am thrilled to continue that effort by joining Big Loud Texas.â€
â€œWeâ€™re so proud to have Brendon join us at Big Loud Texas,â€ shared Lambert. â€œHe is as passionate as we are about the Texas music scene and has knowledge that will benefit artists in so many ways.â€
â€œNot only does he bring years of knowledge of the Texas music industry and culture to the table,â€ Randall noted, â€œbut his legendary and respected musicianship has given him firsthand experience in touring and recording, and a deep understanding of what Texas music artists need in a record label. We are lucky to have him.â€
Brendon Anthony most recently served as director of the Texas Music Office, the agency within the Office of the Governor tasked with overseeing policy related to the Texas commercial music industry.
+ Sony Music Publishing has upped Nasra Artan to the new position of head of international A&R. Artan will take on a broader role in spearheading SMPâ€™s international creative strategy and be responsible for liaising across SMPâ€™s A&R teams. She will continue to be based out of London and will report to SMPâ€™s President of International, Guy Henderson.
Henderson said, â€œIt gives me great pleasure to announce Nasraâ€™s promotion. In addition to her skill set, energy and drive, Nasra approaches the creative world with an open mind, knowing that great songwriters and big songs can come from anywhere. She is well positioned to excel in this new role, and we all look forward to achieving further success together on behalf of our international roster.â€
Artan first joined the company in 2022 as European A&R Manager. Prior to joining the company, Artan spent three years at Warner Music Norway, most recently as A&R project manager.
+ iann dior â€” best known for his feature on 24kGoldnâ€™s Billboard Hot 100-topping â€œMoodâ€ â€” has signed to Big Noise Music Group. The 25-year-old American artist released his latest single, â€œEdge of Tomorrow,â€ on May 10 with the label.
Big Noise President Jon Cohen shared, â€œWelcoming iann and his team into the Big Noise family has been truly exciting for all of us! Between the new music and his global touring presence, iann will certainly turn heads throughout the year and beyond.â€
Nick Gross, Big Noise CEO, said, â€œIann dior is one of those dream artists you hope you have the chance to work with every couple of years as a label. His ear for melody and attention to detail around the art he makes is very special, and Iâ€™m really looking forward to our partnership.

title: Watch Sexyy Red & Lana Del Rey Twerk Together at Hangout Festival
content:
Sexyy Red and Lana Del Rey are the duo we didnâ€™t know we needed. The two artists hung out together at Hangout Festival in Gulf Shores, Ala., over the weekend, and Sexyy has the moment on camera.
The â€œGet It Sexyyâ€ MC posted an Instagram video Tuesday (May 21) of her and Lana twerking to Sexyyâ€™s unreleased song â€œTTGâ€ from her upcoming EP In Sexyy We Trust, which is set to be released this Friday, May 24, via Open Shift/gamma. In Sexyy We Trust arrives a year after her sophomore mixtape, Hood Hottest Princess, which included her standout hits â€œPound Town 2â€ with Tay Keith and Nicki Minaj, and â€œSkeeYee.â€ The set reached No. 62 on the Billboard 200.
Elsewhere in the clip, filmed by Suave Films, the 26-year-old rapper is flaunting fat stacks of cash in her trailer and performing at Hangout Festival, where her fans are proudly holding up â€œSexyy 2024 Make America Sexyy Againâ€ signs. She also shared snaps of herself hanging with the Grammy-nominated singer in another carousel post, captioning it, â€œIâ€™m wit my bthcez so you gotta bring some friendz.â€
Trending on Billboard
The â€œSkeeYeeâ€ rapper is no stranger to superstar power, as sheâ€™s collaborated with Minaj, Drake, SZA, Summer Walker and more. And Sexyy is a consistently charting hitmaker herself, as her latest single, â€œGet It Sexyy,â€ became her first lead top 10 hit on Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs and her first lead top 20 hit on the Billboard Hot 100.
Watch the video of Sexyy Red and Lana from Hangout Festival below.

title: Taylor Swift, Lana del Rey y Billie Eilish se cuelan en la tercera temporada de 'Los Bridgerton'
content:
Las suites de lujo estÃ¡n ocupadas en Shondland. La tercera temporada de Los Bridgerton acaba de aterrizar en Netflix con cuatro episodios. El 13 de junio, EspaÃ±a y el resto del mundo acogerÃ¡n la segunda mitad de esta tanda de capÃ­tulos. Los Bridgerton es uno de los buques insignia de la plataforma roja y su productora, Shonda Rhimes, uno de los nombres que nutren a Netflix. El Ã©xito de esta nueva temporada, por tanto, se da por hecho.
MÃ¡s aÃºn cuando se tienen en cuenta los nombres implicados en los recientes episodios de Los Bridgerton. No hablamos de Penelope, Colin y compaÃ±Ã­a, sino de otra nobleza muy distinta: la del siglo XXI. La banda sonora de Los Bridgerton siempre ha mantenido una posiciÃ³n disruptiva con respecto a la trama. Frente a una ficciÃ³n de Ã©poca, Shonda Rhimes han salpicado Los Bridgerton con versiones instrumentales de artistas contemporÃ¡neos. En esta temporada, Taylor Swift estÃ¡ entre las invitadas, pero no es la Ãºnica. Te contamos quiÃ©nes le acompaÃ±an.
Â¿QuÃ© artistas estÃ¡n en la BSO de â€˜Los Bridgertonâ€™?
Pese a que sÃ³lo se han emitido cuatro capÃ­tulos, la banda sonora de Los Bridgerton ya pasa de veinte piezas musicales. La mayor parte de ellas son composiciones orquestales de cuartetos de cuerda. Sin embargo, estos mismos cuartetos (Vitamin String Quartet entre ellos) han arreglado temas de Taylor Swift, Lana del Rey, Billie Eilish, BTS, Pitbull, Nick Jonas, Sia o GAYLE.
Entre las canciones que oiremos como BSO en esta tercera temporada de Los Bridgerton, destacan:
Snow on the beach, de Taylor Swift y Lana del Rey, a manos del Atwood Quartet
Happier than ever, de Billie Eilish
Cheap Thrills, de Sia
Give me Everything, de Pitbull, arreglado por Archer Marsh
Dynamite - BTS
Jealous - Nick Jonas
abcdefu - GAYLE

title: So half Taylor Swift Lana Del Rey bei ihrem Gewichtsverlust
content:
Mit ihrem Auftritt auf dem Coachella-Festival lÃ¶ste Lana Del Rey (38) Spekulationen Ã¼ber ihr Gewicht aus â€“ die SÃ¤ngerin prÃ¤sentierte sich auf der BÃ¼hne mit einer deutlich schlankeren Figur. Fans unterstellten der "Summertime Sadness"-Interpretin sogar, die verschreibungspflichtigen Ozempic-Abnehmspritzen benutzt zu haben, die eigentlich nur fÃ¼r Diabetiker gedacht sind. Auf einem Foto, das die Musikerin kÃ¼rzlich auf Instagram verÃ¶ffentlichte, ist sie mit einem Sweatshirt der Fitnessmarke Dogpound zu sehen. Taylor Swifts (34) Personaltrainer ist Kirk Meyers â€“ der GrÃ¼nder des Unternehmens. Das kÃ¶nnte ein Hinweis darauf sein, dass ihr der Personaltrainer ihrer besten Freundin dabei half, die Pfunde loszuwerden. Der offizielle Social-Media-Account von Dogpound teilte das Bild von Lana in seiner Story. "Ratet mal, wer in der neuen Sommerkollektion zu sehen ist?", hieÃŸ es dazu.
Lana weigerte sich zuerst, die GerÃ¼chte Ã¼ber ihre Gewichtsabnahme Ã¶ffentlich anzusprechen. Doch den Unterstellungen setzte die 38-JÃ¤hrige mittels eines Instagram-Beitrags ein Ende. Da die "Video Games"-Interpretin und Taylor eng befreundet sind, ist es naheliegend, dass die beiden auch ihre Fitness-Erfolge miteinander teilen. Denn Kirk half auch der 34-JÃ¤hrigen beispielsweise bei ihrer kÃ¶rperlichen Vorbereitung fÃ¼r die Eras-Tour und schwÃ¤rmte nur in den hÃ¶chsten TÃ¶nen von seiner berÃ¼hmten Klientin. "Manche Leute wÃ¼rden sich wahrscheinlich Ã¼bergeben oder mÃ¼ssten sich hinlegen, wenn sie so trainieren wÃ¼rden wie sie", sagte der Dogpound-GrÃ¼nder gegenÃ¼ber Vogue. Die ehemalige Country-SÃ¤ngerin trainierte wÃ¤hrend ihrer Tournee sechs Tage pro Woche â€“ Ã¼ber Lanas Trainingsplan sind hingegen keine Details bekannt.
Zuletzt setzte Lana ihre neue Figur in einem schlichten schwarzen Kleid auf dem roten Teppich der Grammy Awards in Szene. Bei der Verleihung ging die fÃ¼nffach nominierte KÃ¼nstlerin zwar leer aus, freute sich jedoch fÃ¼r Taylor, die einen Grammy in der Hauptkategorie "Album des Jahres" gewann. Die langjÃ¤hrigen Freundinnen lernten sich bereits vor zwÃ¶lf Jahren bei den MTV EMAs kennen und zeigen sich seitdem regelmÃ¤ÃŸig zusammen in der Ã–ffentlichkeit.

title: Jack Antonoff to appear in Boston next month for podcast, concert
content:
Beginning at 1 p.m., Antonoff will join host Matt Whyte and David Kaiser, a theoretical physicist and MIT professor, to discuss the concept of time, including topics like whether or not it comes from human biology or deeper physics principles.
Ahead of a Bleachers concert at MGM Music Hall June 10, the bandâ€™s frontman â€” and 10-time Grammy - winning producer behind Taylor Swift , Lana Del Rey , and more stars â€” will appear at the Museum of Science earlier in the day for a live taping of the podcast â€œSing For Science.â€
Advertisement
â€œBroader questions like these bridge the gap between everyday human experience and incredibly complex science,â€ Whyte said in a press release. â€œThat Jack Antonoff, one of the busiest and most important figures in music today, is drawn to this topic speaks volumes about scienceâ€™s capacity to engage us.â€
Get The Big To-Do Your guide to staying entertained, from live shows and outdoor fun to the newest in museums, movies, TV, books, dining, and more. Enter Email Sign Up
â€œSing for Science,â€ the Talkhouse-produced show on Appleâ€™s top 10 music interview podcast charts, pairs musicians with experts for conversations centered around an artistâ€™s particular interests or songs that touch on scientific concepts. In this case, the chat ties into lyrics from the Bleachers song â€œThe Waiter,â€ where Antonoff sings about â€œthe notion that timeâ€™s gonna stop.â€
The event is part of the Museum of Scienceâ€™s ongoing partnership with the podcast. This past week, the museum hosted a conversation featuring Talking Heads frontman David Byrne and Patrik Svensson, author of â€œThe Book of Eels,â€ for a chat about the many mysteries surrounding our knowledge of eels, from how they reproduce to their unique migration habits.
â€œThis conversation between Jack Antonoff and David Kaiser, two incredible minds, will delve into the nature of time and celebrate the work of one of todayâ€™s most singular talents,â€ said James Monroe, creative director of programming of the Centers for Public Science Learning at the Museum of Science. â€œWe are grateful to our partners at â€˜Sing for Science,â€™ Jack, and David for supporting the work of the Center for Space Sciences through this fascinating and one-of-a-kind discussion.â€
Advertisement
June 10, 1 p.m. Tickets on sale to the public at 1 p.m. today, Museum of Science members get first access at 11 a.m. $25 for general admission, $20 for obstructed view seating. For more information, visit mos.org/events/subspace
Henry Bova can be reached at henry.bova@globe.com.

title: Lana Del Rey revelÃ³ su canciÃ³n favorita del nuevo Ã¡lbum de Taylor Swift
content:
Lana Del Rey elogiÃ³ uno de los temas recientes como su canciÃ³n favorita del nuevo Ã¡lbum de Taylor Swift, "The Tortured Poets Department". (CrÃ©ditos: REUTERS/Andrew Kelly/Republic Records via AP)
En la reciente Met Gala 2024, celebrada en el prestigioso Metropolitan Museum of Art de Nueva York el pasado 6 de mayo, la cantante Lana Del Rey compartiÃ³ sus impresiones sobre el Ãºltimo trabajo discogrÃ¡fico de Taylor Swift, The Tortured Poets Department, y explicÃ³ cuÃ¡l considera como su tema musical preferido.
La intÃ©rprete de â€œVideo Gamesâ€, de 38 aÃ±os, revelÃ³ durante una entrevista con Entertainment Tonight que su canciÃ³n favorita del Ã¡lbum es â€œWhoâ€™s Afraid of Little Old Me?â€. Del Rey describiÃ³ el tema como â€œhermosoâ€, destacando asÃ­ su admiraciÃ³n por el trabajo reciÃ©n lanzado de Swift, que vio la luz el 19 de abril.
"The Tortured Poets Department", lanzado el 19 de abril, incluye 31 temas, cinco de los cuales fueron escritos Ãºnicamente por Taylor Swift. (CrÃ©ditos: Republic Records via AP)
â€œWhoâ€™s Afraid of Little Old Me?â€ ocupa el dÃ©cimo lugar en The Tortured Poets Department, Ã¡lbum que comprende una ediciÃ³n de AntologÃ­a con 31 temas, de los cuales cinco fueron escritos exclusivamente por Swift, de 34 aÃ±os. Esta canciÃ³n aborda la percepciÃ³n pÃºblica de la ganadora del Grammy, satirizando y reflexionando sobre cÃ³mo es vista por el pÃºblico debido a su fama.
La participaciÃ³n de Del Rey en la Met Gala 2024 tambiÃ©n resaltÃ³ por su elecciÃ³n de vestuario, un diseÃ±o a medida realizado por SeÃ¡n McGirr para Alexander McQueen. El atuendo rindiÃ³ homenaje al tema del evento â€œSleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashionâ€, inspirÃ¡ndose en un look de archivo de la colecciÃ³n de otoÃ±o 2006 de McQueen, segÃºn reportes de Vogue.
Lana Del Rey asistiÃ³ a la Met Gala 2024 con un vestido personalizado de SeÃ¡n McGirr para Alexander McQueen, inspirado en una colecciÃ³n de otoÃ±o 2006. (CrÃ©ditos: Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)
Cabe recordar que la colaboraciÃ³n entre Del Rey y Swift no se limita a la admiraciÃ³n mutua expresada durante la Met Gala, ya que anteriormente trabajaron juntas en la canciÃ³n â€œSnow on the Beachâ€, perteneciente al Ã¡lbum â€œMidnightsâ€, lanzado en 2022, otro de los grandes proyectos musicales de Taylor.
Este hecho marcÃ³ un punto de uniÃ³n profesional entre ambas, que se consolidÃ³ aÃºn mÃ¡s con su apariciÃ³n conjunta en los Premios Grammy 2024 en febrero, donde Taylor elogiÃ³ a Lana durante su discurso de aceptaciÃ³n por el premio al Ã¡lbum del aÃ±o, reconociendo la influencia y el legado de Del Rey en la industria musical.
Lana Del Rey y Taylor Swift colaboraron previamente en el tema "Snow on the Beach" del Ã¡lbum Midnights, lanzado en 2022. (CrÃ©ditos: REUTERS/Mike Blake)
Adicionalmente, en una entrevista reciente con Zane Lowe en Apple Music 1, Jack Antonoff, mÃºsico y productor conocido por su trabajo con ambas artistas, compartiÃ³ su perspectiva sobre la â€œmagiaâ€ de colaborar con Swift y Del Rey.
Antonoff, lÃ­der de la banda Bleachers, destacÃ³ la innovaciÃ³n y la creatividad que sigue surgiendo de estas colaboraciones, reflexionando sobre la singularidad y la gratitud de mantener una chispa creativa a lo largo del tiempo en la industria.
Durante los Premios Grammy 2024, Taylor Swift destacÃ³ el impacto y legado de Lana Del Rey en la industria musical al aceptar el premio al Ã¡lbum del aÃ±o. (CrÃ©ditos: Joe Camporeale-USA TODAY Sports)
â€œCada vez que hacemos algo nuevo, bromeo: â€˜Supongo que todavÃ­a lo tenemosâ€™, porque no hay razÃ³n para que siga saliendo como saleâ€, dijo el lÃ­der de Bleachers, de 40 aÃ±os. â€œHay mucha magia ahÃ­. Lo siento asÃ­ con Taylor, lo siento asÃ­ con Lana, lo siento asÃ­ con mi bandaâ€, comentÃ³.
Jack tambiÃ©n destacÃ³ la buena disposiciÃ³n de sus colaboradoras. â€œA menudo pienso, bueno, Â¿cuÃ¡nto tiempo mÃ¡s podrÃ­amos seguir teniendo esta chispa? Y estoy agradecido de que estÃ© ahÃ­, y no sÃ© de dÃ³nde viene ni adÃ³nde va, pero lo Ãºnico que he notado es que cualquiera que afirme saber de dÃ³nde viene y adÃ³nde va se quema bastante rÃ¡pidoâ€, dijo.
Antonoff destaca la continuaciÃ³n de una "chispa creativa" en colaboraciones con Swift y Del Rey, a pesar de las dudas sobre la durabilidad de esta sinergia. (CrÃ©ditos: REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni)
Sin embargo, no todo ha sido positivo en lo que a la relaciÃ³n de Taylor Swift y Lana se refiere. Durante la gala, la cantante fue fotografiada en compaÃ±Ã­a de Kim Kardashian, un gesto que seguidores de Taylor Swift consideraron una completa traiciÃ³n.
Cabe recordar que Taylor y Kim comenzaron una larga disputa despuÃ©s de que la socialitÃ© editara un video para que pareciera que Swift habÃ­a dado su consentimiento para que Kanye West, entonces esposo de Kim, la insultara en una canciÃ³n.
Muchos seguidores de Taylor Swift vieron como una traiciÃ³n el encuentro de Lana del Rey con Kim Kardashian (CrÃ©ditos: Vogue)
Taylor revelÃ³ en una entrevista celebrada en diciembre que ese incidente le causÃ³ varios problemas de salud mental, y hasta ahora, espera una disculpa por parte de Kanye y Kim que no parece que llegarÃ¡ muy pronto.
Fuentes cercanas a la mÃ¡s famosa de las Kardashian aseguraron que Kim no le ha dado mucha importancia al asunto y espera que Taylor â€œsupereâ€ la jugarreta.

title: Shop the best Met Gala 2024 beauty, makeup and hair looks
content:
Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)
Page Six may be compensated and/or receive an affiliate commission if you buy through our links.
The Met Gala 2024 red carpet was in full bloom, with stars pulling out all the stops to nail the â€œGarden of Timeâ€ dress code.
But while Vogueâ€™s annual fÃªte is known as fashionâ€™s biggest night, starsâ€™ beauty looks were just as show-stopping as their couture.
The best part? You wonâ€™t need industry connections or access to designersâ€™ archives re-create some of the nightâ€™s best makeup and hair moments at home.
Below, explore (and shop) some of the buzziest beauty looks from Hollywoodâ€™s night at the museum.
Sydney Sweeney
Sydney Sweeney wearing Miu Miu at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images
Sydney Sweeney debuted a bold new â€˜do on Met Monday, covering her signature blond waves with a jet-black wig styled using KÃ©rastase products like the bestselling Elixir Ultime Lâ€™Huile Originale ($28).
The â€œEuphoriaâ€ actress and Laneige ambassador also reached for products from the famous K-beauty brand to get gala-ready â€” including its viral Lip Sleeping Mask, which has a long list of A-list (and editor) devotees.
â€œIt strengthens the lipsâ€™ moisture barrier and provides [eight] hours of hydration, making it a crucial step ahead of important events like tonight,â€ Sweeneyâ€™s makeup artist Melissa Hernandez said in a press release.
Sephora
Tyla
Tyla wearing Balmain at the 2024 Met Gala. AFP via Getty Images
Tyla brought the beach to the big city with her â€œsands of timeâ€-inspired Balmain gown, which was coated in three types of real sand.
And while her dress required five people to carry it up the steps (plus a last-minute tailoring session inside the Met), her makeup look from beauty icon Pat McGrath is far easier to re-create.
Pat McGrath Labs
Cardi B
Cardi B wearing Windowsen at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images for The Met Museum/Vogue
Forget red bottoms; Cardi B opted to go green at the 2024 Met Gala, matching her emerald-hued nails and eyeliner to show-stopping bling.
Her jewelry wasnâ€™t the only thing shimmering, as makeup artist Erika Laâ€™ Pearl completed the starâ€™s look with a swipe of Vaseline body oil for a glowing finish.
Vaseline
Lana Del Rey
Lana Del Rey wearing Alexander McQueen at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images
Lana Del Rey returned to one of her longtime beauty go-tos for this yearâ€™s Met Gala: Charlotte Tilbury. Having previously worked with the brand to get glowing for Februaryâ€™s Grammys, the â€œSummertime Sadnessâ€ singer prepped for the museum benefit with products like Charlotteâ€™s Magic Serum ($85), Pillow Talk Beauty Light Wand ($42) and Pillow Talk Push Up Lashes Mascara ($29).
Charlotte Tilbury
Kendall Jenner
Kendall Jenner wearing Givenchy at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images
While Kendall Jennerâ€™s 1999 Versace dress had never been worn by a person before (only a mannequin), her beauty standbys have appeared on a long list of fellow famous folks. The reality star and global ambassador for Lâ€™OrÃ©al Paris added some shine with the brandâ€™s True Match Lumi Glotion ( $17 $14) â€” which Martha Stewart, Alix Earle and Kyle Richards similarly swear by.
L'OrÃ©al Paris
Zendaya
Zendaya wearing Maison Margiela Artisanal at the 2024 Met Gala. AFP via Getty Images
For her first Met Gala appearance in five years, Zendaya made up for lost time with not one, but two red carpet looks, both designed by John Galliano. Hairstylist Ursula Stephens helped get her ready for the big night by applying Living Proof products like this leave-in hair mask, then blow-drying with the Dyson Supersonic ($429).
Living Proof
Naomi Campbell
Naomi Campbell wearing Burberry at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images
Celebrity aesthetician Lord Gavin McLeod-Valentineâ€™s worked with some of the most famous faces in the biz, and Mondayâ€™s red carpet was no exception. He treated stars including Campbell to his signature â€œThe Methodâ€ facial, which uses Augustinus Bader skincare like the luxe Rich Cream.
Augustinus Bader
Ashley Graham
Ashley Graham wearing Ludovic de Saint Sernin at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images
Ashley Graham prepped for her role as a Vogue livestream host with sunless tanner from St. Tropez, including this under-$50 buy she used in the days prior to the gala.
St. Tropez
Elle Fanning
Elle Fanning wearing Balmain at the 2024 Met Gala. AFP via Getty Images
Elle Fanningâ€™s Met Gala look went to the (crystal) birds. The actress looked like she stepped right out of a fairytale in a crystalline Balmain gown accented with rosy cheeks dusted in this blush you can pick up from your local drugstore.
L'OrÃ©al Paris
Sabrina Carpenter
Sabrina Carpenter wearing Oscar de la Renta at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images
Sabrina Carpenter wore her platinum tresses in Dyson Airwrap-perfected waves for her Met Gala debut â€” a look she kept going at the afterparties. (Hopefully she had some espresso to get her through the late night.)
Dyson
Keke Palmer
Keke Palmer wearing Marc Jacobs at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images
Jealous (or should we say, jelly) of Keke Palmerâ€™s Met Gala beauty look? The star sported a full face of budget-friendly Milk Makeup products, including the brandâ€™s viral Cooling Water Jelly Tint.
Milk Makeup
Linda Evangelista
Linda Evangelista wearing Khaite at the 2024 Met Gala. Getty Images
Linda Evangelista made her first Met Gala appearance in nearly a decade with soft glam from Pat McGrath Labs â€” including this long-lasting nude lipstick.
Ulta Beauty
Venus Williams
Venus Williams wearing Marc Jacobs at the 2024 Met Gala. WireImage
Game, set, match with Venus Williams. The tennis pro sported an all-over glow at this yearâ€™s gala, thanks to this $12 Beauty Pie buy.
Beauty Pie
Jennifer Lopez
Jennifer Lopez wearing Schiaparelli Haute Couture at the 2024 Met Gala. FilmMagic
To execute J.Loâ€™s perfectly tousled bun, her style team kept this tangle-fighting, under-$20 hairbrush on hand.
â€œThe focus was on refreshing Jenniferâ€™s look, so we kept the color process simple and just worked to amp it up a bit to heighten her natural beauty,â€ celebrity hairstylist Tracey Cunningham â€” who also used Olaplex professional products on Lopez â€” said in a press release.
Tangle Teezer

title: Lana Del Rey and Kim Kardashian Pose Together at 2024 Met Gala: Photos
content:
Lana Del Rey and Kim Kardashian looked like they were having a great time together as they walked the red carpet for the 2024 Met Gala on Monday, May 6. The moments where they were talking on the red carpet came just weeks after Lanaâ€™s friend and collaborator Taylor Swift released the scathing diss track â€œthanK you aIMeeâ€ on her new album The Tortured Poets Department.
Both Lana and Kim were seen chatting with each other on the red carpet, and they posed together for a photo, showing off their fantastic outfits. Kim sported a silver corset gown, with a leafy design down the skirt, while Lana had some vines crawling up her champagne-colored dress, with a matching veil held up by the vines. Both ladies looked completely stunning.
As they walked the carpet, they were each asked what they loved most about one another by Harperâ€™s Bazaar. Kim said â€œeverything,â€ and Lana pointed at her and said her â€œwaistline,â€ making a reference to her outfit and the corset, which accentuated her tiny waist.
While Lana, who was featured on Taylorâ€™s Midnights cut â€œSnow on the Beach,â€ did not address her palâ€™s feud with Kim, she was asked which song was her favorite from The Tortured Poets Department. â€œItâ€™s beautiful,â€ she told Entertainment Tonight. â€œItâ€™s the one, â€˜Whose Afraid of Little Old Me,â€™ whatever that title was.â€ Besides guesting on the Midnights track, Taylor also brought Lana on stage when she won the 2024 Grammy for Album of the Year. The â€œShake It Offâ€ singer had also complimented her pal while accepting the award.
The Met Gala did come just weeks after Taylor released the song â€œthanK you aIMeeâ€ from The Tortured Poets Department: The Anthology. Given the capitalization of the title and the lyrics of the song, many fans have speculated that the song was about Kim. â€œAll that time you were throwinâ€™ punches, I was buildinâ€™ somethinâ€™ / And I couldnâ€™t wait to show you it was real / Screamed â€˜F**k you, Aimee/ to the night sky, as the blood was gushinâ€™,â€ Taylor sings in the chorus.

title: Met Gala 2024: confira os looks que foram destaque no Oscar da moda
content:
O Met Gala 2024 reuniu diversas celebridades no Metropolitan Museum of Art, em Nova York, nos Estados Unidos, nessa segunda-feira (6/5). No tapete vermelho â€” que foi verde este ano â€”, quase nenhum look deixou a desejar. O dress code da noite foi The Garden Of Time (Jardim do Tempo, em traduÃ§Ã£o para o portuguÃªs), inspirado no conto de J.G. Ballard. O tema da exposiÃ§Ã£o do Costume Institute, por sua vez, Ã© Belas Adormecidas: O Despertar da Moda.

Looks dos co-anfitriÃµes do Met Gala 2024
Os tapete vermelho do Metropolitan Museum of Art ganhou ainda mais brilho com a chegada dos co-anfitriÃµes do Met Gala 2024. Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Jennifer Lopez e Chris Hemsworth fizeram jus ao papel de lideranÃ§a durante o evento icÃ´nico, e impressionaram o pÃºblico com os looks escolhidos.
Zendaya â€” uma das personalidades mais esperadas da noite â€” e Bad Bunny, optaram por produÃ§Ãµes assinadas pela Maison Margiela. JÃ¡ Jennifer Lopez brilhou na escadaria da festividade com um deslumbrante vestido da Schiaparelli. Para completar o time, Chris Hemsworth estreou no tapete vermelho do Met Gala com um look off-white assinado por Tom Ford.
E quando todos achavam que a exposiÃ§Ã£o de roupas excÃªntricas no tapete vermelho jÃ¡ havia acabado, Zendaya provou que poderia entregar beleza, tema e conceito nÃ£o sÃ³ uma, mas duas vezes. A atriz reapareceu no local com um visual totalmente diferente do primeiro. O vestido Ã© vintage, de 1996, da coleÃ§Ã£o de alta-costura da Givenchy. O chapÃ©u de buquÃª, que complementou a produÃ§Ã£o, Ã© de 2007, da grife Alexander McQueen.
Looks dos convidados
Com a temÃ¡tica da exposiÃ§Ã£o no museu e o dress code do Met Gala deste ano, internautas logo comeÃ§aram a compartilhar um meme da Miranda Prisley, de O Diabo Veste Prada, para definir as expectativas dos looks nesta ediÃ§Ã£o. A imagem conta com uma frase icÃ´nica da personagem, que questiona: â€œLooks florais? Para a primavera? Inovador.â€
Apesar de inÃºmeras personalidades terem marcado presenÃ§a com, de fato, visuais florais, teve quem ousou e conseguiu protagonizar momentos fashion para alÃ©m das plantas coloridas. A cantora sul-africana Tyla, por exemplo, subiu â€” ou ao menos tentou â€” a escadaria do Met com um vestido feito de areia moldado no prÃ³prio corpo. A peÃ§a foi um dos destaques da noite.
AlÃ©m dela, Elle Fanning Taylor Russell tambÃ©m foram ao baile com roupas que incorporam os elementos da natureza. Com alusÃµes ao conto que inspira o cÃ³digo de vestimenta do Met Gala , Elle apareceu na festividade com um vestido transparente. O modelo adornava o corpo da atriz quase como uma peÃ§a de cristal sob medida. JÃ¡ a atriz canadense, conhecida pelo filme Bones & All, desfilou um corpete personalizado da Loewe , pintado em madeira.
Bruna Marquezine e Gigi Hadid brilharam no tapete vermelho com produÃ§Ãµes florais, mas as peÃ§as, de alguma forma, mantiveram uma essÃªncia sofisticada e nÃ£o tÃ£o previsÃ­vel quanto outros looks da noite. Sarah Jessica Parker marcou presenÃ§a Ã  la Carrie Bradshaw , com look assinado por Richard Queen. E apÃ³s seis anos sem comparecer ao evento, Ariana Grande chegou Ã  festividade com um visual sob medida da grife espanhola Loewe.
Outro look que chamou atenÃ§Ã£o do pÃºblico foi um vestido assinado pela estilista holandesa Iris Van Herpen, usado pela empresÃ¡ria de moda indiana Mona Patel. O modelo Ã© adornado com borboletas, e os acessÃ³rios nos braÃ§os da convidada simulam o bater de asas do inseto.
Emma Chamberlain e Lana Del Rey compareceram ao Met Gala com peÃ§as inspiradas em roupas vintage de diferentes grifes. A youtuber usou um vestido marrom rendado, que remete a um modelo da marca Jean Paul Gaultier de 2003. JÃ¡ a cantora norte-americana apareceu no evento com o prÃ³prio jardim. O visual de tule contou com detalhes que imitavam galhos, e fazia referÃªncia a um look de 2008 da marca Alexander McQueen.
O vestido de Kendall Jenner foi um assunto Ã  parte. A peÃ§a em si, da casa francesa de moda Givenchy, nunca havia sido usada por uma pessoa. Isso porque a vestimenta, de 1999, foi apresentada em uma coleÃ§Ã£o â€œdesfiladaâ€ por manequins. Depois, as roupas seguiram direto para o arquivo da etiqueta.
Anok Yai e Kim Kardashian marcaram presenÃ§a no evento como a definiÃ§Ã£o do brilho em si. A modelo sul-sudanesa-americana apostou em um macacÃ£o repletos de cristais Swarovski, que a cobria dos seios Ã s pontas do pÃ©. A socialite usou um look sob medida feito por John Galliano, com flores prateadas. O destaque ficou para a silhueta ampulheta.
Sobre o Met Gala
Organizado e presidido por Anna Wintour desde 1995, o Met Gala Ã© um dos eventos mais aguardados e prestigiados no mundo fashion. A cerimÃ´nia serve para arrecadar fundos para o Costume Institute do Metropolitan Museum of Art, e marca a inauguraÃ§Ã£o da exposiÃ§Ã£o anual de moda.
Todo ano, a exposiÃ§Ã£o tem um tema, que guia o dress code dos convidados. No ano passado, Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty foi a inspiraÃ§Ã£o para os famosos que passaram no red carpet.

title: The best dressed celebs from the mediocre pickings of the Met Gala 2024
content:
Iris Law is the it girl of the moment
2 hours ago
Yesterday was the first Monday in May which can only mean one thing: The Met Gala. Celebrities from around the globe flew into New York to put the world to rights by means of fashion but even then didnâ€™t do an amazing job. The gala is usually characterised by outlandish looks, cutting edge fashion and bespoke makeup looks but this year was tame to the say the least. Whilst the attendees looked great, that was where it ended. They were just great. Where are my feathers? Where are my gravity defying fits that keep me up at night debating the laws of physics? I needed more!
Saying this, there were definitely a few gems; a few celebs who shone through the bleariness of mediocrity. So, here is a very precise run down of the best dressed celebs from the Met Gala 2024 and the only ones knowing about:
Iris Law
Iris Law is the new it girl of the moment. Butterflies flew so she could walk the red carpet. Attending her first ever Met Gala alongside her dad Jude Law, she stunned in a dress that an ethereal butterfly so graciously gave up itâ€™s wings for.
Doja Cat
A nipple truly is the best accessory.
Zendaya
Zendaya really took an Asda kids generic witch Halloween costume and made it a serve.
Tyla
Queen of Arrakis.
Lana Del Rey
Wish I looked this good after a dog walk through the woods.
Sydney Sweeney
Despite probably not knowing who Claudia Winkleman is, Sydney Sweeney paid homage to her in this wig.
Jonathan Bailey
I love him and the fit but the pose is giving me the ick. We get it, thereâ€™s a flower in your pocket.
Dua Lipa
Itâ€™s giving BBCâ€™s Harlots and I mean that as a compliment.
Mona Patel
Did I know who Mona Patel was before the Met Gala? No. Am I now obsessed with her? Absolutely yes.
Jennifer Lopez
JLo has been around the block so many times that she knows what sheâ€™s doing. Absolutely gorgeous. Thatâ€™s all.

title: Met Gala 2024 : Aya Nakamura, Zendaya, Shakira et Lana Del Rey sur le tapis rouge transformÃ© en "Jardin du temps"
content:
Lundi soir avait lieu le Met Gala Ã  New York, la plus grande soirÃ©e de la mode. Un florilÃ¨ge de cÃ©lÃ©britÃ©s foulaient le tapis rouge pour l'ouverture de la grande exposition du Costume Institute.
