Collecter des fonds au profit du Costume Institute, siÃ¨ge d'une exposition de mode annuelle. Depuis 1995, le Met Gala a permis de lever 223,5 millions de dollars. Le gala est devenu le rendez-vous le plus prestigieux et le plus mÃ©diatisÃ© de lâ€™industrie de la mode.
CoprÃ©sidÃ© par l'actrice Zendaya, la chanteuse Jennifer Lopez, l'acteur australien Chris Hemsworth et le prince du rap latino Bad Bunny, cette Ã©dition accompagnera lâ€™exposition "Spleeping Beauties - Reawakening Fashion (Les Belles endormies - rÃ©veiller la mode)". Elle prÃ©sente des archives anciennes exceptionnelles, souvent trop fragiles pour Ãªtre exposÃ©es.
Anna Wintour, rÃ©dactrice-en-chef du magazine amÃ©ricain Vogue et prÃ©sidente du Met Gala depuis 26 ans, ne se faisait pas dâ€™illusions. Elle savait quâ€™avec le thÃ¨me du gala, "The Garden of Time" (Le Jardin du temps), les cÃ©lÃ©britÃ©s invitÃ©es plÃ©bisciteraient les fleurs. Pourtant, nombre dâ€™entre eux ont rÃ©interprÃ©tÃ© le thÃ¨me Ã  leur maniÃ¨re. Voici les 10 looks les plus mÃ©morables de cette Ã©dition 2024.
13 500 heures de travail. Câ€™est le temps consacrÃ© Ã  la robe Thom Browne portÃ©e par la mannequin Gigi Hadid. ConstituÃ©e dâ€™une robe corset blanche Ã  Ã©paules dÃ©nudÃ©es, elle est superposÃ©e dâ€™un manteau en soie moirÃ©e blanche avec des pointes en satin noir, et dÃ©corÃ©e de roses jaunes. Cette robe sera conservÃ©e dans les archives permanentes de Thom Browne aprÃ¨s le Met Gala. (TAYLOR HILL / GETTY IMAGES NORTH AMERICA)
En tant que co-animatrice officielle du Met Gala, Zendaya devait livrer un moment de mode mÃ©morable. L'actrice portait deux tenues trÃ¨s diffÃ©rentes choisies par le styliste Law Roach. L'une d'elle Ã©tait une robe bleu ocÃ©an en organza et lamÃ© de la Maison Margiela par John Galliano. Un choix appropriÃ© pour le thÃ¨me du Jardin du temps. (DIMITRIOS KAMBOURIS / GETTY IMAGES NORTH AMERICA)
Aya Nakamura, lâ€™artiste franÃ§aise la plus Ã©coutÃ©e Ã  lâ€™Ã©tranger, a fait une apparition surprise pour son premier Met Gala. Elle portait une longue robe fendue brodÃ©e de cristaux et de fleurs, clin d'Å“il au thÃ¨me de la soirÃ©e mais aussi au dÃ©filÃ© Balmain printemps-Ã©tÃ© 2024 oÃ¹ les bouquets rÃ©gnaient en maÃ®tre. (MATT CROSSICK / MAXPPP)
L'influenceur et mannequin nigÃ©rian Wisdom Kaye a Ã©galement fait ses dÃ©buts au Met Gala avec un trench-coat rouge audacieux aux accents brÃ»lÃ©s crÃ©Ã© par Robert Wun. IntitulÃ© "Rose rouge brÃ»lÃ©e", ce look est inspirÃ© par l'aspect romantique de la couleur rouge et raconte la dÃ©cadence Ã  travers le temps. Robert Wun a utilisÃ© des techniques de gravure, d'impression Ã  la main et de peinture pour reproduire les dÃ©fauts naturels et l'assombrissement des pÃ©tales de rose qui se fanent. (JAMIE MCCARTHY / GETTY IMAGES NORTH AMERICA)
Lâ€™actrice de 61 ans Demi Moore, portait une robe dâ€™exception signÃ©e Harris Reed avec des bijoux Cartier de la nouvelle collection "Nature Sauvage". La robe en velours comporte un double panneau de soie ornÃ© de pivoines roses flÃ©tries en organza de soie et peintes Ã  la main. "J'ai pensÃ© que beaucoup de gens allaient considÃ©rer le thÃ¨me de cette annÃ©e en pensant que tout devait Ãªtre trÃ¨s dÃ©licat, [â€¦] de dentelle, de transparence et d'effondrement", explique Harris Reed Ã  Vogue. "Je voulais adopter l'approche inverse." (STEPHEN LOVEKIN/BEI/SHUTTERSTOCK / SIPA)
La rappeuse Cardi B a rÃ©interprÃ©tÃ© le jardin sous forme gothique. Le noir devient audacieux avec Windowsen, l'une des marques Ã©mergentes chinoise. On retrouve les inspirations dramatiques de la crÃ©atrice avec cette robe gÃ©ante aux multiples couches de tulle, faÃ§on rose fanÃ©e. De nombreuses personnes ont dÃ» soulever cette gigantesque traÃ®ne, afin dâ€™aider la rappeuse Ã  se dÃ©placer. (GILBERT FLORES / VARIETY)
Hommage Ã  une archive de la collection automne-hiver 2006-2007 d'Alexander McQueen, la robe de la chanteuse Lana Del Rey Ã©tait une prison de branches dâ€™aubÃ©pines en bronze martelÃ©. Ces branches sâ€™inspirent des sculptures de l'artiste suisse Alberto Giacometti. Le directeur artistique de la maison, SeÃ¡n McGirr, a crÃ©Ã© une version contemporaine romantique en soie et tulle, avec une coiffe en branches d'aubÃ©pine naturelles. (SEAN ZANNI / PATRICK MCMULLAN)
100 mÃ¨tres de tissu ont Ã©tÃ© nÃ©cessaires pour fabriquer cette robe colonne rouge Ã©carlate et sa cape drapÃ©e en forme de rose, signÃ©es Carolina Herrera. La robe est Ã  lâ€™image de la chanteuse Shakira, qui foule le tapis rouge du Met Gala pour la premiÃ¨re fois. "Elle s'est concentrÃ©e sur les moindres dÃ©tails des dÃ©coupes, sur les points d'impact et sur l'encolure", explique Ã  Vogue, Wes Gordon, le directeur de la crÃ©ation, qui pointe "sa conscience du corps". (JOHN SHEARER / WIREIMAGE)
Un vase de roses. VoilÃ  la meilleure description pour la robe de la chanteuse Lizzo, crÃ©Ã©e par le jeune Victor Weinsanto. La robe-corset tout en transparence, Ã©tait teintÃ©e de la mÃªme carnation que la peau de la chanteuse. Lizzo porte une coiffe contenant des pÃ©tales de rose qui descendent en cascade sur le bas de la robe, retroussÃ©e pour les accueillir. Une interprÃ©tation poÃ©tique du jardin en fleur. (JAMIE MCCARTHY / GETTY IMAGES NORTH AMERICA)

title: 15 must-see looks from the Met Gala 2024 red carpet
content:
Often described as one of the biggest nights in fashion, the Met Gala is an annual fundraiser for The Costume Institute at the Metropolitan Museum of Art that takes place â€” rather iconically â€” on the first Monday in May in New York City.
This year's event celebrates the Costume Institute's upcoming exhibition, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion . The exhibition, which features around 250 nature-themed garments and accessories, is an exploration of the fragility and ephemerality of fashion. It's been described as a "celebration of clothing and fashion so fragile that it can't ever be worn again."
The 2024 Met Gala is being co-chaired by Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, Chris Hemsworth â€” and, of course, Vogue magazine editor Anna Wintour. The dress code is "The Garden of Time," a theme inspired by British author J.G. Ballard's 1962 short story of the same name.
Here's how celebrities like Jennifer Lopez, Ariana Grande and Lana Del Rey interpreted the evening's theme on the green (!) carpet.
Zendaya
Zendaya, one of the Gala's co-chairs, wore Maison Margiela Artisanal by John Galliano. (John Shearer/WireImage/Getty Images)
According to her stylist and close collaborator Law Roach, the Challengers star and Met Gala co-chair hadn't even seen her dress for the evening until this past weekend. As usual, she looked amazing in a blue-and-green Maison Margiela Artisanal by John Galliano. The one-shoulder, mermaid-hem gown was paired with a dramatic headpiece and tulle veil detailing.
Emma Chamberlain
Emma Chamberlain in Jean Paul Gaultier. (Dia Dipasupil/Getty Images)
The YouTuber and content creator reprised her role as Vogue's special correspondent again this year, interviewing attendees at the gala. For her own red carpet arrival, Chamberlain made a gothic impression in a custom, lacy Jean Paul Gaultier corset dress that reportedly took four seamstresses around 600 hours to assemble.
Jennifer Lopez
Co-chair Jennifer Lopez shone in Schiaparelli Haute Couture. (Dia Dipasupil/Getty Images)
A co-chair for the evening, Lopez shone in a silver, strapless Schiaparelli Haute Couture dress. Designed by Daniel Roseberry, the very sheer, fitted gown reportedly took 2.5 million beads to make. Lopez styled the custom dress with nude accessories and a statement Tiffany & Co. necklace.
Mindy Kaling
Mindy Kaling wore a sculptural beige dress by Indian designer Gaurav Gupta. (Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images)
The Indian-American actor and producer chose a sculptural beige dress by Indian designer Gaurav Gupta. While it may not seem to fit the evening's dress code, at least at first glance, the dress does look great from all angles â€” and where else can one wear such a gorgeous and truly three-dimensional gown?
Greta Lee
Greta Lee in Loewe, a Spanish fashion brand. (Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images)
Lee, who sported Loewe several times throughout this past awards season, went with the Spanish fashion brand again for the Met Gala. She paired her sheer white architectural gown with white slingback heels and a sleek wig hand-cut by hairstylist Jenny Cho that's sure to inspire many cuts this summer.
Wisdom Kaye
Wisdom Kaye was one of many attendees who wore flower details. (John Shearer/WireImage/Getty Images)
Unsurprisingly, there were many rose-inspired looks tonight, but model Wisdom Kaye's bold red outfit was particularly impactful.
Rebecca Hall
Rebecca Hall wore a Danielle Frankel gown and sheer floral gloves. (Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images)
Making her Met Gala debut, Hall wore a diaphanous, floral dress with an extra-long train by designer Danielle Frankel. Her sheer floral gloves, which are very on-trend, virtually disappear into the beautiful flowers painted on her shoulders and arms. Finally, her slicked back, wet hair provides some much-needed contrast, allowing the overall look to feel modern and not too saccharine.
Morgan Spector
Morgan Spector in a suit by designer Willy ChavarrÃ­a. (John Shearer/WireImage/Getty Images)
There were many men wearing oversized florals tonight. A highlight of this mini-trend was spotted on American actor Morgan Spector, who wore a bold red-and-black double-breasted suit by designer Willy ChavarrÃ­a. The oversized poppies are stunning, and the fit is just right.
Christian Cowan and Sam Smith
Christian Cowan, left, and Sam Smith wore tuxedos designed by Cowan. (Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images for The Met Museum/Vogue)
The stylish couple wore co-ordinating double-breasted tuxedos in cream and black that were designed by Cowan himself. The win here is in the attention to detail â€” the jacket closures are made with actual red roses that were dipped in gold and sterling silver.
Demi Moore
Demi Moore wore a floral dress by Harris Reed with a detachable spiked cape. (Dia Dipasupil/Getty Images)
Moore's pink-and-black strapless dress was made in part with wallpaper, according to designer Harris Reed. Sculpted hips elevate the look, and we're glad to see that the spiky, cape-like part comes off with ease. After all, there's a whole gala dinner for Moore to sit through following the red carpet!
Ariana Grande
Ariana Grande's makeup included 'custom petal wing appliquÃ©s' to go with her gown by Loewe's Jonathan Anderson. (Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images)
Grande wore a strapless dress with a shimmery, mother-of-pearl bodice by Loewe's Jonathan Anderson and noted that pearl is her birthstone. Her Wicked-inspired beauty look is great, too â€” it includes what makeup artist Michael Anthony describes as "custom petal wing appliquÃ©s," and a minimalist long ponytail.
Lana Del Rey
Lana Del Rey in a mother nature inspired gown by designer SeÃ¡n McGirr at Alexander McQueen. (Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images for The Met Museum/Vogue)
Talk about a grand entrance. Del Rey posed on the arrivals carpet wearing literal branches draped with tulle. The theatrical ensemble by designer SeÃ¡n McGirr at Alexander McQueen was inspired by mother nature and pays direct tribute to an archival McQueen look from 2006.
FKA Twigs
FKA Twigs in Stella McCartney. (John Shearer/WireImage/Getty Images)
The British singer-songwriter wore Stella McCartney lab-grown diamonds and a fashion look inspired by the loop knits and sequined separates in the designer's Fall/Winter 2024 runway collection. It's not really on-theme, but it certainly stands out, thanks to plenty of shine â€” Twigs rocked sparkles all over her head, face and legs.
Naomi Watts
Naomi Watts stuns in black and white. (Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images for The Met Museum/Vogue)
In a sea of colourful lace and florals, Watts stood out in a high-contrast look featuring a beaded black gown, puffy cape and white gloves.
Cardi B
Rapper Cardi B in a black turban and tulle gown. (John Shearer/WireImage/Getty Images)
One of the final arrivals of the evening, Cardi B did not disappoint. The American rapper wore a black tulle dress that took a small crowd to move along the carpet.

title: Grape-accented Zendaya leads garden-themed looks at Met Gala
content:
Zendaya wore a dark blue gown adorned with grape clusters and Lana Del Rey donned a dramatic headpiece with tree branches, two of the head-turning looks at this year's garden-themed Met Gala on Monday. Stars were told to dress in "Garden of Time" attire for the invite-only event, known for its A-list celebrities and extravagant outfits. Attendees walked a white and green carpet surrounded by lush foliage and white flowers up the steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
Film and TV star Zendaya, a host of this year's event, sported heavy eyeliner and a blue lamÃ© and organza bias-cut dress worn over a duchess satin corset. Designed by John Galliano, the gown featured clusters of grapes on a hip and arm, a large ruffle on one side and a blue hummingbird on a shoulder. Zendaya later changed into a black Givenchy gown and large floral Alexander McQueen hat.
Del Rey, the Grammy-nominated singer, stood out in a beige, corseted Alexander McQueen gown and a headpiece with natural hawthorn branches. The branches were draped with sheer tulle that fell below her face. A high-profile annual event, the Met Gala is a benefit for the New York museum and marks the opening of its Costume Institute's annual fashion exhibit.
This year's exhibit, called "Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion," will feature rare items that have been dormant in the Costume Institute's permanent collection, including designs so fragile that they will be displayed only through animation and projections. Jennifer Lopez, another Met Gala host, wore a beaded, see-through Schiaparelli gown and a butterfly-shaped necklace.
Singer Rita Ora arrived in strings of long, colorful beads that swung as she walked and revealed a skintight, nude-colored bodysuit underneath. She was accompanied by her husband, film director Taika Waititi. Many attendees chose a floral look. Queen Latifah sported a black dress and jacket with large, orange bird of paradise accents. Demi Moore wore a black structured gown made out of vintage wallpaper that featured pink and white flowers.
Ariana Grande sparkled in an ivory gown with a mother-of-pearl bodice and posed with Cynthia Erivo, her co-star in an upcoming film adaptation of Broadway musical "Wicked." Erivo wore a two-piece black outfit covered in pink petals. Among the men, musician Lil Nas X donned an ivory suit and jacket with 56,000 hand-placed Swarovski crystals arranged in large, gleaming swaths. Members of K-Pop boy band Stray Cats also walked the carpet, in matching suits.
Chinese-owned TikTok, which faces a U.S. ban unless its owners sell the social media app to allay security concerns, was among the sponsors of the event. TikTok's CEO Shou Chew was named an honorary co-chair of the gala and was expected to mingle with guests. Outside the event, pro-Palestinian protesters on Madison Avenue tried to draw attention to the Gaza war. Police made some arrests to contain the protests, the New York Times reported.
(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

title: Lana Del Rey Is the Ultimate Forest Nymph at the 2024 Met Gala
content:
Fresh off her Coachella headlining gig, Lana Del Rey dropped jaws at the 2024 Met Gala on Monday night (May 6), marking her first appearance since 2018 and taking the â€œGarden of Timeâ€ dress code to the next level.
Explore Explore Lana Del Ray See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news
The â€œYoung and Beautifulâ€ star walked the red carpet in a custom beige gown designed by Alexander McQueenâ€™s SeÃ¡n McGirr, and the one-shoulder dress was lined with what appears to be branches down the entire bodice. The branches stretched into a headpiece with a beige mesh veil draped across her face. She accessorized the outfit by holding a single red rose.
The eventâ€™s dress code is â€œThe Garden of Time,â€ inspired by a 1962 J.G. Ballard short story of the same name.
Trending on Billboard
This yearâ€™s theme, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, is set to feature 250 items from the Costume Instituteâ€™s permanent collection, according to an Instagram post announcing the theme back in November. â€œFrom a 17th century English Elizabethan-era bodice and Christian Diorâ€™s famous Junon and Venus ballgowns, to 21st century acquisitions by designers including Phillip Lim, Stella McCartney, and Conner Ives, the core exhibit will span 400 years of history,â€ the caption reads. See the full post here.
LDR hung around the Indio Valley after Coachella to make two unannounced appearances at the Stagecoach Festival, last weekend. While there, she joined Paul Cauthen on stage for a moving rendition of â€œUnchained Melody,â€ the classic ballad that became an iconic hit for the Righteous Brothers in 1965.
Del Rey, who is prepping a country album called Lasso, sang â€œUnchained Melodyâ€ last year for NBC holiday special celebrating the legacy of Elvis Presley, Christmas at Graceland and Cauthen previously covered the song with masked country crooner Orville Peck, with the pair calling themselves The Unrighteous Brothers.

title: Met Gala: Zendaya, Lana Del Rey and SJP shine in Irish designs
content:
With an evocative theme, The Garden of Time, the Met Gala 2024 has provided the A-list guest list ample opportunity to go all out, and Irish design certainly reigned supreme on the iconic steps of the museum.
Coordinated with the Costume Institute's exhibition Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, the gala theme is inspired by the 250 items that have been pulled from the Institute's permanent collection for this year's exhibit, including some that have been rarely seen in public before.
The gala has become one of the most anticipated events on the fashion calendar, and was established in 1948 as a means to fundraise for the Institute.
As well as the many Irish stars that attended the gala, a number of Irish designs were put front and centre on the night, with some celebrity guests spotlighting our homegrown talent.
SeÃ¡n McGirr with Lana Del Rey. Getty Images
Lana Del Rey climbed the Met Gala steps wearing a breathtaking design by Alexander McQueen, headed up by Dublin-born designer SeÃ¡n McGirr.
Speaking to Vogue, McGirr said that he wanted to evoke Mother Nature herself with a "sinister" edge, which came through in the gothic design.
The pale brown dress featured a corset bodice and was overlayed with branch-inspired detailing, with one single red rose on Lana's hand. The vision was completed by an ethereal headpiece, topped off with a matching veil.
Usher wearing a McGirr design. Getty Images
Usher arrived to the gala wearing custom-made Alexander McQueen cape by McGirr. â£â£The piece featured black dipped rose appliquÃ© detail, a tuxedo jacket and trousers in black with all-over jet stone embroidery and red dipped rose appliquÃ© detail and a black fedora.â£
Sarah Jessica Parker wearing Richard Quinn, with a Philip Treacy hat. Getty Images
Sarah Jessica Parker is a seasoned Met Gala veteran at this point, and returned to a favourite Irish designer of hers for her ensemble tonight. She chose a Philip Treacy headpiece to pair with her beige gown, created by London-Irish designer Richard Quinn.
The highly structural gown featured what Parker called a "trellis" of glittering embellishments, while the hat was crafted from a shimmering material in a wavy design.
Zendaya wearing Givenchy and a Philip Treacy hat. Getty Images
Zendaya also wore a Philip Treacy design, emerging from a quick costume change at the end of the red carpet to reveal a second look, following her jaw-dropping Maison Margiela look.
She wore a black archival Givenchy gown, paired with a Philip Treacy hat from his S/S 2007 collection that resembled a bouquet of flowers.
Eve Hewson wearing Simone Rocha. Getty Images
Bad Sisters star Eve Hewson looked bewitching in a pale pink chiffon gown by Irish designer Simone Rocha, which featured a corsetted bodice, puff sleeves, long gloves and a small train, all hand embellished with crystal daisy detailing.
She amped up the feminine look by wearing two white bows in her hair, and contrasted the delicate look with a statement red lip.
Jonathan Groff wearing Simone Rocha. Getty Images
Hamilton star Jonathan Groff dazzled in a Autumn/Winter 2023 venetian wool blazer with flowers made from blood-red crystal embellishment.
We need your consent to load this Instagram contentWe use Instagram to manage extra content that can set cookies on your device and collect data about your activity. Please review their details and accept them to load the content.Manage Preferences
With Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson stepping in as honorary chair for the gala this year, it's no surprise that many guests stepped out in Loewe designs.
Anna Wintour wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Among them was Vogue editor-in-chief and Global Chief Content Officer of CondÃ© Nast Anna Wintour, who wore a striking black long coat with a red and yellow floral motif inspired by a cape designed by Charles Frederick Worth, largely considered to be the first couturier.
Inspired by a circa-1944 evening cape by 20th century designer Charles James, and tailoring from the LOEWE Fall/Winter 2024 women's collection, Wintour's tuxedo in wool with a silk satin shawl collar is decorated with floral motifs using hand-dyed feathers, tonal beading, and pearl embroidery.
Greta Lee wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Greta Lee wore a sheer white gown by the fashion house, which featured a sculptural circular neckline and floral appliques.
Ayo Edebiri wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Ayo Edebiri wore another design, featuring a halter neck silhouette and 3D handstitched flowers that gradually progressed from white to full colour.
Dan Levy
Schitt's Creek star Dan Levy was also spotted in a floral design from the Derry designer.
Ariana Grande wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Ariana Grande looked ethereal in a Loewe design, too, with her gown featuring a bodice over-layed with real mother of pearl before flowing into a delicate skirt.
Irish man Jamie Dornan, who recently appeared in a Loewe campaign, wore a playful suit from Anderson for the stylish occasion.
Jamie Dornan wearing Loewe. Getty Images
With Anderson in charge of the costume design for Challengers. Luca Guadagnino's latest film starring Zendaya, Josh O'Connor and Mike Faist, it seems a natural choice that the two leading men and the director would step out for the Met Gala wearing Loewe.
Josh O'Connor wearing Loewe. Getty Images
O'Connor wore a striking black suit that trailed behind him, and paired it with multicoloured pastel shoes, while Faist wore a black suit jacket accented with a radish-inspired brooch, cream trousers and chunky black shoes.
Mike Faist wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Saltburn star Alison Oliver, who recently appeared in a Loewe campaign, wore a plunging dress designed by Anderson.
Stylist AimÃ©e Croysdill took to Instagram to share details of the look, stating that the lining of the look is "made from 16th century garments, none of which have been cut or harmed in the process".
Alison Oliver wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Canadian actress Taylor Russell McKenzie, American singer Omar Apollo, Bridgerton star Jonathan Bailey, and One Day actress Ambika Mod were all spotted in the Derry man's designs.
Taylor Russell wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Omar Apollo wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Jonathan Bailey wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Ambika Mod wearing Loewe. Getty Images
Of course, Anderson himself wore one of his designs, stepping out in a classic black tuxedo paired with a white shirt, black bowtie and a pair of sparkling green shoes.
Jonathan Anderson wearing Loewe. Getty Images
He finished his look with a shimmering shamrock pin, positioned on his shoulder.

title: Nine looks you might have missed from the Met Gala
content:
The Met Gala is the biggest night of the year in fashion and last nightâ€™s event was no different.
Stars descended on the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York to celebrate the opening of the Costume Instituteâ€™s spring exhibition, which is called Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, putting the spotlight on 250 extremely fragile and rare pieces.
Advertisement
The nightâ€™s official dress code was Garden of Time â€“ which celebrities interpreted in a variety of waysâ€¦
1. Gigi Hadid
Gigi Hadid (Matt Crossick/PA)
Advertisement
Model Gigi Hadid was one of the many celebrities wearing New York-based designer Thom Browne to this yearâ€™s Met Gala.
Her structural, corseted white gown featured black trim and 3D yellow rose detailing. According to Vogue, the skirt took 40 people over 8,500 hours to embroider, while 20 artisans spent 5,000 hours embroidering 2.8 million micro beads onto the dress.
Advertisement
â€œItâ€™s always a privilege to watch Gigi come to life,â€ Browne told Vogue. â€œShe is a true talent that shines at whatever she does. I wanted her look to embody the fragility and immense work that you see in Andrew [Bolton]â€™s exhibit, blooming on the carpet and into The Metropolitan Museum of Art.â€
2. Sarah Jessica Parker
Advertisement
Sarah Jessica Parker (Matt Crossick/PA)
And Just Like Thatâ€¦ star Sarah Jessica Parker chose British designer Richard Quinn for her ethereal Met Gala look.
A mainstay on the Met steps, Parkerâ€™s embellished midi-dress had a sheer, birdcage-style silhouette, with lace floral detailing throughout.
Advertisement
Parker told Vogue she was inspired by Quinnâ€™s spring/summer 2024 collection, as well as Sargent and Fashion at the Tate Britain in London â€“ an exhibition dedicated to American artist John Singer Sargentâ€™s fashion paintings.
3. Lana Del Rey
Lana Del Rey (Matt Crossick/PA)
Advertisement
Singer Lana Del Rey was one of the few stars wearing Alexander McQueen for the event, and was accompanied by the labelâ€™s new creative director, Irish designer SeÃ¡n McGirr.
Her nude corseted dress was embellished with hand-embroidered sequinned branches. Del Rey wore a headpiece made up of real hawthorn branches, with swathes of see-through tulle covering her, and a red rose on her hand.
Advertisement
The outfit referenced a look from the autumn/winter 2006 Alexander McQueen collection, which had similar tulle around the modelâ€™s head, but was held up by â€˜antlersâ€™.
4. Josh Oâ€™Connor
Josh Oâ€™Connor (Evan Agostini/AP)
Fresh off the Challengers press tour, Josh Oâ€™Connor wore a whimsical Loewe suit with a dramatic tailcoat and sparkling micro bow tie.
But the best part of his outfit were the shoes â€“ textural floral boots that look very similar to a pair a model wore on the recent Loewe autumn/winter runway.
5. Kim Kardashian
Kim Kardashian (Matt Crossick/PA)
Kim Kardashian is no stranger to making a splash at the Met â€“ most notably at the 2022 event when she controversially donned an archival dress previously worn by Marilyn Monroe.
This year, the reality star wore a Maison Margiela by John Galliano gown with a silver corset cinching her waist, a floral see-through skirt and grey cardigan over the top. She left her icy blonde hair loose and her make-up relatively pared back.
6. Cardi B
Cardi B (Matt Crossick/PA)
Cardi Bâ€™s outfit was certainly dramatic â€“ her Gothic gown surrounded her with layers of black tulle and a vertiginous turban â€“ but itâ€™s hard to tell how it was inspired by the theme of the night.
She chose up-and-coming designer Windowsen for her couture look, and her stylist Kollin Carter described her look as â€œthe black rebellious roseâ€.
Advertisement
7. Dan Levy
Dan Levy (Evan Agostini/AP)
Canadian actor Dan Levy wore one of the more experimental menswear looks of the night: a perfectly tailored Loewe suit with an austere black top half and a vibrant floral bottom.
Itâ€™s no surprise he chose Loewe â€“ Levy currently stars in the brandâ€™s advertising campaign, and wore the brand for his first Met Gala back in 2021.
8. Zendaya
Zendaya (Matt Crossick/PA)
Zendaya was one of the nightâ€™s co-chairs, so anticipation was high around what she would wear. She certainly brought drama to the event, wearing not one, but two outfits on the Met steps.
The first was a dramatic blue and green tulle gown with a sculptural headpiece by Maison Margiela, with embellishments nodding to the natural world. With a dark lip, thin eyebrows and a dramatic eye make-up, her beauty look nodded to Margielaâ€™s electric couture show, which debuted to huge acclaim in January.
Zendaya (Matt Crossick/PA)
Her surprise second outfit was a nod to the other element of the exhibition. Zendaya wore a voluminous black dress from Givenchyâ€™s spring/summer 1996 couture collection, paired with a floral bouquet as a headpiece.
9. Michael Shannon
Michael Shannon (Evan Agostini/AP)
While it might not have much to do with the theme, actor Michael Shannon had one of the most eye-catching accessories of the night.
Advertisement
He wore a simple black double-breasted suit, clutching what looked to be a yellow bag of potato chips â€“ but on closer inspection, it was actually a cheeky leather handbag from Balenciaga.
According to the brandâ€™s website, the bag is made of glossy calfskin and has a zip closure. The bag comes in three colours and while itâ€™s currently sold out, it retails at Â£1,400.

title: Lana Del Rey leads Garden Of Time fashion at Met Gala 2024
content:
Lana Del Rey has embodied the official dress code at the Met Gala 2024 in a mother-nature inspired woodland look.
The biggest names in film, music, TV and fashion have ascended the off-white and airbrushed green steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York with their interpretation of the theme Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.
Advertisement
The Met Gala, known as fashionâ€™s biggest night, is held on the first Monday in May and celebrates the opening of the Costume Instituteâ€™s spring exhibition at the New York museum.
Sean McGirr, left, and Lana Del Rey attend The Metropolitan Museum of Artâ€™s Costume Institute benefit gala (Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)
US singer Del Rey, who headlined the Coachella music festival in April, personified the official Garden Of Time dress code this year wearing custom Alexander McQueen by designer Sean McGirr.
Advertisement
The ensemble is based on the original late Lee McQueen from his fall 2006 collection titled â€œThe Widows of Cullodenâ€ and featured Del Rey wearing wooden antlers covered in beige netting.
Advertisement
Del Rey told the Vogue Met Gala Livestream that the ensemble was â€œvery architecturalâ€, and the shape was â€œthe most important thingâ€ for her.
â€œIt was the idea of mother nature with a slightly more sinister aspect,â€ McGirr said.
Del Rey attempted not to injure her fellow stars with the headpiece while posing on the carpet, including Kim Kardashian who wore a silver custom Maison Margiela ensemble.
Advertisement
Kim Kardashian attends The Metropolitan Museum of Artâ€™s Costume Institute benefit gala (Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)
Reality star Kardashian described the metal armour-esque bustier top with a floral imprinted bodice design as â€œbeautifulâ€, which was paired with a floral chainmail dress, a gray bolero cardigan and tousled hair.
Meanwhile her sister, US model Kendall Jenner said she was â€œso incredibly honouredâ€ to be wearing an archive Givenchy from 1999 at the annual fundraiser, after she â€œdid her researchâ€ on the Sleeping Beauties theme.
Advertisement
â€œIâ€™m the first human to wear it, it was showed on a mannequin â€¦ it was a miracle that it fit, it was a miracle that we found it and it just feels meant to be,â€ she said on the carpet.
Kendall Jenner attends The Metropolitan Museum of Artâ€™s Costume Institute benefit gala (Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)
Kylie Jenner also appeared on the carpet wearing a strapless bullet bra-style column gown from Oscar de la Renta, the same designer her mother Kris Jenner opted for on the carpet.
Advertisement
Advertisement
Following the Garden Of Time theme was British star Cynthia Erivo, who appeared alongside her Wicked co-star Ariana Grande.
Erivo, who will play Elphaba in the upcoming film adaptation of the musical, wore a Thom Browne look complete with pink silk rose petals and a butterfly attached to the back of her head.
Cynthia Erivo, left, and Ariana Grande attend The Metropolitan Museum of Artâ€™s Costume Institute benefit gala (Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)
Meanwhile US star Grande said the pink hues in the pearls on her custom Loewe white ethereal number reminded her of her Wicked character Glindaâ€™s bubble.
This year, the celebrity co-chairs are Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, and first-time attendee Chris Hemsworth.
